Tailo: Guán ē sí ê sing-khu tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ ū tuà Iésu ê sí, hō͘ Iésu ê ua̍h-miā mā thang tī guán ê sing-khu hián-bîng.
English: always carrying in the body the putting to death of the Lord Jesus, that the life of Jesus may also be revealed in our body.

Tailo: （ Tabi̍t ê si. ）Siōngtsú ah, siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng kià-kha tī Lí ê pò͘-pênn? Siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng tuà tī Lí ê sìng-suaⁿ?
English: Yahweh, who shall dwell in your sanctuary? Who shall live on your holy hill?

Tailo: Guá kah lín tsò-hué ê sî tsin luán-jio̍k, iū-koh kiaⁿ kah phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah.
English: I was with you in weakness, in fear, and in much trembling.

Tailo: Sàulô kah tuè i ê lâng khì tshuē i; ū lâng kā Tabi̍t kóng, i tsiū lo̍h-khì kàu tsio̍h-puâⁿ, tuà tī Ma-óng ê khòng-iá. Sàulô thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū tī Ma-óng ê khòng-iá jiok Tabi̍t.
English: Saul and his men went to seek him. When David was told, he went down to the rock, and stayed in the wilderness of Maon. When Saul heard that, he pursued after David in the wilderness of Maon.

Tailo: Huē-tsiòng tsiū tshut siaⁿ, tuā-siaⁿ huah, hit mê jîn-bîn lóng thî-khàu.
English: All the congregation lifted up their voice, and cried; and the people wept that night.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, lâng sī siáⁿ-mi̍h, Lí kìng-jiân bat i! Lâng ê kiáⁿ sī siáⁿ-mi̍h, Lí kìng-jiân siàu-liām i!
English: Yahweh, what is man, that you care for him? Or the son of man, that you think of him?

Tailo: Iôtah lâi-kàu-uī, suî-sî kiâⁿ uá khì Iésu hia, kiò tsi̍t-siaⁿ Lāu-su , tsiū ti̍t-ti̍t kā I tsim.
English: When he had come, immediately he came to him, and said, Rabbi! Rabbi! and kissed him.

Tailo: Hit sî, Siōngtsú khai-sí hun-kuah Isulael kok, hō͘ i khah sè. Hatsael kong-kik Isulael ê sì-kho͘-uî,
English: In those days Yahweh began to cut off from Israel: and Hazael struck them in all the borders of Israel;

Tailo: In-uī tú-tio̍h bô phah-sǹg ê tāi-tsì, tsiah-ê tsîⁿ-tsâi tsiū siau-sit-khì; hit-ê lâng nā seⁿ kiáⁿ, tshiú lāi mā ē bô puàⁿ-hāng.
English: Those riches perish by misfortune, and if he has fathered a son, there is nothing in his hand.

Tailo: Siu-kuah ê sî, saⁿ-tsa̍p-ê siú-líng tiong ū saⁿ lâng lo̍h-khì kàu A-tu-lâm tōng, kìnn Tabi̍t. Huilīsū lâng kun-ping tsat iâⁿ tī Le-hua-im ê suaⁿ-kok.
English: Three of the thirty chief men went down, and came to David in the harvest time to the cave of Adullam; and the troop of the Philistines was encamped in the valley of Rephaim.

Tailo: Ū Siōngtsú kah guá tông-tsāi, guá tsiū bô kiann, lâng ē-tàng tuì guá án-tsuáⁿ?
English: Yahweh is on my side. I will not be afraid. What can man do to me?

Tailo: Koh ū līng-guā tsi̍t-ê teh tsiáng-kuán hué ê thiⁿ-sài tuì tsè-tuâⁿ tshut-.lâi, tuì gia̍h lāi ê liâm-li̍k-á hit-ê thiⁿ-sài tuā-siaⁿ huah, Īng lí hit ki lāi ê liâm-li̍k-á khì siu-kuah tē-tsiūⁿ kui pha ê phû-tô, in-uī phû-tô í-king kàu si̍k à.
English: Another angel came out from the altar, he who has power over fire, and he called with a great voice to him who had the sharp sickle, saying, Send forth your sharp sickle, and gather the clusters of the vine of the earth, for the earth's grapes are fully ripe!

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng tio̍h lī-khui i ê lō͘, put-gī ê lâng tio̍h kái-uāⁿ i ê liām-thâu. Kui-ǹg Siōngtsú, I ē liân-bín i; kui-ǹg lán ê Siōngtsú, in-uī I beh piàn kiâⁿ sià-bián.
English: let the wicked forsake his way, and the unrighteous man his thoughts; and let him return to Yahweh, and he will have mercy on him; and to our God, for he will abundantly pardon.

Tailo: Tuì Pí-hap-hi-lio̍k tuì-bīn tshut-huat, king-kuè hái tiong kàu khòng-iá, koh tī Í-thóng ê khòng-iá kiânn saⁿ ji̍t ê lō͘-thîng, tsiū tsat iâⁿ tī Mah-la̍h.
English: They traveled from before Hahiroth, and passed through the midst of the sea into the wilderness: and they went three days' journey in the wilderness of Etham, and encamped in Marah.

Tailo: In-uī guá kā lín kóng, tsîng só͘ tshiánn hiah-ê lâng bô tsi̍t-ê ē-tàng tsia̍h-tio̍h guá ê iàn-si̍k. '
English: For I tell you that none of those men who were invited will taste of my supper.'

Tailo: Iésu tsiū kā in kóng, Guā-pang lâng ê kun-ông tsò tsú lâi tī-lí jîn-bîn; thóng-tī-tsiá kiò-tsò Un-tsú.
English: He said to them, The kings of the nations lord it over them, and those who have authority over them are called benefactors.'

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Siōngtsú ê sù-tsiá ìn kóng, Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú ah, Lí tuì Êlúsalèm kah Iôtah tsiah-ê siâⁿ siū-khì í-king tshit-tsa̍p nî, Lí bô si liân-bín tio̍h kàu tang-sî?
English: Then the angel of Yahweh replied, O Yahweh of Armies, how long will you not have mercy on Jerusalem and on the cities of Judah, against which you have had indignation these seventy years?

Tailo: Mô͘se tuì in ê tshiú the̍h lo̍h-.lâi, tī tuâⁿ-.ni̍h sio-tsè ê tíng-bīn sio, lóng sī siat-li̍p sìng-tsit ê lé, tse sī hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú tsò phang-phang ê hué-tsè.
English: Moses took them from their hands, and burned them on the altar on the burnt offering. They were a consecration for a sweet savor. It was an offering made by fire to Yahweh.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Guá í-king kā lín kóng, guá to̍h-sī. Lín nā-sī teh tshuē guá, tsiah-ê lâng tio̍h pàng in khì.
English: Jesus answered, I told you that I AM. If therefore you seek me, let these go their way,

Tailo: Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè ē kā in kau-hù lí, hō͘ in tuā kiaⁿ jiáu-luān, it-ti̍t kàu in bia̍t-bông uî-tsí.
English: But Yahweh your God will deliver them up before you, and will confuse them with a great confusion, until they be destroyed.

Tailo: Uí-tāi ah, I ê sîn-jiah! Hong-sīng ah, I ê kî-sū! I ê kok sī íng-uán ê kok, I ê kuân-pìng kàu bān-sè-tāi!
English: How great are his signs! and how mighty are his wonders! his kingdom is an everlasting kingdom, and his dominion is from generation to generation.

Tailo: Tàn ē phuàⁿ-tuàn i ê jîn-bîn, tshin-tshiūnn Isulael tsi-tso̍k ê tsi̍t-ê.
English: Dan will judge his people, As one of the tribes of Israel.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ē hong ba̍t phô͘-tháⁿ ê tshuì-tûn, kuah-tn̄g kóng tuā-uē ê tshuì-tsi̍h.
English: May Yahweh cut off all flattering lips, And the tongue that boasts,

Tailo: I-é-hú-thah tuì Gilia̍t ê tiúⁿ-ló kóng, Lín tshuā guá tò tńg-khì kah Ammóng lâng kau-tsiàn, Siōngtsú kā in kau tī guá ê bīn-tsîng, guá kám tsin-tsiàⁿ ē-tàng tsò lín ê thâu-lâng?
English: Jephthah said to the elders of Gilead, If you bring me home again to fight with the children of Ammon, and Yahweh deliver them before me, shall I be your head?

Tailo: Lín mā tshin-tshiūnn án-ne, guā-bīn hō͘ lâng khuàⁿ-tsò sī gī lâng, m̄-koh, lāi-bīn tshiong-muá ké-hó kah put-gī.
English: Even so you also outwardly appear righteous to men, but inwardly you are full of hypocrisy and iniquity.

Tailo: Tsia̍h guá ê bah, lim guá ê hueh ê lâng, ū íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā, tī bua̍t-ji̍t, guá ē hō͘ i koh-ua̍h.
English: He who eats my flesh and drinks my blood has eternal life, and I will raise him up at the last day.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h án-ne, Iô-tá-iah lâng khai-sí pik-hāi Iésu, in-uī I tī An-hioh-ji̍t kā lâng i-pēⁿ.
English: For this cause the Jews persecuted Jesus, and sought to kill him, because he did these things on the Sabbath.

Tailo: Lâng nā hō͘ tsiáu-á khuàⁿ-tio̍h i teh Siat ê lô-bāng, siūⁿ beh lia̍h tsiáu á-.sī bô tshái kang.
English: For in vain is the net spread in the sight of any bird:

Tailo: Elísiah kā i kóng, lí khì kā i huê-hok, kóng, Lí it-tīng ē ua̍h; tsóng-.sī, Siōngtsú tsí-sī guá, i it-tīng ē sí.
English: Elisha said to him, Go, tell him, You shall surely recover; however Yahweh has shown me that he shall surely die.

Tailo: Tsit sî liáu-āu, Lēbī lâng tio̍h ji̍p-khì tsò huē-bō͘ ê kang; lí tio̍h hō͘ in tshing-khì, hiàn in tsò iô-tsè,
English: After that, the Levites shall go in to do the service of the Tent of Meeting: and you shall cleanse them, and offer them as a wave offering.

Tailo: Lí kà-sī pa̍t lâng, sī án-tsuáⁿ bô kà-sī ka-kī? Lí kà lâng m̄-thang thau-the̍h, lí ka-kī ū thau-the̍h bô?
English: You therefore who teach another, don't you teach yourself? You who preach that a man shouldn't steal, do you steal?

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng tsi̍t ē khuànn-kìnn Iésu tsiū phak tī I ê bīn-tsîng tuā-siaⁿ huah, Tsì-kuân Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ Iésu, guá kah Lí ū siáⁿ-mi̍h khan-liân? Kiû Lí m̄-thang hō͘ guá siū khó͘-to̍k.
English: When he saw Jesus, he cried out, and fell down before him, and with a loud voice said, What do I have to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I beg you, don't torment me!

Tailo: Jī-.gue̍h ê pan-tiúⁿ sī A-huah lâng Tó-tāi, koh ū Miklot mā sī hit-pan ê thâu-lâng, i ê pan lāi ū nn̄g-bān sì-tshing lâng.
English: Over the division of the second month was Dodai the Ahohite, and his division; and Mikloth the ruler: and in his division were twenty-four thousand.

Tailo: Io-lâm tsē-uī ê sî saⁿ-tsa̍p jī huè, tī Êlúsalèm tsò ông kiōng peh nî. I lī-khui sè-kan bô lâng siàu-liām i, lâng kā i bâi-tsòng tī Tabi̍t ê siâⁿ, tsóng-.sī, bô tī lia̍t ông ê bōng-hn̂g lāi.
English: Thirty-two years old was he when he began to reign, and he reigned in Jerusalem eight years: and he departed without being desired; and they buried him in the city of David, but not in the tombs of the kings.

Tailo: Ehulóng ìn Abulahàm kóng,
English: Ephron answered Abraham, saying to him,

Tailo: Ping-á īng tsham khó͘-táⁿ ê tsiú hō͘ Iésu lim; I tam tsi̍t ē tsiū m̄-lim.
English: They gave him sour wine to drink mixed with gall. When he had tasted it, he would not drink.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn tiong-kan ê ta̍k tso̍k lóng tio̍h kā kuân-lîng kah îng-kng kui hō͘ Siōngtsú, kui hō͘ Siōngtsú!
English: Ascribe to Yahweh, you families of nations, Ascribe to Yahweh glory and strength.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h pá-ak iáu ū thang kiò-tsò Kin-á-ji̍t ê sî-ki, ji̍t-ji̍t hō͘-siōng khuàn-bián, tsiah bián-tit lín tiong-kan ū lâng hō͘ tsuē-ok bê-hi̍k, suah piàn ngē sim.
English: but exhort one another day by day, so long as it is called today; lest any one of you be hardened by the deceitfulness of sin.

Tailo: Tio̍h ū phi-kian nn̄g tè, liân tī siang pîng hō͘ i sio-liân.
English: It shall have two shoulder straps joined to the two ends of it, that it may be joined together.

Tailo: In-uī Isulael ê tsú-bîn á-.sī tī Isulael tiong kià-kha ê tshut-guā lâng, kiàn-nā kah Guá keh-tn̄g, tsiap-la̍p i ê ngó͘-siōng tī i ê sim-lāi, koh hē ē tì-sú huān tsuē ê tsó͘-gāi tī i ka-kī ê bīn-tsîng, koh lâi kìnn sian-ti, siūⁿ beh uī ka-kī ê tāi-tsì lâi mn̄g Guá ê, Guá — Siōngtsú beh tshin-sin kā i ìn-tap.
English: For everyone of the house of Israel, or of the strangers who sojourn in Israel, who separates himself from me, and takes his idols into his heart, and puts the stumbling block of his iniquity before his face, and comes to the prophet to inquire for himself of me; I Yahweh will answer him by myself:

Tailo: Siōngtsú koh huan-hù Mô͘se kóng,
English: Moreover Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Koh tuì i ê lāu-pē kóng, Ū tsi̍t kiāⁿ tāi-tsì kiû lí ín-tsún, iông-ín guá nn̄g gue̍h-ji̍t, hō͘ guá kah guá ê tâng-phuāⁿ khì suaⁿ-.ni̍h, thang uī-tio̍h guá tsi̍t-sì-lâng tsò tsāi-sik-lí lâi thî-khàu.
English: She said to her father, Let this thing be done for me: let me alone two months, that I may depart and go down on the mountains, and bewail my virginity, I and my companions.

Tailo: Hiaⁿ-tī-huē tshut-bē hiann-tī hō͘ i sí, lāu-pē mā ē án-ne khuán-thāi kiáⁿ-jî; kiáⁿ-jî ē khí-lâi kong-kik pē-bú, kā in hāi-sí.
English: Brother will deliver up brother to death, and the father his child. Children will rise up against parents, and cause them to be put to death.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Siōngtsú bô suah I bíng-lia̍t ê tuā siū-khì, to̍h-sī I tuì Iôtah huat-tshut ê siū-khì, sī in-uī Mánáse só͘ kik tio̍h I siū-khì hiah-ê tāi-tsì.
English: Notwithstanding, Yahweh didn't turn from the fierceness of his great wrath, with which his anger was kindled against Judah, because of all the provocation with which Manasseh had provoked him.

Tailo: Guá koh beh ke-thinn lâng tī lín ê tíng-bīn, to̍h-sī Isulael ê ke-ke hō͘-hō͘ it-tshè lóng án-ne; tsiah-ê siâⁿ tsiū ē ū lâng tuà, pha-hng ê só͘-tsāi ē tit-tio̍h khí-tsō.
English: and I will multiply men on you, all the house of Israel, even all of it; and the cities shall be inhabited, and the waste places shall be built;

Tailo: Guá ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, lín tńg-.khì. Khì lah! Guá í-king nî lāu, bē-tàng koh ū tiōng-hu; guá nā kóng, guá iáu ū ǹg-bāng, guá kim-mê nā ū tiōng-hu mā ē seⁿ kiáⁿ,
English: Turn again, my daughters, go your way; for I am too old to have a husband. If I should say, I have hope, if I should even have a husband tonight, and should also bear sons;

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Iôséhuh uī Huâ-láu bé Aigi̍p só͘-ū ê tē, Aigi̍p lâng in-uī hō͘ ki-hng só͘ pik, ta̍k lâng lóng bē i ê tshân-tē, hiah-ê tē tsiū lóng kui tī Huâ-láu.
English: So Joseph bought all the land of Egypt for Pharaoh, for the Egyptians sold every man his field, because the famine was severe on them, and the land became Pharaoh's.

Tailo: Iôséhuh kìnn Aigi̍p ông Huâ-láu ê sî, hit nî saⁿ-tsa̍p huè. Iôséhuh tuì Huâ-láu ê bīn-tsîng tshut-.khì, piàn kiâⁿ Aigi̍p tsuân tē.
English: Joseph was thirty years old when he stood before Pharaoh king of Egypt. Joseph went out from the presence of Pharaoh, and went throughout all the land of Egypt.

Tailo: Lóng sī Siōngtsú tī Si-nái suaⁿ só͘ bīng-līng Mô͘se ê, to̍h-sī i tī Si-nái khòng-iá bīng-līng Isulael lâng hiàn lé-mi̍h hō͘ Siōngtsú ê ji̍t.
English: which Yahweh commanded Moses in Mount Sinai, in the day that he commanded the children of Israel to offer their offerings to Yahweh, in the wilderness of Sinai.

Tailo: Guá hōng guá ê Thiⁿ-pē ê miâ lâi, lín bô beh tsiap-la̍p guá; nā ū pa̍t lâng hōng ka-kī ê miâ lâi, lín tian-tò kā i tsiap-la̍p.
English: I have come in my Father's name, and you don't receive me. If another comes in his own name, you will receive him.

Tailo: Hui-li̍p-pò͘ kā Iésu kóng, Tsú ah, kā Thiⁿ-pē hián-sī hō͘ guán khuànn, guán tsiū ē buán-tsiok.
English: Philip said to him, Lord, show us the Father, and that will be enough for us.

Tailo: Tuà tī tē-ki̍k ê lâng in-uī Lí ê sîn-jiah lâi kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ; ji̍t tshut ji̍t lo̍h ê só͘-tsāi, Lí hō͘ in lóng huann-hí.
English: They also who dwell in far-away places are afraid at your wonders. You call the morning's dawn and the evening with songs of joy.

Tailo: Suî-jiân án-ne, kin-á-ji̍t, bîn-á-tsài kah āu-.ji̍t, guá tio̍h kè-sio̍k kiânn, in-uī sian-ti bô ing-kai tī Êlúsalèm í-guā ê só͘-tsāi hō͘ lâng hāi-sí.
English: Nevertheless I must go on my way today and tomorrow and the next day, for it can't be that a prophet perish outside of Jerusalem.'

Tailo: Tuì hit sî khí, Iésu khai-sí suan-káng tō-lí, kóng, Lín tio̍h hué-kái, in-uī thian-kok teh beh lâi-lîm!
English: From that time, Jesus began to preach, and to say, Repent! For the Kingdom of Heaven is at hand.

Tailo: Kuaⁿ-uân tuì Iá-sùn kah kî-tha ê lâng siu tsînn kau-pó liáu-āu, tsiū pàng in khì.
English: When they had taken security from Jason and the rest, they let them go.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tsiūⁿ Le-ba-nòng khì ai-khàu, tī Basiáng tshut siaⁿ, tuì A-bá-lîm ai-khàu, in-uī lí só͘ tshin-ài ê lóng siū huí-bia̍t à.
English: Go up to Lebanon, and cry; and lift up your voice in Bashan, and cry from Abarim; for all your lovers are destroyed.

Tailo: Tsi̍t ki thiāu kuân tsa̍p-peh tiú, îⁿ-khuân tsa̍p-jī tiú, kāu sì tsáiⁿ, tiong-ng khang-khak.
English: As for the pillars, the height of the one pillar was eighteen cubits; and a line of twelve cubits did compass it; and the thickness of it was four fingers: it was hollow.

Tailo: In suah tuì Iésu khí huán-kám, m̄-koh, Iésu kā in kóng, Sian-ti tī ka-kī ê kò͘-hiong kah ka-tîng í-guā, khì-kàu tó-uī lóng ē siū tsun-tiōng.
English: They were offended by him. But Jesus said to them, A prophet is not without honor, except in his own country, and in his own house.

Tailo: Lí in-uī Isulael ê tsú-bîn ê ki-gia̍p pha-hng lâi huann-hí, Guá mā beh án-ne khuán-thāi lí. Seil suaⁿ, lí ē pha-hng, Etóm tsuân tē mā ē án-ne. In tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: As you did rejoice over the inheritance of the house of Israel, because it was desolate, so will I do to you: you shall be desolate, Mount Seir, and all Edom, even all of it; and they shall know that I am Yahweh.

Tailo: In king-kuè Pí-si-tia lâi-kàu Pam-hu-lí-ah.
English: They passed through Pisidia, and came to Pamphylia.

Tailo: Nî-ko-té-mô͘ mn̄g kóng, Lâng í-king lāu ā, ná ē tîng-thâu-seⁿ? Kám ē-tàng koh ji̍p-khì lāu-bú ê pak-tó͘ lâi tîng-thâu-seⁿ?
English: Nicodemus said to him, How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother's womb, and be born?

Tailo: Iô-há-neh tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tuì He-lo̍t kóng, Lí bô ing-kai tsiàm hiann-tī ê bó͘.
English: For John said to Herod, It is not lawful for you to have your brother's wife.

Tailo: Ki-tok lóng bô huān tsuē, mā bô lâng thiaⁿ-kuè I kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t.
English: who did not sin, neither was deceit found in his mouth.

Tailo: Án-ne, Etóm lâng puē-puān Iôtah, thuat-lī i ê tshiú-thâu, kàu kin-á-ji̍t. Kâng hit sî, Lipnah lâng mā puē-puān.
English: So Edom revolted from under the hand of Judah to this day. Then did Libnah revolt at the same time.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tsiàu I thok guá só͘ kóng ê uē kiânn tī lí, Siōngtsú í-king tuì lí ê tshiú tshiúⁿ-tua̍t kok-uī, kau hō͘ lí ê tâng-phuāⁿ Tabi̍t.
English: Yahweh has done to you, as he spoke by me: and Yahweh has torn the kingdom out of your hand, and given it to your neighbor, even to David.

Tailo: In-uī guá tsai, tsit-ê tāi-tsì ū lín ê kî-tó kah Iésu Ki-tok ê Sìng Sîn ê pang-tsān, guá it-tīng ē tit-tio̍h tháu-pàng, huê-ho̍k tsū-iû.
English: For I know that this will turn out to my salvation, through your supplication and the supply of the Spirit of Jesus Christ,

Tailo: I ê sim só͘ ì-ài ê, Lí í-king hō͘ i; i ê tshuì só͘ kiû ê, Lí lóng ū tap-ìng. [Sè-la̍h]
English: You have given him his heart's desire, And have not withheld the request of his lips. Selah.

Tailo: Án-ne sī beh hō͘ tsìng lâng lóng tsun-kìng Kiáⁿ ná tshin-tshiūnn tsun-kìng Thiⁿ-pē; bô tsun-kìng Kiáⁿ ê lâng, to̍h-sī bô tsun-kìng tshe-phài I lâi ê Thiⁿ-pē.
English: that all may honor the Son, even as they honor the Father. He who doesn't honor the Son doesn't honor the Father who sent him.

Tailo: Guá mā bé lô͘-po̍k kah lú-pī, mā ū tshut-sì tī guá tshù lāi ê, mā ū tsin tsē gû-kûn kah iûⁿ-kûn, iâⁿ-kuè guá í-tsîng tī Êlúsalèm hiah-ê lâng só͘-ū ê.
English: I bought male servants and female servants, and had servants born in my house. I also had great possessions of herds and flocks, above all who were before me in Jerusalem;

Tailo: Tuì tsiaⁿ-gue̍h tshe-it khai-sí kiânn tshing-khì ê tāi-tsì, hit gue̍h ê tshe-peh tsiah kàu Siōngtsú ê mn̂g-lông, peh ji̍t tshing-khì Siōngtsú ê tiān, kàu tsiaⁿ-gue̍h tsa̍p-la̍k tsiū uân-sîng.
English: Now they began on the first day of the first month to sanctify, and on the eighth day of the month came they to the porch of Yahweh; and they sanctified the house of Yahweh in eight days: and on the sixteenth day of the first month they made an end.

Tailo: Lâng ê kha-pō͘ sī Siōngtsú teh tiāⁿ-tio̍h, lâng kám ē tsai i ka-kī ê lō͘?
English: A man's steps are from Yahweh; How then can man understand his way?

Tailo: Siōngtsú khí-tsō Êlúsalèm, tsū-tsi̍p Isulael tiong siū tshian-suá khì guā-pang ê lâng.
English: Yahweh builds up Jerusalem. He gathers together the outcasts of Israel.

Tailo: I m̄-tsai i ê ngó͘-kok, tsiú kah iû lóng sī Guá hō͘ i ê, ke-thinn i ê gîn kah kim ê mā sī Guá; i īng tsiah-ê khì ho̍k-sāi Baal.
English: For she did not know that I gave her the grain, the new wine, and the oil, And multiplied to her silver and gold, which they used for Baal.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h khì guá ê pún-tē pún tso̍k, kā guá ê kiáⁿ Ísak tshuā tsi̍t-ê bó͘.
English: But you shall go to my country, and to my relatives, and take a wife for my son Isaac.

Tailo: Tsiū kā i hō-miâ kiò-tsò Iôséhuh, kóng, Guān Siōngtsú koh ke-thinn guá tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ.
English: She named him Joseph, saying, May Yahweh add another son to me.

Tailo: Īng tsô-kia̍p tshâ tsò kǹg, īng kim pau khí-.lâi.
English: He made the poles of acacia wood, and overlaid them with gold.

Tailo: Sio̍k Náhuthalím ê ū tsi̍t-tshing-ê kun-tiúⁿ, giâ pîn-pâi kah gia̍h tshiuⁿ lâi tuè in ê, ū saⁿ-bān tshit-tshing lâng.
English: Of Naphtali one thousand captains, and with them with shield and spear thirty-seven thousand.

Tailo: Guá bat īng tì-huī tshì-giām só͘-ū ê tāi-tsì; guá kóng, guá beh tsò tì-huī ê lâng, tsóng-.sī, tì-huī lī-khui guá hn̄g-hn̄g.
English: All this have I proved in wisdom. I said, I will be wise; but it was far from me.

Tailo: In tsiū tshut-huat, Siōngtè hō͘ sì-kho͘-uî ê siâⁿ ê lâng lóng tsin tio̍h-kiaⁿ, in tsiū bô khì jiok Iâkop ê tsìng kiáⁿ.
English: They traveled, and a terror of God was on the cities that were around them, and they didn't pursue the sons of Jacob.

Tailo: Tsit-ê huē-bō͘ ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ ū kuè tshing-tiám, hit tiong-kan Lēbī lâng só͘ beh īng ê só͘-ū mi̍h-kiāⁿ, lóng sī tsiàu Mô͘se só͘ huan-hù, king-kuè tsè-si Alông ê kiáⁿ Ithamal ê tshiú só͘ tiám-sǹg ê.
English: This is the amount of material used for the tent, even the Tent of the Testimony, as they were counted, according to the commandment of Moses, for the service of the Levites, by the hand of Ithamar, the son of Aaron the priest.

Tailo: Hit-ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á bīn-māu hui-siông suí, iáu-sī tsāi-sik-lí, mā m̄-bat ū lâng tshin-kīn i. I lo̍h-khì tséⁿ piⁿ, tshiūⁿ muá i ê pân tsiū khí-.lâi.
English: The young lady was very beautiful to look at, a virgin, neither had any man known her. She went down to the spring, filled her pitcher, and came up.

Tailo: Siâⁿ lāi nā pûn sàu-kak, jîn-bîn kám bô kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ? Tsai-eh nā lîm-kàu tsi̍t-ê siâⁿ, kám m̄-sī Siōngtsú só͘ kàng-lo̍h ê?
English: Does the trumpet alarm sound in a city, Without the people being afraid? Does evil happen to a city, And Yahweh hasn't done it?

Tailo: Guá koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h kuí-nā-ê pó-tsō, tsē tī hit tíng-bīn ê ū tit-tio̍h sím-phuàⁿ ê kuân-pìng; guá mā ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h hiah-ê uī Iésu tsò kiàn-tsìng kah uī-tio̍h Siōngtè ê tō hō͘ lâng tsām-thâu ê lâng ê lîng-hûn. Tsiah-ê lâng m̄-bat pài hit tsiah bíng-siù kah bíng-siù ê tsō-siōng, thâu-hia̍h á-.sī tī tshiú-.ni̍h mā bô siū i khàm ìn tsò kì-hō. In lóng koh-ua̍h kah Ki-tok tsò-hué thóng-tī tsi̍t tshing nî .
English: I saw thrones, and they sat on them, and judgment was given to them. I saw the souls of those who had been beheaded for the testimony of Jesus, and for the word of God, and such as didn't worship the beast nor his image, and didn't receive the mark on their forehead and on their hand. They lived, and reigned with Christ for the thousand years.

Tailo: tse sī hué, ē sio kàu bia̍t-bông, pue̍h-tû guá it-tshè só͘ tshut-sán lông-tsok-bu̍t ê kin.
English: For it is a fire that consumes to destruction, And would root out all my increase.

Tailo: Lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê tiong-kan, bô-lūn tī siáⁿ lâng hia tshiau-.tio̍h, tsiū hō͘ i sí, guán mā beh tsò guá ê tsú-lâng ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: With whoever of your servants it be found, let him die, and we also will be my lord's bondservants.

Tailo: Guá mn̄g kah guá kóng-uē ê sù-tsiá kóng, Guá ê tsú ah, tsiah-ê sī siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: I answered and spoke to the angel who talked with me, saying, What are these, my lord?

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng tsai Tsú ê sim-ì? Siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng thè I tshut tsú-ì? (tsù, ISI 43:13)
English: For who has known the mind of the Lord? Or who has been his counselor?

Tailo: Sàulô ê a-tsik kóng, Tshiáⁿ lí kā guá kóng, Samuel kā lín kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: Saul's uncle said, Tell me, Please, what Samuel said to you.

Tailo: Isulael lâng tng kau-tsiàn ê sî ua̍t tńg-sin, Biāniámín lâng khí-tshiú thâi-sí Isulael lâng, tsha-put-to saⁿ-tsa̍p-ê, tsiū kóng, In iû-guân tshin-tshiūnn tsîng pái tī lán ê bīn-tsîng thâi-su.
English: The men of Israel turned in the battle, and Benjamin began to strike and kill of the men of Israel about thirty persons; for they said, Surely they are struck down before us, as in the first battle.

Tailo: Koh tuì Náhuthalím tsi-tso̍k ê sán-gia̍p tiong-kan, īng Ga-lí-la-iah ê Ketésih, to̍h-sī thâi lâng ê tô-siám ê siâⁿ kah i ê kau-iá, í-ki̍p Ham-mo͘-tool kah i ê kau-iá, Kal-thàn kah i ê kau-iá, kiōng saⁿ tsō siâⁿ hō͘ in.
English: Out of the tribe of Naphtali, Kedesh in Galilee with its suburbs, the city of refuge for the manslayer, and Hammothdor with its suburbs, and Kartan with its suburbs; three cities.

Tailo: Samuel kā Siōngtsú ê uē lóng tuì jîn-bîn kóng, to̍h-sī hiah-ê tuì i thó tsi̍t-ê ông ê, kóng,
English: Samuel told all the words of Yahweh to the people who asked of him a king.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — guán ê Tsú ah, Lí ê miâ tī tsuân tē kàu hiah kuân-tuā!
English: Yahweh, our Lord, How majestic is your name in all the earth!

Tailo: Kî-si̍t guá ū tsháu ū niû thang hō͘ lî-á, mā ū piáⁿ ū tsiú thang hō͘ guá pún-sin kah lú-pī, í-ki̍p tuè guá lâi ê lô͘-po̍k ê siàu-liân lâng, lóng bô khiàm kah tsi̍t hāng.
English: Yet there is both straw and provender for our donkeys; and there is bread and wine also for me, and for your handmaid, and for the young man who is with your servants: there is no want of anything.

Tailo: Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, tsi̍t lia̍p be̍h á tsíng-tsí nā bô tsìng lo̍h tē lâi sí, iû-guân sī tsi̍t lia̍p niā-niā. Nā sí, tsiū ē kiat tsin tsē lia̍p be̍h-á.
English: Most assuredly I tell you, unless a grain of wheat falls into the earth and dies, it remains by itself alone. But if it dies, it bears much fruit.

Tailo: Thong-kuè Ki-tok, lín ta̍k hāng tit-tio̍h hù-tsiok, tshiong-muá ta̍k-khuán ê kháu-tsâi kah tì-sik.
English: that in everything you were enriched in him, in all speech and all knowledge;

Tailo: Tsit-ê siâⁿ ē tī bān-kok kā Guá tshing-tsò huann-hí ê miâ, tsò o-ló, tsò îng-kng. In-uī bān-kok thiaⁿ-tio̍h Guá só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in it-tshè ê hok-khì, mā uī-tio̍h Guá só͘ siúⁿ-sù it-tshè ê hok-khì kah pîng-an, ē kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah.
English: This city shall be to me for a name of joy, for a praise and for a glory, before all the nations of the earth, which shall hear all the good that I do to them, and shall fear and tremble for all the good and for all the peace that I procure to it.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, E-bia̍t-me-li̍k tshuā tsiah-ê lâng tsò-hué khì, ji̍p-khì ông-kiong, kàu khò͘-pâng ē-bīn, tuì hia the̍h phuà-pò͘, kū sann, īng soh-á luī lo̍h-khì kó͘-tséⁿ lāi, lâi-kàu I-é-lí-miah hia.
English: So Ebedmelech took the men with him, and went into the house of the king under the treasury, and took there rags and worn-out garments, and let them down by cords into the dungeon to Jeremiah.

Tailo: In-uī lí tshiúⁿ-kiap tsin tsē kok, lia̍t kok tiong só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng mā ē kā lí tshiúⁿ-kiap; sī in-uī lí thâi lâng lâu hueh, tuì kíng lāi kah siâⁿ-tshī í-ki̍p tuà tī kî-tiong ê lâng só͘ kiâⁿ kiông-pō ê iân-kò͘.
English: Because you have plundered many nations, all the remnant of the peoples will plunder you, because of men's blood, and for the violence done to the land, to the city and to all who dwell in it.

Tailo: In tsiū uat-khì hia, kàu hit-ê siàu-liân ê Lēbī lâng ê tshù, to̍h-sī Mika ê tshù, kā i tshíng-an.
English: They turned aside there, and came to the house of the young man the Levite, even to the house of Micah, and asked him of his welfare.

Tailo: I khuàⁿ-tio̍h hit-ê kim-khuân, koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h tshiú-khuân tī in sió-muē ê tshiú, mā thiaⁿ-tio̍h in sió-muē Li-bé-kah ê uē, kóng, Hit-ê lâng tuì guá kóng án-ne, án-ne. I tsiū khì hit-ê lâng hia, khuàⁿ-tio̍h hit-ê lâng iáu khiā tī lo̍k-tô piⁿ, uá-kīn tsuí-tséⁿ.
English: It happened, when he saw the ring, and the bracelets on his sister's hands, and when he heard the words of Rebekah his sister, saying, This is what the man said to me, that he came to the man. Behold, he was standing by the camels at the spring.

Tailo: In tāi-ke tsū-tsi̍p lâi kong-kik gī lâng ê sèⁿ-miā, kā bô tsuē ê lâng tīng sí-tsuē.
English: They gather themselves together against the soul of the righteous, And condemn the innocent blood.

Tailo: i ê hiaⁿ-só tsiū tio̍h tī tiúⁿ-ló ê bīn-tsîng lâi kìnn i, thǹg hit-ê lâng kha-.ni̍h ê ê, phuì nuā tī i ê bīn, kóng, ' Kiàn-nā bô beh uī-tio̍h a-hiaⁿ kiàn-li̍p i ê ke ê, tio̍h án-ne kā i khuán-thāi. '
English: then his brother's wife shall come to him in the presence of the elders, and loose his shoe from off his foot, and spit in his face; and she shall answer and say, So shall it be done to the man who does not build up his brother's house.

Tailo: Samuel kóng, Lí ê to bat hō͘ tsa-bó͘ lâng bô kiáⁿ, án-ne lí ê lāu-bú tī tsa-bó͘ lâng tiong-kan mā ē bô kiáⁿ. Tsiū án-ne, Samuel tī Gilgal, Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, kā Agak phuà-tsò kui tè.
English: Samuel said, As your sword has made women childless, so shall your mother be childless among women. Samuel hewed Agag in pieces before Yahweh in Gilgal.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, i nā kā i ê sán-gia̍p ê tsi̍t hūn hō͘ i ê jîn-sîn tiong-kan ê tsi̍t-ê, sī tsò jîn-sîn ê kàu tsū-iû ê nî, hit sî iû-guân kui tī kun-ông. Kóng-tio̍h i ê sán-gia̍p, tio̍h lâu hō͘ i hiah-ê kiáⁿ.
English: But if he give of his inheritance a gift to one of his servants, it shall be his to the year of liberty; then it shall return to the prince; but as for his inheritance, it shall be for his sons.

Tailo: Tsō ê tíng-bīn ū înn ê iân, kuân puàⁿ tiú; tsō ê tíng-bīn ū i ê thuh-á kah i ê keh-tó͘, lóng kah tsō liân tsò tsi̍t-ê.
English: In the top of the base was there a round compass half a cubit high; and on the top of the base the stays of it and the panels of it were of the same.

Tailo: Tuā suaⁿ ē suá-khui, sió suaⁿ ē î-suá; to̍k-to̍k Guá ê tsû-ài it-tīng bô lī-khui lí, Guá pîng-an ê iok mā bô î-suá. Tse sī liân-bín lí ê Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: For the mountains may depart, and the hills be removed; but my loving kindness shall not depart from you, neither shall my covenant of peace be removed, says Yahweh who has mercy on you.

Tailo: Kah lí pêⁿ-pêⁿ siū Siōngtè kíng-suán ê tsí-muē ê kiáⁿ-jî, mā kā lí tshíng-an.
English: The children of your chosen sister greet you. Amen.

Tailo: I tuà tī Palân ê khòng-iá, i ê lāu-bú tuì Aigi̍p tē kā i tshuā tsi̍t-ê bó͘.
English: He lived in the wilderness of Paran. His mother took a wife for him out of the land of Egypt.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tsiàu guá só͘ thuân ê hok-im, tī sím-phuàⁿ hit ji̍t, Siōngtè ē thong-kuè Ki-tok Iésu, lâi sím-phuàⁿ lâng sim-lāi ún-ba̍t ê tāi-tsì.
English: in the day when God will judge the secrets of men, according to my Good News, by Jesus Christ.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — Siōngtè kā hit-ê lâng hē tī Etiân hn̂g, lâi tsìng-tsoh kah kò͘-siú.
English: Yahweh God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to dress it and to keep it.

Tailo: Tse mā thang pí-phīng Hel-móng ê lō͘-tsuí lo̍h tī Si-óng suaⁿ; in-uī tī hia Siōngtsú ū tiāⁿ-tio̍h sù-hok, to̍h-sī íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā.
English: Like the dew of Hermon, That comes down on the hills of Zion: For there Yahweh gives the blessing, Even life forevermore.

Tailo: Sìng-tiān lāi bīn tshiong-muá Siōngtè ê îng-kng kah kuân-lîng tshìng tshut-.lâi ê ian. It-ti̍t kàu tshit-ê thiⁿ-sài ê tshit-hāng tsai-hō kiat-sok tsìn-tsîng, bô lâng ē-tàng ji̍p-khì sìng-tiān.
English: The temple was filled with smoke from the glory of God, and from his power. No one was able to enter into the temple, until the seven plagues of the seven angels would be finished.

Tailo: Só͘lômóng kah Aigi̍p ông Huâ-láu kiat-tshin, tshuā Huâ-láu ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tsò bó͘, tshuā i ji̍p Tabi̍t siâⁿ, thìng-hāu i khí ka-kī ê tshù kah Siōngtsú ê tiān, í-ki̍p Êlúsalèm sì-kho͘-uî ê siâⁿ tshiûⁿ uân-kang.
English: Solomon made affinity with Pharaoh king of Egypt, and took Pharaoh's daughter, and brought her into the city of David, until he had made an end of building his own house, and the house of Yahweh, and the wall of Jerusalem round about.

Tailo: Lí nā khí sin-tshù, tio̍h tsò lân-kan tī tshù tíng, bián-tit lâng tuì hia pua̍h lo̍h-.lâi, lâu hueh ê tsuē tsiū kui tī lí ê tshù.
English: When you build a new house, then you shall make a battlement for your roof, that you don't bring blood on your house, if any man fall from there.

Tailo: In kā Tsú ê tō-lí kóng hō͘ i kah in tsuân ke ê lâng thiaⁿ.
English: They spoke the word of the Lord to him, and to all who were in his house.

Tailo: Tì-huī ē pó-hō͘ lí siám-phiah îm-hū, siám-phiah kóng phô͘-tháⁿ uē ê ki-lí.
English: That they may keep you from the strange woman, From the foreigner who flatters with her words.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā E-hú kóng, In-uī lí kiâⁿ hó koh tsiâⁿ guá só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò hó ê, tsiàu Guá ê sim-ì khuán-thāi Ahap ê ke, lí ê kiáⁿ-sun ē tsē Isulael ê kok-uī king-kuè sì tāi.
English: Yahweh said to Jehu, Because you have done well in executing that which is right in my eyes, and have done to the house of Ahab according to all that was in my heart, your sons of the fourth generation shall sit on the throne of Israel.

Tailo: Lí ê pîng-iú kah lāu-pē ê pîng-iú, lí lóng m̄-thang khì-sak; lí tú-tio̍h huān-lān ê ji̍t, m̄-thang khì hiann-tī ê tshù; hù-kīn ê tshù-piⁿ iâⁿ-kuè hn̄g-hn̄g ê hiann-tī.
English: Don't forsake your friend and your father's friend. Don't go to your brother's house in the day of your disaster: Better is a neighbor who is near than a distant brother.

Tailo: Koh tsi̍t-ê lâng kóng, ' Guá tú tshuā bó͘, só͘-í bē-tàng khì. '
English: Another said, I have married a wife, and therefore I can't come.'

Tailo: Lí tio̍h huan-hù Isulael lâng, kā in kóng: Hō͘ in tāi-tāi tī saⁿ-á piⁿ tsò tshiu, koh tī ē-té piⁿ ê tshiu tíng, tiò tsi̍t tiâu nâ-sik ê iù-tuà.
English: Speak to the children of Israel, and bid those who they make them fringes in the borders of their garments throughout their generations, and that they put on the fringe of each border a cord of blue:

Tailo: Lín tio̍h ai-khàu! In-uī Siōngtsú ê ji̍t-tsí kīn là! Tshin-tshiūnn huí-bia̍t sī tuì Tsuân-lîng-.ê lâi!
English: Wail; for the day of Yahweh is at hand! It will come as destruction from the Almighty.

Tailo: Hô ē seⁿ-thuàⁿ tshân-kap-á, in ē khí-lâi ji̍p-khì lí ê kiong-tiān, lí ê khùn-pâng, tsiūⁿ lí ê bîn-tshn̂g, ji̍p-khì lí ê jîn-sîn ê tshù, tsiūⁿ lí ê jîn-bîn ê sing-khu, ji̍p-khì lí ê tsàu-khang kah lí tshiau mī ê khì-kū.
English: and the river shall swarm with frogs, which shall go up and come into your house, and into your bedchamber, and on your bed, and into the house of your servants, and on your people, and into your ovens, and into your kneading troughs:

Tailo: koh hō͘ in Ia-thel kah i ê kau-iá, Esitemo͘h kah i ê kau-iá,
English: and Jattir with its suburbs, and Eshtemoa with its suburbs,

Tailo: Tseh-kî suah liáu-āu, in beh tńg-.khì ê sî, gín-á Iésu iáu lâu tī Êlúsalèm; I ê pē-bú m̄-tsai.
English: and when they had fulfilled the days, as they were returning, the boy Jesus stayed behind in Jerusalem. Joseph and his mother didn't know it,

Tailo: I kā ông kóng, Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, ' In-uī lí kā guá só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h beh bia̍t ê lâng pàng tsáu, só͘-í lí ê sèⁿ-miā tsiū tio̍h tāi-thè i ê sèⁿ-miā, lí ê jîn-bîn tsiū tio̍h tāi-thè i ê jîn-bîn. '
English: He said to him, Thus says Yahweh, Because you have let go out of your hand the man whom I had devoted to destruction, therefore your life shall go for his life, and your people for his people.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tiōng-hu iáu ua̍h-.leh ê sî, i nā kah pa̍t-ê tsa-po͘ lâng tuà tsò-hué, tsiū ē hō͘ lâng kiò-tsò îm-hū; tiōng-hu nā sí-.khì, tsiū tit-tio̍h tsū-iû, thuat-lī tsit-ê lu̍t-huat ê sok-pa̍k, suî-jiân kah pa̍t-ê tsa-po͘ lâng tuà tsò-hué, mā m̄-sī îm-hū.
English: So then if, while the husband lives, she is joined to another man, she would be called an adulteress. But if the husband dies, she is free from the law, so that she is no adulteress, though she is joined to another man.

Tailo: Siōngtsú beh tit-tio̍h Iôtah tsò I ê sán-gia̍p tī sìng-tē, mā ē koh kíng-suán Êlúsalèm.
English: Yahweh will inherit Judah as his portion in the holy land, and will again choose Jerusalem.

Tailo: Lín m̄-thang khi-phiàn ka-kī. Lín tiong-kan nā ū lâng īng sè-kan ê phiau-tsún kā ka-kī khuàⁿ-tsò ū tì-huī, i tian-tò tio̍h tsò gû-gōng ê lâng, tsiah ē-tàng tsiâⁿ-tsò tsin-tsiàⁿ ū tì-huī.
English: Let no one deceive himself. If anyone thinks that he is wise among you in this world, let him become a fool, that he may become wise.

Tailo: Tio̍h kā tsit nn̄g tè pó-tsio̍h an-tì tī tsè-si ho̍k ê phi-kian tíng, uī Isulael lâng tsò kì-liām tsio̍h. Alông tio̍h tī nn̄g-ê king-kah-thâu phāinn in ê miâ, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng lâi tsò kì-liām.
English: You shall put the two stones on the shoulder straps of the ephod, to be stones of memorial for the children of Israel: and Aaron shall bear their names before Yahweh on his two shoulders for a memorial.

Tailo: Thok gōng lâng pò siau-sit, tú tshin-tshiūnn kòng tn̄g ka-kī ê kha, hō͘ ka-kī tsia̍h-khui.
English: One who sends a message by the hand of a fool Is cutting off feet and drinking violence.

Tailo: Ba̍k-tsiu ê kng-bîng hō͘ sim huann-hí; hó siau-sit ē tsu-jūn kin-kut.
English: The light of the eyes rejoices the heart. Good news gives health to the bones.

Tailo: Tshin-ài ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, Siōngtè hiah-ni̍h thiàⁿ lán, lán mā tio̍h sio-thiànn.
English: Beloved, if God loved us in this way, we also ought to love one another.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng kóng, Lí ê miâ bô beh koh kiò-tsò Iâkop, beh kiò-tsò Isulael, in-uī lí kah Siōngtè á-.sī kah lâng tàu su-iâⁿ, lóng tit-tio̍h khah iâⁿ.
English: He said, Your name will no longer be called Jacob, but Israel; for you have fought with God and with men, and have prevailed.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guán thiaⁿ-tio̍h lín ê siau-sit liáu-āu, tsiū kè-sio̍k uī lín kî-tó, put-sî khún-kiû Siōngtè hō͘ lín ē-tàng tuì Sìng Sîn tit-tio̍h ta̍k tsióng ê tì-huī kah lí-kái, ē-tàng tshiong-hun bîng-pi̍k I ê tsí-ì,
English: For this cause, we also, since the day we heard this, don't cease praying and making requests for you, that you may be filled with the knowledge of his will in all spiritual wisdom and understanding,

Tailo: Guá Páulô tshin-pit siá phue kā lín tshíng-an. Lín tio̍h siàu-liām guá tsit-má teh tsē-kann. Guān Siōngtè ê un-tián kah lín tông-tsāi!
English: The salutation of me, Paul, with my own hand: remember my bonds. Grace be with you. Amen.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t, Tabi̍t tshut-huat, siám-phiah Sàulô, tsáu kàu Gat ông Akisi hia.
English: David arose, and fled that day for fear of Saul, and went to Achish the king of Gath.

Tailo: Tô͘-bô͘ pháiⁿ tāi ê lâng sim tsûn kuí-tsà; khǹg lâng hô-hó ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h huann-hí.
English: Deceit is in the heart of those who plot evil, But joy comes to the promoters of peace.

Tailo: Pêⁿ-pêⁿ siū Siōngtè suán-tiàu, tsiâⁿ-tsò Ki-tok-tô͘ ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, lín tio̍h tshim-tshim su-khó hit uī lán só͘ sîng-jīn tsò sù-tsiá koh tsò tuā-tsè-si ê Iésu.
English: Therefore, holy brothers, partakers of a heavenly calling, consider the Apostle and High Priest of our confession, Jesus;

Tailo: Guá kám ē tsia̍h gû-káng ê bah, á-.sī lim suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng ê hueh?
English: Will I eat the flesh of bulls, Or drink the blood of goats?

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, guān Lí tsiàu guán só͘ gióng-bōng Lí ê, si-lo̍h Lí ê tsû-ài hō͘ guán.
English: Let your loving kindness be on us, Yahweh, Since we have hoped in you.

Tailo: Siōngtè pīng bô iông-ín huān tsuē ê thiⁿ-sài, só͘-í kā in hiat lo̍h-khì im-hú, kā in kuainn tī o͘-àm ê tshim kheⁿ, tī hia thìng-hāu sím-phuàⁿ.
English: For if God didn't spare angels when they sinned, but cast them down to Tartarus , and committed them to pits of darkness, to be reserved to judgment;

Tailo: tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè;
English: one male goat for a sin offering;

Tailo: Hit-ê bīng-līng kng tio̍h tuì o͘-àm tsiò tshut-.lâi ê Siōngtè, to̍h-sī īng kng tsiò tī lán ê sim-lāi ê Siōngtè, I hō͘ lán jīn-bat tsiò tī Iésu Ki-tok ê bīn hit-ê îng-kng.
English: seeing it is God who said, Light will shine out of darkness, who has shone in our hearts, to give the light of the knowledge of the glory of God in the face of Jesus Christ.

Tailo: Hok-khì ah, lí ê lâng, hok-khì ah, lí ê lô͘-po̍k, ē-tàng tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ khiā tī lí ê bīn-tsîng thiaⁿ lí ê tì-huī.
English: Happy are your men, and happy are these your servants, who stand continually before you, and hear your wisdom.

Tailo: Lâng ê sim nā tshau-huân ē hō͘ i lué-tsì; tsi̍t kù hó uē ē-tàng hō͘ i huann-hí.
English: Anxiety in a man's heart weighs it down, But a kind word makes it glad.

Tailo: I siū sím-phuàⁿ ê sî, guān i tshut-lâi siū tīng tsuē! Guān i ê kî-tó piàn-sîng tsuē-kò!
English: When he is judged, let him come forth guilty. Let his prayer be turned into sin.

Tailo: Guán bong tshiûⁿ, uá piah, tshin-tshiūnn tsheⁿ-mê-.ê; guán sì-kè bong, tshin-tshiūnn bô ba̍k-tsiu ê lâng. Guán tī ji̍t-tiong-tàu ê sî tian-tian tó-tó, tshin-tshiūnn hông-hun ê sî hit khuán; guán tī ióng-tsòng ê lâng ê tiong-kan, ná tshin-tshiūnn sí-lâng.
English: We grope for the wall like the blind; yes, we grope as those who have no eyes: we stumble at noonday as in the twilight; among those who are lusty we are as dead men.

Tailo: Kiû Lí tuì thiⁿ àⁿ lo̍h-lâi khuànn, tuì Lí sìng-kiat îng-kng ê só͘-tsāi khuànn. Lí ê jia̍t-sim kah Lí tuā kuân-lîng-.ê só͘ tsò tī tó-uī? Lí thiàⁿ-thàng ê sim-tn̂g kah liân-bín tuì guá thîng-tsí.
English: Look down from heaven, and see from the habitation of your holiness and of your glory: where are your zeal and your mighty acts? the yearning of your heart and your compassion is restrained toward me.

Tailo: Lí hō͘ tsháu sing-tióng, hō͘ tsing-seⁿ ū thang tsia̍h, mā ū tshài-se tsò lâng ê lō͘-īng, hō͘ tsia̍h-mi̍h tuì tē-.ni̍h seⁿ-tshut;
English: He causes the grass to grow for the livestock, And plants for man to cultivate, That he may bring forth food out of the earth:

Tailo: Koh pun hō͘ Isulael ê kûn-tsiòng, bô-lūn lâm-lí, ta̍k lâng hō͘ in tsi̍t tè piáⁿ, tsi̍t tè bah kah tsi̍t tè phû-tô piáⁿ.
English: He dealt to everyone of Israel, both man and woman, to every one a loaf of bread, and a portion of flesh, and a cake of raisins.

Tailo: In-uī tāi-ke lóng tsai tsa-bó͘ gín-á í-king sí-.khì à, tsiū thí-tshiò Iésu.
English: They were ridiculing him, knowing that she was dead.

Tailo: Iobuh ìn kóng:
English: Then Job answered,

Tailo: Siōngtsú tī uá-kīn Etóm pian-kài ê Hol suaⁿ, huan-hù Mô͘se kah Alông kóng:
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses and Aaron in Mount Hor, by the border of the land of Edom, saying,

Tailo: Siōngtè tuā siū-khì ê ji̍t, tsîⁿ-tsâi bô lō͘-īng; tsí ū kong-gī ē kiù lâng thuat-lī sí-bông.
English: Riches don't profit in the day of wrath, But righteousness delivers from death.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tsuí miâ kiò-tsò Me-lí-bah ê tsuí, sī in-uī Isulael lâng kah Siōngtsú kè-kàu, Siōngtsú tsiū tuì in hián-bîng ka-kī tsò sìng.
English: These are the waters of Meribah; because the children of Israel strove with Yahweh, and he was sanctified in them.

Tailo: Hit sî, Nepkatnetsal muá-sim siū-khì, tuì Sia-to-la̍k, Me-siak kah A-bia̍t-ne-go͘ pìⁿ-bīn, bīng-līng lâng khí pí pîng-siông tshit puē khah jia̍t ê hué-lô͘;
English: Then was Nebuchadnezzar full of fury, and the form of his visage was changed against Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego: therefore he spoke, and commanded that they should heat the furnace seven times more than it was usually heated.

Tailo: Guá beh kàng hué tī Tulô ê siâⁿ tshiûⁿ, kā i ê kiong-tiān sio bia̍t-tiāu.
English: But I will send a fire on the wall of Tyre, And it will devour its palaces.

Tailo: ū gō͘-bān sì-tshing sì-pah miâ.
English: those who were numbered of them, of the tribe of Issachar, were fifty-four thousand four hundred.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h kā Tulô ông tsò ai-ko, tuì i kóng, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Lí só͘-ū lóng tsê-pī, tì-huī tshiong-tsiok, uân-tsuân suí.
English: Son of man, take up a lamentation over the king of Tyre, and tell him, Thus says the Lord Yahweh: You seal up the sum, full of wisdom, and perfect in beauty.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā in hing-khí sū-su ê sî, Siōngtsú tsiū kah sū-su tông-tsāi, mā tī sū-su ua̍h-.leh ê só͘-ū ê ji̍t-tsí, kiù in thuat-lī tuì-ti̍k ê tshiú. In in-uī siū ap-tsè khó͘-to̍k tsiū thó͘-khuì, só͘-í, Siōngtsú tsiū liân-bín in.
English: When Yahweh raised them up judges, then Yahweh was with the judge, and saved them out of the hand of their enemies all the days of the judge: for it grieved Yahweh because of their groaning by reason of those who oppressed them and vexed them.

Tailo: Mesilemiah ê kiáⁿ kah hiann-tī lóng sī ióng-sū, kiōng tsa̍p-peh lâng.
English: Meshelemiah had sons and brothers, valiant men, eighteen.

Tailo: Lí tuì sè-kan kíng-suán tshut-lâi hō͘ guá ê lâng, guá í-king ū kā Lí ê miâ tuì in hián-bîng. In guân-pún sī Lí ê, Lí kā in siúⁿ-sù hō͘ guá, in mā í-king ū tsun-siú Lí ê tō-lí.
English: I revealed your name to the people whom you have given me out of the world. They were yours, and you have given them to me. They have kept your word.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lâng nā àm-sî kiâⁿ lō͘, tsiū ē pua̍h-tó, in-uī bô kng thang tsiò lō͘.
English: But if a man walks in the night, he stumbles, because the light isn't in him.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Iésu kā i kóng, Ū tsi̍t-ê lâng pān tuā iàn-si̍k, tshiánn tsin tsē lâng.
English: But he said to him, A certain man made a great supper, and he invited many people.

Tailo: Koh hiàn tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, kā lín sio̍k-tsuē.
English: and one male goat for a sin offering, to make atonement for you.

Tailo: Guá beh in-uī Êlúsalèm lâi huann-hí, in-uī Guá ê tsú-bîn lâi khuài-lo̍k; kî-tiong it-tīng bô koh thiaⁿ-tio̍h thî-khàu ê siann kah ai-háu ê siann;
English: I will rejoice in Jerusalem, and joy in my people; and there shall be heard in her no more the voice of weeping and the voice of crying.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t, La̍hban tsiū sing kā ū bûn, ū pan ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng, ū tiám, ū pan, làng pe̍h ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ bó, í-ki̍p o͘-sik ê mî-iûⁿ, lóng puah tshut-lâi kau hō͘ i ka-kī hiah-ê kiáⁿ.
English: That day, he removed the male goats that were streaked and spotted, and all the female goats that were speckled and spotted, every one that had white in it, and all the black ones among the sheep, and gave them into the hand of his sons.

Tailo: Hit sî, put-huat ê lâng ē tshut-hiān. Tsú Iésu tsài-lîm ê sî, ē īng I ê tshuì thò͘ tsi̍t-kháu khì lâi kā i thâi-sí, īng I tsài-lîm hián-hiān ê îng-kng kā i siau-bia̍t.
English: Then the lawless one will be revealed, whom the Lord will kill with the breath of his mouth, and destroy by the manifestation of his coming;

Tailo: Suà-tsiap i ê sī kuán-lí Êlúsalèm hit tsi̍t-puàⁿ ê. Ha-lo͘-he-sih ê kiáⁿ Sialúm kah i hiah-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ siu-lí.
English: Next to him repaired Shallum the son of Hallohesh, the ruler of half the district of Jerusalem, he and his daughters.

Tailo: In-uī beh kiù ka-kī sèⁿ-miā ê lâng ē sòng-sit sèⁿ-miā; uī-tio̍h guá ê iân-kò͘ lâi sòng-sit sèⁿ-miā ê lâng, tian-tò ē tit-tio̍h sìng-miā.
English: For whoever desires to save his life will lose it, and whoever will lose his life for my sake will find it.

Tailo: I bē thuat-lī o͘-àm; hué-iām ē kā i ê ki sio-ta; i ē tuì Siōngtsú tshuì lāi ê khuì lâi sí-.khì.
English: He shall not depart out of darkness; The flame shall dry up his branches, By the breath of God's mouth shall he go away.

Tailo: Siōngtsú koh in-uī lín ê iân-kò͘ tuì guá siū-khì, tsiù-tsuā m̄ hō͘ guá kuè Ioltàn hô, mā m̄ hō͘ guá ji̍p-khì Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè só͘ beh siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí tsò sán-gia̍p ê suí tē.
English: Furthermore Yahweh was angry with me for your sakes, and swore that I should not go over the Jordan, and that I should not go in to that good land, which Yahweh your God gives you for an inheritance:

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h tsit tsi̍t tsiah iûⁿ-á, tio̍h suà hiàn kuàn-tiān ê tsiú, sì-hūn tsi-it hin; tī sìng-só͘ tiong, lí tio̍h kā kāu ê tsiú hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú tsò kuàn-tiān.
English: The drink offering of it shall be the fourth part of a hin for the one lamb: in the holy place shall you pour out a drink offering of strong drink to Yahweh.

Tailo: Lín kóng: Siōngtè kā i ê tsuē-ok tsik-tsū tī i ê kiáⁿ; guá kóng: M̄ ta̍t-tio̍h pò-ìng i pún-sin hō͘ i ka-kī tsai.
English: You say, God lays up his iniquity for his children.' Let him recompense it to himself, that he may know it.

Tailo: Lín tsai guán tuì-thāi lín ta̍k lâng, tshin-tshiūnn lāu-pē teh tuì-thāi ka-kī ê kiáⁿ-jî.
English: As you know how we exhorted, comforted, and implored every one of you, as a father does his own children,

Tailo: Gōng lâng, lín iā lo̍h-.khì ê tsíng-tsí nā bô sí-.khì, kám ē ua̍h khí-.lâi?
English: You foolish one, that which you yourself sow is not made alive unless it dies.

Tailo: mā ē tiau-khik pó-tsio̍h lâi siuⁿ, mā ē tiau-khik tshâ, ē tsò ta̍k tsióng kî-khiáu ê kang.
English: in cutting of stones for setting, and in carving of wood, to work in all kinds of skillful workmanship.

Tailo: I ê lāu-pē Ísak tuì i kóng, Guá ê kiáⁿ, tsìn-tsîng lâi tsim guá.
English: His father Isaac said to him, Come near now, and kiss me, my son.

Tailo: Iâkop ê Siōngtè ah, Lí ê tsik-pī tsi̍t-ē huat-tshut, tshia kah bé lóng khùn tāng-bîn.
English: At your rebuke, God of Jacob, Both chariot and horse are cast into a deep sleep.

Tailo: Lán iáu tuà tī tsit-ê pò͘-pênn teh thua-buâ thó͘-khuì, m̄-sī ài kā tē-tsiūⁿ ê thé thǹg khí-.lâi, sī ài tha̍h sio̍k-thiⁿ ê thé, thang hō͘ ua̍h-miā lâi khik-ho̍k hit-ê ē sí ê thé.
English: For indeed we who are in this tent do groan, being burdened; not that we desire to be unclothed, but that we desire to be clothed, that what is mortal may be swallowed up by life.

Tailo: Lí tńg-khì kā Ia-lô-ba-am kóng: Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè án-ne kóng, ' Guá tuì jîn-bîn tiong kí-khí lí, siat-li̍p lí tsò Guá ê Isulael jîn-bîn ê kun-ông,
English: Go, tell Jeroboam, Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel: Because I exalted you from among the people, and made you prince over my people Israel,

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Siōngtsú tuà lín tshut Aigi̍p, thuat-lī tsù-thih ê lô͘, beh tsò I ka-kī sán-gia̍p ê tsú-bîn, tshin-tshiūnn kin-á-ji̍t ê khuán-sit.
English: But Yahweh has taken you, and brought you forth out of the iron furnace, out of Egypt, to be to him a people of inheritance, as at this day.

Tailo: Ông kóng, Lín khì thàm-khuàⁿ i tī tó-uī, guá thang tshe lâng khì kā i lia̍h. Ū lâng kā ông kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, i tī To-than.
English: He said, Go and see where he is, that I may send and get him. It was told him, saying, Behold, he is in Dothan.

Tailo: Ionáthan kā i kóng, Bîn-á-tsài sī gue̍h ê tshe-it, lí ê uī pàng khang, beh kóng lí bô tī-.leh.
English: Then Jonathan said to him, Tomorrow is the new moon: and you will be missed, because your seat will be empty.

Tailo: Amnon tsiū tó-.leh ké phuà-pēⁿ, ông lâi khuànn i. Amnon tsiū tuì ông kóng, Kiû lí hō͘ guá ê sió-muē Thamal lâi guá tsia, tī guá ê bīn-tsîng kā guá tsò nn̄g tè piáⁿ, guá thang tuì i ê tshiú tsiap lâi tsia̍h.
English: So Amnon lay down, and feigned himself sick: and when the king was come to see him, Amnon said to the king, Please let her sister Tamar come, and make me a couple of cakes in my sight, that I may eat from her hand.

Tailo: In tī Êlúsalèm sì-kho͘-uî, lâu Lí tsú-bîn ê hueh tshin-tshiūnn teh piànn tsuí, mā bô lâng kā in bâi-tsòng.
English: Their blood they have shed like water around Jerusalem. There was no one to bury them.

Tailo: I thǹg-khì kaⁿ lāi só͘ tshīng ê saⁿ, tsi̍t-sì-lâng kah Babúlông ông tsò-hué tsia̍h.
English: and changed his prison garments. Jehoiachin ate bread before him continually all the days of his life:

Tailo: In ê bōng tī kheⁿ tiong ki̍k tshim ê só͘-tsāi, i ê jîn-bîn tī i ê bōng ê sì-kho͘-uî, lóng sī siū thâi tó tī to hā ê; in bat tī ua̍h-lâng ê tē hō͘ lâng kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: whose graves are set in the uttermost parts of the pit, and her company is round about her grave; all of them slain, fallen by the sword, who caused terror in the land of the living.

Tailo: Lí ê ke só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng lóng ē lâi kā i kuī-pài, kiû tsi̍t-ê gîn, tsi̍t-ê piáⁿ, kóng: Kiû lí hō͘ guá tng tsè-si-tsit ê tsi̍t-ê, hō͘ guá thang tit-tio̍h tām-po̍h piáⁿ lâi tsia̍h. '
English: It shall happen, that everyone who is left in your house shall come and bow down to him for a piece of silver and a loaf of bread, and shall say, Please put me into one of the priests' offices, that I may eat a morsel of bread.

Tailo: Tsú ìn kóng, Lín nā ū tshin-tshiūnn tsi̍t lia̍p kuà-tshài-tsí hiah tuā ê sìn-sim, to̍h-sī bīng-līng tsit tsâng sng-tsâi tshiū kóng, ' Pue̍h lí ê kin khì tsai tī hái-.ni̍h', hit-tsâng tshiū mā ē sūn-ho̍k lín.
English: The Lord said, If you had faith like a grain of mustard seed, you would tell this sycamore tree, Be uprooted, and be planted in the sea,' and it would obey you.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá tī I ê bīn-tsîng gī-gī tshuah; guá siūⁿ-tio̍h tsiū kiaⁿ.
English: Therefore I am terrified at his presence. When I consider, I am afraid of him.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā uî-puē Guá ê iok, bô tsun-thàn hit-ê iok ê uē, to̍h-sī phuà-khui gû-á lâi king-kuè hit tiong-kan ê sî, tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng só͘ li̍p ê iok,
English: I will give the men who have transgressed my covenant, who have not performed the words of the covenant which they made before me, when they cut the calf in two and passed between the parts of it;

Tailo: Nā kan-taⁿ pûn tsi̍t ki, tsìng siú-líng, to̍h-sī Isulael ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ, tio̍h tsū-tsi̍p kàu lí hia.
English: If they blow but one, then the princes, the heads of the thousands of Israel, shall gather themselves to you.

Tailo: Thê-man lâng Elī-huat ìn kóng:
English: Then Eliphaz the Temanite answered,

Tailo: Tsit gō͘ pak tiùⁿ tio̍h ta̍k-pak sio-liân, hit gō͘ pak tiùⁿ mā tio̍h ta̍k pak sio-liân.
English: Five curtains shall be coupled together one to another; and the other five curtains shall be coupled one to another.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí khuàⁿ, Isulael ê tsú-bîn kóng, ' I só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê ī-siōng, sī sio̍k tī tsin tsē ji̍t í-āu ê tāi-tsì, só͘ kóng ê ī-giân sī teh tsí ki̍k-hn̄g ê bī-lâi. '
English: Son of man, behold, they of the house of Israel say, The vision that he sees is for many day to come, and he prophesies of times that are far off.

Tailo: Tse sī sio-tsè, sò͘-tsè, sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, pó͘ kuè-si̍t ê tsè, siat-li̍p sìng-tsit ê tsè kah siā-un-tsè ê kui-lē.
English: This is the law of the burnt offering, of the meal offering, and of the sin offering, and of the trespass offering, and of the consecration, and of the sacrifice of peace offerings;

Tailo: Ū siaⁿ tuì Tàn thuân-pò, tuì Ehulaim suaⁿ pò tsai-hō.
English: For a voice declares from Dan, and publishes evil from the hills of Ephraim:

Tailo: Lí tio̍h īng kî-khiáu ê kang-hu, tsò tsi̍t-ê phuàⁿ-kuat ê pó͘-kuà; tio̍h kah tsè-si ho̍k sio-siâng ê tsò-huat, īng kim kah nâ-sik, tsí-sik, tsu-âng sik ê liāu, í-ki̍p kuè-pháng ê iù-tē lâi tsò.
English: You shall make a breastplate of judgment, the work of the skillful workman; like the work of the ephod you shall make it; of gold, of blue, and purple, and scarlet, and fine twined linen, shall you make it.

Tailo: Iôná kā in kóng, Lín kā guá lia̍h khí-lâi hiat-lo̍h hái, hái tsiū ē pîng-tiāⁿ; in-uī guá tsai lín tú-tio̍h tsit-ê tuā hong sī uī-tio̍h guá ê iân-kò͘.
English: He said to them, Take me up, and throw me into the sea. Then the sea will be calm for you; for I know that because of me this great tempest is on you.

Tailo: Koh tuì tì-sik, i ê pâng-king tsiū tshiong-muá ta̍k hāng pó-puè kah kuì-tiōng ê tsâi-bu̍t.
English: By knowledge the rooms are filled With all rare and beautiful treasure.

Tailo: In-uī lâng tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ īng kha-liâu tshiú-khàu kah thih-liān kā i pa̍k, m̄-koh, thih-liān lóng hō͘ i tshuah-tn̄g, kha-liâu tshiú-khàu mā hō͘ i kòng tshuì. Bô lâng ū khuì-la̍t thang kā i tsè-ho̍k.
English: because he had been often bound with fetters and chains, and the chains had been torn apart by him, and the fetters broken in pieces. Nobody had the strength to tame him.

Tailo: Aksa̍h kuè-mn̂g ê sî, khǹg tiōng-hu tuì in lāu-pē thó tsi̍t khu tshân; Aksa̍h tuì lî lo̍h-.lâi, Ka-le̍p mn̄g kóng, Lí beh siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: It happened, when she came to him, that she moved him to ask of her father a field: and she alighted from off her donkey; and Caleb said, What would you?

Tailo: Piattò͘ iáu teh siūⁿ tsit-ê ī-siōng ê sî, Sìng Sîn kā i kóng, Ū saⁿ-ê lâng lâi beh tshuē lí.
English: While Peter was pondering the vision, the Spirit said to him, Behold, three men seek you.

Tailo: Guá khuànn, Iôtah ông ê ông-kiong tshin-tshiūnn Le-ba-nòng ê bué-liu; tsóng-.sī, Guá it-tīng beh hō͘ i piàn-tsò khòng-iá, tsiâⁿ-tsò bô lâng tuà ê siâⁿ.
English: For thus says Yahweh concerning the house of the king of Judah: You are Gilead to me, and the head of Lebanon; yet surely I will make you a wilderness, and cities which are not inhabited.

Tailo: Siōngtè só͘ tshe-khián ê hit uī kóng Siōngtè ê uē, in-uī Siōngtè bô hān-liōng siúⁿ-sù Sìng Sîn hō͘ I.
English: For he whom God has sent speaks the words of God; for God gives the Spirit without measure.

Tailo: Án-ne sī beh hō͘ guán tsiah-ê sing kui-ǹg Ki-tok ê lâng, lóng o-ló Siōngtè ê îng-iāu.
English: to the end that we should be to the praise of his glory, we who had before hoped in Christ:

Tailo: In tī iàn-si̍k tuâⁿ khîm tuâⁿ sik, phah kó͘, pûn ta̍t-á, lim tsiú, bô siūⁿ-tio̍h Siōngtsú ê só͘ kiâⁿ, mā bô tsù-ì I ê tshiú só͘ tsò ê.
English: The harp, lyre, tambourine, and flute, with wine, are at their feasts; But they don't regard the work of Yahweh, Neither have they considered the operation of his hands.

Tailo: Koh tsō hiah-ê tsō kah tsō tíng ê phûn,
English: He made also the bases, and the basins made he on the bases;

Tailo: （ Tabi̍t ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ. ）Siōngtsú ah, guá uá-khò Lí, kiû Lí hō͘ guá íng-uán bô kiàn-siàu; tsiàu Lí ê kong-gī tsín-kiù guá.
English: In you, Yahweh, I take refuge. Let me never be disappointed: Deliver me in your righteousness.

Tailo: Bô guā kú ê tiong-kan tsiū piàn thiⁿ, in-uī hong kah hûn o͘-àm, lo̍h tuā hō͘. Ahap tsiū tsē tshia khì E-tsu-le-el.
English: It happened in a little while, that the sky grew black with clouds and wind, and there was a great rain. Ahab rode, and went to Jezreel:

Tailo: Ē-sin lâu-lâng ê lâng só͘ khiâ ê bé-uaⁿ mā sī bô tshing-khì.
English: Whatever saddle he who has the discharge rides on shall be unclean.

Tailo: Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k tuì i siū-khì kóng, Hit sî, lí tio̍h phah gō͘-la̍k pái, tsiū ē kong-kik Alâm, ti̍t-kàu i tsuân-pō͘ siau-bia̍t; taⁿ tsí ū ē phah-pāi Alâm lâng saⁿ pái.
English: The man of God was angry with him, and said, You should have struck five or six times: then had you struck Syria until you had consumed it, whereas now you shall strike Syria but thrice.

Tailo: Piattò͘ kah hit-ê bûn-tô͘ tsiū khì bōng-tē.
English: Therefore Peter and the other disciple went out, and they went toward the tomb.

Tailo: M̄-koh, kàu kin-á-ji̍t, guá ū tit-tio̍h Siōngtè ê pó-hō͘, ē-tàng khiā tī tsia, tuì tsun-kuì kah pi-bî ê lâng tsò kiàn-tsìng. Guá só͘ kóng ê kah sian-ti í-ki̍p Mô͘se só͘ kóng ê uân-tsuân-kāng-khuán, lóng sī kuan-hē tsiong-lâi beh huat-sing ê tāi-tsì,
English: Having therefore obtained the help that is from God, I stand to this day testifying both to small and great, saying nothing but what the prophets and Moses said would happen,

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h guá, guá kám sī tuì lâng ai-uàn? Guá ê sim-sîn án-tsuáⁿ bô tio̍h-kip?
English: As for me, is my complaint to man? Why shouldn't I be impatient?

Tailo: Talsisih kah tó-sū ê lia̍t ông ē lâi tsìn-kòng; Síbah kah Sebah ê ông ē lâi hiàn lé-mi̍h.
English: The kings of Tarshish and of the islands will bring tribute. The kings of Sheba and Seba shall offer gifts.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lín tio̍h tshî-siú lín só͘-ū ê, it-ti̍t kàu guá tsài-lîm.
English: Nevertheless, hold firmly that which you have, until I come.

Tailo: Sàulô iáu-koh kè-sio̍k khióng-hat beh thâi Tsú ê bûn-tô͘. I khì kìⁿ tuā-tsè-si,
English: But Saul, still breathing threats and slaughter against the disciples of the Lord, went to the high priest,

Tailo: Hiah-ê thiāu tshāi tī tiān tsîng, tsi̍t ki tī tsiànn pîng, tsi̍t ki tī tò pîng; tsiànn pîng ê hō-miâ kiò-tsò Iá-kin, tò pîng ê hō-miâ kiò-tsò Bôohtsuh.
English: He set up the pillars before the temple, one on the right hand, and the other on the left; and called the name of that on the right hand Jachin, and the name of that on the left Boaz.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ lí ua̍t tńg-.lâi, Guá beh tshuā lí tsìn-tsîng, hō͘ lí tuì pak-hong ê ki̍k-thâu lâi, tshuā lí kàu Isulael ê suaⁿ.
English: and I will turn you about, and will lead you on, and will cause you to come up from the uttermost parts of the north; and I will bring you on the mountains of Israel;

Tailo: Kok lāi ê jîn-bîn lóng huann-hí, tsuân siânn lóng an-tsīng. In tī ông-kiong hia, īng to thâi-sí Athalíiah.
English: So all the people of the land rejoiced, and the city was quiet. Athaliah they had slain with the sword at the king's house.

Tailo: Uân-tsuân ê gī lâng ē pho͘-pêⁿ i ka-kī ê lō͘; tsí ū pháiⁿ lâng ē in-uī i ka-kī ê pháiⁿ lâi pua̍h-tó.
English: The righteousness of the blameless will direct his way, But the wicked shall fall by his own wickedness.

Tailo: Lí ê tsó͘-sian tshit-tsa̍p lâng lo̍h-khì Aigi̍p, taⁿ Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè hō͘ lí tshin-tshiūnn thinn-tíng ê tsheⁿ hiah-ni̍h tsē.
English: Your fathers went down into Egypt with seventy persons; and now Yahweh your God has made you as the stars of the sky for multitude.

Tailo: Iâkop ê ke, tio̍h lâi! Lán tio̍h tī Siōngtsú ê kng-bîng tiong lâi kiâⁿ.
English: House of Jacob, come, and let us walk in the light of Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ Huâ-láu ê sim ngē, mā beh tī Aigi̍p tē kiânn Guá tsin tsē ê sîn-jiah kî-sū.
English: I will harden Pharaoh's heart, and multiply my signs and my wonders in the land of Egypt.

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng ē-hiáu kóng-khí Siōngtsú ê tuā kuân-lîng? Siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng kóng-tshut I it-tshè ê miâ-siaⁿ?
English: Who can utter the mighty acts of Yahweh, Or fully declare all his praise?

Tailo: Guá beh tuì Siōngtè — guá ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ kóng, Lí ná ē bē kì-tit guá? Guá sī án-tsuáⁿ in-uī tuì-ti̍k ê ap-pik lâi iu-būn, kiâⁿ lâi kiâⁿ khì?
English: I will ask God, my rock, Why have you forgotten me? Why do I go mourning because of the oppression of the enemy?

Tailo: Kuan-hē tsit-ê tāi-tsì, Siōngtsú mā bat bīng-līng i, m̄-thang tuè pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng, tsóng-.sī, i bô siú Siōngtsú só͘ bīng-līng ê.
English: and had commanded him concerning this thing, that he should not go after other gods: but he didn't keep that which Yahweh commanded.

Tailo: Nā ū hó-gia̍h lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h i ê hiaⁿ-tī á-.sī tsí-muē ū khiàm-khueh, m̄-koh, bô tông-tsîng liân-bín ê sim, ná ē-tàng kóng i thiàⁿ Siōngtè?
English: But whoever has the world's goods, and sees his brother in need, and closes his heart of compassion against him, how does the love of God remain in him?

Tailo: Guā-sin sún-siong ê, á-.sī teh tshuì ê, á-.sī phuà-li̍h ê, á-.sī iam ê, m̄-thang hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú, tī lín ê thó͘-tē mā m̄-thang án-ne kiânn.
English: That which has its testicles bruised, crushed, broken, or cut, you shall not offer to Yahweh; neither shall you do thus in your land.

Tailo: Kiû Lí m̄-thang lī-khui guá hn̄g-hn̄g! In-uī huān-lān pik-kīn, bô lâng lâi pang-tsān guá.
English: Don't be far from me, for trouble is near. For there is none to help.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn tsiū huah, tsè-si mā pûn hō-tâng. Jîn-bîn thiaⁿ-tio̍h hō-tâng ê siann, tsiū tuā-siaⁿ huah, siâⁿ tshiûⁿ tsiū tó kah pêⁿ-pêⁿ, jîn-bîn tsiū tsìn-tsîng ji̍p siâⁿ, ta̍k lâng ti̍t-ti̍t khì, tsiū án-ne tsing-ho̍k hit-ê siâⁿ.
English: So the people shouted, and the priests blew the trumpets; and it happened, when the people heard the sound of the trumpet, that the people shouted with a great shout, and the wall fell down flat, so that the people went up into the city, every man straight before him, and they took the city.

Tailo: Mā bē koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h ting-hué ê kng, mā bē koh thiaⁿ-tio̍h sin-lông kah sin-niû ê siann. Lí ê sing-lí lâng pîng-sî tī tē-tsiūⁿ lóng sī ū sè-li̍k ê lâng; bān-kok mā lóng hō͘ lí ê siâ-su̍t bê-hi̍k khì!
English: The light of a lamp will shine no more at all in you. The voice of the bridegroom and of the bride will be heard no more at all in you; for your merchants were the princes of the earth; for with your sorcery all the nations were deceived.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Guá beh īng kńg-lê-á hong kā in tshue suàⁿ khì-kàu in só͘ m̄-bat ê lia̍t kok. Án-ne, tsit-ê tē tī in khì liáu-āu to̍h piàn-tsò pha-hng, tì-sú bô lâng tshut-ji̍p king-kuè, in-uī in hō͘ thang huann-hí ê tē pha-hng à.
English: but I will scatter them with a whirlwind among all the nations which they have not known. Thus the land was desolate after them, so that no man passed through nor returned: for they made the pleasant land desolate.

Tailo: In koh tshut siaⁿ khàu, OOl-pah kah ta-ke tsim-tshuì, to̍k-to̍k Lùthuh kah i pàng bē lī.
English: They lifted up their voice, and wept again: and Orpah kissed her mother-in-law, but Ruth joined with her.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá uàn-sin tsheh-miā, in-uī tī ji̍t-kng ê ē-bīn só͘ tsò ê kang lóng sī hō͘ guá lô-khó͘; in-uī tse lóng sī khang-hi, lóng sī lia̍h-hong.
English: So I hated life, because the work that is worked under the sun was grievous to me; for all is vanity and a chasing after wind.

Tailo: Koh ū Ga̍t ê tsi-tso̍k, Tiu-el ê kiáⁿ Elíasa̍h tsò Ga̍t lâng ê siú-líng.
English: The tribe of Gad: and the prince of the children of Gad shall be Eliasaph the son of Reuel.

Tailo: Isulael lâng tsiàu Mô͘se ê uē kiânn, tuì Aigi̍p lâng thó gîn-khì, kim-khì kah saⁿ-khò͘.
English: The children of Israel did according to the word of Moses; and they asked of the Egyptians jewels of silver, and jewels of gold, and clothing.

Tailo: Guá kā lín kóng, sím-phuàⁿ ê ji̍t-tsí nā kàu, So͘tóm só͘ siū ê hîng-hua̍t pí hit-ê siâⁿ só͘ siū ê iáu khah hó jím-siū.
English: I tell you, it will be more tolerable in that day for Sodom than for that city.

Tailo: In lâi beh thiaⁿ Iésu káng tō-lí, mā beh hō͘ I i-pēⁿ. Hiah-ê hō͘ siâ-sîn hū-sin kiáu-jiáu ê lâng mā lóng tit-tio̍h i-tī.
English: as well as those who were troubled by unclean spirits, and they were being healed.

Tailo: M̄-koh, thiaⁿ-liáu bô khì tsò ê lâng, sī tshin-tshiūnn lâng khí tshù tī thô͘ tíng, bô hē tē-ki, hō͘ khe-lâu tshiong-.tio̍h, hit king tshù tsiū suî-sî tó lo̍h-.khì, koh ē tó kah tsin siong-tiōng.
English: But he who hears, and doesn't do, is like a man who built a house on the earth without a foundation, against which the stream broke, and immediately it fell, and the ruin of that house was great.

Tailo: jî-tshiánn tsit-ê pháiⁿ tso̍k só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê, to̍h-sī tī Guá kā in kuáⁿ kàu hia só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê, in lóng beh kíng sí, m̄ kíng ua̍h. Tse sī bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: Death shall be chosen rather than life by all the residue that remain of this evil family, that remain in all the places where I have driven them, says Yahweh of Armies.

Tailo: Lāu lâng kóng, Guān lí pîng-an, lí só͘ su-iàu ê iû guá lâi tshù-lí, tsí-sī lí m̄-thang tī ke-lō͘-.ni̍h kuè-mê.
English: The old man said, Peace be to you; howsoever let all your wants lie on me; only don't lodge in the street.

Tailo: Guá beh liân-bín lín, hō͘ in mā liân-bín lín, hō͘ lín tńg-lâi pún só͘-tsāi.
English: I will grant you mercy, that he may have mercy on you, and cause you to return to your own land.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, Lí sī íng-uán tsûn-tsāi; Lí ê pó-tsō tāi-tāi bô suah.
English: You, Yahweh, abide forever; Your throne is from generation to generation.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng khuànn ián bē iâⁿ i, tsiū siàn Iâkop ê tuā-thuí-khū; sio-ián ê sî, Iâkop ê tuā-thuí-khū tsuāiⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: When he saw that he didn't prevail against him, he touched the hollow of his thigh, and the hollow of Jacob's thigh was strained, as he wrestled.

Tailo: Bô lâng bîng-pi̍k sī-hui, mā bô lâng tsáu-tshuē Siōngtè.
English: There is no one who understands. There is no one who seeks after God.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h tiuⁿ-tî, in-uī lín m̄-tsai lín ê tsú-lâng tang-sî ē tńg-.lâi, á-.sī beh àm-á, á-.sī puàⁿ-mê, á-.sī ke thî ê sî, á-.sī thiⁿ-kng ji̍t tshut ê sî.
English: Watch therefore, for you don't know when the lord of the house is coming, whether at evening, or at midnight, or when the rooster crows, or in the morning;

Tailo: I ta̍k pái king-kuè, ē kā lín lia̍h-.khì; ta̍k tsá-khí i ē king-kuè, bô làng mê-ji̍t; bîng-pi̍k só͘ thuân ê tsit-ê sìn-sit kan-taⁿ sī ē tuà-lâi kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: As often as it passes through, it will seize you; for morning by morning it will pass through, by day and by night; and it will be nothing but terror to understand the message.

Tailo: Iôséhuh ê tsú-lâng kā i kuaiⁿ lo̍h kaⁿ, to̍h-sī ông ê tsuē-huān siū kuaiⁿ ê só͘-tsāi. Tsiū án-ne, Iôséhuh hông kuainn tī hit-ê kaⁿ lāi.
English: Joseph's master took him, and put him into the prison, the place where the king's prisoners were bound, and he was there in custody.

Tailo: Tng hiah-ê ji̍t-tsí, Iôtah ke ē kah Isulael ê jîn-bîn tâng kiâⁿ; tuì pak-hong ê tē tsò-hué lâi, kàu Guá siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín ê tsó͘-sian tsò sán-gia̍p ê tē.
English: In those days the house of Judah shall walk with the house of Israel, and they shall come together out of the land of the north to the land that I gave for an inheritance to your fathers.

Tailo: Kám-siā hit uī īng tì-huī tshòng-tsō thinn ê Siōngtè, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: To him who by understanding made the heavens; For his loving kindness endures forever:

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Kàu hit ji̍t, Guá beh tuì lí tiong-kan tû-khì lí ê bé, huí-huāi lí ê tshia.
English: It will happen in that day, says Yahweh, That I will cut off your horses out of the midst of you, And will destroy your chariots.

Tailo: Hit sî, guá ìn kóng, Lí khuànn, guá lâi à! Guá ê tāi-tsì í-king kì tī tsheh-.ni̍h.
English: Then I said, Behold, I have come. It is written about me in the book in the scroll.

Tailo: Nā ū ông kah jîn-bîn tāng tshiú kái-uāⁿ tsit-ê bīng-līng, huí-huāi tī Êlúsalèm hit king Siōngtè ê tiān, guān an-tì I ê miâ tī hia ê Siōngtè kā in bia̍t-bông. Guá — Ta-lió-suh tshut tsit-ê bīng-līng, tio̍h kuáⁿ-kín tsiàu án-ne khì kiâⁿ.
English: and the God who has caused his name to dwell there overthrow all kings and peoples who shall put forth their hand to alter the same, to destroy this house of God which is at Jerusalem. I Darius have made a decree; let it be done with all diligence.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guá beh īng kám-un ê siann hiàn tsè hō͘ Lí, siā guá só͘ hē ê guān, tsín-kiù tshut tī Siōngtsú.
English: But I will sacrifice to you with the voice of thanksgiving. I will pay that which I have vowed. Salvation belongs to Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, m̄-sī ta̍k lâng lóng ū tsit khuán tì-sik. Ū lâng pài ngó͘-siōng kuàn-sì, kàu taⁿ tsia̍h hit-ê mi̍h ê sî iáu siūⁿ kóng sī teh tsia̍h ngó͘-siōng ê mi̍h. In ê liông-sim luán-jio̍k, siūⁿ kóng án-ne tsiū ē hō͘ hit khuán tsia̍h-mi̍h bak-tio̍h lah-sap.
English: However, that knowledge isn't in all men. But some, with consciousness of the idol until now, eat as of a thing sacrificed to an idol, and their conscience, being weak, is defiled.

Tailo: Guá nā siūⁿ-khí lán lī-pia̍t ê sî lí teh lâu ba̍k-sái, guá tsiū tsin ài koh kah lí kìⁿ-bīn, thang hō͘ guá muá-sim huann-hí.
English: longing to see you, remembering your tears, that I may be filled with joy;

Tailo: Lín ê tāng-tàⁿ, lín ê tsik-jīm kah lín ê uan-ke, guá ka-kī tsi̍t-ê lâng ná tam-tng ē khí?
English: How can I myself alone bear your encumbrance, and your burden, and your strife?

Tailo: Iésu kah in tsē-toh ê sî, the̍h piáⁿ tsiok-siā, jiân-āu peh-khui pun hō͘ in.
English: It happened, that when he had sat down at the table with them, he took the bread and gave thanks. Breaking it, he gave to them.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — Siōngtè, to̍h-sī Isulael ê Siōngtè, tsí ū I kiânn kî-ī ê tāi-tsì, lán ing-kai o-ló I!
English: Praise be to Yahweh God, the God of Israel, Who alone does marvelous deeds.

Tailo: tuì in kóng, Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k Mô͘se só͘ bīng-līng lín ê, lín lóng tsun-siú, guá só͘ bīng-līng lín ê, lín mā lóng tsun-thàn.
English: and said to them, You have kept all that Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded you, and have listened to my voice in all that I commanded you:

Tailo: In-uī tī Guá ê siū-khì tiong ū hué to̍h khí-.lâi, sio kàu im-kan ki̍k tshim ê só͘-tsāi, mā sio tē kah tē ê tshut-sán, mā khí hué sio tsiah-ê suaⁿ ê tē-ki.
English: For a fire is kindled in my anger, Burns to the lowest Sheol, Devours the earth with its increase, Sets on fire the foundations of the mountains.

Tailo: Kî-si̍t lín tiong-kan ū sio-kò, í-king piáu-sī lín ê tuā sit-tshò. Lín ná ē m̄ lîng-khó hō͘ lâng uan-óng? Ná ē m̄ lîng-khó siū khik-khui?
English: Therefore it is already altogether a defect in you, that you have lawsuits one with another. Why not rather be wronged? Why not rather be defrauded?

Tailo: Guá īng tsuí kā lín sé-lé, sī beh piáu-bîng lín ū hué-kái, m̄-koh, tī guá āu-bīn teh beh lâi ê hit uī, pí guá khah ū kuân-lîng, guá liân kā I kuāⁿ-ê to bē kham-tit. I beh īng Sìng Sîn kah hué kā lín sé-lé.
English: I indeed baptize you in water for repentance, but he who comes after me is mightier than I, whose shoes I am not worthy to carry. He will baptize you in the Holy Spirit.

Tailo: Tio̍h tsun-kìng tsin-tsiàⁿ teh tsiú-kuáⁿ ê hū-jîn-lâng.
English: Honor widows who are widows indeed.

Tailo: Guá ê jîn-bîn tú-tio̍h tsai-hō ê ji̍t-tsí, lí bô ing-kai ji̍p-khì i ê mn̂g; in tú-tio̍h tsai-hō ê ji̍t-tsí, lí bô ing-kai khuànn in teh siū khó͘; in tú-tio̍h tsai-hō ê ji̍t-tsí, lí bô ing-kai bong-tio̍h in ê tsâi-bu̍t.
English: Don't enter into the gate of my people in the day of their calamity. Don't look down on their affliction in the day of their calamity, neither seize their wealth on the day of their calamity.

Tailo: Elísiah kā i ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, Lí thang kā i kóng, lí khuàⁿ, lí uī guán huì tsin tsē sim-su, taⁿ tio̍h kā lí tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? Lí ài guá thè lí kā ông á-.sī kun-tiúⁿ kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h? Tsa-bó͘ lâng ìn kóng, Guá tuà tī guá ê jîn-bîn ê tiong-kan.
English: He said to him, Say now to her, Behold, you have been careful for us with all this care; what is to be done for you? would you be spoken for to the king, or to the captain of the army? She answered, I dwell among my own people.

Tailo: Samuel teh hiàn sio-tsè ê sî, Huilīsū lâng tsìn-tsîng lâi, beh kah Isulael lâng kau-tsiàn. Τī hit ji̍t, Siōngtsú khí tuā-siaⁿ ê luî lâi kong-kik Huilīsū lâng, kā in phah-luān, in tsiū tī Isulael lâng ê bīn-tsîng thâi-su.
English: As Samuel was offering up the burnt offering, the Philistines drew near to battle against Israel; but Yahweh thundered with a great thunder on that day on the Philistines, and confused them; and they were struck down before Israel.

Tailo: Sàulô í-king kā i ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Mikal, to̍h-sī Tabi̍t ê bó͘, hō͘ Ka-lîm lâng Laisi ê kiáⁿ Phàⁿthê tsò bó͘.
English: Now Saul had given Michal his daughter, David's wife, to Palti the son of Laish, who was of Gallim.

Tailo: In-uī gû kah iûⁿ ê hueh, bē-tàng tû-khì lâng ê tsuē.
English: For it is impossible that the blood of bulls and goats should take away sins.

Tailo: Tī guā-bīn ū to-kiàm, tī lāi-bīn ū un-i̍k, ū ki-hng; tī tshân-iá ê ē tuì to-kiàm lâi sí, ki-hng kah un-i̍k ē thun-bia̍t tī siâⁿ lāi ê.
English: The sword is outside, and the pestilence and the famine within: he who is in the field shall die with the sword: and he who is in the city, famine and pestilence shall devour him.

Tailo: Kî-si̍t bô pa̍t khuán ê hok-im, guá án-ne kóng sī in-uī ū lâng kā lín kiáu-jiáu, siūⁿ beh khiok-kái Ki-tok ê hok-im.
English: and there isn't another good news. Only there are some who trouble you, and want to pervert the Good News of Christ.

Tailo: Lí ê hiann-tī piàn sàn-tshiah lâi tuà tī lí hia, lí tio̍h kā i pó͘-tsō͘, hō͘ i kah lí tsò-hué tuà, tshin-tshiūnn tshut-guā lâng kah kià-kha ê.
English: If your brother has become poor, and his hand can't support him among you; then you shall uphold him. As a stranger and a sojourner he shall live with you.

Tailo: lí ê tshiú lāi nā ū tsuē-kò, tsiū tio̍h kā i tû-khì hn̄g-hn̄g, mā m̄-thang iông-ín put-gī tiàm tī lí ê pò͘-pêⁿ lāi.
English: If iniquity is in your hand, put it far away, Don't let unrighteousness dwell in your tents.

Tailo: Siōngtè ê ba̍k-tsiu teh khuàⁿ-kò͘ Iôtah ê tiúⁿ-ló, hiah-ê lâng bô hō͘ in thîng kang, thìng-hāu tsit-ê tāi-tsì kàu Ta-lió-suh, tit-tio̍h bûn-su lâi huê-hok tsit-ê tāi-tsì.
English: But the eye of their God was on the elders of the Jews, and they did not make them cease, until the matter should come to Darius, and then answer should be returned by letter concerning it.

Tailo: I ê sió-tī tuè-āu koh tshut-.lâi, i ê tshiú khîⁿ-tiâu Esáu ê kha-āu-teⁿ, só͘-í tsiū kā i hō-miâ kiò-tsò Iâkop. Nn̄g-ê kiáⁿ tshut-sì ê sî, Ísak tú-á la̍k-tsa̍p huè.
English: After that, his brother came out, and his hand had hold on Esau's heel. He was named Jacob. Isaac was sixty years old when she bore them.

Tailo: Guá koh thiaⁿ-tio̍h tuì thinn-tíng ū siaⁿ kóng, Lí tio̍h siá lo̍h-.lâi! Tuì taⁿ í-āu, uī-tio̍h Tsú lâi sòng-sit sèⁿ-miā ê lâng si̍t-tsāi ū hok-khì! Sìng Sîn huê-ìng kóng, Sī à, in ē kiat-sok in ê lô-khó͘ lâi an-hioh, in-uī in lô-khó͘ ê sîng-kó ē kin-tuè in khì.
English: I heard the voice from heaven saying, Write, Blessed are the dead who die in the Lord from now on.' Yes, says the Spirit, that they may rest from their labors; for their works follow with them.

Tailo: Kàu in tú-tio̍h tsin tsē tsai-hō huān-lān ê sî, tsit-ê kua ē tī in ê bīn-tsîng tsò kiàn-tsìng lâi kiàn-tsìng in, in-uī in ê kiáⁿ-sun ê tshuì beh liām, bô bē kì-.tit. In-uī hiān-kim Guá iáu-buē tshuā in kàu Guá só͘ tsiù-tsuā ê tē, in só͘ tsûn ê liām-thâu, Guá í-king tsai.
English: It shall happen, when many evils and troubles are come on them, that this song shall testify before them as a witness; for it shall not be forgotten out of the mouths of their seed: for I know their imagination which they frame this day, before I have brought them into the land which I swore.

Tailo: Lâng nā bô iok-sok ka-kī ê sim, tú tshin-tshiūnn huí-huāi ê siâⁿ bô tshiûⁿ.
English: Like a city that is broken down and without walls Is a man whose spirit is without restraint.

Tailo: Guá mā khióng-kiaⁿ guá āu-piàn koh khì lín hia ê sî, guá ê Siōngtè ē hō͘ guá tī lín ê bīn-tsîng kiàn-siàu, guá mā ē uī-tio̍h tsin tsē lâng thî-khàu, in-uī in tuì í-tsîng só͘ huān ê tsuē, ù-uè, kan-îm kah hòng-tōng, kàu taⁿ iáu-buē hué-kái.
English: that again when I come my God would humble me before you, and I would mourn for many of those who have sinned before now, and not repented of the uncleanness and sexual immorality and lustfulness which they committed.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, in kah bûn-tô͘ tsò-hué tuà siong-tong kú.
English: They stayed there with the disciples for a long time.

Tailo: Guān Lí ê tsok-uî tuì Lí ê lô͘-po̍k hián-hiān; guān Lí ê îng-kng tuì guán ê kiáⁿ-sun hián-bîng.
English: Let your work appear to your servants; Your glory to their children.

Tailo: Lí kiám-tsió i tshing-liân ê ji̍t-tsí, koh hō͘ i tuā-tuā kiàn-siàu. [Sè-la̍h]
English: You have shortened the days of his youth. You have covered him with shame. Selah.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ uàn-tò͘ Iôséhuh, kā i bē khì Aigi̍p; m̄-koh, Siōngtè kah i tông-tsāi,
English: The patriarchs, moved with jealousy against Joseph, sold him into Egypt. God was with him,

Tailo: Tē-jī-ê, tē-saⁿ-ê, kàu tē-tshit-ê lóng sī kāng-khuán tsîng-hîng.
English: In like manner the second also, and the third, to the seventh.

Tailo: Tsò hū-jîn-lâng ê, tio̍h tshin-tshiūnn sūn-ho̍k Tsú án-ne lâi sūn-ho̍k ka-kī ê tiōng-hu.
English: Wives, be subject to your own husbands, as to the Lord.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Siōngtsú ê miâ tuì hn̄g-hn̄g lâi, I ê siū-khì to̍h khí-.lâi, ba̍t-ba̍t ê ian tshìng kuân. I ê tshuì-tûn tshiong-muá siū-khì, I ê tsi̍h tshin-tshiūnn thun-bia̍t ê hué.
English: Behold, the name of Yahweh comes from far away, burning with his anger, and in thick rising smoke. His lips are full of indignation, and his tongue is as a devouring fire.

Tailo: Isulael ê tsú-bîn, lín tuì Guá kiânn kan-tsà, tsin-tsiàⁿ tshin-tshiūnn tsa-bó͘ lâng kiânn kan-tsà lī-khui i ê tiōng-hu. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: Surely as a wife treacherously departs from her husband, so have you dealt treacherously with me, house of Israel, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Iôséhuh kah in lāu-pē ê ka-kuàn lóng tuà Aigi̍p, Iôséhuh ua̍h pah-it huè.
English: Joseph lived in Egypt, he, and his father's house. Joseph lived one hundred ten years.

Tailo: Ông, lí teh khuàⁿ, tsiū khuàⁿ-tio̍h ū tsi̍t sian tuā siōng, tsit-ê siōng tsin kuân, hui-siông tshàn-lān, khiā tī lí ê bīn-tsîng, i ê hîng-tsōng tsin kiaⁿ-lâng.
English: You, O king, saw, and behold, a great image. This image, which was mighty, and whose brightness was excellent, stood before you; and the aspect of it was awesome.
