Tailo: Iôná tī hî ê pak-tó͘ lāi tuì i ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú kî-tó, kóng:
English: Then Jonah prayed to Yahweh, his God, out of the fish's belly.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h siú Guá it-tshè ê lu̍t-lē kah Guá só͘-ū ê huat-tō͘ lâi kiâⁿ, bián-tit Guá só͘ tshuā lín khì tuà ê tē kā lín thò͘ tshut-.khì.
English: You shall therefore keep all my statutes, and all my ordinances, and do them; that the land, where I am bringing you to dwell, may not vomit you out.

Tailo: Abulahàm khí-.lâi, tuì hit só͘-tsāi ê lâng, to̍h-sī Hiat tso̍k, àⁿ-io.
English: Abraham rose up, and bowed himself to the people of the land, even to the children of Heth.

Tailo: Iésu khì-kàu-uī ê sî, La̍h-tsa-lō͘ í-king bâi-tsòng tī bōng-.ni̍h sì ji̍t ā.
English: So when Jesus came, he found that he had been in the tomb four days already.

Tailo: Tsú ê Sìng Sîn lîm-kàu guá, in-uī I īng iû buah guá, hō͘ guá thuân hok-im hō͘ sàn-tshiah lâng. I tshe-phài guá lâi suan-pò͘ kóng, siū lia̍h ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h tháu-pàng, tsheⁿ-mê-.ê ē khuànn-kìnn, siū ap-pik ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h tsū-iû,
English: The Spirit of the Lord is on me, Because he has anointed me to preach good news to the poor. He has sent me to heal the brokenhearted, To proclaim release to the captives, Recovering of sight to the blind, To deliver those who are crushed,

Tailo: Lán nā kóng lán kah Siōngtè ū thuân-khè ê kuan-hē, m̄-koh, iáu kè-sio̍k tī o͘-àm tiong sing-ua̍h, án-ne sī teh kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t, bô tsiàu tsin-lí teh kiâⁿ.
English: If we say that we have fellowship with him and walk in the darkness, we lie, and don't tell the truth.

Tailo: Siōngtsú sī guá ê suaⁿ-giâm, guá ê suaⁿ-tsē, guá ê Kiù-tsú; guá ê Siōngtè, guá ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ, guá beh uá-khò I; I sī guá ê tîn-pâi, sī kiù guá ê hō-kak, sī guá ê siâⁿ-pó.
English: Yahweh is my rock, my fortress, and my deliverer; My God, my rock, in whom I take refuge; My shield, and the horn of my salvation, my high tower.

Tailo: Ohui ê kim bē ta̍t-tio̍h i; pó-kuì ê phik-gi̍k kah nâ-pó-tsio̍h mā bē-tàng.
English: It can't be valued with the gold of Ophir, With the precious onyx, or the sapphire .

Tailo: In tuì Nepkatnetsal ông kóng, Guān ông bān-suè!
English: They answered Nebuchadnezzar the king, O king, live for ever.

Tailo: I ê tē-ki tshāi tī siáⁿ-mi̍h ê tíng-bīn? Á-sī i kak-thâu ê tsio̍h sī siáⁿ lâng an-tì?
English: Whereupon were the foundations of it fastened? Or who laid its cornerstone,

Tailo: Só͘-í, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá ê lô͘-po̍k beh tsia̍h, m̄-koh, lín ē iau; lí khuàⁿ, Guá ê lô͘-po̍k beh lim, m̄-koh, lín ē tshuì-ta; lí khuàⁿ, Guá ê lô͘-po̍k beh huann-hí, m̄-koh, lín ē kiàn-siàu.
English: Therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh, Behold, my servants shall eat, but you shall be hungry; behold, my servants shall drink, but you shall be thirsty; behold, my servants shall rejoice, but you shall be disappointed;

Tailo: Iésu tsi̍t ē kā in kóng, Guá to̍h-sī. , in tsiū tó thè, pua̍h-tó tī thô͘-kha.
English: When therefore he said to them, I AM, they went backward, and fell to the ground.

Tailo: Iésu Ki-tok tsun-tsiàu Siōngtè ê tsí-ì, tsí-iàu tsi̍t pái hiàn ka-kī ê sing-khu, tsiū kàu-gia̍h hō͘ lán tit-tio̍h sìng-huà lâi kui-ǹg Siōngtè.
English: by which will we have been sanctified through the offering of the body of Jesus Christ once for all.

Tailo: Huâ-láu ê jîn-sîn khuàⁿ-tio̍h i, tsiū tuì Huâ-láu o-ló i. Hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tsiū hō͘ lâng tshuā ji̍p-khì Huâ-láu ê ông-kiong.
English: The princes of Pharaoh saw her, and praised her to Pharaoh; and the woman was taken into Pharaoh's house.

Tailo: Hit sî, in tsiū tsō gû-á kiáⁿ ê siōng, tuì hit-ê ngó͘-siōng hiàn tsè, huann-hí in ka-kī ê tshiú só͘ tsò ê ngó͘-siōng.
English: They made a calf in those days, and brought a sacrifice to the idol, and rejoiced in the works of their hands.

Tailo: Hiah-ê beh sím-mn̄g Páulô ê lâng tsiū suî-sî lī-khui. Iâⁿ-tiúⁿ tsi̍t ē tsai-iáⁿ Páulô sī Lô-má kong-bîn, koh in-uī bat kā i pa̍k, tsiū tsin kiaⁿ.
English: Immediately those who were about to examine him departed from him, and the commanding officer also was afraid when he realized that he was a Roman, because he had bound him.

Tailo: Lí nā kín-sīn tsun-thàn Siōngtsú só͘ bīng-līng Mô͘se kà-sī Isulael tsiah-ê lu̍t-lē kah huat-tō͘, lí tsiū ē hing-thong. Lí tio̍h hùn-tsì hó-tánn, m̄-bián kiaⁿ, m̄-bián lún.
English: Then shall you prosper, if you observe to do the statutes and the ordinances which Yahweh gave Moses concerning Israel. Be strong, and of good courage. Don't be afraid, neither be dismayed.

Tailo: Guá ū kè-uē kah tsin ê tì-sik; guá to̍h-sī tshong-bîng, guá ū lîng-li̍k.
English: Counsel and sound knowledge are mine. I have understanding and power.

Tailo: Jiânāu Páulô tsiū lī-khui in tshut-.khì.
English: Thus Paul went out from among them.

Tailo: In-uī guá mā sī hō͘ lâng kuán ê lâng, mā ū ping hō͘ guá kuán. Guá kā tsit-ê kóng, ' Khì! ', i tsiū khì; kā hit-ê kóng, ' Lâi! ', i tsiū lâi; kā guá ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, ' Án-ne tsò', i tsiū án-ne khì tsò.
English: For I also am a man placed under authority, having under myself soldiers. I tell this one, Go!' and he goes; and to another, Come!' and he comes; and to my servant, Do this,' and he does it.

Tailo: Tuā tsuí liáu-āu, nó͘-ah koh-tsài ua̍h saⁿ-pah gō͘-tsa̍p nî.
English: Noah lived three hundred fifty years after the flood.

Tailo: Tē-saⁿ ji̍t, tī Ga-lí-la-iah síng ê Ka-ná ū hun-iàn, Iésu ê lāu-bú ū tsham-ka.
English: The third day, there was a marriage in Cana of Galilee. Jesus' mother was there.

Tailo: Bâi-tsòng, koh tsiàu king-tián só͘ kì-tsài, tē-saⁿ ji̍t koh-ua̍h.
English: that he was buried, that he was raised on the third day according to the Scriptures,

Tailo: Te-li-lah tsiū īng sin soh-á kā i pa̍k khí-.lâi, tuì i kóng, Sâmsóng ah, Huilīsū lâng lâi beh lia̍h lí! Hit sî, bâi-ho̍k ê lâng bih tī lāi-pâng, Sâmsóng tsiū tshuah-tn̄g i tshiú-kut-.ni̍h ê soh-á, tshin-tshiūnn tshuah-tn̄g tsi̍t tiâu suàⁿ hiah kán-tan.
English: So Delilah took new ropes, and bound him therewith, and said to him, The Philistines are on you, Samson. The ambush was waiting in the inner chamber. He broke them off his arms like a thread.

Tailo: Ko-lîn-to ê pîng-iú, guán ê sim-hing í-king phah-khui, khui tshuì teh tuì lín kóng uē.
English: Our mouth is open to you, Corinthians. Our heart is enlarged.

Tailo: in-uī tuì Siōngtè lâi ê tsai-hō hō͘ guá kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ, in-uī I ê ui-giâm, guá tng bē-khí.
English: For calamity from God is a terror to me, By reason of his majesty I can do nothing.

Tailo: Hit sî, Só͘lômóng uī-tio̍h Mô͘ap khó-ò͘ⁿ ê sîn-bîng Ke-mô͘-sih kah Ammóng lâng khó-ò͘ⁿ ê sîn-bîng Mô͘-lo̍k, tī Êlúsalèm thâu-tsîng ê suaⁿ khí suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ.
English: Then did Solomon build a high place for Chemosh the abomination of Moab, on the mountain that is before Jerusalem, and for Molech the abomination of the children of Ammon.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Asiul bat tsò Le-ba-nòng ê pik-hiuⁿ tshiū, ki-ue tsin suí, ìm-ńg tshin-tshiūnn tshiū-nâ, tshiū-sin kuân-tuā, ki bué tshun ji̍p-khì tī hûn tiong.
English: Behold, the Assyrian was a cedar in Lebanon with beautiful branches, and with a forest-like shade, and of high stature; and its top was among the thick boughs.

Tailo: Mô͘ap ê tsai-hō teh beh kàu, i ê huān-lān tsin kín to̍h kàu.
English: The calamity of Moab is near to come, and his affliction hurries fast.

Tailo: Tio̍h tuì Siōngtè kóng, Lí ê tsok-uî hiah thang kiaⁿ-uì! In-uī Lí ê tuā kuân-lîng, Lí ê tuì-ti̍k lóng ē khut-ho̍k.
English: Tell God, How awesome are your deeds! Through the greatness of your power, your enemies submit themselves to you.

Tailo: Tē-tshit-ê thiⁿ-sài kā i hit-ê uánn piàⁿ lo̍h-khì khong-tiong, tsiū ū tuā-siaⁿ tuì sìng-tiān ê pó-tsō tshut-.lâi, kóng, Uân-sîng à!
English: The seventh poured out his bowl into the air. A loud voice came forth out of the temple of heaven, from the throne, saying, It is done!

Tailo: M̄-thang tshàng-tshiu; m̄-thang ngē lí ê ām-kún lâi kóng tuā-uē.
English: Don't lift up your horn on high. Don't speak with a stiff neck.

Tailo: Tuì mn̂g ji̍p-khì ê tsiah sī iûⁿ ê bo̍k-tsiá.
English: But one who enters in by the door is the shepherd of the sheep.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Hui-su-to͘ ìn kóng, Páulô kuainn tī Kai-sa-lī-a, guá liâm-piⁿ mā beh tńg-khì hia.
English: However Festus answered that Paul should be kept in custody at Caesarea, and that he himself was about to depart shortly.

Tailo: Gī lâng ê kng ē bîng-liāng; pháiⁿ lâng ê ting ē sit-.khì.
English: The light of the righteous shines brightly, But the lamp of the wicked is snuffed out.

Tailo: Lí lim tsuí mā tio̍h tsiàu niû, ta̍k ji̍t tsi̍t hin ê la̍k-hūn tsi-it, tsiàu-sî lâi lim.
English: You shall drink water by measure, the sixth part of a hin: from time to time shall you drink.

Tailo: Isulael ê tsú-bîn, lín tī khòng-iá sì-tsa̍p nî, kám ū īng tsè-sū kah lé-mi̍h hiàn hō͘ Guá?
English: Did you bring to me sacrifices and offerings in the wilderness forty years, house of Israel?

Tailo: Guá siū-tio̍h Iô-tá-iah lâng ê bô͘-hāi, tshì-liān, iáu-koh khiam-pi lâu ba̍k-sái teh ho̍k-sāi Tsú.
English: serving the Lord with all humility, with many tears, and with trials which happened to me by the plots of the Jews;

Tailo: Iésu Ki-tok tuì kuè-khì-kàu kin-á-ji̍t, it-ti̍t kàu íng-uán lóng bē kái-piàn.
English: Jesus Christ is the same yesterday, today, and forever.

Tailo: Tsè-si ji̍p-khì ê sî, tsiū m̄-thang tuì sìng-só͘ tshut-lâi-kàu guā-īⁿ; tio̍h tī hia pàng-lo̍h in kiânn tsit-hūn ê sî só͘ tshīng ê saⁿ, in-uī he sī sìng; tio̍h uāⁿ in ê saⁿ tsiah thang kàu sio̍k tī jîn-bîn ê só͘-tsāi.
English: When the priests enter in, then shall they not go out of the holy place into the outer court, but there they shall lay their garments in which they minister; for they are holy: and they shall put on other garments, and shall approach to that which pertains to the people.

Tailo: Iô-há-neh ìn kûn-tsiòng kóng, Guá īng tsuí kā lín sé-lé, to̍k-to̍k ū tsi̍t uī pí guá khah ū kuân-lîng ê teh beh lâi, guá liân kā I thǹg ê to bē kham-tit; I beh īng Sìng Sîn kah hué kā lín sé-lé.
English: John answered them all, I indeed baptize you with water, but he comes who is mightier than I, the latchet of whose sandals I am not worthy to loosen. He will baptize you in the Holy Spirit and fire,

Tailo: Guá ê sió-muē, guá ê sin-niû, lí tua̍t-khì guá ê sim; īng lí ê ba̍k-tsiu tsi̍t-ē khuànn, īng lí ê ām-kún ê tsi̍t tiâu kim liān-á, lí tua̍t-khì guá ê sim!
English: You have ravished my heart, my sister, my bride. You have ravished my heart with one of your eyes, With one chain of your neck.

Tailo: Guá beh īng un-i̍k kah lâu hueh lâi kā i pān; Guá mā beh īng tuā hō͘, tuā pha̍uh kah hué, í-ki̍p liû-hông kàng-lo̍h hō͘ i kah i ê kun-tuī, í-ki̍p kah i tsò-hué ê jîn-bîn.
English: With pestilence and with blood will I enter into judgment with him; and I will rain on him, and on his hordes, and on the many peoples who are with him, an overflowing shower, and great hailstones, fire, and sulfur.

Tailo: Kiau-ngō͘ kan-taⁿ ē ín-khí sio-tseⁿ; hō͘-siong tsham-siông ê lâng ū tì-huī.
English: Pride only breeds quarrels, But with ones who take advice is wisdom.

Tailo: In-uī tsin tsē lâng hō͘ siâ-sîn hū-sin, siâ-sîn tuā-siaⁿ huah tsiū tuì só͘ hū-sin ê lâng tshut-.khì. Tsin tsē piàn-suī-.ê, pái-kha-.ê, mā lóng tit-tio̍h i hó.
English: For unclean spirits came out of many of those who had them. They came out, crying with a loud voice. Many who had been paralyzed and lame were healed.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tī Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng tshî-siú ka-kī ê sìn-gióng. Tsò ka-kī khuàⁿ-tsò tio̍h ê tāi-tsì, koh bô tsuē-ok-kám ê lâng, si̍t-tsāi ū hok-khì.
English: Do you have faith? Have it to yourself before God. Happy is he who doesn't judge himself in that which he approves.

Tailo: I ê khuì kiōng-beh tn̄g; lîm-tsiong ê sî, tsiū kā i ê kiáⁿ ê miâ hō-tsò Biān-o͘-nî. M̄-koh, i ê lāu-pē kā i hō-miâ kiò-tsò Biāniámín.
English: It happened, as her soul was departing (for she died), that she named him Benoni, but his father named him Benjamin.

Tailo: Koh ū nn̄g tsâng ê kaⁿ-ná tshiū, tsi̍t tsâng tī iû kuī ê tsiànn pîng, tsi̍t tsâng tī iû kuī ê tò pîng.
English: and two olive trees by it, one on the right side of the bowl, and the other on the left side of it.

Tailo: Tí-tàn ê jîn-bîn, lí tio̍h thè-.khì, tio̍h khì tô-tsáu, tio̍h bih khì ún-ba̍t ê só͘-tsāi; in-uī Guá hîng-hua̍t Esáu ê sî, Guá beh hō͘ i ê tsai-hō lîm-kàu tī i.
English: Flee you, turn back, dwell in the depths, inhabitants of Dedan; for I will bring the calamity of Esau on him, the time that I shall visit him.

Tailo: In-uī I bô tuì thai-.ni̍h hō͘ guá sí, hō͘ guá ê lāu-bú tsò guá ê bōng, i ē tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tuā pak-tó͘.
English: because he didn't kill me from the womb; and so my mother would have been my grave, and her womb always great.

Tailo: Án-ne khuàⁿ khí-.lâi, tshe guá kàu tsia ê, m̄-sī lín, sī Siōngtè. I koh hō͘ guá tshin-tshiūnn Huâ-láu ê pē, tsò i tsuân ke ê tsú kah kuán-lí Aigi̍p tsuân tē.
English: So now it wasn't you who sent me here, but God, and he has made me a father to Pharaoh, lord of all his house, and ruler over all the land of Egypt.

Tailo: Hiah-ê jîn-bîn tsē, tuā koh lò, tshin-tshiūnn Alap lâng, tsóng-.sī, Siōngtsú tī Ammóng lâng ê bīn-tsîng kā in tsâu-bia̍t, in tsiū tit-tio̍h in ê tē, suà-tsiap tuà tī hia.
English: a people great, and many, and tall, as the Anakim; but Yahweh destroyed them before them; and they succeeded them, and lived in their place;

Tailo: Iôtah ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ sim-lāi ē siūⁿ kóng, ' Tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê jîn-bîn tsò guá ê la̍t, in-uī in ū uá-khò in ê Siōngtè — bān-kun ê Siōngtsú. '
English: The chieftains of Judah will say in their heart, The inhabitants of Jerusalem are my strength in Yahweh of Armies their God.'

Tailo: Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng tiong-kan ū ê kóng, Tsit-ê lâng bô siú An-hioh-ji̍t, m̄-sī tuì Siōngtè lâi ê. Ū ê kóng, Ū tsuē ê lâng ná ē kiânn tsit khuán sîn-jiah? In tsiū án-ne ì-kiàn hun-lia̍t.
English: Some therefore of the Pharisees said, This man is not from God, because he doesn't keep the Sabbath. Others said, How can a man who is a sinner do such signs? There was division among them.

Tailo: īng hué sio lí ê tshù-the̍h, tī tsin tsē tsa-bó͘ lâng ê bīn-tsîng sím-phuàⁿ lí; Guá it-tīng hō͘ lí bô koh kiânn kan-îm, mā bô koh sàng lâng mi̍h-kiāⁿ.
English: They shall burn your houses with fire, and execute judgments on you in the sight of many women; and I will cause you to cease from playing the prostitute, and you shall also give no hire any more.

Tailo: I jiok in, kiâⁿ i só͘ m̄-bat kiânn ê lō͘, an-jiân kuè-.khì.
English: He pursues them, And passes by safely, Even by a way that he had not gone with his feet.

Tailo: M̄-thang phian-ǹg hiah-ê hō͘ kuí hū-sin ê kah kiâⁿ siâ-su̍t ê, mā m̄-thang khì mn̄g in, tì-kàu hō͘ in uè lah-sap. Guá sī Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè.
English: Don't turn to those who are mediums, nor to the wizards. Don't seek them out, to be defiled by them. I am Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Lēbī tī in tshù uī-tio̍h Iésu pān tuā iàn-si̍k. Ū thiu-suè ê lâng kah kî-tha tsin tsē lâng lâi kah in tsò-hué tsē-toh tsia̍h pn̄g.
English: Levi made a great feast for him in his house. There was a great crowd of tax collectors and others who were reclining with them.

Tailo: I kóng, ' Kiû lí tsún guá-.khì, in-uī guán tau tī siâⁿ lāi ū tsè-sū, guá ê a-hiaⁿ huan-hù guá khì. Taⁿ guá nā tī lí ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián, kiû lí tsún khì kìⁿ guá hiah-ê a-hiaⁿ. ' Só͘-í, i bô lâi kah ông tsē-toh.
English: and he said, Please let me go, for our family has a sacrifice in the city; and my brother, he has commanded me to be there: and now, if I have found favor in your eyes, let me get away, I pray you, and see my brothers. Therefore he is not come to the king's table.

Tailo: Kì-jiân tī in ê ngó͘-siōng ê bīn-tsîng tsò jîn-bîn ê tshe-īng, koh tsò tsó͘-gāi hō͘ Isulael ê tsú-bîn hām-lo̍h tsuē-kò, só͘-í Guá gia̍h-khí tshiú kā in kong-kik, in ē tam-tng in ê tsuē-kò. Tse sī tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: Because they ministered to them before their idols, and became a stumbling block of iniquity to the house of Israel; therefore have I lifted up my hand against them, says the Lord Yahweh, and they shall bear their iniquity.

Tailo: Lín m̄-sī tsia̍h tsi̍t kang, nn̄g kang, gō͘ kang, tsa̍p kang, jī-tsa̍p kang,
English: You shall not eat one day, nor two days, nor five days, neither ten days, nor twenty days,

Tailo: Taⁿ lín m̄-thang bú-bān, nā bô, khióng-kiaⁿ kā lín pa̍k ê soh ē khún khah ân; in-uī guá tuì Tsú — bān-kun ê Siōngtsú thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, I tsua̍t-tuì ē tī tsuân tē-tsiūⁿ kiânn só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h bia̍t-bông ê tāi-tsì.
English: Now therefore don't be scoffers, lest your bonds be made strong; for I have heard a decree of destruction from the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, on the whole earth.

Tailo: Siōngtsú mā beh tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ ín-tshuā lí, tī khòng-uāⁿ ê tē, hō͘ lí sim-muá ì-tsiok, kut-thâu ióng-tsòng; lí ē tshin-tshiūⁿ siū kuàn-ak ê hn̂g, koh tshin-tshiūnn lâu bē-ta ê tsuí-tsuâⁿ.
English: and Yahweh will guide you continually, and satisfy your soul in dry places, and make strong your bones; and you shall be like a watered garden, and like a spring of water, whose waters don't fail.

Tailo: Tsè-si Êlīatsal tuì kau-tsiàn tńg-.lâi ê kun-tuī kóng, Siōngtsú só͘ bīng-līng Mô͘se lu̍t-huat ê tiâu-lē to̍h-sī án-ne:
English: Eleazar the priest said to the men of war who went to the battle, This is the statute of the law which Yahweh has commanded Moses:

Tailo: I ê kiáⁿ Ísak kah Isimael kā i bâi-tsòng tī Mak-pe-la̍h ê hia̍t, tsit-ê hia̍t tī Mamlē ê thâu-tsîng, Hiat lâng Tso-hal ê kiáⁿ Ehulóng ê tshân tiong,
English: Isaac and Ishmael, his sons, buried him in the cave of Machpelah, in the field of Ephron, the son of Zohar the Hittite, which is before Mamre,

Tailo: Guá ê ba̍k-tsiu in-uī iu-siong phah-pháiⁿ. Siōngtsú ah, guá ta̍k ji̍t teh kiû-kiò Lí, guá ǹg Lí gia̍h tshiú kî-tó.
English: My eyes are dim from grief. I have called on you daily, Yahweh. I have spread out my hands to you.

Tailo: In hiah-ê tuà tī tsng-thâu ê hiann-tī, muí tshit ji̍t lâi kā in tàu-kha-tshiú.
English: Their brothers, in their villages, were to come in every seven days from time to time to be with them:

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, in bô kiáⁿ, in-uī E-lí-sa-biat bē huâi-īn, nn̄g lâng ê nî-huè iū-koh lāu à.
English: But they had no child, because Elizabeth was barren, and they both were well advanced in years.

Tailo: Gī-huē ê lâng thiaⁿ-liáu hui-siông siū-khì, ài beh kā in hāi-sí.
English: But they, when they heard this, were cut to the heart, and determined to kill them.

Tailo: mā bô tshin-tshiūnn tuì Guá bīng-līng sū-su kuán-lí Guá ê tsú-bîn — Isulael lâng ê ji̍t, Guá ē hō͘ lí thuat-lī só͘-ū ê tuì-ti̍k, tit-tio̍h an-tsīng, jî-tshiánn Siōngtsú kā lí kóng, Siōngtsú ē kā lí kiàn-li̍p lí ê ke.
English: and as from the day that I commanded judges to be over my people Israel; and I will cause you to rest from all your enemies. Moreover Yahweh tells you that Yahweh will make you a house.

Tailo: So͘tóm kah Ammo͘la̍h í-ki̍p sì-kho͘-uî siâⁿ-tshī ê lâng, mā kah hiah-ê thiⁿ-sài kāng-khuán kiânn kan-îm, hòng-tshiòng uî-huán tsū-jiân ê sìng-io̍k, tì-sú siū-tio̍h íng-uán bē-hua ê hué ê hîng-hua̍t. Tse thang tsò tsìng lâng ê kíng-kài.
English: Even as Sodom and Gomorrah, and the cities around them, having, in the same way as these, given themselves over to sexual immorality and gone after strange flesh, are set forth as an example, suffering the punishment of eternal fire.

Tailo: I m̄-siū khó͘-khǹg, guán tsiū suah-.khì, kan-taⁿ kóng, Guān Tsú ê tsí-ì si̍t-hiān!
English: When he would not be persuaded, we ceased, saying, The Lord's will be done.

Tailo: Ē-bīn sī Siōngtsú só͘ tsí-tīng ê tseh-kî, to̍h-sī lín kàu Siōngtsú só͘ tsí-tīng ê ji̍t-tsí só͘ tio̍h suan-pò͘ ê sìng-huē.
English: These are the set feasts of Yahweh, even holy convocations, which you shall proclaim in their appointed season.

Tailo: beh tsò i kah i ê kiáⁿ-sun íng-uán tsò tsè-si ê tsit-ê iok, in-uī i uī-tio̍h i ê Siōngtè ū tsi̍t-tò͘ ê sim, koh uī-tio̍h Isulael lâng sio̍k-tsuē. '
English: and it shall be to him, and to his seed after him, the covenant of an everlasting priesthood; because he was jealous for his God, and made atonement for the children of Israel.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá tāi-sing khuàn-bián lí, tio̍h thè só͘-ū ê lâng hiòng Siōngtè khún-kiû, kî-tó, tāi-tó kah kám-siā.
English: I exhort therefore, first of all, that petitions, prayers, intercessions, and givings of thanks, be made for all men:

Tailo: Guá in-uī tuā-siaⁿ huah tì-kàu ià-siān, guá ê nâ-âu ta-.khì; guá in-uī thìng-hāu Siōngtè, ba̍k-tsiu suah hue khì.
English: I am weary with my crying. My throat is dry. My eyes fail, looking for my God.

Tailo: Hit-ê enn-á kàu tē-peh ji̍t tio̍h siū kat-lé.
English: In the eighth day the flesh of his foreskin shall be circumcised.

Tailo: lín tsiū tio̍h kā i khuán-thāi, tshin-tshiūnn i siūⁿ beh kā i khuán-thāi ê hiann-tī ê. Αń-ne tsiū ē-tàng tuì lín tiong-kan tû-khì hit-ê pháiⁿ.
English: then shall you do to him, as he had thought to do to his brother: so shall you put away the evil from the midst of you.

Tailo: Tsiū-sī Babúlông lâng, Kal-tí-ah tsìng lâng kah Pe-ko͘t, Siú-ua, Go-ah tsiah-ê tso̍k. Asiul ê tsìng lâng kah in lâi, ū síng-tiúⁿ, kuaⁿ-uân, kun-tiúⁿ, ū miâ-siaⁿ ê, khiâ bé ê, lóng sī khó-ài ê siàu-liân lâng.
English: the Babylonians and all the Chaldeans, Pekod and Shoa and Koa, and all the Assyrians with them; desirable young men, governors and rulers all of them, princes and men of renown, all of them riding on horses.

Tailo: In teh kìng-pài Tsú, kìm-tsia̍h ê sî, Sìng Sîn kóng, Tio̍h uī guá tshe-phài Ba-ná-ba kah Sàulô, khì tsò guá ho͘-tiàu in khì tsò ê kang-tsok.
English: As they served the Lord and fasted, the Holy Spirit said, Separate Barnabas and Saul for me, for the work to which I have called them.

Tailo: Lín nā guān-ì tsiap-siū tsiah-ê ī-giân, tsit-ê lâng to̍h-sī teh beh lâi ê Eliiah.
English: If you are willing to receive it, this is Elijah, who is to come.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, gín-á m̄-tsai tse sī siáⁿ-mi̍h ì-sù, tsí ū Ionáthan kah Tabi̍t tsai tsit-ê tāi-tsì.
English: But the boy didn't know anything: only Jonathan and David knew the matter.

Tailo: Kā iûⁿ tshiat tsi̍t tè tsi̍t tè, Mô͘se kā thâu kah bah-tè, í-ki̍p iû lóng sio.
English: He cut the ram into its pieces; and Moses burned the head, and the pieces, and the fat.

Tailo: Tio̍h ǹg I gîm-si, ǹg I tshiùⁿ kua o-ló! Tâm-lūn I it-tshè kî-biāu ê só͘ tsò!
English: Sing to him, sing praises to him! Tell of all his marvelous works.

Tailo: mā-sī in lāu-pē ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ, koh sī tuā khuì-la̍t ê ióng-sū. Tsiàu in ê tso̍k-phó͘, in ê sè-hē lâi sǹg, ū nn̄g-bān khòng nn̄g-pah lâng.
English: They were reckoned by genealogy, after their generations, heads of their fathers' houses, mighty men of valor, twenty thousand two hundred.

Tailo: Hó-gia̍h lâng siūⁿ kóng tsâi-bu̍t sī i kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ, ná tshin-tshiūnn ū kuân tshiûⁿ thang khò.
English: The rich man's wealth is his strong city, Like an unscalable wall in his own imagination.

Tailo: Tshuā siū lia̍h ê lâng tuì Babúlông lâi-kàu Êlúsalèm ê sî, Sesibatsal kā tsiah-ê lóng tuà-.khì.
English: All the vessels of gold and of silver were five thousand and four hundred. All these did Sheshbazzar bring up, when they of the captivity were brought up from Babylon to Jerusalem.

Tailo: Amí-me-li̍k kóng, Siáⁿ lâng tsò tsit-ê tāi-tsì guá m̄-tsai, lí mā bô kā guá kóng, kàu kin-á-ji̍t guá tsiah thiaⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: Abimelech said, I don't know who has done this thing. Neither did you tell me, neither did I hear of it, until today.

Tailo: Ē ū tsiah-ê tsín-kiù ê lâng tsiūⁿ Si-óng suaⁿ, lâi sím-phuàⁿ Esáu ê suaⁿ; kok-tō͘ tsiū kui tī Siōngtsú.
English: Saviors will go up on Mount Zion to judge the mountains of Esau, and the kingdom will be Yahweh's.

Tailo: Hi-lu̍t ông thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê tāi-tsì, sim-lāi put-an, tsuân Êlúsalèm ê lâng mā sī án-ne.
English: When Herod the king heard it, he was troubled, and all Jerusalem with him.

Tailo: Koh tio̍h tshuā Alông kah i hiah-ê kiáⁿ, lâi-kàu huē-bō͘ mn̂g tsîng, īng tsuí kā in sé.
English: You shall bring Aaron and his sons to the door of the tent of meeting, and shall wash them with water.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — guá ê Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí pang-tsān guá, tsiàu Lí ê tsû-ài tsín-kiù guá,
English: Help me, Yahweh, my God. Save me according to your loving kindness;

Tailo: [siàu-lí] Ông tsē-toh ê sî, guá ê ná-ta̍t phang-iû tshìng-tshut i ê phang-bī.
English: While the king sat at his table, My perfume spread its fragrance.

Tailo: Ga̍t ē hō͘ kun-tuī tui-pik; tsóng-.sī, i beh tui-pik in ê kha-āu-teⁿ.
English: Gad, a troop will press on him; But he will press on their heel.

Tailo: In í-king pûn sàu-kak, tsún-pī tsê-tsuân; tsóng-.sī, bô lâng tshut-khì kau-tsiàn, in-uī Guá ê tuā siū-khì lîm-kàu in tsìng lâng.
English: They have blown the trumpet, and have made all ready; but none goes to the battle; for my wrath is on all the multitude of it.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, koh kah Huilīsū lâng tī Gop kau-tsiàn, hit sî ū Ho-siah lâng Sibékai thâi-sí tsi̍t-ê tuā-hàn tso̍k ê lâng, miâ tsò Sa-huh.
English: It came to pass after this, that there was again war with the Philistines at Gob: then Sibbecai the Hushathite killed Saph, who was of the sons of the giant.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, tī huē-bō͘ ê mn̂g-kháu, thâi hit tsiah gû.
English: You shall kill the bull before Yahweh, at the door of the tent of meeting.

Tailo: Iésu mn̄g in kóng, Lín ū guā tsē piáⁿ? In kóng, Tshit tè.
English: He asked them, How many loaves do you have? They said, Seven.

Tailo: Êsutel ê tsiàu-bīng kian-kò͘ Phul ê tāi-tsì, mā ū kì tī tsheh-.ni̍h.
English: The commandment of Esther confirmed these matters of Purim; and it was written in the book.

Tailo: I mā siū-khì i saⁿ-ê pîng-iú, in-uī in siūⁿ bô uē thang ìn, iáu-koh gí-tiāⁿ Iobuh ū tsuē.
English: Also his wrath was kindled against his three friends, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, lí tio̍h kā lí ê kiáⁿ kóng, ' Tse sī in-uī Siōngtsú, tī guá tshut Aigi̍p ê sî, só͘ kā guá kiânn ê tāi-tsì.
English: You shall tell your son in that day, saying, It is because of that which Yahweh did for me when I came forth out of Egypt.'

Tailo: Kàu hit sî, kiàn-nā ū kiû-kiò Siōngtsú ê miâ ê ē tit-tio̍h kiù; in-uī tī Si-óng suaⁿ kah tī Êlúsalèm ē ū tô-thuat ê lâng, tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ kóng ê, tī tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê jîn-bîn tiong-kan ē ū Siōngtsú só͘ tiàu ê.
English: It will happen that whoever will call on the name of Yahweh shall be saved; For in Mount Zion and in Jerusalem there will be those who escape, As Yahweh has said, And among the remnant, those whom Yahweh calls.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā lí ê tshiú só͘ ing-kai tsò ê tāi-tsì, tio̍h tsīn-la̍t khì tsò; in-uī tī lí só͘ beh khì ê im-kan, bô kang-tsok, bô kè-uē, bô tì-sik, mā bô tì-huī.
English: Whatever your hand finds to do, do it with your might; for there is no work, nor device, nor knowledge, nor wisdom, in Sheol, where you are going.

Tailo: Bôohtsuh mn̄g i só͘ phài kuah be̍h ê thâu-lâng kóng, Hit-ê sī siáⁿ lâng ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ?
English: Then said Boaz to his servant who was set over the reapers, Whose young lady is this?

Tailo: A-buah lâng tsō Nip-ha-tsuh kah Thal-thak, Se-hua-ba-im lâng īng hué sio kiáⁿ-jî, hiàn hō͘ Se-hua-ba-im ê sîn-bîng Atolammeli̍k kah A-nam-me-li̍k.
English: and the Avvites made Nibhaz and Tartak; and the Sepharvites burnt their children in the fire to Adrammelech and Anammelech, the gods of Sepharvaim.

Tailo: Guá m̄-bat kā Lí ê kong-gī khàm ba̍t tī guá ê sim-lāi; guá í-king pâi-lia̍t Lí ê sìn-si̍t kah Lí ê kiù-un; guá tī tuā tsū-huē tiong m̄-bat am-khàm Lí ê tsû-ài kah sìn-si̍t.
English: I have not hidden your righteousness within my heart. I have declared your faithfulness and your salvation. I have not concealed your loving kindness and your truth from the great assembly.

Tailo: Guá kiû ài tit-tio̍h tsit-ê gín-á, Siōngtsú í-king siúⁿ-sù guá só͘ tuì I kiû ê.
English: For this child I prayed; and Yahweh has given me my petition which I asked of him:

Tailo: E-siu-lûn puî tsiū ah-pà, lí í-king puî, koh tuā-lia̍p, bah tsin phauh; i tsiū lī-khui tshòng-tsō i ê Siōngtsú, khuànn-khin tsín-kiù i ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ.
English: But Jeshurun grew fat, and kicked: You have grown fat, you are grown thick, you are become sleek; Then he forsook God who made him, Lightly esteemed the Rock of his salvation.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê lâng tshò tshiū ê sî, pó͘-thâu bah ka-la̍uh tī tsuí-.ni̍h. I tsiū tuā-siaⁿ huah, Tshám ah! Guá ê Tsú ah, tsit ki pó͘-thâu sī tsioh lâi ê.
English: But as one was felling a beam, the axe head fell into the water; and he cried, and said, Alas, my master! for it was borrowed.

Tailo: Huilīsū hiah-ê siú-líng tshut-lâi kau-tsiàn, in ta̍k pái tshut-.lâi, Tabi̍t tsò pí Sàulô hiah-ê jîn-sîn khah tsing-thong. Tsiū án-ne, i ê miâ hō͘ lâng koh khah tsun-tiōng.
English: Then the princes of the Philistines went forth: and it happened, as often as they went forth, that David behaved himself more wisely than all the servants of Saul; so that his name was much set by.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng kóng, Lí só͘ hō͘ guá tsò-phuāⁿ ê tsa-bó͘ lâng, i kā hit-tsâng tshiū ê kué-tsí hō͘ guá, guá tsiū tsia̍h.
English: The man said, The woman whom you gave to be with me, she gave me of the tree, and I ate.

Tailo: Jiânāu guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h sì-ê thiⁿ-sài khiā tī tē ê sì-kak-thâu, kā tē sì-bīn ê hong tòng teh, hō͘ hong bē tshue-lâi tē, hái kah it-tshè ê tshiū-ba̍k.
English: After this, I saw four angels standing at the four corners of the earth, holding the four winds of the earth, so that no wind would blow on the earth, or on the sea, or on any tree.

Tailo: Tsia̍h piáⁿ ê tsa-po͘ lâng tsiū ū gō͘-tshing.
English: Those who ate the loaves were five thousand men.

Tailo: Phâng tshit tè uánn, té-muá siōng lō͘-bué tshit-hāng tsai-hō ê thiⁿ-sài, kî-tiong tsi̍t-ê lâi kah guá kóng-uē, kóng, Lâi! Guá beh pò lí khuàⁿ sin-niû, to̍h-sī iûⁿ-ko ê bó͘.
English: One of the seven angels who had the seven bowls, who were loaded with the seven last plagues came, and he spoke with me, saying, Come here. I will show you the wife, the Lamb's bride.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê kûn-tsiòng kám bô beh īng sio̍k-gí lâi phue-phîng i, īng phì-jū lâi kā i khau-sé, kóng, Tsik-tsū tsin tsē bô sio̍k ka-kī ê tsâi-bu̍t, tio̍h koh guā kú? The̍h tsin tsē tsún-tǹg ê mi̍h lâi tòng-tsò ka-kī ê, hit khuán lâng ū tsai-hō ah.
English: Won't all these take up a parable against him, and a taunting proverb against him, and say, Woe to him who increases that which is not his, and who enriches himself by extortion! How long?'

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng: Guá ê tsú-bîn kì-jiân bô-iân bô-kò͘ hō͘ lâng lia̍h-.khì, taⁿ Guá tī tsia teh tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? Siōngtsú kóng: Kā in kuán-hat ê lâng huā-huā háu teh kiò, Guá ê miâ kui ji̍t siū siat-to̍k.
English: Now therefore, what do I here, says Yahweh, seeing that my people is taken away for nothing? those who rule over them do howl, says Yahweh, and my name continually all the day is blasphemed.

Tailo: Ū tuì thiⁿ kau-tsiàn ê, tsheⁿ-sîn tuì in ê kuí-tō lâi kah Sisela̍h kau-tsiàn.
English: From the sky the stars fought, From their courses they fought against Sisera.

Tailo: Sán-pô tuì Huâ-láu kóng, Hi-bú-lâi ê tsa-bó͘ lâng kah Aigi̍p ê tsa-bó͘ lâng bô kāng, in khah ū ua̍h-la̍t, sán-pô iáu-buē kàu, in í-king seⁿ-liáu.
English: The midwives said to Pharaoh, Because the Hebrew women aren't like the Egyptian women; for they are vigorous, and give birth before the midwife comes to them.

Tailo: Tsit-ê ī-siōng tsí ū guá — Taniel tsi̍t-ê lâng khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, in-uī kah guá tông-tsāi ê lâng bô khuàⁿ-tio̍h hit-ê ī-siōng, kan-taⁿ phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah, tsáu-khì bih.
English: I, Daniel, alone saw the vision; for the men who were with me didn't see the vision; but a great quaking fell on them, and they fled to hide themselves.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guá tī Isulael lâng tiong-kan lâu tshit tshing lâng, in ê kha-thâu-u m̄-bat kuī kuè Baal, in ê tshuì m̄-bat kā i tsim.
English: Yet will I leave me seven thousand in Israel, all the knees which have not bowed to Baal, and every mouth which has not kissed him.

Tailo: hō͘ thâi-sí-lâng ê lâng, to̍h-sī pîng-sî bô kiat-uàn, sit-gō͘ thâi-sí i ê tshù-piⁿ ê, thang tô-tsáu khì hia, nā í-king tsáu ji̍p-khì tsiah-ê siâⁿ ê lâng, tsiū ē-tàng tit-tio̍h ua̍h,
English: that the manslayer might flee there, who kills his neighbor unawares, and didn't hate him in time past; and that fleeing to one of these cities he might live:

Tailo: thâu tì tâng-khue, sin tshīng ū lân ê tsiàn-kah, i ê tsiàn-kah ê tâng, ū gō͘ tshing si-khel ê tāng;
English: He had a helmet of brass on his head, and he was clad with a coat of mail; and the weight of the coat was five thousand shekels of brass.

Tailo: In lóng sio-siâng tó tī thô͘-.ni̍h, hō͘ thâng khàm ba̍t.
English: They lie down alike in the dust, The worm covers them.

Tailo: In-uī thó͘-tē án-tsuáⁿ hō͘ pah hāng ê ngó͘-kok puh-gê, hn̂g án-tsuáⁿ hō͘ só͘ tsìng ê sing-tióng, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú mā beh án-ne hō͘ kong-gī kah o-ló tī bān-kok ê bīn-tsîng huat-sing.
English: For as the earth brings forth its bud, and as the garden causes the things that are sown in it to spring forth; so the Lord Yahweh will cause righteousness and praise to spring forth before all the nations.

Tailo: Guá beh īng tì-huī kiânn tī uân-tsuân ê lō͘. Lí siáⁿ-sî ē lâi-kàu guá tsia? Guá beh īng uân-tsuân ê sim kiânn tī guá ê tshù lāi.
English: I will be careful to live a blameless life. When will you come to me? I will walk within my house with a blameless heart.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Guá pó-sioh Guá ê sìng-miâ, to̍h-sī Isulael ê tsú-bîn tī in só͘ khì-kàu ê lia̍t kok tiong só͘ siat-to̍k ê.
English: But I had regard for my holy name, which the house of Israel had profaned among the nations, where they went.

Tailo: Siōngtsú thiaⁿ Isulael lâng ê siann, kā Ka-nân lâng kau-tài in; in tsiū kā Ka-nân lâng kah in ê siâⁿ tsuân-pō͘ siau-bia̍t. Hit só͘-tsāi ê miâ tsiū kiò-tsò Hol-mah.
English: Yahweh listened to the voice of Israel, and delivered up the Canaanites; and they utterly destroyed them and their cities: and the name of the place was called Hormah.

Tailo: Lín ē tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì! Lín sī ka-kī jia-khàm lâi tsheⁿ-mê! In tsuì m̄-sī in-uī tsiú; in tian-lâi tian-khì m̄-sī in-uī kāu tsiú.
English: Pause and wonder! Blind yourselves and be blind! They are drunken, but not with wine; they stagger, but not with strong drink.

Tailo: Án-ne kóng-khí-.lâi, in-uī tsit-má ê îng-kng pí í-tsîng ê koh khah tuā, tì-sú kuè-khì hiah-ni̍h tuā ê îng-kng suah siau-sit-.khì.
English: For most assuredly that which has been made glorious has not been made glorious in this respect, by reason of the glory that surpasses.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h ē kì-tit lí tī Aigi̍p bat tsò lô͘-lē, Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè kiù-sio̍k lí tuì hia tshut-.lâi, só͘-í, guá bīng-līng lí tio̍h án-ne kiânn.
English: but you shall remember that you were a bondservant in Egypt, and Yahweh your God redeemed you there: therefore I command you to do this thing.

Tailo: E-hō͘-iá-kim kah i ê tsó͘-sian tâng khùn. I ê kiáⁿ E-hō͘-iá-kin suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: So Jehoiakim slept with his fathers; and Jehoiachin his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h Iésu ê kà-sī, tsin tio̍h-kiaⁿ.
English: When the multitudes heard it, they were astonished at his teaching.

Tailo: In ìn Iosiúah kóng, In-uī ū lâng khak-si̍t pò lí ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè bat bīng-līng I ê lô͘-po̍k Mô͘se, kā tsit-ê tsuân tē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín, mā tī lín ê thâu-tsîng tsâu-bia̍t tuà tī tsit-ê só͘-tsāi só͘-ū ê jîn-bîn, só͘-í, guán in-uī lín ê iân-kò͘, khióng-kiaⁿ bô miā, tsiah tsò tsit-ê tāi-tsì.
English: They answered Joshua, and said, Because it was certainly told your servants, how that Yahweh your God commanded his servant Moses to give you all the land, and to destroy all the inhabitants of the land from before you; therefore we were sore afraid for our lives because of you, and have done this thing.

Tailo: Tng kàng hîng-hua̍t ê ji̍t, ū tsai-hō tuì hn̄g-hn̄g lîm-kàu, hit sî lín beh án-tsuáⁿ? Lín beh tsáu-khì kiû siáⁿ lâng kā lín kiù? Lín ê tsâi-pó ē lâu tī siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi?
English: What will you do in the day of visitation, and in the desolation which will come from afar? To whom will you flee for help? Where will you leave your wealth?

Tailo: In tio̍h ta̍k tsá-khí án-ne tsún-pī iûⁿ-ko, sò͘-tsè kah iû, tsò tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ hiàn ê sio-tsè.
English: Thus shall they prepare the lamb, and the meal offering, and the oil, morning by morning, for a continual burnt offering.

Tailo: In-uī Hesibóng ai-siong ê siann thàng-kàu E-lé-a-leh, ti̍t-ti̍t kàu Ia-hat, koh tuì Tso-al kàu Ho-lo-niám, it-ti̍t kàu Eg-lat-si-li-siah, in-uī Nim-lim ê tsuí it-tīng ē ta-.khì.
English: From the cry of Heshbon even to Elealeh, even to Jahaz have they uttered their voice, from Zoar even to Horonaim, to Eglath Shelishiyah: for the waters of Nimrim also shall become desolate.

Tailo: Mô͘se tshiú gia̍h-khí ê sî, Isulael lâng tsiū khah iâⁿ; tshiú suê lo̍h-.khì ê sî, Amáli̍k lâng tsiū khah iâⁿ.
English: It happened, when Moses held up his hand, that Israel prevailed; and when he let down his hand, Amalek prevailed.

Tailo: Iôtah uá-kīn Iôséhuh kóng, Guá ê tsú, kiû lí iông-ín lí ê lô͘-po̍k kóng tsi̍t kù uē hō͘ guá ê tsú thiaⁿ. M̄-thang tuì lí ê lô͘-po̍k siū-khì, in-uī lí kah Huâ-láu sio-siâng.
English: Then Judah came near to him, and said, Oh, my lord, please let your servant speak a word in my lord's ears, and don't let your anger burn against your servant; for you are even as Pharaoh.

Tailo: Tshì-thàm-tsiá uá-lâi kā I kóng, Lí nā-sī Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ, tio̍h bīng-līng tsiah-ê tsio̍h-thâu piàn-tsò piáⁿ.
English: The tempter came and said to him, If you are the Son of God, command that these stones become bread.

Tailo: Abigail tsiū khí-.lâi, phak tī thô͘-kha, kóng, Lí ê lú-pī tī tsia, guān tsò tshe-īng, lâi sé guá ê tsú hiah-ê lô͘-po̍k ê kha.
English: She arose, and bowed herself with her face to the earth, and said, Behold, your handmaid is a servant to wash the feet of the servants of my lord.

Tailo: Kám ū tsi̍t kok kái-uāⁿ in ê sîn-bîng? Kî-si̍t hiah-ê m̄-sī Siōngtè! Tsóng-.sī, Guá ê jîn-bîn kā in ê îng-kng the̍h-lâi uāⁿ hit-ê bô lī-ik ê.
English: Has a nation changed its gods, which yet are no gods? but my people have changed their glory for that which does not profit.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtè beh kiù Si-óng, khí-tsō Iôtah ê siâⁿ; in ē tit-tio̍h ìng-ín ê tē tsò sán-gia̍p, lâi tuà tī hia.
English: For God will save Zion, and build the cities of Judah. They shall settle there, and own it.

Tailo: Kiû Lí m̄-thang kì-tit guán tsó͘-sian ê tsuē lâi tuì guán thó; guān Lí ê tsû-pi kín-kín lîm-kàu guán, in-uī guán í-king hām-lo̍h kàu ki̍k pi-bî ê tē-pō͘.
English: Don't hold the iniquities of our forefathers against us. Let your tender mercies speedily meet us, For we are in desperate need.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h thó͘-khuì kah-ná io-kut at-tn̄g lâi thòng-khó͘; tī in ê bīn-tsîng thó͘-khuì.
English: Sigh therefore, you son of man; with the breaking of your thighs and with bitterness shall you sigh before their eyes.

Tailo: Siōngtè kóng, Tsuí tio̍h sing-thuàⁿ tsin tsē ū ua̍h-miā ê tōng-bu̍t, tsiáu pue tī tē ê tíng-bīn kah thinn-tíng ê kiong-tshong.
English: God said, Let the waters swarm with swarms of living creatures, and let birds fly above the earth in the open expanse of sky.

Tailo: Guān Lí ê tsè-si īng kong-gī tsò saⁿ-tshīng! Guān Lí sìng ê tsú-bîn tshut huann-hí ê siann!
English: Let your priest be clothed with righteousness. Let your saints shout for joy!

Tailo: Ehulaim mā bô kā tuà tī Getsel ê Ka-nân lâng kuáⁿ tshut-.khì, Ka-nân lâng tsiū tī in tiong-kan, iû-guân tuà tī Getsel.
English: Ephraim didn't drive out the Canaanites who lived in Gezer; but the Canaanites lived in Gezer among them.

Tailo: Huilīsū lâng tsiū kau-tsiàn, Isulael lâng thâi-su, ta̍k-ê tsáu tńg-khì in ê pò͘-pênn, thâi-sí tsin tsē. Isulael ê pō͘-ping sí saⁿ bān lâng.
English: The Philistines fought, and Israel was struck, and they fled every man to his tent: and there was a very great slaughter; for there fell of Israel thirty thousand footmen.

Tailo: Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, hok-im bô-lūn thuân-kàu siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi, lâng lóng ē kóng-khí tsit-ê hū-jîn-lâng só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì, lâi kā i kì-liām.
English: Most assuredly I tell you, wherever this Good News may be preached throughout the whole world, that which this woman has done will also be spoken of for a memorial of her.

Tailo: tsiū lóng tsū-tsi̍p uá-.lâi, tâng-sim ha̍p-ì beh kah Iosiúah í-ki̍p Isulael lâng kau-tsiàn.
English: that they gathered themselves together, to fight with Joshua and with Israel, with one accord.

Tailo: Kong-kik só͘-ū ê kuân suaⁿ kah só͘-ū tuā ê suaⁿ-niá;
English: For all the high mountains, For all the hills that are lifted up,

Tailo: Sàn-tshiah lâng nā ū sio-kò, lí m̄-thang phian-tuàn.
English: You shall not deny justice to your poor people in their lawsuits.

Tailo: Tng in jua̍h-.lâng ê sî, Guá beh uī in pān tsiú-toh, hō͘ i tsiú-tsuì, hō͘ i khuài-lo̍k, hō͘ i kú-tn̂g teh khùn, íng-uán bô tsing-sîn. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: When they are heated, I will make their feast, and I will make them drunken, that they may rejoice, and sleep a perpetual sleep, and not wake, says Yahweh.

Tailo: tui-kiù tsit-ê tāi-tsì, kó-jiân sī si̍t, tsiū kā hit nn̄g lâng tiàu tī tshâ-kè tíng, koh kā tsit-ê tāi-tsì tī ông ê bīn-tsîng kì-tsài tī li̍k-sú ê tsheh.
English: When inquisition was made of the matter, and it was found to be so, they were both hanged on a tree: and it was written in the book of the chronicles before the king.

Tailo: Tabi̍t tsiàu Ga̍t ê uē tsiūⁿ-.khì, tsiàu Siōngtsú ê bīng-līng.
English: David went up according to the saying of Gad, as Yahweh commanded.

Tailo: Kàu hit ji̍t, lín bē koh mn̄g guá siáⁿ-mi̍h. Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, lín hōng guá ê miâ tuì Thiⁿ-pē só͘ kiû ê, I lóng ē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín.
English: In that day you will ask me no questions. Most assuredly I tell you, whatever you may ask of the Father in my name, he will give it to you.

Tailo: Siōngtè ah, Lí bat tshì-giām guán, tuàn-liān guán tshin-tshiūnn teh tuàn-liān gîn.
English: For you, God, have tested us. You have refined us, as silver is refined.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ē kā lí khui I thinn-tíng pó-puè ê khò͘-pâng, lo̍h ki̍p-sî ê hō͘ tī lí ê tē, tī lí ê tshiú só͘ tsò it-tshè ê tāi-tsì kā lí sù-hok. Lí ē tsioh hō͘ tsin tsē kok, lí mā m̄-bián tsioh.
English: Yahweh will open to you his good treasure in the sky, to give the rain of your land in its season, and to bless all the work of your hand: and you shall lend to many nations, and you shall not borrow.

Tailo: Tng Phelsiah ông Ko-le-si guân nî, in-uī beh ìng-giām Siōngtsú thok I-é-lí-miah só͘ kóng ê uē, Siōngtsú tsiū kik-tōng Phelsiah ông Ko-le-si ê sim, hō͘ i suan-pò͘ tī tsuân kok, koh siá bīng-līng, kóng,
English: Now in the first year of Cyrus king of Persia, that the word of Yahweh by the mouth of Jeremiah might be accomplished, Yahweh stirred up the spirit of Cyrus king of Persia, so that he made a proclamation throughout all his kingdom, and put it also in writing, saying,

Tailo: Guá tsiū kā guá ê sè-î kuah kui tè, tshe lâng the̍h kàu Isulael tit-tio̍h tsò sán-gia̍p ê tsuân tē, in-uī in tī Isulael tiong kiânn kan-îm kah kiàn-siàu sū.
English: I took my concubine, and cut her in pieces, and sent her throughout all the country of the inheritance of Israel; for they have committed lewdness and folly in Israel.

Tailo: Tī tsia, Siōngtè pīng bô hō͘ i sán-gia̍p, liân khiā kha ê só͘-tsāi to bô. Suî-jiân hit sî i iáu-buē ū kiáⁿ, Siōngtè ìng-ín beh sù hō͘ i tsit-ê thó͘-tē, thang tsò i kah kiáⁿ-sun ê sán-gia̍p.
English: He gave him no inheritance in it, no, not so much as to set his foot on. He promised that he would give it to him for a possession, and to his seed after him, when he still had no child.

Tailo: Só͘lômóng hō͘ Hilâm nn̄g bān kol ê sió-be̍h, jī-tsa̍p kol ê tshing-iû, tsò i tshù lāi ê tsia̍h-mi̍h. Só͘lômóng ta̍k nî tsiàu án-ne hō͘ Hilâm.
English: Solomon gave Hiram twenty thousand measures of wheat for food to his household, and twenty measures of pure oil: thus gave Solomon to Hiram year by year.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Aigi̍p tsuân tē ē tú-tio̍h tuā hó-nî-tang tshit nî,
English: Behold, there come seven years of great plenty throughout all the land of Egypt.

Tailo: In-uī tse tuì lín lâi kóng m̄-sī khang-khang ê tāi-tsì, sī lín ê ua̍h-miā, mā ē in-uī tsit-ê tāi-tsì, lín ê ji̍t-tsí tit-tio̍h kú-tn̂g, tī lín kuè Ioltàn hô beh ji̍p-khì sîng-tsiap ê tē.
English: For it is no vain thing for you; because it is your life, and through this thing you shall prolong your days in the land, where you go over the Jordan to possess it.

Tailo: Tē-gō͘ ji̍t tio̍h hiàn gû-káng-á káu tsiah, mî-iûⁿ-káng nn̄g tsiah, bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-á tsa̍p-sì tsiah, lóng tio̍h bô khuat-tiám ê.
English: On the fifth day nine bulls, two rams, fourteen male lambs a year old without blemish;

Tailo: Huē-tsiòng tshuā hit-ê lâng tshut-khì iâⁿ guā, īng tsio̍h-thâu kā i tìm kàu sí, sī tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ bīng-līng Mô͘se ê.
English: All the congregation brought him outside of the camp, and stoned him to death with stones; as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: I īng lé-mi̍h hiàn hō͘ Mô͘ap ông Egúlóng, Egúlóng sī tsi̍t-ê tsin puî ê lâng.
English: He offered the tribute to Eglon king of Moab: now Eglon was a very fat man.

Tailo: koh īng sûn-kim hō͘ i tsò bah-tshe, puânn kah pue, koh tshìn kim hō͘ i thang tsò ta̍k-ê kim uáⁿ, tshìn gîn hō͘ i tsò ta̍k-ê gîn-uáⁿ,
English: and the forks, and the basins, and the cups, of pure gold; and for the golden bowls by weight for every bowl; and for the silver bowls by weight for every bowl;

Tailo: Bé tio̍h kín tsiūⁿ-.lâi! Tshia tio̍h luān-luān tsáu! Ióng-sū tio̍h tshut-.lâi, Kú-si̍t kah Put ê lâng lóng giâ tîn-pâi, Lùt ê lâng gâu khui kiong.
English: Go up, you horses; and rage, you chariots; and let the mighty men go forth: Cush and Put, who handle the shield; and the Ludim, who handle and bend the bow.

Tailo: Iésu tiām-tiām lóng bô ìn. Tuā-tsè-si koh mn̄g I kóng, Lí sī Ki-tok, sī ing-kai o-ló ê hit uī ê Kiáⁿ, á m̄-sī?
English: But he stayed quiet, and answered nothing. Again the high priest asked him, Are you the Christ, the Son of the Blessed?

Tailo: I uī-tio̍h só͘ thiaⁿ-tio̍h kah só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâi tsò kiàn-tsìng, mā bô lâng tsiap-la̍p I ê kiàn-tsìng.
English: What he has seen and heard, of that he testifies; and no one receives his witness.

Tailo: In tī hia tuā-siaⁿ huah, tsóng-.sī, bô lâng kā in ū ìn-tap, in-uī pháiⁿ lâng kiau-ngō͘-ê iân-kò͘.
English: There they cry, but none gives answer, Because of the pride of evil men.

Tailo: In-uī Guá beh kā tsuí piàⁿ hō͘ tshuì-ta ê lâng, īng hô tsuí kuàn-ak ta tē. Guá beh kā Guá ê sîn kàng-lo̍h tī lí ê kiáⁿ-sun, kā Guá ê hok-khì kàng-lo̍h tī lí ê āu-tāi.
English: For I will pour water on him who is thirsty, and streams on the dry ground; I will pour my Spirit on your seed, and my blessing on your offspring:

Tailo: Ū lâng tuì Iésu kóng, Iô-há-neh ê bûn-tô͘ tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kìm-tsia̍h kî-tó, Hua-lí-sái phài ê bûn-tô͘ mā sī án-ne, m̄-koh, Lí ê bûn-tô͘ mā lim mā tsia̍h.
English: They said to him, Why do John's disciples often fast and pray, likewise also the disciples of the Pharisees, but yours eat and drink?

Tailo: Îm-hū īng tsin tsē kî-khiáu ê uē ín-iú i, īng phô͘-tháⁿ ê tshuì pik i tsò-hué khì.
English: With persuasive words, she led him astray. With the flattering of her lips, she seduced him.

Tailo: Lín í-tsîng tsò liáu tsin hó. Sī siáⁿ lâng kā lín tsó͘-tòng, hō͘ lín bô koh sūn-tsiông tsin-lí?
English: You were running well! Who interfered with you that you should not obey the truth?

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng ê tshù ē tó-huāi; tsìng-ti̍t lâng ê pò͘-pênn ē hing-ōng.
English: The house of the wicked will be overthrown, But the tent of the upright will flourish.

Tailo: Tī i ê jîn-bîn tiong-kan ē bô kiáⁿ bô sun, tī i kià-kha ê só͘-tsāi mā bô lâu tsi̍t-ê lâng tī-.leh.
English: He shall have neither son nor grandson among his people, Nor any remaining where he sojourned.

Tailo: Tio̍h khǹg lāu lâng m̄-thang ài lim tsiú, tio̍h tuan-tsong siú-kí, koh ū sûn-tsuân ê sìn-gióng, thiàⁿ-sim kah nāi-sim.
English: that older men should be temperate, sensible, sober minded, sound in faith, in love, and in patience:

Tailo: Iésu kóng, Ū nn̄g-ê lâng khiàm tsè-tsú ê tsînn. Tsi̍t-ê khiàm i gō͘-pah ê gîn-á, tsi̍t-ê khiàm i gō͘-tsa̍p.
English: A certain lender had two debtors. The one owed five hundred denarii, and the other fifty.

Tailo: I kiânn Siōngtsú só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò hó ê tāi-tsì, tsiàu i ê tsó͘-sian Tabi̍t só͘ kiâⁿ ê it-tshè.
English: He did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh, according to all that David his father had done.

Tailo: Lí ná ē thau-thau-á tsáu? Lí thau-tsáu mā bô kā guá kóng; hō͘ guá bē-tàng īng huann-hí, tshiùⁿ kua, phah kó͘, tuâⁿ khîm, lâi sàng lí tńg-.khì, kám m̄-sī?
English: Why did you flee secretly, and deceive me, and didn't tell me, that I might have sent you away with mirth and with songs, with tambourine and with harp;

Tailo: I ê thang, i ê mn̂g-lông kah i ê tsang tshiū, lóng sī tsiàu ǹg tang ê mn̂g; lâng tuì tshit tsàn ê kiā-á tsiūⁿ-kàu hia, thâu-tsîng ū hiah-ê lông.
English: The windows of it, and the arches of it, and the palm trees of it, were after the measure of the gate whose prospect is toward the east; and they went up to it by seven steps; and the arches of it were before them.

Tailo: Tso-lô-ba-bel ê tshiú ū hē tsit king tiān ê tē-ki, i ê tshiú mā beh uân-sîng tsit-ê kang, lí tsiū ē tsai sī bān-kun ê Siōngtsú tshe-phài guá lâi-kàu lín tsia.
English: The hands of Zerubbabel have laid the foundation of this house. His hands shall also finish it; and you will know that Yahweh of Armies has sent me to you.

Tailo: In-uī Iô-há-neh tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kā i kóng, Lí tsiàm tsit-ê hū-jîn-lâng lâi tsò bó͘ bô ha̍h lu̍t-huat.
English: For John said to him, It is not lawful for you to have her.

Tailo: Lín bô-lūn kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h á-.sī tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h, lóng tio̍h tsiàu Tsú Iésu ê tsí-ì, thong-kuè I lâi kám-siā Thiⁿ-pē Siōngtè.
English: Whatever you do, in word or in deed, do all in the name of the Lord Jesus, giving thanks to God the Father, through him.

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h lí nā kiânn tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng, tshin-tshiūnn lí ê lāu-pē Tabi̍t só͘ kiâⁿ ê, tsun-thàn Guá it-tshè só͘ bīng-līng lí ê, tsip-siú Guá ê lu̍t-lē kah Guá ê huat-tō͘,
English: As for you, if you will walk before me as David your father walked, and do according to all that I have commanded you, and will keep my statutes and my ordinances;

Tailo: Tsú kóng, In-uī tsiah-ê jîn-bîn tshin-kīn Guá, īng tshuì, īng tshuì-tûn tsun-kìng Guá, sim khiok lī-khui Guá hn̄g-hn̄g. In tsun-kìng Guá, tsí-put-kò sī tsun-thàn lâng só͘ kà-sī ê bīng-līng niā-niā.
English: The Lord said, Because this people draws near with their mouth and with their lips to honor me, but they have removed their heart far from me, and their fear of me is a commandment of men which has been taught;

Tailo: Lāu-su ah, Mô͘se kóng, ' Ū lâng bô senn kiáⁿ to̍h sí-.khì, i ê sió-tī tio̍h tshuā hiaⁿ-só lâi tsò bó͘, thang seⁿ kiáⁿ lâi uī i ê a-hiaⁿ thuân-tsong tsiap-tāi. (tsù, SBK 25:5)
English: saying, Teacher, Moses said, If a man dies, having no children, his brother shall marry his wife, and raise up seed for his brother.'

Tailo: Í-āu Amnon hui-siông uàn-hūn i, hit-ê uàn-hūn i ê uàn-hūn, pí í-tsîng thiàⁿ i ê thiàⁿ koh khah tuā. Amnon tsiū kā i kóng, Khí-.lâi, lí tshut-.khì.
English: Then Amnon hated her with exceeding great hatred; for the hatred with which he hated her was greater than the love with which he had loved her. Amnon said to her, Arise, be gone.

Tailo: Tuā-tsè-si Atsalíah kah só͘-ū ê tsè-si khuàⁿ-tio̍h i thâu-hia̍h khí thái-ko, tsiū kā i kuáⁿ-tshut tiān; i ka-kī mā kuáⁿ-kín tshut-.khì, in-uī Siōngtsú kā i phah.
English: Azariah the chief priest, and all the priests, looked on him, and behold, he was leprous in his forehead, and they thrust him out quickly from there; yes, himself hurried also to go out, because Yahweh had struck him.

Tailo: sī lí sì-kho͘-uî tsiah-ê kok ê sîn-bîng. ' Lī-khui lín tsin kīn, á-.sī lī-khui lín tsin hn̄g, tuì tsit-ê tē-ki̍k kàu hit-ê tē-ki̍k ê,
English: of the gods of the peoples who are round about you, near to you, or far off from you, from the one end of the earth even to the other end of the earth;

Tailo: Ki-tok sī tiong-si̍t ê kiàn-tsìng-jîn, sī thâu tsi̍t-ê tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h, koh sī tē-tsiūⁿ bān-ông ê Tsú-tsáiⁿ.
English: and from Jesus Christ, the faithful witness, the firstborn of the dead, and the ruler of the kings of the earth. To him who loves us, and washed us from our sins by his blood;

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, i ê siàu-liân lâng ē tī i ê ke-lō͘ tó lo̍h-.khì. Tng hit ji̍t, i só͘-ū ê ping-á lóng ē bia̍t-bông. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: Therefore shall her young men fall in her streets, and all her men of war shall be brought to silence in that day, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā ū tì-huī ê lâng ē kuan-sim tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, mā ē siàu-liām Siōngtsú ê tsû-ài.
English: Whoever is wise will pay attention to these things. They will consider the loving kindnesses of Yahweh.

Tailo: Tsuân huē-tsiòng tshe lâng kā Lim-móng tsio̍h-puâⁿ ê Biāniámín lâng kóng, īng hô-pîng ê uē pò in.
English: The whole congregation sent and spoke to the children of Benjamin who were in the rock of Rimmon, and proclaimed peace to them.

Tailo: Tio̍h īng pán tsò tuâⁿ, tiong-ng khang-khak, lóng tio̍h tsiàu Guá tī suaⁿ tíng tsí-sī lí ê khuán-sit lâi tsò.
English: Hollow with planks shall you make it: as it has been shown you on the mountain, so shall they make it.

Tailo: Lâng nā beh sio̍k-huê tsit-ê tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it ê siáⁿ-mi̍h mi̍h, tsiū tio̍h ke gō͘-hūn tsi-it ê kè-tsînn.
English: If a man redeems anything of his tithe, he shall add a fifth part to it.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h tsiàu Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè só͘ bīng-līng lín ê, tio̍h tsip-siú lâi tsiàu án-ne kiânn, m̄-thang phian tsó, mā m̄-tio̍h phian iū.
English: You shall observe to do therefore as Yahweh your God has commanded you: you shall not turn aside to the right hand or to the left.

Tailo: Sìng Sîn só͘ kiat ê kué-tsí-sī, thiàⁿ-sim, huann-hí, hô-pîng, jím-nāi, tsû-pi, siān-liông, tiong-si̍t,
English: But the fruit of the Spirit is love, joy, peace, patience, kindness, goodness, faithfulness,

Tailo: in khì tsun-thàn pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng kā i ho̍k-sāi, sī in pîng-sî só͘ m̄-bat ê sîn-bîng, Siōngtsú m̄-bat hun-phài hō͘ in ê.
English: and went and served other gods, and worshiped them, gods that they didn't know, and that he had not given to them:

Tailo: Tabi̍t kiàn só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì lóng tsin tsing-thong, Siōngtsú kah i tông-tsāi.
English: David behaved himself wisely in all his ways; and Yahweh was with him.

Tailo: Guá kā lí kóng, khí-.lâi, giâ lí ê pho͘-á tńg-khì lí ê tshù.
English: I tell you, arise, take up your mat, and go to your house.

Tailo: Siōngtsú to̍k-to̍k huaⁿ-hí lí ê tsó͘-sian, thiàⁿ in, tī bān-bîn tiong kíng-suán in ê kiáⁿ-sun, to̍h-sī lín tsiah-ê, tshin-tshiūnn kin-á-ji̍t to̍h-sī.
English: Only Yahweh had a delight in your fathers to love them, and he chose their seed after them, even you above all peoples, as at this day.

Tailo: Bíng lâng tshiúⁿ-khì ê, kám ē-tàng tshiúⁿ tò tńg-.lâi? Kiông ê lâng só͘ tshiúⁿ-lia̍h ê, kám ē-tàng kiù i?
English: Shall the prey be taken from the mighty, or the lawful captives be delivered?

Tailo: Elísiah koh kóng, Kiò i lâi. Tsiū khì kiò i lâi. Tsa-bó͘ lâng tsiū khiā tī mn̂g-kháu.
English: He said, Call her. When he had called her, she stood in the door.

Tailo: I kiânn Siōngtsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, kiânn Ia-lô-ba-am ê lō͘ kah i hō͘ Isulael lâng só͘ huān ê tsuē.
English: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, and walked in the way of Jeroboam, and in his sin with which he made Israel to sin.

Tailo: In-uī i ê bé tsin tsē, giâ khí ê thô͘-sua hún ē kā lí jia-khàm; i ji̍p-khì lí ê siâⁿ mn̂g, tshin-tshiūnn lâng ji̍p-khì ū phuà-khiah ê siâⁿ. Hit sî, in-uī khiâ bé ê kah ūn-niû tshia, í-ki̍p tsiàn-tshia ê siann, lí ê siâⁿ ē iô-tāng.
English: By reason of the abundance of his horses their dust shall cover you: your walls shall shake at the noise of the horsemen, and of the wagons, and of the chariots, when he shall enter into your gates, as men enter into a city in which is made a breach.

Tailo: M̄-koh, sî-ji̍t teh beh kàu, sin-lông ē hō͘ lâng tuì in tiong-kan lia̍h-.khì. Hit ji̍t in tsiū ē kìm-tsia̍h.
English: But the days will come when the bridegroom will be taken away from them, and then will they fast in that day.

Tailo: Siōngtsú beh tsò ông, it-ti̍t kàu íng-uán.
English: Yahweh shall reign forever and ever.

Tailo: Lín kā hiah-ê gī lâng tīng tsuē, koh kā in thâi-sí, in mā bô kā lín tí-khòng.
English: You have condemned, you have murdered the righteous one. He doesn't resist you.

Tailo: Guán ê tsó͘-sian só͘ huí-bia̍t ê, to̍h-sī Go-tsán, Khal-lân, Le-tse-hu kah sio̍k The-la-sal ê Etiân lâng, tsiah-ê kok ê sîn-bîng kám bat kā in kiù?
English: Have the gods of the nations delivered them, which my fathers have destroyed, Gozan, and Haran, and Rezeph, and the children of Eden that were in Telassar?

Tailo: Án-ne sī kóng, tuì jio̍k-thé seⁿ ê kiáⁿ bô lóng sǹg sī Siōngtè ê kiáⁿ-jî, tsí ū tuì Siōngtè ê ìng-ín seⁿ ê tsiah sǹg-tsò sī Siōngtè ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: That is, it is not the children of the flesh who are children of God, but the children of the promise are counted as a seed.

Tailo: Un-i̍k liáu-āu, Siōngtsú huan-hù Mô͘se kah tsè-si Alông ê kiáⁿ Êlīatsal kóng,
English: It happened after the plague, that Yahweh spoke to Moses and to Eleazar the son of Aaron the priest, saying,

Tailo: I ê kiáⁿ-sun tī sè-kan it-tīng kiông-sīng; tsìng-ti̍t lâng ê āu-tāi it-tīng ē tit-tio̍h hok-khì.
English: His seed will be mighty in the land. The generation of the upright will be blessed.

Tailo: Iésu kóng tsiah-ê uē, sī teh tsí Piattò͘ ē án-tsuáⁿ sí lâi îng-kng Siōngtè. Án-ne kóng suah, Iésu kā i kóng, Lâi tuè guá.
English: Now he said this, signifying by what kind of death he would glorify God. When he had said this, he said to him, Follow me.

Tailo: Guá suî-jiân sī kong-gī, mā m̄-káⁿ ìn I, to̍k-to̍k tuì sím-phuàⁿ guá ê kiû in.
English: Whom, though I were righteous, yet would I not answer. I would make supplication to my judge.

Tailo: Ia-lô-ba-am ê bó͘ tsiū tsiàu án-ne khì kiâⁿ, khí-sin khì Sī-lô, lâi-kàu Ahiiah ê ke. Ahiiah in-uī nî lāu, ba̍k-tsiu tshâ-tshâ khuànn bē-tio̍h.
English: Jeroboam's wife did so, and arose, and went to Shiloh, and came to the house of Ahijah. Now Ahijah could not see; for his eyes were set by reason of his age.

Tailo: M̄-thang kóng i án-tsuáⁿ khuán-thāi guá, guá mā án-ne kā i khuán-thāi; guá beh tsiàu hit-ê lâng ê só͘ tsò lâi pò-ho̍k.
English: Don't say, I will do to him as he has done to me; I will render to the man according to his work.

Tailo: Guá ê tsuē-ok puâⁿ-kuè guá ê thâu-khak, tshin-tshiūnn tāng-tàⁿ hō͘ guá taⁿ bē-khí.
English: For my iniquities have gone over my head. As a heavy burden, they are too heavy for me.

Tailo: kóng: Lán tio̍h khí-.lâi, khì kong-kik Iôtah, kā i jiáu-luān kong-phuà, koh tī i ê tiong-kan siat-li̍p Tha-bi-el ê kiáⁿ tsò ông.
English: Let's go up against Judah, and tear it apart, and let's divide it among ourselves, and set up a king in the midst of it, even the son of Tabeel.

Tailo: Guá tsiàu in ê ù-uè, tsiàu in ê kuè-sit khuán-thāi in, tuì in am Guá ê bīn.
English: According to their uncleanness and according to their transgressions did I to them; and I hid my face from them.

Tailo: I ê kin khînn tī tsio̍h-tui, thàu kàu tsio̍h-thâu ê só͘-tsāi.
English: His roots are wrapped around the rock pile, He sees the place of stones.

Tailo: Siōngtsú só͘ kiù-sio̍k ê lâng tio̍h kóng tsiah-ê uē; to̍h-sī I tuì tuì-ti̍k tshiú tiong só͘ kiù-sio̍k ê lâng,
English: Let the redeemed by Yahweh say so, Whom he has redeemed from the hand of the adversary,

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kóng, ' Lí ê lô͘-po̍k, tuì siàu-liân kàu taⁿ, guán liân guán ê tsó͘-sian lóng sī teh tshī tsing-seⁿ. ' Án-ne lín thang lâi khiā tī Go-sián ê tē, in-uī kiàn-nā tshī tsing-seⁿ ê lóng sī Aigi̍p lâng só͘ thó-ià ê.
English: that you shall say, Your servants have been keepers of livestock from our youth even until now, both we, and our fathers:' that you may dwell in the land of Goshen; for every shepherd is an abomination to the Egyptians.

Tailo: Guán teh tsū-huē ê lâu-tíng ū tiám tsin tsē ting-hué.
English: There were many lights in the upper chamber where we were gathered together.

Tailo: I ìn kóng, Kā i liân-bín hit-ê lâng to̍h-sī. Iésu kā i kóng, Lí khì, tsiàu án-ne khì tsò.
English: He said, He who showed mercy on him. Then Jesus said to him, Go and do likewise.

Tailo: Guán siū lia̍h liáu-āu tsa̍p-jī nî tsa̍p-gue̍h tshe gō͘, ū tsi̍t-ê lâng tuì Êlúsalèm tô-tsáu lâi-kàu guá tsia, kóng, Siâⁿ í-king siū kong-phuà.
English: It happened in the twelfth year of our captivity, in the tenth month, in the fifth day of the month, that one who had escaped out of Jerusalem came to me, saying, The city has been struck.

Tailo: Kî-tha ê lâng kóng, Sió tán tsi̍t ē, khuànn Eliiah ē lâi kā I kiù á bē.
English: The rest said, Let him be. Let's see whether Elijah comes to save him.

Tailo: Tsit ji̍t, lín tio̍h siú-tsò tuā ê An-hioh-ji̍t, lín tio̍h khik-khó͘ lín ê sim, tse sī tsò íng-uán ê lē.
English: It is a Sabbath of solemn rest to you, and you shall afflict your souls; it is a statute forever.

Tailo: Tsit-má mā sī án-ne; Siōngtè ū lâu tsi̍t-kuá īng un-tián kíng-suán ê lâng.
English: Even so then at this present time also there is a remnant according to the election of grace.

Tailo: Guá ê lô͘-po̍k lú-pī kah guá piān-lūn ê sî, guá nā ū biáu-sī in ê lí-iû,
English: If I have despised the cause of my male servant Or of my female servant, When they contended with me;

Tailo: Ông tuì hia king-kuè ê sî, i kiò ông kóng, Lí ê lô͘-po̍k tshut-tīn, ū tsi̍t-ê lâng uat-lâi piⁿ-á, koh tshuā tsi̍t-ê lâng lâi kau hō͘ guá, kóng, ' Lí kò͘-siú tsit-ê lâng, i nā sit-lo̍h, lí ê sèⁿ-miā tio̍h tāi-thè i ê sèⁿ-miā; nā bô, lí tio̍h kau tshut tsi̍t tha-lan-t ê gîn. '
English: As the king passed by, he cried to the king; and he said, Your servant went out into the midst of the battle; and behold, a man turned aside, and brought a man to me, and said, Keep this man: if by any means he be missing, then shall your life be for his life, or else you shall pay a talent of silver.

Tailo: Tsit-ê sìn-sit sī bān-sè-tāi í-lâi, tuì jîn-luī ún-ba̍t ê ò-pì, taⁿ í-king tuì I ê sìn-tô͘ hián-bîng.
English: the mystery which has been hidden for ages and generations. But now it has been revealed to his saints,

Tailo: Sian-ti ê ha̍k-sing, tiàm tī I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ tī i ê tuì-bīn ê, khuàⁿ-tio̍h i, tsiū kóng, Kám-tōng Eliiah ê Sìng Sîn tiàm tī Elísiah à. In tsiū lâi kā i gîng-tsiap, phak-lo̍h tī i ê bīn-tsîng.
English: When the sons of the prophets who were at Jericho over against him saw him, they said, The spirit of Elijah does rest on Elisha. They came to meet him, and bowed themselves to the ground before him.

Tailo: ' Lí kā iá-siù tuà-.lâi, kā i tsú hó tsu-bī, hō͘ guá tsia̍h. Guá beh tī buē sí tsìn-tsîng, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng kā lí tsiok-hok. '
English: Bring me venison, and make me savory food, that I may eat, and bless you before Yahweh before my death.'

Tailo: Kî-si̍t hiah-ê khuàⁿ khí-lâi khah nńg-tsiáⁿ ê ki-thé, tian-tò koh khah ū pit-iàu.
English: No, much rather, those members of the body which seem to be weaker are necessary.

Tailo: Siōngtè khuàⁿ-kò͘ Isulael lâng, Siōngtsú mā tsai-iáⁿ in ê tāi-tsì.
English: God saw the children of Israel, and God was concerned about them.

Tailo: Abúlâm kā So͘tóm ông kóng, Guá ū kí thiⁿ-tē ê Tsú — tsì-kuân Siōngtè Siōngtsú lâi tsiù-tsuā,
English: Abram said to the king of Sodom, I have lifted up my hand to Yahweh, God Most High, possessor of heaven and earth,

Tailo: Guá — Altasiásuta ông pún-sin koh kàng-tsiàu hō͘ hô guā só͘-ū kuán kim-khò͘ ê kuann, kóng, ' Thong-ta̍t thinn-tíng Siōngtè ê lu̍t-huat ê king-ha̍k kàu-su — tsè-si Etsula̍h, bô-lūn tuì lín thó siáⁿ-mi̍h, lín tio̍h tì-ì tsiàu án-ne kiânn;
English: I, even I Artaxerxes the king, do make a decree to all the treasurers who are beyond the River, that whatever Ezra the priest, the scribe of the law of the God of heaven, shall require of you, it be done with all diligence,

Tailo: Bôohtsuh huan-hù siàu-liân lâng kóng, I nā tī kui khún ê tiong-kan khioh be̍h-sap, mā tio̍h iông-ín i, m̄-thang hō͘ i kiàn-siàu;
English: When she was risen up to glean, Boaz commanded his young men, saying, Let her glean even among the sheaves, and don't reproach her.

Tailo: In kiò tsi̍t-kuá ké tsìng-jîn lâi, kóng, Tsit-ê lâng kóng-uē put-sî teh kong-kik tsit-ê sìng-tiān kah Mô͘se ê lu̍t-huat.
English: and set up false witnesses who said, This man never stops speaking blasphemous words against this holy place and the law.

Tailo: Kìng-pài Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k nā ē-tàng tsi̍t pái tsiū sé-tshing i ê tsuē, liông-sim bô koh ū tsuē ê ì-sik, tsiū m̄-bián koh-tsài hiàn tsè.
English: Or else wouldn't they have ceased to be offered, because the worshippers, having been once cleansed, would have had no more consciousness of sins?

Tailo: Kha ē kā i thún-ta̍h, to̍h-sī sàn-tshiah lâng ê kha, khùn-khó͘ ê lâng ê kha-pō͘.
English: The foot shall tread it down; Even the feet of the poor, And the steps of the needy.

Tailo: Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí kā guá tshòng-tsō tshing-khì ê sim, hō͘ guá ê lāi-bīn ū uāⁿ sin tsìng-ti̍t ê sim-sîn.
English: Create in me a clean heart, O God. Renew a right spirit within me.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Siōngtè tshe sian-ti kàu in hia, beh ín-tshuā in kui-ǹg Siōngtsú. Sian-ti tuì in tsò kiàn-tsìng, m̄-koh, in m̄-thiaⁿ.
English: Yet he sent prophets to them, to bring them again to Yahweh; and they testified against them: but they would not give ear.

Tailo: Khó-kiàn Siōngtè ê kíng-suán sī kin-kì I ê liân-bín, m̄-sī kin-kì lâng ê ì-guān á-.sī ló͘-li̍k.
English: So then it is not of him who wills, nor of him who runs, but of God who has mercy.

Tailo: Tsiàu Tsú kā guá bīng-līng ê, khì bé sio-huî lâng ê hn̂g. (tsù, CKL 11:12-13; ILM 32:6-9)
English: And they gave them for the potter's field, As the Lord commanded me.

Tailo: Iosiúah kóng, Lí án-tsuáⁿ hāi guán? Kin-á-ji̍t Siōngtsú mā beh hāi lí. Tsiū án-ne, Isulael jîn-bîn īng tsio̍h-thâu kā i tìm-sí, īng hué sio in, īng tsio̍h-thâu tìm in.
English: Joshua said, Why have you troubled us? Yahweh shall trouble you this day. All Israel stoned him with stones; and they burned them with fire, and stoned them with stones.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, kî-tha ê tsóng-tiúⁿ kah tsóng-tok tsiū tī kok-tsìng tiong tshuē khang-phāng beh kò Taniel; tsóng-.sī, tshuē bô i ê khang-phāng kah kuè-sit, in-uī i tsīn-tiong, só͘-í in lóng tshuē bô i ê tshò-gō͘ kah kuè-sit.
English: Then the presidents and the satraps sought to find occasion against Daniel as touching the kingdom; but they could find no occasion nor fault, because he was faithful, neither was there any error or fault found in him.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn khuàⁿ-tio̍h luî tân, sih-nà kah sàu-kak ê siann, suaⁿ tíng koh tshut ian, jîn-bîn tsi̍t-ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsiū phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah, hn̄g-hn̄g khiā-.leh,
English: All the people perceived the thunderings, the lightnings, the sound of the trumpet, and the mountain smoking. When the people saw it, they trembled, and stayed at a distance.

Tailo: Tī lí ê kok lāi ū tsi̍t-ê lâng, i ê sim-lāi ū sìng ê Siōngtè ê sîn-lîng. Lí ê lāu-pē tsāi-seⁿ ê ji̍t-tsí, khuàⁿ-tshut i ê sim-lāi ū kng-bîng, tshong-bîng kah tì-huī, tshin-tshiūnn tsiah-ê sîn-bîng ê tì-huī. Lí ê lāu-pē — Nepkatnetsal ông, to̍h-sī ông lí ê lāu-pē, kā i siat-li̍p tsò tsheⁿ-siōng-ka, su̍t-sū, Kal-tí-ah lâng kah tsiam-pok-tsiá ê thâu-lâng.
English: There is a man in your kingdom, in whom is the spirit of the holy gods; and in the days of your father light and understanding and wisdom, like the wisdom of the gods, were found in him; and the king Nebuchadnezzar your father, the king, I say, your father, made him master of the magicians, enchanters, Chaldeans, and soothsayers;

Tailo: Iésu suî-sî kah in kóng-uē, kóng, An lín ê sim, sī guá, m̄-bián kiaⁿ.
English: But immediately Jesus spoke to them, saying Cheer up! I AM! Don't be afraid.

Tailo: Guá īng Siōngtè ê Sìng Sîn tshiong-muá i, hō͘ i ū tì-huī, ū tshong-bîng, ū tì-sik, ē tsò ta̍k tsióng ê kang,
English: and I have filled him with the Spirit of God, in wisdom, and in understanding, and in knowledge, and in all manner of workmanship,

Tailo: Tsit-ê tē pi-ai, tsuân kok ê tsháu kah tshài lóng ta-.khì, ē kàu tang-sî? Uī-tio̍h tuà tī hia ê jîn-bîn ê pháiⁿ, tsing-seⁿ, pue-tsiáu lóng bia̍t-bông. In-uī in kóng: I bô khuàⁿ-tio̍h guán ê kiat-kio̍k.
English: How long shall the land mourn, and the herbs of the whole country wither? for the wickedness of those who dwell therein, the animals are consumed, and the birds; because they said, He shall not see our latter end.

Tailo: ' Mā m̄-thang kiânn kan-îm.
English: Neither shall you commit adultery.

Tailo: In kìng-jiân īng in khó-ò͘ⁿ ê mi̍h hē tī īng Guá ê miâ só͘ tshing-ho͘ ê tshù, lâi kā i uè lah-sap.
English: But they set their abominations in the house which is called by my name, to defile it.

Tailo: Sù-tô͘ tńg-.lâi, kā in só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì pò-kò hō͘ Iésu thiaⁿ. Iésu tsiū tshuā in siám-phiah-khì-kàu tsi̍t-ê kiò-tsò Bia̍t-sái-tah ê siâⁿ.
English: The apostles, when they had returned, told him what things they had done. He took them, and withdrew apart to a deserted place of a city called Bethsaida.

Tailo: Guá mā beh tuì hit-ê lâng pìⁿ-bīn, kā i tuì jîn-bîn tiong-kan tsián-tû, in-uī i īng kiáⁿ-jî hiàn hō͘ Mô͘-lo̍k, kā Guá ê sìng-só͘ uè lah-sap, siat-to̍k Guá ê sìng-miâ.
English: I also will set my face against that person, and will cut him off from among his people because he has given of his seed to Molech, to defile my sanctuary, and to profane my holy name.

Tailo: Guá ê ba̍k-tsiu in-uī iu-būn lâi ba̍k-hîn, guá ê pah-thé lóng tshin-tshiūnn iánn.
English: My eye also is dim by reason of sorrow. All my members are as a shadow.

Tailo: I kā tē hē tī tē-ki tíng-bīn, hō͘ i íng-uán bē iô-tāng.
English: He laid the foundations of the earth, That it should not be moved forever.

Tailo: Tī Iésu ê thâu-khak tíng-bīn ū tsuē-tsōng ê pâi-á siá kóng, Tsit-ê sī Iô-tá-iah lâng ê ông.
English: An inscription was also written over him in letters of Greek, Latin, and Hebrew: THIS IS THE KING OF THE JEWS.

Tailo: Lâng nā bô tsiap-la̍p lín, lín lī-khui in ê siâⁿ ê sî, tio̍h kā lín kha-.ni̍h ê thô͘-sua hún puāⁿ-tiāu, lâi kā in kíng-kò.
English: As many as don't receive you, when you depart from that city, shake off even the dust from your feet for a testimony against them.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h huan-hù Isulael lâng, kā hit-ê uī-tio̍h beh tsiò-kng só͘ kheh tshing ê kaⁿ-ná iû, the̍h-lâi hō͘ lí, hō͘ ting tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tiám-to̍h.
English: You shall command the children of Israel, that they bring to you pure olive oil beaten for the light, to cause a lamp to burn continually.

Tailo: M̄-thang tshin-tshiūnn m̄-bat Siōngtè ê guā-pang lâng teh hòng-tshiòng su-io̍k.
English: not in the passion of lust, even as the Gentiles who don't know God;

Tailo: Eliiah kā i kóng, Bián-kiaⁿ! Tsò lí khì! Tsiàu lí só͘ kóng ê lâi kiâⁿ. Tsóng-.sī, tāi-sing kā guá tsò tsi̍t tè sè tè ê piáⁿ, tuà-lâi hō͘ guá, jiân-āu tsiah uī lí kah lí ê kiáⁿ khì piak.
English: Elijah said to her, Don't be afraid; go and do as you have said; but make me of it a little cake first, and bring it forth to me, and afterward make for you and for your son.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá tsiah teh siū khó͘, m̄-koh, guá bô kám-kak kiàn-siàu, in-uī guá bat guá só͘ sìn ê Siōngtè, mā khak-sìn I ē pó-siú guá tsò I kau-thok guá tsò ê kang-tsok, it-ti̍t kàu Tsú tsài-lîm ê ji̍t.
English: For this cause I suffer also these things. Yet I am not ashamed, for I know him whom I have believed, and I am persuaded that he is able to guard that which I have committed to him against that day.

Tailo: Hiong-kông ê tsuí tsá to̍h kā lán im-sí.
English: Then the proud waters would have gone over our soul.

Tailo: In-uī in taⁿ ē kóng, Guán bô ông, in-uī guán bô kìng-uì Siōngtsú. Ông ē thè guán tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: Surely now they will say, We have no king; for we don't fear Yahweh; And the king, what can he do for us?

Tailo: I tsiū kóng, Lí tsai guá uī siáⁿ-mi̍h lâi lí tsia? Taⁿ guá beh tò tńg-khì kah Phelsiah ê thiⁿ-sài kau-tsiàn, guá khì-liáu, lí khuàⁿ, Hi-la̍h ê thiⁿ-sài teh beh lâi.
English: Then he said, Do you know why I have come to you? Now I will return to fight with the prince of Persia. When I go forth, behold, the prince of Greece shall come.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h beh hō͘ lí tsip-siú kè-uē, tshuì-tûn tio̍h pó-tsûn tì-sik.
English: That you may maintain discretion, That your lips may preserve knowledge.

Tailo: tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng, tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè;
English: one male goat for a sin offering;

Tailo: Lí īng tuā kuân-lîng lâi hâ io, īng tuā khuì-la̍t hō͘ tsiah-ê suaⁿ an-ún khiā tsāi.
English: Who by his power forms the mountains, Having armed yourself with strength;

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Siat-sú in bô beh sìn lí, mā bô beh sìn thâu tsi̍t-ê sîn-jiah, tsiū ē sìn tē-jī-ê sîn-jiah.
English: It will happen, if they will neither believe you nor listen to the voice of the first sign, that they will believe the voice of the latter sign.

Tailo: Tabi̍t koh kóng, Siōngtsú kiù guá thuat-lī sai ê jiáu kah hîm ê jiáu, I mā ē kiù guá thuat-lī tsit-ê Huilīsū lâng ê tshiú. Sàulô kā Tabi̍t kóng, Lí khì, Siōngtsú ē kah lí tông-tsāi.
English: David said, Yahweh who delivered me out of the paw of the lion, and out of the paw of the bear, he will deliver me out of the hand of this Philistine. Saul said to David, Go, and Yahweh shall be with you.

Tailo: M̄-thang in-uī guá kóng, ' Lín tio̍h tîng-thâu-seⁿ' lâi kám-kak kî-kuài.
English: Don't marvel that I said to you, You must be born anew.'

Tailo: Ahasuiló͘ ông ìn ông-hō͘ Êsutel kóng, Siáⁿ lâng káⁿ tsûn-sim tsò tsit-ê tāi-tsì? Hit-ê lâng tī tó-uī?
English: Then spoke the king Ahasuerus and said to Esther the queen, Who is he, and where is he, that dared presume in his heart to do so?

Tailo: Guán nā tú-tio̍h huān-lān, sī beh hō͘ lín tit-tio̍h an-uì kah tsín-kiù; guán nā tit-tio̍h an-uì, mā sī beh hō͘ lín tit-tio̍h an-uì, thang ū khuì-la̍t lâi jím-siū kah guán kāng-khuán ê khó͘-lān.
English: But if we are afflicted, it is for your comfort and salvation. If we are comforted, it is for your comfort, which produces in you the patient enduring of the same sufferings which we also suffer.

Tailo: Guán tī hia tú-tio̍h tsi̍t tsiah tsûn beh khì Hue-ní-ke, tsiū tsiūⁿ hit tsiah tsûn tshut-huat.
English: Having found a ship crossing over to Phoenicia, we went aboard, and set sail.

Tailo: I īng tsìⁿ tē ê tsìⁿ siā ji̍p guá ê pak lāi.
English: He has caused the shafts of his quiver to enter into my kidneys.

Tailo: Tī suaⁿ-kok lāi, kng-ku̍t ê tsio̍h-thâu tiong, ū lí ê hūn-gia̍h. Tsiah-ê to̍h-sī lí só͘ tit-tio̍h ê sán-gia̍p; lí mā tuì i kuàn-tiān, hiàn lé-mi̍h. In-uī tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, Guá kám ē an-sim?
English: Among the smooth stones of the valley is your portion; they, they are your lot; even to them have you poured a drink offering, you have offered an offering. Shall I be appeased for these things?

Tailo: Tsiū-sī in-uī tsit-ê tsha-pia̍t, Iésu tsiâⁿ-tsò koh khah hó ê iok ê pó-tsìng-jîn.
English: By so much has Jesus become the collateral of a better covenant.

Tailo: Jiânāu Iésu koh kā in kóng, Taⁿ lín tio̍h kā tsuí iúⁿ tshut-.lâi, phâng khì hō͘ pān toh ê hū-tsik-jîn. In tsiū phâng khì hō͘ i.
English: He said to them, Now draw some out, and take it to the ruler of the feast. So they took it.

Tailo: （ Etóm lâng To-ik lâi pò Sàulô kóng, Tabi̍t lâi-kàu Ahiméli̍k ê ke. Hit sî, Tabi̍t tsò tsit-siú kà-sī ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ. ）Ióng-bíng ê lâng, lí ná ē uī-tio̍h tsò pháiⁿ lâi khua-kháu? Siōngtè ê tsû-ài íng-uán tī-.leh.
English: Why do you boast of mischief, mighty man? God's loving kindness endures continually.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ē hō͘ lí tē-tsiūⁿ ê hō͘ piàn-tsò thô͘-hún, piàn-tsò sua, i ē tuì thiⁿ lo̍h tī lí, it-ti̍t kàu lí bia̍t-bông.
English: Yahweh will make the rain of your land powder and dust: from the sky shall it come down on you, until you are destroyed.

Tailo: Lí kám ài tsun-thàn kó͘-tsá lâng ê lō͘, to̍h-sī pháiⁿ lâng só͘ kiâⁿ ê lō͘?
English: Will you keep the old way Which wicked men have trodden,

Tailo: Mā uī-tio̍h gû-káng, iûⁿ-káng kah iûⁿ-á, suà hiàn i ê sò͘-tsè, i ê kuàn-tiān, lóng tsiàu in ê sò͘-gia̍h, tsiàu hit-ê lē;
English: their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance;

Tailo: hit-ê lâng tio̍h thì i ê mn̂g, tsóng-.sī, tshng m̄-thang thì, tsè-si tio̍h koh kā hit-ê seⁿ tshng ê lâng kuaiⁿ-kìm tshit ji̍t.
English: then he shall be shaved, but he shall not shave the itch; and the priest shall shut him up who has the itch seven more days.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá uī-tio̍h Siōngtè kíng-suán ê tsú-bîn jím-siū it-tshè, hō͘ in mā ē tit-tio̍h Ki-tok Iésu ê tsín-kiù kah íng-uán ê îng-kng.
English: Therefore I endure all things for the chosen ones' sake, that they also may obtain the salvation which is in Christ Jesus with eternal glory.

Tailo: Siōngtsú siúⁿ-sù khuì-la̍t hō͘ I ê tsú-bîn; Siōngtsú sù pîng-an hō͘ I ê tsú-bîn.
English: Yahweh will give strength to his people. Yahweh will bless his people with peace.

Tailo: I bô iông-ín siáⁿ lâng khi-hū in, uī-tio̍h in ê iân-kò͘ I khián-tsik hiah-ê kun-ông.
English: He allowed no one to do them wrong. Yes, he reproved kings for their sakes,

Tailo: Kiàn-nā guá só͘ bīng-līng lín ê, lín lóng tio̍h tsip-siú lâi kiâⁿ, lí m̄-thang ke-thinn, mā m̄-thang kiám-tsió.
English: Whatever thing I command you, that shall you observe to do: you shall not add thereto, nor diminish from it.

Tailo: I tshuā guá tshut-lâi-kàu guā-īⁿ, koh tshuā guá ji̍p-khì līng-guā keh-khui ê tē sio tuì-bīn ê pâng; hit king pâng ǹg pak, tī tshù-the̍h ê tuì-bīn.
English: Then he brought me forth into the outer court, the way toward the north: and he brought me into the chamber that was over against the separate place, and which was over against the building toward the north.

Tailo: Amí-me-li̍k kah tuè i ê lâng, tsiū lóng tsiūⁿ-khì Sal-mòng suaⁿ. Amí-me-li̍k tshiú the̍h pó͘-thâu, tshò tsi̍t tsâng tshiū-ki, giâ tī king-kah-thâu tíng, tuì tuè i ê lâng kóng, Lín khuànn guá só͘ kiâⁿ ê, mā tio̍h kuáⁿ-kín o̍h guá lâi kiâⁿ.
English: Abimelech got him up to Mount Zalmon, he and all the people who were with him; and Abimelech took an axe in his hand, and cut down a bough from the trees, and took it up, and laid it on his shoulder: and he said to the people who were with him, What you have seen me do, make haste, and do as I have done.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h ka-kī kín-sīn, bián-tit lín ê sim siū bê-hi̍k, tì-sú lín uai-tshua̍h, khì ho̍k-sāi pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng, lâi kā i kìng-pài.
English: Take heed to yourselves, lest your heart be deceived, and you turn aside, and serve other gods, and worship them;

Tailo: Só͘-í, bô lâng ē-tàng kóng, lín ū hōng guá ê miâ niá siū sé-lé.
English: so that no one should say that I had baptized you into my own name.

Tailo: Lín khuànn khong-tiong ê pue-tsiáu, in bô tsìng-tsoh, bô siu-sîng, bô tsik-tsū tī tshik-tshng, lín ê Thiⁿ-pē mā teh kā in iúⁿ-tshī. Lín kám bô pí hiah-ê tsiáu-á khah kuì-tiōng?
English: See the birds of the sky, that they don't sow, neither do they reap, nor gather into barns. Your heavenly Father feeds them. Aren't you of much more value than they?

Tailo: Páulô ìn kóng, Guá sī Iô-tá-iah lâng, tshut-sì tī Ki-lí-kiah ê Tà-soh, sī tsi̍t-ê put-tsí tshut-miâ ê siâⁿ-tshī ê kong-bîn. Kiû lí tsún guá tuì bîn-tsiòng kóng-uē.
English: But Paul said, I am a Jew, from Tarsus in Cilicia, a citizen of no insignificant city. I beg you, allow me to speak to the people.

Tailo: Tabi̍t kā i kóng, Lí ê hueh kui tī lí ê thâu-khak, in-uī lí ê tshuì ka-kī kiàn-tsìng kóng, ' Guá thâi-sí Siōngtsú só͘ buah iû ê. '
English: David said to him, Your blood be on your head; for your mouth has testified against you, saying, I have slain Yahweh's anointed.

Tailo: Tī in ê thó͘-tē tshân-kap-á seⁿ-thuàⁿ tsin tsē, liân ông ê pâng-king mā ū.
English: Their land swarmed with frogs, Even in the chambers of their kings.
