Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng tsè-tsō sîn-pu̍t, tsù-tsō bô lī-ik ê ngó͘-siōng?
English: Who has fashioned a god, or molten an image that is profitable for nothing?

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Ammóng lâng ê kuì-tso̍k tuì Hanun kóng, Tabi̍t tshe lâng lâi an-uì lí, siūⁿ kóng i sī teh tsun-kìng lí ê lāu-pē? I ê jîn-sîn lâi kìnn lí, kám m̄-sī beh siông-sè tsa-khuàⁿ, thàm-thiaⁿ tsit-ê tē, beh lâi kā i huí-bia̍t?
English: But the princes of the children of Ammon said to Hanun, Think you that David does honor your father, in that he has sent comforters to you? Aren't his servants come to you to search, and to overthrow, and to spy out the land?

Tailo: Hiah-ê Iô-tá-iah lâng ìn kóng, Guán īng tsio̍h-thâu kā Lí tìm, m̄-sī uī-tio̍h Lí tsò hó sū, sī in-uī Lí siat-to̍k Siōngtè. Lí put-kò sī tsi̍t-ê lâng, iáu-koh ka-kī tsū-tshing tsò Siōngtè.
English: The Jews answered him, We don't stone you for a good work, but for blasphemy: because you, being a man, make yourself God.

Tailo: Lí sià-bián Lí ê tsú-bîn ê tsuē-ok, Lí jia-khàm in it-tshè ê tsuē-kò. [Sè-la̍h]
English: You have forgiven the iniquity of your people. You have covered all their sin. Selah.

Tailo: ông kā Náthan sian-ti kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, guá tiàm tī pik-hiuⁿ tshâ ê tshù lāi, tsóng-.sī, Siōngtsú ê kuī tiàm tī tiùⁿ-lî lāi.
English: that the king said to Nathan the prophet, See now, I dwell in a house of cedar, but the ark of God dwells within curtains.

Tailo: I tsē-uī ê sî tsa̍p la̍k huè, tī Êlúsalèm tsò ông kiōng gō͘-tsa̍p jī nî. I ê lāu-bú ê miâ kiò-tsò E-kho-li-ah, sī Êlúsalèm lâng.
English: Sixteen years old was Uzziah when he began to reign; and he reigned fifty-two years in Jerusalem: and his mother's name was Jechiliah, of Jerusalem.

Tailo: Siōngtè beh tsiàu ta̍k lâng ê hîng-uî kā in pò-ìng. (tsù, SPh 66:12; TsG 24:12)
English: who will pay back to everyone according to their works:

Tailo: Tiong-tàu ê sî, tsuân tē o͘-àm, suà-kàu ē-po͘ saⁿ tiám.
English: When the sixth hour had come, there was darkness over the whole land until the ninth hour.

Tailo: Ia-lô-ba-am tsò ông, kiōng jī-tsa̍p jī nî, tsiū kah i ê tsó͘-sian tsò-hué khùn. I ê kiáⁿ Nátap suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: The days which Jeroboam reigned were two and twenty years: and he slept with his fathers, and Nadab his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: In ē tsīⁿ thô͘-sua hún tshin-tshiūnn tsuâ, tshin-tshiūnn tī thô͘-kha teh sô ê mi̍h, phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah tshut i ê khang. In ē kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ lâi kui lán ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú, koh in-uī Lí lâi kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: They will lick the dust like a serpent. Like crawling things of the earth they shall come trembling out of their dens. They will come with fear to Yahweh our God, And will be afraid because of you.

Tailo: Koh ū Lēbī lâng ê thâu-lâng Siabethài kah Io-tsa-bat, kuán-lí Siōngtè tiān ê guā-sū.
English: and Shabbethai and Jozabad, of the chiefs of the Levites, who had the oversight of the outward business of the house of God;

Tailo: Uá-khò Siōngtsú, pí uá-khò ông-tshin khah hó.
English: It is better to take refuge in Yahweh, Than to put confidence in princes.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Kai-ín kóng, Lí án-tsuáⁿ teh siū-khì? Lí ná ē pìⁿ-bīn?
English: Yahweh said to Cain, Why are you angry? Why has the expression of your face fallen?

Tailo: Sī gōng lâng ê tsí-tō tsiá, sī siàu-liân lâng ê lāu-su. Lí siūⁿ kóng kì-jiân ū lu̍t-huat, tuì tì-sik kah tsin-lí tsiū ū pá-ak.
English: a corrector of the foolish, a teacher of babies, having in the law the form of knowledge and of the truth.

Tailo: I kóng, Τhang tsiàu lín ê uē lâi kiâⁿ. Tsiū án-ne, i tshe in tshut-.khì, in tsiū khì. Jiânāu, i īng tsu-âng sik ê soh-á pa̍k tī thang-á.
English: She said, According to your words, so be it. She sent them away, and they departed: and she bound the scarlet line in the window.

Tailo: Hiat sin-si kah piàⁿ hué-hu tī tsuân-pō͘ ê suaⁿ-kok kah só͘-ū ê tshân-hn̂g, it-ti̍t kàu Kit-lông khe, koh ti̍t-kàu tang pîng Bé ê mn̂g ê kak-thâu lóng beh tsò sìng, kui tī Siōngtsú, bô koh pue̍h-tshut, bô koh tshia-tó, it-ti̍t kàu íng-uán.
English: The whole valley of the dead bodies and of the ashes, and all the fields to the brook Kidron, to the corner of the horse gate toward the east, shall be holy to Yahweh; it shall not be plucked up, nor thrown down any more forever.

Tailo: Kàu tē-peh ji̍t, in tsiū siat giâm-siok-huē, in-uī in siú hiàn tuâⁿ ê lé tshit ji̍t, koh siú tseh tshit ji̍t.
English: On the eighth day they held a solemn assembly: for they kept the dedication of the altar seven days, and the feast seven days.

Tailo: Hui-li̍p-pò͘ khí-lâi tsiū tshut-huat. Tī lō͘ tiong, i tú-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê Ai-si-o-pí-a ê thài-kàm, to̍h-sī Ai-si-o-pí-a lú-ông Kan-ta-ke ê tsâi-bū tāi-sîn.
English: He arose and went; and behold, there was a man of Ethiopia, a eunuch of great authority under Candace, queen of the Ethiopians, who was over all her treasure, who had come to Jerusalem to worship.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, Lí ê ba̍k-tsiu kám m̄-sī ǹg sîng-si̍t? Lí kā in phah, in mā bô iu-siong; Lí kā in huí-bia̍t, in mā m̄-khíng siū kàu-tok. In hō͘ in ê bīn pí tsio̍h khah tīng, m̄-khíng huê-thâu.
English: O Yahweh, don't your eyes look on truth? you have stricken them, but they were not grieved; you have consumed them, but they have refused to receive correction: they have made their faces harder than a rock; they have refused to return.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu Eliiah kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to him, saying,

Tailo: Kiû Lí tsiàu Lí ê tuā tsû-ài sià-bián tsiah-ê jîn-bîn ê tsuē, tshin-tshiūnn Lí tuì Aigi̍p kàu taⁿ, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ sià-bián in sio-siâng.
English: Pardon, Please, the iniquity of this people according to the greatness of your loving kindness, and according as you have forgiven this people, from Egypt even until now.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Jîn-tsú tit-tio̍h îng-kng ê sî kàu à.
English: Jesus answered them, The time has come for the Son of Man to be glorified.

Tailo: Ông bīng-līng tuā-tsè-si Hilkíiah kah tē-jī kip ê tsè-si, í-ki̍p kò͘-mn̂g ê kuann, kā uī-tio̍h Baal kah A-si-lah, í-ki̍p thinn-tíng ê bān-siōng só͘ tsō hiah-ê khì-kū, puaⁿ-tshut Siōngtsú ê tiān, tī Êlúsalèm guā Kit-lông khe piⁿ ê tshân kā i sio-tiāu, tuà i ê hué-hu lâi-kàu Bethel.
English: The king commanded Hilkiah the high priest, and the priests of the second order, and the keepers of the threshold, to bring forth out of the temple of Yahweh all the vessels that were made for Baal, and for the Asherah, and for all the army of the sky, and he burned them outside of Jerusalem in the fields of the Kidron, and carried the ashes of them to Bethel.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú teh beh lâi ā, I beh lâi sím-phuàⁿ tsuân tē. I beh tsiàu kong-gī sím-phuàⁿ sè-kài, tsiàu I ê sìn-si̍t sím-phuàⁿ bān-bîn.
English: Before Yahweh; for he comes, For he comes to judge the earth. He will judge the world with righteousness, The peoples with his truth.

Tailo: Iâkop tiong tsua̍t-tuì bô huat-su̍t, Isulael tiong mā bô tsiam-pok; kàu-sî lūn-khí Iâkop kah Isulael beh kóng: Siōngtè kiânn hiah-ni̍h tuā ê tāi-tsì!
English: Surely there is no enchantment with Jacob; Neither is there any divination with Israel: Now shall it be said of Jacob and of Israel, What has God done!

Tailo: Iosiúah kong-tshú hiah-ê ông só͘-ū ê siâⁿ kah in ê ông, īng to kā in thâi-sí, kā in tsuân-pō͘ siau-bia̍t, tsiàu Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k Mô͘se só͘ bīng-līng ê.
English: All the cities of those kings, and all the kings of them, did Joshua take, and he struck them with the edge of the sword, and utterly destroyed them; as Moses the servant of Yahweh commanded.

Tailo: In lâi-kàu Biat-ma-kah ê Abel, kā i uî-khùn, tsiū tī siâⁿ guā khí thô͘-tui, khí tī guā-siâⁿ ê tuì-bīn. Ioap kah tuè i ê jîn-bîn lòng siâⁿ, beh hō͘ i tò.
English: They came and besieged him in Abel of Beth Maacah, and they cast up a mound against the city, and it stood against the rampart; and all the people who were with Joab battered the wall, to throw it down.

Tailo: í-ki̍p kah i tsì-tshin tsò tsāi-sik-lí ê tsí-muē, to̍h thang uī-tio̍h i uè lah-sap ka-kī.
English: and for his virgin sister who is near to him, who has had no husband; for her he may defile himself.

Tailo: Lín lâi-kàu Siōngtè ê tuā-kiáⁿ tsū-tsi̍p ê só͘-tsāi, in ê miâ lóng ū ting-kì tī thinn-tíng. Lín lâi-kàu sím-phuàⁿ bān-bîn ê Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng, lín lâi-kàu í-king sîng-tsuân ê gī lâng ê lîng-hûn hia.
English: to the general assembly and assembly of the firstborn who are enrolled in heaven, to God the Judge of all, to the spirits of just men made perfect,

Tailo: Li-bé-kah ê a-hiaⁿ kah lāu-bú kóng, Tshiánn iông-ín tsa-bó͘ gín-á kah guán koh tuà kuí kang, siāng tsió tsa̍p kang, jiân-āu i to̍h thang khì.
English: Her brother and her mother said, Let the young lady stay with us a few days, at least ten. After that she will go.

Tailo: Tio̍h tī suaⁿ-iûⁿ ê thâu-khak tíng huāⁿ-tshiú, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, tī thâi sio-tsè ê tsing-seⁿ ê só͘-tsāi kā i thâi, tse sī sio̍k-tsuē-tsè.
English: He shall lay his hand on the head of the goat, and kill it in the place where they kill the burnt offering before Yahweh. It is a sin offering.

Tailo: Gilia̍t ê Ia-be-si lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h Huilīsū lâng só͘ tuì-thāi Sàulô it-tshè ê tāi-tsì.
English: When all Jabesh Gilead heard all that the Philistines had done to Saul,

Tailo: Thâu tsi̍t tiâu miâ kiò-tsò Pi-sióng, to̍h-sī se̍h-lâu tī Habíla̍h tsuân tē ê, tī hia ū tshut kim.
English: The name of the first is Pishon: this is the one which flows through the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold;

Tailo: Bo̍k-tsiá bô lō͘ thang tô-tsáu, iûⁿ-kûn ê thâu-ba̍k mā bô lō͘ thang thuat-lī.
English: The shepherds shall have no way to flee, nor the principal of the flock to escape.

Tailo: I tī khong-tiong ê tíng-bīn thí-khui pak-hong, kā tē tiàu tī bô mi̍h ê tíng-bīn.
English: He stretches out the north over empty space, And hangs the earth on nothing.

Tailo: Muí tshit ji̍t ê thâu tsi̍t ji̍t, lín ta̍k lâng tio̍h tsiàu ka-kī ê siu-ji̍p puah tsi̍t-kuá tsînn khí-lâi khǹg, bián-tit guá khì lín hia ê sî tsiah khai-sí bō͘-khuán.
English: On the first day of the week, let each one of you save, as he may prosper, that no collections be made when I come.

Tailo: Pò hó siau-sit, thuân hô-pîng, pò hok-khì ê hó siau-sit, thuân kiù-un ê, i tuì Si-óng kóng: Lí ê Siōngtè tsò ông à! I ê kha tsiūⁿ suaⁿ tíng, i ê kha-jiah kàu tsiah suí!
English: How beautiful on the mountains are the feet of him who brings good news, who publishes peace, who brings good news of good, who publishes salvation, who says to Zion, Your God reigns!

Tailo: tshiū tíng ū sann ki tshiū-ki teh puh íⁿ, khui hue, jiân-āu kiat tsi̍t pha tsi̍t pha sîng-si̍k ê phû-tô.
English: and in the vine were three branches. It was as though it budded, its blossoms shot forth, and the clusters of it brought forth ripe grapes.

Tailo: （ Lí khuàⁿ, Kal-tí-ah lâng ê tē, taⁿ tsiah-ê jîn-bîn bô-.khì à, Asiul lâng hō͘ i tsò iá-siù tuà ê só͘-tsāi. In khí in ê tsiú-keⁿ lâu, huí-huāi in ê kiong-tiān, hō͘ i piàn-tsò pha-hng. ）
English: Behold, the land of the Chaldeans. This people was not. The Assyrians founded it for those who dwell in the wilderness. They set up their towers. They overthrew its palaces. They made it a ruin.

Tailo: Àm-sî guá ê kut siū tshì-tsha̍k lut tsat; thàng-thiàⁿ khè guá bô suah.
English: In the night season my bones are pierced in me, And the pains that gnaw me take no rest.

Tailo: Lín gī lâng tio̍h in-uī Siōngtsú lâi huann-hí; tsìng-ti̍t ê lâng ê mā tio̍h o-ló Siōngtsú.
English: Rejoice in Yahweh, you righteous! Praise is fitting for the upright.

Tailo: Biāniámín lâng kóng, In iû-guân thâi-su tī lán ê bīn-tsîng. Isulael lâng kóng, Lán tio̍h tô-tsáu, ín-iú in lī-khui siâⁿ kàu tuā lō͘.
English: The children of Benjamin said, They are struck down before us, as at the first. But the children of Israel said, Let us flee, and draw them away from the city to the highways.

Tailo: Mā ū Hi-bú-lâi lâng kuè Ioltàn hô lâi-kàu Gat kah Gilia̍t tē. Sàulô iáu-koh tī Gilgal, jîn-bîn lóng phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah lâi kin-tuè i.
English: Now some of the Hebrews had gone over the Jordan to the land of Gad and Gilead; but as for Saul, he was yet in Gilgal, and all the people followed him trembling.

Tailo: koh ū I án-tsuáⁿ khuán-thāi Aigi̍p ê kun-ping kah in ê bé, in ê tshia, in jiok lín ê sî, Siōngtsú án-tsuáⁿ hō͘ Âng-hái ê tsuí im in, kā in bia̍t-bông kàu kin-á-ji̍t,
English: and what he did to the army of Egypt, to their horses, and to their chariots; how he made the water of the Red Sea to overflow them as they pursued after you, and how Yahweh has destroyed them to this day;

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lín hō͘ hiàn-sin-tsiá lim tsiú, huan-hù sian-ti kóng: M̄-thang kóng sian-ti uē.
English: But you gave the Nazirites wine to drink, And commanded the prophets, saying, Don't prophesy!'

Tailo: Tī tang pîng ū la̍k-ê Lēbī lâng, tī pak pîng ta̍k ji̍t ū sì-ê lâng, tī lâm pîng ta̍k ji̍t ū sì-ê lâng, tī khò͘-pâng ū nn̄g lâng, koh ū nn̄g lâng sio thè-uāⁿ.
English: Eastward were six Levites, northward four a day, southward four a day, and for the storehouse two and two.

Tailo: Guán ê Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí thiaⁿ, in-uī guán hō͘ lâng khuànn-khin, kiû Lí hō͘ in ê huí-pòng kui tī in ê thâu-khak, hō͘ in tī siū lia̍h ê tē tú-tio̍h tshiúⁿ-kiap.
English: Hear, our God; for we are despised: and turn back their reproach on their own head, and give them up for a spoil in a land of captivity;

Tailo: Kî-tha tsa̍p-ê bûn-tô͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū tuì Iâkop kah Iô-há-neh siū-khì.
English: When the ten heard it, they began to be indignant towards James and John.

Tailo: Guá só͘ beh khí ê tiān tsin tuā, in-uī guán ê Siōngtè tsin tuā, iâⁿ-kuè só͘-ū ê sîn-bîng.
English: The house which I build is great; for great is our God above all gods.

Tailo: I kā it-tshè só͘-ū ê lóng kau Iôséhuh ê tshiú, tû-khì i ka-kī só͘ tsia̍h ê mi̍h í-guā, pa̍t hāng só͘-ū ê i lóng m̄-tsai. Iôséhuh ing-tsùn koh phiau-phiat.
English: He left all that he had in Joseph's hand. He didn't concern himself with anything, except for the food which he ate. Joseph was well-built and handsome.

Tailo: Siōngtè beh kàu tang-sî tsiah ē ua̍t tńg-sin mài khuànn guá, pàng guá tsi̍t-sî-á tsū-iû, hō͘ guá thun tsi̍t-ē-á nuā?
English: How long will you not look away from me, Nor leave me alone until I swallow down my spittle?

Tailo: Lí kám m̄-tsai? Lí kám bô thiaⁿ-.tio̍h? Íng-uán tsûn-tsāi ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú, tshòng-tsō tē-ki̍k ê, I bô ià, mā bô siān; I ê tì-huī bô thang tshik-to̍k.
English: Haven't you known? Haven't you heard? The everlasting God, Yahweh, The Creator of the ends of the earth, doesn't faint. He isn't weary. His understanding is unsearchable.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn tsit khuán ê tāi-tsì, siáⁿ lâng bat thiaⁿ-.tio̍h? Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì siáⁿ lâng bat khuàⁿ-.tio̍h? Kok kám ē tsi̍t ji̍t to̍h lâi kiàn-li̍p? Jîn-bîn kám ē tsi̍t-sî-á to̍h lâi tshut-sì? Tsóng-.sī, Si-óng tsi̍t-ē tú-tio̍h seⁿ kiáⁿ ê kan-khó͘ tsiū seⁿ kiáⁿ-jî.
English: Who has heard such a thing? who has seen such things? Shall a land be born in one day? shall a nation be brought forth at once? for as soon as Zion travailed, she brought forth her children.

Tailo: Tsiū-sī hit uī īng khuì-la̍t hâ guá ê io, hō͘ guá ê lō͘ uân-tsuân ê Siōngtè.
English: The God who arms me with strength, and makes my way perfect?

Tailo: Tsiù-tsó͘ lāu-pē á-.sī lāu-bú ê, it-tīng tio̍h hō͘ i sí.
English: Anyone who curses his father or his mother shall surely be put to death.

Tailo: Tuì guá siū siat-li̍p tī Iôtah tē tsò in ê tsóng-tok, to̍h-sī tuì Altasiásuta ông jī-tsa̍p nî kàu saⁿ-tsa̍p jī nî, kiōng tsa̍p-jī nî ê tiong-kan, guá kah guá ê hiann-tī lóng bô tsia̍h tsóng-tok ê sin-hōng.
English: Moreover from the time that I was appointed to be their governor in the land of Judah, from the twentieth year even to the two and thirtieth year of Artaxerxes the king, that is, twelve years, I and my brothers have not eaten the bread of the governor.

Tailo: Ta̍k-ê gîn-puâⁿ tāng tsi̍t-pah saⁿ-tsa̍p si-khel, ta̍k-ê uánn tāng tshit-tsa̍p si-khel; só͘-ū khì-kū ê gîn, tsiàu sìng-só͘ ê si-khel, tsóng-kiōng ū nn̄g-tshing sì-pah si-khel.
English: each silver platter weighing one hundred thirty shekels, and each bowl seventy; all the silver of the vessels two thousand four hundred shekels, after the shekel of the sanctuary;

Tailo: I koh pâi-lia̍t tshâ, kā gû-á tshiat-tsò kui tè, hē tī tshâ tíng, kóng, Lín īng sì-ê tháng té tsuí muá-muá, piàⁿ tī sio-tsè kah tshâ-ê tíng-bīn.
English: He put the wood in order, and cut the bull in pieces, and laid it on the wood. He said, Fill four jars with water, and pour it on the burnt offering, and on the wood.

Tailo: Kā só͘-ū ê hē tī Alông ê tshiú kah i ê kiáⁿ ê tshiú, tsò iô-tsè tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng iô.
English: He put all these in Aaron's hands and in his sons' hands, and waved them for a wave offering before Yahweh.

Tailo: Isulael ông tuì i ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, Lín kám m̄-tsai Gilia̍t ê La̍h-mot sī lán ê? Lán kìng-jiân tiām-tiām bô tuì Alâm ông ê tshiú tshiúⁿ tńg-.lâi?
English: The king of Israel said to his servants, You know that Ramoth Gilead is ours, and we are still, and don't take it out of the hand of the king of Syria?

Tailo: Guá beh kā lín ê kiáⁿ-jî bē tī Iôtah lâng ê tshiú tiong, in ē kā in bē hō͘ Síbah lâng, to̍h-sī hn̄g-hn̄g ê kok. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: And I will sell your sons and your daughters into the hands of the children of Judah, And they will sell them to the men of Sheba, To a faraway nation, For Yahweh has spoken it.

Tailo: Babúlông hut-jiân siū tshia-tó, huí-huāi; tio̍h uī i thî-khàu, the̍h jú-hiuⁿ lâi tsí i ê thàng-thiàⁿ, kiám-tshái iáu ē i-.tit.
English: Babylon is suddenly fallen and destroyed: wail for her; take balm for her pain, if so be she may be healed.

Tailo: In-uī Lí ê sím-phuàⁿ tsìng-khak, Si-óng suaⁿ tio̍h huann-hí, Iôtah ê siâⁿ-tshī tio̍h khuài-lo̍k.
English: Let Mount Zion be glad! Let the daughters of Judah rejoice, Because of your judgments.

Tailo: Bô lâng jiok ê sî, mā tshin-tshiūnn tī to-kiàm ê thâu-tsîng, in ē tāi-ke sio kheh lâi pua̍h-tó. Lín tī tuì-ti̍k ê bīn-tsîng mā khiā bē tiâu.
English: They will stumble over one another, as it were before the sword, when no one pursues: and you will have no power to stand before your enemies.

Tailo: Aigi̍p lâng pháiⁿ khuán-thāi guán, kā guán khó͘-to̍k, kiò guán tsò khó͘-kang.
English: The Egyptians dealt ill with us, and afflicted us, and laid on us hard bondage:

Tailo: Hōng Tsú ê miâ lâi ê ông ing-kai tit-tio̍h o-ló, guān thinn-tíng hô-pîng, kui îng-kng hō͘ tsì-kuân Siōngtè.
English: saying, Blessed is the King who comes in the name of the Lord! Peace in heaven, and glory in the highest!

Tailo: Lín suî-jiân hiàn sio-tsè kah lín ê sò͘-tsè hō͘ Guá, Guá mā bô huann-hí, lín hiàn puî ê tsing-seⁿ tsò siā-un-tsè, Guá bô beh kàm-la̍p.
English: Yes, though you offer me your burnt offerings and meal offerings, I will not accept them; Neither will I regard the peace offerings of your fat animals.

Tailo: Lián kiânn ê sî, sì-bīn lóng ē kiânn-.tit, kiânn ê sî m̄-bián tńg-ua̍t.
English: When they went, they went in their four directions: they didn't turn when they went.

Tailo: Nā seⁿ-thuàⁿ tī phuê-hu, tsè-si tsiū tio̍h tuàn-tīng i tsò bô tshing-khì, sī huān-tio̍h tsìng-thâu.
English: If it spreads in the skin, then the priest shall pronounce him unclean. It is a plague.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ē kā lí kńg tsò tsi̍t kńg, hiat tī khui-khuah ê só͘-tsāi, ná tshin-tshiūnn teh hiat kiû. Lí tsò tsú-lâng ê ke ê lîng-jio̍k ê lâng ē sí tī hia; lí îng-kng ê tsiàn-tshia mā ē tī hia.
English: He will surely wind you around and around, and throw you like a ball into a large country. There you will die, and there the chariots of your glory will be, you shame of your lord's house.

Tailo: Tuì sū-su tī-lí Isulael ê sî, kàu Isulael ông kah Iôtah lia̍t ông ê sî, si̍t-tsāi iáu-buē ū siú tshin-tshiūnn tsit khuán ê Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh.
English: Surely there was not kept such a Passover from the days of the judges who judged Israel, nor in all the days of the kings of Israel, nor of the kings of Judah;

Tailo: Thang hō͘ sè-kan lâng tsai Lí tuā kuân-lîng ê tsok-uî, tsai Lí kok-tō͘ ê ui-giâm kah îng-kng.
English: To make known to the sons of men his mighty acts, The glory of the majesty of his kingdom.

Tailo: Tng in khí thô͘-tui, tsō tâi beh bia̍t-bông tsin tsē lâng ê sî, Huâ-láu tshuā tuā tuī ping kah tsin tsē lâng lâi, mā bē tī kau-tsiàn tiong kā i pang-tsān.
English: Neither shall Pharaoh with his mighty army and great company help him in the war, when they cast up mounds and build forts, to cut off many persons.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tsì-kuân Siōngtè sìng ê tsú-bîn ē tit-tio̍h kok-uī, kú-tn̂g tsiáng-lí kok-kuân, íng-uán bô suah.
English: But the saints of the Most High shall receive the kingdom, and possess the kingdom forever, even forever and ever.

Tailo: M̄-thang tham lí ê tshù-piⁿ ê tshù, mā m̄-thang tham lí ê tshù-piⁿ ê bó͘, lô͘-po̍k, lú-pī, gû, lî-á, í-ki̍p lí ê tshù-piⁿ it-tshè só͘-ū ê.
English: You shall not covet your neighbor's house. You shall not covet your neighbor's wife, nor his male servant, nor his female servant, nor his ox, nor his donkey, nor anything that is your neighbor's.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōngtsú kā guá pò-siúⁿ, sī tsiàu guá ê kong-gī, mā tsiàu guá tī I ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng ê tshing-khì.
English: Therefore has Yahweh recompensed me according to my righteousness, According to my cleanness in his eyesight.

Tailo: I huì-tû suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ, huí-huāi thiāu-siōng, tshò A-si-lah, phah-tshuì Mô͘se só͘ tsō ê tâng-tsuâ, in-uī kàu hit sî Isulael lâng tuì i sio hiuⁿ, kā i kiò-tsò Ne-hu-si-tàn（ tsù, tsí Mô͘se tī khòng-iá sî só͘ tsù ê tâng-tsuâ, i tsiâⁿ-tsò Isulael lâng moh-pài ê tuì-siōng ）.
English: He removed the high places, and broke the pillars, and cut down the Asherah: and he broke in pieces the brazen serpent that Moses had made; for to those days the children of Israel did burn incense to it; and he called it Nehushtan.

Tailo: tsóng-.sī, Siōngtè tuì guá kóng, Lí bē-tàng uī Guá ê miâ khí tiān, in-uī lí sī tsiàn-sū, ū hō͘ lâng lâu hueh. '
English: But God said to me, You shall not build a house for my name, because you are a man of war, and have shed blood.

Tailo: Guá tsiū tuì guá ê a-tsik ê kiáⁿ Hanámel bé Anáthot hit khu tshân, tshìn hit-ê kè-tsînn hō͘ i, kiōng tsa̍p-tshit si-khel.
English: I bought the field that was in Anathoth of Hanamel my uncle's son, and weighed him the money, even seventeen shekels of silver.

Tailo: Tsiū guān guá só͘ tsìng-tsoh ê hō͘ pa̍t lâng khì tsia̍h, guá só͘ tshut-sán ê lông-tsok-bu̍t ê kin siū pue̍h khí-.lâi.
English: Then let me sow, and let another eat; Yes, let the produce of my field be rooted out.

Tailo: Mā uī-tio̍h gû-káng, iûⁿ-káng kah iûⁿ-á, suà hiàn i ê sò͘-tsè, i ê kuàn-tiān, lóng tsiàu in ê sò͘-gia̍h, tsiàu hit-ê lē.
English: and their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance;

Tailo: In pa̍k hiah-ê kuì-tso̍k ê tshiú, kā in tiàu lī tē; kìⁿ-tio̍h láu-tuā ê bīn, mā bô tsun-kìng.
English: Princes were hanged up by their hand: The faces of elders were not honored.

Tailo: Hit sî, hián-tshut i îng-kng ê kok ê hù-jū kah ka-kī hó ê ui-giâm kah tsun-kuì, king-kuè tsin tsē ji̍t, to̍h-sī tsi̍t-pah peh-tsa̍p kang.
English: He displayed the riches of his glorious kingdom and the honor of his excellent majesty many days, even one hundred eighty days.

Tailo: Tang pîng ê mn̂g ū sī-uē pâng, tsit pâng saⁿ king, hit pâng saⁿ king, lóng kāng-khuán ê tshùn-tshioh; tsit pîng ê thiāu kah hit pîng ê thiāu mā sī kāng-khuán ê tshùn-tshioh.
English: The lodges of the gate eastward were three on this side, and three on that side; they three were of one measure: and the posts had one measure on this side and on that side.

Tailo: Nátap kiânn Siōngtsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, i tsiàu án-ne kiâⁿ i ê lāu-pē ê lō͘, koh huān-tio̍h i ê lāu-pē hō͘ Isulael lâng só͘ huān ê tsuē.
English: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, and walked in the way of his father, and in his sin with which he made Israel to sin.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtè kā tuì-ti̍k kau tī lí ê tshiú, ing-kai o-ló I. Abúlâm kā só͘-ū só͘ tit-tio̍h ê, tsa̍p hūn the̍h tsi̍t hūn hō͘ Malkitsetik.
English: and blessed be God Most High, who has delivered your enemies into your hand. Abram gave him a tenth of all.

Tailo: Guá īng guá ê sim mê-kan him-bō͘ Lí, mā īng guá ê sim-sîn thiⁿ-kng tsá-khí tshuē Lí; in-uī Lí sím-phuàⁿ sè-tsiūⁿ ê sî, tē-tsiūⁿ ê jîn-bîn tsiū ē ha̍k-si̍p gī.
English: With my soul have I desired you in the night. Yes, with my spirit within me will I seek you earnestly; for when your judgments are in the earth, the inhabitants of the world learn righteousness.

Tailo: I kā ū pe̍h bûn ê tshiū-ki tshah tī iûⁿ lim tsuí ê tsuí-kau kah tsuí-tsô, hō͘ i kah iûⁿ sio tuì-siòng; iûⁿ lâi lim tsuí ê sî, kang-bó͘ kau-ha̍p.
English: He set the rods which he had peeled opposite the flocks in the gutters in the watering-troughs where the flocks came to drink. They conceived when they came to drink.

Tailo: Phah tâng sai-hū A-li̍k-san-toh kā guá hāi kah tsin tshám, Tsú ē tsiàu i ê só͘ tsò lâi kā i pò-ìng.
English: Alexander, the coppersmith, did much evil to me. The Lord will repay him according to his works,

Tailo: Hit sî, Tabi̍t tī siâⁿ-pó, Huilīsū lâng ê ping-iâⁿ tī Bia̍tléhèm.
English: David was then in the stronghold, and the garrison of the Philistines was then in Bethlehem.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tī Siōngtsú só͘ beh kíng-suán lâi an-tì I ê miâ ê só͘-tsāi, tuì lí ê iûⁿ-kûn, gû-kûn, īng Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh ê tsing-seⁿ, hiàn tsè hō͘ Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè.
English: You shall sacrifice the Passover to Yahweh your God, of the flock and the herd, in the place which Yahweh shall choose, to cause his name to dwell there.

Tailo: Tabi̍t ê lô͘-po̍k lâi-kàu Kal-mel kìnn Abigail, kā i kóng, Tabi̍t tshe guán lâi kìnn lí, siūⁿ beh tshuā lí tsò bó͘.
English: When the servants of David were come to Abigail to Carmel, they spoke to her, saying, David has sent us to you, to take you to him as wife.

Tailo: Io-a-si ê kiáⁿ Ia-lu-ba-al tńg-khì ka-kī ê tshù tuà.
English: Jerubbaal the son of Joash went and lived in his own house.

Tailo: Piattò͘ tuì Iésu kóng, Tsú ah, lán tī tsia tsin hó! Lí nā ì-ài, guá tī tsia lâi tah saⁿ-king liâu-á, tsi̍t king hō͘ Lí, tsi̍t king hō͘ Mô͘se, tsi̍t king hō͘ Eliiah.
English: Peter answered, and said to Jesus, Lord, it is good for us to be here. If you want, let's make three tents here: one for you, one for Moses, and one for Elijah.

Tailo: In ê tsìⁿ tē sī khui-khui ê bōng; in lóng sī ióng-sū.
English: Their quiver is an open tomb, they are all mighty men.

Tailo: Guá tsit-má īng tiúⁿ-ló ê sin-hūn, khó͘-khǹg lín tiong-kan ê tiúⁿ-ló; guá koh sī Ki-tok siū khó͘ ê kiàn-tsìng-jîn, mā beh hun-hióng teh beh hián-hiān ê îng-kng.
English: I exhort the elders among you, as a fellow elder, and a witness of the sufferings of Christ, and who will also share in the glory that will be revealed.

Tailo: Jiânāu Iésu giâm-kìm bûn-tô͘, m̄-thang kā lâng kóng I to̍h-sī Ki-tok.
English: Then he charged the disciples that they should tell no one that he is Jesus the Christ.

Tailo: Khuànn só͘-ū kiau-ngō͘ ê lâng, ah-tshi̍h hō͘ i kē, ta̍h pháiⁿ lâng tī in só͘ khiā ê tē.
English: Look on everyone who is proud, and humble him. Crush the wicked in their place.

Tailo: Án-ne, Siōngtsú kiù Hitsekia kah tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê jîn-bîn thuat-lī Asiul ông Senahkhelip ê tshiú, mā thuat-lī só͘-ū tuì-ti̍k ê tshiú, koh hō͘ in sì-kho͘-uî pîng-an.
English: Thus Yahweh saved Hezekiah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem from the hand of Sennacherib the king of Assyria, and from the hand of all others, and guided them on every side.

Tailo: Lí kám ē tuì guán siū-khì-kàu íng-uán? Lí kám ē kā Lí ê siū-khì kè-sio̍k kàu bān tāi?
English: Will you be angry with us forever? Will you draw out your anger to all generations?

Tailo: Lí tsit-ê tshàu-miâ tsin tsē koh jiáu-luān ê siâⁿ, hiah-ê lī-khui lí kīn, á-.sī lī-khui lí hn̄g ê, lóng ē kā lí thí-tshiò.
English: Those who are near, and those who are far from you, shall mock you, you infamous one and full of tumult.

Tailo: Tio̍h īng sûn-kim tsò tsi̍t-ê pâi, tsiàu khik-ìn ê huat-tō͘ khik tī i ê tíng-bīn, án-ne siá, ' Tsò sìng kui Siōngtsú'.
English: You shall make a plate of pure gold, and engrave on it, like the engravings of a signet, HOLY TO YAHWEH.'

Tailo: Lín bô kā I ê uē khǹg tī sim-lāi, in-uī lín m̄-sìn I tshe-phài lâi ê hit uī.
English: You don't have his word living in you; because you don't believe him whom he sent.

Tailo: Iûⁿ-ko thiah-khui tē-saⁿ-ê hong-ìn ê sî, guá thiaⁿ-tio̍h tē-saⁿ tsiah ua̍h-mi̍h kóng, Lâi! Guá tsi̍t ē khuànn, tsiū khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t tsiah o͘ bé, khiâ bé ê lâng tshiú the̍h tshìn-á.
English: When he opened the third seal, I heard the third living creature saying, Come and see! And behold, a black horse, and he who sat on it had a balance in his hand.

Tailo: Tsú ah, guá taⁿ tio̍h thìng-hāu siáⁿ-mi̍h? Guá ê ǹg-bāng sī tsāi tī Lí!
English: Now, Lord, what do I wait for? My hope is in you.

Tailo: Lí teh khua-kháu, lâng kám tio̍h tiām-tiām? Lí teh thí-tshiò ê sî, kám bô lâng hō͘ lí kiàn-siàu?
English: Should your boastings make men hold their peace? When you mock, shall no man make you ashamed?

Tailo: Sò͘-tsè kah tiān-tsiú lóng bô thang kàu tī Siōngtsú ê tiān; ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú ê tsè-si lóng pi-ai.
English: The meal offering and the drink offering are cut off from Yahweh's house. The priests, Yahweh's ministers, mourn.

Tailo: Koh tī tshit gue̍h tsa̍p-gō͘, lín ê lông-sán-bu̍t siu-sîng ê sî, tio̍h siú Siōngtsú ê tseh tshit ji̍t. Thâu tsi̍t ji̍t tsò sìng ê an-hioh, tē-peh ji̍t mā tsò sìng ê an-hioh.
English: So on the fifteenth day of the seventh month, when you have gathered in the fruits of the land, you shall keep the feast of Yahweh seven days: on the first day shall be a solemn rest, and on the eighth day shall be a solemn rest.

Tailo: Lâng lī-khui pún só͘-tsāi khì phiau-liû, tú tshin-tshiūnn tsiáu-á lī-khui i ê siū sì-kè pue.
English: As a bird that wanders from her nest, So is a man who wanders from his home.

Tailo: Isáiah kóng, Siōngtsú ē tsiânn I só͘ kóng ê. Tse sī Siōngtsú beh hō͘ lí ê tiāu-thâu:
English: This shall be the sign to you from Yahweh, that Yahweh will do this thing that he has spoken.

Tailo: Tsú-lâng tuā siū-khì, kā i kuaiⁿ lo̍h kaⁿ khì siū hîng-hua̍t, it-ti̍t kàu i kā tsuân-pō͘ ê tsè-bū hîng tshing-tshó uî-tsí.
English: His lord was angry, and delivered him to the tormentors, until he should pay all that was due to him.

Tailo: Tī tsin tsē jîn-bîn ê siâⁿ lāi ū lâng ai-uàn, siū-siong ê lâng ê sim pi-ai; tsóng-.sī, Siōngtè bô kàm-tshat hit-ê put-gī.
English: From out of the populous city, men groan. The soul of the wounded cries out, Yet God doesn't regard the folly.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Iôséhuh tńg-khì kā i ê lāu-pē bâi-tsòng. Kah i tsò-hué tńg-.khì ê, ū Huâ-láu ê tsìng jîn-sîn kah Huâ-láu tshù lāi ê tiúⁿ-ló, í-ki̍p Aigi̍p kok ê tsìng tiúⁿ-ló,
English: Joseph went up to bury his father; and with him went up all the servants of Pharaoh, the elders of his house, all the elders of the land of Egypt,

Tailo: In-uī ū ping-tè tsiū lô, ū seh khǹg tī hit lāi-bīn;
English: Which are black by reason of the ice, in which the snow hides itself:

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí khí-lâi tí-tòng tuì-ti̍k, kā i phah-tó; īng Lí ê to kiù guá ê sèⁿ-miā thuat-lī pháiⁿ lâng.
English: Arise, Yahweh, Confront him, cast him down. Deliver my soul from the wicked by your sword;

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē koh lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: Also the word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Lín gō͘-ê lâng ē kuáⁿ-tsáu tsi̍t pah-ê lâng, lín tsi̍t pah-ê lâng ē kuáⁿ-tsáu tsi̍t-bān-ê lâng, tuì-ti̍k ē tī lín ê bīn-tsîng tó tī to hā.
English: Five of you shall chase a hundred, and a hundred of you shall chase ten thousand; and your enemies shall fall before you by the sword.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tsiū tuì guá kóng, ' In só͘ kóng ê sī hó,
English: Yahweh said to me, They have well said that which they have spoken.

Tailo: Simiān lâng ê sán-gia̍p sī tuì Iôtah lâng ê sán-gia̍p tiong-kan tit-tio̍h ê, in-uī Iôtah lâng ê hūn-gia̍h siuⁿ tsē, só͘-í, Simiān lâng tī in ê sán-gia̍p tiong-kan tit-tio̍h gia̍p.
English: Out of the part of the children of Judah was the inheritance of the children of Simeon; for the portion of the children of Judah was too much for them: therefore the children of Simeon had inheritance in the midst of their inheritance.

Tailo: Guá beh kā khó-ò͘ⁿ ù-uè ê mi̍h hiat tī lí ê sin tsiūⁿ, kā lí lîng-jio̍k, hō͘ lâng ba̍k-tsiu khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: I will throw abominable filth on you, and make you vile, and will set you a spectacle.

Tailo: Pue-tsiáu tsò siū tī hit lāi-bīn; ū ho̍h tuà tī siông tshiū ê tiong-kan.
English: Where the birds make their nests. The stork makes its home in the fir trees.

Tailo: Án-ne, guán tsò Lí ê tsú-bîn, Lí ê tsháu-tiûⁿ ê iûⁿ ê lâng, beh kám-siā Lí kàu íng-uán; beh o-ló Lí ê miâ kàu bān-sè-tāi.
English: So we, your people and sheep of your pasture, Will give you thanks forever. We will praise you forever, to all generations.

Tailo: Lí kám m̄ koh kā guán kiù-ua̍h, hō͘ Lí ê tsú-bîn in-uī Lí lâi huann-hí?
English: Won't you revive us again, That your people may rejoice in you?

Tailo: Koh jīn-tshut i to̍h-sī pîng-sî tsē tī sìng-tiān ê Suí mn̂g teh kiû-khit hit-ê lâng, tsiū tuì i sin tsiūⁿ só͘ tú-.tio̍h ê tāi-tsì tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì.
English: They recognized him, that it was he who used to sit begging for gifts for the needy at the Beautiful Gate of the temple. They were filled with wonder and amazement at what had happened to him.

Tailo: Siōngtè siúⁿ-sù bí-niûⁿ hō͘ só͘-ū ê ua̍h-mi̍h, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: Who gives food to every creature; For his loving kindness endures forever.

Tailo: Lí tuì Siōngtè hē guān, siā guān m̄-thang iân-tshiân; in-uī I bô huann-hí gû-gōng ê lâng, lí só͘ hē ê guān ing-kai tio̍h siā.
English: When you vow a vow to God, don't defer to pay it; for he has no pleasure in fools. Pay that which you vow.

Tailo: Lí beh kā in puà, hong ē kā in tshue-.khì, kńg-lê-á hong ē kā in sàu-.khì. M̄-koh, lí ē in-uī Siōngtsú lâi huann-hí, ē in-uī Isulael ê sìng ê lâi khua-kháu.
English: You will winnow them, And the wind will carry them away, And the whirlwind will scatter them. You will rejoice in Yahweh. You will glory in the Holy One of Israel.

Tailo: Hāi ah! Huān-tsuē ê kok, tsuē-ok ê jîn-bîn, kiâⁿ pháiⁿ ê tsíng-luī kah pāi-huāi ê kiáⁿ-jî! In lī-khui Siōngtsú, khuànn-khin Isulael ê sìng ê, kah I tsheⁿ-so͘, ua̍t tńg-sin lī-khui khì.
English: Ah sinful nation, A people loaded with iniquity, A seed of evil-doers, Children who deal corruptly! They have forsaken Yahweh. They have despised the Holy One of Israel. They are estranged and backward.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá ì-ài Lí ê kài-bīng iâⁿ-kuè kim, mā iâⁿ-kuè sûn-kim.
English: Therefore I love your commandments more than gold, Yes, more than pure gold.

Tailo: Guá kah lí ū iok, tshin-tshiūnn tsîng guá ê lāu-pē kah lí ê lāu-pē án-ne. Taⁿ guá īng kim-gîn sàng lí, tshiáⁿ lí khì huì-tû lí kah Isulael ông Basiah só͘ li̍p ê iok, hō͘ i lī-khui guá.
English: There is a league between me and you, as there was between my father and your father: behold, I have sent you silver and gold; go, break your league with Baasha king of Israel, that he may depart from me.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōngtsú án-ne ìn guá kóng, Lí nā tò tńg-.lâi, Guá tsiū beh hō͘ lí tò tńg-lâi khiā tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng; lí nā tuì hā-tsiān ê tiong-kan kíng pó-kuì ê tshut-.lâi, lí tsiū ē-tàng tsò Guá ê tāi-giân-jîn. In it-tīng ē kui-ǹg lí, tsóng-.sī, lí m̄-thang kui-ǹg in.
English: Therefore thus says Yahweh, If you return, then will I bring you again, that you may stand before me; and if you take forth the precious from the vile, you shall be as my mouth: they shall return to you, but you shall not return to them.

Tailo: Hó-gia̍h lâng ka-kī khuàⁿ-tsò sī ū tì-huī, to̍k-to̍k tshong-bîng ê sàn-tshiah lâng kā i khuànn tshut-tshut.
English: The rich man is wise in his own eyes; But the poor who has understanding sees through him.

Tailo: Siōngtsú sù-hok hō͘ Nó͘ah kah i ê kiáⁿ, mā tuì in kóng, Lín tio̍h sing-thuàⁿ tsin tsē, tshiong-muá tē-tsiūⁿ.
English: God blessed Noah and his sons, and said to them, Be fruitful, and multiply, and replenish the earth.

Tailo: mā kā guán khí-thâu tshut ê mī-hún kah guán ê kí-tsè ê lé-mi̍h, í-ki̍p ta̍k tsióng tshiū ê kué-tsí, sin tsiú kah iû, tuà-lâi hō͘ tsè-si, siu ji̍p-khì tī guán Siōngtè ê tiān ê khò͘-pâng, kā guán tē-tsiūⁿ só͘ siu-sîng ê tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it hō͘ Lēbī lâng, in-uī Lēbī lâng tī guán só͘-ū tshut lông-sán-bu̍t ê siâⁿ tit-tio̍h tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it.
English: and that we should bring the first fruits of our dough, and our wave offerings, and the fruit of all manner of trees, the new wine and the oil, to the priests, to the chambers of the house of our God; and the tithes of our ground to the Levites; for they, the Levites, take the tithes in all the cities of our tillage.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, Lí ê miâ liû-thuân kàu íng-uán! Siōngtsú ah, Lí thang kì-liām ê miâ liû-thuân kàu bān tāi!
English: Your name, Yahweh, endures forever; Your renown, Yahweh, throughout all generations.

Tailo: Siōngtè sī sìn-si̍t ê, guán tuì lín tap-ìng ê uē mā m̄-sī liâm-piⁿ Sī , koh liâm-piⁿ M̄-sī .
English: But as God is faithful, our word toward you was not Yes and no.

Tailo: （ Khóla̍h kiáⁿ-sun kà-sī ê si, koh sī ài-bō͘ ê kua; kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ; tiāu īng Pik-ha̍p-hue . ）Guá ê sim tshìng-tshut bí-hó ê uē, guá kóng-khí guá uī-tio̍h ông só͘ tsò ê si, guá ê tsi̍h tshin-tshiūnn láu-liān tsok-ka ê pit.
English: My heart overflows with a noble theme. I recite my verses for the king. My tongue is like the pen of a skillful writer.

Tailo: Guá tī siâⁿ lāi teh sì-kè kiânn ê sî, khuàⁿ-tio̍h lín teh kìng-pài ê só͘-tsāi, ū tú-tio̍h tsi̍t tsō tuâⁿ, tíng-bīn án-ne siá, ' hiàn hō͘ m̄-bat ê sîn. 'Lín teh kìng-pài tsit uī lín m̄-bat ê sîn, tsit-má guá beh lâi pò lín tsai.
English: For as I passed along, and observed the objects of your worship, I found also an altar with this inscription: TO AN UNKNOWN GOD.' What therefore you worship in ignorance, this I announce to you.

Tailo: Tsí-ū I sī guá ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ, sī guá ê tsín-kiù; I sī guá ê siâⁿ-pó, guá lóng bē iô-tāng.
English: He alone is my rock and my salvation, my fortress. I will not be shaken.

Tailo: Sann nî āu, guá tsiah-khì Êlúsalèm pài-hóng Piattò͘ kah i tuà tsa̍p-gō͘ ji̍t.
English: Then after three years I went up to Jerusalem to visit Peter, and stayed with him fifteen days.

Tailo: Siōngtè tshuā i tshut Aigi̍p, i tshin-tshiūnn ū iá-gû ê la̍t; i ē thun-tsia̍h tuì-ti̍k ê kok, at-tn̄g in ê kut-thâu; īng tsìnn kā in siā kàu thàng-kuè.
English: God brings him forth out of Egypt; He has as it were the strength of the wild ox: He shall eat up the nations his adversaries, Shall break their bones in pieces, Smite them through with his arrows.

Tailo: Iésu tsiū tuì bûn-tô͘ kóng, Thang siu-sîng ê tsin tsē, siu-kuah ê kang-lâng tsin tsió.
English: Then he said to his disciples, The harvest indeed is plentiful, but the laborers are few.

Tailo: Kàu tē-saⁿ ji̍t, sī Huâ-láu ê seⁿ-ji̍t, i uī tsìng jîn-sîn pâi-siat iàn-si̍k, tī tsiah-ê jîn-sîn ê bīn-tsîng, thâi-kí tsiú-tsìng-tiúⁿ kah tû-pâng-tiúⁿ.
English: It happened the third day, which was Pharaoh's birthday, that he made a feast for all his servants, and he lifted up the head of the chief cupbearer and the head of the chief baker among his servants.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê pēnn-lâng, miâ kiò-tsò La̍h-tsa-lō͘, i tuà tī Bē-tha-niah, to̍h-sī Mâlíah kah i ê á-tsé Mal-tha ê tsng-thâu.
English: Now a certain man was sick, Lazarus from Bethany, of the village of Mary and her sister, Martha.

Tailo: Eliiah ìn in kóng, Guá nā-sī Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k, guān hué tuì thiⁿ lo̍h-.lâi, sio lí kah lí hit gō͘-tsa̍p lâng! Tsiū ū Siōngtsú ê hué tuì thiⁿ lo̍h-.lâi, sio i kah i hit gō͘-tsa̍p lâng.
English: Elijah answered them, If I be a man of God, let fire come down from the sky, and consume you and your fifty. The fire of God came down from the sky, and consumed him and his fifty.

Tailo: Hit sî, Isulael jîn-bîn pun-tsò nn̄g pîng; tsi̍t-puàⁿ tuè Ke-na̍t ê kiáⁿ Thêpínî, beh kā i siat-li̍p tsò ông; līng-guā tsi̍t-puàⁿ tuè Omlī.
English: Then were the people of Israel divided into two parts: half of the people followed Tibni the son of Ginath, to make him king; and half followed Omri.

Tailo: Tshuē-tio̍h liáu-āu, tsiū tshuā i kàu Ai-ti-o-khè. Tsiok-tsiok tsi̍t nî, in kah kàu-huē ê huē-iú tsū-huē, kà-sī tsin tsē lâng. Bûn-tô͘ hō͘ lâng kiò-tsò Ki-tok-tô͘ , sī tuì An-ti-o-khè khai-sí.
English: When he had found him, he brought him to Antioch. It happened, that for a whole year they were gathered together with the assembly, and taught many people. The disciples were first called Christians in Antioch.

Tailo: Lín lâi-kàu Sin-iok ê tiong-pó — Iésu ê bīn-tsîng kah só͘ hiù ê hueh hia; tsit-ê hueh pí Abel ê hueh só͘ piáu-ta̍t ê koh khah hó.
English: to Jesus, the mediator of a new covenant, and to the blood of sprinkling that speaks better than that of Abel.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, Isulael lâng tī tuì-ti̍k ê bīn-tsîng khiā bē-tiâu. In tī tuì-ti̍k ê bīn-tsîng ua̍t tńg-sin tô-tsáu, sī in-uī in tsiâⁿ-tsò siū tsiù-tsó͘ ê; lín nā bô kā ing-kai hiàn ê mi̍h, tuì lín tiong-kan tû-.khì, Guá tsiū bô koh kah lín tông-tsāi.
English: Therefore the children of Israel can't stand before their enemies; they turn their backs before their enemies, because they are become accursed: I will not be with you any more, except you destroy the devoted thing from among you.

Tailo: Thàu-tsá-khí-.lâi, tāi-ke hō͘-siong tsiù-tsuā. Ísak sàng in tshut-huat, in tsiū an-jiân lī-khui i khì.
English: They rose up some time in the morning, and swore one to another. Isaac sent them away, and they departed from him in peace.

Tailo: Tsiàu Siōngtsú bīng-līng Iosiúah ê, i tsiū tī Iôtah ê tso̍k tiong, kā tsi̍t hūn pun hō͘ E-hun-neh ê kiáⁿ Ka-le̍p tsò sán-gia̍p, to̍h-sī Ki-lia̍t-a-ba, mā kiò-tsò Hebúlông; Albah sī Alap tso̍k ê tsó͘-sian.
English: To Caleb the son of Jephunneh he gave a portion among the children of Judah, according to the commandment of Yahweh to Joshua, even Kiriath Arba, which Arba was the father of Anak (the same is Hebron).

Tailo: Taⁿ tio̍h thiaⁿ Siōngtsú só͘ kóng ê! I kóng, Khí-.lâi! Lí tio̍h tī tsiah-ê suaⁿ ê bīn-tsîng piān-lūn, hō͘ tsiah-ê suaⁿ-niá thiaⁿ-tio̍h lí ê siann.
English: Listen now to what Yahweh says: Arise, plead your case before the mountains, And let the hills hear what you have to say.

Tailo: Samuel kā kok-huat tuì jîn-bîn kóng bîng, koh kì tī tsheh-.ni̍h, hē tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, jiân-āu Samuel kā kûn-tsiòng sì-suàⁿ-khui, ta̍k-ê tńg-khì in ê ke.
English: Then Samuel told the people the manner of the kingdom, and wrote it in a book, and laid it up before Yahweh. Samuel sent all the people away, every man to his house.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tsiàu ta̍k tsi-tso̍k lâi kíng-suán ū tì-huī, ū kiàn-sik koh ū bîng-bōng ê lâng, thang hō͘ guá lâi kā in siat-li̍p tsò lín ê siú-líng. '
English: Take wise men of understanding and well known according to your tribes, and I will make them heads over you.

Tailo: Lán tio̍h hō͘-siong kuan-huâi lâi kik-lē thiàⁿ-sim kah tsò hó sū.
English: Let us consider how to provoke one another to love and good works,

Tailo: Páulô án-ne piān-hō͘ ê sî, Hui-su-to͘ tuā-siaⁿ huah, Páulô, lí teh khí-kông! Lí ha̍k-būn siuⁿ pá suah hō͘ lí khí-kông!
English: As he thus made his defense, Festus said with a loud voice, Paul, you are crazy! Your great learning is driving you insane!

Tailo: Nā khuàⁿ-tio̍h uàn-hūn lí ê lâng ê lî-á tsài tāng teh tó lo̍h-.khì, m̄-thang kiâⁿ-khui, tio̍h kah i tsò-hué sià lo̍h lî só͘ tsài ê huè.
English: If you see the donkey of him who hates you fallen down under his burden, don't leave him, you shall surely help him with it.

Tailo: Ísak tuā kiaⁿ, phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah, kóng, He sī siáⁿ lâng? Lí iáu-buē lâi ê tsìn-tsîng, phâng i só͘ phah-tio̍h ê lâi hō͘ guá. Guá tsia̍h-liáu, koh kā i tsiok-hok, i it-tīng beh tit-tio̍h hok-khì.
English: Isaac trembled violently, and said, Who, then, is he who has taken venison, and brought it me, and I have eaten of all before you came, and have blessed him? Yes, he will be blessed.

Tailo: In-uī gī lâng pua̍h-tó tshit pái ē koh peh khí-.lâi; pháiⁿ lâng siū tsai-lān tsiū tó-huāi.
English: For a righteous man falls seven times, and rises up again; But the wicked are overthrown by calamity.

Tailo: guān Lí tī thiⁿ-.ni̍h Lí tuà ê só͘-tsāi, lâi thiaⁿ in ê kî-tó, tsiàu guā-pang lâng it-tshè só͘ tuì Lí kiû ê lâi kiâⁿ, hō͘ thiⁿ-ē bān-bîn lóng bat Lí ê miâ, kìng-uì Lí, tshin-tshiūnn Lí ê tsú-bîn — Isulael, koh hō͘ in tsai guá só͘ khí tsit king tiān sī īng Lí ê miâ lâi tshing-ho͘ ê.
English: hear in heaven, your dwelling place, and do according to all that the foreigner calls to you for; that all the peoples of the earth may know your name, to fear you, as does your people Israel, and that they may know that this house which I have built is called by my name.

Tailo: Leah kóng, Siōngtè hō͘ guá kang-tsînn, in-uī guá kā lú-pī hō͘ guá ê tiōng-hu. Tsiū án-ne, kā i hō-miâ kiò-tsò Itsakal.
English: Leah said, God has given me my hire, because I gave my handmaid to my husband. She named him Issachar.

Tailo: Lín nā jīn-tsin kiânn tsit-ê tāi-tsì, tsiū ē ū tsē Tabi̍t pó-tsō ê ông, i kah i ê jîn-sîn, jîn-bîn, á-.sī tsē tshia, á-.sī khiâ bé, tshut-ji̍p tsit-ê tshù ê mn̂g.
English: For if you do this thing indeed, then shall there enter in by the gates of this house kings sitting on the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, he, and his servants, and his people.

Tailo: tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng-á, tsi̍t tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng, tsi̍t tsiah bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á, tsò sio-tsè;
English: one young bull, one ram, one male lamb a year old, for a burnt offering;

Tailo: I ū kiù guá thuat-lī só͘-ū ê huān-lān; guá ū tshin-ba̍k khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá ê tuì-ti̍k tú-tio̍h pò-ìng.
English: For he has delivered me out of all trouble. My eye has seen triumph over my enemies.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Siōngtsú kā Samuel kóng, M̄-thang khuànn i ê iông-māu kah i sing-khu ê tuā-hàn, tsit-ê lâng sī Guá só͘ kī-tsua̍t ê. In-uī Siōngtsú teh khuàⁿ bô tshin-tshiūnn lâng teh khuàⁿ, lâng khuànn guā-māu, Siōngtsú sī khuànn lāi-sim.
English: But Yahweh said to Samuel, Don't look on his face, or on the height of his stature; because I have rejected him: for Yahweh sees not as man sees; for man looks at the outward appearance, but Yahweh looks at the heart.

Tailo: Siat-sú Lí ê tsú-bîn — Isulael lâng, in-uī tik-tsuē Lí tsiah thâi-su tī tuì-ti̍k ê bīn-tsîng, in nā kui-ǹg Lí, jīn Lí ê miâ, koh tī tsit king tiān kî-tó ǹg Lí khún-kiû,
English: If your people Israel be struck down before the enemy, because they have sinned against you, and shall turn again and confess your name, and pray and make supplication before you in this house;

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Mô͘se tshiú sng, in tsiū suá tsi̍t lia̍p tsio̍h-thâu lâi hē tī i ê ē-bīn, i tsē tī tsio̍h-thâu tíng, Alông kah Huul hû i ê tshiú, tsi̍t-ê tī tsit pîng, tsi̍t-ê tī hit pîng, i ê tshiú tsiū an-ún tsū-tsāi, ti̍t-ti̍t kàu ji̍t lo̍h.
English: But Moses' hands were heavy; and they took a stone, and put it under him, and he sat on it. Aaron and Hur held up his hands, the one on the one side, and the other on the other side. His hands were steady until sunset.

Tailo: King-tián án-ne kóng, kin-á-ji̍t lín nā thiaⁿ-tio̍h Siōngtè ê siann, tsiū m̄-thang ngē lín ê sim, tshin-tshiūnn lín ê tsó͘-sian puē-gi̍k ê sî. (tsù, SPh 95:7-8)
English: while it is said, Today if you will hear his voice, Don't harden your hearts, as in the rebellion.

Tailo: Tsing-seⁿ nā tuì kò͘-siú ê lâng hia hō͘ lâng thau lia̍h-.khì, i tsiū tio̍h puê guân tsú-lâng.
English: But if it is stolen from him, he shall make restitution to the owner of it.

Tailo: Tabi̍t kā hit-ê sù-tsiá kóng, Lí tio̍h án-ne kā Ioap kóng, ' M̄-bián tshau-huân tsit-ê tāi-tsì, in-uī to-kiàm thâi-sí-lâng, tsit-ê hit-ê bô it-tīng; lí tio̍h koh khah tsīn-la̍t kong siâⁿ, lâi kā i tshia-tó. ' Lí tio̍h án-ne kā i bián-lē.
English: Then David said to the messenger, Thus shall you tell Joab, Don't let this thing displease you, for the sword devours one as well as another; make your battle more strong against the city, and overthrow it: and encourage you him.

Tailo: I beh hō͘ in tsun-thàn I ê lu̍t-lē, tsun-siú I ê huat-tō͘. Lín tio̍h o-ló Siōngtsú!
English: That they might keep his statutes, And observe his laws. Praise Yah!

Tailo: Tio̍h kā Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí lâi sîng-tsiap kài lāi ê tē, hun-tsò saⁿ khu, koh kā i khui lō͘, hō͘ hiah-ê thâi lâng ê lóng thang tsáu-khì hia.
English: You shall prepare you the way, and divide the borders of your land, which Yahweh your God causes you to inherit, into three parts, that every manslayer may flee there.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, lia̍t ông tsū-tsi̍p, in tsò-hué tuì hia king-kuè.
English: For, behold, the kings assembled themselves, They passed by together.

Tailo: Kiàm ê pèⁿ mā sūn-suà ji̍p-.khì, kiàm hō͘ iû kā tiâu-.leh, in-uī i bô tuì i ê pak-tó͘ pue̍h kiàm tshut-.lâi, tsiū thàng-kuè kha-tsiah-phiaⁿ tshut-.lâi.
English: and the haft also went in after the blade; and the fat closed on the blade, for he didn't draw the sword out of his body; and it came out behind.

Tailo: I niû āu-bīn keh-khui ê tē thâu-tsîng ê tshù-the̍h, í-ki̍p tsit pîng, hit pîng lâu ê lông, tn̂g tsi̍t pah tiú, koh niû lāi-tiān kah īⁿ ê lông.
English: He measured the length of the building before the separate place which was at the back of it, and the galleries of it on the one side and on the other side, one hundred cubits; and the inner temple, and the porches of the court;

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k Páulô siūⁿ kóng án-ne bô sik-ha̍p, in-uī tsit-ê Iô-há-neh tī Pam-hu-lí-ah bat lī-khui in, bô kè-sio̍k kah in tsò-kang.
English: But Paul didn't think that it was a good idea to take with them someone who had withdrawn from them in Pamphylia, and didn't go with them to do the work.

Tailo: Tàn ê lâng ua̍t thâu khuànn, mn̄g Mika kóng, Lí tsū-tsi̍p hiah-ê lâng lâi, sī siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì?
English: They cried to the children of Dan. They turned their faces, and said to Micah, What ails you, that you come with such a company?

Tailo: Taⁿ guá tsai-iáⁿ Siōngtsú pí hiah-ê sîn-bîng khah uí-tāi, to̍h-sī tuì in hiah-ê Aigi̍p lâng kiau-ngō͘ khuán-thāi tsiah-ê jîn-bîn ê tāi-tsì.
English: Now I know that Yahweh is greater than all gods because of the thing in which they dealt arrogantly against them.

Tailo: Samuel kóng, Lín tio̍h tuà Amáli̍k ông Agak lâi guá tsia. Agak tsiū an-sim lâi-kàu i ê bīn-tsîng, Agak kóng, Sí-bông ê kan-khó͘ it-tīng kuè-khì à.
English: Then said Samuel, Bring you here to me Agag the king of the Amalekites. Agag came to him cheerfully. Agag said, Surely the bitterness of death is past.

Tailo: Kám-siā kā Huâ-láu kah i ê kun-ping hiat tī Âng-hái ê Siōngtè, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: But overthrew Pharaoh and his army in the Red Sea; For his loving kindness endures forever:

Tailo: Guá tsit-má king-kuè Ma-ke-tó-niah liáu-āu, tsiū beh khì lín hia.
English: But I will come to you when I have passed through Macedonia, for I am passing through Macedonia.

Tailo: Iésu tuā-siaⁿ huah, Sìn guá ê lâng m̄-sī teh sìn guá, sī sìn tshe-phài guá lâi ê hit uī.
English: Jesus cried out and said, Whoever believes in me, believes not in me, but in him who sent me.

Tailo: Tio̍h tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ huann-hí.
English: Rejoice always.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú ê tsài-lîm mā ē tshin-tshiūⁿ Nó͘ah ê tsîng-hîng.
English: As the days of Noah were, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

Tailo: Ū tsai-hō ah! Hiah-ê īng tshù tsiap tshù, īng tshân tsiap tshân, tì-sú bô lâu khàng-tē ê lâng; tsí ū tshun lín ka-kī khiā tī hit-ê kíng lāi.
English: Woe to those who join house to house, Who lay field to field, until there is no room, And you are made to dwell alone in the midst of the land!

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng kàu tē-saⁿ ji̍t, tio̍h īng hit-ê tsuí tshing-khì pún-sin; kàu tē-tshit ji̍t tsiah tshing-khì; i nā tī tē-saⁿ ji̍t bô tshing-khì pún-sin, kàu tē-tshit ji̍t tsiū bô tshing-khì.
English: the same shall purify himself therewith on the third day, and on the seventh day he shall be clean: but if he doesn't purify himself the third day, then the seventh day he shall not be clean.

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ lâi mn̄g Iésu kóng, Lí sī án-tsuáⁿ tio̍h īng phì-jū kā in kóng?
English: The disciples came, and said to him, Why do you speak to them in parables?

Tailo: Tio̍h kā tsit-ê tāi-tsì tī lia̍t pang tiong suan-pò͘, tio̍h tsún-pī kau-tsiàn, kik-tōng ióng-sū, hō͘ só͘-ū ê tsiàn-sū hiòng tsîng māi-tsìn.
English: Proclaim this among the nations: Prepare for war! Stir up the mighty men. Let all the warriors draw near. Let them come up.

Tailo: I ê tshiú nā īng ē hō͘ lâng sí ê tsio̍h-thâu tìm lâng, tì-sú lâng sí, i to̍h-sī hiong-huān, hiong-huān it-tīng tio̍h sí.
English: If he struck him with a stone in the hand, by which a man may die, and he died, he is a murderer: the murderer shall surely be put to death.

Tailo: In-uī Iôtah lâng ê tuì-ti̍k — Agak tso̍k Hametátha ê kiáⁿ Hamán, i siat kè-bô͘ beh kong-kik Iôtah lâng lâi kā in tsâu-bia̍t, pua̍h Phul, to̍h-sī thiu-tshiam, uī-tio̍h beh pāi-huāi in, kā in tsâu-bia̍t;
English: because Haman the son of Hammedatha, the Agagite, the enemy of all the Jews, had plotted against the Jews to destroy them, and had cast Pur, that is the lot, to consume them, and to destroy them;

Tailo: hit uī tshòng-tsō koh î-tshî bān-mi̍h ê Siōngtè, uī-tio̍h beh tshuā tsin tsē kiáⁿ-jî tsìn-ji̍p îng-kng, tsiah tio̍h hō͘ tsín-kiù ê khai-lō͘ sian-hong Iésu tuì khó͘-lān lâi sîng-tsuân. Siōngtè án-ne tsò sī ū sik-tòng.
English: For it became him, for whom are all things, and through whom are all things, in bringing many children to glory, to make the author of their salvation perfect through sufferings.

Tailo: In huí-huāi Baal ê thiāu-siōng, huí-huāi Baal ê biō, īng i tsò tshik-tî kàu kin-á-ji̍t.
English: They broke down the pillar of Baal, and broke down the house of Baal, and made it a latrine, to this day.

Tailo: Sé liáu-āu, tsè-si kā i giām, lí khuàⁿ, nā hit-ê tsìng-thâu khah siau, i tsiū tio̍h tuì saⁿ-á-.sī phuê, á-.sī king á-.sī huī uī, kā i thiah khí-.lâi.
English: If the priest looks, and behold, the plague has faded after it is washed, then he shall tear it out of the garment, or out of the skin, or out of the warp, or out of the woof:

Tailo: I tio̍h tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng thâi gû-káng-á. Alông ê kiáⁿ-sun tsò tsè-si ê, tio̍h hiàn hit-ê hueh, kā hueh hiù tī huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu kah tuâⁿ ê sì-kho͘-uî.
English: He shall kill the bull before Yahweh. Aaron's sons, the priests, shall present the blood and sprinkle the blood around on the altar that is at the door of the Tent of Meeting.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h khì khiā tī sìng-tiān, kā tsit-ê sù ua̍h-miā ê sìn-sit lóng tuì tsìng lâng suan-káng.
English: Go stand and speak in the temple to the people all the words of this life.

Tailo: I hō͘ pháiⁿ lâng ê tsuē-ok kui tī in ka-kī ê sin tsiūⁿ. In tsò pháiⁿ ê sî, I ē kā in tsâu-bia̍t; Siōngtsú — lán ê Siōngtè ē kā in tsâu-bia̍t.
English: He has brought on them their own iniquity, And will cut them off in their own wickedness. Yahweh, our God, will cut them off.

Tailo: Guá tshut-sì ê ji̍t, guān hit-ê ji̍t-tsí siū tsiù-tsó͘; guá ê lāu-bú seⁿ guá ê ji̍t, guān hit-ê ji̍t-tsí bô tit-tio̍h hok-khì.
English: Cursed be the day in which I was born: don't let the day in which my mother bore me be blessed.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h beh hō͘ lín ē-tàng pó-tsûn hok-im ê tsin-lí, guán tsi̍t-si-á to bô tuì in niū-pō͘.
English: to whom we gave no place in the way of subjection, not for an hour, that the truth of the Good News might continue with you.

Tailo: Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh kàng tsai-hō tī tsit só͘-tsāi, í-ki̍p tuà tī tsia ê jîn-bîn, to̍h-sī in tī Iôtah ông bīn-tsîng tha̍k ê tsheh só͘ kì-tsài ê hiah-ê tsiù-tsó͘.
English: Thus says Yahweh, Behold, I will bring evil on this place, and on the inhabitants of it, even all the curses that are written in the book which they have read before the king of Judah.

Tailo: I tsiū khì kiò hiah-ê kò͘-mn̂g ê khì pò hō͘ ông-ka tsai.
English: He called the porters; and they told it to the king's household within.

Tailo: Tī Bethel ê tuâⁿ, í-ki̍p Nebat ê kiáⁿ Ia-lô-ba-am, hō͘ Isulael huān tsuē ê, só͘ khí ê suaⁿ-thâu biō, taⁿ Io-si-iah huí hit-ê tuâⁿ kah suaⁿ-thâu biō, koh sio i ê suaⁿ-thâu biō, kā i tuî tsò hún, sūn-suà sio hit-ê A-si-lah.
English: Moreover the altar that was at Bethel, and the high place which Jeroboam the son of Nebat, who made Israel to sin, had made, even that altar and the high place he broke down; and he burned the high place and beat it to dust, and burned the Asherah.

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h the̍h tsiah-ê tsò iô-tsè, iô tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng; tse kah só͘ iô ê hing, só͘ kí ê thuí, lóng tsò sìng-mi̍h, kui hō͘ tsè-si, jiân-āu hiàn-sin-tsiá tsiah thang lim tsiú.
English: and the priest shall wave them for a wave offering before Yahweh. This is holy for the priest, together with the breast that is waved and the thigh that is offered. After that the Nazirite may drink wine.

Tailo: Guān lán ê Thiⁿ-pē Siōngtè kah Tsú Iésu Ki-tok, siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín un-tián kah pîng-an!
English: Grace to you and peace from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng sim-lāi siūⁿ kóng, Lí bô beh tui-kiù. I ná ē án-ne biáu-sī Siōngtè?
English: Why does the wicked person condemn God, And say in his heart, God won't call me into account?

Tailo: Lí nā uī-tio̍h tsia̍h-mi̍h ê tāi-tsì, hō͘ lí ê hiann-tī sim-kuann kan-khó͘, lí ê hîng-uî tsiū m̄-sī tshut tī thiàⁿ-sim. Lí m̄-thang uī-tio̍h ka-kī ê tsia̍h-mi̍h lâi pāi-huāi Ki-tok ū thè i sí ê lâng.
English: Yet if because of food your brother is grieved, you walk no longer in love. Don't destroy with your food him for whom Christ died.

Tailo: I î-suá suaⁿ, suaⁿ mā m̄-tsai; I siū-khì tiong, hō͘ suaⁿ pang lo̍h-.khì.
English: Who removes the mountains, and they don't know it, When he overturns them in his anger

Tailo: Siōngtè m̄-sī tiàu lán lâi kuè ù-uè ê sing-ua̍h, sī tiàu lán lâi kuè sìng-kiat ê sing-ua̍h.
English: For God called us not for uncleanness, but in sanctification.

Tailo: Lín ta̍k lâng tuì i ê tshù-piⁿ, ta̍k lâng tuì i ê hiann-tī tio̍h án-ne kóng, ' Siōngtsú ū ìn siáⁿ-mi̍h? Siōngtsú ū kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h? '
English: Thus shall you say everyone to his neighbor, and everyone to his brother, What has Yahweh answered? and, What has Yahweh spoken?

Tailo: Án-ne, lín ê sìn-sim ē-tàng kian-kò͘, tī lán ê Tsú Iésu kah I ê tsìng sìn-tô͘ koh-tsài lâi-lîm ê sî, tī lán ê Thiⁿ-pē Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng, ē-tàng sìng-kiat bô thang hiâm.
English: to the end he may establish your hearts blameless in holiness before our God and Father, at the coming of our Lord Jesus with all his saints.

Tailo: Kiû Lí kiù guá thuat-lī tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng, koh kiù guá thuat-lī ài hāi lâng sèⁿ-miā ê lâng!
English: Deliver me from the workers of iniquity. Save me from the bloodthirsty men.

Tailo: Khì kìⁿ tsè-si Lēbī lâng kah tong-sî ê sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ lâi mn̄g in, in ē kā phuàⁿ-sû tsí-sī lí.
English: and you shall come to the priests the Levites, and to the judge who shall be in those days: and you shall inquire; and they shall show you the sentence of judgment.

Tailo: Lâi khuànn guá ê tshiú, guá ê kha, khak-si̍t sī guá pún-sin. Lín bong tsiū tsai, in-uī kuí bô kut bô bah. Lín bong khuànn, guá lóng ū!
English: See my hands and my feet, that it is truly me. Touch me and see, for a spirit doesn't have flesh and bones, as you see that I have.

Tailo: Guá beh kiû-kiò tsì-kuân Siōngtè, to̍h-sī kā guá sîng-tsuân ta̍k hāng tāi-tsì ê Siōngtè.
English: I cry out to God Most High, To God who accomplishes my requests for me.

Tailo: In sī beh ho̍k-sāi in ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú kah in ê ông Tabi̍t ê, to̍h-sī Guá beh kā in hing-khí ê.
English: but they shall serve Yahweh their God, and David their king, whom I will raise up to them.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Siōngtsú thok tsìng sian-ti kah sian-kiàn, tuì Isulael kah Iôtah tsò kiàn-tsìng, kóng, Tio̍h lī-khui lín ê pháiⁿ só͘ kiâⁿ, tsip-siú Guá ê kài-bīng kah lu̍t-lē, tsiàu Guá huan-hù lín ê tsó͘-sian kah thok Guá ê lô͘-po̍k tsìng sian-ti só͘ thuân hō͘ lín uân-tsuân ê lu̍t-huat.
English: Yet Yahweh testified to Israel, and to Judah, by every prophet, and every seer, saying, Turn you from your evil ways, and keep my commandments and my statutes, according to all the law which I commanded your fathers, and which I sent to you by my servants the prophets.

Tailo: Iésu kā i kóng, Tsit-má teh kah lí kóng-uē ê to̍h-sī.
English: Jesus said to her, I am he, the one who speaks to you.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, guá khui tshuì, I tsiū hō͘ guá tsia̍h hit kńg tsheh.
English: So I opened my mouth, and he caused me to eat the scroll.

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn I ê kuân-lîng ūn-hîng tī lán tsiah-ê sìn-tô͘ tiong-kan, sī tuā kàu siáⁿ-mi̍h thîng-tō͘.
English: and what is the exceeding greatness of his power toward us who believe, according to that working of the strength of his might

Tailo: In tsò-hué kóng, Siáⁿ lâng tsò tsit-ê tāi-tsì? In tsa-mn̄g liáu-āu, tsiū kóng, Tse sī Io-a-si ê kiáⁿ Gîtióng só͘ tsò ê.
English: They said one to another, Who has done this thing? When they inquired and asked, they said, Gideon the son of Joash has done this thing.

Tailo: Iâkop puē-puān Alâm lâng La̍hban thau tsáu-.khì, bô kā i kóng.
English: Jacob deceived Laban the Syrian, in that he didn't tell him that he was running away.

Tailo: Le-ba-nòng ê îng-kng, to̍h-sī siông tshiū, sam tshiū, n̂g-iông tshiū, lóng beh tsò-hué kui lí, uī-tio̍h beh táⁿ-pān Guá ê sìng-só͘; Guá mā beh hō͘ guá kha-ta̍h ê só͘-tsāi tit-tio̍h îng-kng.
English: The glory of Lebanon shall come to you, the fir tree, the pine, and the box tree together, to beautify the place of my sanctuary; and I will make the place of my feet glorious.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā tsit só͘-tsāi ê tsìng lâng kah tsè-si kóng, ' Lín tshit-tsa̍p nî lâi, tī gō͘-.gue̍h, tshit-.gue̍h kìm-tsia̍h pi-ai, kám sī uī-tio̍h Guá, kám uī-tio̍h Guá teh kìm-tsia̍h?
English: Speak to all the people of the land, and to the priests, saying, When you fasted and mourned in the fifth and in the seventh month for these seventy years, did you at all fast to me, really to me?

Tailo: Ài tsò thâu-lâng ê lâng tio̍h tsò lín ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: Whoever desires to be first among you shall be your bondservant,

Tailo: Êlúsalèm lâng, lín tio̍h gia̍h thâu khuànn, tuì pak-hong lâi ê lâng! Tsá-tsîng só͘ hō͘ lí ê iûⁿ-kûn, to̍h-sī lí suí ê iûⁿ-kûn, taⁿ tī tó-uī?
English: Lift up your eyes, and see those who come from the north: where is the flock that was given you, your beautiful flock?

Tailo: I tsiū kā tsi̍t tuì gû tshiat-tsò tsi̍t tè tsi̍t tè, kau-tài sù-tsiá sàng khì-kàu Isulael ê tsuân kíng, kóng, Kiàn-nā bô tshut-lâi kin-tuè Sàulô kah Samuel ê, mā beh án-ne khuán-thāi i ê gû. Siōngtsú hō͘ jîn-bîn khí kiaⁿ, in tsiū hô-tsê lóng tshut-.lâi.
English: He took a yoke of oxen, and cut them in pieces, and sent them throughout all the borders of Israel by the hand of messengers, saying, Whoever doesn't come forth after Saul and after Samuel, so shall it be done to his oxen. The dread of Yahweh fell on the people, and they came out as one man.

Tailo: Tio̍h khiú tsiáu ê siang si̍t, kā i thiah-khui, tsóng-.sī, m̄-thang phuà hō͘ i tn̄g; tsè-si tio̍h kā i sio tī tuâⁿ tíng hué-.ni̍h ê tshâ. Tse sī sio-tsè, hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú tsò phang-phang ê hué-tsè.
English: He shall tear it by its wings, but shall not divide it apart. The priest shall burn it on the altar, on the wood that is on the fire. It is a burnt offering, an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to Yahweh.

Tailo: koh kiû Lí siúⁿ-sù guá ê kiáⁿ Só͘lômóng ū sîng-si̍t ê sim, lâi siú Lí ê bīng-līng, huat-tō͘ kah lu̍t-lē, tsò-tsiâⁿ tsiah-ê só͘-ū ê tāi-tsì, īng guá só͘ tsún-pī ê lâi khí tiān.
English: and give to Solomon my son a perfect heart, to keep your commandments, your testimonies, and your statutes, and to do all these things, and to build the palace, for which I have made provision.

Tailo: Kiû Lí tsiàu Lí ê kong-gī tsín-kiù guá, tháu-pàng guá; kiû Lí àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ guá, lâi kiù guá.
English: Deliver me in your righteousness, and rescue me. Turn your ear to me, and save me.

Tailo: I ê lô͘-po̍k Abulahàm ê kiáⁿ-sun kah I só͘ kíng-suán Iâkop ê kiáⁿ-sun,
English: Remember his marvelous works that he has done; His wonders, and the judgments of his mouth,

Tailo: Só͘-í, guán tshe-phài Iôtah kah Sela̍h, in ē tuì lín kóng-khí kah pue lāi só͘ siá kāng-khuán ê tāi-tsì.
English: We have sent therefore Judas and Silas, who themselves will also tell you the same things by word of mouth.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Siōngtsú ê ji̍t lîm-kàu; hit ji̍t ē ū tsân-jím, thòng-hūn kah tuā siū-khì, hō͘ tsit-ê tē pha-hng, koh tuì hit tiong-kan kā ū tsuē ê lâng tû-bia̍t.
English: Behold, the day of Yahweh comes, cruel, with wrath and fierce anger; to make the land a desolation, and to destroy its sinners out of it.

Tailo: I hông bâi-tsòng tī Utsà ê hn̂g ê ka-kī ê bōng. I ê kiáⁿ Io-si-iah suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: He was buried in his tomb in the garden of Uzza: and Josiah his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Tshit gue̍h kan, ông-tshin Elísiamah ê sun, Nethániah ê kiáⁿ Isimael, tshuā tsa̍p-ê lâng kah i tsò-hué lâi, phah-sí Getália̍h í-ki̍p kah i tī Mi-su-peh ê Iôtah lâng kah Kal-tí-ah lâng.
English: But it happened in the seventh month, that Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, the son of Elishama, of the royal seed came, and ten men with him, and struck Gedaliah, so that he died, and the Jews and the Chaldeans that were with him at Mizpah.

Tailo: Guá beh tuì Siōngtè kóng, m̄-thang tīng guá ū tsuē, tio̍h tsí-sī guá, Lí uī siáⁿ-mi̍h kah guá tsing-piān?
English: I will tell God, Do not condemn me, Show me why you contend with me.

Tailo: Ông tshut-.khì, i ê ka-kuàn lóng tuè i khì, ông lâu tsa̍p-ê pîn-hui kò͘ tshù.
English: The king went forth, and all his household after him. The king left ten women, who were concubines, to keep the house.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k lín tio̍h kìng-uì Siōngtsú, sîng-sim si̍t-ì ho̍k-sāi I, in-uī lín tio̍h ē kì-tit I uī lín só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì ū guā tuā.
English: Only fear Yahweh, and serve him in truth with all your heart; for consider how great things he has done for you.

Tailo: In kng Siōngtsú ê kuī ji̍p-.khì, hē tī i ê só͘-tsāi, to̍h-sī Tabi̍t uī i tah ê pò͘-pênn, Tabi̍t tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng hiàn sio-tsè kah siā-un-tsè.
English: They brought in the ark of Yahweh, and set it in its place, in the midst of the tent that David had pitched for it; and David offered burnt offerings and peace offerings before Yahweh.

Tailo: Iâkop tuì Pa-tàn-a-lâm tńg-.lâi, Siōngtè koh tuì i tshut-hiān, sù-hok hō͘ i.
English: God appeared to Jacob again, when he came from Paddan Aram, and blessed him.

Tailo: kóng: Guá it-tīng bô beh ji̍p-khì guá ê tshù ê pò͘-pênn, mā bô beh tsiuN77 guá ê bîn-tshn̂g;
English: Surely I will not come into the structure of my house, Nor go up into my bed;

Tailo: Lín hō͘ sàn-tshiah lâng ê kè-uē sit-pāi, tsóng-.sī, Siōngtsú ē tsò in pī-lān ê só͘-tsāi.
English: You frustrate the plan of the poor, Because Yahweh is his refuge.

Tailo: Sí-lâng koh-ua̍h mā sī án-ne. Bâi-tsòng lo̍h thô͘ ê jio̍k-thé ē hiú-nuā, koh-ua̍h liáu-āu tsiū tsiâⁿ-tsò bē hiú-nuā.
English: So also is the resurrection of the dead. It is sown in corruption; it is raised in incorruption.

Tailo: Abiiah tsiām-tsiām kiông-sīng, tshuā tsa̍p-sì-ê bó͘, seⁿ jī-tsa̍p jī-ê kiáⁿ, tsa̍p la̍k-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ.
English: But Abijah grew mighty, and took to himself fourteen wives, and became the father of twenty-two sons, and sixteen daughters.

Tailo: Tse to̍h-sī tuì thiⁿ kàng-lo̍h ê piáⁿ, hō͘ lâng tsia̍h liáu bē sí.
English: This is the bread which comes down out of heaven, that anyone may eat of it and not die.

Tailo: Iésu tsiū kóng, Siōngtè kok-tō͘ tshin-tshiūnn siáⁿ-mi̍h? Guá tio̍h īng siáⁿ-mi̍h lâi pí-phīng?
English: He said, What is the Kingdom of God like? To what shall I compare it?

Tailo: Guá ê sim-sîn bat tuì Siōngtsú kóng, Lí sī guá ê Tsú. Lí í-guā, guá bô hok-khì.
English: My soul, you have said to Yahweh, You are my Lord. Apart from you I have no good thing.

Tailo: Sè-hàn ê mā seⁿ kiáⁿ, kā i hō-miâ kiò-tsò Biān-am-mih, to̍h-sī hiān-kim Ammóng lâng ê tsó͘-sian.
English: The younger also bore a son, and called his name Ben Ammi. He is the father of the children of Ammon to this day.

Tailo: M̄-thang tsik-pī lāu lâng, tio̍h tshin-tshiūnn khó͘-khǹg lāu-pē án-ne kā i khuàn-bián; tuì siàu-liân lâng khuàn-bián mā tio̍h tshin-tshiūnn khó͘-khǹg ka-kī ê hiann-tī;
English: Don't rebuke an older man, but exhort him as a father; the younger men as brothers;

Tailo: In tsiū án-ne tī Siōngtè ê pó-tsō tsîng, mê-ji̍t tī I ê sìng-tiān ho̍k-sāi I. Tsē tī pó-tsō ê hit uī ē kah in tông-tsāi lâi pó-siú in.
English: Therefore they are before the throne of God, they serve him day and night in his temple. He who sits on the throne will spread his tent over them.

Tailo: Nā ū lâng kā lí kiû siáⁿ-mi̍h tio̍h hō͘ i; nā ū lâng tshiúⁿ lí ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ, m̄-thang kā i thó tńg-.lâi.
English: Give to everyone who asks you, and don't ask him who takes away your goods to give them back again.

Tailo: Īng hiah-ê huān tsuē hāi ka-kī ê sèⁿ-miā ê lâng ê hiuⁿ-lô͘, tuî-tsò kui-phìⁿ, lâi an tsè-tuâⁿ. In-uī in hiàn tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, só͘-í, sī sìng ê, thang hō͘ Isulael lâng tsò kàm-kài.
English: even the censers of these sinners against their own lives; and let them be made beaten plates for a covering of the altar: for they offered them before Yahweh; therefore they are holy; and they shall be a sign to the children of Israel.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng thau-thau-á tsiap-siū lâng ê o͘-se, ē hō͘ àn-kiāⁿ píng liàn-tńg.
English: A wicked man receives a bribe in secret, To pervert the ways of justice.

Tailo: Tuà tī Ti-bóng ê jîn-bîn, lí tio̍h tuì lí îng-kng ê uī lo̍h-.lâi, tsē tī ta-sò ê tē; in-uī huí-bia̍t Mô͘ap ê khí-lâi kong-kik lí, huí-huāi lí hiah-ê siâⁿ-pó.
English: You daughter who dwells in Dibon, come down from your glory, and sit in thirst; for the destroyer of Moab is come up against you, he has destroyed your strongholds.

Tailo: Iobuh, lí tio̍h àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ guá ê uē, tio̍h tiām-tiām, guá tsiū beh kóng.
English: Mark well, Job, and listen to me: Hold your peace, and I will speak.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê siann hō͘ lo̍k-bú tio̍h-kiaⁿ lâi seⁿ kiáⁿ, mā hō͘ tshiū-nâ ê tshiū-hio̍h lak kah kng-kng. Kiàn-nā tī tiān lāi ê lâng lóng huah kóng, îng-kng kui Siōngtsú!
English: Yahweh's voice makes the deer calve, And strips the forests bare. In his temple everything says, Glory!

Tailo: In ji̍t-ji̍t tshuē Guá, huann-hí tsai Guá ê tō-lō͘, tshin-tshiūnn kiâⁿ gī ê jîn-bîn, bô lī-khui in ê Siōngtè ê lu̍t-huat. In kiû Guá tsiàu kong-gī sím-phuàⁿ, huann-hí tshin-kīn Siōngtè.
English: Yet they seek me daily, and delight to know my ways: as a nation that did righteousness, and didn't forsake the ordinance of their God, they ask of me righteous judgments; they delight to draw near to God.

Tailo: mā uī-tio̍h i lâu bô tsuē ê lâng ê hueh, in-uī i īng bô tsuē ê lâng ê hueh tshiong-muá Êlúsalèm, tsit-ê tsuē Siōngtsú m̄-khíng sià-bián.
English: and also for the innocent blood that he shed; for he filled Jerusalem with innocent blood: and Yahweh would not pardon.

Tailo: Lí hō͘ kuáⁿ-hū khang-tshiú tńg-.khì, ko͘-jî ê tshiú-kut siū at-tn̄g.
English: You have sent widows away empty, And the arms of the fatherless have been broken.

Tailo: Guá ē pàng-lī Guá ê sán-gia̍p só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê, kā in kau tī tuì-ti̍k ê tshiú, in ē tsiâⁿ-tsò in só͘-ū ê tuì-ti̍k só͘ lia̍h só͘ tshiúⁿ ê tuì-siōng,
English: I will cast off the remnant of my inheritance, and deliver them into the hand of their enemies; and they shall become a prey and a spoil to all their enemies;

Tailo: Ioap khì kìⁿ ông kóng, Lí tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? Lí khuàⁿ, Apnel lâi kìnn lí, lí ná ē sàng i khì? Taⁿ i lī-khui khì à!
English: Then Joab came to the king, and said, What have you done? behold, Abner came to you; why is it that you have sent him away, and he is quite gone?

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h īng tsíng-thâu-á ùn hueh, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, tuì sìng-só͘ ê tiùⁿ-lî tsîng, hiù hueh tshit pái.
English: The priest shall dip his finger in the blood, and sprinkle some of the blood seven times before Yahweh, before the veil of the sanctuary.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, guán tsiām-sî kah lín hun-lī, he sī sing-khu ê hun-lī, guán ê sim pīng bô lī-khui lín, guán guā-ni̍h-á pik-tshiat siūⁿ beh koh kah lín kìⁿ-bīn.
English: But we, brothers, being bereaved of you for a short season, in presence, not in heart, tried even harder to see your face with great desire,

Tailo: Tâng tsē-toh ê lâng bô tsi̍t-ê tsai-iáⁿ Iésu ná ē tuì i kóng tsit kù uē.
English: Now no man at the table knew why he said this to him.

Tailo: I nā bô tuì tē-it-ê bó͘ tsīn tsit sann hāng gī-bū, i tsiū thang tsū-iû lī-khui-.khì, bián īng tsînn lâi sio̍k.
English: If he doesn't do these three things for her, she may go free without paying any money.

Tailo: M̄-koh, lín sī lâi-kàu Si-óng suaⁿ, íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōngtè ê siâⁿ, thinn-tíng ê Êlúsalèm, tī hia ū tshing-tshing bān-bān ê thiⁿ-sài.
English: But you have come to Mount Zion, and to the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to innumerable multitudes of angels,

Tailo: koh tsiàu lí só͘ sit-lo̍h ê kun-ping lâi tsio-bō͘ tsi̍t tuī kun-ping, īng bé pó͘ bé, īng tsiàn-tshia pó͘ tsiàn-tshia; lán tī pîng-guân kah in kau-tsiàn, ún-tàng ē iâⁿ. Ông tsiū thiaⁿ in ê uē khì kiâⁿ.
English: and number you an army, like the army that you have lost, horse for horse, and chariot for chariot; and we will fight against them in the plain, and surely we shall be stronger than they. He listened to their voice, and did so.

Tailo: Taⁿ kiû lí sià-bián guá ê tsuē, kah guá tńg-.khì, hō͘ guá thang kìng-pài Siōngtsú.
English: Now therefore, please pardon my sin, and turn again with me, that I may worship Yahweh.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Lín só͘ hē tī tsit-ê siâⁿ lāi ê sí-lâng to̍h-sī bah, tsit-ê siâⁿ to̍h-sī tiánn; tsóng-.sī, lín ē tuì hit tiong-kan hông kuáⁿ tshut-.khì.
English: Therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh: Your slain whom you have laid in the midst of it, they are the flesh, and this city is the caldron; but you shall be brought forth out of the midst of it.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng, to̍h-sī hit só͘-tsāi ê Tsú, kā guán kóng, ' Nā ài hō͘ guá tsai lín sī láu-si̍t lâng, lín hiann-tī tiong tio̍h lâu tsi̍t-ê tī guá tsia, lín tsiah-ê thang tuà ngó͘-kok tńg-.khì, kiù lín tshù lāi ê ki-hng.
English: The man, the lord of the land, said to us, By this I will know that you are honest men: leave one of your brothers with me, and take grain for the famine of your houses, and go your way.

Tailo: Guá Páulô tshin-pit kā lín tshíng-an.
English: This greeting is by me, Paul, with my own hand.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ lín ê tseh-kî piàn-tsò pi-ai, kua-khik lóng piàn-tsò ai-ko, beh hō͘ tsìng lâng io hâ muâ-pò͘, thâu-khak bô puàⁿ-ki mn̂g, koh hō͘ i pi-ai tshin-tshiūnn to̍k-seⁿ kiáⁿ sí-.khì, kàu bué tshin-tshiūnn thòng-khó͘ ê ji̍t-tsí.
English: I will turn your feasts into mourning, And all your songs into lamentation; And I will make you wear sackcloth on all your bodies, And baldness on every head. I will make it like the mourning for an only son, And the end of it like a bitter day.

Tailo: In-uī Lí sī in khuì-la̍t ê îng-kng; Koh in-uī Lí kah-ì guán, guán ê kak tsiū ē-tàng gia̍h kuân.
English: For you are the glory of their strength. In your favor, our horn will be exalted.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Isáiah sian-ti lâi kìnn Hitsekia ông, mn̄g i kóng, Tsiah-ê lâng kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h? In tuì tó-uī lâi kìnn lí? Hitsekia ìn kóng, In tuì hn̄g-hn̄g ê só͘-tsāi, to̍h-sī tuì Babúlông, lâi kìnn guá.
English: Then Isaiah the prophet came to king Hezekiah, and asked him, What did these men say? Where did they come from to you? Hezekiah said, They have come from a country far from me, even from Babylon.

Tailo: Só͘-í, kī-tsua̍t tsit-ê kà-sī, m̄-sī kī-tsua̍t lâng, sī teh kī-tsua̍t siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín Sìng Sîn ê Siōngtè.
English: Therefore he who rejects doesn't reject man, but God, who has also given his Holy Spirit to you.

Tailo: Taⁿ guá ê sim-sîn tī guá ê lāi-bīn ki̍k sit-tsì; huān-lān ê ji̍t-tsí kā guá khîⁿ tiâu-tiâu.
English: Now my soul is poured out within me. Days of affliction have taken hold on me.

Tailo: Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h i uá-kīn kang ê mî-iûⁿ, ǹg i huat tuā siū-khì, tak hit tsiah mî-iûⁿ, phah-tn̄g i nn̄g ki kak. Mî-iûⁿ bô la̍t thang khiā tī i ê bīn-tsîng; i tsiū hō͘ hit tsiah kang mî-iûⁿ tó tī tē-.ni̍h, kā i thún-ta̍h, bô tsi̍t-ê ē-tàng kiù mî-iûⁿ thuat-tshut i ê tshiú.
English: I saw him come close to the ram, and he was moved with anger against him, and struck the ram, and broke his two horns; and there was no power in the ram to stand before him; but he cast him down to the ground, and trampled on him; and there was none who could deliver the ram out of his hand.

Tailo: I kóng, Iô-tá-iah lâng í-king kóng hó-sè, ké-tsò beh koh siông-sè tsa-mn̄g Páulô ê àn-tsîng, ē kiû lí bîn-á-tsài tshuā Páulô khì gī-huē.
English: He said, The Jews have agreed to ask you to bring Paul down to the council tomorrow, as though intending to inquire somewhat more accurately concerning him.

Tailo: I ê kiáⁿ tsiàu ka-kī ê ji̍t-tsí, lûn-liû khì ta̍k-ê hiann-tī ê tshù pâi-siat iàn-si̍k, koh tshe lâng khì tshiánn in saⁿ-ê tsí-muē lâi kah in lim-tsia̍h.
English: His sons went and held a feast in the house of each one on his birthday; and they sent and called for their three sisters to eat and to drink with them.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h īng tsio̍h-bō bō be̍h; tû-khì lí ê phè, thǹg lí ê tn̂g-sann, lō͘-hiān lí ê kha-thuí, liâu kuè khe.
English: Take the millstones, and grind meal; remove your veil, strip off the train, uncover the leg, pass through the rivers.

Tailo: Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lí kóng, lí siàu-liân ê sî ka-kī pa̍k khò͘-tuà, suî-piān khì lí ài khì ê só͘-tsāi; to̍k-to̍k kàu nî lāu ê sî, lí tio̍h tshun tshiú hō͘ lâng kā lí pa̍k, kā lí thua kàu lí bô ài khì ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Most assuredly I tell you, when you were young, you dressed yourself, and walked where you wanted to. But when you are old, you will stretch out your hands, and another will dress you, and carry you where you don't want to go.

Tailo: koh khí Bala̍h kah Só͘lômóng só͘-ū kim-khò͘ ê siâⁿ, kah hē tshia ê siâⁿ, kah bé-ping ê siâⁿ, kah Só͘lômóng tī Êlúsalèm, tī Le-ba-nòng kah tī i só͘ tī-lí ê tsuân tē, uī ka-kī ê khuài-lo̍k só͘ ài khí ê, lóng kā i khí.
English: and Baalath, and all the storage cities that Solomon had, and all the cities for his chariots, and the cities for his horsemen, and all that Solomon desired to build for his pleasure in Jerusalem, and in Lebanon, and in all the land of his dominion.

Tailo: Êlúsalèm lâng kah Iôtah lâng siū lia̍h khì Babúlông, kî-tiong I-é-lí-miah mā hō͘ sī-uē-tiúⁿ lia̍h-.khì, īng thih-liān kā i pa̍k khí-.lâi, āu-lâi tuì La̍h-má pàng i khì, jiân-āu Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah.
English: The word which came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, after that Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard had let him go from Ramah, when he had taken him being bound in chains among all the captives of Jerusalem and Judah, who were carried away captive to Babylon.

Tailo: Kal-tí-ah ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á, lí tio̍h tiām-tiām tsē, ji̍p-khì tī àm-tiong, in-uī lí bô koh hông kiò-tsò lia̍t kok ê tsú-bó.
English: Sit you silent, and get you into darkness, daughter of the Chaldeans; for you shall no more be called The mistress of kingdoms.

Tailo: Siōngtè koh kóng, ' Guá beh sím-phuàⁿ hit-ê hō͘ in tsò lô͘-lē ê kok-ka. Āu-lâi, guá ē hō͘ in tshut-.lâi, tī tsit-ê só͘-tsāi kìng-pài guá. ' (tsù, CSK 15:14)
English: I will judge the nation to which they will be in bondage,' said God, and after that will they come out, and serve me in this place.'

Tailo: Ông ê tuā siū-khì tshin-tshiūnn sai hm̄-hm̄ háu; i ê un-tián tshin-tshiūnn tsháu-tíng ê lō͘-tsuí.
English: The king's wrath is like the roaring of a lion, But his favor is like dew on the grass.

Tailo: I tsiū mn̄g in i ê kiáⁿ sī tang-sî tsiah hó khí-.lâi, in ìn kóng, Tsa-hng ē-po͘ tsi̍t tiám, jia̍t tsiū thè.
English: So he inquired of them the hour when he began to get better. They said therefore to him, Yesterday at the seventh hour, the fever left him.
