Tailo: Taⁿ kóng-kàu tsia, lán beh koh kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h? Siōngtè nā uī lán, siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng kah lán tsò tuì-ti̍k?
English: What then shall we say about these things? If God is for us, who can be against us?

Tailo: ' Tsiap-siū lâng ê o͘-se lâi hāi-sí bô tsuē ê lâng ê tio̍h siū tsiù-tsó͘! ' Jîn-bîn lóng tio̍h kóng, ' A-men! '
English: Cursed be he who takes a bribe to kill an innocent person. All the people shall say, Amen.

Tailo: Mā m̄-thang uī ka-kī tshāi tiau-khik ê thiāu, tse sī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè só͘ uàn-hūn ê.
English: Neither shall you set yourself up a pillar; which Yahweh your God hates.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, I lo̍h im-kan ê hit ji̍t, Guá hō͘ lâng pi-ai. Guá uī-tio̍h i jia-khàm tshim-ian, iok-sok kang-hô, hō͘ tuā-tsuí thîng lâu; Guá mā hō͘ Le-ba-nòng uī-tio̍h i tshiⁿ-tshám, tshân-iá tsiah-ê tshiū lóng in-uī i lâi hūn-.khì.
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh: In the day when he went down to Sheol I caused a mourning: I covered the deep for him, and I restrained the rivers of it; and the great waters were stayed; and I caused Lebanon to mourn for him, and all the trees of the field fainted for him.

Tailo: Hiah-ê ki-lō͘-ping ê si̍t, kiōng tn̂g jī-tsa̍p tiú, tsit-ê ki-lō͘-ping tsi̍t ki si̍t tn̂g gō͘ tiú, tshun-kàu tiān tsit pîng ê piah, hit ki si̍t mā sī gō͘ tiú, tshun-kàu hit-ê ki-lō͘-ping ê si̍t.
English: The wings of the cherubim were twenty cubits long: the wing of the one cherub was five cubits, reaching to the wall of the house; and the other wing was likewise five cubits, reaching to the wing of the other cherub.

Tailo: Aigi̍p ê jîn-bîn lóng ē tsai Guá to̍h-sī Siōngtsú, in-uī in tuì Isulael ê tsú-bîn bat tsò kah-ná lô͘-uí bô la̍t ê kuái-á.
English: All the inhabitants of Egypt will know that I am Yahweh, because they have been a staff of reed to the house of Israel.

Tailo: tíng-bīn hit khing ū té Huâ-láu só͘ tsia̍h ta̍k tsióng piak ê mi̍h, ū tsiáu lâi tok guá thâu-khak tíng khing lāi ê mi̍h.
English: In the uppermost basket there was all kinds of baked food for Pharaoh, and the birds ate them out of the basket on my head.

Tailo: M̄-koh, guá kā lín kóng, nā ū lâng sim tsûn siâ-io̍k lâi khuànn hū-jîn-lâng, i tī sim-lāi í-king kah i huān kan-îm ā.
English: but I tell you that everyone who gazes at a woman to lust after her has committed adultery with her already in his heart.

Tailo: Lán tsiah-ê sìn ê lâng, ē-tàng tsìn-ji̍p Siōngtè só͘ siúⁿ-sù ê an-hioh. Tsiàu I só͘ kóng, guá tsiū tī siū-khì tiong tsiù-tsuā kóng, In tsua̍t-tuì bē-tàng tsìn-ji̍p guá ê an-hioh. (tsù, SPh 95:11) kî-si̍t Siōngtè tī tshòng-tsō ú-tiū ê sî, I ê kang-tsok í-king uân-sîng.
English: For we who have believed do enter into that rest, even as he has said, As I swore in my wrath, they will not enter into my rest; although the works were finished from the foundation of the world.

Tailo: Tsiū thâi hit tsiah mî-iûnn-káng, Mô͘se īng hueh hiù tī tuâⁿ tíng ê sì-kho͘-uî.
English: He killed it; and Moses sprinkled the blood on the altar round about.

Tailo: Iâkop tuì La̍hban kóng, Ji̍t-kî í-king muá, kiû lí kā guá ê bó͘ hō͘ guá, guá thang kah i tâng-pâng.
English: Jacob said to Laban, Give me my wife, for my days are fulfilled, that I may go in to her.

Tailo: Sìng-só͘ ê lāi-bīn só͘-ū ê tiau-khik, in tsit-má īng pó͘-thâu kah thuî kā in tsuân-pō͘ phò-huāi.
English: Now all its carved work They break down with hatchet and hammers.

Tailo: Án-ne, lín tsiū ín-tsún i m̄-bián hō͘ i ê lāu-pē á-.sī lāu-bú hû-ióng-kim.
English: then you no longer allow him to do anything for his father or his mother,

Tailo: Hapsená hiah-ê kiáⁿ khí-tsō Hî-mn̂g; hē i ê înn, an i ê mn̂g-sìⁿ kah i ê só, i ê mn̂g-tshuàⁿ.
English: The fish gate did the sons of Hassenaah build; they laid the beams of it, and set up the doors of it, the bolts of it, and the bars of it.

Tailo: Siâⁿ lāi ê jîn-bîn kā Elísiah kóng, Tshiáⁿ lí khuànn tsit-ê siâⁿ ê tē-tiám sī hó, tsiàu guá ê tsú só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê; tsóng-.sī, tsuí pháiⁿ, tì-sú thó͘-tē bô tshut-sán.
English: The men of the city said to Elisha, Behold, we pray you, the situation of this city is pleasant, as my lord sees: but the water is bad, and the land miscarries.

Tailo: Siōngtsú sī ua̍h ê, guān guá ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ tit-tio̍h o-ló, guān Siōngtsú, to̍h-sī kiù guá ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ ê, tit-tio̍h tsun-tsò kuân!
English: Yahweh lives; Blessed be my rock; Exalted be God, the rock of my salvation,

Tailo: koh tī Tsik-lak, Me-ko-nah kah i ê tsng-thâu;
English: and in Ziklag, and in Meconah and in the towns of it,

Tailo: Lí khí-.lâi, khì Ni-ne-beh hit-ê tuā siâⁿ, tshut siaⁿ kā in kíng-kài, in-uī in ê tsuē-ok thàu kàu Guá ê bīn-tsîng.
English: Arise, go to Nineveh, that great city, and preach against it, for their wickedness has come up before me.

Tailo: Iésu tsiū kā hit-ê lâng kóng, Khí-.lâi, tsò lí tńg-.khì, lí ê sìn-sim hō͘ lí tit-tio̍h i hó à.
English: Then he said to him, Get up, and go your way. Your faith has healed you.

Tailo: Án-ne tsiah bián hō͘ Satán iâⁿ-kuè lán, in-uī lán tsin tshing-tshó Satán ê kuí-kè.
English: that no advantage may be gained over us by Satan; for we are not ignorant of his schemes.

Tailo: In hiah-ê lâng siū pa̍k, iû-guân tshīng khò͘, phâu kah lāi-saⁿ, í-ki̍p kî-tha ê saⁿ, hông hiat lo̍h-khì iām-jua̍h ê hué-lô͘.
English: Then these men were bound in their pants, their tunics, and their mantles, and their other garments, and were cast into the midst of the burning fiery furnace.

Tailo: Án-ne, Iô-sa-huat ê kok thài-pîng, in-uī i ê Siōngtè siúⁿ-sù i sì-kho͘-uî pîng-an.
English: So the realm of Jehoshaphat was quiet; for his God gave him rest round about.

Tailo: [tsùn-lâm] Guá ê sió-muē, guá ê ài-jîn-á, guá ji̍p-khì guá ê hn̂g lāi, bán guá ê bu̍t-io̍h kah guá ê phang-liāu, tsia̍h guá ê bi̍t-pâng kah guá ê bi̍t; lim guá ê tsiú kah guá ê ling. [tsìng tsa-bó͘ gín-á] Pîng-iú, lâi tsia̍h! Lông-kun, lâi lim, koh lim tsin tsē!
English: I have come into my garden, my sister, my bride. I have gathered my myrrh with my spice; I have eaten my honeycomb with my honey; I have drunk my wine with my milk. Friends Eat, friends! Drink, yes, drink abundantly, beloved. Beloved

Tailo: Tē ê tsio̍h-khòng tiong ū nâ-pó-tsio̍h, i mā ū kim-sua.
English: Sapphires come from its rocks. It has dust of gold.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kā ka-kī sé tshing-khì, tuì Guá ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng tû-khì lín só͘ kiâⁿ ê pháiⁿ, thîng-tsí lín ê tsò pháiⁿ!
English: Wash yourselves, make yourself clean. Put away the evil of your doings from before my eyes; Cease to do evil.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, Iô-tá-iah lâng tsiū hō͘-siong tsing-lūn, kóng, Tsit-ê lâng ná ē īng I ê bah hō͘ lán tsia̍h?
English: The Jews therefore contended with one another, saying, How can this man give us his flesh to eat?

Tailo: Hiah-ê ki kah hiah-ê hue lóng kah i liân tsò tsi̍t-ê, lóng īng sûn-kim, tsiàu phah ê hong-huat lâi tsò.
English: Their buds and their branches were of one piece with it. The whole thing was one beaten work of pure gold.

Tailo: Só͘ thiàⁿ ê hiann-tī tsí-muē! Guán suî-jiân án-ne kóng, m̄-koh, guán khak-sìn lín ê tsîng-hîng pí guán só͘ kóng ê khah hó, lín ē-tàng tit-kiù.
English: But, beloved, we are persuaded of better things for you, and things that accompany salvation, even though we speak like this.

Tailo: Iā phê-á ê tuì-ti̍k, to̍h-sī tsí Mô͘-kuí; siu-sîng ê sî sī tsí kim-sè ê bua̍t-ji̍t, siu-kuah ê to̍h-sī tsí thiⁿ-sài.
English: The enemy who sowed them is the devil. The harvest is the end of the age, and the reapers are angels.

Tailo: In tuì suaⁿ-niá kah suaⁿ-giâm huah, Tó lo̍h-lâi kā guán khàm-.leh, hō͘ guán thang siám-phiah hit uī tsē tī pó-tsō ê bīn kah iûⁿ-ko ê siū-khì.
English: They told the mountains and the rocks, Fall on us, and hide us from the face of him who sits on the throne, and from the wrath of the Lamb,

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, lín sio̍k tī bô, lín ê só͘ tsò sio̍k tī khang-khang; hit-ê kíng-suán lín ê sī khó-ò͘ⁿ ê.
English: Behold, you are of nothing, And your work is of nothing. He who chooses you is an abomination.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h ho̍k-tsiông tsiáng-kuân-tsiá, m̄-nā uī-tio̍h kiaⁿ Siōngtè siū-khì, mā sī uī-tio̍h liông-sim ê iân-kò͘.
English: Therefore you need to be in subjection, not only because of the wrath, but also for conscience' sake.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h beh sím-phuàⁿ I ê tsú-bîn, I ē kiò tíng-bīn ê thiⁿ kah tē lâi tsò-tsìng.
English: He calls to the heavens above, To the earth, that he may judge his people:

Tailo: Tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè ê gû-káng kah sio̍k-tsuē-tsè ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ, in ê hueh í-king tuà ji̍p-khì sìng-só͘ sio̍k-tsuē, in ê sing-khu tio̍h tuà tshut-khì iâⁿ guā, īng hué sio in ê phuê, in ê bah, in ê sái.
English: The bull for the sin offering, and the goat for the sin offering, whose blood was brought in to make atonement in the Holy Place, shall be carried forth outside the camp; and they shall burn their skins, their flesh, and their dung with fire.

Tailo: Ki-tok uī lán hi-sing sèⁿ-miā, lán tsiū tuì án-ne tsai-iáⁿ siáⁿ-mi̍h sī thiàⁿ-sim. Lán mā ing-kai uī-tio̍h hiaⁿ-tī á-.sī tsí-muē hi-sing sèⁿ-miā.
English: By this we know love, because he laid down his life for us. And we ought to lay down our lives for the brothers.

Tailo: Koh tuì Iôtah hiah-ê siâⁿ tshuā hiah-ê tsè-si tshut-.khì, kā tsè-si sio hiuⁿ ê suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ uè lah-sap, tuì Ge-bah kàu Bel-sí-bah, mā thiah-huí hiah-ê mn̂g ê suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ, to̍h-sī tī kuán-siâⁿ ê Iosiúah ê mn̂g tsîng, to̍h-sī lâng ji̍p siâⁿ mn̂g ê tò pîng.
English: He brought all the priests out of the cities of Judah, and defiled the high places where the priests had burned incense, from Geba to Beersheba; and he broke down the high places of the gates that were at the entrance of the gate of Joshua the governor of the city, which were on a man's left hand at the gate of the city.

Tailo: Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k tshe lâng khì kìⁿ Isulael ông, kóng, Lí tio̍h kín-sīn, m̄-thang tuì bó͘ só͘-tsāi king-kuè, in-uī Alâm lâng lo̍h-lâi tī hia.
English: The man of God sent to the king of Israel, saying, Beware that you not pass such a place; for there the Syrians are coming down.

Tailo: In-uī in kam-sim hiàn, jîn-bîn lóng huann-hí, in-uī in tsīn-sim hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú, Tabi̍t ông mā tuā huann-hí kàu-ki̍k.
English: Then the people rejoiced, because they offered willingly, because with a perfect heart they offered willingly to Yahweh: and David the king also rejoiced with great joy.

Tailo: Lí ê kok lîm-kàu. Lí ê tsí-ì tit tsiâⁿ, tī tē-.ni̍h tshin-tshiūnn tī thiⁿ-.ni̍h.
English: Let your Kingdom come. Let your will be done, as in heaven, so on earth.

Tailo: Guā-īⁿ ǹg pak ê mn̂g, i niû i ê tn̂g-khuah.
English: The gate of the outer court whose prospect is toward the north, he measured the length of it and the breadth of it.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tī tsi̍t ji̍t ê tiong-kan, i ê tsai-hō ē lóng kàu, ū sí-bông, pi-ai, ki-hng. I mā ē hō͘ hué sio bia̍t, in-uī sím-phuàⁿ i ê Tsú — Siōngtè ū tuā khuì-la̍t.
English: Therefore in one day her plagues will come: death, mourning, and famine; and she will be utterly burned with fire; for the Lord God who has judged her is strong.

Tailo: Ahatsiah bih tī Sa-má-lī-a, E-hú teh tshuē i, lâng kā i lia̍h-.lâi, ah i lâi-kàu E-hú hia, tsiū kā i thâi-sí, lâng kā i bâi-tsòng; in-uī in kóng, i sī hit-ê tsuan-sim tsáu-tshuē Siōngtsú ê Iô-sa-huat ê kiáⁿ. Án-ne, Ahatsiah ê ke tsiū bô ū kuân-li̍k thang pó-siú kok-uī ê.
English: He sought Ahaziah, and they caught him (now he was hiding in Samaria), and they brought him to Jehu, and killed him; and they buried him, for they said, He is the son of Jehoshaphat, who sought Yahweh with all his heart. The house of Ahaziah had no power to hold the kingdom.

Tailo: Thang pò-ìng guā-pang, hîng-hua̍t lia̍t kok.
English: To execute vengeance on the nations, And punishments on the peoples;

Tailo: Guá tsá-tsîng hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ-tio̍h Lí, taⁿ guá ê ba̍k-tsiu khuàⁿ-tio̍h Lí;
English: I had heard of you by the hearing of the ear, But now my eye sees you.

Tailo: Guá ê sim nā hō͘ tsa-bó͘ lâng ín-iú khì, á-.sī guá bih tī tshù-piⁿ ê mn̂g teh tán tsa-bó͘ lâng,
English: If my heart has been enticed to a woman, And I have laid wait at my neighbor's door;

Tailo: Tsio̍h-thâu tāng, sua mā sī án-ne; gōng lâng ê siū-khì pí tsit nn̄g hāng khah tāng.
English: A stone is heavy, And sand is a burden; But a fool's provocation is heavier than both.

Tailo: Tī tshiū-nâ lāi tshin-tshiūnn lî teh háu; tī tshì-phè kha teh tshun-ûn.
English: Among the bushes they bray; And under the nettles they are gathered together.

Tailo: Kìng-uì Siōngtsú sī tì-sik ê kin-pún; gû-gōng ê lâng biáu-sī tì-huī kah kà-sī.
English: The fear of Yahweh is the beginning of knowledge; But the foolish despise wisdom and instruction.

Tailo: Lín ū tsi̍t sî kah Siōngtè keh-tn̄g kuan-hē, sim-lāi kah I tuì-ti̍k, tsò pháiⁿ tāi-tsì.
English: You, being in past times alienated and enemies in your mind in your evil works,

Tailo: Kî-tha ê lâng lia̍h i ê lô͘-po̍k lâi lîng-jio̍k, kā in thâi-sí.
English: and the rest grabbed his servants, and treated them shamefully, and killed them.

Tailo: Kî-tiong iong-ping, tshin-tshiūnn tiâu lāi puî ê gû-á, in ua̍t tńg-sin tsò tsi̍t-ē tô-tsáu, khiā bē-tiâu; in-uī in tú-tio̍h huān-lān ê ji̍t, siū hîng-hua̍t ê sî í-king kàu à.
English: Also her hired men in the midst of her are like calves of the stall; for they also are turned back, they are fled away together, they didn't stand: for the day of their calamity is come on them, the time of their visitation.

Tailo: Hō͘ ho̍k-sāi Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k tit-tio̍h tshiong-hun ê tsong-pī, thang tsò ta̍k tsióng ê hó sū.
English: that the man of God may be complete, thoroughly equipped for every good work.

Tailo: Guá beh kā La̍h-hap kah Babúlông sǹg tī bat guá ê bîn-tso̍k lāi-bīn; lí khuàⁿ, Huilīsū, Tulô kah Kú-si̍t lóng tī Si-óng tsia tshut-sì.
English: I will record Rahab and Babylon among those who acknowledge me. Behold, Philistia, Tyre, and also Ethiopia: This one was born there.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Lín tio̍h kín-sīn, m̄-thang hō͘ lâng kā lín bê-hi̍k.
English: Jesus, answering, began to tell them, Be careful that no one leads you astray.

Tailo: Ho͘-tiàu lín ê sī sìn-si̍t ê Siōngtè, I it-tīng ē tsiàu án-ne kā lín sîng-tsuân.
English: Faithful is he who calls you, who will also do it.

Tailo: Hit sî, ū tsi̍t-ê Tso-lah lâng, sī Tàn ê tso̍k, miâ kiò-tsò Manouah, i ê bó͘ bô huâi-īn, bô seⁿ.
English: There was a certain man of Zorah, of the family of the Danites, whose name was Manoah; and his wife was barren, and didn't bear.

Tailo: Ki-tok kah Mô͘-kuí ná ē-tàng hô-hó? Sìn kah bô sìn ê lâng ū siáⁿ-mi̍h kiōng thong ê só͘-tsāi?
English: What agreement has Christ with Belial? Or what portion has a believer with an unbeliever?

Tailo: I kā guá kóng, Keh-khui ê só͘-tsāi ê thâu-tsîng, tsiah-ê pak pîng ê pâng, lâm pîng ê pâng lóng sī sìng ê pâng; tshin-kīn Siōngtsú ê tsè-si ē tī hia tsia̍h tsì-sìng ê mi̍h, mā īng tsì-sìng ê mi̍h, to̍h-sī sò͘-tsè, sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, pó͘ kuè-si̍t ê tsè, hē tī hit só͘-tsāi, in-uī tsit só͘-tsāi sī sìng.
English: Then said he to me, The north chambers and the south chambers, which are before the separate place, they are the holy chambers, where the priests who are near to Yahweh shall eat the most holy things: there shall they lay the most holy things, and the meal offering, and the sin offering, and the trespass offering; for the place is holy.

Tailo: Tsiū-sī ing-tsiáu tī khong-tiong ê lō͘, tsuâ tī tsio̍h-puâⁿ tíng ê lō͘, tsûn tī hái tiong ê lō͘, lâm kak lú kau-ha̍p ê lō͘.
English: The way of an eagle in the air; The way of a serpent on a rock; The way of a ship in the midst of the sea; And the way of a man with a maiden.

Tailo: Siōngtsú siū-khì Isulael ê lâng, kā in kau tī tshiúⁿ-lia̍h in ê lâng ê tshiú, in tsiū kā in tshiúⁿ, I koh kā in bē hō͘ sì-kho͘-uî tuì-ti̍k ê tshiú, tì-sú in tī tuì-ti̍k ê thâu-tsîng bô koh khiā ē tiâu.
English: The anger of Yahweh was kindled against Israel, and he delivered them into the hands of spoilers who despoiled them; and he sold them into the hands of their enemies round about, so that they could not any longer stand before their enemies.

Tailo: Tsit-ê beh kóng: Guá sī sio̍k Siōngtsú ê; hit-ê beh īng Iâkop ê miâ ka-kī tshing-ho͘, koh ū tsit-ê beh tshin-tshiú siá: Kui tī Siōngtsú ê, mā beh īng Isulael ê miâ tshing-ho͘ ka-kī.
English: One shall say, I am Yahweh's; and another shall call himself by the name of Jacob; and another shall subscribe with his hand to Yahweh, and surname himself by the name of Israel.

Tailo: Guá ê sim, lí ná ē ut-tsut? Sī án-tsuáⁿ tī guá ê lāi-bīn teh tio̍h-kip? Lí tio̍h gióng-bōng Siōngtsú, in-uī guá iáu-koh beh o-ló I. I sī guá ê bīn ê îng-kng, guá ê Siōngtè.
English: Why are you in despair, my soul? Why are you disturbed within me? Hope in God! For I shall still praise him: My Savior, my helper, and my God.

Tailo: Lín it-tīng bat thiaⁿ-kuè Siōngtè uī-tio̍h lín ê iân-kò͘, siúⁿ-sù un-tián hō͘ guá tsit-ê tsit-bū.
English: if it is so that you have heard of the administration of that grace of God which was given me toward you;

Tailo: M̄-koh, Piattò͘ khiā tī mn̂g guā, hit-ê kah tuā-tsè-si ū si̍k-sāi ê bûn-tô͘ tshut-khì kā kò͘-mn̂g ê tsa-bó͘ lâng kóng tsi̍t-siaⁿ, tsiū tshuā Piattò͘ ji̍p-.khì.
English: but Peter was standing at the door outside. So the other disciple, who was known to the high priest, went out and spoke to her who kept the door, and brought in Peter.

Tailo: Thau iúⁿ-.lâi ê tsuí sī tinn ê; thau-tsia̍h ê piáⁿ khah ū tsu-bī.
English: Stolen water is sweet. Food eaten in secret is pleasant.

Tailo: Guá ka-kī mā m̄-bat I, to̍k-to̍k guá lâi īng tsuí kā lâng sé-lé, sī beh hō͘ Isulael lâng jīn-bat I.
English: I didn't know him, but for this reason I came baptizing in water: that he would be revealed to Israel.

Tailo: Lí bat uī ka-kī kiàn-li̍p Lí ê tsú-bîn — Isulael íng-uán tsò Lí ê tsú-bîn; Siōngtsú ah, Lí mā tsò in ê Siōngtè.
English: You did establish to yourself your people Israel to be a people to you forever; and you, Yahweh, became their God.

Tailo: Tsò tiōng-hu ê, tio̍h thiàⁿ lín ê hū-jîn-lâng, tshin-tshiūnn Ki-tok thiàⁿ kàu-huē, mā uī-tio̍h kàu-huē hi-sing ka-kī.
English: Husbands, love your wives, even as Christ also loved the assembly, and gave himself up for it;

Tailo: Uá-kīn Asel ê tē-kài, tuì tang kàu sai, Náhuthalím tsi-tso̍k tsi̍t hūn.
English: By the border of Asher, from the east side even to the west side, Naphtali, one portion.

Tailo: Tshuā in ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tsò bó͘, mā kā tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ kè hō͘ in ê kiáⁿ, suah ho̍k-sāi in hiah-ê sîn-bîng.
English: and they took their daughters to be their wives, and gave their own daughters to their sons and served their gods.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guān Siōngtè kóng-uē, koh khui I ê tshuì kā lí piān-pok;
English: But oh that God would speak, And open his lips against you,

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h īng tsíng-thâu-á the̍h tām-po̍h sio̍k-tsuē-tsè ê hueh, buah tī sio-tsè ê tuâⁿ hiah-ê kak, kā hueh piàⁿ tī sio-tsè ê tuâⁿ-kha.
English: The priest shall take some of the blood of the sin offering with his finger, and put it on the horns of the altar of burnt offering. He shall pour out the rest of its blood at the base of the altar of burnt offering.

Tailo: In kiû-kiò, mā bô lâng kiù in; to̍h-sī kiû-kiò Siōngtsú, I mā bô ìn.
English: They cried, but there was none to save; Even to Yahweh, but he didn't answer them.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê lâng to̍h-sī Siōngtsú só͘ bīng-līng tī Ka-nân tē kā sán-gia̍p pun hō͘ Isulael lâng ê.
English: These are they whom Yahweh commanded to divide the inheritance to the children of Israel in the land of Canaan.

Tailo: tsun-thàn Siōngtsú tī Isulael ê thâu-tsîng só͘ kuáⁿ-tshut ê guā-pang lâng kah Isulael lia̍t ông só͘ siat ê kui-lē.
English: and walked in the statutes of the nations, whom Yahweh cast out from before the children of Israel, and of the kings of Israel, which they made.

Tailo: In tio̍h īng tsô-kia̍p tshâ tsò tsi̍t-ê kuī, tn̂g nn̄g tiú puàⁿ, khuah tiú puàⁿ, kuân tiú puàⁿ.
English: They shall make an ark of acacia wood. Its length shall be two and a half cubits, its breadth a cubit and a half, and a cubit and a half its height.

Tailo: Guá kám tio̍h koh kóng? Guá bô sî-kan thang thê-khí Gîtióng, Ba-la̍k, Sâmsóng, I-é-hú-thah, Tabi̍t, Samuel kah tsìng sian-ti ê tāi-tsì.
English: What more shall I say? For the time would fail me if I told of Gideon, Barak, Samson, Jephthah, David, Samuel, and the prophets;

Tailo: Iésu tuì in kóng, Lâng ná ē kóng Ki-tok sī Tabi̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun?
English: He said to them, Why do they say that the Christ is David's son?

Tailo: Muí pak tiùⁿ tio̍h tn̂g jī-tsa̍p peh tiú, khuah sì tiú, tiùⁿ lóng tio̍h sio-siâng ê tshùn-tshioh.
English: The length of each curtain shall be twenty-eight cubits, and the breadth of each curtain four cubits: all the curtains shall have one measure.

Tailo: Tio̍h thiaⁿ kà-sī, tsiū ē tit-tio̍h tì-huī, m̄-thang khì-tsua̍t guá ê kà-sī.
English: Hear instruction, and be wise. Don't refuse it.

Tailo: Ki-tok tī si̍p-jī-kè tíng tshin-sin tam-tng lán ê tsuē, hō͘ lán thuat-lī tsuē ê sí-bông, kui-ǹg kong-gī lâi ua̍h. Lín tuì I ê siong-hûn tit-tio̍h i hó.
English: who his own self bore our sins in his body on the tree, that we, having died to sins, might live to righteousness; by whose stripes you were healed.

Tailo: Lín mā tshin-tshiūnn án-ne, lín tsò uân siū kau-tài ê tāi-tsì, tio̍h kóng, ' Guán sī bô lō͘-īng ê lô͘-po̍k, kan-tāⁿ tsīn pún-hūn khì tsò niā-niā. '
English: Even so you also, when you have done all the things that are commanded you, say, We are unworthy servants. We have done our duty.'

Tailo: Taⁿ tsiah-ê lâng lia̍h guá tsò in ê kua-khik, tsò in ê uē-pèⁿ.
English: Now I have become their song. Yes, I am a byword to them.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h huan-hù huē-tsiòng, tuì in kóng, ' Lín tio̍h lī-khui Khóla̍h, Ta-than kah Amí-lâm ê pò͘-pênn ê sì-kho͘-uî. '
English: Speak to the congregation, saying, Get away from around the tent of Korah, Dathan, and Abiram.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tsing-seⁿ ê tiong-kan thâu-tsuí seⁿ ê, bô-lūn sī gû sī iûⁿ, nā í-king kui Siōngtsú tsò thâu-tsuí seⁿ ê, lâng m̄-thang koh kā i hun-pia̍t tsò sìng, in-uī tse pún-lâi to̍h sī Siōngtsú ê.
English: Only the firstborn among animals, which is made a firstborn to Yahweh, no man may dedicate it; whether an ox or sheep, it is Yahweh's.

Tailo: In sī sî iáu-buē kàu to̍h siū siau-bia̍t, in ê tē-ki hō͘ tuā-tsuí lâu-.khì.
English: Who were snatched away before their time, Whose foundation was poured out as a stream,

Tailo: Taⁿ guá ê tsú só͘ kóng ê sió-be̍h, tuā-be̍h, iû, tsiú, guān ē-tàng sūn-sū ūn lâi hō͘ tsiah-ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: Now therefore the wheat and the barley, the oil and the wine, which my lord has spoken of, let him send to his servants:

Tailo: Iésu koh mn̄g in kóng, Á lín lè? Lín kóng guá sī siáⁿ lâng? Piattò͘ ìn kóng, Lí sī Ki-tok.
English: He said to them, But who do you say that I am? Peter answered, You are the Christ.

Tailo: Guá sī Páulô, hōng Siōngtè ê tsí-ì siū-tiàu, tsò Iésu Ki-tok ê sù-tô͘. Guá kah hiann-tī Só͘-su-sián-neh,
English: Paul, called to be an apostle of Jesus Christ through the will of God, and our brother Sosthenes,

Tailo: mā bô koh in-uī ngó͘-siōng kah khó-ò͘ⁿ ê mi̍h, í-ki̍p it-tshè ê tsuē-kò, kā pún-sin uè lah-sap. Guá beh kiù in thuat-tshut in só͘-ū tuà ê só͘-tsāi, to̍h-sī in huān tsuē hia; Guá beh kā in tshing-khì; án-ne, in ē tsò Guá ê tsú-bîn; Guá beh tsò in ê Siōngtè.
English: neither shall they defile themselves any more with their idols, nor with their detestable things, nor with any of their transgressions; but I will save them out of all their dwelling places, in which they have sinned, and will cleanse them: so shall they be my people, and I will be their God.

Tailo: M̄-koh, lín khuànn-khin sàn-tshiah lâng. Kî-si̍t, kā lín khi-ap koh thua lín khì huat-tîng ê, kám m̄-sī hiah-ê hó-gia̍h lâng?
English: But you have dishonored the poor man. Don't the rich oppress you, and personally drag you before the courts?

Tailo: Guá ê jîn-bîn, tio̍h hâ muâ-pò͘, kō tī hué-hu tiong. Tio̍h pi-siong, tshin-tshiūnn sòng-sit to̍k-seⁿ kiáⁿ, thòng-sim thî-khàu, in-uī tsân-sat ê ē hut-jiân lâi-kàu lán tiong-kan.
English: Daughter of my people, gird you with sackcloth, and wallow yourself in ashes: make you mourning, as for an only son, most bitter lamentation; for the destroyer shall suddenly come on us.

Tailo: Iésu sī kóng La̍h-tsa-lō͘ í-king sí-.khì, m̄-koh, in lia̍h-tsún sī kóng i tsin-tsiàⁿ teh khùn.
English: Now Jesus had spoken of his death, but they thought that he spoke of taking rest in sleep.

Tailo: Tī Siōngtsú ê tiān lāi khí kuí-nā-ê tuâⁿ, Siōngtsú bat kí tsit-ê tiān, kóng, Guá ē kā Guá ê miâ an-tì tī Êlúsalèm.
English: He built altars in the house of Yahweh, of which Yahweh said, In Jerusalem will I put my name.

Tailo: I tio̍h īng hit tsiah tsiáu ê hueh, ua̍h-tsuí, ua̍h-tsiáu, pik-hiuⁿ tshâ, gû-tshik-tsháu kah tsu-âng sik liāu, lâi tshing-khì hit king tshù.
English: He shall cleanse the house with the blood of the bird, and with the running water, with the living bird, with the cedar wood, with the hyssop, and with the scarlet;

Tailo: Tsiú mā tio̍h sì-hūn tsi-it hin lâi tsò kuàn-tiān, bô-lūn sio-tsè á-.sī pa̍t tsióng tsè, lóng tio̍h án-ne lâi hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú.
English: and wine for the drink offering, the fourth part of a hin, shall you prepare with the burnt offering, or for the sacrifice, for each lamb.

Tailo: Tio̍h īng tsi̍t tiâu nâ-sik ê iù-tuà, kā i pa̍k tī bō-á tíng, to̍h-sī tī bō-á ê thâu-tsîng.
English: You shall put it on a lace of blue, and it shall be on the sash; on the front of the sash it shall be.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, Asiul ông Senahkhelip kah i ê kun-tuī kong-kik La̍hkisih ê sî, tsiū tshe i ê lô͘-po̍k kàu Êlúsalèm kìnn Iôtah ông Hitsekia kah só͘-ū tī Êlúsalèm ê Iôtah lâng, kóng,
English: After this did Sennacherib king of Assyria send his servants to Jerusalem, (now he was before Lachish, and all his power with him), to Hezekiah king of Judah, and to all Judah who were at Jerusalem, saying,

Tailo: Guá mā tshin-tshiūnn bô thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâng, tshuì mā bô ìn-tap.
English: Yes, I am as a man who doesn't hear, In whose mouth are no reproofs.

Tailo: Guá sī Páulô, tsò Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k kah Iésu Ki-tok ê sù-tô͘, siū suán-tiàu lâi pang-tsān Siōngtè ê suán-bîn ê sìn-gióng, ín-tshuā in lâi bat lán ê sìn-gióng só͘ kà-sī ê tsin-lí.
English: Paul, a servant of God, and an apostle of Jesus Christ, according to the faith of God's chosen ones, and the knowledge of the truth which is according to godliness,

Tailo: Tuâⁿ mā phuà-li̍h, tuâⁿ tíng ê hué-hu mā piàⁿ lo̍h-.lâi, tú tsiàu Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k tsun-thàn Siōngtsú ê uē só͘ kóng-tshut ê tiāu-thâu.
English: The altar also was torn, and the ashes poured out from the altar, according to the sign which the man of God had given by the word of Yahweh.

Tailo: Taⁿ guá bô tsu-keh koh tsò lí ê kiáⁿ. Tshiánn hō͘ guá tsò lí ê tn̂g-kang to̍h hó. '
English: I am no more worthy to be called your son. Make me as one of your hired servants.'

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, hiah-ê sian-ti tuì i ê tâng-phuāⁿ thau-the̍h Guá ê uē ê, Guá lâi kā in kong-kik.
English: Therefore, behold, I am against the prophets, says Yahweh, who steal my words everyone from his neighbor.

Tailo: Lín khuàⁿ-tio̍h thàu lâm-hong ê sî, lín tsiū kóng, ' Beh sio-jua̍h ā', tsiū tsin-tsiàⁿ sio-jua̍h khí-.lâi.
English: When a south wind blows, you say, There will be a scorching heat,' and it happens.

Tailo: Tse-lú-iah ê kiáⁿ Ioap khai-sí kā i tiám-sǹg, tsóng-.sī, tuì tsit-ê tāi-tsì ū Siōngtsú ê siū-khì kàu tī Isulael, só͘-í, bô sǹg kàu suah-bué, i ê sò͘-gia̍h mā bô kì tī Tabi̍t ông ê li̍k-tāi tsì-lio̍k.
English: Joab the son of Zeruiah began to number, but didn't finish; and there came wrath for this on Israel; neither was the number put into the account in the chronicles of king David.

Tailo: Tshin-ài ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, guá tsá to̍h it-ti̍t siūⁿ beh siá phue hō͘ lín, lâi tâm-lūn lán lóng ū-hūn ê tsín-kiù. Taⁿ guá kám-kak tsin su-iàu siá phue lâi kā lín kó͘-lē, lín tio̍h uī Siōngtè tsi̍t pái to̍h uân-tsíng thuân hō͘ sìn-tô͘ ê sìn-gióng-lâi hùn-tàu.
English: Beloved, while I was very eager to write to you about our common salvation, I was constrained to write to you exhorting you to contend earnestly for the faith which was once for all delivered to the saints.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê uē si̍t-tsāi kóng liáu tsin tio̍h. Guá ài lí ti̍k-pia̍t kiông-tiāu tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, thang hō͘ sìn Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k tsuan-sim tsò hó sū. Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì lóng sī hó, koh tuì lâng ū lī-ik.
English: This saying is faithful, and concerning these things I desire that you affirm confidently, so that those who have believed God may be careful to maintain good works. These things are good and profitable to men;

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, lí í-king kiânn tsit-ê tāi-tsì, bô lâu lí ê kiáⁿ, to̍h-sī lí to̍k-seⁿ ê kiáⁿ, Guá kí ka-kī tsiù-tsuā:
English: and said, I have sworn by myself, says Yahweh, because you have done this thing, and have not withheld your son, your only son,

Tailo: Mā tio̍h uī guán kî-tó, kî-kiû Siōngtè koh hō͘ guán ū thuân tō-lí ê ki-huē, thang suan-iông Ki-tok ê ò-pì. Guá uī-tio̍h tsit-ê tāi-tsì tsiah teh tsē-kann.
English: praying together for us also, that God may open to us a door for the word, to speak the mystery of Christ, for which I am also in bonds;

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Mô͘se kóng, Kā Alông ê kuái-á iû-guân hē tī huat-kuī tsîng, lâu-.leh, tsò tsiah-ê puē-gi̍k ê lâng ê kàm-kài; án-ne lí tsiū ē hō͘ in tuì Guá ai-uàn ê uē suah, bián-tit in sí-bông.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Put back the rod of Aaron before the testimony, to be kept for a token against the children of rebellion; that you may make an end of their murmurings against me, that they not die.

Tailo: Pik-tshiat khún-kiû kóng, Guá sè-hàn ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ teh beh sí à. Kiû Lí lâi kā i huāⁿ-tshiú, hō͘ i tit-tio̍h i hó, ē-tàng koh-ua̍h khí-.lâi.
English: and begged him much, saying, My little daughter is at the point of death. Please come and lay your hands on her, that she may be made healthy, and live.

Tailo: Sia-to-la̍k, Me-siak kah A-bia̍t-ne-go͘ hit saⁿ-ê lâng lóng siū pa̍k, tuī lo̍h-khì tī iām-jua̍h ê hué-lô͘.
English: These three men, Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, fell down bound into the midst of the burning fiery furnace.

Tailo: Koh tī An-hioh-ji̍t, gue̍h ê tshe-it kah tseh-kî, hiàn tsiah-ê sio-tsè hō͘ Siōngtsú, tsiàu mi̍h ê sò͘-gia̍h, tsiàu só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê lē, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ hiàn tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng.
English: and to offer all burnt offerings to Yahweh, on the Sabbaths, on the new moons, and on the set feasts, in number according to the ordinance concerning them, continually before Yahweh;

Tailo: In pháu-tsáu tshin-tshiūnn ióng-sū, peh-tsiūⁿ siâⁿ tshin-tshiūnn tsiàn-sū; ta̍k-ê tsiàu lō͘ kiânn, bô luān tuī-ngó͘.
English: They run like mighty men. They climb the wall like warriors. They each march in his line, and they don't swerve off course.

Tailo: In-uī tsiàu guá khuànn, ah-sàng huān-lâng, nā bô tsí-bîng i ê àn-tsîng, sī bô ha̍h lí.
English: For it seems to me unreasonable, in sending a prisoner, not to also specify the charges against him.

Tailo: In iáu teh kah i kóng-uē ê sî, ông ê thài-kàm lâi, kiò Hamán kuáⁿ-kín khì hù Êsutel só͘ siat ê iàn-si̍k.
English: While they were yet talking with him, came the king's chamberlains, and hurried to bring Haman to the banquet that Esther had prepared.

Tailo: Αpsalôm tsáu kàu Ge-siul, tī hia tuà sann nî.
English: So Absalom fled, and went to Geshur, and was there three years.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kóng, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Tsit-ê siâⁿ, ū lâu lâng ê hueh tī hit lāi-bīn, hō͘ i ê ji̍t-tsí kàu, koh tsng ngó͘-siōng lâi kā ka-kī uè lah-sap, hām-hāi ka-kī.
English: You shall say, Thus says the Lord Yahweh: A city that sheds blood in the midst of her, that her time may come, and that makes idols against herself to defile her!

Tailo: Alông beh ji̍p sìng-só͘ tio̍h án-ne, tio̍h tuà tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng-á-kiáⁿ tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, tsi̍t tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng tsò sio-tsè.
English: Herewith shall Aaron come into the sanctuary: with a young bull for a sin offering, and a ram for a burnt offering.

Tailo: Guān hiah-ê tsuē-ok tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, tì-sú I kā in ê miâ tuì sè-kan siau-bia̍t!
English: Let them be before Yahweh continually, That he may cut off the memory of them from the earth;

Tailo: Iôséhuh ìn Huâ-láu kóng, Tse m̄-sī tsāi tī guá; Siōngtsú ē kā pîng-an tsí-sī Huâ-láu.
English: Joseph answered Pharaoh, saying, It isn't in me. God will give Pharaoh an answer of peace.

Tailo: Lán mā tsai Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ í-king lîm-kàu, I koh hō͘ lán hiáu-ngō͘, lâi jīn-bat hit uī tsin-si̍t ê Siōngtè. Lán kah tsin-si̍t ê Siōngtè kiat-liân, in-uī lán kah I ê Kiáⁿ Iésu Ki-tok mā ū kiat-liân. tsit uī sī tsin-si̍t ê Siōngtè, mā sī íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā.
English: We know that the Son of God has come, and has given us an understanding, that we know him who is true, and we are in him who is true, in his Son Jesus Christ. This is the true God, and eternal life.

Tailo: Αpsalôm koh kóng, Khó-sioh bô siat-li̍p guá tsò tsit-ê só͘-tsāi ê sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ! Kiàn-nā ū sio-kò tio̍h phuàⁿ-tuàn ê tāi-tsì ê lâi-kàu guá tsia, guá ē tsiàu kong-gī phuàⁿ-kuat.
English: Absalom said moreover, Oh that I were made judge in the land, that every man who has any suit or cause might come to me, and I would do him justice!

Tailo: Tē-tshit ji̍t phah-phú-kng ê sî, in tsá-tsá khí-.lâi, tsiàu án-ne se̍h siâⁿ tshit pái; tsí ū tsit ji̍t se̍h siâⁿ tshit pái.
English: It happened on the seventh day, that they rose early at the dawning of the day, and compassed the city after the same manner seven times: only on the day they compassed the city seven times.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Lín tio̍h síng-tshat lín ê só͘ kiâⁿ.
English: This is what Yahweh of Armies says: Consider your ways.

Tailo: Ē ū tsûn tuì Kitthê hia lâi, khó͘-to̍k Asiul, khó͘-to̍k Ê-bel; i mā ē íng-uán bia̍t-bông.
English: But ships shall come from the coast of Kittim, They shall afflict Asshur, and shall afflict Eber; He also shall come to destruction.

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h tuì hit tsi̍t lô-kik ê iû tiong-kan the̍h tām-po̍h-á, tò tī ka-kī tò tshiú ê tshiú tiong-sim.
English: The priest shall take some of the log of oil, and pour it into the palm of his own left hand.

Tailo: Sio̍k Iôséhuh ê kiáⁿ-sun tsiah-ê ke, Mánáse ê sun, Makil ê kiáⁿ Gilia̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun, hiah-ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ lâi-kàu Mô͘se kah Isulael lâng tsiah-ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ tsiah-ê siú-líng ê bīn-tsîng, kóng,
English: The heads of the fathers' houses of the family of the children of Gilead, the son of Machir, the son of Manasseh, of the families of the sons of Joseph, came near, and spoke before Moses, and before the princes, the heads of the fathers' houses of the children of Israel:

Tailo: Só͘-í, lán m̄-thang thîng-liû tī Ki-tok ê tsho͘-pō͘ tō-lí, tio̍h hiòng tsîng kiû tsìn-pō͘, kàu uân-tsuân sîng-si̍k ê thîng-tō͘; lán bián koh-tsài īng thuat-lī sí-bông ê hîng-uî lâi sìn Siōngtè,
English: Therefore leaving the doctrine of the first principles of Christ, let us press on to perfectionnot laying again a foundation of repentance from dead works, of faith toward God,

Tailo: Guá nā beh sǹg, he pí hái sua khah tsē; guá khùn tsing-sîn ê sî, iû-guân kah Lí tông-tsāi.
English: If I would count them, they are more in number than the sand. When I wake up, I am still with you.

Tailo: Tsit-ê Isulael jîn-bîn ê Siōngtè kíng-suán lán ê tsó͘-sian, tī in kià-kha Aigi̍p ê sî, hō͘ in tsiâⁿ-tsò tuā ê bîn-tso̍k, koh īng tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú tshuā in tshut Aigi̍p,
English: The God of this people chose our fathers, and exalted the people when they stayed as aliens in the land of Egypt, and with an uplifted arm, he led them out of it.

Tailo: Tī I ê tn̂g-phàu kah kha-thuí ū siá tsi̍t-ê miâ, to̍h-sī Bān-ông ê Ông, bān-tsú ê Tsú .
English: He has on his garment and on his thigh a name written, KING OF KINGS, AND LORD OF LORDS.

Tailo: Huâ-láu kiò Mô͘se kah Alông lâi, kóng, Lín khì, tī tsit-ê tē tsè-sū lín ê Siōngtè!
English: Pharaoh called for Moses and for Aaron, and said, Go, sacrifice to your God in the land!

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn lu̍t-huat hō͘ Lí ê lô͘-po̍k siū kíng-kài; siú kài-bīng tsiū ē tit-tio̍h tuā siúⁿ-sù.
English: Moreover by them is your servant warned. In keeping them there is great reward.

Tailo: Tsheⁿ-siōng-ka tńg-khì liáu-āu, Tsú ê thiⁿ-sài kā Iôséhuh thok-bāng, kóng, Khí-.lâi, tshuā enn-á kah I ê lāu-bú tô-tsáu khì Aigi̍p, tuà hia kàu guá koh kā lí thong-ti, in-uī He-lo̍t teh tshuē enn-á beh lâi kā I thâi-sí.
English: Now when they had departed, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to Joseph in a dream, saying, Arise and take the young child and his mother, and flee into Egypt, and stay there until I tell you, for Herod will seek the young child to destroy him.

Tailo: guá nā tuì hiú-nuā kóng: Lí sī guá ê lāu-pē; tuì thâng kóng: Lí sī guá ê lāu-bú, guá ê tsí-muē.
English: If I have said to corruption, You are my father;' To the worm, My mother,' and my sister;'

Tailo: Hái tiong ê tsuí ē tuān-tsua̍t, hô tsuí ē siau-sit ta-.khì.
English: As the waters fail from the sea, And the river wastes and dries up,

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, tī Iôtah tē, lâng it-tīng tshiùnn tsit-ê kua, kóng: Guán ū kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ. I ē īng kiù-un li̍p-tsò siâⁿ tshiûⁿ, tsò guā-tîng siâⁿ.
English: In that day, this song will be sung in the land of Judah: We have a strong city. God appoints salvation for walls and bulwarks.

Tailo: Babúlông, Guá uī lí siat ua̍h-tauh, lí hō͘ i tauh-tio̍h mā m̄-tsai. Lí hō͘ lâng tshuē-.tio̍h, lia̍h-.tio̍h, in-uī lí kah Siōngtsú tsò tuì-ti̍k.
English: I have laid a snare for you, and you are also taken, Babylon, and you weren't aware: you are found, and also caught, because you have striven against Yahweh.

Tailo: Lín siū hiah tsē kan-khó͘ kám lóng bô tshái-kang? It-tīng sī ū lō͘-īng tsiah tio̍h.
English: Did you suffer so many things in vain, if it is indeed in vain?

Tailo: Lùthuh tsiū kóng, Lí só͘ huan-hù ê, guá lóng ē tsiàu án-ne khì tsò.
English: She said to her, All that you say I will do.

Tailo: Ahimâtsu tuì ông tuā-siaⁿ huah, Pîng-an à! Tsiū tī ông ê bīn-tsîng phak tī thô͘-kha pài, kóng, Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè sī ing-kai tio̍h o-ló ê, in-uī I í-king kā hiah-ê khí tshiú kong-kik guá ê tsú — guá ê ông ê lâng kau hō͘ lí.
English: Ahimaaz called, and said to the king, All is well. He bowed himself before the king with his face to the earth, and said, Blessed be Yahweh your God, who has delivered up the men who lifted up their hand against my lord the king.

Tailo: Lán tsiah-ê ū lîng-li̍k ê lâng, ing-kai kā luán-jio̍k ê lâng tàu taⁿ tāng-tàⁿ, m̄-thang kiû ka-kī ê buán-tsiok.
English: Now we who are strong ought to bear the weaknesses of the weak, and not to please ourselves.

Tailo: Siâⁿ hiah-ê mn̂g tio̍h tsiàu Isulael tsi-tso̍k ê miâ. Pak bīn ū saⁿ-ê mn̂g: Lūbiān ê mn̂g tsi̍t-ê, Iôtah ê mn̂g tsi̍t-ê, Lēbī ê mn̂g tsi̍t-ê.
English: and the gates of the city shall be after the names of the tribes of Israel, three gates northward: the gate of Reuben, one; the gate of Judah, one; the gate of Levi, one.

Tailo: E-hō͘-iá-kim tsē-uī ê sî, jī-tsa̍p gō͘ huè, tī Êlúsalèm tsò ông, kiōng tsa̍p-it nî. I ê lāu-bú ê miâ kiò-tsò Tse-bi-tah, sī Lu-mah lâng Petáiah ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ.
English: Jehoiakim was twenty-five years old when he began to reign; and he reigned eleven years in Jerusalem: and his mother's name was Zebidah the daughter of Pedaiah of Rumah.

Tailo: In ū thun lo̍h-pak, m̄-koh, khuàⁿ bē-tshut ū thun lo̍h-.khì, in-uī hit-ê khiap-sì ê khuán iû-guân kah í-tsîng kāng-khuán. Jiânāu, guá tsiū tshéⁿ.
English: and when they had eaten them up, it couldn't be known that they had eaten them, but they were still ugly, as at the beginning. So I awoke.

Tailo: Tē-gō͘ ji̍t sī Simiān kiáⁿ-sun ê siú-líng, Tsu-lí-sià-tāi ê kiáⁿ Silumiel.
English: On the fifth day Shelumiel the son of Zurishaddai, prince of the children of Simeon

Tailo: E-hú kóng, Lí kah guá tsò-hué khì, khuànn guá uī-tio̍h Siōngtsú ê jia̍t-sim. Tsiū hō͘ i tsē tī i ê tshia tíng.
English: He said, Come with me, and see my zeal for Yahweh. So they made him ride in his chariot.

Tailo: I tsiū thê-khí i ê kua, kóng: Bohol ê kiáⁿ Palân kóng: ba̍k-tsiu ha̍p-.leh ê lâng kóng;
English: He took up his parable, and said, Balaam the son of Beor says, The man whose eye was closed says;

Tailo: Tī Aigi̍p tsuân tē, kiàn-nā tī tshân-.ni̍h ê, bô-lūn lâng á-.sī tsing-seⁿ, lóng hō͘ pha̍uh phah, pha̍uh mā phah tshân-.ni̍h só͘-ū ê tshài-se, koh phah-tn̄g tshân-.ni̍h só͘-ū ê tshiū-ba̍k.
English: The hail struck throughout all the land of Egypt all that was in the field, both man and animal; and the hail struck every herb of the field, and broke every tree of the field.

Tailo: Sī-uē-tiúⁿ kā in kau-tài Iôséhuh, i tsiū sū-hāu in; in tsiū tī kaⁿ lāi ū tsò-hué tsi̍t tuāⁿ sî-kan.
English: The captain of the guard assigned them to Joseph, and he took care of them. They stayed in prison many days.

Tailo: Lí ê lô͘-po̍k tiàm tī Lí só͘ kíng ê jîn-bîn tiong-kan, tsiah-ê jîn-bîn tsē kàu sǹg bē-liáu.
English: Your servant is in the midst of your people which you have chosen, a great people, that can't be numbered nor counted for multitude.

Tailo: Guán bô koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h guán ê tiāu-thâu, bô koh ū sian-ti; guán tiong-kan mā bô lâng tsai tsit khuán tsîng-hîng ē kàu tang-sî!
English: We see no miraculous signs. There is no longer any prophet, Neither is there among us anyone who knows how long.

Tailo: In kóng, Ū tsi̍t-ê Aigi̍p lâng kiù guán thuat-lī kò͘ iûⁿ ê lâng ê tshiú, koh thè guán tshut-la̍t tshiūⁿ tsuí hō͘ iûⁿ-kûn lim.
English: They said, An Egyptian delivered us out of the hand of the shepherds, and moreover he drew water for us, and watered the flock.

Tailo: Taⁿ guá beh khí-.lâi, tī siâⁿ lāi sì-kè kiânn, tī ke-lō͘, tī khui-khuah ê só͘-tsāi, guá beh tshuē guá sim só͘ ài ê; guá tshuē i mā tshuē bē-tio̍h.
English: I will get up now, and go about the city; In the streets and in the squares I will seek him whom my soul loves. I sought him, but I didn't find him.

Tailo: Siōngtsú îng-kng ê khuán-sit tshin-tshiūnn hué tī suaⁿ tíng teh sio, Isulael lâng tshin-ba̍k khuànn-kìnn.
English: The appearance of the glory of Yahweh was like devouring fire on the top of the mountain in the eyes of the children of Israel.

Tailo: Ē ū tsin tsē jîn-bîn kah kiông-tuā ê kok lâi Êlúsalèm tshuē bān-kun ê Siōngtsú, kiû Siōngtsú ê un.
English: Yes, many peoples and strong nations will come to seek Yahweh of Armies in Jerusalem, and to entreat the favor of Yahweh.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kā Isulael tsuân huē-tsiòng ê tsóng-sò͘, tsiàu in ê ke-kháu tsong-tso̍k, tsiàu lâng-miâ ê sò͘-gia̍h, sǹg in tsa-po͘ ê jîn-ting.
English: Take a census of all the congregation of the children of Israel, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of the names, every male, one by one;

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tio̍h ē kì-tit lí tuì tó-uī pua̍h-tó, tio̍h hué-kái, huê-ho̍k lí khí-thâu thiàⁿ ê kiâⁿ-ta̍h; nā bô, guá ē khì lí hia, kā lí ê ting-tâi suá-tsáu.
English: Remember therefore from where you have fallen, and repent and do the first works; or else I am coming to you swiftly, and will move your lampstand out of its place, unless you repent.

Tailo: Pîng-siông sî bat i ê lâng, khuànn i tī sian-ti tiong teh kóng sian-ti uē, tsiū tsò-hué kóng, Kisi ê kiáⁿ tú-tio̍h án-ne sī án-tsuáⁿ? Sàulô kám mā lia̍t tī sian-ti tiong?
English: It happened, when all who knew him before saw that, behold, he prophesied with the prophets, then the people said one to another, What is this that is come to the son of Kish? Is Saul also among the prophets?

Tailo: （ Tabi̍t ê si; to̍h-sī i tī Amí-me-li̍k ê bīn-tsîng ké hong-tian, siū kuáⁿ tshut-.khì ê sî só͘ tsò ê. ）Guá beh sî-sî o-ló Siōngtsú; guá ê tshuì beh tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ o-ló I.
English: I will bless Yahweh at all times. His praise will always be in my mouth.

Tailo: Nā ū tshut-guā lâng tī lín tiong-kan, á-.sī ta̍k sè-tāi ū lâng tuà tī lín tiong-kan, beh hiàn phang-phang ê hué-tsè hō͘ Siōngtsú, lín án-ne kiânn, in mā tio̍h tsiàu án-ne kiânn.
English: If a stranger lives as a foreigner with you, or whoever may be among you throughout your generations, and will offer an offering made by fire, of a sweet savor to Yahweh; as you do, so he shall do.

Tailo: In tāi-ke tsham-siông kóng, Lâi! Lán tio̍h tsò tsng, sio hō͘ i si̍k. In ū tsng thang tāi-thè tsio̍h, koh ū tá-má-ka thang tāi-thè hue-thô͘.
English: They said one to another, Come, let's make bricks, and burn them thoroughly. They had brick for stone, and they used tar for mortar.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Samuel kóng, Lí tio̍h tsun-thàn in ê uē, kā in siat-li̍p tsi̍t-ê ông. Samuel kā Isulael lâng kóng, Lín ta̍k-ê lóng tńg-khì ka-kī ê siâⁿ!
English: Yahweh said to Samuel, Listen to their voice, and make them a king. Samuel said to the men of Israel, Go you every man to his city.

Tailo: I tio̍h tshin-tshiú tuà hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú ê hué-tsè lâi, to̍h-sī tuà iû kah hing lâi, thang īng hing tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng tsò iô-tsè lâi iô.
English: With his own hands he shall bring the offerings of Yahweh made by fire. He shall bring the fat with the breast, that the breast may be waved for a wave offering before Yahweh.

Tailo: kā bah-tè, to̍h-sī só͘-ū puî koh suí ê bah-tè, tsîng-thuí, āu-thuí, lóng khioh lâi hē tī lāi-bīn, kíng hó ê kut thia̍p hō͘ i muá.
English: gather the pieces of it into it, even every good piece, the thigh, and the shoulder; fill it with the choice bones.

Tailo: m̄-bat tsiūⁿ suaⁿ khì tsia̍h tsè-mi̍h, m̄-bat gióng-bōng Isulael ê tsú-bîn ê ngó͘-siōng, m̄-bat kā tshù-piⁿ ê bó͘ uè lah-sap,
English: who has not eaten on the mountains, neither has lifted up his eyes to the idols of the house of Israel, has not defiled his neighbor's wife,

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá beh hō͘ Sa-má-lī-a piàn-tsò tshân-.ni̍h ê thô͘-tui, koh tsò tsìng phû-tô ê só͘-tsāi, mā beh kā i ê tsio̍h-thâu piàⁿ lo̍h-khì suaⁿ-kok tiong, lâi lō͘-tshut i ê tē-ki.
English: Therefore I will make Samaria like a rubble heap of the field, Like places for planting vineyards; And I will pour down its stones into the valley, And I will uncover its foundations.

Tailo: Tsit-ê tāi-tsì í-tsîng, kuán-lí guán Siōngtè tiān lāi ê pâng-king ê tsè-si Elíasip kah Tobiiah kiat-bîng,
English: Now before this, Eliashib the priest, who was appointed over the chambers of the house of our God, being allied to Tobiah,

Tailo: Lán ū tsai-hō à! Siáⁿ lâng ē kiù lán thuat-lī tsiah-ê tuā kuân-lîng ê Siōngtè ê tshiú? Tsá-tsîng tī khòng-iá īng ta̍k tsióng ê tsai-hō phah Aigi̍p lâng ê, to̍h-sī tsit-ê Siōngtè.
English: Woe to us! who shall deliver us out of the hand of these mighty gods? these are the gods that struck the Egyptians with all manner of plagues in the wilderness.

Tailo: Tsē tī thinn-tíng ê teh tshiò, Tsú ē kā in biáu-sī;
English: He who sits in the heavens will laugh. The Lord will have them in derision.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, guá ài lín tsai, guá só͘ thuân ê hok-im m̄-sī tsiàu lâng ê ì-sù.
English: But I make known to you, brothers, concerning the Good News which was preached by me, that it is not according to man.

Tailo: kóng: Isulael tsiah-ê suaⁿ, lín tio̍h thiaⁿ tsì-kuân Siōngtsú ê uē. Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú tuì tuā suaⁿ, sió suaⁿ, tsuí-kau, suaⁿ-kok án-ne kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá, Guá beh īng to-kiàm lîm-kàu lín, mā beh huí-bia̍t lín ê suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ.
English: and say, You mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord Yahweh: Thus says the Lord Yahweh to the mountains and to the hills, to the watercourses and to the valleys: Behold, I, even I, will bring a sword on you, and I will destroy your high places.

Tailo: I ê pē-bú tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì. Iésu bīng-līng in m̄-thang kā só͘ huat-sing ê tāi-tsì kā lâng kóng.
English: Her parents were amazed, but he charged them to tell no one what had been done.

Tailo: Tabi̍t kah Sàulô kóng-uē liáu-āu, Ionáthan ê sèⁿ-miā kah Tabi̍t ê sèⁿ-miā seⁿ sio-liân, Ionáthan thiàⁿ i tshin-tshiūnn ka-kī ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: It happened, when he had made an end of speaking to Saul, that the soul of Jonathan was knit with the soul of David, and Jonathan loved him as his own soul.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, guá hō͘ Siōngtsú ê siū-khì tshiong-muá, jím bē-tiâu. Só͘-í, Siōngtsú kóng, Guá beh tsò tsi̍t-ē piàⁿ lo̍h-khì tī ke-lō͘ ê gín-á kah tsū-huē ê siàu-liân lâng, liân tiōng-hu kah i ê bó͘, lāu lâng kah ji̍t-tsí buán-tsiok ê, lóng ē siū lia̍h.
English: Therefore I am full of the wrath of Yahweh; I am weary with holding in: pour it out on the children in the street, and on the assembly of young men together; for even the husband with the wife shall be taken, the aged with him who is full of days.

Tailo: Tse to̍h-sī pháiⁿ lâng tuì Siōngtè só͘ tit ê hūn-gia̍h; sī Siōngtè kā i tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê sán-gia̍p.
English: This is the portion of a wicked man from God, The heritage appointed to him by God.

Tailo: Guá beh kā Guá ê sîn-lîng hē tī lín ê lāi-bīn, hō͘ lín sūn-ho̍k Guá ê lu̍t-lē, siú Guá ê huat-tō͘ lâi kiâⁿ.
English: I will put my Spirit within you, and cause you to walk in my statutes, and you shall keep my ordinances, and do them.

Tailo: Pí-la̍h-to koh ìn kóng, Án-ne, lín kiò-tsò Iô-tá-iah lâng ê ông hit uī, guá tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ kā I pān?
English: Pilate again asked them, What then should I do to him whom you call the King of the Jews?

Tailo: I tio̍h tshut-tsāi lâng phah tshuì-phué, muá-muá siū lîng-jio̍k.
English: Let him give his cheek to him who strikes him; let him be filled full with reproach.

Tailo: Siōngtè ū thong-kuè tsìng sian-ti ê tshuì ī-giân I ê Ki-tok tio̍h siū-lān, tsit-ê tāi-tsì kó-jiân ìng-giām ā.
English: But the things which God announced by the mouth of all his prophets, that Christ should suffer, he thus fulfilled.

Tailo: I ê tiōng-hu tuè i ê āu-bīn, ná kiâⁿ ná háu, kah i lâi-kàu Ba-hu-lîm. Apnel kā i kóng, Lí tò tńg-.khì! I tsiū tò tńg-.khì.
English: Her husband went with her, weeping as he went, and followed her to Bahurim. Then said Abner to him, Go, return: and he returned.

Tailo: I tsiū tuì guá kóng, Isulael ê tsú-bîn kah Iôtah ke ê tsuē-kò hui-siông tāng. Tsuân tē ū lâu hueh ê tāi-tsì, muá siâⁿ ū uan-óng, in-uī in kóng, ' Siōngtsú í-king lī-khui tsit-ê tē, Siōngtsú bô teh khuàⁿ. '
English: Then said he to me, The iniquity of the house of Israel and Judah is exceeding great, and the land is full of blood, and the city full of wrestling of judgment: for they say, Yahweh has forsaken the land, and Yahweh doesn't see.

Tailo: M̄-koh lán siong-sìn, lán tsí ū tsi̍t-ê Siōngtè, to̍h-sī Thiⁿ-pē, bān-mi̍h lóng sī I tshòng-tsō ê, lán mā uī-tio̍h I lâi ua̍h. Lán tsí ū tsi̍t-ê Tsú Iésu Ki-tok, bān-mi̍h lóng thong-kuè I lâi tshòng-tsō, lán mā thong-kuè I lâi sing-tsûn.
English: yet to us there is one God, the Father, of whom are all things, and we for him; and one Lord, Jesus Christ, through whom are all things, and we live through him.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kā tē-gō͘-tsa̍p nî hun-pia̍t tsò sìng, tī tsuân tē kā só͘-ū tuà tī hia ê jîn-bîn suan-pò͘ tsū-iû. Tsit nî beh tsò lín ê hí-nî, lín ta̍k lâng tio̍h tńg-khì i ka-kī ê sán-gia̍p, ta̍k lâng tio̍h tńg-khì i ka-kī ê pún-ke.
English: You shall make the fiftieth year holy, and proclaim liberty throughout the land to all its inhabitants. It shall be a jubilee to you; and each of you shall return to his own property, and each of you shall return to his family.

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, lí nā uī-tio̍h tshù-piⁿ tsò tiong-pó, thè guā-lâng tah tshiú tam-pó,
English: My son, if you have become collateral for your neighbor, If you have struck your hands in pledge for a stranger;

Tailo: Tng Iôtah ông — Io-si-iah ê kiáⁿ E-hō͘-iá-kim tsē-uī ê sî, Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah, kóng,
English: The word which came to Jeremiah from Yahweh in the days of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, saying,

Tailo: Tuì kok lāi tû-khì lâm-sìng biō-tshiong, koh tû-khì i ê tsó͘-sian só͘ tsò ê só͘-ū ngó͘-siōng;
English: He put away the sodomites out of the land, and removed all the idols that his fathers had made.

Tailo: Ga̍t tsiū lâi kìnn Tabi̍t, kā i kóng, Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, ' Lí tio̍h ka-kī kíng,
English: So Gad came to David, and said to him, Thus says Yahweh, Take which you will:

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê thái-ko ê pēnn-lâng lâi-kàu Iésu ê bīn-tsîng, kuī lo̍h-khì kā I kiû, kóng, Lí nā khíng, tsiū ē-tàng hō͘ guá tshing-khì.
English: There came to him a leper, begging him, kneeling down to him, and saying to him, If you want to, you can make me clean.

Tailo: Lâng tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ tsiah ē-tàng ji̍p-khì ióng-sū ê tshù tshiúⁿ i ê tsâi-bu̍t? Kám m̄-sī tio̍h tāi-sing kā hit-ê ióng-sū pa̍k khí-.lâi?
English: Or how can one enter into the house of the strong man, and plunder his goods, unless he first bind the strong man? Then he will plunder his house.

Tailo: Hit sî, guá tī hia tsò sai-hū-thâu, ji̍t-ji̍t hō͘ I huann-hí, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī I bīn-tsîng khuài-lo̍k;
English: Then I was the craftsman by his side. I was a delight day by day, Always rejoicing before him,

Tailo: I ê tshuì só͘ kóng ê uē khí-thâu sī gû-gōng; i ê uē ê lō͘-bué sī hāi lâng ê tian-kông.
English: The beginning of the words of his mouth is foolishness; and the end of his talk is mischievous madness.

Tailo: Huâ-láu ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ kā i kóng, Phō tsit-ê gín-á khì, thè guá kā i io, guá ē hō͘ lí kang-tsînn. Tsa-bó͘ lâng tsiū phō gín-á tńg-khì io.
English: Pharaoh's daughter said to her, Take this child away, and nurse him for me, and I will give you your wages. The woman took the child, and nursed it.

Tailo: Guá ê sù-tsiá ē kiânn tī lí ê thâu-tsîng, tshuā lí kàu Amô͘lī, Hiat, Pe-lí-ji, Ka-nân, Hi-bī, I-é-bú-suh hiah-ê tso̍k ê tē; Guá beh kā in tsián-tû.
English: For my angel shall go before you, and bring you in to the Amorite, the Hittite, the Perizzite, the Canaanite, the Hivite, and the Jebusite; and I will cut them off.

Tailo: Sio̍k Iôtah ê tsi-tso̍k king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê,
English: Of the children of Judah, their generations, by their families, by their fathers' houses, according to the number of the names, from twenty years old and upward, all who were able to go out to war;

Tailo: I tsi̍t-ē thòng-hūn, siáⁿ lâng ē khiā-.leh? I tuā siū-khì, siáⁿ lâng tng ē khí? I ê siū-khì tshin-tshiūnn hué piàⁿ tshut-.lâi, tsio̍h-puâⁿ in-uī I piak-li̍h.
English: Who can stand before his indignation? Who can endure the fierceness of his anger? His wrath is poured out like fire, and the rocks are broken apart by him.

Tailo: Lán tio̍h síng-tshat koh tshâ-khó lán ê lō͘, tio̍h ua̍t tńg-lâi kui Siōngtsú.
English: Let us search and try our ways, and turn again to Yahweh.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí thiaⁿ guá ê kî-tó, àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ guá ê kiû-kiò! Guá lâu ba̍k-sái, kiû Lí m̄-thang bô tshut siaⁿ! Guá tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng sī tsi̍t-ê tshut-guā lâng kah guá ê tsó͘-sian kāng-khuán sī kià-kha ê.
English: Hear my prayer, Yahweh, and give ear to my cry. Don't be silent at my tears. For I am a stranger with you, A foreigner, as all my fathers were.

Tailo: Tuì sian-ti Samuel ê ji̍t í-āu, tī Isulael tiong bô ū tshin-tshiūnn tsit sî só͘ siú ê Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh; jî-tshiánn Isulael lia̍t ông mā lóng bô tshin-tshiūnn Io-si-iah, tsè-si kah Lēbī lâng, í-ki̍p tông-tsāi ê Iôtah, kah Isulael lâng, kah tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê jîn-bîn só͘ siú ê án-ne teh siú Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh.
English: There was no Passover like that kept in Israel from the days of Samuel the prophet; neither did any of the kings of Israel keep such a Passover as Josiah kept, and the priests, and the Levites, and all Judah and Israel who were present, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

Tailo: Tshiánn lín kā tī Ki-tok kah guá tâng lô-khó͘ ê U-ba-nô͘, í-ki̍p guá só͘ thiàⁿ ê Su-ta-khù tshíng-an.
English: Greet Urbanus, our fellow worker in Christ, and Stachys, my beloved.

Tailo: Tī īⁿ ê sì-kak-thâu ū īⁿ, sì-bīn ū tshiûⁿ uî-.leh; ta̍k-ê īⁿ, tn̂g sì-tsa̍p tiú, khuah saⁿ-tsa̍p; sì-ê kak-thâu ê īⁿ, in ê tshùn-tshioh lóng kāng-khuán.
English: In the four corners of the court there were courts enclosed, forty cubits long and thirty broad: these four in the corners were of one measure.

Tailo: La̍hban kóng, Hó, guá guān-ì tsiàu lí ê uē kiânn.
English: Laban said, Behold, I desire it to be according to your word.

Tailo: Iobuh tsiū ìn Siōngtsú kóng:
English: Then Job answered Yahweh,

Tailo: huí in ê siâⁿ, ta̍k lâng hiat tsio̍h-thâu lâi thūn-muá só͘-ū hó ê tē, that tiâu só͘-ū ê tsuí-tsuâⁿ, tshò in ta̍k tsâng hó ê tshiū, tsí ū tshun Kel-ha-la-siat ê tsio̍h-tshiûⁿ; hìⁿ tsio̍h-thâu ê tuì sì-kho͘-uî lâi kā i kong-kik.
English: They beat down the cities; and on every good piece of land they cast every man his stone, and filled it; and they stopped all the springs of water, and felled all the good trees, until in Kir Hareseth only they left the stones of it; however the men armed with slings went about it, and struck it.

Tailo: Guá lâi sī beh īng hué tàn tī tē-tsiūⁿ, hué nā to̍h khí-.lâi, m̄-tsai guā-ni̍h-á hó lè?
English: I came to throw fire on the earth. I wish it were already kindled.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, hit sî, Guá beh hō͘ Tabi̍t huat-tshut gī ê tshiū-ki, i ē tī tē-tsiūⁿ kiânn kong-pêⁿ kah kong-gī.
English: In those days, and at that time, will I cause a Branch of righteousness to grow up to David; and he shall execute justice and righteousness in the land.

Tailo: to̍h-sī O͘-huil ê kim saⁿ tshing tha-lan-t, tuàn-liān ê gîn tshit tshing tha-lan-t, lâi an-tsng tsiah-ê tshù ê tshiûⁿ.
English: even three thousand talents of gold, of the gold of Ophir, and seven thousand talents of refined silver, with which to overlay the walls of the houses;

Tailo: Tī ông-kiong lāi ê thài-kàm — Kú-si̍t lâng E-bia̍t-me-li̍k thiaⁿ-tio̍h in kā I-é-lí-miah luī-lo̍h tséⁿ （ hit sî, ông tsē tī Biāniámín mn̂g-kháu ）.
English: Now when Ebedmelech the Ethiopian, a eunuch, who was in the king's house, heard that they had put Jeremiah in the dungeon (the king then sitting in the gate of Benjamin),

Tailo: Só͘-í, tsa-bó͘ lâng ê thâu tio̍h tà thâu-kin, lâi piáu-sī tuì kuân-ui khut-ho̍k ê kì-hō, mā sī uī-tio̍h kìng-uì thiⁿ-sài ê iân-kò͘.
English: For this cause the woman ought to have authority on her head, because of the angels.

Tailo: Tsit-ê sio̍k-tsuē-tsè í-king sī tsì-sìng ê, Siōngtsú koh kā hit-ê kui hō͘ lín, lâi tam-tng huē-tsiòng ê tsuē-kò, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng kā in sio̍k-tsuē, lín án-tsuáⁿ bô tī sìng ê só͘-tsāi tsia̍h hiah-ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ?
English: Why haven't you eaten the sin offering in the place of the sanctuary, seeing it is most holy, and he has given it you to bear the iniquity of the congregation, to make atonement for them before Yahweh?

Tailo: Ehulaim siū pō-gio̍k, siū sím-phuàⁿ, ap-tsè, in-uī i kam-sim tsun-thàn bīng-līng.
English: Ephraim is oppressed, He is crushed in judgment; Because he is intent in his pursuit of idols.

Tailo: La̍h-khel khuànn i ka-kī bô kā Iâkop seⁿ kiáⁿ, tsiū uàn-tò͘ i ê tuā-tsé. I tuì Iâkop kóng, Lí tio̍h hō͘ guá ū kiáⁿ, nā bô, guá beh sí.
English: When Rachel saw that she bore Jacob no children, Rachel envied her sister. She said to Jacob, Give me children, or else I will die.

Tailo: I tsiū khí-lâi tsia̍h koh lim; uá-khò tsit pái tsia̍h ê khuì-la̍t, i kiânn sì-tsa̍p kang koh sì-tsa̍p mê, lâi-kàu Siōngtsú ê suaⁿ, to̍h-sī Hô-lep suann.
English: He arose, and ate and drink, and went in the strength of that food forty days and forty nights to Horeb the Mount of God.

Tailo: Guá nā kìm-tsí sàn-tshiah lâng ê ì-guān, á-.sī hō͘ kuáⁿ-hū ê ba̍k-tsiu khuànn kàu ba̍k-hîn;
English: If I have withheld the poor from their desire, Or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail,

Tailo: M̄-thang tham-luân sè-kan á-.sī sè-kan ê mi̍h; lâng nā thiàⁿ tsit sè-kan, i tsiū bô thiàⁿ Thiⁿ-pē.
English: Don't love the world, neither the things that are in the world. If anyone loves the world, the Father's love isn't in him.

Tailo: Guá beh tsū-tsi̍p bān-bîn, tshuā in lo̍h-khì Iô-sa-huat ê suaⁿ-kok, tī hia kā in sím-phuàⁿ; in-uī in kā Guá ê tsú-bîn, to̍h-sī Guá ê sán-gia̍p — Isulael, hun-suànn tī lia̍t kok tiong, koh pun Guá ê thó͘-tē,
English: I will gather all nations, And will bring them down into the valley of Jehoshaphat; And I will execute judgment on them there for my people, And for my heritage, Israel, whom they have scattered among the nations. They have divided my land,

Tailo: Siōngtsú koh tuì guá kóng, Lí ē koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h in ê só͘ kiâⁿ, iáu ū koh khah tuā khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì.
English: He said also to me, You shall again see yet other great abominations which they do.

Tailo: Lín só͘ tsai ê, guá mā tsai; guá bô pí lín khah su.
English: What you know, I know also. I am not inferior to you.

Tailo: Hit sî, thiⁿ-tē kah kî-tiong só͘-ū ê ē in-uī Babúlông sit-pāi lâi huann-hí, in-uī kiânn huí-bia̍t ê ē tuì pak-hong lâi-kàu i hia. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: Then the heavens and the earth, and all that is therein, shall sing for joy over Babylon; for the destroyers shall come to her from the north, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Hō͘-siong sio-sî liáu-āu, guán tsiūⁿ tsûn, in tńg-khì in tau.
English: After saying goodbye to each other, we went on board the ship, and they returned home again.

Tailo: Tī tsiah-ê it-tshè, siáⁿ lâng m̄-tsai sī Siōngtè ê tshiú án-ne tsò?
English: Who doesn't know that in all these, The hand of Yahweh has done this,

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tsit-má Siōngtsú ê uē kóng, Sann nî lāi, tsiàu tn̂g-kang ê nî-hān, Mô͘ap ê îng-kng kah i ê jîn-bîn ē tú-tio̍h lîng-jio̍k; só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng tsin tsió, put kham it kik.
English: But now Yahweh has spoken, saying, Within three years, as a worker bound by contract would count them, the glory of Moab shall be brought into contempt, with all his great multitude; and the remnant will be very small and feeble.

Tailo: Ū lâng kā Tabi̍t kóng, i tsiū tshe lâng khì kā in gîng-tsiap, in-uī hiah-ê lâng kiàn-siàu kàu-ki̍k. Ông kóng, Thang tuà tī I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ thìng-hāu tshuì-tshiu huat tn̂g, tsiah tò tńg-.lâi.
English: When they told it to David, he sent to meet them; for the men were greatly ashamed. The king said, Wait at Jericho until your beards be grown, and then return.

Tailo: Ū tsin tsē lâng ē kha that-tio̍h lâi pua̍h-tó, pua̍h kah tshuì-tshuì, mā ē hō͘ i bāng-tio̍h, lia̍h-tio̍h.
English: Many will stumble over it, fall, be broken, be snared, and be captured.

Tailo: In tsiūⁿ suaⁿ-phiânn beh ji̍p-khì siâⁿ lāi ê sî, tú-tio̍h kuí-nā-ê siàu-liân ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á tshut-lâi tshiūⁿ tsuí, mn̄g in kóng, Sian-kiàn ū tī tsia bô?
English: As they went up the ascent to the city, they found young maidens going out to draw water, and said to them, Is the seer here?

Tailo: Iésu kah sù-tô͘ tsia̍h àm-tǹg ê sî, Mô͘-kuí kā tshut-bē Iésu ê ì-sù hē tī Ka-lio̍k lâng Símòng ê kiáⁿ Iôtah ê sim.
English: After supper, the devil having already put into the heart of Judas Iscariot, Simon's son, to betray him,

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kóng: Guá beh hō͘ i tshut-.khì, i ē ji̍p-khì thau-the̍h ê lâng ê tshù, mā ē ji̍p-khì kí Guá ê miâ lām-sám tsiù-tsuā ê lâng ê tshù, beh tuà tī i ê tshù lāi kā i huí bia̍t-tiāu, í-ki̍p i ê tshâ, i ê tsio̍h.
English: I will cause it to go out, says Yahweh of Armies, and it will enter into the house of the thief, and into the house of him who swears falsely by my name; and it will remain in the midst of his house, and will destroy it with its timber and its stones.

Tailo: Lín tsí ū khut-sin tī siū lia̍h ê lâng ê ē-bīn, tó tī siū thâi ê lâng ê ē-bīn. Suî-jiân án-ne, Siōngtsú ê siū-khì iáu-buē siau, I ê tshiú iû-guân tshun-.leh.
English: They will only bow down under the prisoners, And will fall under the slain. For all this his anger is not turned away, But his hand is stretched out still.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Batseba khì kìⁿ Só͘lômóng ông, beh uī Atonîiah kóng-uē. Ông khí-lâi kā i gîng-tsiap, tuì i kiok-kiong, koh tsē i ê uī, mā huan-hù lâng uī ông ê lāu-bú siat tsō-uī, i tsiū tsē tī ông ê tsiànn pîng.
English: Bathsheba therefore went to king Solomon, to speak to him for Adonijah. The king rose up to meet her, and bowed himself to her, and sat down on his throne, and caused a throne to be set for the king's mother; and she sat on his right hand.

Tailo: Lí khì kā Só͘lômóng ê kiáⁿ, Iôtah ông Lô-bo-àm kah Iôtah Biāniámín tsuân ke, í-ki̍p kî-tha ê jîn-bîn kóng,
English: Speak to Rehoboam the son of Solomon, king of Judah, and to all the house of Judah and Benjamin, and to the rest of the people, saying,

Tailo: Mô͘se kah Isulael ê tiúⁿ-ló tsiū tńg-khì iâⁿ lāi.
English: Moses got him into the camp, he and the elders of Israel.

Tailo: Tiau-khik ê siōng ū siáⁿ-mi̍h lī-ik, tsiah hō͘ tsō i ê lâng lâi kā i tiau-khik? Tsù ê ngó͘-siōng kah ké ê lāu-su ū siáⁿ-mi̍h lī-ik, tsiah hō͘ tsō i ê lâng uá-khò i, lâi tsō é-káu ê ngó͘-siōng?
English: What value does the engraved image have, that its maker has engraved it; the molten image, even the teacher of lies, that he who fashions its form trusts in it, to make mute idols?

Tailo: Lí kah Lēbī lâng, í-ki̍p lín tiong-kan ê tshut-guā lâng, tio̍h in-uī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí kah lí ê ka-kuàn it-tshè ê hok-hūn lâi huann-hí.
English: You shall rejoice in all the good which Yahweh your God has given to you, and to your house, you, and the Levite, and the foreigner who is in the midst of you.

Tailo: Ammóng ê jîn-sîn puē-puān i, tī ông-kiong lāi kā ông thâi-sí.
English: The servants of Amon conspired against him, and put the king to death in his own house.

Tailo: in-uī tuì Guá tshuā Isulael khí-.lâi ê ji̍t kàu kin-á-ji̍t, Guá m̄-bat tuà tī tshù lāi, sī tuì tsit-ê pò͘-pênn kàu hit-ê pò͘-pênn, tuì tsit-ê tiùⁿ-pâng kàu hit-ê tiùⁿ-pâng.
English: for I have not lived in a house since the day that I brought up Israel, to this day, but have gone from tent to tent, and from one tent to another.

Tailo: Thiⁿ-pē liân lín ê thâu-mn̂g mā lóng ū sǹg kuè.
English: but the very hairs of your head are all numbered.

Tailo: Tsè-si ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ nā kiânn kan-îm, lîng-jio̍k ka-kī, to̍h-sī lîng-jio̍k i ê lāu-pē, tio̍h īng hué kā i sio sí.
English: The daughter of any priest, if she profanes herself by playing the prostitute, she profanes her father: she shall be burned with fire.

Tailo: Tī thinn-tíng koh ū līng-guā tsi̍t-ê tiāu-thâu tshut-hiān, tsi̍t bué tshiah-sik ê tuā bé lîng, ū tshit-ê thâu, tsa̍p ki kak, thâu-khak tì tshit tíng ông-kuan.
English: Another sign was seen in heaven. Behold, a great red dragon, having seven heads and ten horns, and on his heads seven crowns.

Tailo: Nā beh tsū-tsi̍p huē-tsiòng, lín tio̍h pûn kó͘-tshue, tsóng-.sī, m̄-thang pûn tuā-siaⁿ.
English: But when the assembly is to be gathered together, you shall blow, but you shall not sound an alarm.

Tailo: Iâkop khùn-tshéⁿ, kóng, Siōngtsú tsin-tsiàⁿ kah guá tông-tsāi, guá kìng-jiân m̄-tsai.
English: Jacob awakened out of his sleep, and he said, Surely Yahweh is in this place, and I didn't know it.

Tailo: Lí īng Lí ê tsû-ài, tshuā Lí só͘ kiù-sio̍k ê tsú-bîn; Lí īng Lí ê kuân-lîng, tshuā in ji̍p-khì Lí sìng ê só͘-tsāi.
English: You, in your loving kindness, have led the people that you have redeemed. You have guided them in your strength to your holy habitation.

Tailo: M̄-nā án-ne, i siū tsìng kàu-huē suán-phài lâi tsò guán lí-hîng ê tâng-phuāⁿ, tsham-ú guán tsit-hāng tsû-siān kang-tsok; tsit-ê kang-tsok sī beh kui îng-kng hō͘ Tsú, mā piáu-sī guán huann-hí kam-guān án-ne tsò.
English: Not only so, but who was also appointed by the assemblies to travel with us in this grace, which is served by us to the glory of the Lord himself, and to show our readiness.

Tailo: In suá khì tang pîng ê sî-tsūn, tī Sīnal tē tú-tio̍h tsi̍t-phiàn ê pîng-guân, tsiū tuà tī hia.
English: It happened, as they traveled east, that they found a plain in the land of Shinar, and they lived there.

Tailo: Thái-ko ê pháiⁿ tsìng-thâu, lí tio̍h tsin sè-jī, tsè-si Lēbī lâng it-tshè só͘ kà-sī lín ê, tio̍h tsiàu án-ne lâi kiâⁿ. Guá só͘ bīng-līng in ê, lín tio̍h tsip-siú lâi kiâⁿ.
English: Take heed in the plague of leprosy, that you observe diligently, and do according to all that the priests the Levites shall teach you: as I commanded them, so you shall observe to do.

Tailo: Guá kui ji̍t tshun tshiú ǹg hiah-ê puē-gi̍k ê jîn-bîn; in tshut-tsāi ka-kī ê ì-sù, kiânn m̄-hó ê lō͘.
English: I have spread out my hands all the day to a rebellious people, who walk in a way that is not good, after their own thoughts;

Tailo: Iésu kā in kóng, Lâng nā lî i ê bó͘ koh tshuā pa̍t-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng, to̍h-sī huān kan-îm lâi ko͘-hū i ê bó͘;
English: He said to them, Whoever divorces his wife, and marries another, commits adultery against her.

Tailo: Ū hué tī hit-tīn lâng tiong-kan huat-khí; ū hué-iām sio-bia̍t hiah-ê pháiⁿ lâng.
English: A fire was kindled in their company. The flame burned up the wicked.

Tailo: I tī huān-lān ê sî, tsiū khún-kiû Siōngtsú — i ê Siōngtè, koh tī i ê tsó͘-sian ê Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng hui-siông khiam-pi.
English: When he was in distress, he begged Yahweh his God, and humbled himself greatly before the God of his fathers.

Tailo: Kàu tē-tshit ji̍t, tsè-si tio̍h koh khì giām, lí khuàⁿ, tsìng-thâu nā thuàⁿ tī tshù ê tshiûⁿ-piah,
English: The priest shall come again on the seventh day, and look. If the plague has spread in the walls of the house,

Tailo: Tī tseh-kî kah tāi-huē ê sî, sò͘-tsè tio̍h uī-tio̍h tsi̍t tsiah gû-káng hiàn tsi̍t-ê e-huat, uī-tio̍h tsi̍t tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng hiàn tsi̍t-ê e-huat, uī-tio̍h hiah-ê iûⁿ-ko tsiū tsiàu i ê king-tsè li̍k-liōng, tsi̍t-ê e-huat phuè iû tsi̍t hin.
English: In the feasts and in the solemnities the meal offering shall be an ephah for a bull, and an ephah for a ram, and for the lambs as he is able to give, and a hin of oil to an ephah.

Tailo: sī in-uī Isulael lâng kah Iôtah lâng it-tshè ê siâ-ok, to̍h-sī in kah in ê kun-ông, kuì-tso̍k, tsè-si, sian-ti kah Iôtah ê kûn-tsiòng, í-ki̍p tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê jîn-bîn só͘ kiâⁿ ê, lâi jiá Guá siū-khì.
English: because of all the evil of the children of Israel and of the children of Judah, which they have done to provoke me to anger, they, their kings, their princes, their priests, and their prophets, and the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

Tailo: In-uī in iú-hi̍k Guá ê tsú-bîn, kóng, ' Pîng-an! ' Kî-si̍t bô ū pîng-an; to̍h-sī tshin-tshiūnn lâng teh khí tshiûⁿ-piah, in kā i tshíng hue-tsuí.
English: Because, even because they have seduced my people, saying, Peace; and there is no peace; and when one builds up a wall, behold, they daub it with whitewash:

Tailo: Alông tsiàu án-ne kiânn, tiám ting tsiò-kng tī ting-tâi tsîng, sī tsiàu Siōngtsú bīng-līng Mô͘se ê.
English: Aaron did so. He lit its lamps to light the area in front of the lampstand, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: Tû-kàⁿ-tseh ê thâu tsi̍t ji̍t, to̍h-sī thâi Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh ê iûⁿ-ko ê ji̍t, bûn-tô͘ mn̄g Iésu kóng, Lí ài guán khì siáⁿ-mi̍h só͘-tsāi tsún-pī hō͘ Lí tsia̍h Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh ê buán-tshan?
English: On the first day of unleavened bread, when they sacrificed the Passover, his disciples asked him, Where do you want us to go and make ready that you may eat the Passover?

Tailo: Hit sî, Guá hō͘ lí kah hiah-ê lo̍h im-hú ê tsò-hué lo̍h-.khì, kàu kó͘-tsá lâng hia; hō͘ lí tiàm tī tē-hā tshim ê só͘-tsāi, tuì kó͘-tsá to̍h pha-hng ê só͘-tsāi kah hiah-ê lo̍h im-hú ê lâng tông-tsāi, bô koh ū lâng tuà tī hia, tī ua̍h-lâng ê tē bô koh ū îng-kng.
English: then will I bring you down with those who descend into the pit, to the people of old time, and will make you to dwell in the lower parts of the earth, in the places that are desolate of old, with those who go down to the pit, that you be not inhabited; and I will set glory in the land of the living:

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k Siōngtsú tsē-uī tsò tsú kàu íng-uán; I í-king an-tì I ê pó-tsō beh lâi sím-phuàⁿ.
English: But Yahweh reigns forever. He has prepared his throne for judgment.

Tailo: Hit sî, ū kuán-ke ê Hilkíiah ê kiáⁿ Eliakim kah su-kì Siapná, í-ki̍p sú-kuaⁿ Asah ê kiáⁿ Io-uah tshut-lâi kìnn i.
English: Then Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, who was over the household, and Shebna the scribe, and Joah, the son of Asaph, the recorder came out to him.

Tailo: E-hú tsio-tsi̍p tsìng lâng, kā in kóng, Ahap ho̍k-sāi Baal iáu-sī sió-khuá, E-hú ē tuā-tuā kā i ho̍k-sāi.
English: Jehu gathered all the people together, and said to them, Ahab served Baal a little; but Jehu will serve him much.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guá khak-sìn Tsú ē hō͘ guá pún-sin mā tsin kín ē-tàng khì kìⁿ lín.
English: But I trust in the Lord that I myself also will come shortly.

Tailo: Tsit-ê puē-gi̍k, ù-uè, pō-gio̍k ê siâⁿ ū tsai-hō à!
English: Woe to her who is rebellious and polluted, the oppressing city!

Tailo: Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, tsiah-ê hueh-tsè lóng beh kui tī tsit tāi ê lâng.
English: Most assuredly I tell you, all these things will come upon this generation.

Tailo: Tì-huī lâng ê sim tī pān song-sū ê ke; gû-gōng lâng ê sim tī khuài-lo̍k ê ke.
English: The heart of the wise is in the house of mourning; but the heart of fools is in the house of mirth.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tsiah-ê tāi-tsì lóng í-king si̍t-hiān, sī beh ìng-giām sian-ti tī king-tián só͘ kì-tsài ê uē. Hit sî, bûn-tô͘ lóng pàng-sak Iésu, tô-tsáu-.khì.
English: But all this has happened, that the Scriptures of the prophets might be fulfilled. Then all the disciples left him, and fled.

Tailo: Isulael ngē-phīⁿ, tshin-tshiūnn ngē-phīⁿ ê gû-bó; taⁿ Siōngtsú beh tshī in, tshin-tshiūnn tshī iûⁿ tī khui-khuah ê tē.
English: For Israel has behaved extremely stubbornly, like a stubborn heifer. Then how will Yahweh feed them like a lamb in a meadow.

Tailo: Piattò͘ phah guā-kháu mn̂g ê sî, ū tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò-tsò Lô-tāi ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á tshut-lâi thiaⁿ khuànn sī siáⁿ-mi̍h lâng.
English: When Peter knocked at the door of the gate, a maid named Rhoda came to answer.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê sù-tsiá tī khòng-iá ê tsuí-tsuâⁿ piⁿ tú-tio̍h Hagal; hit-ê tsuí-tsuâⁿ tī Siu-l ê lō͘-tsiūⁿ.
English: The angel of Yahweh found her by a fountain of water in the wilderness, by the fountain in the way to Shur.

Tailo: Tsú ah, taⁿ tsiàu Lí ê uē, hō͘ Lí ê lô͘-po̍k pîng-pîng an-an lī-khui sè-kan.
English: Now you are releasing your servant, Master, According to your word, in peace;

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Li-bé-kah tī lí ê bīn-tsîng, lí thang kā i tshuā-.khì, tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ kóng ê, hō͘ lí ê tsú-lâng ê kiáⁿ tsò bó͘.
English: Behold, Rebekah is before you. Take her, and go, and let her be your master's son's wife, as Yahweh has spoken.

Tailo: Tsin-si̍t ê kiàn-tsìng bô kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t; ké ê kiàn-tsìng kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t uē.
English: A truthful witness will not lie, But a false witness pours out lies.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì í-āu, Ahasuiló͘ ông kí-khí Agak tso̍k Hametátha ê kiáⁿ Hamán, kā i ko-sing, hō͘ i ê uī pí só͘-ū tông-liâu ê jîn-sîn khah kuân.
English: After these things did king Ahasuerus promote Haman the son of Hammedatha the Agagite, and advanced him, and set his seat above all the princes who were with him.

Tailo: Liân sian-ti kah tsè-si to sī siat-to̍k ê, to̍h-sī tī Guá ê tshù lāi, Guá mā khuàⁿ-tio̍h in ê pháiⁿ. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: for both prophet and priest are profane; yes, in my house have I found their wickedness, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Kol-né-lioh kóng, Sì ji̍t tsîng, tsha-put-to tsit-ê sî ē-po͘ saⁿ tiám, guá tī tshù lāi teh kî-tó, hut-jiân ū tsi̍t-ê lâng, saⁿ-khò͘ kng iàⁿ-iàⁿ, khiā tī guá ê bīn-tsîng,
English: Cornelius said, Four days ago, I was fasting until this hour, and at the ninth hour, I prayed in my house, and behold, a man stood before me in bright clothing,

Tailo: Tī ta̍k-ê kuân suaⁿ ê tíng-bīn, ta̍k tsâng tsheⁿ-tshuì ê tshiū kha, khiā thiāu-siōng kah hiah-ê A-si-lah;
English: and they set them up pillars and Asherim on every high hill, and under every green tree;

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k ta̍k lâng īng gîn bé-.lâi ê lô͘-po̍k í-king kā i kiânn kat-lé ê, tsiū thang tsia̍h.
English: but every man's servant who is bought for money, when you have circumcised him, then shall he eat of it.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, i ē hō͘ lâng kng kàu bōng-á-po͘, koh ū lâng tī i ê bōng kò͘-siú.
English: Yet shall he be borne to the grave, Men shall keep watch over the tomb.

Tailo: Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, i nā tshuē-tio̍h hit tsiah sit-bê ê iûⁿ, it-tīng pí ū káu-tsa̍p-káu tsiah bô phah-m̄-kiàn koh khah huann-hí.
English: If he finds it, most assuredly I tell you, he rejoices over it more than over the ninety-nine which have not gone astray.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kā tsit-ê tāi-tsì thuân hō͘ lín ê kiáⁿ, kiáⁿ koh thuân hō͘ sun, sun koh thuân hō͘ āu-tāi.
English: Tell your children about it, And have your children tell their children, And their children, another generation.

Tailo: Kàu beh khui-toh ê sî, tshe i ê lô͘-po̍k kā só͘ tshiánn ê lâng kóng, ' Tshiánn lín tio̍h lâi, ta̍k hāng lóng tsún-pī hó-sè à. '
English: He sent out his servant at supper time to tell those who were invited, Come, for everything is ready now.'

Tailo: Sàulô īng tshiuⁿ tso̍k khì, in-uī kóng, guá beh tsha̍k Tabi̍t, kā i tìng tī piah-.ni̍h. Tabi̍t tī i ê bīn-tsîng siám-phiah nn̄g pái.
English: and Saul cast the spear; for he said, I will strike David even to the wall. David avoided out of his presence twice.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, in tsun-thàn Palân ê kè-bô͘, hō͘ Isulael lâng tī Bohol ê tāi-tsì tik-tsuē Siōngtsú, tì-sú Siōngtsú ê huē-tsiòng tú-tio̍h un-i̍k.
English: Behold, these caused the children of Israel, through the counsel of Balaam, to commit trespass against Yahweh in the matter of Peor, and so the plague was among the congregation of Yahweh.

Tailo: Nā ū lâng ká-mō͘ guán ê miâ kóng guán ū ī-giân á-.sī thuân-káng á-.sī siá phue kóng, Tsú ê ji̍t tsit-má kàu à, lín ê sim m̄-thang suî-piān iô-tāng, mā m̄-thang kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: not to be quickly shaken in your mind, nor yet be troubled, either by spirit, or by word, or by letter as from us, saying that the day of Christ had come.

Tailo: Só͘lômóng ê bé sī tuì Aigi̍p ūn-.lâi ê, sī ông ê sing-lí lâng, tsi̍t tsūn tsi̍t tsūn, tsiàu kè-tsîⁿ bé-.lâi ê.
English: The horses which Solomon had were brought out of Egypt; and the king's merchants received them in droves, each drove at a price.

Tailo: Lí bô o̍h in ê só͘ kiâⁿ, mā bô tsiàu in khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì khì tsò, lí lia̍h-tsò sió-khuá tāi-tsì, lí só͘ kiâⁿ ê it-tshè pí in khah tshàu miâ-siaⁿ.
English: Yet have you not walked in their ways, nor done after their abominations; but, as if that were a very little thing, you were more corrupt than they in all your ways.

Tailo: I ē kiù-sio̍k in ê sèⁿ-miā thuat-lī ap-pik kah pō-gio̍k; i ē khuànn in ê hueh tsò pó-puè.
English: He will redeem their soul from oppression and violence. Their blood will be precious in his sight.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, Lí ê tsik-pī tsi̍t-ē huat, Lí ê phīⁿ-khang ê khuì tsi̍t-ē tshut, hái-té tsiū tshut-hiān, tāi-tē ê kin-ki mā lō͘-hiān.
English: Then the channels of waters appeared, The foundations of the world were laid bare at your rebuke, Yahweh, At the blast of the breath of your nostrils.

Tailo: Tng tsè-si tuì sìng-só͘ tshut-.lâi ê sî, ū hûn tshiong-muá Siōngtsú ê tiān;
English: It came to pass, when the priests were come out of the holy place, that the cloud filled the house of Yahweh,

Tailo: Pàng tsi̍t tsiah o͘-a tshut-.khì. O͘-a pue-lâi pue khì, it-ti̍t kàu tē-tsiūⁿ ê tsuí ta-.khì.
English: and he sent forth a raven. It went back and forth, until the waters were dried up from the earth.

Tailo: Lín tsiah-ê kiáⁿ, tio̍h thiaⁿ lāu-pē ê kà-sī; tio̍h tsuan-sim ha̍k-si̍p lâi tit-tio̍h bîng-lí.
English: Listen, sons, to a father's instruction. Pay attention and know understanding;

Tailo: Sè-î kiânn kan-îm lâi puē-puān i ê tiōng-hu, lī-khui i tò tńg-khì Iôtah Bia̍tléhèm, kàu lāu-pē ê ke, tuà hia sì gue̍h-ji̍t.
English: His concubine played the prostitute against him, and went away from him to her father's house to Bethlehem Judah, and was there the space of four months.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, tsiah-ê put-kò sī I só͘ tsò ê sió-khuá tāi-tsì; lán só͘ tuì I thiaⁿ-tio̍h ê siann sè kàu án-tsuáⁿ? I tuā kuân-lîng ê luî, siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng tshik-to̍k?
English: Behold, these are but the outskirts of his ways. How small a whisper do we hear of him! But the thunder of his power who can understand?

Tailo: Í-āu Guá beh kā Iôtah ông Tsetikiah kah i ê jîn-sîn, jîn-bîn, to̍h-sī tī tsit-ê siâⁿ lāi, tuì un-i̍k, to-kiàm, ki-hng só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê, lóng kau tī Babúlông ông Nepkatnetsal ê tshiú kah in ê tuì-ti̍k ê tshiú, í-ki̍p siàu-siūⁿ in ê sèⁿ-miā ê lâng ê tshiú. I ē īng to kā in thâi-sí, bô pó-sioh, bô khó-liân, bô khuan-iông. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê. '
