English: Afterward, says Yahweh, I will deliver Zedekiah king of Judah, and his servants, and the people, even such as are left in this city from the pestilence, from the sword, and from the famine, into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and into the hand of their enemies, and into the hand of those who seek their life: and he shall strike them with the edge of the sword; he shall not spare them, neither have pity, nor have mercy.

Tailo: Lâng teh kóng, ' Lán uá-khò I lâi sing-ua̍h, hîng-tōng kah tsûn-tsāi', tú tshin-tshiūnn lín tiong-kan ê si-jîn ū án-ne kóng, ' In-uī lán mā sī I ê kiáⁿ-sun. '
English: For in him we live, and move, and have our being.' As some of your own poets have said, For we are also his offspring.'

Tailo: Tsa̍p-jī-.gue̍h, to̍h-sī A-ta̍t gue̍h ê tsa̍p-saⁿ, ông ê bīng-līng kah jū-tsí teh beh kí-hîng, to̍h-sī Iôtah lâng ê tuì-ti̍k ǹg-bāng tit-tio̍h kā in kuán-hat ê ji̍t, tsóng-.sī, tāi-tsì tuì-huán, tian-tò hō͘ Iôtah lâng kuán-hat só͘-ū uàn-hūn in ê lâng.
English: Now in the twelfth month, which is the month Adar, on the thirteenth day of the same, when the king's commandment and his decree drew near to be put in execution, on the day that the enemies of the Jews hoped to have rule over them, (whereas it was turned to the contrary, that the Jews had rule over those who hated them),

Tailo: Guá tsiū kiaⁿ guá tsiah-ê iu-khó͘, in-uī guá tsai Siōngtè it-tīng bô lia̍h guá tsò bô tsuē.
English: I am afraid of all my sorrows, I know that you will not hold me innocent.

Tailo: Kî-tó ê sî, Iésu ê bīn-māu ū kái-piàn. I ê saⁿ piàn kah pe̍h-siak-siak koh kng iàⁿ-iàⁿ.
English: As he was praying, the appearance of his face was altered, and his clothing became white and dazzling.

Tailo: Kah só͘-ū Siōngtè tsú-bîn ê kàu-huē kāng-khuán, tsa-bó͘ lâng tī kàu-huē tiong tio̍h tiām-tiām, m̄-thang huat-giân. Iô-tá-iah lâng ê lu̍t-huat mā kui-tīng in tio̍h sūn-ho̍k.
English: let your wives keep silent in the assemblies, for it has not been permitted for them to speak; but let them be in subjection, as the law also says.

Tailo: Tik-khak bô lâng tuà tī hia, mā bô lâng kià-kha tī hia, ē tshin-tshiūⁿ So͘tóm, Ammo͘la̍h, kah hù-kīn ê siâⁿ tó-huāi.
English: As in the overthrow of Sodom and Gomorrah and the neighbor cities of it, says Yahweh, no man shall dwell there, neither shall any son of man sojourn therein.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tio̍h tsun-siú I ê lu̍t-lē kài-bīng, to̍h-sī guá kin-á-ji̍t só͘ bīng-līng lí ê, hō͘ lí kah lí ê kiáⁿ-sun thang tit-tio̍h hok-khì, koh ke-thinn lí ê ji̍t-tsí kú-tn̂g, tī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí ê tē, ti̍t-kàu íng-uán.
English: You shall keep his statutes, and his commandments, which I command you this day, that it may go well with you, and with your children after you, and that you may prolong your days in the land, which Yahweh your God gives you, forever.

Tailo: Lô-bo-àm ông tshe kuán-lí tsò khó͘-kang ê lâng Atolâm khì Isulael lâng hia, Isulael jîn-bîn tsiū īng tsio̍h-thâu kā i tìm-sí. Lô-bo-àm ông tsiū kuáⁿ-kín tsiūⁿ tshia, tsáu-khì Êlúsalèm.
English: Then king Rehoboam sent Adoram, who was over the men subject to forced labor; and all Israel stoned him to death with stones. King Rehoboam made speed to get him up to his chariot, to flee to Jerusalem.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kám-siā Siōngtsú; in-uī I sī hó, I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tī-.leh.
English: Oh give thanks to Yahweh; for he is good; For his loving kindness endures forever.

Tailo: Siōngtè í-king kā I ìng-ín ê pó-puè kah ki̍k tuā ê un-tián siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lán, hō͘ lín thong-kuè tsiah-ê ìng-ín thang thuat-lī sè-kan ê tsîng-io̍k só͘ tsō-sîng ê pāi-huāi, lâi hun-hióng Siōngtè ê sîn-sìng.
English: by which he has granted to us his precious and exceedingly great promises; that through these you may become partakers of the divine nature, having escaped from the corruption that is in the world by lust.

Tailo: Ial-mut kah i ê kau-iá, Ún-kan-lîng kah i ê kau-iá, kiōng sì tsō siâⁿ hō͘ in.
English: Jarmuth with its suburbs, En Gannim with its suburbs; four cities.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Siōngtsú ê tsû-ài kui tī kìng-uì I ê lâng, tuì íng-uán kàu íng-uán; I ê kong-gī mā kui tī i ê kiáⁿ-kiáⁿ sun-sun;
English: But Yahweh's loving kindness is from everlasting to everlasting with those who fear him, His righteousness to children's children;

Tailo: hō͘ guán tshin-tshiūnn lia̍t kok án-ne, guán ê ông phuàⁿ-tuàn guán tiong-kan ê būn-tê, tsò thâu tshuā guán, thè guán kau-tsiàn.
English: that we also may be like all the nations, and that our king may judge us, and go out before us, and fight our battles.

Tailo: Guán uī-tio̍h Ki-tok ê iân-kò͘ tsò gōng lâng, lín kah Ki-tok kiat-liân tsò khiáu-lâng. Guán luán-jio̍k, lín ióng-tsòng; lín siū tsun-tiōng, guán hō͘ lâng khin-sī.
English: We are fools for Christ's sake, but you are wise in Christ. We are weak, but you are strong. You have honor, but we have dishonor.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kín-sīn kò͘-siú, it-ti̍t kàu lín tī Êlúsalèm Siōngtsú tiān ê pâng lāi, tī tsè-si ê thâu-lâng kah Lēbī lâng, í-ki̍p Isulael hiah-ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ ê bīn-tsîng kā i tshìn.
English: Watch you, and keep them, until you weigh them before the chiefs of the priests and the Levites, and the princes of the fathers' houses of Israel, at Jerusalem, in the chambers of the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá — Piattò͘, sī Iésu Ki-tok ê sù-tô͘, siá tsit tiuⁿ phue kià hō͘ sì-suàⁿ pī-lān, tī Pong-to͘, Ga-la̍h-tia, Ge-bah-to-kiah, A-si-a kah Pí-tshui-nî teh khiā-khí ê Siōngtè suán-bîn.
English: Peter, an apostle of Jesus Christ, to the chosen ones who are living as strangers in the Dispersion in Pontus, Galatia, Cappadocia, Asia, and Bithynia,

Tailo: In tsûn nn̄g-iūⁿ ê sim, taⁿ ē siū tīng tsuē. Siōngtsú ē thiah in ê tsè-tuâⁿ, huí in ê thiāu-siōng.
English: Their heart is divided. Now they will be found guilty. He will demolish their altars. He will destroy their sacred stones.

Tailo: Lô-pa khì tsiàm Ke-na̍t kah Ke-na̍t tsiah-ê tsng-thâu, tsiū tsiàu ka-kī ê miâ kā i tshing-tsò Lô-pa.
English: Nobah went and took Kenath, and the villages of it, and called it Nobah, after his own name.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, Lí ê uē khak-li̍p tī thiⁿ-.ni̍h, ti̍t-kàu íng-uán.
English: Yahweh, your word is settled in heaven forever.

Tailo: Taⁿ guá uī-tio̍h lín siū tsiah-ê kan-khó͘, kám-kak tsin huann-hí; guá jio̍k-thé siū khó͘ sī uī-tio̍h Ki-tok ê sing-khu, to̍h-sī kàu-huē, teh siū iáu-buē tsīn ê khó͘-lān.
English: Now I rejoice in my sufferings for your sake, and fill up on my part that which is lacking of the afflictions of Christ in my flesh for his body's sake, which is the assembly;

Tailo: Tàng-sng ê lâng só͘ īng ê huat-tō͘ sī pháiⁿ ê, i siat kè-bô͘, īng pe̍h-tsha̍t uē huí-bia̍t kan-khó͘ lâng; sàn-tshiah lâng káng-lūn kong-lí ê sî, i mā tsiàu-siông kiânn huí-bia̍t.
English: The ways of the scoundrel are evil. He devises wicked devices to destroy the humble with lying words, Even when the needy speaks right.

Tailo: Iôtah ông Tsetikiah tē-tsa̍p nî, to̍h-sī Nepkatnetsal tsa̍p-peh nî, ū Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah.
English: The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh in the tenth year of Zedekiah king of Judah, which was the eighteenth year of Nebuchadnezzar.

Tailo: Si-phian Tē-it Kuàn(1~41 phiⁿ） Bô kiâⁿ pháiⁿ lâng ê kè-bô͘, bô khiā tsuē-jîn ê lō͘, bô kah bú-bān ê lâng tsē tsò-hué, tsit khuán lâng ū hok-khì.
English: Blessed is the man who doesn't walk in the counsel of the wicked, Nor stand in the way of sinners, Nor sit in the seat of scoffers;

Tailo: Biāniámín lâng mā tī tē-jī ji̍t tuì Gi-be-at tshut-.lâi, kā in kong-kik, koh thâi-sí Isulael lâng tsi̍t-bān peh-tshing lâng, tó tī tē-.ni̍h, lóng sī gia̍h to ê.
English: Benjamin went forth against them out of Gibeah the second day, and destroyed down to the ground of the children of Israel again eighteen thousand men; all these drew the sword.

Tailo: Lín nā án-ne tsò, tsiū ē tsiâⁿ-tsò Thiⁿ-pē ê kiáⁿ-jî, in-uī I hō͘ ji̍t-thâu tsiò pháiⁿ lâng kah hó lâng, mā uī-tio̍h gī lâng kah put-gī ê lâng lo̍h hō͘.
English: that you may be children of your Father who is in heaven. For he makes his sun to rise on the evil and the good, and sends rain on the just and the unjust.

Tailo: Siōngtè ah, Lí lo̍h tuā hō͘; Lí ê sán-gia̍p — Isulael ià-siān ê sî, Lí hō͘ i kian-kò͘.
English: You, God, sent a plentiful rain. You confirmed your inheritance, when it was weary.

Tailo: In-uī suí ê tshiong-ki ū tsin tsē îm-hīng, si̍p-kuàn tsò ang-î, īng i ê îm-hīng bê-hi̍k lia̍t kok, īng i ê siâ-su̍t bê-hi̍k tsin tsē tso̍k.
English: because of the multitude of the prostitution of the alluring prostitute, the mistress of witchcraft, who sells nations through her prostitution, and families through her witchcraft.

Tailo: to̍h-sī Iôtah ê kuì-tso̍k, Êlúsalèm ê kuì-tso̍k, í-ki̍p thài-kàm, tsè-si kah kíng lāi tsìng lâng, kiàn-nā tuì phuà-khui ê gû-á ê tiong-kan king-kuè ê.
English: the princes of Judah, and the princes of Jerusalem, the eunuchs, and the priests, and all the people of the land, who passed between the parts of the calf;

Tailo: Iâkop kóng, Kin-á-ji̍t lí tio̍h tuì guá tsiù-tsuā. Esáu tsiū tuì i tsiù-tsuā, kā tuā-kiáⁿ ê miâ-hūn bē hō͘ Iâkop.
English: Jacob said, Swear to me first. He swore to him. He sold his birthright to Jacob.

Tailo: Hit sî, Tabi̍t kóng, Tû-khì Lēbī lâng í-guā, bô lâng thang kng Siōngtè ê iok-kuī, in-uī Siōngtsú kíng in lâi kng Siōngtsú ê iok-kuī, koh ho̍k-sāi I ti̍t-kàu íng-uán.
English: Then David said, None ought to carry the ark of God but the Levites: for them has Yahweh chosen to carry the ark of God, and to minister to him forever.

Tailo: Kûn-tsiòng sì-suàⁿ liáu-āu, Iésu tsiū ka-kī tsiūⁿ suaⁿ kî-tó. Thiⁿ í-king àm, kan-taⁿ I ka-kī tī hia.
English: After he had sent the multitudes away, he went up into the mountain by himself to pray. When evening had come, he was there alone.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h khuànn, Siōngtsú í-king kā An-hioh-ji̍t siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín, só͘-í, tē-la̍k ji̍t I hō͘ lín nn̄g ji̍t ê bí-niûⁿ, tē-tshit ji̍t ta̍k lâng tio̍h tiàm ka-kī ê só͘-tsāi, lóng m̄-thang tshut-.khì.
English: Behold, because Yahweh has given you the Sabbath, therefore he gives you on the sixth day the bread of two days. Everyone stay in his place. Let no one go out of his place on the seventh day.

Tailo: Kā in kóng, Guá ê sim iu-būn kah kiōng- beh sí, lín tuà tsia tio̍h kíng-síng.
English: He said to them, My soul is exceedingly sorrowful, even to death. Stay here, and watch.

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h tī tsheh-.ni̍h siá tsiah-ê tsiù-tsó͘ ê uē, īng hiah-ê jī buah ji̍p-khì tī khó͘-tsuí-.ni̍h.
English: The priest shall write these curses in a book, and he shall blot them out into the water of bitterness.

Tailo: sī tshin-tshiūnn lâng siám-phiah sai lâi tô-tsáu, koh khì tú-tio̍h hîm, ji̍p-khì tshù lāi tshiú tsi̍t-ē uá piah, tsiū hō͘ tsuâ kā-tio̍h.
English: As if a man fled from a lion, And a bear met him; Or he went into the house and leaned his hand on the wall, And a snake bit him.

Tailo: M̄-thang pîn-tuāⁿ, tio̍h o̍h hiah-ê tuì sìn kah thun-lún lâi sîng-tsiap Siōngtè ìng-ín ê lâng.
English: that you won't be sluggish, but imitators of those who through faith and patience inherited the promises.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tsia̍h bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ la̍k ji̍t, tē-tshit ji̍t lí tio̍h siú Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè ê giâm-siok-huē, lóng m̄-thang tsò-kang.
English: Six days you shall eat unleavened bread; and on the seventh day shall be a solemn assembly to Yahweh your God; you shall do no work therein.

Tailo: I koh tshuā guá tuì pak mn̂g lâi-kàu tiān ê thâu-tsîng. Guá tsiū khuànn, khuàⁿ-tio̍h Siōngtsú ê îng-kng tshiong-muá Siōngtsú ê tiān, guá tsiū phak lo̍h tē.
English: Then he brought me by the way of the north gate before the house; and I looked, and behold, the glory of Yahweh filled the house of Yahweh: and I fell on my face.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tsiū siū-khì Isulael lâng, kóng, In-uī tsiah-ê jîn-bîn uî-puē Guá ê iok, to̍h-sī Guá só͘ bīng-līng in ê tsó͘-sian ê, mā bô tsun-thàn Guá ê uē,
English: The anger of Yahweh was kindled against Israel; and he said, Because this nation have transgressed my covenant which I commanded their fathers, and have not listened to my voice;

Tailo: In koh kóng, Lâi! Lán tio̍h khí siâⁿ kah thah, thah-tíng tú thiⁿ, uī lán li̍p tsi̍t-ê miâ, bián-tit lán sì-suàⁿ tī tsuân tē.
English: They said, Come, let's build ourselves a city, and a tower whose top reaches to the sky, and let's make ourselves a name, lest we be scattered abroad on the surface of the whole earth.

Tailo: In-uī Lí bat īng khuì-la̍t hâ guá, hō͘ guá ē kau-tsiàn, Lí hō͘ hiah-ê khí-lâi kong-kik guá ê, lóng khut-ho̍k tī guá.
English: For you have girded me with strength to the battle; You have subdued under me those who rose up against me.

Tailo: Lāu-su ah, lu̍t-huat tiong tó tsi̍t tiâu kài-bīng siōng tiōng-iàu?
English: Teacher, which is the greatest commandment in the law?

Tailo: Sio̍k lāi-īⁿ jī-tsa̍p tiú ê tuì-bīn, koh sio̍k guā-īⁿ pho͘ tsio̍h tē ê tuì-bīn, ū lâu ê lông tuì lâu ê lông, saⁿ tsàn.
English: Over against the twenty cubits which belonged to the inner court, and over against the pavement which belonged to the outer court, was gallery against gallery in the third story.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè kóng, ' Guá si̍t-tsāi bat kóng, lí ê ke, lí ê lāu-pē ê ke ē íng-uán kiânn tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng; tsóng-.sī, taⁿ Siōngtsú kóng, Guá tsua̍t-tuì bô beh án-ne, in-uī tsun-tiōng Guá ê, Guá ē kā i tsun-tiōng; biáu-sī Guá ê, i ē siū khuànn-khin.
English: Therefore Yahweh, the God of Israel, says, I said indeed that your house, and the house of your father, should walk before me forever: but now Yahweh says, Be it far from me; for those who honor me I will honor, and those who despise me shall be lightly esteemed.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kian-siú tuì khí-thâu só͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê sìn-sit. Lín nā kian-siú tuì khí-thâu só͘ thiaⁿ ê sìn-sit, lín tsiū ē kè-sio̍k ua̍h tī Kiáⁿ kah Thiⁿ-pē ê lāi-bīn.
English: Therefore, as for you, let that remain in you which you heard from the beginning. If that which you heard from the beginning remains in you, you also will remain in the Son, and in the Father.

Tailo: In tio̍h kng huē-bō͘ hiah-ê tiùⁿ-pak, í-ki̍p huē-bō͘ kah i ê kuà kah tī hit tíng-bīn hái-káu phuê tsò ê kuà kah huē-bō͘ ê mn̂g-lî,
English: they shall carry the curtains of the tabernacle, and the Tent of Meeting, its covering, and the covering of sealskin that is above on it, and the screen for the door of the Tent of Meeting,

Tailo: Toh-tíng ê tsia̍h-mi̍h, jîn-sîn pâi-lia̍t teh tsē, lô͘-po̍k kin-tuè ho̍k-sāi, í-ki̍p in ê saⁿ-khò͘ kah i ê tsiú-tsìng, koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h i tsiūⁿ Siōngtsú sìng-tiān ê kiā-á, tsiū kiaⁿ kah hûn put hù-thé.
English: and the food of his table, and the sitting of his servants, and the attendance of his ministers, and their clothing, and his cup bearers, and his ascent by which he went up to the house of Yahweh; there was no more spirit in her.

Tailo: Guá m̄-sī ài lín khiām-tn̂g neh-tō͘ lâi hō͘ pa̍t lâng khah liōng-siōng, sī ài lín ū ki-huē hō͘-siong pang-tsān.
English: For this is not that others may be eased and you distressed,

Tailo: koh tī Ioltàn guā, kīn I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ, Ioltàn hô ê tang pîng, tī Lūbiān tsi-tso̍k ê tē, ū khòng-iá ê Be-tsel kah i ê kau-iá, Al-tsah kah i ê kau-iá,
English: and beyond the Jordan at Jericho, on the east side of the Jordan, were given them, out of the tribe of Reuben, Bezer in the wilderness with its suburbs, and Jahzah with its suburbs,

Tailo: Muí pak tiùⁿ tn̂g saⁿ-tsa̍p tiú, khuah sì tiú; tsa̍p-it pak tiùⁿ lóng sī sio-siâng ê tshùn-tshioh.
English: The length of each curtain was thirty cubits, and four cubits the breadth of each curtain. The eleven curtains had one measure.

Tailo: Bat Lí ê miâ ê lâng ē uá-khò Lí; in-uī Siōngtsú Lí m̄-bat khì-sak tsáu-tshuē Lí ê lâng.
English: Those who know your name will put their trust in you, For you, Yahweh, have not forsaken those who seek you.

Tailo: Tsú tuì i kóng, Khí-.lâi, khì hit tiâu kiò-tsò ' Ti̍t'ê ke-lō͘, tī Iôtah ê tshù tshuē tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò-tsò Sàulô ê Tà-soh lâng, lí ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h i tī hia teh kî-tó.
English: The Lord said to him, Arise, and go to the street which is called Straight, and inquire in the house of Judas for one named Saul, a man of Tarsus. For behold, he is praying,

Tailo: Lāi-guā tiān lāi bīn sì-kho͘-uî ê tshiûⁿ lóng ū tiau-khik, to̍h-sī tiau-khik ki-lō͘-ping, tsó tshiū kah hue-luí ê khuán-sit.
English: He carved all the walls of the house round about with carved figures of cherubim and palm trees and open flowers, inside and outside.

Tailo: In ē thâi-su pua̍h-tó; guán ē khí-lâi khiā tsāi-tsāi.
English: They are bowed down and fallen, But we rise up, and stand upright.

Tailo: Hit sî, Etóm ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, Mô͘ap ing-hiông ê lâng tì-sú phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah, tuà tī Ka-nân tē ê jîn-bîn, sim lóng siau-iûⁿ.
English: Then the chiefs of Edom were dismayed. Trembling takes hold of the mighty men of Moab. All the inhabitants of Canaan are melted away.

Tailo: Kûn-tsiòng tsū-tsi̍p uá-.khì, iau-kiû Pí-la̍h-to tsiàu kuàn-lē lâi pàng tsi̍t-ê huān-lâng.
English: The multitude, crying aloud, began to ask him to do as he always did for them.

Tailo: Alông tuì in ê tshiú tsiap-.lâi, tsù tsi̍t tsiah gû-á, īng tshiám-to-á tiau-khik. Jîn-bîn tsiū kóng, Isulael, tse sī lí ê sîn-bîng, tshuā lí tshut Aigi̍p tē ê.
English: He received what they handed him, and fashioned it with an engraving tool, and made it a molten calf; and they said, These are your gods, Israel, which brought you up out of the land of Egypt.

Tailo: In ê tshuì thò͘-tshut pháiⁿ uē, tshuì-tûn ū to; in siūⁿ kóng, siáⁿ lâng ū thiaⁿ-.tio̍h?
English: Behold, they spew with their mouth. Swords are in their lips, For, they say, who hears us?

Tailo: Lán tian-tò tio̍h īng thiàⁿ-sim kóng sîng-si̍t-uē, ta̍k hong-bīn lóng o̍h Ki-tok ê bô͘-iūⁿ lâi tsiām-tsiām sîng-tióng, in-uī Ki-tok sī lán ê thâu.
English: but speaking truth in love, we may grow up in all things into him, who is the head, Christ;

Tailo: I tuì ông ê sī-uē-tiúⁿ — Alio̍k, kóng, Ông só͘ tshut ê bīng-līng ná ē kah tsiah kín-kip? Alio̍k tsiū kā tsit-ê tāi-tsì tuì Taniel kóng.
English: he answered Arioch the king's captain, Why is the decree so urgent from the king? Then Arioch made the thing known to Daniel.

Tailo: I koh huâi-īn seⁿ kiáⁿ, kóng, Tsit-má guá beh o-ló Siōngtsú. Só͘-í, i kā i ê miâ kiò-tsò Iôtah. Jiânāu i tsiū thîng-tsí, bô koh seⁿ.
English: She conceived again, and bore a son. She said, This time will I praise Yahweh. Therefore she named him Judah. Then she stopped bearing.

Tailo: Tuā suaⁿ iáu-buē tiāⁿ-tio̍h, sió suaⁿ iáu-buē ū tsìn-tsîng, guá í-king tshut-sì.
English: Before the mountains were settled in place, Before the hills, I was brought forth;

Tailo: Siān-sū m̄-sī kan-taⁿ guá kah lín tsò-hué ê sî tio̍h tsò, sī tio̍h put-sî jia̍t-sim khì tsò.
English: But it is always good to be zealous in a good cause, and not only when I am present with you.

Tailo: Iôséhuh tsiū tī tsú-lâng ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián, lâi kā i ho̍k-sāi; tsú-lâng siat-li̍p i kuán-lí i ê ke, kā it-tshè só͘-ū ê lóng kau i ê tshiú.
English: Joseph found favor in his sight. He ministered to him, and he made him overseer over his house, and all that he had he put into his hand.

Tailo: In-uī kan-taⁿ thiaⁿ lu̍t-huat ê lâng, tī Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng m̄-sī gī lâng, tsí ū tsun-hîng lu̍t-huat ê lâng tsiah ē hō͘ Siōngtè jīm-tīng tsò gī lâng.
English: For it isn't the hearers of the law who are righteous before God, but the doers of the law will be justified

Tailo: Guá ū tsin tsē tāi-tsì beh kā lín kóng, m̄-koh, bô ài īng tsuá kah pit; guá khah ǹg-bāng khì lín hia, tng-bīn tsò-hué kóng, thang hō͘ lán ê huann-hí tshiong-muá.
English: Having many things to write to you, I don't want to do so with paper and ink, but I hope to come to you, and to speak face to face, that our joy may be made full.

Tailo: Īng to thâi-sí Iô-há-neh ê a-hiaⁿ Iâkop.
English: He killed James, the brother of John, with the sword.

Tailo: In bē-tàng tshiùⁿ kua lim tsiú; kāu tsiú tuì lim ê lâng ē tsiâⁿ-tsò khó͘.
English: They will not drink wine with a song. Strong drink will be bitter to those who drink it.

Tailo: Siōngtsú hō͘ lâng tsai I ê tsín-kiù, tī lia̍t pang hián-bîng I ê kong-gī;
English: Yahweh has made known his salvation. He has openly shown his righteousness in the sight of the nations.

Tailo: Kî-tiong ū Hu-mé-nái kah A-li̍k-san-toh; guá í-king kā in kau hō͘ Satán, hō͘ in siū kíng-kài, bē koh huí-pòng, siat-to̍k Siōngtè.
English: of whom is Hymenaeus and Alexander; whom I delivered to Satan, that they might be taught not to blaspheme.

Tailo: Tse-bul tuì i kóng, Lí bat kóng, Amí-me-li̍k sī siáⁿ lâng, hō͘ lán kā i ho̍k-sāi, lí kóng tsiah-ê uē ê tshuì tī tó-uī? Tse kám m̄-sī lí só͘ biáu-sī ê jîn-bîn? Lí taⁿ tio̍h tshut-khì kah in kau-tsiàn.
English: Then said Zebul to him, Where is now your mouth, that you said, Who is Abimelech, that we should serve him? is not this the people that you have despised? go out now, I pray, and fight with them.

Tailo: Ông ê jîn-sîn kā i kóng, Hamán khiā tī īⁿ lāi. Ông kóng, Kiò i ji̍p-.lâi.
English: The king's servants said to him, Behold, Haman stands in the court. The king said, Let him come in.

Tailo: Kim siak-siak ê kng tuì pak-hong tshut-.lâi; Siōngtè ū ui-giâm thang kiaⁿ.
English: Out of the north comes golden splendor; With God is awesome majesty.

Tailo: Nn̄g-nî lāi, Guá beh kā Babúlông ông — Nepkatnetsal tuì tsit só͘-tsāi tshiúⁿ khì-kàu Babúlông, to̍h-sī Siōngtsú ê tiān só͘-ū ê khì-kū, lóng beh hō͘ i tò tńg-lâi tsit só͘-tsāi.
English: Within two full years will I bring again into this place all the vessels of Yahweh's house, that Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon took away from this place, and carried to Babylon:

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, tiōng-hu thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê ji̍t, nā kā i huì-tû, kiàn-nā i ê tshuì só͘ tshut ê, á-.sī só͘ hē ê guān, á-.sī ka-kī iok ê, tsiū lóng bē sîng-li̍p, in-uī i ê tiōng-hu í-king kā i huì-tû, Siōngtsú mā ē sià-bián i.
English: But if her husband made them null and void in the day that he heard them, then whatever proceeded out of her lips concerning her vows, or concerning the bond of her soul, shall not stand: her husband has made them void; and Yahweh will forgive her.

Tailo: I tsiū kā in kóng, Tuì tsia̍h ê tshut tsia̍h-mi̍h, Τuì kiông ê tshut tinn. In saⁿ ji̍t lāi tshai bē-tshut.
English: He said to them, Out of the eater came forth food, Out of the strong came forth sweetness. They couldn't in three days declare the riddle.

Tailo: Tsiū lia̍h ing-kai suà-tsiap i ê ông-uī ê tuā-kiáⁿ, tī siâⁿ tíng kā i hiàn tsò sio-tsè. Ū tuā thòng-hūn kàu tī Isulael, in tsiū lī-khui i, tńg-khì in pún-kok.
English: Then he took his eldest son who would have reigned in his place, and offered him for a burnt offering on the wall. There was great wrath against Israel: and they departed from him, and returned to their own land.

Tailo: Siōngtsú hing-khí tsi̍t-ê tuì-ti̍k lâi kong-kik Só͘lômóng, to̍h-sī Etóm lâng Hata̍t; i sī Etóm ông ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: Yahweh raised up an adversary to Solomon, Hadad the Edomite: he was of the king's seed in Edom.

Tailo: Isulael lâng tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ bīng-līng Mô͘se ê khì kiâⁿ, lâi pun hit-ê tē.
English: As Yahweh commanded Moses, so the children of Israel did; and they divided the land.

Tailo: Tuì tshing-khì ê lâng lâi kóng, bān-mi̍h lóng sī tshing-khì; tuì hiah-ê ù-uè kah bô sìn ê lâng lâi kóng, bô tsi̍t hāng mi̍h sī tshing-khì, liân in ê sim-su kah liông-sim mā lóng ù-uè.
English: To the pure, all things are pure; but to those who are defiled and unbelieving, nothing is pure; but both their mind and their conscience are defiled.

Tailo: Iôtah lâng kah Isulael lâng ē tsò-hué tsū-tsi̍p, uī ka-kī siat-li̍p tsi̍t-ê thâu-lâng, tuì tsit-ê tē-tsiūⁿ-.khì, in-uī E-tsu-le-el ê ji̍t ē tsiâⁿ-tsò tuā ê ji̍t.
English: The children of Judah and the children of Israel will be gathered together, and they will appoint themselves one head, and will go up from the land; for great will be the day of Jezreel.

Tailo: Mô͘se kah Isulael huē-tsiòng tú-á tī huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu teh khàu ê sî, hut-jiân ū Isulael tiong tsi̍t-ê lâng, tng in ba̍k-tsiu tsîng tshuā tsi̍t-ê Mítiân ê tsa-bó͘ lâng kàu i ê hiann-tī hia.
English: Behold, one of the children of Israel came and brought to his brothers a Midianite woman in the sight of Moses, and in the sight of all the congregation of the children of Israel, while they were weeping at the door of the tent of meeting.

Tailo: Asah kiânn Siōngtsú só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò hó ê, tshin-tshiūnn i ê tsó͘-sian Tabi̍t.
English: Asa did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh, as did David his father.

Tailo: Iôtah ông Io-si-iah ê kiáⁿ E-hō͘-iá-kim khí-thâu tsē-uī ê sî, ū tsit-ê uē tuì Siōngtsú lâi, kóng,
English: In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim the son of Josiah, king of Judah, came this word from Yahweh, saying,

Tailo: Kiàn-nā Alông kiáⁿ-sun tiong tsa-po͘-.ê, lóng tio̍h tsia̍h tsiah-ê mi̍h, tuì Siōngtsú ê hué-tsè tiong tsò íng-uán ê hūn-gia̍h, it-ti̍t kàu lín ê bān-sè-tāi. Bong tsiah-ê tsè-mi̍h ê lâng lóng ē tsiâⁿ-tsò sìng.
English: Every male among the children of Aaron shall eat of it, as their portion forever throughout your generations, from the offerings of Yahweh made by fire. Whoever touches them shall be holy.'

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, ē ū tuā lō͘ tuì Aigi̍p thàu kàu Asiul. Asiul lâng ē ji̍p-khì Aigi̍p, Aigi̍p lâng mā ē ji̍p-khì Asiul; Aigi̍p lâng ē kah Asiul lâng tsò-hué ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú.
English: In that day there will be a highway out of Egypt to Assyria, and the Assyrian shall come into Egypt, and the Egyptian into Assyria; and the Egyptians will worship with the Assyrians.

Tailo: Ông kóng, Siahuat ê kiáⁿ Elísiah ê thâu-khak, kin-á-ji̍t nā iû-guân liân tī i ê sing-khu, guān Siōngtsú ka-puē kā guá tsik-hua̍t!
English: Then he said, God do so to me, and more also, if the head of Elisha the son of Shaphat shall stand on him this day.

Tailo: I tsiū kā Kaleah ê kiáⁿ Io-ha-nân, í-ki̍p kah i tông-tsāi ê tsìng kun-tiúⁿ kah tsìng lâng, tuì sè kàu tuā lóng kiò in lâi,
English: Then called he Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces who were with him, and all the people from the least even to the greatest,

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k thang thau-thau-á thó͘-khuì, m̄-thang tshut siaⁿ, m̄-thang pān-lí song-sū, thâu-khak iû-guân tio̍h pau thâu-kin, kha iû-guân tio̍h tshīng ê, m̄-thang am lí ê tshuì-tûn, mā m̄-thang tsia̍h tiàu-song ê piáⁿ.
English: Sigh, but not aloud, make no mourning for the dead; bind your headdress on you, and put your shoes on your feet, and don't cover your lips, and don't eat men's bread.

Tailo: Tsetikiah ông kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, i tī lín ê tshiú-thâu, ông bē-tàng kan-sia̍p lín siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì.
English: Zedekiah the king said, Behold, he is in your hand; for the king is not he who can do anything against you.

Tailo: In-uī nā kā saⁿ-tshīng lo̍h-.khì, lán tsiū bē thǹg-pak-theh.
English: if so be that being clothed we will not be found naked.

Tailo: Guá kóng liáu, in tsiū bô koh kóng; guá ê uē tshin-tshiūnn hō͘ tih tī in ê tíng-bīn.
English: After my words they didn't speak again; My speech fell on them.

Tailo: Hit sî, tsiah-ê tuà tī iân hái ê jîn-bîn ē kóng, ' Lí khuàⁿ, lán tsiah-ê pîng-sî só͘ ǹg-bāng ê, to̍h-sī lán in-uī beh thuat-lī Asiul ông tsiah tsáu-khì kiû i tsín-kiù ê, kì-jiân án-ne, lán ná ē-tàng tô-thuat? '
English: The inhabitants of this coast land will say in that day, Behold, this is our expectation, where we fled for help to be delivered from the king of Assyria. And we, how will we escape?

Tailo: Nā kóng beh uá-khò lé-gî, guá mā ē; nā ū lâng siūⁿ kóng ē-tàng uá-khò lé-gî, guá koh khah ē-tàng.
English: though I myself might have confidence even in the flesh. If any other man thinks that he has confidence in the flesh, I yet more:

Tailo: Siâng khuán, Ki-tok mā m̄-sī ka-kī tsing-tshú-tsò tuā-tsè-si ê îng-iāu, huán-tńg sī Siōngtè tuì I kóng, Lí to̍h-sī guá ê Kiáⁿ, guá kin-á-ji̍t seⁿ Lí. (tsù, SPh 2:7)
English: So also Christ didn't glorify himself to be made a high priest, but it was he who said to him, You are my Son. Today I have become your father.

Tailo: Tabi̍t kì-jiân tshing Ki-tok tsò Tsú, Ki-tok ná ē tsò Tabi̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun?
English: David therefore calls him Lord, so how is he his son?

Tailo: In lâi-kàu lāu-pē Liû-el hia, lāu-pē mn̄g kóng, Kin-á-ji̍t lín ná ē hiah kín tńg-.lâi?
English: When they came to Reuel, their father, he said, How is it that you have returned so early today?

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, Guá í-king at-tn̄g Aigi̍p ông — Huâ-láu ê tshiú-kut; bô pau i ê siong, bô kô͘ io̍h, bô tsat pò͘-tiâu, thang hō͘ i ū la̍t gia̍h to.
English: Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh king of Egypt; and behold, it has not been bound up, to apply healing medicines, to put a bandage to bind it, that it be strong to hold the sword.

Tailo: Moltékái tshīng nâ-sik pe̍h-sik ê tiâu-ho̍k, tì tuā tíng ê kim bián-liû, koh tshīng tsí-sik iù-tē pò͘ ê guā-ho̍k, tuì ông ê bīn-tsîng tshut-.lâi.
English: Mordecai went forth from the presence of the king in royal clothing of blue and white, and with a great crown of gold, and with a robe of fine linen and purple: and the city of Shushan shouted and was glad.

Tailo: Siōngtè kì-jiân kóng-khí sin ê iok, tsiū hō͘ thâu tsi̍t-ê iok piàn-tsò kū ê. Hit-ê tsiām-tsiām kū khì koh sue-thè ê tsiū ē liâm-piⁿ siau-sit-.khì.
English: In that he says, A new covenant, he has made the first old. But that which is becoming old and grows aged is near to vanishing away.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Siōngtsú ē tī hué tiong kàng-lîm, I ê tshia tshin-tshiūnn kńg-lê-á hong; I īng tuā siū-khì lâi kiâⁿ pò-ìng, īng hué-iām kiânn tsik-hua̍t.
English: For, behold, Yahweh will come with fire, and his chariots shall be like the whirlwind; to render his anger with fierceness, and his rebuke with flames of fire.

Tailo: Guá kā lín kóng, m̄-sī. Lín nā bô hué-kái, lóng ē tshin-tshiūⁿ án-ne bia̍t-bông.
English: I tell you, no, but, unless you repent, you will all perish in the same way.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Isulael tso̍k tiong ê guā-pang lâng, to̍h-sī sim bô siū kat-lé, sing-khu bô siū kat-lé ê guā-pang lâng, lóng m̄-thang ji̍p-lâi Guá ê sìng-só͘.
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh, No foreigner, uncircumcised in heart and uncircumcised in flesh, shall enter into my sanctuary, of any foreigners who are among the children of Israel.

Tailo: I lâi-kàu Êlúsalèm, tuè i ê lâng tsin tsē, ū lo̍k-tô tsài phang-liāu kah n̂g-kim tsin tsē, mā ū pó-tsio̍h. I kìnn Só͘lômóng ê sî, tsiū kā sim-lāi it-tshè só͘ tsûn ê kah i kóng.
English: She came to Jerusalem with a very great train, with camels that bore spices, and very much gold, and precious stones; and when she was come to Solomon, she talked with him of all that was in her heart.

Tailo: Tāi-ke tsia̍h pá, kā be̍h-á hiat-lo̍h hái, thang hō͘ tsûn khah khin.
English: When they had eaten enough, they lightened the ship, throwing out the wheat into the sea.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng: I ê tshiū-nâ suî-jiân tsin ba̍t, in mā beh kā i tshò, in-uī in pí tsháu-me̍h khah tsē, bē-tàng sǹg-.tit.
English: They shall cut down her forest, says Yahweh, though it can't be searched; because they are more than the locusts, and are innumerable.

Tailo: Lí kám ē-tàng tshik-to̍k Siōngtè ê ò-pì? Lí kám ē-tàng thiat-té tshik-to̍k Tsuân-lîng-.ê?
English: Can you fathom the mystery of God? Or can you probe the limits of the Almighty?

Tailo: Siōngtè khuànn I it-tshè só͘ tsō ê tsiū kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tsin hó. Ū ê-hng, ū tsá-khí, sī tē-la̍k ji̍t.
English: God saw everything that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. There was evening and there was morning, a sixth day.

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ lâng tsiū khì, tsiàu Eliiah ê uē lâi kiâⁿ. Tsa-bó͘ lâng kah i ê ke kah Eliiah tsò-hué tsia̍h tsin tsē ji̍t.
English: She went and did according to the saying of Elijah: and she, and he, and her house, ate many days.

Tailo: Guá beh khiā tsiú-keⁿ lâu, khiā tī iâⁿ-tsē kuan-khuàⁿ, khuànn I tuì guá kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h uē, guá thang īng siáⁿ-mi̍h uē lâi piān-kái tshing-tshó.
English: I will stand at my watch, and set myself on the ramparts, and will look out to see what he will say to me, and what I will answer concerning my complaint.

Tailo: Guá ê bīn tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ ǹg tsit-ê siâⁿ, beh kàng tsai-hō, m̄ kàng hok-khì; tsit-ê siâⁿ beh kau tī Babúlông ông ê tshiú, i ē īng hué kā i sio.
English: For I have set my face on this city for evil, and not for good, says Yahweh: it shall be given into the hand of the king of Babylon, and he shall burn it with fire.

Tailo: Lí m̄-thang tsò hit khuán kā lâng tap-ìng, á-.sī kā khiàm-tsîⁿ ê lâng tsò tam-pó ê tāi-tsì.
English: Don't you be one of those who strike hands, Of those who are collateral for debts.

Tailo: Siōngtsú thok I ê lô͘-po̍k, hiah-ê sian-ti, kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke by his servants the prophets, saying,

Tailo: In-uī Lí tuì guá si-lo̍h tuā ê tsû-ài; Lí kiù guá ê sèⁿ-miā bián lo̍h ki̍k tshim ê im-hú.
English: For your loving kindness is great toward me. You have delivered my soul from the lowest Sheol.

Tailo: I koh tit-tio̍h ín-tsún thang īng ua̍h-khì pûn ji̍p-khì bíng-siù ê ngó͘-siōng, hō͘ bíng-siù ê ngó͘-siōng ē kóng-uē, koh sat-hāi só͘ ū bô pài bíng-siù ngó͘-siōng ê lâng.
English: It was given to him to give breath to it, to the image of the beast, that the image of the beast should both speak, and cause as many as wouldn't worship the image of the beast to be killed.

Tailo: Guá mā beh īng tshing ê tsuí hiù lín, lín tsiū sé tshing-khì; Guá beh kā lín sé-tshing, tû-khì lín it-tshè ê lah-sap kah lín só͘-ū ê ngó͘-siōng.
English: I will sprinkle clean water on you, and you shall be clean: from all your filthiness, and from all your idols, will I cleanse you.

Tailo: Tng teh siūⁿ ê sî, ū Tsú ê thiⁿ-sài tī i ê bîn-bāng tiong tshut-hiān, kóng, Tabi̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun — Iôséhuh, m̄-bián kiaⁿ, lí tio̍h tshuā Mâlíah kuè-mn̂g tsò bó͘, in-uī i só͘ huâi-īn ê thai sī tuì Sìng Sîn lâi ê.
English: But when he thought about these things, behold, an angel of the Lord appeared to him in a dream, saying, Joseph, son of David, don't be afraid to take to yourself Mary, your wife, for that which is conceived in her is of the Holy Spirit.

Tailo: Guá ê sim-sîn luân-bō͘ Siōngtsú ê tiān-īⁿ kàu beh hūn-.khì; guá ê sim-tn̂g, guá ê jio̍k-thé, ǹg ua̍h ê Siōngtsú kiû-kiò.
English: My soul longs, and even faints for the courts of Yahweh. My heart and my flesh cry out for the living God.

Tailo: Lín kî-tó ê sî, m̄-thang tshin-tshiūnn ké-hó ê lâng, uī-tio̍h ài beh hō͘ lâng khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, thiau-kò͘-ì khiā tī huē-tn̂g á-.sī tuā ke-lō͘ kháu kî-tó. Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, in í-king tit-tio̍h in ê pò-siúⁿ à.
English: When you pray, you shall not be as the hypocrites, for they love to stand and pray in the synagogues and in the corners of the streets, that they may be seen by men. Most assuredly, I tell you, they have received their reward.

Tailo: Thiⁿ ē hián-bîng i ê tsuē-ok, tē ē khí-lâi kong-kik i.
English: The heavens shall reveal his iniquity, The earth shall rise up against him.

Tailo: Guá ê kha tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kiânn Lí ê lō͘, guá ê kha m̄-bat ta̍h tshū khì.
English: My steps have held fast to your paths, My feet have not slipped.

Tailo: Mā kám-siā tshuā Isulael lâng tuì hit tiong-kan king-kuè ê Siōngtè, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: And made Israel to pass through the midst of it; For his loving kindness endures forever;

Tailo: Lí ji̍p-khì kā Aigi̍p ông Huâ-láu kóng, tio̍h tsún Isulael lâng lī-khui i ê tē.
English: Go in, speak to Pharaoh king of Egypt, that he let the children of Israel go out of his land.

Tailo: Kelsióng lâng tsiah-ê ke ê kang-tîng, só͘ tio̍h pān-lí, só͘ tio̍h kng ê, to̍h-sī tsiah-ê:
English: This is the service of the families of the Gershonites, in serving and in bearing burdens:

Tailo: mā mn̄g bān-kun ê Siōngtsú tiān lāi ê tsè-si í-ki̍p sian-ti, kóng, Guá li̍k-nî í-lâi, tī gō͘-gue̍h kan thî-khàu beh hō͘ ka-kī hun-pia̍t sè-sio̍k, taⁿ kám iáu-koh tio̍h án-ne kiânn?
English: and to speak to the priests of the house of Yahweh of Armies, and to the prophets, saying, Should I weep in the fifth month, separating myself, as I have done these so many years?

Tailo: Hn̂g-tsú koh tshe līng-guā tsi̍t-ê lô͘-po̍k khì siu-tso͘, tshân-tiān phah-siong i ê thâu-khak, koh kā i lîng-jio̍k.
English: Again, he sent another servant to them; and they threw stones at him, wounded him in the head, and sent him away shamefully treated.

Tailo: Nā ū lâng thuân pa̍t khuán bô hû-ha̍p lán ê Tsú Iésu Ki-tok tuan-tsiàⁿ ê tō-lí, koh bô tsiàu kìng-khiân ê kàu-gī,
English: If anyone teaches a different doctrine, and doesn't consent to sound words, the words of our Lord Jesus Christ, and to the doctrine which is according to godliness,

Tailo: Koh tuì Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng té bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ ê khing, the̍h-tshut tsi̍t tè bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ, tsi̍t tè iû-piáⁿ, tsi̍t tè po̍h piáⁿ, lóng hē tī iû kah tsiànn-thuí tíng-bīn.
English: and out of the basket of unleavened bread, that was before Yahweh, he took one unleavened cake, and one cake of oiled bread, and one wafer, and placed them on the fat, and on the right thigh.

Tailo: Sitòng kah tuà tī Albua̍t ê jîn-bîn tsò lí ê kò tsiúⁿ ê; lí tiong-kan ê gâu lâng tsò lí ê huāⁿ tuā ê.
English: The inhabitants of Sidon and Arvad were your rowers: your wise men, Tyre, were in you, they were your pilots.

Tailo: Siōngtè tsò ông tī-lí bān-kok; Siōngtè tsē tī I sìng ê pó-tsō.
English: God reigns over the nations. God sits on his holy throne.

Tailo: I koh-tsài án-tsuáⁿ khuán-thāi Lūbiān ê kiáⁿ-sun Elíap ê kiáⁿ Ta-than kah Amí-lâm, tē án-tsuáⁿ tī Isulael lâng ê tiong-kan khui tshuì kā in thun-tsia̍h kah in ê ka-kuàn, í-ki̍p in ê pò͘-pênn, kah it-tshè kin-tuè in ê ua̍h-mi̍h.
English: and what he did to Dathan and Abiram, the sons of Eliab, the son of Reuben; how the earth opened its mouth, and swallowed them up, and their households, and their tents, and every living thing that followed them, in the midst of all Israel:

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā lí ê kiáⁿ kóng, ' Í-tsîng guán tī Aigi̍p tsò Huâ-láu ê lô͘-lē, Siōngtsú īng tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú, tshuā guán tshut Aigi̍p.
English: then you shall tell your son, We were Pharaoh's bondservants in Egypt: and Yahweh brought us out of Egypt with a mighty hand;

Tailo: Kuí-tsà ê thian-phîng sī Siōngtsú só͘ thó-ià; kong-pêⁿ ê tshìn-thuî sī I só͘ huann-hí.
English: A false balance is an abomination to Yahweh, But accurate weights are his delight.

Tailo: Tng hiah-ê ji̍t, Iôtah ê kuì-tso̍k tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kià phue hō͘ Tobiiah, Tobiiah mā īng phue kā in huê-hok.
English: Moreover in those days the nobles of Judah sent many letters to Tobiah, and the letters of Tobiah came to them.

Tailo: Lín Tio̍h tshe lín tiong-kan tsi̍t-ê lâng khì tshuā lín ê sió-tī lâi. Lín tsiah-ê lóng tio̍h kuainn tī tsia, thang tsìng-bîng lín ê uē, khuànn lín ū sîng-si̍t á-bô; nā bô, guá kí Huâ-láu ê sèⁿ-miā lâi tsiù-tsuā, lín it-tīng sī tsing-thàm.
English: Send one of you, and let him get your brother, and you shall be bound, that your words may be tested, whether there is truth in you, or else by the life of Pharaoh surely you are spies.

Tailo: Tsit tsa̍p-ê lâng lóng sī Hametátha ê sun, Iôtah lâng ê tuì-ti̍k Hamán ê kiáⁿ. Tsóng-.sī, bô tshiúⁿ in ê tsâi-bu̍t.
English: the ten sons of Haman the son of Hammedatha, the Jew's enemy, killed they; but they didn't lay their hand on the spoil.

Tailo: Lín ē in-uī guá ê miâ hō͘ tsìng lâng uàn-hūn, to̍k-to̍k jím-nāi kàu-té ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h kiù.
English: You will be hated by all men for my name's sake, but he who endures to the end will be saved.

Tailo: In ta̍k lâng kuáⁿ-kín īng ka-kī ê saⁿ pho͘ tī kiā-á ê tíng-tsân, hē tī E-hú ê ē-bīn, in pûn sàu-kak kóng, E-hú tsò ông à!
English: Then they hurried, and took every man his garment, and put it under him on the top of the stairs, and blew the trumpet, saying, Jehu is king.

Tailo: Tio̍h īng si̍t hō͘ Mô͘ap, hō͘ i pue-tsáu. I tsiah-ê siâⁿ ē tì-kàu pha-hng, bô lâng tuà.
English: Give wings to Moab, that she may fly and get her away: and her cities shall become a desolation, without any to dwell therein.

Tailo: Páulô kah Ba-ná-ba tī Tel-bé thuân hok-im, hō͘ tsin tsē lâng tsiâⁿ-tsò sìn-tô͘. Āu-lâi, in tńg-khì Lú-su-toh, Í-ko-ni-óng kah Ai-ti-o-khè,
English: When they had preached the Good News to that city, and had made many disciples, they returned to Lystra, Iconium, and Antioch,

Tailo: Lí í-king tsiūⁿ-kàu kuân ê só͘-tsāi, kā hiah-ê hu-ló͘ lia̍h-.lâi; Lí tuì lâng ê tiong-kan tsiap-siū in só͘ hiàn ê, liân puē-gi̍k ê lâng mā hiàn, hō͘ Siōngtsú — Siōngtè thang tuà in tiong-kan.
English: You have ascended on high. You have led away captives. You have received gifts among men, Yes, among the rebellious also, that Yah God might dwell there.

Tailo: Guá Páulô, sī hōng Siōngtè ê tsí-ì tsò Ki-tok Iésu ê sù-tô͘, siá phue hō͘ tuà tī Ê-hu-soh, sio̍k Ki-tok Iésu ê tiong-si̍t ê sìn-tô͘.
English: Paul, an apostle of Christ Jesus through the will of God, to the saints who are at Ephesus, and the faithful in Christ Jesus:

Tailo: Mi̍h tsiáⁿ bô tsham iâm, kám ē tsia̍h-tit? Nn̄g-tshing kám ū tsu-bī?
English: Can that which has no flavor be eaten without salt? Or is there any taste in the white of an egg?

Tailo: Mô͘se ê tiūⁿ-lâng E-thu-ló tshuā Mô͘se ê tsa-bó͘ lâng Tsi̍p-pho-la̍h lâi, to̍h-sī Mô͘se tsîng tshe i tńg-.khì ê,
English: Jethro, Moses' father-in-law, received Zipporah, Moses' wife, after he had sent her away,

Tailo: Pah-siù ji̍p hia̍t, lóng tuà tī in ê tōng.
English: Then the animals take cover, And remain in their dens.

Tailo: tsit nn̄g-ê sio-tsèⁿ ê lâng tsiū tio̍h khiā tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng kah tong-sî ê tsè-si í-ki̍p sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ ê bīn-tsîng.
English: then both the men, between whom the controversy is, shall stand before Yahweh, before the priests and the judges who shall be in those days;

Tailo: Etóm tsiah-ê khe ē piàn-tsò tá-má-ka, thô͘-sua hún ē piàn-tsò liû-hông; i ê tē tsiâⁿ-tsò í-king to̍h ê tá-má-ka.
English: Its streams will be turned into pitch, Its dust into sulfur, And its land will become burning pitch.

Tailo: Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Guá só͘ li̍p ji̍t-sî, àm-sî ê iok nā ē bô-.khì, Guá nā bô siat thiⁿ-tē ê tīng-lē,
English: Thus says Yahweh: If my covenant of day and night fails, if I have not appointed the ordinances of heaven and earth;

Tailo: I ê ióng-sū ê tîn-pâi sī âng ê, tsiàn-sū lóng tshīng tsu-âng saⁿ. Tī i tsún-pī kau-tsiàn ê ji̍t, tsiàn-tshia ê kǹg-thih iām-iām sih, i ê tshiuⁿ bú-lâi bú-khì.
English: The shield of his mighty men is made red. The valiant men are in scarlet. The chariots flash with steel in the day of his preparation, and the pine spears are brandished.

Tailo: Tiâⁿ ê sai-bīn tio̍h ū uî, khuah gō͘-tsa̍p tiú, uî ê thiāu tsa̍p ki, khū tsa̍p-ê.
English: For the breadth of the court on the west side shall be hangings of fifty cubits; their pillars ten, and their sockets ten.

Tailo: Hit-ê tsiàu-bûn sī tuì ông ê tsáu bûn-su ê thuân kàu ông ê ta̍k síng, bīng-līng kā Iôtah lâng, tuì siàu-liân kàu lāu, enn-á kah tsa-bó͘ lâng, tī A-ta̍t gue̍h ê tsi̍t ji̍t lāi, to̍h-sī tsa̍p-jī-gue̍h tsa̍p-saⁿ, tsuân-pō͘ kā i bia̍t-tiāu, kā i thâi-sí, hō͘ i sí-bông, koh tshiúⁿ in ê tsâi-bu̍t lâi tsò tsiàn-lī-phín.
English: Letters were sent by posts into all the king's provinces, to destroy, to kill, and to cause to perish, all Jews, both young and old, little children and women, in one day, even on the thirteenth day of the twelfth month, which is the month Adar, and to take the spoil of them for a prey.

Tailo: Ông, thàu tiong-tàu ê sî, guá tī lō͘ tiong khuàⁿ-tio̍h pí ji̍t-thâu khah kiông ê kng, tuì thinn-tíng tsiò lo̍h-lâi tī guá kah tâng-phuāⁿ ê sì-kho͘-uî.
English: at noon, O King, I saw on the way a light from the sky, brighter than the sun, shining around me and those who traveled with me.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lâng sí tsiū tó ti̍t-ti̍t; khuì tsi̍t-ē tn̄g, lâng tī tó-uī?
English: But man dies, and is laid low. Yes, man gives up the spirit, and where is he?

Tailo: Guá beh koh mn̄g, Isulael lâng kám tsin-tsiàⁿ m̄-tsai? Mô͘se tsá-tsîng to̍h ū kóng kuè, Guá beh īng m̄-sī Guá ê tsú-bîn ê lâng lâi kik-khí lín ê tsi̍t-tò͘, īng m̄-bat guá ê guā-pang lâng lâi kik-khí lín ê siū-khì. （ Tsù, SBK 32:21)
English: But I ask, didn't Israel know? First Moses says, I will provoke you to jealousy with that which is no nation, With a nation void of understanding I will make you angry.

Tailo: Guá ê tshuì-tûn tsua̍t-tuì bô kóng put-gī, guá ê tsi̍h mā bô kóng kuí-tsà.
English: Surely my lips shall not speak unrighteousness, Neither shall my tongue utter deceit.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Siōngtè īng I ê lîng-li̍k lâi kiâⁿ tuā sū; siáⁿ lâng tsò kàu-su ū tshin-tshiūnn I?
English: Behold, God is exalted in his power. Who is a teacher like him?

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h tsun-siú guá kin-á-ji̍t só͘ bīng-līng lín ê it-tshè kài-bīng, hō͘ lín tsòng-táⁿ, ē-tàng ji̍p-khì sîng-tsiap lín só͘ beh kuè-khì sîng-tsiap ê tē,
English: Therefore shall you keep all the commandment which I command you this day, that you may be strong, and go in and possess the land, where you go over to possess it;

Tailo: Kiàn-nā ka-kī sí-.khì ê mi̍h, lín lóng m̄-thang tsia̍h, thang hō͘ lín mn̂g lāi kià-kha ê lâng tsia̍h á-.sī bē hō͘ guā-kok lâng tsia̍h, in-uī lí sī sìng ê jîn-bîn, sio̍k tī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè. Tsú suaⁿ-iûⁿ-á, m̄-thang īng i ê bú ê ling.
English: You shall not eat of anything that dies of itself: you may give it to the foreigner living among you who is within your gates, that he may eat it; or you may sell it to a foreigner: for you are a holy people to Yahweh your God. You shall not boil a kid in its mother's milk.

Tailo: Iosiúah tsiū tshòng hué-tsio̍h to, tī Pau-phuê suaⁿ （ Tsù, Guân i̍k-pún sī Tû-khì phuê suaⁿ ）hia, kā Isulael lâng kiânn kat-lé.
English: Joshua made himself flint knives, and circumcised the children of Israel at the hill of the foreskins.

Tailo: Mô͘se tshuā Isulael lâng tuì Âng-hái tsìn-tsîng kiâⁿ, in tshut-.khì, lâi-kàu Siu-l ê khòng-iá, tī khòng-iá kiânn saⁿ ji̍t, tshuē bô tsuí.
English: Moses led Israel onward from the Red Sea, and they went out into the wilderness of Shur; and they went three days in the wilderness, and found no water.

Tailo: In tī pún só͘-tsāi an-jiân sing-ua̍h, bô lâng hō͘ in kiaⁿ, tī Guá kā in tuì lia̍t kok tiong tshuā tò tńg-.lâi, tuì tuì-ti̍k ê tē tsū-tsi̍p uá-.lâi. Guá tī lia̍t kok ê bīn-tsîng, tī in sin tsiūⁿ hián-bîng tsò sìng ê sî, in ē tam-tng in ê kiàn-siàu kah in puē-gi̍k Guá it-tshè ê tsuē.
English: when I have brought them back from the peoples, and gathered them out of their enemies' lands, and am sanctified in them in the sight of many nations.

Tailo: Lí nā ū uē thang kóng, tsiū ìn guá; tsò lí kóng, in-uī guá ài lia̍h lí tsò gī.
English: If you have anything to say, answer me: Speak, for I desire to justify you.

Tailo: A-si-ke-lông ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h án-ne lâi kiaⁿ; Ga-jah khuàⁿ-tio̍h mā ē tsin kan-khó͘; Ik-lóng mā ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h in-uī sit-bōng lâi kiàn-siàu. Ga-jah it-tīng bô koh ū kun-ông, A-si-ke-lông bô koh ū lâng tuà.
English: Ashkelon will see it, and fear; Gaza also, and will writhe in agony; As will Ekron, for her expectation will be disappointed; And the king will perish from Gaza, And Ashkelon will not be inhabited.

Tailo: Memukan tī ông kah hiah-ê tāi-sîn ê bīn-tsîng, ìn kóng, Ông-hō͘ Ua-si-thih só͘ tsò ê m̄-nā bú-jio̍k ông, mā sī bô hō͘ Ahasuiló͘ ông tī ta̍k síng só͘-ū ê tāi-sîn kah tsìng lâng bīn-tsú.
English: Memucan answered before the king and the princes, Vashti the queen has not done wrong to the king only, but also to all the princes, and to all the peoples who are in all the provinces of the king Ahasuerus.

Tailo: Iésu kah Piattò͘, Iâkop, Iô-há-neh lâi-kàu kî-tha ê bûn-tô͘ hia, khuàⁿ-tio̍h kui tuā-tīn lâng kā in uî-.leh, mā ū king-ha̍k kàu-su kah in teh piān-lūn.
English: Coming to the disciples, he saw a great multitude around them, and scribes questioning them.

Tailo: Iésu kā in kóng, Tsit-ê uē m̄-sī ta̍k lâng lóng ē-tàng tsiap-siū. Kan-taⁿ ū tsit khuán un-sù ê lâng tsiah ē.
English: But he said to them, Not all men can receive this saying, but those to whom it is given.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Kàu hit ji̍t, ū ì-sù ē hing-khí tī lí ê sim, lí ē tô͘-bô͘ pháiⁿ ê kè-bô͘,
English: Thus says the Lord Yahweh: It shall happen in that day, that things shall come into your mind, and you shall devise an evil device:

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ i ê tshiú tshun-kàu tuā hái, tsiàⁿ tshiú tshun-kàu tuā hô.
English: I will set his hand also on the sea, And his right hand on the rivers.

Tailo: Guá thiaⁿ-tio̍h ū siaⁿ tuì thinn-tíng tshut-.lâi, tshin-tshiūnn tuā-tsuí teh tshiâng ê siann, mā tshin-tshiūnn luî teh tân ê siann; guá só͘ thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê siann, tshin-tshiūnn khîm-tshiú teh tuâⁿ khiā-khîm ê siann.
English: I heard a sound from heaven, like the sound of many waters, and like the sound of a great thunder. The sound which I heard was like that of harpists playing on their harps.

Tailo: Tī An-hioh-ji̍t tsîng tsi̍t ji̍t hông-hun ê sî, guá tsiū bīng-līng lâng kā Êlúsalèm siâⁿ mn̂g kuainn khí-.lâi, koh bīng-līng, An-hioh-ji̍t iáu-buē kuè m̄-thang khui; guá phài kuí-nā-ê lô͘-po̍k kuán-lí siâⁿ mn̂g, bián-tit ū lâng tī An-hioh-ji̍t taⁿ siáⁿ-mi̍h tàⁿ ji̍p-.lâi.
English: It came to pass that, when the gates of Jerusalem began to be dark before the Sabbath, I commanded that the doors should be shut, and commanded that they should not be opened until after the Sabbath: and some of my servants set I over the gates, that there should no burden be brought in on the Sabbath day.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ lí ê kiáⁿ-sun hui-siông tsē; kok-tō͘ ē tuì lí lâi li̍p, kun-ông ē tuì lí lâi tshut.
English: I will make you exceedingly fruitful, and I will make nations of you. Kings will come out of you.

Tailo: I tsiū huâi-īn seⁿ kiáⁿ, Iôtah tsiū kā i hō-miâ kiò-tsò El.
English: She conceived, and bore a son; and he named him Er.

Tailo: Lín khuànn, guá tshin-pit īng tsiah tuā ê jī siá phue hō͘ lín!
English: See with what large letters I write to you with my own hand.

Tailo: Án-ne, lán bô koh-tsài sī gín-á, bē koh hō͘ ta̍k tsióng kàu-gī ê hong iô-tāng phiau-liû, tiòng-tio̍h lâng ê kuí-kè kah muâ-phiàn, tì-sú hō͘ lâng ín-iú khì.
English: that we may no longer be children, tossed back and forth and carried about with every wind of doctrine, by the trickery of men, in craftiness, after the wiles of error;

Tailo: Iésu kā in kóng, Siàu-liân lâng, lín lia̍h ū hî bô? In kóng, Bô puàⁿ-bué..
English: Jesus therefore said to them, Children, have you anything to eat? They answered him, No.

Tailo: Ông tsiū tshut līng, lâng tsiū khì tshuā Taniel lâi, beh kā i hiat lo̍h-khì sai hia̍t. Ông tuì Taniel kóng, Lí ê Siōngtè, lí só͘ tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ teh ho̍k-sāi ê, I ē lâi kiù lí.
English: Then the king commanded, and they brought Daniel, and cast him into the den of lions. Now the king spoke and said to Daniel, Your God whom you serve continually, he will deliver you.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Tng hiah-ê ji̍t, tuì lia̍t kok bān-tso̍k tiong ē ū tsa̍p lâng khînn tsi̍t-ê Iôtah lâng ê saⁿ-á-ki, khînn i, kóng, ' Guán beh kah lín tsò-hué khì, in-uī guán thiaⁿ-tio̍h ū Siōngtsú kah lín tông-tsāi. '
English: Thus says Yahweh of Armies: In those days, ten men will take hold, out of all the languages of the nations, they will take hold of the skirt of him who is a Jew, saying, We will go with you, for we have heard that God is with you.'

Tailo: Lán ê tshù ê ênn-á sī pik-hiuⁿ tshâ, i ê kak-á sī tshîng-peh tshâ.
English: The beams of our house are cedars. Our rafters are firs.

Tailo: Tsit pái lín m̄-bián kau-tsiàn, Iôtah kah Êlúsalèm, lín tio̍h pâi tīn khiā-.leh, khuànn Siōngtsú lâi tsín-kiù lín. M̄-bián kiaⁿ, m̄-bián lún, bîn-á-tsài tio̍h tshut-khì in hia, in-uī Siōngtsú kah lín tông-tsāi. '
English: You shall not need to fight in this battle: set yourselves, stand you still, and see the salvation of Yahweh with you, O Judah and Jerusalem; don't be afraid, nor be dismayed: tomorrow go out against them: for Yahweh is with you.

Tailo: Siōngtè tuì Abulahàm ìng-ín ê hit-ê kî ná kīn, Isulael lâng tī Aigi̍p seⁿ-thuàⁿ ná hing-ōng.
English: But as the time of the promise came close which God had sworn to Abraham, the people grew and multiplied in Egypt,

Tailo: Tshân-iá ê tshiū ē kiat kué-tsí, tē mā ē ū tshut-sán; in ē an-jiân tuà tī pún só͘-tsāi. Guá at-tn̄g in só͘ phāinn ê ka-tann, kiù in thuat-lī hit-ê lia̍h in tsò lô͘-lē ê lâng ê tshiú; hit sî, in tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: The tree of the field shall yield its fruit, and the earth shall yield its increase, and they shall be secure in their land; and they shall know that I am Yahweh, when I have broken the bars of their yoke, and have delivered them out of the hand of those who made slaves of them.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, Isulael tiong ū tsit-ê lē, Isulael tsiah-ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á ta̍k nî khì tui-tō Gilia̍t lâng I-é-hú-thah ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, muí nî sì ji̍t.
English: that the daughters of Israel went yearly to celebrate the daughter of Jephthah the Gileadite four days in a year.

Tailo: I tuì hia suá kàu Bethel tang pîng ê suaⁿ, tī hia tah pò͘-pêⁿ; sai pîng sī Bethel, tang pîng sī Ai siânn. I tī hia uī-tio̍h Siōngtsú khí tsi̍t tsō tuâⁿ, kiû-kiò Siōngtsú ê miâ.
English: He left from there to the mountain on the east of Bethel, and pitched his tent, having Bethel on the west, and Ai on the east. There he built an altar to Yahweh and called on the name of Yahweh.

Tailo: Si-phian Tē-sì Kuàn(90~106 phiⁿ)（ Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k — Mô͘se ê kî-tó. ） Tsú ah, Lí ta̍k sè-tāi tsò guán tuà ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Lord, you have been our dwelling place for all generations.

Tailo: In-uī tuì Guá tshuā lín tsó͘-sian tshut Aigi̍p hit tsi̍t ji̍t kàu kin-á-ji̍t, Guá pik-tshiat kā in kíng-kài, to̍h-sī tsá-tsá khí-lâi kā in kíng-kài, kóng, ' Lín tio̍h tsun-thàn Guá ê uē. '
English: For I earnestly protested to your fathers in the day that I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, even to this day, rising early and protesting, saying, Obey my voice.

Tailo: Iôtah ông Ahatsiah ê kiáⁿ Io-a-si jī-tsa̍p saⁿ nî, E-hú ê kiáⁿ Ehuahátsuh tī Sa-má-lī-a tsē-uī, tsò Isulael ông, kiōng tsa̍p-tshit nî.
English: In the three and twentieth year of Joash the son of Ahaziah, king of Judah, Jehoahaz the son of Jehu began to reign over Israel in Samaria, and reigned seventeen years.

Tailo: I nā bô put-tik-í ê tāi-tsì, sī tshut tī ka-kī ê kuat-sim, koh ē-tàng khòng-tsè ka-kī ê ì-tsì, kuat-tīng bô beh hō͘ tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ kiat-hun, án-ne tsò sī hó.
English: But he who stands steadfast in his heart, having no necessity, but has power over his own heart, to keep his own virgin, does well.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, hiah-ê īng ké ê bāng lâi tsò sian-ti ê, in kóng-khí in ê bāng, mā īng in ê pe̍h-tsha̍t kah in ê hong-hàm hō͘ Guá ê tsú-bîn kiânn tshe-lō͘, Guá kā in kong-kik. In-uī Guá bô tshe in, mā bô bīng-līng in, in lóng bô lī-ik-tio̍h tsiah-ê jîn-bîn. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: Behold, I am against those who prophesy lying dreams, says Yahweh, and do tell them, and cause my people to err by their lies, and by their vain boasting: yet I didn't send them, nor commanded them; neither do they profit this people at all, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Uá-kīn Ehulaim ê tē-kài, tuì tang kàu sai, Lūbiān tsi-tso̍k tsi̍t hūn.
English: By the border of Ephraim, from the east side even to the west side, Reuben, one portion.

Tailo: In mā khì-sak Siōngtsú, khì ho̍k-sāi Baal kah A-si-tha-lot.
English: They forsook Yahweh, and served Baal and the Ashtaroth.

Tailo: Uá-kīn i ê sī Mánáse ê tsi-tso̍k, Pa-ta-tsul ê kiáⁿ Gâmáliel tsò Mánáse lâng ê siú-líng.
English: Next to him shall be the tribe of Manasseh: and the prince of the children of Manasseh shall be Gamaliel the son of Pedahzur.

Tailo: In-uī lí thiaⁿ Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè ê uē, tsun-siú I it-tshè ê kài-bīng, to̍h-sī guá kin-á-ji̍t só͘ bīng-līng lí ê, lâi kiâⁿ Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò sī hó ê.
English: when you shall listen to the voice of Yahweh your God, to keep all his commandments which I command you this day, to do that which is right in the eyes of Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Uī-tio̍h Isulael lâng huān tsuē kàu tē-saⁿ pái, mā kàu tē-sì pái, Guá bô beh bián-tû i ê hîng-hua̍t; in-uī in tshut-bē gī lâng lâi tit-tio̍h gîn, tshut-bē sàn-tshiah lâng lâi tit-tio̍h tsi̍t siang ê.
English: Thus says Yahweh: For three transgressions of Israel, yes, for four, I will not turn away its punishment; Because they have sold the righteous for silver, And the needy for a pair of shoes;

Tailo: Án-ne, lán kám ē in-uī tsit-ê sìn suah hō͘ lu̍t-huat sit-khì kong-hāu? Tong-jiân bē! Lán tian-tò ē khak-li̍p lu̍t-huat.
English: Do we then nullify the law through faith? May it never be! No, we establish the law.

Tailo: tsiū tī kûn-tsiòng ê bīn-tsîng, kái-uāⁿ kí-tōng, tī in ê tshiú-hā ké tian-kông, tī siâⁿ mn̂g ê mn̂g-sìⁿ luān siá luān uē, hō͘ nuāⁿ lâu tī tshuì-tshiu-.ni̍h.
English: He changed his behavior before them, and feigned himself mad in their hands, and scrabbled on the doors of the gate, and let his spittle fall down on his beard.

Tailo: Iâkop lâi-kàu in lāu-pē hia, kóng, Guá ê a-pa. I kóng, Guá tī tsia. Guá ê kiáⁿ, lí sī siáⁿ lâng?
English: He came to his father, and said, My father? He said, Here I am. Who are you, my son?

Tailo: I kiânn Isulael tsiah-ê ông ê lō͘ kah Ahap ê ke bô koh-iūⁿ, in-uī i tshuā Ahap ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tsò bó͘, kiânn Siōngtsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì.
English: He walked in the way of the kings of Israel, as did the house of Ahab; for he had the daughter of Ahab as wife: and he did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh.

Tailo: Kóng-uē sò-sìng ê lâng tshin-tshiūnn to teh tsha̍k lâng; tì-huī lâng ê tshuì-tsi̍h ē i hó lâng.
English: There is one who speaks rashly like the piercing of a sword, But the tongue of the wise heals.

Tailo: Hiah-ê kuì-tso̍k tuì Palosih kóng, Lí kah I-é-lí-miah tio̍h khì bih-.leh, m̄-thang hō͘ lâng tsai lín tī tó-uī.
English: Then said the princes to Baruch, Go, hide you, you and Jeremiah; and let no man know where you are.

Tailo: I tī Aigi̍p án-tsuáⁿ hián-tshut I ê sîn-jiah; tī Tsó-an tshân án-tsuáⁿ hián-tshut kî-sū;
English: How he set his signs in Egypt, His wonders in the field of Zoan,

Tailo: Iésu kā i kóng, Piattò͘ ah, guá kā lí kóng, kin-á-ji̍t ke iáu-buē thî í-tsîng, lí ē saⁿ pái m̄ jīn guá.
English: He said, I tell you, Peter, the rooster will by no means crow today until you deny that you know me three times.

Tailo: Kin-á-ji̍t, Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè bīng-līng lí kiânn tsiah-ê lu̍t-lē kah huat-tō͘, só͘-í, lí tio̍h tsīn-sim tsīn-sìng tsip-siú, lâi tsiàu án-ne kiânn.
English: This day Yahweh your God commands you to do these statutes and ordinances: you shall therefore keep and do them with all your heart, and with all your soul.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè kóng, Lî bó͘ ê tāi-tsì kah īng kiông-pō khuán-thāi bó͘ ê lâng, Guá uàn-hūn i! Só͘-í, tio̍h kín-sīn siú lín ê sim-sîn, m̄-thang kiânn kuí-tsà. Tse sī bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: For I hate divorce, says Yahweh, the God of Israel, and him who covers his garment with violence!' says Yahweh of Armies. Therefore take heed to your spirit, that you don't deal treacherously.

Tailo: I tshuā guá kàu īⁿ ê mn̂g. Guá kuan-khuàⁿ, khuàⁿ-tio̍h tshiûⁿ-piah ū tsi̍t-ê khang.
English: He brought me to the door of the court; and when I looked, behold, a hole in the wall.

Tailo: Koh hiàn tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, kā lín sio̍k-tsuē.
English: and one male goat for a sin offering, to make atonement for you;

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, guá kā lín kóng, hia̍t-khì ê jio̍k-thé bē-tàng sîng-siū Siōngtè kok-tō͘. Tsiū-sī kóng, ē hiú-nuā ê bē-tàng sîng-siū bē hiú-nuā-ê.
English: Now I say this, brothers, that flesh and blood can't inherit the Kingdom of God; neither does corruption inherit incorruption.

Tailo: Lín kó-jiân beh tuì guá tuā khua-kháu, koh īng guá ê lîng-jio̍k tsik-pī guá;
English: If indeed you will magnify yourselves against me, And plead against me my reproach;

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ lâng kiânn tī lín ê tíng-bīn, to̍h-sī Guá ê tsú-bîn — Isulael. In ē tit-tio̍h lí, lí ē tsò in ê sán-gia̍p; lí mā bô koh hō͘ in tsua̍t-sû.
English: Yes, I will cause men to walk on you, even my people Israel; and they shall possess you, and you shall be their inheritance, and you shall no more henceforth bereave them of children.

Tailo: I koh kóng, Siáⁿ lâng beh tāi-sing khì kā Abulahàm kóng, ' Sala̍h beh hō͘ enn-á suh-ling '? In-uī tī i nî lāu ê sî, guá kā i seⁿ tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ?
English: She said, Who would have said to Abraham, that Sarah would nurse children? For I have borne him a son in his old age.

Tailo: M̄-thang in-uī kiáⁿ lâi hō͘ lāu-pē sí, mā m̄-thang in-uī lāu-pē lâi hō͘ kiáⁿ sí, ta̍k lâng lóng tio̍h uī-tio̍h ka-kī ê tsuē lâi sí.
English: The fathers shall not be put to death for the children, neither shall the children be put to death for the fathers: every man shall be put to death for his own sin.

Tailo: saⁿ-khò͘ kah tshù ê thái-ko,
English: and for the destructive mildew of a garment, and for a house,

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Malkitsetik m̄-sī sio̍k Lēbī ê sè-hē, i ū tuì Abulahàm the̍h tsa̍p-hūn tsi-it, koh kā tit-tio̍h Siōngtè ìng-ín ê Abulahàm tsiok-hok.
English: but he whose genealogy is not counted from them has taken tithes of Abraham, and has blessed him who has the promises.

Tailo: Uá-khò ka-kī tsîⁿ-tsâi ê lâng ē pua̍h-tó; gī lâng ē tshin-tshiūⁿ tsheⁿ-tshuì ê tshiū-hio̍h hing-ōng.
English: He who trusts in his riches will fall, But the righteous shall flourish as the green leaf.

Tailo: Pa̍t lâng nā ū kuân tuì lín iau-kiû, guán kám m̄-sī koh khah ū kuân? Tsóng-.sī, guán lóng m̄-bat sú-iōng tsit-ê kuân, tian-tò jím-nāi it-tshè, tsiah bián hō͘ Ki-tok ê hok-im siū tsó͘-gāi.
English: If others partake of this right over you, don't we yet more? Nevertheless we did not use this right, but we bear all things, that we may cause no hindrance to the Good News of Christ.

Tailo: Guá ê tshuì beh kóng-tshut tsin-si̍t; guá ê tshuì-tûn uàn-hūn pháiⁿ tāi.
English: For my mouth speaks truth. Wickedness is an abomination to my lips.

Tailo: Námān kóng, Nā m̄ siu, kiû lí kā nn̄g tsiah lô só͘ ē-tàng tsài ê thô͘ hō͘ lí ê lô͘-po̍k, in-uī tuì taⁿ í-āu, lí ê lô͘-po̍k bô koh īng sio-tsè á-.sī pa̍t tsióng ê tsè hō͘ pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng, tsí ū beh hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú.
English: Naaman said, If not, yet, please let there be given to your servant two mules' burden of earth; for your servant will henceforth offer neither burnt offering nor sacrifice to other gods, but to Yahweh.

Tailo: In teh tsia̍h ê sî, Iésu the̍h piáⁿ tsiok-siā liáu-āu tsiū peh-phuà, pun hō͘ bûn-tô͘, kóng, The̍h khì tsia̍h; tsit-ê sī guá ê sing-khu.
English: As they were eating, Jesus took bread, and when he had blessed, he broke it, and gave to them, and said, Take, eat. This is my body.

Tailo: Siōngtsú sī jia̍t-sim ê Siōngtè, mā kiânn pò-siû. Siōngtsú sī pò-siû koh tuā siū-khì; Siōngtsú tuì I ê tuì-ti̍k pò-siû, uī-tio̍h I ê siû-ti̍k lâi khǹg siū-khì.
English: Yahweh is a jealous God and avenges. Yahweh avenges and is full of wrath. Yahweh takes vengeance on his adversaries, and he maintains wrath against his enemies.

Tailo: Lâng kā sè-tsiūⁿ siū kuaiⁿ-kaⁿ ê ta̍h tī kha tsîng, tse sī Tsú só͘ bô huann-hí ê.
English: To crush under foot all the prisoners of the earth,

Tailo: Taⁿ lín tio̍h kiaⁿ-uì Siōngtsú, kín-sīn tsò tāi-tsì, in-uī Siōngtsú — lán ê Siōngtè bô ū put-gī, bô phian-thán, bô tsiap-siū lâng ê o͘-se.
English: Now therefore let the fear of Yahweh be on you; take heed and do it: for there is no iniquity with Yahweh our God, nor respect of persons, nor taking of bribes.

Tailo: mā m̄-thang hō͘ I hioh-khùn, it-ti̍t kàu I kiàn-li̍p Êlúsalèm, hō͘ Êlúsalèm tī tē-tsiūⁿ tsiâⁿ-tsò thang o-ló ê.
English: and give him no rest, until he establish, and until he make Jerusalem a praise in the earth.

Tailo: Samuel thiaⁿ-tio̍h jîn-bîn só͘-ū ê uē liáu-āu, tsiū kā hiah-ê uē kóng hō͘ Siōngtsú thiaⁿ.
English: Samuel heard all the words of the people, and he rehearsed them in the ears of Yahweh.

Tailo: In tshiúⁿ-lia̍h Hagal lâng ê tsing-seⁿ, ū lo̍k-tô gō͘ bān tsiah, iûⁿ jī-tsa̍p gō͘ bān tsiah, lî nn̄g tshing tsiah, koh ū tsa̍p-bān-ê lâng.
English: They took away their livestock; of their camels fifty thousand, and of sheep two hundred fifty thousand, and of donkeys two thousand, and of men one hundred thousand.

Tailo: Ji̍t-sî, Siōngtsú ê hûn tī huē-bō͘ tíng; àm-sî hit tiong-kan ū hué, tī Isulael tsuân ke ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng. Tī in só͘ kiâⁿ ê lō͘-thîng lóng sī án-ne.
English: For the cloud of Yahweh was on the tent by day, and there was fire in the cloud by night, in the sight of all the house of Israel, throughout all their journeys.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h tuì Babúlông tiong tô-tsáu, tuì Kal-tí-ah lâng ê tē tshut-.khì, tio̍h tshin-tshiūnn kang ê suaⁿ-iûⁿ tī iûⁿ-kûn ê thâu-tsîng.
English: Flee out of the midst of Babylon, and go forth out of the land of the Chaldeans, and be as the male goats before the flocks.

Tailo: In ìn kóng, Tsú ah, kiû Lí khui guán ê ba̍k-tsiu, hō͘ guán ē khuànn-kìnn.
English: They told him, Lord, that our eyes may be opened.

Tailo: I tshòng-tsō thiⁿ, tē, hái kah kî-tiong ê bān-mi̍h; I pó-siú sìn-si̍t kàu tī íng-uán.
English: Who made heaven and earth, The sea, and all that is in them; Who keeps truth forever;

Tailo: Êlúsalèm ê sù-tô͘ thiaⁿ-tio̍h Sa-má-lī-a í-king tsiap-la̍p Siōngtè ê tō-lí, tsiū tshe Piattò͘ kah Iô-há-neh khì in hia.
English: Now when the apostles who were at Jerusalem heard that Samaria had received the word of God, they sent Peter and John to them,

Tailo: Tī Si-óng bô tshau-huân ê, tī Sa-má-lī-a suaⁿ lia̍h-tsò ún-tàng ê, tī bān-kok tiong tsò tē-it kok ê siú-líng, to̍h-sī Isulael ê tsú-bîn só͘ kui-uá ê ū tsai-hō!
English: Woe to those who are at ease in Zion, And to those who are secure on the mountain of Samaria, The notable men of the chief of the nations, To whom the house of Israel come!

Tailo: Hiah-ê tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng, to̍h-sī guá ê tuì-ti̍k, lâi kong-kik guá, beh tsia̍h guá ê bah, hit sî in tsiū ē kha that-tio̍h lâi pua̍h-tó.
English: When evil-doers came at me to eat up my flesh, Even my adversaries and my foes, they stumbled and fell.

Tailo: Thiⁿ-sài kā guá kóng, Lí tio̍h koh suan-pò͘ kuan-hē Siōngtè tuì kok tsióng bîn-tso̍k, kok-ka, gí-giân kah kun-ông só͘ ī-giân ê tāi-tsì.
English: They told me, You must prophesy again over many peoples, nations, languages, and kings.

Tailo: to̍h-sī lí tshin-ba̍k khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê tuā tshì-liān, sîn-jiah, kî-sū kah tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú, kah tshun tshut-.lâi ê tshiú-kut, lóng sī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè só͘ īng lâi tshuā lí tshut Aigi̍p ê. Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè mā ē án-ne kiânn tī lí só͘ kiaⁿ ê só͘-ū jîn-bîn sin tsiūⁿ.
English: the great trials which your eyes saw, and the signs, and the wonders, and the mighty hand, and the outstretched arm, by which Yahweh your God brought you out: so shall Yahweh your God do to all the peoples of whom you are afraid.

Tailo: Tsîng Iôtah lia̍t ông só͘ siat-li̍p pài ngó͘-siōng ê tsè-si, tī Iôtah hiah-ê siâⁿ kah Êlúsalèm sì-kho͘-uî ê suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ sio hiuⁿ ê, taⁿ ông lóng kā i lut, mā lut hiah-ê sio hiuⁿ tī Baal kah ji̍t, gue̍h, hîng-tsheⁿ, í-ki̍p thinn-tíng ê bān-siōng ê.
English: He put down the idolatrous priests, whom the kings of Judah had ordained to burn incense in the high places in the cities of Judah, and in the places round about Jerusalem; those also who burned incense to Baal, to the sun, and to the moon, and to the planets, and to all the army of the sky.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng ê kng si̍t-tsāi ē hua, i ê hué-iām ē bô kng.
English: Yes, the light of the wicked shall be put out, The spark of his fire shall not shine.

Tailo: I ê tò tshiú hû guá ê thâu-khak, i ê tsiàⁿ tshiú phō guá.
English: His left hand is under my head. His right hand embraces me.

Tailo: Hesibóng kah i pîng-guân hiah-ê siâⁿ, to̍h-sī Ti-bóng, Pa-bua̍t-pa-li̍k, Pik-pa-li̍k-bián,
English: Heshbon, and all its cities that are in the plain; Dibon, and Bamoth Baal, and Beth Baal Meon,

Tailo: Abúlâm kah Hagal tâng-pâng, Hagal tsiū huâi-īn; i tsai ka-kī ū sin, tsiū khuànn-khin tsú-bó.
English: He went in to Hagar, and she conceived. When she saw that she had conceived, her mistress was despised in her eyes.

Tailo: Lí kā tsit-ê lâu ling kah bi̍t ê tē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in, to̍h-sī Lí tuì in ê tsó͘-sian tsiù-tsuā beh hō͘ in ê.
English: and gave them this land, which you did swear to their fathers to give them, a land flowing with milk and honey;

Tailo: Siōngtsú ē hō͘ lí tī tuì-ti̍k ê bīn-tsîng thâi-su, lí tuì tsi̍t tiâu lō͘ tshut-khì kā in tí-ti̍k, ē tī in ê bīn-tsîng tuì tshit tiâu lō͘ lâi tô-tsáu. Lí ē tī thian-hā bān-kok tiong sì-kè liû-lōng.
English: Yahweh will cause you to be struck before your enemies; you shall go out one way against them, and shall flee seven ways before them: and you shall be tossed back and forth among all the kingdoms of the earth.

Tailo: Siōngtsú koh lîm-kàu, kā i kóng, Tsit-ê lâng m̄-sī beh tsò lí ê hō͘-sû; tuì lí pún-sin tshut ê tsiah sī lí ê hō͘-sû.
English: Behold, the word of Yahweh came to him, saying, This man will not be your heir, but he who will come forth out of your own body will be your heir.

Tailo: Só͘lômóng ông tsiū tshe Io-ho-iá-tah ê kiáⁿ Benáiah khì, i tsiū kā i phah-tó, hō͘ i sí.
English: King Solomon sent by Benaiah the son of Jehoiada; and he fell on him, so that he died.

Tailo: Alâm lâng tī Isulael ê bīn-tsîng tô-tsáu, Tabi̍t thâi-sí Alâm tshit pah tâi tsiàn-tshia ê ping kah bé-ping sì bān, koh phah in ê kun-tiúⁿ Sokhuat, hō͘ i sí tī hia.
English: The Syrians fled before Israel; and David killed of the Syrians the men of seven hundred chariots, and forty thousand horsemen, and struck Shobach the captain of their army, so that he died there.

Tailo: Tsiú-tsuì ê lâng, lín tio̍h tshénn khí-lâi thî-khàu; hò͘ⁿ-tsiú ê lâng, lín tio̍h uī-tio̍h tiⁿ-tsiú lâi thî-khàu, in-uī bô tsiú thang koh kàu tī lí ê tshuì à.
English: Wake up, you drunkards, and weep! Wail, all you drinkers of wine, because of the sweet wine; For it is cut off from your mouth.

Tailo: Tē it, guá thiaⁿ-kóng lín tsū-huē ê sî ū kiat-tóng hun-phài, guá siong-sìn tse ū tsi̍t-pō͘-hūn sī sū-si̍t.
English: For first of all, when you come together in the assembly, I hear that divisions exist among you, and I partly believe it.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Siōngtsú kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, ji̍t-tsí teh beh kàu, Guá beh pān Babúlông tiau-khik ê ngó͘-siōng, tsuân kok siū-siong ê lâng ē ai-siaⁿ thó͘-khuì.
English: Therefore, behold, the days come, says Yahweh, that I will execute judgment on her engraved images; and through all her land the wounded shall groan.

Tailo: Taⁿ tsuân ke ê lâng lóng khí-lâi kong-kik lí ê lú-pī, kóng, ' Lí tio̍h kā hit-ê phah-sí hiann-tī ê kau tshut-.lâi, guán thang hō͘ i sí, puê i phah-sí hiann-tī ê sèⁿ-miā, tsua̍t i ê hō͘-sû. ' Án-ne, in ē kā guá tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê hué-thuàⁿ phah-hua, bô hō͘ guá ê tiōng-hu lâu-miâ lâu kiáⁿ-sun tī sè-kan.
English: Behold, the whole family is risen against your handmaid, and they say, Deliver him who struck his brother, that we may kill him for the life of his brother whom he killed, and so destroy the heir also. Thus will they quench my coal which is left, and will leave to my husband neither name nor remainder on the surface of the earth.

Tailo: Mikaiah kóng, Guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h Isulael tsìng lâng sì-suàⁿ tī suaⁿ-.ni̍h, tshin-tshiūnn bô bo̍k-tsiá ê iûⁿ. Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, ' Tsiah-ê bô tsú-lâng, in ta̍k-ê thang pîng-an tńg-khì in ê ke. '
English: He said, I saw all Israel scattered on the mountains, as sheep that have no shepherd: and Yahweh said, These have no master; let them return every man to his house in peace.

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng, Go͘k tsiūⁿ-lâi kong-kik Isulael tē ê ji̍t, Guá ê siū-khì ē tuì Guá ê phīⁿ-khang tshut.
English: It shall happen in that day, when Gog shall come against the land of Israel, says the Lord Yahweh, that my wrath shall come up into my nostrils.

Tailo: Iésu tsiàu-siông tshut-khì Kaⁿ-ná suaⁿ, sù-tô͘ mā tuè I khì.
English: He came out, and went, as his custom was, to the Mount of Olives. His disciples also followed him.

Tailo: In īng kiáu bu̍t-io̍h ê tsiú hō͘ Iésu lim. I m̄-lim.
English: They offered him wine mixed with myrrh to drink, but he didn't take it.

Tailo: Hit lāi-bīn só͘-ū ē tsia̍h-tit ê tsia̍h-mi̍h, bak-tio̍h tsuí ê tsiū bô tshing-khì, koh-tsài hit-ê khì-kū lāi ē lim-.tit ê, mā sī bô tshing-khì.
English: All food which may be eaten, that on which water comes, shall be unclean; and all drink that may be drunk in every such vessel shall be unclean.

Tailo: Mā bô khiàm-iōng lâng ê tshiú só͘ hiàn ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ. I tian-tò kā ua̍h-miā, tshuán-khuì kah bān-mi̍h siúⁿ-sù hō͘ jîn-luī.
English: neither is he served by men's hands, as though he needed anything, seeing he himself gives to all life and breath, and all things.

Tailo: Tsiàu I tī Hô-se-a su só͘ kóng, Tsiah-ê m̄-sī Guá ê tsú-bîn ê, guá beh tshing in tsò Guá ê tsú-bîn ; Hiah-ê m̄-sī guá só͘ ài ê, guá beh tshing in tsò Guá só͘ ài ê. (tsù, HSA 2:23)
English: As he says also in Hosea, I will call them my people,' which were not my people; And her beloved,' who was not beloved.

Tailo: Guān Lí li̍h-khui thiⁿ lâi kàng-lîm, hō͘ tsiah-ê suaⁿ tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng tín-tāng,
English: Oh that you would tear the heavens, that you would come down, that the mountains might quake at your presence,

Tailo: I tsi̍t-ē tn̄g-khuì tsiū kui thó͘; i ê kè-uē tī hit ji̍t tsiū piàn khang-khang.
English: His spirit departs, and he returns to the earth. In that very day, his thoughts perish.

Tailo: Hit mê, Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu Náthan kóng,
English: It happened the same night, that the word of Yahweh came to Nathan, saying,

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, Lâng só͘ tsò bē-kàu ê, Siōngtè lóng ē.
English: But he said, The things which are impossible with men are possible with God.

Tailo: Tsim-giân tī gōng lâng ê tshuì, tú tshin-tshiūnn tsi̍t ki tshì tsha̍k ji̍p-khì tsuì-hàn ê tshiú.
English: Like a thornbush that goes into the hand of a drunkard, So is a parable in the mouth of fools.

Tailo: Elī ê sim-pū — Hui-ne-hah ê bó͘, huâi-īn beh kàu sán-kî, i thiaⁿ-tio̍h Siōngtsú ê kuī hō͘ lâng tshiúⁿ-.khì, ta-kuaⁿ kah tiōng-hu lóng sí ê siau-sit, tsiū àⁿ lo̍h-lâi seⁿ kiáⁿ, in-uī tuā thàng-thiàⁿ hut-jiân kàu.
English: His daughter-in-law, Phinehas' wife, was with child, near to be delivered: and when she heard the news that the ark of God was taken, and that her father-in-law and her husband were dead, she bowed herself and brought forth; for her pains came on her.

Tailo: Manouah tuì Siōngtsú ê sù-tsiá kóng, Tshiáⁿ lí hō͘ guá kā lí lâu-.leh, guán thang kā lí tsún-pī tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-á.
English: Manoah said to the angel of Yahweh, I pray you, let us detain you, that we may make ready a kid for you.

Tailo: Isulael ông kóng, Tio̍h tuà Mikaiah khì kau hō͘ siâⁿ-siú Ammóng kah ông ê kiáⁿ Io-a-si, kóng,
English: The king of Israel said, Take Micaiah, and carry him back to Amon the governor of the city, and to Joash the king's son;

Tailo: Tabi̍t kā tuì i kóng ê siàu-liân lâng kóng, Lí tuì tó-uī lâi? I ìn kóng, Guá sī tshut-guā lâng ê kiáⁿ, Amáli̍k lâng.
English: David said to the young man who told him, Whence are you? He answered, I am the son of a foreigner, an Amalekite.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng kóng, Lí ê miâ kiò-tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? I kóng, Guá kiò-tsò Iâkop.
English: He said to him, What is your name? He said, Jacob.

Tailo: Ionáthan tsiū kah Tabi̍t ê ke kiat iok, kóng, Guān Siōngtsú tuì Tabi̍t tsiah-ê tuì-ti̍k ê tshiú lâi thó i.
English: So Jonathan made a covenant with the house of David, saying, Yahweh will require it at the hand of David's enemies.

Tailo: Koh ū Iôséhuh tī Aigi̍p só͘ seⁿ ê kiáⁿ ū nn̄g-ê. Iâkop ê ke lâi-kàu Aigi̍p ê, tsóng-kiōng tshit-tsa̍p lâng.
English: The sons of Joseph, who were born to him in Egypt, were two souls. All the souls of the house of Jacob, who came into Egypt, were seventy.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h ka-kī kín-sīn, m̄-thang tī lí khuàⁿ kah-ì ê só͘-tsāi hiàn lín ê sio-tsè.
English: Take heed to yourself that you don't offer your burnt offerings in every place that you see;

Tailo: Guá tsi̍t ē khuànn, lín í-king tik-tsuē Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè, uī ka-kī tsù tsi̍t tsiah gû-á, tsin kín to̍h uai-tshua̍h Siōngtsú só͘ bīng-līng lín ê lō͘.
English: I looked, and behold, you had sinned against Yahweh your God; you had made you a molten calf: you had turned aside quickly out of the way which Yahweh had commanded you.

Tailo: Iôtah tshuā tsi̍t tuī Lô-má ping kah hiah-ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ í-ki̍p Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng só͘ phài lâi ê sìng-tiān kíng-uē, gia̍h ting, hué-pé kah bú-khì lâi-kàu hia.
English: Judas then, having taken a detachment of soldiers and officers from the chief priests and the Pharisees, came there with lanterns, torches, and weapons.

Tailo: Nā ū lô͘-po̍k thuat-lī i ê tsú-lâng, tsáu kàu lí hia, lí m̄-thang kā i kau hō͘ i ê tsú-lâng.
English: You shall not deliver to his master a servant who is escaped from his master to you:

Tailo: Khí-.lâi! Mā hō͘ gín-á khí-.lâi, īng lí ê tshiú kā i khan-.leh, Guá beh hō͘ i tsiâⁿ-tsò tuā kok.
English: Get up, lift up the boy, and hold him in your hand. For I will make him a great nation.

Tailo: saⁿ-hūn tsi-it tio̍h tī ông-kiong, saⁿ-hūn tsi-it tio̍h tī tē-ki ê mn̂g; jîn-bîn lóng tio̍h tī Siōngtsú tiān lāi ê īⁿ.
English: and a third part shall be at the king's house; and a third part at the gate of the foundation: and all the people shall be in the courts of the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: Kàu bān-mi̍h khut-ho̍k tī Ki-tok ê sî, Kiáⁿ mā ē khut-ho̍k tī hō͘ bān-mi̍h lóng khut-ho̍k ê Siōngtè, thang hō͘ Siōngtè uân-tsuân kuán-hat bān-mi̍h.
English: When all things have been subjected to him, then the Son will also himself be subjected to him who subjected all things to him, that God may be all in all.

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ lâng kā Eliiah kóng, Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k, guá kah lí ū siáⁿ-mi̍h khan-liân? Lí lâi guá tsia hō͘ Siōngtsú ē kì-tit guá ê tsuē, hō͘ guá ê kiáⁿ sí-.khì.
English: She said to Elijah, What have I to do with you, you man of God? You have come to me to bring my sin to memory, and to kill my son!

Tailo: Ē hō͘ lí siám-phiah pháiⁿ lō͘, thuat-lī kóng-uē hîng-gi̍k ê lâng.
English: To deliver you from the way of evil, From the men who speak perverse things;

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Tabi̍t tī Ta-má-su-ko ê A-Lâm tē siat-li̍p hông-siú ê ping-iâⁿ, Alâm lâng tsiū khut-ho̍k Tabi̍t lâi kā i tsìn-kòng. Tabi̍t bô-lūn khì tó-uī, Siōngtsú lóng hō͘ i tik-sìng.
English: Then David put garrisons in Syria of Damascus; and the Syrians became servants to David, and brought tribute. Yahweh gave victory to David wherever he went.

Tailo: Ē ū tsai-hō ke-thinn tsai-hō, hong-siaⁿ suà-tsiap hong-siaⁿ; in beh tuì sian-ti kiû ī-siōng, tsóng-.sī, tsè-si ê lu̍t-huat kah tiúⁿ-ló ê kè-uē lóng ē tuān-tsua̍t.
English: Mischief shall come on mischief, and rumor shall be on rumor; and they shall seek a vision of the prophet; but the law shall perish from the priest, and counsel from the elders.

Tailo: Sàulô the-sî kóng, Guá m̄-tsia̍h. Tsóng-.sī, i ê lô͘-po̍k kah tsa-bó͘ lâng hó-tshuì khǹg i, i tsiah thiaⁿ in ê tshuì tuì tē-.ni̍h khí-.lâi, tsē tī tshn̂g-.ni̍h.
English: But he refused, and said, I will not eat. But his servants, together with the woman, constrained him; and he listened to their voice. So he arose from the earth, and sat on the bed.

Tailo: Ē ū tsin tsē lâng ka-kī tshing-khì-kàu pe̍h-pe̍h, koh siū tuàn-liān; tsóng-.sī, pháiⁿ lâng iû-guân ē kiâⁿ pháiⁿ; só͘-ū ê pháiⁿ lâng lóng bē bîng-pi̍k, to̍k-to̍k tì-huī ê lâng ē bîng-pi̍k.
English: Many shall purify themselves, and make themselves white, and be refined; but the wicked shall do wickedly; and none of the wicked shall understand; but those who are wise shall understand.

Tailo: Iésu kā i kóng, Lí ê sió-tī ē koh ua̍h khí-.lâi.
English: Jesus said to her, Your brother will rise again.

Tailo: Isulael khuàⁿ-tio̍h Iôséhuh nn̄g-ê kiáⁿ, tsiū kóng, Tse sī siáⁿ lâng?
English: Israel saw Joseph's sons, and said, Who are these?

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kíng-síng, tī sìn-gióng siōng khiā ho͘ tsāi, tio̍h ióng-kám, kian-kiông.
English: Watch! Stand firm in the faith! Be courageous! Be strong!

Tailo: Siōngtsú koh tuì guá kóng, Jîn-tsú, lí kám beh sím-mn̄g A-hô-la̍h kah A-hô-lí-bah? Lí tio̍h tsí-tshut in só͘ kiâⁿ khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì.
