English: Yahweh said moreover to me: Son of man, will you judge Oholah and Oholibah? then declare to them their abominations.

Tailo: Lí tsit-ê Mô͘-kuí á kiáⁿ, lí sī it-tshè kong-gī ê tuì-ti̍k, tshiong-muá ta̍k tsióng ê kuí-tsà kah siâ-ok, lí ná ē ài beh niú-khiok Tsú ê tsin-lí?
English: and said, Full of all deceit and all cunning, you son of the devil, you enemy of all righteousness, will you not cease to pervert the right ways of the Lord?

Tailo: Kî-tiong tsi̍t tsiah sī Símòng ê, Iésu tsiūⁿ tsûn, kiò i kā tsûn kò khì lī-khui huāⁿ piⁿ ê só͘-tsāi. Iésu tsiū tsē tī tsûn tíng kà-sī kûn-tsiòng.
English: He entered into one of the boats, which was Simon's, and asked him to put out a little from the land. He sat down and taught the multitudes from the boat.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Iésu bîng-pi̍k kā in kóng, La̍h-tsa-lō͘ sí-.khì à.
English: So Jesus said to them plainly then, Lazarus is dead.

Tailo: Iésu kā i kóng, Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lí kóng, kin-á-ji̍t, to̍h-sī tī ing-àm ke thî nn̄g pái í-tsîng, lí ē saⁿ pái m̄ jīn guá.
English: Jesus said to him, Most assuredly I tell you, that you today, even this night, before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times.

Tailo: I tshun-tshut tshin-tshiūnn tsi̍t ki tshiú ê khuán, khiú-tiâu guá tsi̍t kó͘ ê thâu-mn̂g; sîn-lîng tsiū kā guá kí-khí kàu thiⁿ kah tē ê tiong-kan, tī Siōngtè ê ī-siōng tiong, tshuā guá kàu Êlúsalèm, ǹg pak ê lāi-īⁿ mn̂g-kháu, tī hia ū tsi̍t-tò͘ ê ngó͘-siōng tsō-uī, to̍h-sī kik-tōng tsi̍t-tò͘ ê.
English: He put forth the form of a hand, and took me by a lock of my head; and the Spirit lifted me up between earth and the sky, and brought me in the visions of God to Jerusalem, to the door of the gate of the inner court that looks toward the north; where was the seat of the image of jealousy, which provokes to jealousy.

Tailo: Ông kā in kóng, Lín só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò hó ê, guá ē tsiàu án-ne khì tsò. Tsiū án-ne, ông khiā tī siâⁿ mn̂g piⁿ, jîn-bîn ū ê tsi̍t pah, ū ê tsi̍t tshing, tsiàu tshù-sū tshut-.khì.
English: The king said to them, What seems you best I will do. The king stood beside the gate, and all the people went out by hundreds and by thousands.

Tailo: Tāi-ke tshiánn Páulô ke tuà kuí ji̍t, i bô tap-ìng.
English: When they asked him to stay with them a longer time, he declined;

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā thâu-tsiūⁿ ê kiáⁿ kui tī Guá. Lí ê gû kah lí ê iûⁿ mā tio̍h án-ne; tshit ji̍t thang tuè i ê bó, tī tē-peh ji̍t tio̍h kui tī Guá.
English: You shall do likewise with your oxen and with your sheep. Seven days it shall be with its mother, then on the eighth day you shall give it me.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-kuá kìng-khiân ê lâng kā Su-tê-hua-no͘h bâi-tsòng, uī-tio̍h i pi-siong tuā-siaⁿ thî-khàu.
English: Devout men buried Stephen, and lamented greatly over him.

Tailo: Iū-koh tsi̍t hūn, tn̂g nn̄g-bān gō͘-tshing, khuah tsi̍t bān, tio̍h kui tī tiān lāi tsò tshe-īng-ê Lēbī lâng, tsò in ê sán-gia̍p, jī-tsa̍p king pâng.
English: Twenty-five thousand in length, and ten thousand in breadth, shall be to the Levites, the ministers of the house, for a possession to themselves, for twenty chambers.

Tailo: I ê tsû-ài kám ē íng-uán siau-sit? I ê ìng-ín kám ē tāi-tāi huì-tû?
English: Has his loving kindness vanished forever? Does his promise fail for generations?

Tailo: Sàulô tuì thô͘-kha peh khí-.lâi, ba̍k-tsiu thí-khui, siáⁿ-mi̍h to khuàⁿ bô. In tsiū khan i ê tshiú, tshuā i ji̍p-khì Ta-má-su-ko.
English: Saul arose from the ground, and when his eyes were opened, he saw no one. They led him by the hand, and brought him into Damascus.

Tailo: Huilīsū lâng gō͘-ê siú-líng khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, siâng hit ji̍t tsiū tńg-khì Ik-lóng.
English: When the five lords of the Philistines had seen it, they returned to Ekron the same day.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h siá phue hō͘ Lâu-tí-kiah kàu-huē ê sù-tsiá, kā in kóng, tsò A-men, tsò tiong-sìn tsin-si̍t ê kiàn-tsìng tsiá, tsò Siōngtè tshòng-tsō ê guân-thâu hit uī án-ne kóng,
English: To the angel of the assembly in Laodicea write: The Amen, the Faithful and True Witness, the Head of God's creation, says these things:

Tailo: Guān Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè tsí-sī guán só͘ tio̍h kiânn ê lō͘, só͘ tio̍h tsò ê tāi-tsì.
English: that Yahweh your God may show us the way in which we should walk, and the thing that we should do.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lâng kìng-uì I; I bô kā ū tì-huī ê sim khuànn tsāi gán-lāi.
English: Therefore men revere him. He doesn't regard any who are wise of heart.

Tailo: Lí só͘-ū hiám-iàu ê só͘-tsāi ē tshin-tshiūⁿ bû-hua-kó tshiū, ū khí-thâu si̍k ê bû-hua-kó, tsi̍t-ē kā i iô, tsiū ka-la̍uh tī tsia̍h ê lâng ê tshuì.
English: All your fortresses will be like fig trees with the first-ripe figs: if they are shaken, they fall into the mouth of the eater.

Tailo: I ê tò tshiú ē hû guá ê thâu-khak, i ê tsiàⁿ tshiú beh phō guá.
English: His left hand would be under my head. His right hand would embrace me.

Tailo: Guá í-king kā guá só͘ niá-siū siōng tiōng-iàu ê sìn-sit thuân hō͘ lín, to̍h-sī tsiàu king-tián só͘ kì-tsài, Ki-tok uī-tio̍h lán ê tsuē sí,
English: For I delivered to you first of all that which I also received: that Christ died for our sins according to the Scriptures,

Tailo: Siōngtè pang-tsān i kong-kik Huilīsū lâng kah tuà tī Gul-ba-al ê A-la-puh lâng, í-ki̍p Mi-u-nî lâng.
English: God helped him against the Philistines, and against the Arabians who lived in Gur Baal, and the Meunim.

Tailo: Só͘ tshiúⁿ ê mi̍h, to̍h-sī ping-á só͘ tshiúⁿ īng tshun-ê, iûⁿ la̍k-tsa̍p-tshit bān gō͘-tshing tsiah;
English: Now the prey, over and above the booty which the men of war took, was six hundred seventy-five thousand sheep,

Tailo: Siâng tsit ji̍t, lóng m̄-thang tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h kang, in-uī sī sio̍k-tsuē ê ji̍t, tī Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng kā lín sio̍k-tsuē.
English: You shall do no manner of work in that same day; for it is a day of atonement, to make atonement for you before Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú ah, tó tsi̍t-ê tuā kuân-lîng ê ē-tàng kah Lí pí? Lí ê sìn-si̍t tī Lí ê sì-kho͘-uî.
English: Yahweh, God of Armies, who is a mighty one, like you? Yah, your faithfulness is around you.

Tailo: Koh kám-siā thâi-sí Basiáng ông O͘k ê Siōngtè, in-uī I ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi.
English: Og king of Bashan; For his loving kindness endures forever;

Tailo: In ē tī hi-bî ê tē ê tiong-kan lâi tsiâⁿ-tsò hi-bî; i tsiah-ê siâⁿ mā ē lia̍t tī tsiah-ê hong-huì ê siâⁿ ê tiong-kan.
English: They shall be desolate in the midst of the countries that are desolate; and her cities shall be in the midst of the cities that are wasted.

Tailo: In-uī koh tsi̍t-sî-á, Guá tuì lín ê siū-khì tsiū ē siau-.khì, jî-tshiánn Guá ê siū-khì ē tuì in ê bia̍t-bông lâi suah.
English: For yet a very little while, and the indignation against you will be accomplished, and my anger will be directed to his destruction.

Tailo: Koh kóng, Guá ê tsú ná ē beh jiok lô͘-po̍k? Guá kám ū tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h m̄-tio̍h? Guá ê tshiú ū siáⁿ-mi̍h pháiⁿ?
English: He said, Why does my lord pursue after his servant? for what have I done? or what evil is in my hand?

Tailo: Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú — guá kiù-un ê khuì-la̍t, tī kau-tsiàn ê ji̍t, Lí pó-hō͘ guá ê thâu-khak.
English: Yahweh, the Lord, the strength of my salvation, You have covered my head in the day of battle.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín í-king kái-piàn, kiânn Guá só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò tsìng-ti̍t ê tāi-tsì; ta̍k lâng tuì tshù-piⁿ suan-pò͘ tháu-pàng, koh tī īng Guá ê miâ lâi tshing-ho͘ ê tshù, tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng li̍p-iok.
English: You were now turned, and had done that which is right in my eyes, in proclaiming liberty every man to his neighbor; and you had made a covenant before me in the house which is called by my name:

Tailo: Abúlâm thâi-iâⁿ Ke-tah-láu-mel í-ki̍p kah i tsò-tīn hiah-ê ông tńg-.lâi ê sî, So͘tóm ông tshut-.lâi, kàu Sa-bí ê suaⁿ-kok kā i gîng-tsiap; Sa-bí ê suaⁿ-kok to̍h-sī ông ê suaⁿ-kok.
English: The king of Sodom went out to meet him, after his return from the slaughter of Chedorlaomer and the kings who were with him, at the valley of Shaveh (that is, the King's Valley).

Tailo: Nā-sī guá, guá beh gióng-bōng Siōngtsú, mā beh thìng-hāu kiù guá ê Siōngtè; guá ê Siōngtè ē thiaⁿ guá.
English: But as for me, I will look to Yahweh. I will wait for the God of my salvation. My God will hear me.

Tailo: Isulael lâng tsiū tû-khì tsiah-ê Baal kah A-si-tha-lot, kan-taⁿ ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú.
English: Then the children of Israel did put away the Baals and the Ashtaroth, and served Yahweh only.

Tailo: Iésu kā in kóng, Tú-tsiah pha-tio̍h ê hî, lia̍h kuí-bué-á lâi.
English: Jesus said to them, Bring some of the fish which you have just caught.

Tailo: Tsiū kuah-tn̄g i ê thâu-khak, thǹg i ê tsiàn-kah, tshe lâng kàu Huilīsū tē ê sì-kho͘-uî, piàn thuân tī hiah-ê ngó͘-siōng ê biō kah jîn-bîn ê tiong-kan.
English: They cut off his head, and stripped off his armor, and sent into the land of the Philistines round about, to carry the news to the house of their idols, and to the people.

Tailo: Guá mā kiù lín thuat-lī Aigi̍p lâng ê tshiú, mā thuat-lī it-tshè ap-tsè lín ê lâng ê tshiú, tuì lín ê bīn-tsîng kā in kuáⁿ tshut-.khì, kā in ê tē hō͘ lín.
English: and I delivered you out of the hand of the Egyptians, and out of the hand of all who oppressed you, and drove them out from before you, and gave you their land;

Tailo: Tuà kun-khì ê kiânn tī pûn hō-tâng ê tsè-si ê thâu-tsîng, āu-tuī tuè iok-kuī kiânn. Tsè-si ná kiâⁿ ná pûn hō-tâng.
English: The armed men went before the priests who blew the trumpets, and the rearward went after the ark, the priests blowing the trumpets as they went.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè nā tsiàu I tuì lí ê tsó͘-sian só͘ tsiù-tsuā ê, khui-khuah lí ê kíng-kài, kā só͘ ìng-ín siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí ê tsó͘-sian ê tsuân tē hō͘ lí.
English: If Yahweh your God enlarge your border, as he has sworn to your fathers, and give you all the land which he promised to give to your fathers;

Tailo: （ Tabi̍t kim ê si. ）Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí pó-hō͘ guá, in-uī guá uá-khò Lí.
English: Preserve me, God, for in you do I take refuge.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, tsit nn̄g tuī o-ló kám-siā ê lâng khiā tī Siōngtè ê tiān, liân guá kah kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ ê tsi̍t-puàⁿ mā lóng khiā tī hia.
English: So stood the two companies of those who gave thanks in the house of God, and I, and the half of the rulers with me;

Tailo: Lín só͘ khuànn-kìnn, lín só͘ bat ê tsit-ê pái-kha-.ê, i tuì sìn-khò Iésu ê miâ lâi tit-tio̍h khuì-la̍t. I in-uī sìn-khò Iésu ê miâ tsiū uân-tsuân hó khí-.lâi, lín tāi-ke lóng ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit-hāng tāi-tsì.
English: By faith in his name has his name made this man strong, whom you see and know. Yes, the faith which is through him has given him this perfect soundness in the presence of you all.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Satán kóng, Lí tuì tó-uī lâi? Satán tsiū ìn Siōngtsú kóng, Guá tī tē-tsiūⁿ kiâⁿ-lâi kiâⁿ-khì, piàn kiâⁿ tī hia, tuì hia lâi.
English: Yahweh said to Satan, Where have you come from? Then Satan answered Yahweh, and said, From going back and forth in the earth, and from walking up and down in it.

Tailo: Guá bat tshing lí ê miâ tsò ' tsheⁿ-tshuì ê kaⁿ-ná tshiū', hó khuànn, mā kiat hó kué-tsí; taⁿ Guá beh īng huā-huā jióng ê siann, khí hué tī i ê tíng-bīn, ki-ue mā siū at-tn̄g.
English: Yahweh called your name, A green olive tree, beautiful with goodly fruit: with the noise of a great tumult he has kindled fire on it, and the branches of it are broken.

Tailo: Lūbiān koh tuì in kóng, M̄-thang hō͘ i lâu hueh. Kā i hiat lo̍h-khì tsit-ê khòng-iá ê ta-tséⁿ, m̄-thang hē tshiú kā i hāi-sí. I ê ì-sù sī beh kiù Iôséhuh thuat-lī in ê tshiú, hō͘ i ē-tàng tńg-khì i ê lāu-pē hia.
English: Reuben said to them, Shed no blood. Throw him into this pit that is in the wilderness, but lay no hand on himthat he might deliver him out of their hand, to restore him to his father.

Tailo: Ū tsai-eh ah! Lí tsit-ê tshiúⁿ-tua̍t lâng ê, ka-kī bô siū tshiúⁿ-tua̍t; tsò tāi-tsì kuí-tsà ê, lâng bô īng kuí-tsà khuán-thāi lí. Lí tshiúⁿ-tua̍t tú-á suah, ka-kī ē siū tshiúⁿ-tua̍t; lí kiânn kuí-tsà tú-á suah, lâng ē īng kuí-tsà khuán-thāi lí.
English: Woe to you who destroy, but you weren't destroyed; And who betray, but nobody betrayed you! When you have finished destroying, you will be destroyed; And when you have made an end of betrayal, you will be betrayed.

Tailo: Isulael lâng kah Baal-pau-al liân-ha̍p, Siōngtsú tsiū tuì Isulael lâng siū-khì.
English: Israel joined himself to Baal Peor: and the anger of Yahweh was kindled against Israel.

Tailo: Kuan-hē Ga̍t tsiū kóng: Hō͘ Ga̍t huat-tián ê ìng-tong tit-tio̍h o-ló! I bih-.leh tshin-tshiūnn bó ê sai; i thiah-li̍h tshiú-kut kah thâu-khak.
English: Of Gad he said, Blessed be he who enlarges Gad: He dwells as a lioness, Tears the arm, yes, the crown of the head.

Tailo: Guán tsua̍t-tuì ē tsiânn guán ê tshuì só͘ kóng it-tshè ê uē, ǹg thian-hō͘ sio hiuⁿ, kuàn-tiān, tsiàu guán kah guán ê tsó͘-sian, guán ê kun-ông, guán ê kuì-tso̍k, tī Iôtah tsiah-ê siâⁿ kah Êlúsalèm ê ke-lō͘, pîng-sî só͘ kiâⁿ ê kāng-khuán; in-uī hit sî, guán ê tsia̍h-mi̍h tshiong-tsiok, hióng-siū pîng-an, pīng bô khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsai-hō.
English: But we will certainly perform every word that is gone forth out of our mouth, to burn incense to the queen of the sky, and to pour out drink offerings to her, as we have done, we and our fathers, our kings and our princes, in the cities of Judah, and in the streets of Jerusalem; for then had we plenty of food, and were well, and saw no evil.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Lēbī lâng ê siâⁿ, to̍h-sī in só͘ tit-tio̍h tsò sán-gia̍p ê siâⁿ hit tiong-kan ê tshù, Lēbī lâng thang put-kuán-sî lâi sio̍k-huê.
English: Nevertheless the cities of the Levites, the houses in the cities of their possession, the Levites may redeem at any time.

Tailo: Guān Siōngtsú ke-thinn lín ê jîn-sò͘, ke-thinn lín kah lín ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: May Yahweh increase you more and more, You and your children.

Tailo: Ū siū kat-lé kah bô siū kat-lé lóng bô iàu-kín, iàu-kín ê sī lán tio̍h tsiâⁿ-tsò sin tshòng-tsō ê lâng.
English: For in Christ Jesus neither is circumcision anything, nor uncircumcision, but a new creation.

Tailo: Tsú ê jîn-tsû ta̍k tsá-khí uāⁿ sin; Lí ê sîng-si̍t hui-siông khuah-tuā!
English: They are new every morning; great is your faithfulness.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā jîn-bîn kah pang-kok m̄ ho̍k-sāi lí ê, ē tú-tio̍h bia̍t-bông, hiah-ê pang-kok ē tsuân-jiân hong-huì.
English: For that nation and kingdom that will not serve you shall perish; yes, those nations shall be utterly wasted.

Tailo: Tsit-ê thó͘-tē ū kî-ī khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì;
English: A wonderful and horrible thing is happen in the land:

Tailo: In-uī in iáu-buē liáu-kái hit gō͘ tè piáⁿ ê sîn-jiah; in ê sim tsin tūn.
English: for they hadn't understood about the loaves, but their hearts were hardened.

Tailo: Sī-uē-tiúⁿ Nebutsalatàn tsiū kā jîn-bîn tiong sàn kàu bô puàⁿ-hāng ê lâng lâu tī Iôtah tē, tong-sî mā hō͘ in phû-tô hn̂g kah tshân.
English: But Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard left of the poor of the people, who had nothing, in the land of Judah, and gave them vineyards and fields at the same time.

Tailo: Ua̍h-khàu uī-tio̍h i tâi tī thô͘-.ni̍h, puàⁿ-soh uī-tio̍h i tiuⁿ tī lō͘-.ni̍h.
English: A noose is hidden for him in the ground, A trap for him in the way.

Tailo: Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Nā-sī Iôtah ông Tsetikiah kah i tsiah-ê kuì-tso̍k, í-ki̍p Êlúsalèm só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi iáu lâu tī tsit só͘-tsāi ê jîn-bîn, í-ki̍p tuà tī Aigi̍p tē ê, Guá kā in khuàⁿ-tsò tshin-tshiūnn tsiah-ê bái ê bû-hua-kó, bē tsia̍h-tit, in-uī tsin bái.
English: As the bad figs, which can't be eaten, they are so bad, surely thus says Yahweh, So will I give up Zedekiah the king of Judah, and his princes, and the residue of Jerusalem, who remain in this land, and those who dwell in the land of Egypt,

Tailo: Aláunah kā Tabi̍t kóng, Guá ê tsú — guá ê ông, tsiàu lí só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò hó ê the̍h-lâi hiàn. Lí khuàⁿ, tsia ū gû thang tsò sio-tsè, ū phah ngó͘-kok ê khì-kū kah thò gû ê ka-tshia thang tsò tshâ.
English: Araunah said to David, Let my lord the king take and offer up what seems good to him: behold, the oxen for the burnt offering, and the threshing instruments and the yokes of the oxen for the wood:

Tailo: Hō͘ tì-huī ê lâng thiaⁿ-liáu ke-thinn ha̍k-būn, hō͘ tshong-bîng ê lâng tit-tio̍h tsin ê kiàn-sik;
English: That the wise man may hear, and increase in learning; That the man of understanding may attain to sound counsel:

Tailo: Guá siàu-liām Siōngtè, tsiū iu-būn; guá tiām-tiām siūⁿ, sim-sîn suah hūn-.khì. [Sè-la̍h]
English: I remember God, and I groan. I complain, and my spirit is overwhelmed. Selah.

Tailo: I sīm-tsì khì-sak Sī-lô ê huē-bō͘, to̍h-sī I tī lâng ê tiong-kan só͘ tah ê pò͘-pênn.
English: So that he forsook the tent of Shiloh, The tent which he placed among men;

Tailo: Tio̍h kā lí ê ka-tann sià hō͘ Siōngtsú, I ē hû-tshî lí; I íng-uán bē hō͘ gī lâng iô-tāng.
English: Cast your burden on Yahweh, and he will sustain you. He will never allow the righteous to be moved.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, guá tshin-tshiūnn tshàu-hīⁿ-lâng bô thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, tshin-tshiūnn é-káu bô khui tshuì kóng-uē.
English: But I, as a deaf man, don't hear. I am as a mute man who doesn't open his mouth.

Tailo: Taⁿ in-uī lín tsiap-siū guá só͘ kā lín kóng ê tō-lí, lín í-king hō͘ I siu-tsíng hó-sè à.
English: You are already pruned clean because of the word which I have spoken to you.

Tailo: Tsú — guán ê Siōngtè ah, Lí bat īng tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú tshuā Lí ê tsú-bîn tshut Aigi̍p tē, hō͘ Lí ū miâ-siaⁿ, tshin-tshiūnn kin-á-ji̍t. Guán ū huān tsuē, guán ū kiâⁿ pháiⁿ.
English: Now, Lord our God, who has brought your people forth out of the land of Egypt with a mighty hand, and have gotten you renown, as at this day; we have sinned, we have done wickedly.

Tailo: Tē-la̍k ji̍t sī Ga̍t kiáⁿ-sun ê siú-líng, Tiu-el ê kiáⁿ Elíasa̍h.
English: On the sixth day, Eliasaph the son of Deuel, prince of the children of Gad

Tailo: tshiú-kiàⁿ, iù-tē saⁿ, pau-thâu ê kin, tsa̍h sing-khu ê phè.
English: the hand mirrors, the fine linen garments, the tiaras, and the shawls.

Tailo: Taⁿ guá lâi kong-kik huí-bia̍t tsit-ê tē, kám bô Siōngtsú ê ì-sù? Siōngtsú huan-hù guá kóng, ' Lí tsiūⁿ-khì kong-kik huí-bia̍t tsit-ê tē. '
English: Am I now come up without Yahweh against this place to destroy it? Yahweh said to me, Go up against this land, and destroy it.

Tailo: Tī hia ū tsûn teh kiâⁿ, ū Lí só͘ tshòng-tsō ê tuā hî siû lâi siû khì.
English: There the ships go, And leviathan, whom you formed to play there.

Tailo: I tuì hn̄g-hn̄g khuàⁿ-tio̍h Iésu, tsiū tsáu-lâi phak tuà Iésu ê bīn-tsîng,
English: When he saw Jesus from afar, he ran and bowed down to him,

Tailo: Koh tī hiah-ê tsìng lâng, to̍h-sī Isulael jîn-bîn, bô-lūn lâm-lí, muí lâng pun hō͘ in tsi̍t tè piáⁿ, tsi̍t tè bah kah tsi̍t tè phû-tô kuaⁿ piáⁿ; tsìng lâng tsiū lī-khui, ta̍k lâng tńg-khì in ka-kī ê tshù.
English: He dealt among all the people, even among the whole multitude of Israel, both to men and women, to everyone a cake of bread, and a portion of flesh, and a cake of raisins. So all the people departed everyone to his house.

Tailo: Iésu kā in kóng, Guá mā beh mn̄g lín tsi̍t kù uē. Lín nā ìn guá, guá tsiah beh kā lín kóng guá khò siáⁿ-mi̍h kuân-pìng lâi tsò tsiah-ê tāi-tsì.
English: Jesus said to them, I will ask you one question. Answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.

Tailo: Lâm-hong ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h Esáu ê suaⁿ, pîng-guân ê lâng ē tit-tio̍h Huilīsū, mā ē tit-tio̍h Ehulaim ê tshân kah Sa-má-lī-a ê tshân; Biāniámín lâng ē tit-tio̍h Gilia̍t.
English: Those of the South will possess the mountain of Esau, and those of the lowland, the Philistines. They will possess the field of Ephraim, and the field of Samaria. Benjamin will possess Gilead.

Tailo: Sàn-tshiah khùn-khó͘ ê lâng beh tshuē tsuí mā tshuē bô; in in-uī tshuì khuah, tsi̍h ta. Guá — Siōngtsú ē ìn in, Guá — Isulael ê Siōngtè it-tīng bô pàng-sak in.
English: The poor and needy seek water, and there is none. Their tongue fails for thirst. I, Yahweh, will answer them. I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them.

Tailo: Tio̍h siám-phiah siàu-liân lâng ê tsîng-io̍k, lâi kah hiah-ê īng tshing-khì ê sim-lîng kiû-kiò Tsú ê lâng tsò-hué tui-kiû kong-gī, sìn-sim, thiàⁿ-sim kah hô-pîng.
English: Flee from youthful lusts; but pursue righteousness, faith, love, and peace with those who call on the Lord out of a pure heart.

Tailo: Iésu ìn kóng, King-tián ū kóng, M̄-thang tshì-thàm Tsú — lí ê Siōngtè. (tsù, SBK 6:16)
English: Jesus answering, said to him, It has been said, You shall not tempt the Lord your God.'

Tailo: Palân ìn Baal kóng, Guá taⁿ lâi-kàu lí tsia, guá kám ū kuân thang kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h? Siōngtè īng siáⁿ-mi̍h uē kau-tài guá, guá tsiū án-ne kóng.
English: Balaam said to Balak, Behold, I have come to you: have I now any power at all to speak anything? the word that God puts in my mouth, that shall I speak.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng bô bîng-pi̍k kong-gī, m̄-koh, tsáu-tshuē Siōngtsú ê lâng lóng bîng-pi̍k.
English: Evil men don't understand justice; But those who seek Yahweh understand it fully.

Tailo: Guān kìng-uì Lí ê lâng kui-ǹg guá, in tsiū ē tsai Lí ê kà-sī.
English: Let those who fear you turn to me. They will know your statutes.

Tailo: Nā án-ne, lán iáu ū siáⁿ-mi̍h thang khua-kháu? Lóng bô! Lán tio̍h khò siáⁿ-mi̍h huat-tsik? Khò hîng-uî, sī-.bô? M̄-sī, sī khò sìn-sim!
English: Where then is the boasting? It is excluded. By what manner of law? Of works? No, but by a law of faith.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng ná ē ua̍h-.leh, tsia̍h tn̂g huè-siū, sè-li̍k kiông-sīng?
English: Why do the wicked live, Become old, yes, and grow mighty in power?

Tailo: Tio̍h tuì Êlúsalèm kóng hó uē, koh pò i tsai, i ê kau-tsiàn í-king tsīn, i ê tsuē-kò í-king sià; i uī-tio̍h i it-tshè ê tsuē, tuì Siōngtsú ê tshiú ka-puē siū hîng-hua̍t.
English: Speak comfortably to Jerusalem; and call out to her that her warfare is accomplished, that her iniquity is pardoned, that she has received of Yahweh's hand double for all her sins.

Tailo: Tuì ông-tshin ê tiong-kan kíng tsi̍t-ê lâng, kah i li̍p-iok, kah i tsiù-tsuā, koh lia̍h kok lāi ū sè-li̍k ê lâng,
English: and he took of the seed royal, and made a covenant with him; he also brought him under an oath, and took away the mighty of the land;

Tailo: Lí huan-hù Alông kā i kóng, lí tiám ting ê sî, tshit tsuáⁿ ting lóng tio̍h tī ting-tâi tsîng tsiò-kng.
English: Speak to Aaron, and tell him, When you light the lamps, the seven lamps shall give light in front of the lampstand.'

Tailo: Taⁿ guán kā ta̍k lâng só͘ tit-tio̍h ê kim-khì, liān-á, tshiú-khuân, phah ìn-á ê tshiú-tsáiⁿ, hīⁿ-kau, kuà ām-kún ê tsu-liān-á, lóng tuà-lâi tsò lé-mi̍h hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú, thang tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, uī-tio̍h guán pún-sin sio̍k-tsuē.
English: We have brought Yahweh's offering, what every man has gotten, of jewels of gold, armlets, and bracelets, signet rings, earrings, and necklaces, to make atonement for our souls before Yahweh.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng sī tì-huī á-.sī gû-gōng, siáⁿ lâng ē tsai? Jî-tshiánn guá tī ji̍t-kng ê ē-bīn, īng tì-huī lô-lo̍k só͘ tsò-tsiâⁿ ê, i ē kā i kuán-hat. Tse mā sī khang-hi.
English: Who knows whether he will be a wise man or a fool? Yet he will have rule over all of my labor in which I have labored, and in which I have shown myself wise under the sun. This also is vanity.

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn gōng lâng kiânn tī lō͘-.ni̍h, khiàm-khueh tì-huī, tuì tsìng lâng kóng i sī gōng lâng.
English: Yes also, when the fool walks by the way, his understanding fails him, and he says to everyone that he is a fool.

Tailo: In-uī lâng tī ji̍t-kng ê ē-bīn lô-lo̍k lô-sim, ū tit-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: For what has a man of all his labor, and of the striving of his heart, in which he labors under the sun?

Tailo: Pîng-siông sî khó͘-to̍k lí ê, in ê kiáⁿ-sun lóng beh kàu lí ê bīn-tsîng àⁿ-io; khuànn-khin lí ê, lóng beh tī lí ê kha tsîng kuī-pài. In beh tshing lí tsò Siōngtsú ê siâⁿ , tshing-tsò Isulael ê sìng-.ê ê Si-óng .
English: The sons of those who afflicted you shall come bending to you; and all those who despised you shall bow themselves down at the soles of your feet; and they shall call you The city of Yahweh, The Zion of the Holy One of Israel.

Tailo: Utsiiah ê kiáⁿ Iô-thàm jī-tsa̍p nî, Ela̍h ê kiáⁿ Hôsèa puē-puān Le-má-liah ê kiáⁿ Pekah, kā i phah koh thâi-sí, tshuàn i ê uī.
English: Hoshea the son of Elah made a conspiracy against Pekah the son of Remaliah, and struck him, and killed him, and reigned in his place, in the twentieth year of Jotham the son of Uzziah.

Tailo: sai sī iá-siù tiong tē-it bíng, i bián uī-tio̍h pa̍t mi̍h lâi siám-phiah;
English: The lion, which is mightiest among animals, And doesn't turn away for any;

Tailo: Lín siu-kuah tshân ê ngó͘-kok, tshân ê kak-thâu m̄-thang kuah kàu tsīn, ka-la̍uh ê mā m̄-thang khioh, tio̍h lâu hō͘ sàn-tshiah lâng kah tshut-guā ê khioh. Guá sī Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè.
English: When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not wholly reap into the corners of your field, neither shall you gather the gleanings of your harvest: you shall leave them for the poor, and for the foreigner. I am Yahweh your God.'

Tailo: Hit-ê tsheⁿ-mê-.ê thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsin tsē lâng tuì hia king-kuè, tsiū mn̄g sī siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì.
English: Hearing a multitude going by, he asked what this meant.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Iésu án-ne kóng sī teh tsí I ka-kī sing-khu ê tiān.
English: But he spoke of the temple of his body.

Tailo: Hué kiânn tī I ê bīn-tsîng, sio I sì-kho͘-uî ê tuì-ti̍k.
English: A fire goes before him, And burns up his adversaries on every side.

Tailo: Hiah-ê lîng-hûn to̍h-sī Nó͘ah teh tsún-pī tuā tsûn ê kî-kan, Siōngtè ū nāi-sim teh thìng-hāu ê hiah-ê m̄ sūn-ho̍k ê lâng. Tong-sî tsìn-ji̍p tuā tsûn ê lâng tsin tsió, kan-taⁿ peh-ê, in ū tuì tsuí lâi tit-kiù.
English: who before were disobedient, when God waited patiently in the days of Noah, while the ark was being built. In it, few, that is, eight souls, were saved through water.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú, to̍h-sī Isulael ê Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí khí-lâi tshú-hua̍t bān-kok! M̄-thang liân-bín hiah-ê kiânn kan-tsà ê pháiⁿ lâng! [Sè-la̍h]
English: You, Yahweh God of Armies, the God of Israel, Rouse yourself to punish the nations. Show no mercy to the wicked traitors. Selah.

Tailo: Tit-tio̍h tì-huī ê lâng, ē thiàⁿ-sioh i ê lîng-hûn; pó-siú bîng-lí ê lâng, ē tit-tio̍h hok-khì.
English: He who gets wisdom loves his own soul. He who keeps understanding shall find good.

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ kā I kóng, Lí khuànn, kui tīn lâng teh kā Lí e-kheh, ná ē mn̄g kóng, siáⁿ lâng ū bong guá?
English: His disciples said to him, You see the multitude pressing against you, and you say, Who touched me?'

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì liáu-āu, ū tsi̍t-ê A-li-má-tha-iah lâng Iôséhuh, i lâi kiû Pí-la̍h-to tsún i khì siu Iésu ê sin-si. I in-uī kiaⁿ Iô-tá-iah lâng tsiah thau-thau-á tsò Iésu ê bûn-tô͘. Pí-la̍h-to ín-tsún, Iôséhuh tsiū khì siu Iésu ê sin-si.
English: After these things, Joseph of Arimathaea, being a disciple of Jesus, but secretly for fear of the Jews, asked of Pilate that he might take away Jesus' body. Pilate gave him permission. He came therefore and took away his body.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí tò tńg-.lâi! Kiû Lí tuì thiⁿ àⁿ lo̍h-lâi khuànn, tsiàu-kò͘ tsit tsâng phû-tô tshiū,
English: Turn again, we beg you, God of Armies. Look down from heaven, and see, and visit this vine,

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, hit-ê thih, thô͘, tâng, gîn kah kim tsò tsi̍t-ē phah kah tshuì-tshuì, piàn-tsò ná jua̍h-thinn tiūⁿ-tiâⁿ ê tsho͘-khng, hō͘ hong tshue-suàⁿ, bô koh ū in ê só͘-tsāi. Jî-tshiánn tsit-ê kòng-tio̍h siōng ê tsio̍h ē piàn-tsò tuā suaⁿ, tshiong-muá tsuân tē.
English: Then was the iron, the clay, the brass, the silver, and the gold, broken in pieces together, and became like the chaff of the summer threshing floors; and the wind carried them away, so that no place was found for them: and the stone that struck the image became a great mountain, and filled the whole earth.

Tailo: Tabi̍t ê nn̄g-ê bó͘, E-tsu-le-el lâng Ahinoám kah bat tsò Kal-mel lâng Nabal ê bó͘ Abigail, mā hō͘ in lia̍h-.khì.
English: David's two wives were taken captive, Ahinoam the Jezreelitess, and Abigail the wife of Nabal the Carmelite.

Tailo: Lín í-king tuì sūn-ho̍k tsin-lí lâi kiat-tsīng ka-kī, koh kah kî-tha ê sìn-tô͘ ū sûn tsin ê tshiú-tsiok-tsi-tsîng, lín tio̍h tuì sim-té jia̍t-tshiat sio-thiànn.
English: Seeing you have purified your souls in your obedience to the truth through the Spirit in sincere brotherly affection, love one another from the heart fervently:

Tailo: Keh kang tsá-khí hiàn tsè ê sî, lí khuàⁿ, ū tsuí tuì Etóm ê lō͘ lâu lâi, tsuân tē tsiū ū tsuí muá-muá.
English: It happened in the morning, about the time of offering the offering, that behold, there came water by the way of Edom, and the country was filled with water.

Tailo: In khò iûⁿ-ko ê hueh kah in só͘ kiàn-tsìng ê sìn-sit, í-king iâⁿ-kuè hit bué liông; in sīm-tsì guān-ì hi-seam in ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: They overcame him because of the Lamb's blood, and because of the word of their testimony. They didn't love their life, even to death.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā Siōngtsú tuì Isulael ê tsú-bîn só͘ kóng ê hó uē, bô kah tsi̍t kù lo̍k-khong, lóng ū ìng-giām.
English: There failed not anything of any good thing which Yahweh had spoken to the house of Israel; all came to pass.

Tailo: Kiû Lí tio̍h ē kì-tit Lí ê lô͘-po̍k Abulahàm, Ísak, Iâkop, m̄-thang kì-liām tsiah-ê jîn-bîn ê ngē-sim kah in ê pháiⁿ, in ê tsuē,
English: Remember your servants, Abraham, Isaac, and Jacob; don't look to the stubbornness of this people, nor to their wickedness, nor to their sin,

Tailo: Iésu tshut-.khì, khuàⁿ-tio̍h kui tuā-tīn ê lâng, tsiū liân-bín in, i hó in tiong-kan ū pēⁿ ê lâng.
English: Jesus went out, and he saw a great multitude. He had compassion on them, and healed their sick.

Tailo: Iésu tsiū tshénn khí-.lâi, tsik-pī hong, koh bīng-līng tsuí-íng kóng, Tsīng lo̍h-.lâi! Hong tsiū thîng, tsuí-íng mā tiāⁿ lo̍h-.lâi.
English: He awoke, and rebuked the wind, and said to the sea, Peace! Be still! The wind ceased, and there was a great calm.

Tailo: Hit-ê kā lâng tīng tsuē ê nā ū hit khuán ê îng-kng, kā lâng suan-phuàⁿ bô tsuē ê kám m̄-sī koh khah tshiong-muá îng-kng?
English: For if the service of condemnation has glory, the service of righteousness exceeds much more in glory.

Tailo: Hiah-ê ki-lō͘-ping thí-khui si̍t, kiōng jī-tsa̍p tiú, in ê kha khiā-.leh, bīn ǹg lāi-bīn.
English: The wings of these cherubim spread themselves forth twenty cubits: and they stood on their feet, and their faces were toward the house.

Tailo: Iôséhuh tsiū khí-.lâi, tshuā enn-á kah I ê lāu-bú tńg-khì Isulael tē.
English: He arose and took the young child and his mother, and came into the land of Israel.

Tailo: Guān i ê kiáⁿ-jî piàn-tsò ko͘-jî, i ê bó͘ piàn-sîng kuáⁿ-hū!
English: Let his children be fatherless, And his wife a widow.

Tailo: Lí bat ū gō͘-ê ang, taⁿ kah lí tông-ki ê m̄-sī lí ê ang; lí án-ne kóng bô m̄-tio̍h.
English: for you have had five husbands; and he whom you now have is not your husband. This you have said truly.

Tailo: Ahasuiló͘ ông tsiū kā ông-hō͘ Êsutel kah Iôtah lâng Moltékái kóng, In-uī Hamán beh bô͘-hāi Iôtah lâng, guá í-king kā i ê ka-sán hō͘ Êsutel, lâng mā kā Hamán tiàu tī tshâ-kè tíng.
English: Then the king Ahasuerus said to Esther the queen and to Mordecai the Jew, See, I have given Esther the house of Haman, and him they have hanged on the gallows, because he laid his hand on the Jews.

Tailo: M̄-thang ū lâng kah lí tsò-hué lâi, piàn-suaⁿ lóng m̄-thang khuàⁿ-tio̍h ū lâng, tī suaⁿ-kha mā m̄-thang hō͘ gû-kûn, iûⁿ-kûn tsia̍h tsháu.
English: No one shall come up with you; neither let anyone be seen throughout all the mountain; neither let the flocks nor herds feed before that mountain.

Tailo: Lín m̄-thang kám-kak tsit-ê tāi-tsì kî-kuài, in-uī sî teh beh kàu, só͘-ū tī bōng-.ni̍h ê sí-lâng ē thiaⁿ-tio̍h Kiáⁿ ê siann, tuì bōng-.ni̍h tshut-.lâi.
English: Don't marvel at this, for the hour comes, in which all that are in the tombs will hear his voice,

Tailo: Koh bīng-līng sù-tsiá tuì in ê tsú kóng: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè án-ne kóng: Lín tio̍h tuì lín ê tsú án-ne kóng:
English: and give them a charge to their masters, saying, Thus says Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, Thus shall you tell your masters:

Tailo: ē tshiong ji̍p-khì Iôtah, tiòng muá sì-kè im-tsuí, kuân kàu ām-kún. Em-má-nu-el, i ê si̍t thí-khui, phiàn-muá lí ê tē.
English: It will sweep onward into Judah. It will overflow and pass through; it will reach even to the neck; and the stretching out of its wings will fill the breadth of your land, Immanuel.

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ lâng lī-khui i ê ke liáu-āu, thang khì kè pa̍t lâng.
English: When she is departed out of his house, she may go and be another man's wife.

Tailo: M̄-koh, ū tsi̍t-kuá lâng kò͘-tsi̍p m̄-sìn, tī kûn-tsiòng ê bīn-tsîng siat-to̍k Tsú ê tō-lō͘. Páulô tsiū tshuā bûn-tô͘ lī-khui in, ta̍k ji̍t tī Tu-la̍h-nô͘ ê káng-tn̂g kah lâng piān-lūn.
English: But when some were hardened and disobedient, speaking evil of the Way before the multitude, he departed from them, and separated the disciples, reasoning daily in the school of Tyrannus.

Tailo: In tī tsuí-tsuâⁿ mn̂g ê tuì-bīn, tuì Tabi̍t siâⁿ ê kiā-á-tsàn tńg-.khì, to̍h-sī tsiūⁿ siâⁿ tshiûⁿ ê só͘-tsāi, sī Tabi̍t ông kiong ê tíng-bīn, ǹg tang khì-kàu tsuí-mn̂g.
English: By the spring gate, and straight before them, they went up by the stairs of the city of David, at the ascent of the wall, above the house of David, even to the water gate eastward.

Tailo: Lâng khi-phiàn i ê tshù-piⁿ, kóng, Guá sī teh kún-tshiò ,
English: Like a madman who shoots firebrands, arrows, and death,

Tailo: In-uī guá ê tsú-bîn bē kì-tit Guá, ǹg hi-ké ê sîn sio hiuⁿ, in hō͘ in tī só͘ kiâⁿ ê lō͘, tī kū ê lō͘ that-tio̍h, hō͘ in kiânn phian lō͘, bô thūn kuân ê;
English: For my people have forgotten me, they have burned incense to false gods; and they have been made to stumble in their ways, in the ancient paths, to walk in byways, in a way not built up;

Tailo: M̄-koh, lūn hit-ê ji̍t-tsí á-.sī hit-ê sî-khik, bô lâng tsai-iáⁿ. Thinn tíng ê thiⁿ-sài m̄-tsai, Kiáⁿ mā m̄-tsai; to̍k-to̍k Thiⁿ-pē tsai niā-niā.
English: But no one knows of that day and hour, not even the angels of heaven, but my Father only.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Piattò͘ kóng, Tsú ah, tshian-bān m̄-thang, in-uī guá m̄-bat tsia̍h lah-sap bô tshing-khì ê mi̍h.
English: But Peter said, Not so, Lord; for I have never eaten anything that is common or unclean.

Tailo: Koh kā sì tâi tshia kah peh tsiah gû, kau hō͘ Melalih ê kiáⁿ-sun, tsiàu in só͘ tsò ê kang; in lóng hō͘ tsè-si Alông ê kiáⁿ Ithamal kuán-hat.
English: and he gave four wagons and eight oxen to the sons of Merari, according to their service, under the direction of Ithamar the son of Aaron the priest.

Tailo: Iésu mn̄g i kóng, Lí hō-tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h miâ? Hit-ê lâng ìn kóng, Guá ê miâ kiò-tsò ' Kun-thuân', in-uī guán sī kui tuā-tīn ê kuí.
English: He asked him, What is your name? He said to him, My name is Legion, for we are many.

Tailo: Guá tsin kiaⁿ, só͘-í, kā lí hit tsi̍t-tshìn gîn-pè tâi tī thô͘-kha. Taⁿ lí ê gîn-pè hîng lí. '
English: I was afraid, and went away and hid your talent in the earth. Behold, you have what is yours.'

Tailo: Nepkatnetsal ông bat kah i kí Siōngtè lâi tsiù-tsuā, tsóng-.sī, i puē-puān, ngē i ê ām-kún, kò͘-tsi̍p i ê sim, m̄ kui-sūn Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè.
English: He also rebelled against king Nebuchadnezzar, who had made him swear by God: but he stiffened his neck, and hardened his heart against turning to Yahweh, the God of Israel.

Tailo: Lâng nā ài tshut-miâ tsiū bē tiām-tiām-á tsò tāi-tsì. Lí kì-jiân teh tsò tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, tio̍h khì tsò hō͘ sè-kan lâng khuànn.
English: For no one does anything in secret, and himself seeks to be known openly. If you do these things, reveal yourself to the world.

Tailo: Ehulaim ke khí tsè-tuâⁿ tì-sú huān tsuē; in-uī án-ne, tsè-tuâⁿ hō͘ in huān tsuē.
English: Because Ephraim has multiplied altars for sinning, They became for him altars for sinning.

Tailo: Thiàⁿ guá ê lâng, guá mā thiàⁿ i; khún-tshiat tsáu-tshuē guá ê lâng, ē tshuē-.tio̍h.
English: I love those who love me. Those who seek me diligently will find me.

Tailo: Guán ê sim-sîn sî-sî teh thìng-hāu Siōngtsú; I sī tsò guán ê pang-tsān, tsò guán ê tîn-pâi.
English: Our soul has waited for Yahweh. He is our help and our shield.

Tailo: A-pí-hāi ê kiáⁿ So͘-lia̍t tsò Melalih tsong-tso̍k tsiah-ê ke ê siú-líng, in tio̍h tsat iâⁿ tī huē-bō͘ piⁿ ê pak pîng.
English: The prince of the fathers' house of the families of Merari was Zuriel the son of Abihail. They shall encamp on the north side of the tabernacle.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê lâng m̄-sī lín só͘ kóng teh tsiú-tsuì, in-uī tsit-má tsiah tsá-khí sî káu tiám.
English: For these aren't drunken, as you suppose, seeing it is only the third hour of the day .

Tailo: I tuì Lí kiû ua̍h-miā, Lí tsiū hō͘ i; to̍h-sī tn̂g huè-siū kàu tī íng-uán.
English: He asked life of you, you gave it to him, Even length of days forever and ever.

Tailo: Lí tī mn̂g-āu, mn̂g-khing āu, khiā lí ê kì-liām; tuì pa̍t lâng lō͘-hiān sing-khu, tsiūⁿ-khì lí khui-khuah ê bîn-tshn̂g kah in li̍p-iok; lí tī hia khuàⁿ-tio̍h in ê bîn-tshn̂g, tsiū tsin ì-ài.
English: Behind the doors and the posts have you set up your memorial: for you have uncovered yourself to another than me, and are gone up; you have enlarged your bed, and made you a covenant with them: you loved their bed where you saw it.

Tailo: Gōng ê kā tshong-bîng ê kóng, ' Tshiánn kā lín ê iû pun tsi̍t-kuá hō͘ guán, in-uī guán ê ting teh beh hua-khì à. '
English: The foolish said to the wise, Give us some of your oil, for our lamps are going out.'

Tailo: In-uī Lí ê tsû-ài pí sèⁿ-miā khah hó, guá ê tshuì-tûn beh o-ló Lí.
English: Because your loving kindness is better than life, My lips shall praise you.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, Siōngtè hō͘ in sán-sing kiông-lia̍t ê tshò-kak, khì siong-sìn hiah-ê hi-ké.
English: Because of this, God sends them a working of error, that they should believe a lie;

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê bē tsí-sik-pò͘ ê hū-jîn-lâng lâi thiaⁿ tō-lí, i ê miâ kiò-tsò Lu-tí-a, i sī Τhu-a-tí-lah siâⁿ ê lâng, pîng-sî kìng-pài Siōngtè. Siōngtè khui i ê sim, hō͘ i tsuan-sim thiaⁿ Páulô só͘ kóng ê uē.
English: A certain woman named Lydia, a seller of purple, of the city of Thyatira, one who worshiped God, heard us; whose heart the Lord opened to listen to the things which were spoken by Paul.

Tailo: Iâkop huan-hù i hiah-ê kiáⁿ liáu-āu, kha kiu-khì bîn-tshn̂g tíng, tsiū tn̄g-khuì, tńg-khì i ê tsó͘-sian hia.
English: When Jacob made an end of charging his sons, he gathered up his feet into the bed, and yielded up the spirit, and was gathered to his people.

Tailo: Tit-tio̍h lán ê Siōngtè si un ê tshiú pang-tsān guán, in tī Isulael ê kan-á-sun, Lēbī ê sun, Mak-lī ê kiáⁿ-sun tiong-kan, tshuā tsi̍t-ê thong-ta̍t ê lâng lâi, koh ū Se-le-biah kah i hiah-ê kiáⁿ, kah i ê hiann-tī, kiōng tsa̍p-peh lâng.
English: According to the good hand of our God on us they brought us a man of discretion, of the sons of Mahli, the son of Levi, the son of Israel; and Sherebiah, with his sons and his brothers, eighteen;

Tailo: M̄-thang bē kì-tit tsiap-thāi tshut-guā lâng, in-uī án-ne tsò ē tī bô-ì-tiong tsiap-thāi tio̍h thiⁿ-sài.
English: Don't forget to show hospitality to strangers, for in doing so, some have entertained angels without knowing it.

Tailo: E-hō͘-iá-kin kiânn Siōngtsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, tsiàu i ê lāu-pē it-tshè ê só͘ kiâⁿ.
English: He did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh, according to all that his father had done.

Tailo: M̄-koh liân-tiúⁿ ài beh kiù Páulô, tsiū kā in tsó͘-tòng, bīng-līng ē siû-tsuí ê lâng sing thiàu lo̍h-tsuí tsiūⁿ huāⁿ.
English: But the centurion, desiring to save Paul, stopped them from their purpose, and commanded that those who could swim should throw themselves overboard first to go toward the land;

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Mô͘se kóng, Lí tio̍h huan-hù Alông ê kiáⁿ-sun tsò tsè-si ê, kóng: Ka-tso̍k tiong nā ū lâng sí, m̄-thang uī-tio̍h i lâi uè lah-sap ka-kī.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Speak to the priests, the sons of Aaron, and say to them, A priest shall not defile himself for the dead among his people;

Tailo: Siū-siong ê lô͘-tik, I bô beh at-tn̄g; beh hua ê ting-hué, I mā bô beh pûn-sit, it-ti̍t kàu I hō͘ kong-gī tik-sìng.
English: He won't break a bruised reed. He won't quench a smoking flax, Until he leads justice to victory.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tī o͘-àm tiong só͘ kóng ê, ē tī kng-bîng tiong hō͘ lâng thiaⁿ-.tio̍h. Lín tī pâng-king lāi hīⁿ-khang piⁿ só͘ kóng ê, ē hō͘ lâng tī tshù-bué-tíng kong-khai suan-pò͘.
English: Therefore whatever you have said in the darkness will be heard in the light. What you have spoken in the ear in the inner chambers will be proclaimed on the housetops.

Tailo: Guān Siōngtsú huann-hí ê bīn khuànn lí, siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí pîng-an. '
English: Yahweh lift up his face toward you, And give you peace.'

Tailo: Huāⁿ lê ê lâng lê guá ê kha-tsiah-phiaⁿ, lê ê kau-hûn thua tsin tn̂g.
English: The plowers plowed on my back. They made their furrows long.

Tailo: Nā m̄-sī bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kā lán lâu tām-po̍h tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê jîn-bîn, lán tsá to̍h tshin-tshiūnn So͘tóm, tshin-tshiūnn Ammo͘la̍h án-ne siū siau-bia̍t.
English: Unless Yahweh of Armies had left to us a very small remnant, We would have been as Sodom; We would have been like Gomorrah.

Tailo: Ū gī lâng kiâⁿ gī, tian-tò bia̍t-bông; ū pháiⁿ lâng kiâⁿ pháiⁿ, tian-tò tsia̍h tn̂g huè-siū. Guá tī khang-hi ê ji̍t-tsí lóng ū khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: All this have I seen in my days of vanity: there is a righteous man who perishes in his righteousness, and there is a wicked man who lives long in his evil-doing.

Tailo: Tio̍h hō͘ in ê ba̍k-tsiu hue, bē-tàng khuànn-kìnn. Tio̍h hō͘ in ê kha-tsiah-phiaⁿ íng-uán khiau-ku. （ Tsù, SPh 69:22-23)
English: Let their eyes be darkened, that they may not see. Bow down their back always.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Piattò͘ kóng, Pîng-iú, lí teh kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h, guá m̄-tsai. Iáu teh kóng ê sî, ke suî-sî thî.
English: But Peter said, Man, I don't know what you are talking about! Immediately, while he was still speaking, a rooster crowed.

Tailo: Iôséhuh kā i ê lāu-pē kah i ê a-hiaⁿ kóng, in lāu-pē tsiū kā i tsik-pī, kóng, Lí só͘ bāng-kìnn tsit-ê bāng sī siáⁿ-mi̍h bāng? Kám kóng guá kah lín lāu-bú, lín hiann-tī, lóng tio̍h phak-teh kā lí pài?
English: He told it to his father and to his brothers. His father rebuked him, and said to him, What is this dream that you have dreamed? Will I and your mother and your brothers indeed come to bow ourselves down to you to the earth?

Tailo: Guá tsuân-sim tsuân-ì teh ho̍k-sāi Siōngtè, suan-iông kuan-hē I ê Kiáⁿ ê hok-im. Siōngtè ē thè guá tsò-tsìng, guá tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī kî-tó tiong siàu-liām lín,
English: For God is my witness, whom I serve in my spirit in the Good News of his Son, how unceasingly I make mention of you always in my prayers,

Tailo: Āu-lâi, i koh tshut khì tshuā tshit ê pí ka-kī khah pháiⁿ ê siâ-sîn, ji̍p-khì hia tsò-hué tuà; án-ne, hit-ê lâng ê kiat-kio̍k pí khí-thâu koh khah tshám. Tsit-ê siâ-ok ê sè-tāi mā ē tshin-tshiūⁿ án-ne.
English: Then he goes, and takes with himself seven other spirits more evil than he is, and they enter in and dwell there. The last state of that man becomes worse than the first. Even so will it be also to this evil generation.

Tailo: In-uī lán ê tsó͘-sian ū huān tsuē, kiânn Siōngtsú — lán ê Siōngtè só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, lī-khui I, ua̍t-tńg i ê bīn, kha-tsiah-phiaⁿ ǹg Siōngtsú tuà ê só͘-tsāi.
English: For our fathers have trespassed, and done that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh our God, and have forsaken him, and have turned away their faces from the habitation of Yahweh, and turned their backs.

Tailo: Ka-la̍uh tī lō͘ piⁿ ê, sī teh phì-jū lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h tō-lí, Mô͘-kuí tsiū lâi tuì in ê sim-lāi kā tō-lí tshiúⁿ-.khì, hō͘ in bē-tàng sìn tō-lí lâi tit-tio̍h kiù.
English: Those along the road are those who hear, then the devil comes, and takes away the word from their heart, that they may not believe and be saved.

Tailo: Kuan-hē Isulael lâng, Isáiah bat suan-pò͘ kóng, Isulael ê kiáⁿ-sun, suî-jiân sò͘-bo̍k tshin-tshiūnn hái sua hiah-ni̍h tsē, ē tit-tio̍h kiù ê sī só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê tsió-sò͘ niā-niā.
English: Isaiah cries concerning Israel, If the number of the children of Israel are as the sand of the sea, It is the remnant who will be saved;

Tailo: Iôtah siū lia̍h ê kûn-tsiòng tī Babúlông ê, ē īng tsit nn̄g lâng tsò uē-pèⁿ lâi tsiù-tsó͘ lâng, kóng, ' Guān Siōngtsú hō͘ lí tshin-tshiūnn Tsetikiah kah Ahap, hō͘ Babúlông ông īng hué kā lí sio. '
English: and of them shall be taken up a curse by all the captives of Judah who are in Babylon, saying, Yahweh make you like Zedekiah and like Ahab, whom the king of Babylon roasted in the fire;

Tailo: In tsiū khì kìnn tuā-tsè-si Hilkíiah, kā só͘-ū hiàn tī Siōngtsú tiān ê gîn kau hō͘ i; tsit-ê gîn sī kò͘-mn̂g ê Lēbī lâng, tuì Mánáse, Ehulaim kah só͘-ū Isulael tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng, í-ki̍p Iôtah, Biāniámín kûn-tsiòng kah tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê jîn-bîn siu-.lâi ê.
English: They came to Hilkiah the high priest, and delivered the money that was brought into the house of God, which the Levites, the keepers of the threshold, had gathered of the hand of Manasseh and Ephraim, and of all the remnant of Israel, and of all Judah and Benjamin, and of the inhabitants of Jerusalem.

Tailo: In-uī tuì guá lâi kóng, ua̍h sī uī-tio̍h Ki-tok, sí mā ū khah tuā ê lī-ik.
English: For to me to live is Christ, and to die is gain.

Tailo: M̄-koh, hiah-ê sió-táⁿ ê, m̄-sìn ê, khó-ò͘ⁿ ê, thâi lâng ê, îm-luān ê, kiâⁿ siâ-su̍t-ê, pài ngó͘-siōng ê kah só͘-ū kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t ê lâng, in tsù tiāⁿ-tio̍h khì ê só͘-tsāi sī hit-ê ū hué kah liû-hông teh sio ê ô͘; tsit-ê to̍h-sī tē-jī pái ê sí.
English: But for the cowardly, unbelieving, sinners, abominable, murderers, sexually immoral, sorcerers, idolaters, and all liars, their part is in the lake that burns with fire and sulfur, which is the second death.

Tailo: Be-lot lâng tsá-tsîng tsáu kàu Git-tha-im, tshut-guā tī hia, kàu kin-á-ji̍t.
English: and the Beerothites fled to Gittaim, and have lived as foreigners there until this day).

Tailo: Tabi̍t ê tuā-hiaⁿ Elíap thiaⁿ-tio̍h i kah lâng teh kóng uē, Elíap tuì Tabi̍t siū-khì, kóng, Lí ná ē lo̍h-lâi tsia? Hit kuí tsiah iûⁿ tī khòng-iá-.ni̍h, lí pàng kau hō͘ siáⁿ lâng? Guá tsai lí kiau-ngō͘ kah lí sim-lāi ê pháiⁿ, lí lo̍h-lâi tsí-put-kò sī beh khuànn kau-tsiàn!
English: Eliab his eldest brother heard when he spoke to the men; and Eliab's anger was kindled against David, and he said, Why are you come down? and with whom have you left those few sheep in the wilderness? I know your pride, and the naughtiness of your heart; for you have come down that you might see the battle.

Tailo: Tī tshù tíng ê lâng m̄-thang ji̍p-khì tshù lāi the̍h mi̍h-kiāⁿ.
English: and let him who is on the housetop not go down, nor enter in, to take anything out of his house.

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ lâng tuì Eliiah kóng, Taⁿ guá tsai lí sī Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k, lí só͘ kóng ê Siōngtsú ê uē lóng sī tsin-si̍t ê.
English: The woman said to Elijah, Now I know that you are a man of God, and that the word of Yahweh in your mouth is truth.

Tailo: Iésu ê bûn-tô͘ mn̄g I tsit-ê phì-jū sī siáⁿ ì-sù.
English: Then his disciples asked him, What does this parable mean?

Tailo: Lín nā kìng-uì Siōngtsú, ho̍k-sāi I, thiaⁿ I ê uē, bô uî-puē Siōngtsú ê bīng-līng, lín kah kā lín kuán-hat ê ông mā sūn-ho̍k Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè tsiū hó.
English: If you will fear Yahweh, and serve him, and listen to his voice, and not rebel against the commandment of Yahweh, and both you and also the king who reigns over you are followers of Yahweh your God, well:

Tailo: Tì-sú guá ē hông tshui-sí, ài sí-bông, khah iâⁿ tshun tsiah-ê kut.
English: So that my soul chooses strangling, Death rather than my bones.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tuì in kóng, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng: Guá kí Guá ê íng-uán ua̍h-miā lâi tsiù-tsuā, Guá tsua̍t-tuì bô huann-hí pháiⁿ lâng sí-bông, to̍k-to̍k huann-hí pháiⁿ lâng ua̍t tńg-lâi lī-khui i só͘ kiâⁿ ê lō͘ lâi ua̍h. Isulael ê tsú-bîn, lín tio̍h ua̍t tò tńg-.lâi, lī-khui pháiⁿ lō͘, lín ná ē beh tshú sí?
English: Tell them, As I live, says the Lord Yahweh, I have no pleasure in the death of the wicked; but that the wicked turn from his way and live: turn you, turn you from your evil ways; for why will you die, house of Israel?

Tailo: Ha-ka-liah ê kiáⁿ Nîhímiah ê kì-lio̍k. Tng jī-tsa̍p nî, Ki-su-liû gue̍h, guá tī Su-san ê ông-kiong.
English: The words of Nehemiah the son of Hacaliah. Now it happened in the month Chislev, in the twentieth year, as I was in Shushan the palace,

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, gī lâng ē tuì Siōngtsú tit-tio̍h kiù; huān-lān ê sî, Siōngtsú ē tsò in ê iâⁿ-tsē.
English: But the salvation of the righteous is from Yahweh. He is their stronghold in the time of trouble.

Tailo: Nā bô, guá khiā tī gī-huē teh sin-sò͘ ê sî, in tio̍h tsí-tshut guá ū siáⁿ-mi̍h m̄-tio̍h ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Or else let these men themselves say what injustice they found in me when I stood before the council,

Tailo: Tng ông tiàm tī tshù lāi, Siōngtsú mā í-king hō͘ i thuat-lī sì-kho͘-uî ê tuì-ti̍k, tit-tio̍h an-tsīng ê sî,
English: It happened, when the king lived in his house, and Yahweh had given him rest from all his enemies round about,

Tailo: Hit ji̍t, Guá beh hō͘ Iôtah ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ tshin-tshiūnn hué-tiáⁿ tī tshâ ê tiong-kan, koh tshin-tshiūnn hué-pé tī tiū-khún ê tiong-kan; in ē tī tò pîng tsiànn pîng sio-bia̍t sì-kho͘-uî ê lia̍t kok. Êlúsalèm jîn-bîn ē iû-guân tuà tī pún só͘-tsāi, to̍h-sī Êlúsalèm.
English: In that day I will make the chieftains of Judah like a pan of fire among wood, and like a flaming torch among sheaves; and they will devour all the surrounding peoples, on the right hand and on the left; and Jerusalem will yet again dwell in their own place, even in Jerusalem.

Tailo: I tsi̍t-ē tshut siaⁿ, hô͘-sîn kui tīn pue-.lâi, Koh ū sat-bó tī in ê kíng lāi muá sì-kè.
English: He spoke, and swarms of flies came, And lice in all their borders.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Io-a-si ông tiàu tsè-si Io-ho-iá-tah kah kî-tha ê tsè-si lâi, kā in kóng, Lín ná ē bô siu-lí tiān phò-huāi ê só͘-tsāi? Taⁿ lín m̄-thang koh tuì só͘ bat ê lâng siu gîn, tio̍h kā hit-ê gîn kau tshut-.lâi, thang siu-lí tiān phò-huāi ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Then king Jehoash called for Jehoiada the priest, and for the other priests, and said to them, Why don't you repair the breaches of the house? now therefore take no more money from your acquaintance, but deliver it for the breaches of the house.

Tailo: Kā in kau hō͘ Lô-má kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ, kóng, Tsit nn̄g-ê lâng sī Iô-tá-iah lâng, lâi teh jiáu-luān lán ê siâⁿ,
English: When they had brought them to the magistrates, they said, These men, being Jews, are agitating our city,

Tailo: Āu-lâi, Tabi̍t mn̄g Siōngtsú kóng, Guá kám thang tsiūⁿ-khì Iôtah ê tsi̍t-ê siâⁿ? Siōngtsú kā i kóng, Thang tsiūⁿ-.khì. Tabi̍t kóng, Guá tio̍h tsiūⁿ-khì tó-uī? I kóng, Khì Hebúlông.
English: It happened after this, that David inquired of Yahweh, saying, Shall I go up into any of the cities of Judah? Yahweh said to him, Go up. David said, Where shall I go up? He said, To Hebron.

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ lâng lâi-kàu hit-ê suaⁿ, kàu Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k hia, tsiū lám i ê kha. Gehatsih tsìn-tsîng lâi beh kā i tshia-khui, Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, Tshut-tsāi i, in-uī i sim-lāi thòng-khó͘, Siōngtsú tuì guá am-khàm, bô kā guá kóng.
English: When she came to the man of God to the hill, she caught hold of his feet. Gehazi came near to thrust her away; but the man of God said, Let her alone: for her soul is vexed within her; and Yahweh has hid it from me, and has not told me.

Tailo: Lí ê uē tī guá ê tshuì lāi ū guā tinn, tī guá ê tshuì lāi pí bi̍t khah tiⁿ!
English: How sweet are your promises to my taste, More than honey to my mouth!

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê siann ū tuā khuì-la̍t, Siōngtsú ê siann tshiong-muá ui-giâm.
English: Yahweh's voice is powerful. Yahweh's voice is full of majesty.

Tailo: Lín ē thiaⁿ-tio̍h kau-tsiàn kah jiáu-luān ê tāi-tsì, hit sî lín m̄-bián tio̍h-kiaⁿ, in-uī tsiah-ê tāi-tsì it-tīng ē tāi-sing huat-sing, tsóng-.sī, bua̍t-ji̍t bē suî-sî kàu.
English: When you hear of wars and disturbances, don't be terrified, for these things must happen first, but the end won't come immediately.

Tailo: Sâmsóng-lâi-kàu Ga-jah, tī hia khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê ki-lí, tsiū tshin-kīn i.
English: Samson went to Gaza, and saw there a prostitute, and went in to her.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kian-kò͘ guá, hō͘ guá tsē guá ê lāu-pē Tabi̍t ê uī, tsiàu I só͘ ìng-ín ê uē kā guá kiàn-li̍p ke; guá kí I íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā lâi tsiù-tsuā, Atonîiah kin-á-ji̍t it-tīng tio̍h sí.
English: Now therefore as Yahweh lives, who has established me, and set me on the throne of David my father, and who has made me a house, as he promised, surely Adonijah shall be put to death this day.

Tailo: Iâkop teh kah in kóng-uē ê sî, La̍h-khel tshuā in lāu-pē ê iûⁿ uá-.lâi, in-uī iûⁿ sī i teh kò͘.
English: While he was yet speaking with them, Rachel came with her father's sheep, for she kept them.

Tailo: I ū hō͘-hui tshit pah, lóng sī kuì-tso̍k ê, koh ū pîn-hui saⁿ pah. Tsiah-ê lú-tsú iú-hi̍k i ê sim.
English: He had seven hundred wives, princesses, and three hundred concubines; and his wives turned away his heart.

Tailo: In tuì Bethel tshut-huat, lī-khui Ehula̍t iáu ū tsi̍t-tsām-á lō͘ ê sî, La̍h-khel lîm-sán, tú-tio̍h ū kan-lân.
English: They traveled from Bethel. There was still some distance to come to Ephrath, and Rachel travailed. She had hard labor.

Tailo: Pē-bú khuàⁿ-tio̍h I tsiū tio̍h-kiaⁿ; I ê lāu-bú tuì I kóng, Kiáⁿ ah, Lí ná thang án-ne tuì-thāi guán? Lí khuànn, Lí ê lāu-pē kah guá tsin huân-ló, it-ti̍t teh tshuē Lí.
English: When they saw him, they were astonished, and his mother said to him, Son, why have you treated us this way? Behold, your father and I were anxiously looking for you.

Tailo: Khuànn, tsiah-ê to̍h-sī pháiⁿ lâng; in tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ hó kuè-ji̍t, tsâi-pó ná ke-thinn.
English: Behold, these are the wicked. Being always at ease, they increase in riches.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú tī tsit ji̍t beh kā lín sio̍k-tsuē, hō͘ lín tshing-khì, lín ē tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h tshing-khì, thuat-lī it-tshè ê tsuē-kò.
English: for on this day shall atonement be made for you, to cleanse you; from all your sins you shall be clean before Yahweh.

Tailo: Hó lâng ē tit-tio̍h Siōngtsú ê un-tián; Siat kuí-kè ê lâng ē hō͘ Siōngtsú tīng tsuē.
English: A good man shall obtain favor from Yahweh, But he will condemn a man of wicked devices.

Tailo: Guá kiânn tī kong-gī ê lō͘, kiânn tī kong-pêⁿ ê lō͘,
English: I walk in the way of righteousness, In the midst of the paths of justice;

Tailo: Lín só͘-ū ê tsa-po͘ ting tio̍h tsi̍t nî saⁿ pái lâi kìnn tsì-kuân Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè.
English: Three times in the year all your males shall appear before the Lord Yahweh, the God of Israel.

Tailo: Bîn-tsiòng kóng, Lí m̄-bat khi-hū guán, m̄-bat ap-tsè guán, mā m̄-bat tuì lâng ê tshiú the̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h mi̍h.
English: They said, You have not defrauded us, nor oppressed us, neither have you taken anything of any man's hand.

Tailo: Lí khuànn i ê sim tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng tsīn-tiong, tsiū kah i li̍p-iok, ìng-ín kā Ka-nân lâng, Hiat lâng, Amô͘lī lâng, Pe-lí-ji lâng, I-é-bú-suh lâng, Gi-ga-sih lâng ê tē hō͘ i ê kiáⁿ-sun, koh ū ìng-giām Lí ê uē, in-uī Lí sī kong-gī ê.
English: and found his heart faithful before you, and made a covenant with him to give the land of the Canaanite, the Hittite, the Amorite, and the Perizzite, and the Jebusite, and the Girgashite, to give it to his seed, and have performed your words; for you are righteous.

Tailo: I ìn kóng, Hit-ê miâ kiò-tsò Iésu ê lâng kiáu thô͘ kô͘ guá ê ba̍k-tsiu, kā guá kóng, ' Khì Si-ló-ám tî sé. ' Guá suî-sî khì sé, tsiū piàn ē khuànn-kìnn.
English: He answered, A man called Jesus made mud, anointed my eyes, and said to me, Go to the pool of Siloam, and wash.' So I went away and washed, and I received sight.

Tailo: Sian-ti I-é-lí-miah tuì Êlúsalèm kià phue hō͘ siū lia̍h iáu tī-.leh ê láu-tuā kah tsiah-ê tsè-si, sian-ti, í-ki̍p tsìng lâng, to̍h-sī Nepkatnetsal tuì Êlúsalèm lia̍h kàu Babúlông ê.
English: Now these are the words of the letter that Jeremiah the prophet sent from Jerusalem to the residue of the elders of the captivity, and to the priests, and to the prophets, and to all the people, whom Nebuchadnezzar had carried away captive from Jerusalem to Babylon,

Tailo: Batseba kóng, Guān lí kā Siu-ném ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á Amí-siak, siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí ê a-hiaⁿ Atonîiah tsò bó͘.
English: She said, Let Abishag the Shunammite be given to Adonijah your brother as wife.

Tailo: Kng tsin-tsiàⁿ sī hó, ba̍k-tsiu khuàⁿ-tio̍h kng mā sī thang huann-hí.
English: Truly the light is sweet, And a pleasant thing it is for the eyes to see the sun.

Tailo: In tshin-tshiūnn tsù-tiāⁿ lo̍h im-hú ê iûⁿ-kûn, sí-bông tsò in ê bo̍k-tsiá, tshuā in tsi̍t-lō͘ kàu bōng-tē. Kàu tsá-khí sî, tsìng-ti̍t ê lâng ē kā in kuán-hat, in ê hîng-thé ē hō͘ im-hú siau-bia̍t, tì-sú bô koh ū tuà ê só͘-tsāi.
English: They are appointed as a flock for Sheol. Death shall be their shepherd. The upright shall have dominion over them in the morning. Their beauty shall decay in Sheol, Far from their mansion.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, lí só͘ uá-khò ê Aigi̍p, sī hit-ê pit-phuà ê lô͘-tik kuáiⁿ; lâng nā uá i, tsiū ē tsha̍k ji̍p-khì i ê tshiú. Aigi̍p ông Huâ-láu tuì só͘-ū uá-khò i ê lâng mā sī án-ne.
English: Now, behold, you trust on the staff of this bruised reed, even on Egypt; whereon if a man lean, it will go into his hand, and pierce it: so is Pharaoh king of Egypt to all who trust on him.

Tailo: Guá mā beh kā lín kuáⁿ lī-khui Guá ê bīn-tsîng, tshin-tshiūnn Guá bat kuáⁿ lín ê tsìng hiann-tī — Ehulaim só͘-ū ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: I will cast you out of my sight, as I have cast out all your brothers, even the whole seed of Ephraim.

Tailo: Kah guá kóng-uē ê sù-tsiá tuì guá kóng, Lí tio̍h tshut siaⁿ kóng, bān-kun ê Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Uī-tio̍h Êlúsalèm kah uī-tio̍h Si-óng, Guá jia̍t-sim kàu-ki̍k.
English: So the angel who talked with me said to me, Proclaim, saying, Thus says Yahweh of Armies: I am jealous for Jerusalem and for Zion with a great jealousy.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú lâi mā tsia̍h mā lim, lín tsiū kóng, ' I sī tham-tsia̍h hò͘ⁿ-tsiú ê lâng, sī thiu-suè-.ê kah tsuē-jîn ê pîng-iú. '
English: The Son of Man has come eating and drinking, and you say, Behold, a gluttonous man, and a drunkard; a friend of tax collectors and sinners!'

Tailo: Lô-bo-àm só͘ kiâⁿ ê tāi-tsì, tuì-thâu kàu-bué, kám bô kì tī sian-ti Simáiah kah sian-kiàn Ittó͘ ê tsheh iú-kuan tso̍k-phó͘ ê? Lô-bo-àm kah Ia-lô-ba-am tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kau-tsiàn.
English: Now the acts of Rehoboam, first and last, aren't they written in the histories of Shemaiah the prophet and of Iddo the seer, after the manner of genealogies? There were wars between Rehoboam and Jeroboam continually.

Tailo: Iôséhuh kā in kóng, Guá tú-á kóng lín sī tsing-thàm, tsit-ê uē si̍t-tsāi bô m̄-tio̍h.
English: Joseph said to them, It is like I told you, saying, You are spies.'

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá hō͘ lí ê bīn ngē, sī beh pí in ê bīn khah ngē; Guá hō͘ lí ê thâu-hia̍h tīng, sī beh pí in ê thâu-hia̍h khah tīng.
English: Behold, I have made your face hard against their faces, and your forehead hard against their foreheads.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guán ê Siōngtè ah, taⁿ kiû Lí thiaⁿ Lí ê lô͘-po̍k ê kî-tó khún-kiû, koh in-uī Tsú ê iân-kò͘, hō͘ Lí ê bīn ê kng tsiò tī Lí pha-hng ê sìng-só͘.
English: Now therefore, our God, listen to the prayer of your servant, and to his petitions, and cause your face to shine on your sanctuary that is desolate, for the Lord's sake.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, i kī-tsua̍t lāu lâng só͘ hō͘ i ê kè-tshik kah hiah-ê khiā tī i bīn-tsîng, khì kah i pêⁿ-ûn ê siàu-liân lâng tsham-siông,
English: But he forsook the counsel of the old men which they had given him, and took counsel with the young men who had grown up with him, who stood before him.

Tailo: Bē ài put-gī, tsí ū ài tsin-lí.
English: doesn't rejoice in unrighteousness, but rejoices with the truth;

Tailo: I tài-liām in tsí-put-kò sī hia̍t-khì ê lâng, sī tshue kuè-khì bô koh tò tńg-.lâi ê hong.
English: He remembered that they were but flesh, A wind that passes away, and doesn't come again.

Tailo: Thâu tsi̍t tâi tshia kuà tshiah bé, tē-jī tâi tshia kuà o͘ bé,
English: In the first chariot were red horses; in the second chariot black horses;

Tailo: Tshám ah! Hit-ê ji̍t sī tuā, bô thang pí-phīng; sī Iâkop tú-tio̍h huān-lān ê kî-ji̍t; tsóng-.sī, i ē tit-tio̍h kiù lâi thuat-tshut.
English: Alas! for that day is great, so that none is like it: it is even the time of Jacob's trouble; but he shall be saved out of it.

Tailo: hit-ê kài koh tuì suaⁿ tíng kàu Nî-hut-to-a ê tsuí-tsuâⁿ, thàng-kàu Ehulóng suaⁿ hiah-ê siâⁿ; hit-ê kài koh kàu Bala̍h, ( Bala̍h to̍h-sī Ki-lia̍t-iâ-lîm );
English: and the border extended from the top of the mountain to the spring of the waters of Nephtoah, and went out to the cities of Mount Ephron; and the border extended to Baalah (the same is Kiriath Jearim);

Tailo: Guá kā Lí ê giân-gí khǹg tī sim-lāi, bián-tit guá tik-tsuē Lí.
English: I have hidden your word in my heart, That I might not sin against you.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Isulael ê ke, lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh hō͘ tsi̍t kok tuì hn̄g-hn̄g lâi kā lín kong-kik, to̍h-sī kiông ê kok, tuì kó͘-tsá to̍h ū ê kok, i ê giân-gí lí bē liáu-kái, mā bē bîng-pi̍k i só͘ kóng ê.
English: Behold, I will bring a nation on you from far, house of Israel, says Yahweh: it is a mighty nation, it is an ancient nation, a nation whose language you don't know, neither understand what they say.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Mô͘se kah Alông kóng, Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh ê lē sī án-ne: Guā-pang lâng lóng m̄-thang tsia̍h Puâⁿ-kuè-tseh.
English: Yahweh said to Moses and Aaron, This is the ordinance of the Passover. There shall no foreigner eat of it,

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā tsiah-ê tāi-tsì kā in khuàn-bián kah kà-sī.
English: Command and teach these things.

Tailo: Lí ê ke kah lí ê kok ē íng-uán kiàn-li̍p tī lí ê bīn-tsîng, lí ê kok-uī mā ē kian-kò͘ kàu íng-uán. '
English: Your house and your kingdom shall be made sure for ever before you: your throne shall be established forever.

Tailo: nn̄g tsiah gû-káng, gō͘ tsiah mî-iûⁿ-káng, gō͘ tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng, gō͘ tsiah bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á, tsò siā-un-tsè. Tsiah-ê sī A-mi-hut ê kiáⁿ Elísiamah ê lé-mi̍h.
English: and for the sacrifice of peace offerings, two oxen, five rams, five male goats, and five male lambs a year old. This was the offering of Elishama the son of Ammihud.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k Iô-tá-iah lâng siàn-tōng kìng-khiân tsun-kuì ê hū-jîn-lâng kah siâⁿ lāi ê thâu-lâng lâi pik-hāi Páulô kah Ba-ná-ba, kā in kuáⁿ-tshut hit só͘-tsāi.
English: But the Jews stirred up the devout and prominent women and the chief men of the city, and stirred up a persecution against Paul and Barnabas, and threw them out of their borders.

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h tshia-lián ê khuân sī kuân kah tsin kiaⁿ-lâng; sì-ê lián ê khuân ū ba̍k-tsiu muá-muá.
English: As for their rims, they were high and dreadful; and they four had their rims full of eyes round about.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Mô͘se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng kā tuā hō͘-tsuí khui lō͘; á-.sī tsún-pī luî-tiān ê lō͘?
English: Who has cut a channel for the flood water, Or the path for the thunderstorm;

Tailo: tsiū thang kā i tshuā kàu lí ê ke, i tsiū tio̍h thì thâu-mn̂g, siu tsíng-kah,
English: then you shall bring her home to your house; and she shall shave her head, and pare her nails;

Tailo: guān Lí tī thiⁿ-.ni̍h, Lí só͘ tuà ê só͘-tsāi, lâi thiaⁿ, lâi sià-bián, lâi si-hîng. Lí tsai in ê sim, tsiàu in ta̍k lâng ê hîng-uî lâi khuán-thāi in, ( in-uī sè-kan ta̍k lâng ê sim, tsí ū Lí tsai ),
English: then hear in heaven, your dwelling place, and forgive, and do, and render to every man according to all his ways, whose heart you know; (for you, even you only, know the hearts of all the children of men;)

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá tshe Guá ê sù-tsiá tī lí ê thâu-tsîng, tī lō͘-.ni̍h pó-hō͘ lí, tshuā lí kàu Guá só͘ tsún-pī ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Behold, I send an angel before you, to keep you by the way, and to bring you into the place which I have prepared.

Tailo: Lín teh khuàⁿ tsiah-ê it-tshè, hit-ê ji̍t-tsí teh beh kàu, tī tsia bô tsi̍t tè tsio̍h ē sio-tha̍h, lóng ē tó kah pênn-pênn-pênn.
English: As for these things which you see, the days will come, in which there will not be left here one stone on another that will not be thrown down.

Tailo: I tuì tíng-bīn kàng-lo̍h hué, ji̍p guá ê kut lâi kā guá tsè-ho̍k; I tiuⁿ lô-bāng lâi tîⁿ-puàⁿ guá ê kha, hō͘ guá ua̍t tò-tńg; I hō͘ guá kui ji̍t hi-bî, hūn-.khì.
English: From on high has he sent fire into my bones, and it prevails against them; He has spread a net for my feet, he has turned me back: He has made me desolate and faint all the day.

Tailo: Gi-bóng lâng kóng, Guán kah Sàulô kah i ê ke ê tāi-tsì bô kuan-hē kim-gîn, mā m̄-thang uī-tio̍h guán ê iân-kò͘ hāi-sí tsi̍t-ê Isulael lâng. Tabi̍t mn̄g kóng, Lín só͘ kóng án-tsuáⁿ, guá ē uī lín tsiàu án-ne kiânn.
English: The Gibeonites said to him, It is no matter of silver or gold between us and Saul, or his house; neither is it for us to put any man to death in Israel. He said, What you shall say, that will I do for you.

Tailo: Guá tuì gī lâng kóng, ' I it-tīng ē ua̍h! ' I nā uá-khò i ê gī lâi kiâⁿ pháiⁿ, i só͘ kiâⁿ ê gī tsiū lóng bô tit-tio̍h kì-liām. I ē in-uī i só͘ kiâⁿ ê pháiⁿ lâi sí.
English: When I tell the righteous, that he shall surely live; if he trust to his righteousness, and commit iniquity, none of his righteous deeds shall be remembered; but in his iniquity that he has committed, therein shall he die.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ lín ê tíng-bīn ū kin, koh hō͘ lín ū bah, koh īng phuê kā lín pau, īng ua̍h-khì ji̍p-khì tī lín lāi-bīn, lín tsiū ē ua̍h khí-.lâi. Lín tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú. '
English: I will lay sinews on you, and will bring up flesh on you, and cover you with skin, and put breath in you, and you shall live; and you shall know that I am Yahweh.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k Ki-nî-sé tso̍k, E-hun-neh ê kiáⁿ Ka-le̍p kah Nùn ê kiáⁿ Iosiúah thang khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, in-uī in ū tsuan-sim tuè Siōngtsú.
English: save Caleb the son of Jephunneh the Kenizzite, and Joshua the son of Nun; because they have wholly followed Yahweh.

Tailo: In tsiū ē tsai Guá — Siōngtsú — in ê Siōngtè sī kah in tông-tsāi, mā ē tsai in Isulael ê jîn-bîn sī Guá ê tsú-bîn. Tse sī tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: They shall know that I, Yahweh, their God am with them, and that they, the house of Israel, are my people, says the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: Lí ê tshiú tshòng-tsō guá, sîng-tsuân guá; kiû Lí hō͘ guá tì-huī thang lâi ha̍k-si̍p Lí ê kài-bīng!
English: Your hands have made me and formed me. Give me understanding, that I may learn your commandments.

Tailo: Ta̍k lâng tio̍h pó-tshî siū-tiàu hit sî ê sin-hūn.
English: Let each man stay in that calling in which he was called.

Tailo: In-uī I tsai lán ê thé-tsit, siàu-liām lán sī thô͘-sua hún.
English: For he knows how we are made. He remembers that we are dust.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, taⁿ kiû Lí tsín-kiù! Siōngtsú ah, taⁿ kiû Lí hō͘ guán huat-ta̍t!
English: Save us now, we beg you, Yahweh; Yahweh, we beg you, now send prosperity.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā hông tú-.tio̍h ê ē siū tsha̍k thàng-kuè, kiàn-nā hông lia̍h-tio̍h ê ē hō͘ to thâi-sí.
English: Everyone who is found will be thrust through. Everyone who is captured will fall by the sword.

Tailo: Abulahàm kā hit-ê só͘-tsāi kiò-tsò I-é-ho-bah Í-leh, kàu kin-á-ji̍t, lâng iáu teh kóng, Tī Siōngtsú ê suaⁿ, Tsú ē tsún-pī.
English: Abraham called the name of that place Yahweh Will Provide . As it is said to this day, On Yahweh's mountain, it will be provided.

Tailo: Guá í-tsîng bat kóng kuè, taⁿ guá koh kóng tsi̍t pái, nā ū lâng thuân hō͘ lín ê hok-im kah lín í-king tsiap-siū ê bô kāng-khuán, hit-ê lâng tio̍h siū tsiù-tsó͘.
English: As we have said before, so I now say again: if any man preaches to you any good news other than that which you received, let him be cursed.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h tuì Isulael ê tsú-bîn tshut bī-tshai, siat phì-jū,
English: Son of man, put forth a riddle, and speak a parable to the house of Israel;

Tailo: Mô͘se īng hueh hiù jîn-bîn, kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tse sī li̍p-iok ê hueh, sī Siōngtsú tsiàu tse it-tshè ê uē kah lín só͘ li̍p ê.
English: Moses took the blood, and sprinkled it on the people, and said, Look, this is the blood of the covenant, which Yahweh has made with you concerning all these words.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā kiàn-tsìng ê uē kńg ân-ân, tī guá ha̍k-sing ê tiong-kan kā lu̍t-huat hong ba̍t.
English: Wrap up the testimony. Seal the law among my disciples.

Tailo: Tshit ji̍t ê thâu tsi̍t ji̍t thàu-tsá, ji̍t tú-á tshut ê sî, in lâi-kàu bōng-tē.
English: Very early on the first day of the week, they came to the tomb when the sun had risen.

Tailo: Piattò͘ mn̄g i kóng, Lí kā guá kóng, lín bē tshân-hn̂g só͘ tit-tio̍h ê tsînn kan-taⁿ tsiah-ê, sī-.bô? I ìn kóng, Tio̍h, sī tsiah-ê niā-niā.
English: Peter answered her, Tell me whether you sold the land for so much. She said, Yes, for so much.

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ lâng hiat-lāu nā í-king hó, tio̍h uī ka-kī sǹg tshit ji̍t, jiân-āu tsiah tshing-khì.
English: But if she is cleansed of her discharge, then she shall count to herself seven days, and after that she shall be clean.

Tailo: Tabi̍t kóng, Tsò-thâu kong-kik I-é-bú-suh lâng ê ē tsò siú-líng, tsò guân-suè. Tse-lú-iah ê kiáⁿ Ioap tāi-sing khì kong-kik, tsiū tsò siú-líng.
English: David said, Whoever strikes the Jebusites first shall be chief and captain. Joab the son of Zeruiah went up first, and was made chief.

Tailo: In mā ē tshuā tsin tsē lâng khí-lâi kong-kik lí, īng tsio̍h-thâu kā lí tìm-sí, īng to-kiàm tsha̍k-thàu lí,
English: They shall also bring up a company against you, and they shall stone you with stones, and thrust you through with their swords.

Tailo: Liāu-lí pâi-lia̍t ê piáⁿ, sò͘-tsè ê mī-hún, á-.sī bô kàⁿ ê po̍h piáⁿ kah tiáⁿ lāi só͘ piak ê, í-ki̍p tiâu-hô ê mi̍h, koh kuán-lí tshìn kah niû ê tāi-tsì.
English: for the show bread also, and for the fine flour for a meal offering, whether of unleavened wafers, or of that which is baked in the pan, or of that which is soaked, and for all manner of measure and size;

Tailo: Iôtah ông Tsetikiah it-tīng bē thuat-lī Kal-tí-ah lâng ê tshiú, tiāⁿ-tio̍h ē kau tī Babúlông ông ê tshiú, mā ē kah i tshuì tuì tshuì kóng-uē, i ê ba̍k-tsiu mā ē khuànn i ê ba̍k-tsiu.
English: and Zedekiah king of Judah shall not escape out of the hand of the Chaldeans, but shall surely be delivered into the hand of the king of Babylon, and shall speak with him mouth to mouth, and his eyes shall see his eyes;

Tailo: Jiânāu tuì thinn-tíng kàng-lo̍h tuā-lia̍p pha̍uh, ta̍k-lia̍p ê tāng-liōng lóng ū kuí-nā-tsa̍p kong-kin. Lâng uī-tio̍h pha̍uh ê tsai-hō, tsiū siat-to̍k Siōngtè, in-uī hit-ê tsai-hō hui-siông giâm-tiōng.
English: Great hailstones, about the weight of a talent, came down out of the sky on people. People blasphemed God because of the plague of the hail, for this plague is exceedingly severe.

Tailo: Iésu kah bûn-tô͘ lâi-kàu I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ. In kah tsi̍t-tuā-tīn lâng tshut I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ ê sî, ū tsi̍t-ê tsheⁿ-mê-.ê khit-tsia̍h, Tí-mái ê kiáⁿ Ba-tí-mái, tsē tī lō͘ piⁿ.
English: They came to Jericho. As he went out from Jericho, with his disciples and a great multitude, the son of Timaeus, Bartimaeus, a blind beggar, was sitting by the road.

Tailo: Lia̍h hiah-ê ông tshut-lâi-kàu Iosiúah hia ê sî, Iosiúah tsiū kiò Isulael jîn-bîn lâi, tuì hiah-ê kah i tsò-hué khì ê kun-tiúⁿ kóng, Lín kiâⁿ uá-.lâi, īng kha ta̍h tī tsiah-ê ông ê ām-kún. In tsiū kiâⁿ uá-.lâi, īng kha ta̍h tī in ê ām-kún.
English: It happened, when they brought forth those kings to Joshua, that Joshua called for all the men of Israel, and said to the chiefs of the men of war who went with him, Come near, put your feet on the necks of these kings. They came near, and put their feet on the necks of them.

Tailo: Guá tsai lí ê só͘ tsò, lí ê sìn-gióng bô sio bô líng. Guá khah ì-ài lí á-.sī sio á-.sī líng.
English: I know your works, that you are neither cold nor hot. I wish you were cold or hot.

Tailo: Isulael ê tsú-bîn, tio̍h thiaⁿ tsit-ê uē, to̍h-sī guá kóng-tio̍h lín só͘ tsò ê ai-ko:
English: Listen to this word which I take up for a lamentation over you, O house of Israel.

Tailo: Nî-thâu, lia̍t ông tshut-lâi kau-tsiàn ê sî, Ioap tshuā kun-ping huí-huāi Ammóng lâng ê tē, kā Lap-bah uî-khùn; Tabi̍t iû-guân tuà tī Êlúsalèm. Ioap phah La̍h-pa ê siâⁿ, kā i tsing-ho̍k.
English: It happened, at the time of the return of the year, at the time when kings go out to battle, that Joab led forth the army, and wasted the country of the children of Ammon, and came and besieged Rabbah. But David stayed at Jerusalem. Joab struck Rabbah, and overthrew it.

Tailo: I án-ne tsò sī beh ìng-giām Siōngtè thong-kuè sian-ti só͘ kóng ê uē, Guá beh khui tshuì kóng phì-jū, kóng bîng tshòng-sè í-lâi ê ò-pì. (tsù, SPh 78:2)
English: that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophet, saying, I will open my mouth in parables; I will utter things hidden from the foundation of the world.

Tailo: Kú-si̍t kah Aigi̍p tsò i bô hān-liōng ê khuì-la̍t; Put kah Lu-bí tso̍k （ Tsù, Guân i̍k-pún sī Lu-bí , to̍h-sī Li-bí-a ）, sī pang-tsān lí ê.
English: Cush and Egypt were her boundless strength. Put and Libya were her helpers.

Tailo: In lóng sī gû-tshún bû-ti; ngó͘-siōng ê kà-sī, tsí-put-kò sī tshâ niā-niā.
English: But they are together brutish and foolish: the instruction of idols! it is but a stock.

Tailo: Asel lâng kah tuà hit só͘-tsāi Ka-nân lâng ê tiong-kan tsò-hué tuà, in-uī bô kā in kuáⁿ tshut-.khì.
English: but the Asherites lived among the Canaanites, the inhabitants of the land; for they did not drive them out.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: I hō͘ kang-hô piàn-tsò khòng-iá, hō͘ tsuí-tsuâⁿ piàn-tsò ta-sò ê tē.
English: He turns rivers into a desert, Water springs into a thirsty ground,

Tailo: kóng: Hó tik-hīng ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tsin tsē, to̍k-to̍k lí sī siōng hó ê.
English: Many women do noble things, But you excel them all.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, tsiah-ê thiⁿ ē o-ló Lí ê kî-sū; tī sìng-ê ê tsū-huē tiong ē o-ló Lí ê sìn-si̍t.
English: The heavens will praise your wonders, Yahweh; Your faithfulness also in the assembly of the holy ones.

Tailo: Lâm-hong ê ông ē tuā siū-khì, tshut-lâi kah pak-hong ê ông kau-tsiàn; pak-hong ê ông ē pâi-lia̍t tuā kun-tuī, tsóng-.sī, tuā kun-tuī ē kau-hù tī lâm-hong ê ông ê tshiú.
English: The king of the south shall be moved with anger, and shall come forth and fight with him, even with the king of the north; and he shall set forth a great multitude, and the multitude shall be given into his hand.

Tailo: In tit-tio̍h pang-tsān, Hagal lâng kah kin-tuè in ê lâng lóng kau tī in ê tshiú, in-uī in tī tsiàn-tīn ê tiong-kan kiû-kiò Siōngtè, koh ū uá-khò Siōngtè, I tsiū thiaⁿ in.
English: They were helped against them, and the Hagrites were delivered into their hand, and all who were with them; for they cried to God in the battle, and he was entreated of them, because they put their trust in him.

Tailo: Khuànn kué-tsí tsiū ē-tàng tsai hit-tsâng tshiū ê hó-pháiⁿ. Lâng bē-tàng tuì tshì-phè lāi bán bû-hua-kó, mā bē-tàng tuì tshì-á-tîn bán phû-tô.
English: For each tree is known by its own fruit. For people don't gather figs from thorns, nor do they gather grapes from a bramble bush.

Tailo: Phah-hua lia̍t-hué, siám-phiah lāi to ê sat-hāi; jio̍k-sè tsiâⁿ-tsò kiông-sè, tī tsiàn-tiûⁿ ióng-bíng, kong-phuà guā-kok ê kun-tuī.
English: quenched the power of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, from weakness were made strong, grew mighty in war, and turned to flight armies of aliens.

Tailo: Guá beh kā lí hiat tī tē-.ni̍h, pàng lo̍h-khì tī tshân-iá, hō͘ khong-tiong ê pue-tsiáu lóng hioh tī lí ê tíng-bīn, hō͘ tsuân tē ê iá-siù lóng tsia̍h lí kàu pá.
English: I will leave you on the land, I will cast you forth on the open field, and will cause all the birds of the sky to settle on you, and I will satisfy the animals of the whole earth with you.

Tailo: Siōngtè siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín ti̍k-pia̍t ê un-tián, hō͘ hiah-ê lâng koh khah kìng-ài lín, koh uī lín kî-tó.
English: while they themselves also, with supplication on your behalf, yearn for you by reason of the exceeding grace of God in you.

Tailo: Khi-hū sàn-tshiah lâng lâi lī-ik ka-kī, koh sàng lé-mi̍h hō͘ hó-gia̍h lâng ê lâng, lóng ē tì-kàu khiàm-khueh.
English: Whoever oppresses the poor for his own increase and whoever gives to the rich, Both come to poverty.

Tailo: Guá hō͘ ka-kī an-tsīng kàu thiⁿ-kng; I tshin-tshiūnn sai at-tn̄g guá só͘-ū ê kut-thâu, tuì tsá-khí kàu ê-hng, Siōngtsú it-ti̍t siūⁿ beh kiat-sok guá ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: I waited patiently until morning. He breaks all my bones like a lion. From day even to night you will make an end of me.

Tailo: Abigail lâi-kàu Nabal hia, khuàⁿ-tio̍h i tī tshù lāi pâi-siat iàn-si̍k, tshin-tshiūnn ông ê iàn-si̍k. Nabal sim-lāi tuā huann-hí, in-uī i tsin-tsiàⁿ tuā tsuì. Só͘-í, Abigail bô-lūn tuā-sè ê tāi-tsì, lóng bô kā i kóng, thìng-hāu kàu keh kang tsá-khí.
English: Abigail came to Nabal; and behold, he held a feast in his house, like the feast of a king; and Nabal's heart was merry within him, for he was very drunken: therefore she told him nothing, less or more, until the morning light.

Tailo: Tsit-ê tuì Etóm lâi, tuì Bo-tsu-la̍h kàu, sin tshīng âng saⁿ, saⁿ-khò͘ ko-kuì, ū tuā khuì-la̍t, tuā pō͘ teh kiâⁿ ê sī siáⁿ lâng? Sī Guá, sī tsiàu kong-gī kóng-uē, ū tuā khuì-la̍t, ē kiânn tsín-kiù ê Siōngtsú.
English: Who is this who comes from Edom, with dyed garments from Bozrah? this who is glorious in his clothing, marching in the greatness of his strength? I who speak in righteousness, mighty to save.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h hō͘ luán-jio̍k ê tshiú ióng-tsòng, hō͘ bô la̍t ê kha-thâu-u tsū-tsāi.
English: Strengthen the weak hands, And make firm the feeble knees.

Tailo: Tsit-ê lâng nā m̄-sī tuì Siōngtè hia lâi, tsiū bô khó-lîng tsò tsit khuán tāi-tsì.
English: If this man were not from God, he could do nothing.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lín liân tsi̍t ki thâu-mn̂g mā bē sit-lo̍h.
English: And not a hair of your head will perish.

Tailo: I beh tshin-tshiūnn bo̍k-tsiá kò͘ I ê iûⁿ-kûn, I ē īng tshiú âⁿ-uá iûⁿ-á-kiáⁿ, kā i phō tī hing tsîng, bān-bān-á tshuā hiah-ê hō͘ iûⁿ-á suh-ling ê.
English: He will feed his flock like a shepherd. He will gather the lambs in his arm, And carry them in his bosom. He will gently lead those who have their young.

Tailo: Guá tsai Lí bān sū lóng ē; Lí ê tsí-ì lóng bē-tàng tsó͘-tòng-.tit.
English: I know that you can do all things, And that no purpose of yours can be restrained.

Tailo: Iobuh tsiū khí-.lâi, thiah-li̍h guā-saⁿ, thì thâu, phak tī thô͘-kha lâi pài,
English: Then Job arose, and tore his robe, and shaved his head, and fell down on the ground, and worshiped.

Tailo: Sè-kan lâng, I bat tsí-sī lí siáⁿ-mi̍h sī hó. Siōngtsú ài lí tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? To̍k-to̍k ài lí kiânn kong-gī, sim tsûn liân-bín, khiam-pi, lâi kah lí ê Siōngtè tsò-hué kiânn.
English: He has shown you, O man, what is good. What does Yahweh require of you, but to act justly, To love mercy, and to walk humbly with your God?

Tailo: Lâng phah guá ê kha-tsiah-phiaⁿ, guá tshut-tsāi i phah; lâng tshuah guá tshuì-phué ê tshuì-tshiu, guá tshut-tsāi i tshuah; lâng lîng-jio̍k guá, kā guá phuì nuā, guá mā bô am bīn.
English: I gave my back to the strikers, and my cheeks to those who plucked off the hair; I didn't hide my face from shame and spitting.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng lóng tsin tsun-tiōng tsiah-ê sù-tô͘, m̄-koh, tsin tsē lâng m̄-káⁿ kah in tsiap-kīn.
English: None of the rest dared to join them, however the people honored them.

Tailo: Lí tsò tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, guá tiām-tiām bô kóng-uē, lí suah siūⁿ kóng guá tú-tú kah lí kāng-khuán; kî-si̍t guá beh kā lí tsik-pī, kā tsiah-ê tāi-tsì lóng pâi tī lí ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng.
English: You have done these things, and I kept silent. You thought that the I AM was just like you. I will rebuke you, and accuse you in front of your eyes.
