Tailo: In beh tshut-lâi jiok guán, kàu guán ín-iú in lī-khui siâⁿ; in-uī in ē kóng, ' Tsiah-ê lâng tshin-tshiūnn thâu tsi̍t pái tī guán ê bīn-tsîng tô-tsáu. ' Só͘-í, guán beh tī in ê bīn-tsîng tô-tsáu;
English: and they will come out after us, until we have drawn them away from the city; for they will say, They flee before us, as at the first: so we will flee before them;

Tailo: kóng: Lí khuàⁿ, tse to̍h-sī hit khuán bô uá-khò Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k, sī uá-khò i ka-kī ê tsîⁿ-tsâi, ka-kī lia̍h-tsún khiā tsāi tī siâ-ok tiong.
English: Behold, this is the man who didn't make God his strength, But trusted in the abundance of his riches, And strengthened himself in his wickedness.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsò-hué tuà, kî-tiong nā tsi̍t-ê sí-khì bô kiáⁿ, sí-lâng ê bó͘ m̄-thang kè guā-lâng, i tiōng-hu ê sió-tī tio̍h ji̍p-khì i hia, tshuā i tsò bó͘, lâi tsīn sió-tsik ê pún-hūn.
English: If brothers dwell together, and one of them die, and have no son, the wife of the dead shall not be married outside to a stranger: her husband's brother shall go in to her, and take her to him as wife, and perform the duty of a husband's brother to her.

Tailo: Lí í-king tsí-sī guá ua̍h-miā ê lō͘. Hō͘ guá tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng muá-sim khuài-lo̍k. (tsù, SPh 16:8-11)
English: You made known to me the ways of life. You will make me full of gladness with your presence.'

Tailo: Ū tsai-hō ah! Hō͘ lâng lâu hueh ê siâⁿ, ū kuí-tsà kiông-pō muá-muá, tshiúⁿ-kiap bô suah.
English: Woe to the bloody city! It is all full of lies and robbery. The prey doesn't depart.

Tailo: Tshú i ê hueh tām-po̍h-á, īng tsíng-thâu-á buah tī tuâⁿ ê sì-kak, kā hueh lóng piàⁿ tī tuâⁿ-kha.
English: You shall take of the blood of the bull, and put it on the horns of the altar with your finger; and you shall pour out all the blood at the base of the altar.

Tailo: Tsū tshòng-sè í-lâi, lâng khuànn bē-tio̍h Hit-ê Siōngtè ê pún-sìng, to̍h-sī I íng-uán ê tuā lîng-li̍k kah sîn-sìng, lâng nā khuàⁿ-tio̍h I só͘ tshòng-tsō ê mi̍h tsiū ē-tàng tsai-iáⁿ, só͘-í, lâng lóng bô piān-kái ê î-tē.
English: For the invisible things of him since the creation of the world are clearly seen, being perceived through the things that are made, even his everlasting power and divinity; that they may be without excuse.

Tailo: Ti in-uī ū pun-tê thiah-tshe, tsóng-.sī, bô huan-tsháu, tuì lín lâi kóng sī bô tshing-khì ê.
English: The pig, because he has a split hoof, and is cloven-footed, but doesn't chew the cud, he is unclean to you.

Tailo: I ê jîn-tsû tuā kàu án-tsuáⁿ! I ê suí hó khuànn kàu án-tsuáⁿ! Ngó͘-kok ē hō͘ siàu-liân lâng ióng-kiāⁿ, sin tsiú ē hō͘ tsāi-sik-lí mā án-ne.
English: For how great is his goodness, And how great is his beauty! Grain will make the young men flourish, And new wine the virgins.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tsai, tī sè-kài ê bua̍t-ji̍t ū tsióng-tsióng ê khó͘-lān.
English: But know this, that in the last days, grievous times will come.

Tailo: I ê thuh-á ê pán kah i ê keh-tó͘ ê tíng-bīn, tsiàu i ê khang-uī, i khik ki-lō͘-ping kah sai, kah tsó tshiū, sì-kho͘-uî ū khik hue-khuân.
English: On the plates of the stays of it, and on the panels of it, he engraved cherubim, lions, and palm trees, according to the space of each, with wreaths round about.

Tailo: Ông mn̄g guá kóng, Lí ài kiû siáⁿ-mi̍h? Tsiū án-ne, guá kî-tó thinn-tíng ê Siōngtsú.
English: Then the king said to me, For what do you make request? So I prayed to the God of heaven.

Tailo: Tsóng-tok Le-hóm, su-kì Simsiai kah kî-tha ê tâng-phuāⁿ Tí-nah lâng, A-huat-sat-thê-ka lâng, Thal-pe-lái lâng, Al-pak-sat lâng, Al-ke-bueh lâng, Babúlông lâng, Siu-san-ki lâng, Da-ha-bah lâng, Ê-lám lâng
English: then wrote Rehum the chancellor, and Shimshai the scribe, and the rest of their companions, the Dinaites, and the Apharsathchites, the Tarpelites, the Apharsites, the Archevites, the Babylonians, the Shushanchites, the Dehaites, the Elamites,

Tailo: Thong-ta̍t ê lâng lóng īng tì-huī tsò tāi-tsì; to̍k-to̍k gōng lâng teh suan-iông ka-kī ê gû-gōng.
English: Every prudent man acts from knowledge, But a fool exposes folly.

Tailo: In tsiū pí tshiú-gí mn̄g enn-á ê lāu-pē, ài beh kā i hō siáⁿ-mi̍h miâ.
English: They made signs to his father, what he would have him called.

Tailo: Tsit khuán ê uē ē tshin-tshiūⁿ to̍k-tshng seⁿ-thuàⁿ; Hu-mé-nái kah Hui-lé-toh to̍h sī tsit khuán lâng.
English: and their word will consume like gangrene, of whom is Hymenaeus and Philetus;

Tailo: I ē kóng, ' Guá m̄-sī sian-ti, guá sī tsoh-sit lâng; guá tuì sè-hàn tsiū tsò lâng ê lô͘-po̍k. '
English: but he will say, I am no prophet, I am a tiller of the ground; for I have been made a bondservant from my youth.'

Tailo: Kā tsó͘-tòng lâng jīn-bat Siōngtè ê it-tshè kiau-ngō͘ lóng siau-bia̍t, koh kái-piàn muí tsi̍t-ê lâng ê sim-su ì-liām, hō͘ i uân-tsuân sūn-ho̍k Ki-tok.
English: throwing down imaginations and every high thing that is exalted against the knowledge of God, and bringing every thought into captivity to the obedience of Christ;

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng: Guá lī-khui Guá ê tshù, pàng-sak Guá ê sán-gia̍p, kā Guá sim só͘ thiàⁿ ê kau tī tuì-ti̍k tshiú tiong.
English: I have forsaken my house, I have cast off my heritage; I have given the dearly beloved of my soul into the hand of her enemies.

Tailo: Lín it-tīng tsai, tī ūn-tōng-tiâⁿ tsham-ka pí-sài ê lâng, lóng ū lo̍h-khì tsáu, m̄-koh, tit-tio̍h pò-siúⁿ ê tsí ū tsi̍t-ê. Lín tio̍h án-ne phah-piàⁿ tsáu, tsiah ē-tàng tit-tio̍h siúⁿ.
English: Don't you know that those who run in a race all run, but one receives the prize? Run like that, that you may win.

Tailo: Phûn ê tshuì tī táu ê lāi-bīn ǹg tíng-bīn, tshim tsi̍t tiú; i ê tshuì sī înn ê, tshin-tshiūnn sió-tsō ê khuán-sit, tsi̍t tiú puàⁿ; tī i ê tshuì ū tiau-khik, i ê keh-tó͘ sī sì-kak-hîng ê, m̄-sī înn ê.
English: The mouth of it within the capital and above was a cubit: and the mouth of it was round after the work of a pedestal, a cubit and a half; and also on the mouth of it were engravings, and their panels were foursquare, not round.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Tsuân tē it-tīng pha-hng, tsóng-.sī, Guá bô beh huí-bia̍t kàu tsīn.
English: For thus says Yahweh, The whole land shall be a desolation; yet will I not make a full end.

Tailo: Bān-kok tio̍h tsū-tsi̍p, tsìng lâng tio̍h tsū-huē. Kî-tiong siáⁿ lâng ē kā tsit-ê kóng bîng, mā kā í-tsîng ê tāi-tsì lóng kóng hō͘ guán thiaⁿ? In thang tshuā kiàn-tsìng lâi, ka-kī hián-bîng in tsò tio̍h, á-.sī lâng nā thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū kóng: Tse sī tsin-si̍t.
English: Let all the nations be gathered together, and let the peoples be assembled: who among them can declare this, and show us former things? let them bring their witnesses, that they may be justified; or let them hear, and say, It is truth.

Tailo: I tī lāu-jia̍t ê ke-lō͘ thâu tuā-siaⁿ teh kiò, tī siâⁿ mn̂g-kháu, tī siâⁿ lāi, kóng-tshut i ê uē,
English: She calls at the head of noisy places. At the entrance of the city gates, she utters her words:

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, i tsiū kám-kik Iôtah kûn-tsiòng ê sim, tshin-tshiūnn tsi̍t-ê lâng ê sim. In tsiū tshe lâng khì kìⁿ ông kóng, Guān lí kah lí ê tsìng jîn-sîn lóng tńg-.lâi.
English: He bowed the heart of all the men of Judah, even as the heart of one man; so that they sent to the king, saying, Return you, and all your servants.

Tailo: lí ē tsò tsit-ê kua lâi lūn Babúlông ông, kóng: Tsè-ap lâng ê ná ē kìng-jiân sí-.khì! Li̍k-sik lâng ê ná ē kìng-jiân sí-.khì!
English: that you will take up this parable against the king of Babylon, and say, How the oppressor has ceased! The golden city has ceased!

Tailo: Guá ì-ài Lí ê uē, tshin-tshiūnn lâng tit-tio̍h tsin tsē thâi-iâⁿ ê mi̍h.
English: I rejoice at your word, As one who finds great spoil.

Tailo: Tsit-ê pán ê ē-bīn ū nn̄g-ê khū, hit-ê pán ê ē-bīn mā ū nn̄g-ê khū.
English: and their forty sockets of silver; two sockets under one board, and two sockets under another board.

Tailo: mā kā in ê sîn-bîng kah só͘ tsù ê ngó͘-siōng, í-ki̍p gîn kim ê pó-khì tshiúⁿ-lia̍h kàu Aigi̍p. Kuí-nā nî kú, i lóng bô koh khì kong-kik pak-hong ê ông.
English: Also their gods, with their molten images, and with their goodly vessels of silver and of gold, shall he carry captive into Egypt; and he shall refrain some years from the king of the north.

Tailo: Ka-la̍uh tī tshì-á lāi ê, sī teh phì-jū lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h tō-lí, tsiū khì hō͘ sè-kan ê tshau-huân, tsîⁿ-tsâi kah iàn-lo̍k tsó͘-gāi, tō-lí suah bē sîng-tióng kiat-si̍t.
English: That which fell among the thorns, these are those who have heard, and as they go on their way they are choked with cares, riches, and pleasures of life, and bring no fruit to maturity.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t sī pī-pān tseh ê ji̍t, An-hioh-ji̍t teh beh kàu à.
English: It was the day of the Preparation, and the Sabbath was drawing near.

Tailo: Lí ê kài-bīng tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kah guá tông-tsāi, hō͘ guá pí guá ê tuì-ti̍k khah ū tì-huī.
English: Your commandments make me wiser than my enemies, For your commandments are always with me.

Tailo: Tong-sî, tsiàu sio̍k-sè lâi seⁿ ê pik-hāi tuì Siōngtè ê Sìng Sîn só͘ seⁿ ê, tsit-má mā sī án-ne.
English: But as then, he who was born according to the flesh persecuted him who was born according to the Spirit, so also it is now.

Tailo: Hit sî, bûn-tô͘ lâi kā Iésu kóng, Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h Lí kóng tsit-ê uē tsin hùn-khài, Lí kám tsai?
English: Then the disciples came, and said to him, Do you know that the Pharisees were offended, when they heard this saying?

Tailo: Tī lo̍h hō͘ ê ji̍t, hûn tiong khīng ê hîng-siōng án-tsuáⁿ, sì-kho͘-uî ê kng ê hîng-siōng mā sī án-ne. Guá tsi̍t-ē khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū phak tī thô͘-kha, koh thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê lâng kóng-uē ê siann.
English: As the appearance of the bow that is in the cloud in the day of rain, so was the appearance of the brightness round about. This was the appearance of the likeness of the glory of Yahweh. When I saw it, I fell on my face, and I heard a voice of one that spoke.

Tailo: Uá-khò tiau-khik ê ngó͘-siōng, tuì tsù-tsō ê ngó͘-siōng kóng, Lí sī guán ê Siōngtè ê, tsit khuán lâng ē siū kuáⁿ-tsáu, in ē tuā kiàn-siàu.
English: Those who trust in engraved images, Who tell molten images, You are our gods' Will be turned back. They will be utterly disappointed.

Tailo: Lí tuà Le-ba-nòng, tsò siū tī pik-hiuⁿ tshiū ê, thòng-khó͘ lîm-kàu lí, thàng-thiàⁿ tshin-tshiūnn beh seⁿ kiáⁿ ê tsa-bó͘ lâng, hit sî, lí ê khó-liân ē kàu án-tsuáⁿ!
English: Inhabitant of Lebanon, who makes your nest in the cedars, how greatly to be pitied shall you be when pangs come on you, the pain as of a woman in travail!

Tailo: Iôtah ke thuat-lī huān-lān só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê jîn-bîn iû-guân ē ē-bīn tìng-kin, tíng-bīn kiat kué-tsí.
English: The remnant that is escaped of the house of Judah will again take root downward, and bear fruit upward.

Tailo: Siōngtè koh tuì Abulahàm kóng, Lí ê bó͘ Salái, m̄-thang koh kā i kiò-tsò Salái, i ê miâ beh kái kiò-tsò Sala̍h.
English: God said to Abraham, As for Sarai your wife, you shall not call her name Sarai, but her name will be Sarah.

Tailo: In mā ū kuí-bué-á sè-bué hî; Iésu kāng-khuán kám-siā liáu-āu, kiò bûn-tô͘ the̍h-khì pun.
English: They had a few small fish. Having blessed them, he said to serve these also.

Tailo: Siōngtè ah, guān Lí kuân-tuā puâⁿ-kuè hiah-ê thiⁿ! Guān Lí ê îng-kng puâⁿ-kuè tsuân tē!
English: Be exalted, God, above the heavens, Let your glory be over all the earth.

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, lí tio̍h tsia̍h bi̍t, in-uī bi̍t sī hó; tsia̍h bi̍t-pâng só͘ tih ê bi̍t tsiū tsai tinn.
English: My son, eat honey, for it is good; The droppings of the honeycomb, which are sweet to your taste:

Tailo: Tsí-ū Lí — Siōngtsú íng-uán tsûn-tsāi; Lí hō͘ lâng kì-liām kàu bān-sè-tāi.
English: But you, Yahweh, will abide forever; Your renown endures to all generations.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h hō͘-siong jīn tsuē, sio-thè kî-tó, thang tit-tio̍h i hó. Gī lâng ê kî-tó ū tsin tuā ê kong-hāu.
English: Confess your offenses to one another, and pray one for another, that you may be healed. The insistent prayer of a righteous person is powerfully effective.

Tailo: Tabi̍t sī siōng sè ê, hit saⁿ-ê khah sī-tuā ê kin-tuè Sàulô.
English: David was the youngest; and the three eldest followed Saul.

Tailo: Tsha-put-to kuè saⁿ-tiám-tsing āu, i ê bó͘ mā ji̍p-.lâi, iáu m̄-tsai só͘ huat-sing ê tāi-tsì.
English: About three hours later, his wife, not knowing what had happened, came in.

Tailo: I biáu-sī kun-ông, khau-sé kuì-tso̍k, líng-tshiò só͘-ū ê siâⁿ-pó, khí thô͘-tui lâi kong, kā i tsing-ho̍k.
English: Yes, he scoffs at kings, and princes are a derision to him. He laughs at every stronghold, for he builds up an earthen ramp, and takes it.

Tailo: Bô lō͘-īng ê bo̍k-tsiá, khì-sak iûⁿ-kûn ê ū tsai-hō ah! To ē lîm-kàu i ê tshiú kah i ê tsiànn ba̍k. I ê tshiú ē tsuân-pō͘ ko͘-tâ-.khì, i ê tsiànn ba̍k ē o͘-o͘ àm-àm.
English: Woe to the worthless shepherd who leaves the flock! The sword will be on his arm, and on his right eye. His arm will be completely withered, and his right eye will be totally blinded!

Tailo: Guá khióng-kiaⁿ khì lín hia ê sî, kiám-tshái ē khuànn-kìnn lín kah guá só͘ kî-thāi ê bô kāng-khuán, lín mā khuànn-kìnn guá kah lín só͘ kî-thāi ê bô kāng-khuán. Guá koh khióng-kiaⁿ lín ū hun-tsing, uàn-tò͘, siū-khì, kiat-tóng, huí-pòng, kóng kha-tsiah-āu uē, phòng-hong, hun-luān.
English: For I am afraid that by any means, when I come, I might find you not the way I want to, and that I might be found by you as you don't desire; that by any means there would be strife, jealousy, outbursts of anger, factions, slander, whisperings, proud thoughts, riots;

Tailo: Ki-tok bô tshe-phài guá lâi kā lâng sé-lé, sī beh lâi thuân hok-im. Guá bô īng tì-huī ê giân-sû thuân, tsiah bián hō͘ Ki-tok ê si̍p-jī-kè sit-khì ì-gī.
English: For Christ sent me not to baptize, but to preach the Good Newsnot in wisdom of words, so that the cross of Christ wouldn't be made void.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê lóng tio̍h o-ló Siōngtsú ê miâ! In-uī I tsi̍t ē bīng-līng, it-tshè tsiū lóng siū tshòng-tsō.
English: Let them praise the name of Yahweh, For he commanded, and they were created.

Tailo: In tih tī khòng-iá ê tsháu-po͘, suaⁿ-thâu īng huann-hí tsò tuà lâi hâ.
English: The wilderness grasslands overflow. The hills are clothed with gladness.

Tailo: tsò siā-un-tsè ê tsing-seⁿ, tsóng-kiōng gû-káng jī-tsa̍p sì tsiah, mî-iûⁿ-káng la̍k-tsa̍p tsiah, suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng la̍k-tsa̍p tsiah, bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á la̍k-tsa̍p tsiah. Tsiah-ê to̍h-sī īng iû buah tuâⁿ liáu-āu, uī-tio̍h kiânn hiàn-tuâⁿ ê lé só͘ hiàn ê.
English: and all the oxen for the sacrifice of peace offerings twenty-four bulls, the rams sixty, the male goats sixty, the male lambs a year old sixty. This was the dedication of the altar, after it was anointed.

Tailo: In lia̍h mê tsò ji̍t, kóng, kng teh tsiap-kīn o͘-àm.
English: They change the night into day, Saying The light is near' in the presence of darkness.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, só͘-ū tuì lí tuā siū-khì ê it-tīng lóng ē làu-khuì, kiàn-siàu; kah lí sio-tseⁿ ê it-tīng ē tshin-tshiūⁿ bô tsûn-tsāi, mā ē bia̍t-bông.
English: Behold, all those who are incensed against you will be disappointed and confounded. Those who strive with you will be like nothing, and shall perish.

Tailo: to̍h-sī thiaⁿ-tio̍h Guá kong-kik tsit só͘-tsāi kah tuà tī tsia ê jîn-bîn, só͘ kóng ē hō͘ i pha-hng koh siū tsiù-tsó͘, lí ê sim tsiū nńg, lí ka-kī tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng khiam-pi, koh thiah-li̍h lí ê saⁿ, tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng thî-khàu, Guá mā ū thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: because your heart was tender, and you did humble yourself before Yahweh, when you heard what I spoke against this place, and against the inhabitants of it, that they should become a desolation and a curse, and have torn your clothes, and wept before me; I also have heard you, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Só͘-í, nā tsia̍h-mi̍h ē hō͘ guá ê hiaⁿ-tī á-.sī tsí-muē ê sìn-gióng siū tsó͘-gāi, guá tsua̍t-tuì m̄-tsia̍h tsè-kuè ngó͘-siōng ê mi̍h, tsiah bián hō͘ in tī sìn-gióng siōng pua̍h-tó.
English: Therefore, if food causes my brother to stumble, I will eat no meat forevermore, that I don't cause my brother to stumble.

Tailo: Iā lo̍h-.khì ê sī pi-tsiān ê, koh-ua̍h ê sī îng-kng ê; tâi lo̍h-.khì ê sī nńg-tsiáⁿ ê, koh-ua̍h ê sī ióng-tsòng ê;
English: It is sown in dishonor; it is raised in glory. It is sown in weakness; it is raised in power.

Tailo: Sàulô it-sing tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kah Huilīsū lâng tuā kau-tsiàn, Sàulô kiàn-nā khuàⁿ-tio̍h ū lîng-li̍k ê lâng á-.sī ióng-sū, tsiū tsio-tsi̍p lâi uá i.
English: There was sore war against the Philistines all the days of Saul: and when Saul saw any mighty man, or any valiant man, he took him to him.

Tailo: Só͘-í, bô-lūn sī tiàm tī tē-tsiūⁿ ê sing-khu, á-.sī lī-khui sing-khu, guán só͘ tì-ì ê sī hō͘ Tsú huann-hí.
English: Therefore also we make it our aim, whether at home or absent, to be well pleasing to him.

Tailo: Tuì lán lī-khui Ka-té-si Bal-né-ah kàu kuè Sat-lia̍t khe ê ji̍t, tsóng-kiōng saⁿ-tsa̍p peh nî, kàu hit tāi ê bú-sū lóng sí-bông tī kun-iâⁿ tiong, tsiàu Siōngtsú tuì in só͘ tsiù-tsuā-.ê.
English: The days in which we came from Kadesh Barnea, until we were come over the brook Zered, were thirty-eight years; until all the generation of the men of war were consumed from the midst of the camp, as Yahweh swore to them.

Tailo: Beh tit-tio̍h tshing-khì ê lâng tio̍h sé i ê saⁿ-khò͘, thì i tsuân-pō͘ ê mn̂g, īng tsuí sé sing-khu tsiū tshing-khì; jiân-āu thang ji̍p-khì iâⁿ lāi, tsóng-.sī, tio̍h tī ka-kī ê pò͘-pênn guā tuà tshit ji̍t.
English: He who is to be cleansed shall wash his clothes, and shave off all his hair, and bathe himself in water; and he shall be clean. After that he shall come into the camp, but shall dwell outside his tent seven days.

Tailo: M̄-thang hō͘ in tuà tī lí ê thó͘-tē, khióng-kiaⁿ in ē hō͘ lí tik-tsuē Guá. Lí nā ho̍k-sāi in ê sîn-bîng, tse ē tsiâⁿ-tsò lí ê lô-bāng.
English: They shall not dwell in your land, lest they make you sin against me, for if you serve their gods, it will surely be a snare to you.

Tailo: Ela̍h kî-tha ê tāi-tsì, kiàn-nā i só͘ kiâⁿ ê, kám bô lóng kì tī Isulael tsiah-ê ông ê kì-lio̍k?
English: Now the rest of the acts of Elah, and all that he did, aren't they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

Tailo: Biāniámín lâng sí-.khì ê ū tsi̍t-bān peh-tshing, tsiah-ê lóng sī ióng-sū, kî-tha ê lâng ua̍t tńg-sin tô-tsáu khì khòng-iá, kàu Lim-móng ê tsio̍h-puâⁿ.
English: There fell of Benjamin eighteen thousand men; all these were men of valor.

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng ē kú-tn̂g ua̍h-.leh bē sí, ē kiù i ê lîng-hûn thuat-lī im-hú ê kuân-pìng? [Sè-la̍h]
English: What man is he who shall live and not see death, Who shall deliver his soul from the power of Sheol? Selah.

Tailo: Lēbī lâng Mat-ta-thí-iah sī Khóla̍h tso̍k Sialúm ê tuā-kiáⁿ, i ê tsik-jīm sī kuán-lí puânn lāi só͘ piak ê mi̍h.
English: Mattithiah, one of the Levites, who was the firstborn of Shallum the Korahite, had the office of trust over the things that were baked in pans.

Tailo: Siōngtè ah, guān Lí ê kuân-tuā puâⁿ-kuè tsiah-ê thiⁿ! Guān Lí ê îng-kng puâⁿ-kuè tsuân tē!
English: Be exalted, God, above the heavens! Let your glory be above all the earth!

Tailo: Bô lâng ē-tàng ka-kī tshú-tit tsit-ê tsun-kuì ê tsit-hūn, tsí ū tshin-tshiūnn Alông án-ne hō͘ Siōngtè suán-tiàu.
English: Nobody takes this honor on himself, but he is called by God, just like Aaron was.

Tailo: to̍h-sī hiah-ê tsun-siú I ê iok, kì-liām I ê kà-sī lâi tsun-thàn ê lâng.
English: To those who keep his covenant, To those who remember to obey his precepts.

Tailo: Án-ne, guá koh-tsài khì lín hia ê sî, hō͘ lín ū koh khah tshiong-hun ê lí-iû, ē-tàng uī-tio̍h guá ê iân-kò͘ lâi īng Ki-tok Iésu tsò lín ê khua-kháu.
English: that your rejoicing may abound in Christ Jesus in me through my presence with you again.

Tailo: Tsiū-sī hiah-ê lim tsiú m̄-tsai suah, sì-kè khì tshuē tiâu-hô tsiú lim ê hit khuán lâng.
English: Those who stay long at the wine; Those who go to seek out mixed wine.

Tailo: Hit gō͘-ê lâng ji̍p-khì Mika ê tshù, the̍h tiau-khik ê ngó͘-siōng, tsè-si ho̍k, tshù lāi ê ngó͘-siōng kah tsù ê siōng, tsè-si tsiū mn̄g in kóng, Lín teh tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: When these went into Micah's house, and fetched the engraved image, the ephod, and the teraphim, and the molten image, the priest said to them, What do you?

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, kiau-ngō͘-ê Babúlông lâng, Guá beh tsò lí ê tuì-ti̍k, in-uī Guá pān lí ê ji̍t, hit-ê kî í-king kàu.
English: Behold, I am against you, you proud one, says the Lord, Yahweh of Armies; for your day is come, the time that I will visit you.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê sù-tsiá tshun-tshut tshiú-.ni̍h só͘ gia̍h ê kuái-á bué, lâi tuh-tio̍h bah kah bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ, tsiū ū hué tuì tsio̍h-puâⁿ tshut-.lâi, tsuân-pō͘ ê bah kah bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ sio khí-.lâi. Siōngtsú ê sù-tsiá tsiū lī-khui khì, bô koh-tsài khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: Then the angel of Yahweh put forth the end of the staff that was in his hand, and touched the flesh and the unleavened cakes; and there went up fire out of the rock, and consumed the flesh and the unleavened cakes; and the angel of Yahweh departed out of his sight.

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng nā ing-kai siū phah, sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ tio̍h hō͘ i phak tī tē-.ni̍h, tī i ê bīn-tsîng, tsiàu i ê tsuē, tsiàu siàu-gia̍h kā i phah.
English: and it shall be, if the wicked man be worthy to be beaten, that the judge shall cause him to lie down, and to be beaten before his face, according to his wickedness, by number.

Tailo: Málûn kah Ki-liân nn̄g lâng mā sí, tshun hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng bô tiōng-hu, mā bô kiáⁿ.
English: Mahlon and Chilion died both of them; and the woman was left of her two children and of her husband.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Mô͘se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Isulael ông Ahap tē-sì nî, Asah ê kiáⁿ Iô-sa-huat tsē-uī tsò Iôtah ông.
English: Jehoshaphat the son of Asa began to reign over Judah in the fourth year of Ahab king of Israel.

Tailo: Hō͘ guán kah lín lâi kah Ki-tok kiat-liân ê sī Siōngtè, koh sī Siōngtè pún-sin kíng-suán lán tsiâⁿ-tsò I ê tsú-bîn.
English: Now he who establishes us with you in Christ, and anointed us, is God;

Tailo: Guán ê gû thua huè muá tsài, bô lâng ji̍p-lâi tshim-tsiàm; guán mā bián tshut-khì tsing-tsiàn, guán ê ke-lō͘ bô thî-khàu ê siann.
English: Our oxen will pull heavy loads. There is no breaking in, and no going away, And no outcry in our streets.

Tailo: In-uī kiû ông puah tsi̍t tuī pō͘-ping kah bé-ping, pang-tsān guán tī lō͘-.ni̍h tí-tòng tuì-ti̍k, guá lia̍h-tsò kiàn-siàu; in-uī guán bat tuì ông kóng, Guán ê Siōngtè ê tshiú ē pó-hō͘ só͘-ū tuì I kî-kiû ê lâng; to̍k-to̍k I ê lîng-li̍k kah siū-khì kong-kik só͘-ū khì-sak I ê lâng.
English: For I was ashamed to ask of the king a band of soldiers and horsemen to help us against the enemy in the way, because we had spoken to the king, saying, The hand of our God is on all those who seek him, for good; but his power and his wrath is against all those who forsake him.

Tailo: Utsiiah kiânn Siōngtsú só͘ khuàⁿ-tsò hó ê tāi-tsì, tsiàu i ê lāu-pē Amátsiah só͘ kiâⁿ ê it-tshè.
English: He did that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh, according to all that his father Amaziah had done.

Tailo: Ia-be-si ê kiáⁿ Sialúm puē-puān i, tī jîn-bîn ê bīn-tsîng kā i phah, kā i thâi, tshuàn i ê uī.
English: Shallum the son of Jabesh conspired against him, and struck him before the people, and killed him, and reigned in his place.

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, lí ná ē luân-bō͘ îm-hū? Ná ē khì lám ki-lí?
English: For why should you, my son, be captivated with an adulteress? Why embrace the bosom of another?

Tailo: Koh kóng, Guán nā tī lí ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián, kiû lí īng tsit-ê tē hō͘ lí ê lô͘-po̍k tsò sán-gia̍p, m̄-thang tshuā guán kuè Ioltàn hô.
English: They said, If we have found favor in your sight, let this land be given to your servants for a possession; don't bring us over the Jordan.

Tailo: I ê siann sī piáu-bîng I, mā īng só͘ beh khí ê tuā hong-hō͘ tsí-sī tsing-seⁿ.
English: The noise of it tells about him, And the livestock also concerning the storm that comes up.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h khiā tī guā-bīn, thìng-hāu kā lí tsioh ê lâng the̍h tsún-tǹg tshut-lâi hō͘ lí.
English: You shall stand outside, and the man to whom you do lend shall bring forth the pledge outside to you.

Tailo: Ông kah Hamán lâi hù ông-hō͘ Êsutel ê iàn-si̍k.
English: So the king and Haman came to banquet with Esther the queen.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h án-ne, guán tâng-sim ha̍p-ì kuat-tīng kíng-suán tāi-piáu, tshe-phài in kah guán só͘ thiàⁿ ê Ba-ná-ba í-ki̍p Páulô khì lín hia;
English: it seemed good to us, having come to one accord, to choose out men and send them to you with our beloved Barnabas and Paul,

Tailo: Lín tio̍h ǹg sìng-só͘ gia̍h-khí lín ê tshiú, lâi o-ló Siōngtsú.
English: Lift up your hands in the sanctuary. Praise Yahweh!

Tailo: Guá khuàⁿ-tshut, guá tsai Siōngtè bô tshe i, sī i ka-kī kóng tsit-ê sian-ti uē lâi kong-kik guá, sī Tobiiah kah Sanballat kā i o͘-se.
English: I discerned, and behold, God had not sent him; but he pronounced this prophecy against me: and Tobiah and Sanballat had hired him.

Tailo: Hit mê, tio̍h tsia̍h īng hué piak ê iûⁿ-á bah kah bô-kàⁿ piáⁿ, khó͘-tshài tsham-teh tsia̍h.
English: They shall eat the flesh in that night, roasted with fire, and unleavened bread. They shall eat it with bitter herbs.

Tailo: I ê siang tshiú tshin-tshiūnn kim-khuân siuⁿ n̂g-gi̍k; i ê sing-khu tshin-tshiūnn tiau-khik ê tshiūⁿ-gê, sì-kho͘-uî siuⁿ nâ-pó-tsio̍h.
English: His hands are like rings of gold set with beryl. His body is like ivory work overlaid with sapphires.

Tailo: Kàu beh àm-á ê sî, hn̂g-tsú kā i ê kuán-ke kóng, ' Kiò kang-lâng lâi, huat kang-tsîⁿ hō͘ in. Tuì lō͘-bué lâi ê khai-sí huat, kàu tāi-sing lâi ê uî-tsí. '
English: When evening had come, the lord of the vineyard said to his steward, Call the laborers and pay them their wages, beginning from the last to the first.'

Tailo: In bē-tàng kah hiah-ê bô siū kat-lé tsiah tó-.leh ê ióng-sū tsò-hué tó-.leh; tsiah-ê ióng-sū tuà ke-si lo̍h im-kan, thâu-khak khùn tī to-kiàm, kut-thâu tíng ū in ê tsuē-ok; in bat tī ua̍h-lâng ê tē hō͘ ióng-sū kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: They shall not lie with the mighty who are fallen of the uncircumcised, who are gone down to Sheol with their weapons of war, and have laid their swords under their heads, and their iniquities are on their bones; for they were the terror of the mighty in the land of the living.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, Tsú — bān-kun ê Siōngtsú, Isulael ê tuā-lîng-.ê kóng, Ho͘h! Guá beh tû-khì Guá ê siû-ti̍k, hō͘ ka-kī khah ē pîng-an, Guá beh tuì Guá ê tuì-ti̍k pò-siû!
English: Therefore the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, The Mighty One of Israel, says: Ah, I will get relief from my adversaries, And avenge myself of my enemies;

Tailo: m̄-sī khì hiah-ê kóng-uē tshim-ò, giân-gí oh-tit thiaⁿ ê tsin tsē kok, in ê uē lí bē liáu-kái, thiaⁿ m̄-bat.
English: not to many peoples of a strange speech and of a hard language, whose words you can not understand. Surely, if I sent you to them, they would listen to you.

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, tsìng jîn-bîn ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ, tsè-si kah Lēbī lâng, lóng tsū-tsi̍p lâi-kàu king-ha̍k kàu-su Etsula̍h hia, ài beh tì-ì thiaⁿ lu̍t-huat ê uē.
English: On the second day were gathered together the heads of fathers' houses of all the people, the priests, and the Levites, to Ezra the scribe, even to give attention to the words of the law.

Tailo: Khiam-pi ê lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsiū huann-hí; guān tsáu-tshuē Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k ê sim ua̍h khí-.lâi.
English: The humble have seen it, and are glad. You who seek after God, let your heart live.

Tailo: Lín ná ē iáu-teh kiau-ngō͘ tsū-tuā? Kìng-jiân bô kám-kak ai-siong, bô kā tsò tsit khuán tāi-tsì ê lâng tuì lín tiong-kan kuáⁿ tshut-.khì!
English: You are puffed up, and didn't rather mourn, that he who had done this deed might be removed from among you.

Tailo: Ông kah in kóng-uē, tī in tsìng lâng ê tiong-kan, khuàⁿ bô tsi̍t-ê kah Taniel, Hananiah, Misael kah Atsalíah ē pí-.tit, só͘-í in tit-tio̍h khiā tī ông ê bīn-tsîng ê khuán-thāi.
English: The king talked with them; and among them all was found none like Daniel, Hananiah, Mishael, and Azariah: therefore stood they before the king.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huat-tshut bíng-lia̍t ê siū-khì, pîng-an ê iûⁿ-tiâu tsiâⁿ-tsò líng-tsīng.
English: The peaceable folds are brought to silence because of the fierce anger of Yahweh.

Tailo: Tabi̍t tsin tio̍h-kip, in-uī tsìng lâng kóng tio̍h īng tsio̍h-thâu kā Tabi̍t tìm-sí. Lâng-lâng uī-tio̍h in ê kiáⁿ-jî tsin huân-ló, tsóng-.sī, Tabi̍t uá-khò Siōngtsú — i ê Siōngtè, ka-kī kian-kò͘.
English: David was greatly distressed; for the people spoke of stoning him, because the soul of all the people was grieved, every man for his sons and for his daughters: but David strengthened himself in Yahweh his God.

Tailo: Guá pí kâng tsi̍t puè ê Iô-tá-iah lâng koh khah tsun-siú kàu-kui, koh khah jia̍t-sim tsun-siú tsó͘-sian ê thuân-thóng.
English: I advanced in the Jews' religion beyond many of my own age among my countrymen, being more exceedingly zealous for the traditions of my fathers.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng, miâ kiò-tsò Ne-ko té bó, sī Iô-tá-iah lâng ê kuann.
English: Now there was a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews.

Tailo: Guá mā tsai Lēbī lâng só͘ ing-kai tit-tio̍h ê hūn-gia̍h bô hō͘ in, tì-sú tam-tng tsit-bū ê Lēbī lâng kah tshiùⁿ kua ê, ta̍k-ê lóng tńg-khì in ê tshân-hn̂g.
English: I perceived that the portions of the Levites had not been given them; so that the Levites and the singers, who did the work, were fled everyone to his field.

Tailo: Guá tuì tī I sī uân-tsuân, guá mā siú pún-sin bô kiâⁿ guá ê pháiⁿ.
English: I was also perfect toward him; I kept myself from my iniquity.

Tailo: ' Jîn-tsú it-tīng ē hông tshut-bē kau tī tsuē-jîn ê tshiú, hō͘ in tìng tī si̍p-jī-kè, tē-saⁿ ji̍t koh-ua̍h. '
English: saying that the Son of Man must be delivered up into the hands of sinful men, and be crucified, and the third day rise again?

Tailo: Lí tio̍h tuì in kóng: Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè án-ne kóng: Bô tsun-thàn tsit-ê iok ê uē ê lâng tio̍h siū tsiù-tsó͘.
English: and say you to them, Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel: Cursed be the man who doesn't hear the words of this covenant,

Tailo: Bián-tit bô tsuē ê hueh lâu tī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí tsò sán-gia̍p ê tē, tì-sú lâu hueh ê tsuē kui tī lí.
English: that innocent blood not be shed in the midst of your land, which Yahweh your God gives you for an inheritance, and so blood be on you.

Tailo: In lī-khui Siōngtsú ê suaⁿ, tshut-huat kiânn saⁿ ji̍t ê lō͘-thîng; Siōngtsú ê iok-kuī tī thâu-tsîng kiânn saⁿ ji̍t ê lō͘-thîng, kā in tshuē an-hioh ê só͘-tsāi.
English: They set forward from the Mount of Yahweh three days' journey; and the ark of the covenant of Yahweh went before them three days' journey, to seek out a resting place for them.

Tailo: I ē pó-siú I sìng-ê ê kha, hō͘ pháiⁿ lâng tī o͘-àm tiong tiām tsih-tsih; in-uī lâng uá-khò khuì-la̍t bē-tàng khah iâⁿ.
English: He will keep the feet of his holy ones; But the wicked shall be put to silence in darkness; For by strength shall no man prevail.

Tailo: Siáⁿ lâng phìng-tiāⁿ bó͘ iáu-buē tshuā i? I mā thang tńg-khì in tau, khióng-kiaⁿ i ē tīn-bông suah hō͘ pa̍t lâng tshuā i.
English: What man is there who has pledged to be married a wife, and has not taken her? let him go and return to his house, lest he die in the battle, and another man take her.

Tailo: In-uī king-tián ū kóng, I hō͘ bān-mi̍h lóng khut-ho̍k tī I ê kha-ē. Tsin bîng-hián, tsia só͘ kóng ê Bān mi̍h pīng bô pau-hâm hō͘ bān-mi̍h khut-ho̍k tī Ki-tok kha-ē ê Siōngtè.
English: For, He put all things in subjection under his feet. But when he says, All things are put in subjection, it is evident that he is excepted who subjected all things to him.

Tailo: Tsí-ū kim, gîn kah tâng thih ê khì-kū, lóng tio̍h hun-pia̍t kui hō͘ Siōngtsú, siu ji̍p-khì Siōngtsú ê kim-khò͘.
English: But all the silver, and gold, and vessels of brass and iron, are holy to Yahweh: they shall come into the treasury of Yahweh.

Tailo: Koh kā Ala̍hbah kah uá-kīn Ioltàn hô ê tē, tuì Kin-né-lo̍t ti̍t-kàu Ala̍hbah ê hái, to̍h-sī Iâm-hái, í-ki̍p Pí-su-ka suaⁿ-kha tang pîng ê tē, lóng hō͘ in.
English: the Arabah also, and the Jordan and the border of it, from Chinnereth even to the sea of the Arabah, the Salt Sea, under the slopes of Pisgah eastward.

Tailo: Ông kah Io-ho-iá-tah kā gîn hō͘ tsò Siōngtsú tiān lāi pān-sū ê lâng, in tsiū tshiàⁿ tsio̍h-tshiūⁿ, ba̍k-tshiūⁿ lâi siu-tsíng Siōngtsú ê tiān, koh tshiàⁿ thih-kang, tâng-tshiūⁿ, lâi siu-lí Siōngtsú ê tiān.
English: The king and Jehoiada gave it to such as did the work of the service of the house of Yahweh; and they hired masons and carpenters to restore the house of Yahweh, and also such as worked iron and brass to repair the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: In tshin-tshiūnn phah-la̍h ê teh jiok guán ê kha-pō͘, tì-sú guán m̄-káⁿ kiânn tī guán ê ke-lō͘. Guán ê tsiong-kio̍k teh beh kàu, guán ê ji̍t-tsí í-king muá à; in-uī guán ê tsiong-kio̍k kàu à.
English: They hunt our steps, so that we can't go in our streets: Our end is near, our days are fulfilled; for our end is come.

Tailo: Asah ū tuì Iôtah tshut ê kun-ping saⁿ-tsa̍p bān, giâ pîn-pâi kah tshiuⁿ, koh ū tuì Biāniámín tshut ê jī-tsa̍p peh bān, giâ pîn-pâi khui kiong. Tsiah-ê lóng sī tuā la̍t ê ióng-sū.
English: Asa had an army that bore bucklers and spears, out of Judah three hundred thousand; and out of Benjamin, that bore shields and drew bows, two hundred eighty thousand: all these were mighty men of valor.

Tailo: Kiû Lí in-uī Lí ê miâ ê iân-kò͘, m̄-thang thó-ià guán; m̄-thang lîng-jio̍k Lí îng-kng ê pó-tsō. Kiû Lí tui-liām guán, m̄-thang uî-puē Lí kah guán só͘ li̍p ê iok.
English: Do not abhor us, for your name's sake; do not disgrace the throne of your glory: remember, don't break your covenant with us.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê sù-tsiá kàu O͘hulah, tsē tī Abietsel tso̍k ê lâng Io-a-si ê siōng tshiū kha. Io-a-si ê kiáⁿ Gîtióng tī tsiú-khut hia teh phah-be̍h, bô ài hō͘ Mítiân lâng khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: The angel of Yahweh came, and sat under the oak which was in Ophrah, that pertained to Joash the Abiezrite: and his son Gideon was beating out wheat in the winepress, to hide it from the Midianites.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá phah lí, hō͘ lí siū tāng-siong, in-uī lí ê tsuē hō͘ lí hong-huì.
English: Therefore I also have struck you with a grievous wound. I have made you desolate because of your sins.

Tailo: Tsá-tsîng lí ê tsó͘-sian só͘ li̍p ê tē-kài, lí m̄-thang tshian-suá.
English: Don't move the ancient boundary stone, Which your fathers have set up.

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn pháiⁿ lâng nā huê-thâu, lī-khui i só͘ kiâⁿ ê pháiⁿ, lâi kiâⁿ tsìng-ti̍t kah ha̍p-lí ê tāi-tsì, i ē hō͘ i ê sîn-hûn tit-tio̍h ua̍h-miā.
English: Again, when the wicked man turns away from his wickedness that he has committed, and does that which is lawful and right, he shall save his soul alive.

Tailo: M̄-koh, hit-ê thiu-suè ê lâng khiā tuà hn̄g-hn̄g ê só͘-tsāi, liân gia̍h thâu ǹg thiⁿ to m̄-káⁿ, kan-taⁿ pi-siong kóng, ' Siōngtè ah, liân-bín guá tsit-ê ū tsuē ê lâng. '
English: But the tax collector, standing far away, wouldn't even lift up his eyes to heaven, but beat his breast, saying, God, be merciful to me, a sinner!'

Tailo: Iôtah ông Iô-sa-huat tsa̍p-peh nî, Ahap ê kiáⁿ Io-lâm tī Sa-má-lī-a tsē-uī, tsò Isulael ông, kiōng tsa̍p-jī nî.
English: Now Jehoram the son of Ahab began to reign over Israel in Samaria in the eighteenth year of Jehoshaphat king of Judah, and reigned twelve years.

Tailo: Guá sī Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè, bat tshuā lín tshut Aigi̍p tē, uī-tio̍h beh siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín Ka-nân tē, mā beh tsò lín ê Siōngtè.
English: I am Yahweh your God, who brought you forth out of the land of Egypt, to give you the land of Canaan, and to be your God.

Tailo: Án-ne, sè-kan tsiū bô lâng ē-tàng tī Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng khua-kháu.
English: that no flesh should boast before God.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, guá kiû-kiò Lí, in-uī hué kā khòng-iá ê tsháu-tiûⁿ sio-bia̍t, hué-iām sio-tsīn tshân-iá ê tshiū-ba̍k.
English: Yahweh, I cry to you, For the fire has devoured the pastures of the wilderness, And the flame has burned all the trees of the field.

Tailo: In tsiū tuì in tiong-kan tû-khì guā-pang ê sîn-bîng, lâi ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú. Siōngtsú ê sim in-uī Isulael lâng ê kan-khó͘, tsiū iu-būn.
English: They put away the foreign gods from among them, and served Yahweh; and his soul was grieved for the misery of Israel.

Tailo: Sái ba̍k-bué lâi huē-ì ê lâng hō͘ lâng iu-būn; tshuì kóng gōng uē ê lâng ē sit-pāi.
English: One winking with the eye causes sorrow, But a chattering fool will fall.

Tailo: Kóng-tio̍h hit tsa̍p ki kak, to̍h-sī tuì hit-ê kok lāi beh hing-khí tsa̍p-ê ông. Āu-lâi, līng-guā ū tsi̍t-ê ông hing-khí kah tsîng hiah-ê bô kāng, i ē hō͘ saⁿ-ê ông khut-ho̍k tī i ê bīn-tsîng.
English: As for the ten horns, out of this kingdom shall ten kings arise: and another shall arise after them; and he shall be diverse from the former, and he shall put down three kings.

Tailo: Khùn-khó͘ ê lâng ji̍t-tsí lóng ū tsai-hō; sim khuài-lo̍k ê jîn-iàn-si̍k bô tn̄g.
English: All the days of the afflicted are wretched, But one who has a cheerful heart enjoys a continual feast.

Tailo: Thiⁿ tsi̍t ē kng, hiah-ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ kah bîn-kan ê tiúⁿ-ló tsò-hué kè-bô͘ beh hām-hāi Iésu, lâi kā I tshú sí-hîng.
English: Now when morning had come, all the chief priests and the elders of the people took counsel against Jesus to put him to death:

Tailo: Tabi̍t tsiū tuì tē-.ni̍h khí-.lâi, sé sing-khu, buah iû, uāⁿ saⁿ, ji̍p-khì Siōngtsú ê tiān kìng-pài, jiân-āu tńg-khì i ê tshù. I huan-hù lâng pâi mi̍h tī i ê bīn-tsîng, i tsiū tsia̍h.
English: Then David arose from the earth, and washed, and anointed himself, and changed his clothing; and he came into the house of Yahweh, and worshiped: then he came to his own house; and when he required, they set bread before him, and he ate.

Tailo: Ehuahátsuh khún-kiû Siōngtsú, Siōngtsú thiaⁿ i, in-uī I khuàⁿ-tio̍h Isulael lâng siū tsè-ap, to̍h-sī Alâm ông kā in tsè-ap.
English: Jehoahaz begged Yahweh, and Yahweh listened to him; for he saw the oppression of Israel, how that the king of Syria oppressed them.

Tailo: Nepkatnetsal koh kā Siōngtsú tiān lāi ê khì-kū tuà kàu Babúlông, hē tī Babúlông i ê biō lāi.
English: Nebuchadnezzar also carried of the vessels of the house of Yahweh to Babylon, and put them in his temple at Babylon.

Tailo: Tsit-ê sī Mô͘se tī Isulael lâng ê bīn-tsîng só͘ pâi-lia̍t ê lu̍t-huat,
English: This is the law which Moses set before the children of Israel:

Tailo: Tī Hebúlông tso̍k tiong-kan, ū Ia-li-iah tsò thâu, to̍h-sī tī Hebúlông tso̍k tiong-kan tsiàu i tsó͘-sian ê sè-hē, tī Tabi̍t tsē-uī ê tē-sì-tsa̍p nî, tī Gilia̍t ê Ia-ji-el, tshuē-tio̍h in tiong-kan kuí-nā-ê tuā ióng-sū.
English: Of the Hebronites was Jerijah the chief, even of the Hebronites, according to their generations by fathers' houses. In the fortieth year of the reign of David they were sought for, and there were found among them mighty men of valor at Jazer of Gilead.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tshiáⁿ lí phài uē-ping khì kò͘-siú hit-ê bōng kàu tē-saⁿ ji̍t, án-ne tsiah bē hō͘ I ê bûn-tô͘ lâi thau-the̍h I ê sin-si, jiân-āu kā tsìng lâng kóng, ' I tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h. ' Nā án-ne, tsit-ê āu-lâi ê khi-phiàn ē pí khí-thâu ê koh khah giâm-tiōng.
English: Command therefore that the tomb be made secure until the third day, lest perhaps his disciples come at night and steal him away, and tell the people, He is risen from the dead;' and the last deception will be worse than the first.

Tailo: Tsá-tsîng tuì Bohol ê tsuē, lán kám iáu lia̍h-tsò sī sió-khuá? Suî-jiân un-i̍k lîm-kàu Siōngtsú ê huē-tsiòng, kàu kin-á-ji̍t lán iáu-buē tshing-khì.
English: Is the iniquity of Peor too little for us, from which we have not cleansed ourselves to this day, although there came a plague on the congregation of Yahweh,

Tailo: M̄-thang î-suá tsá-tsîng só͘ li̍p ê tē-kài, mā m̄-thang tshim-tsiàm ko͘-jî ê tshân-tē.
English: Don't move the ancient boundary stone. Don't encroach on the fields of the fatherless:

Tailo: Siōngtè ē tī lia̍t kok tiong lâi sím-phuàⁿ, uī-tio̍h tsin tsē jîn-bîn lâi kái-kuat. In ē kā in ê to phah-tsò lê-thâu, kā in ê tshiuⁿ phah-tsò liâm-á. Tsit kok bô gia̍h to kong-kik hit kok, in mā bô koh ha̍k-si̍p kau-tsiàn.
English: He will judge between the nations, And will decide concerning many peoples; And they shall beat their swords into plowshares, And their spears into pruning hooks. Nation shall not lift up sword against nation, Neither shall they learn war any more.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t sī o͘-o͘ àm-àm, ba̍t hûn o͘-àm ê ji̍t, tshin-tshiūnn phah-phú-kng ê sik-tì pho͘-muá suaⁿ-thâu. Ū tsi̍t tso̍k tuā koh kiông, tsiông kàu taⁿ m̄-bat ū án-ne ê, í-āu kàu tāi-tāi mā bô.
English: A day of darkness and gloominess, A day of clouds and thick darkness. As the dawn spreading on the mountains, A great and strong people; There has never been the like, Neither will there be any more after them, Even to the years of many generations.

Tailo: Hō͘ lí kā in phah-tshuì, lí ê kha-ta̍h tī tuì-ti̍k ê hueh tiong, lí ê káu tsīⁿ in ê hueh.
English: That you may crush them, dipping your foot in blood, That the tongues of your dogs may have their portion from your enemies.

Tailo: Tuì uá thô͘-kha ê té-tsō kàu ē-tsàn ê khiat-á, kuân nn̄g tiú, khuah tsi̍t tiú, tuì sè khiat-á kàu tuā khiat-á, kuân sì tiú, khuah tsi̍t tiú.
English: From the bottom on the ground to the lower ledge shall be two cubits, and the breadth one cubit; and from the lesser ledge to the greater ledge shall be four cubits, and the breadth a cubit.

Tailo: Moltékái ta̍k ji̍t tī lú-īⁿ ê thâu-tsîng kiâⁿ lâi kiâⁿ khì, ài tsai Êsutel ū pîng-ána bô, kah i tsiong-lâi ê kíng-gū án-tsuáⁿ.
English: Mordecai walked every day before the court of the women's house, to know how Esther did, and what would become of her.

Tailo: In-uī lí bô uī-tio̍h lí ê hó-gia̍h, īng huann-hí ê sim kah khuài-lo̍k ê ì-sù, lâi ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè.
English: Because you didn't serve Yahweh your God with joyfulness, and with gladness of heart, by reason of the abundance of all things;

Tailo: Tio̍h īng tsô-kia̍p tshâ tsò nn̄g ki kǹg, īng kim pau khí-.lâi.
English: You shall make poles of acacia wood, and overlay them with gold.

Tailo: I koh pàng tsi̍t tsiah hún-tsiáu tshut-.khì, beh khuànn tsuí tuì tē-tsiūⁿ thè-khì á-buē.
English: He sent forth a dove from him, to see if the waters were abated from the surface of the ground,

Tailo: Lí mā tio̍h kā jîn-bîn kóng, ' Lín tio̍h hō͘ ka-kī tsò sìng, tsún-pī bîn-á-tsài thang tsia̍h bah, in-uī lín ū thî-khàu hō͘ Siōngtsú thiaⁿ-tio̍h lín kóng, siáⁿ lâng hō͘ guán tsia̍h bah? In-uī guán tī Aigi̍p tsin hó. Só͘-í, Siōngtsú beh hō͘ lín bah, hō͘ lín thang tsia̍h.
English: Say you to the people, Sanctify yourselves against tomorrow, and you shall eat flesh; for you have wept in the ears of Yahweh, saying, Who shall give us flesh to eat? for it was well with us in Egypt: therefore Yahweh will give you flesh, and you shall eat.

Tailo: I ē lia̍h kìng-uì Siōngtsú tsò huann-hí; i m̄-sī pîn ba̍k-tsiu só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâi sím-phuàⁿ, mā m̄-sī pîn hīⁿ-khang só͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâi phuàⁿ-tuàn;
English: His delight will be in the fear of Yahweh. He will not judge by the sight of his eyes, Neither decide by the hearing of his ears;

Tailo: Bûn-tô͘ mn̄g Iésu kóng, Lāu-su ah, tsiah-ê tāi-tsì tang-sî ē huat-sing? Koh tsiah-ê tāi-tsì beh huat-sing tsìn-tsîng, ū siáⁿ-mi̍h tiāu-thâu?
English: They asked him, Teacher, so when will these things be? What is the sign that these things are about to happen?

Tailo: Abulahàm it-sing ê nî-ji̍t sī tsi̍t-pah tshit-tsa̍p-gō͘ huè.
English: These are the days of the years of Abraham's life which he lived: one hundred seventy-five years.

Tailo: Thiāu ê pán tn̂g tsa̍p tiú, khuah tsi̍t tiú puàⁿ.
English: Ten cubits shall be the length of a board, and one and a half cubits the breadth of each board.

Tailo: In ē tshin-tshiūⁿ ióng-bíng ê sai hm̄-hm̄ háu, tshin-tshiūnn sè-tsiah sai teh háu-kiò.
English: They shall roar together like young lions; they shall growl as lions' cubs.

Tailo: Kā lí ê kám bô hut-jiân khí-.lâi, kiáu-jiáu lí ê kám bô tshénn khí-.lâi, lí tsiū ē tsò in só͘ tshiúⁿ ê mi̍h?
English: Won't your debtors rise up suddenly, and wake up those who make you tremble, and you will be their victim?

Tailo: Kah tsha̍t hun-tsong ê lâng sī uàn-hūn ka-kī ê sèⁿ-miā; i thiaⁿ-tio̍h kiò lâng tsiù-tsuā ê uē, mā bē kóng-tshut si̍t-uē.
English: Whoever is an accomplice of a thief is an enemy of his own soul. He takes an oath, but dares not testify.

Tailo: Tio̍h kā in kóng: Lín tāi-tāi ê kiáⁿ-sun, kiàn-nā sing-khu ū ù-uè lâi tshin-kīn Isulael lâng só͘ hun-pia̍t tsò sìng, kui hō͘ Siōngtsú tsò sìng-mi̍h ê, hit-ê lâng tio̍h tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng tsián-tû. Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: Tell them, If anyone of all your seed throughout your generations approaches the holy things, which the children of Israel make holy to Yahweh, having his uncleanness on him, that soul shall be cut off from before me. I am Yahweh.

Tailo: In kóng, lâi à! Guá khì phâng tsiú, lán lim kāu tsiú kàu tsuì; bîn-á-tsài ē tshin-tshiūⁿ kin-á-ji̍t, iàn-lo̍k ki̍k tuā bô pí.
English: Come you, say they, I will get wine, and we will fill ourselves with strong drink; and tomorrow shall be as this day, a day great beyond measure.

Tailo: In-uī guán bat thiaⁿ-tio̍h i kóng, ' Tsit-ê Na-tsa-lia̍t lâng Iésu beh huí-huāi tsit-ê sìng-tiān, koh beh kái-piàn Mô͘se thuân hō͘ lán ê kui-lē. '
English: For we have heard him say that this Jesus of Nazareth will destroy this place, and will change the customs which Moses delivered to us.

Tailo: Bô-lūn siáⁿ-mi̍h lâng, nā kah Ki-tok kiat-liân, to̍h-sī sin tshòng-tsō ê lâng; kū ê tāi-tsì í-king kuè-.khì, taⁿ lóng piàn-tsò sin ê.
English: Therefore if anyone is in Christ, he is a new creation. The old things have passed away. Behold, all things have become new.

Tailo: Siōngtè tsiū tuì in huat siū-khì, kā in tiong-kan ióng-tsòng ê lâng thâi-sí, phah-tó Isulael ê siàu-liân lâng.
English: When the anger of God went up against them, Killed some of the fattest of them, And struck down the young men of Israel.

Tailo: Siōngtè ê tshia tshing-tshing bān-bān; Tsú tī hit tiong-kan, tshin-tshiūnn tī Si-nái, tī sìng ê só͘-tsāi.
English: The chariots of God are tens of thousands and thousands of thousands. The Lord is among them, from Sinai, into the sanctuary.

Tailo: nā bô tāi-sing khan kàu huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu, lâi Siōngtsú ê huē-bō͘ tsîng, hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú tsò lé-mi̍h, lâu hueh ê tsuē beh kui tī hit-ê lâng, i ū lâu hueh, hit-ê lâng ē tuì i ê jîn-bîn tiong tsián-tû.
English: and hasn't brought it to the door of the Tent of Meeting, to offer it as an offering to Yahweh before the tabernacle of Yahweh: blood shall be imputed to that man. He has shed blood; and that man shall be cut off from among his people.

Tailo: Só͘-ū lí ê mi̍h, to̍h-sī tsi̍t tiâu suàⁿ, tsi̍t tiâu uê-tuà, guá lóng m̄-the̍h, bián-tit lí kóng, ' Guá hō͘ Abúlâm hó-gia̍h. '
English: that I will not take a thread nor a sandal strap nor anything that is yours, lest you should say, I have made Abram rich.'

Tailo: Guán kó͘-lē lín, an-uì lín, sī ài beh hō͘ lín ê kiâⁿ-ta̍h ē-tàng hû-ha̍p Siōngtè ê tsí-ì, I ū ho͘-tiàu lín tsìn-ji̍p I ê kok-tō͘ kah îng-iāu.
English: to the end that you should walk worthily of God, who calls you into his own Kingdom and glory.

Tailo: Koh kiû lí tuì Le-ba-nòng ūn pik-hiuⁿ tshiū, siông tshiū, tuâⁿ-hiuⁿ tshiū lâi-kàu guá tsia, in-uī guá tsai lí ê lô͘-po̍k gâu tshò Le-ba-nòng ê tshiū. Lí khuàⁿ, guá ê lô͘-po̍k beh kah lí ê lô͘-po̍k tsò-hué tsò.
English: Send me also cedar trees, fir trees, and algum trees, out of Lebanon; for I know that your servants know how to cut timber in Lebanon: and behold, my servants shall be with your servants,

Tailo: Huilīsū lâng lâi liáu-āu, pò͘-tì tī Le-hua-im ê suaⁿ-kok.
English: Now the Philistines had come and spread themselves in the valley of Rephaim.

Tailo: Hit sî, in bē-tàng siú tseh, in-uī ka-kī tshing-khì ê tsè-si iáu bô kàu-gia̍h, jîn-bîn mā bô tsū-tsi̍p lâi tī Êlúsalèm.
English: For they could not keep it at that time, because the priests had not sanctified themselves in sufficient number, neither had the people gathered themselves together to Jerusalem.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, guá kin-á-ji̍t ū īng ua̍h kah hok-khì, sí kah tsai-hō, pâi-lia̍t tī lí ê bīn-tsîng.
English: Behold, I have set before you this day life and good, and death and evil;

Tailo: Tng O͘-tsi-a ông sí hit nî, guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h Tsú tsē tī kuân-kuân ê pó-tsō, I ê saⁿ-khò͘ suê lo̍h-lâi tsa̍h muá sìng-tiān.
English: In the year that king Uzziah died, I saw the Lord sitting on a throne, high and lifted up; and his train filled the temple.

Tailo: Guá li̍p-tsì beh khì iáu m̄-bat thiaⁿ-tio̍h Ki-tok ê miâ ê só͘-tsāi thuân hok-im, tsiah bē kah pa̍t lâng ê kang-tsok tiông-hok.
English: yes, making it my aim to preach the Good News, not where Christ was already named, that I might not build on another's foundation.

Tailo: Guá nā kóng uē, guá ê iu-būn iû-guân bô kiám khin; guá nā tiām-tiām, iu-būn kám tsiū ē lī-khui guá?
English: Though I speak, my grief is not subsided. Though I forbear, what am I eased?

Tailo: In-uī Sìng Sîn tsó͘-tsí in tī A-si-a síng thuân tō-lí, in tsiū tuì Hu-lú-gia̍h kah Ga-la̍h-tia ê só͘-tsāi king-kuè.
English: When they had gone through the region of Phrygia and Galatia, they were forbidden by the Holy Spirit to speak the word in Asia.

Tailo: Kám thang in-uī i la̍t tuā, tsiū uá-khò i? Kám thang kā lí ê khang-khuè kau-tài i?
English: Will you trust him, because his strength is great? Or will you leave to him your labor?

Tailo: Lí ê hiann-tī nā piàn sàn-tshiah, bē i ê sán-gia̍p kuí-nā hūn, i ê tsì-tshin tio̍h lâi kā i sio̍k-huê lí ê hiann-tī só͘ bē ê.
English: If your brother becomes poor, and sells some of his possessions, then his kinsman who is next to him shall come, and redeem that which his brother has sold.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h thò bé-tshia, khiâ bé! Tì thâu-khue khiā khí-.lâi, buâ tshiuⁿ, tshīng tsiàn-kah!
English: Harness the horses, and get up, you horsemen, and stand forth with your helmets; furbish the spears, put on the coats of mail.

Tailo: I ê tsú-bîn mā kui-uá tī tsia, muá-pue ê tsuí in lim kàu-liáu.
English: Therefore their people return to them, And they drink up waters of abundance.

Tailo: Hit sî, ke tsiū thî tē-jī pái. Piattò͘ siūⁿ-khí Iésu kā i kóng ê uē, Ke thî nn̄g pái í-tsîng, lí ē saⁿ pái m̄ jīn guá , tsiū tuā-siaⁿ thî-khàu.
English: The rooster crowed the second time. Peter remembered the word, how that Jesus said to him, Before the rooster crows twice, you will deny me three times. When he thought about that, he wept.

Tailo: Lián ê khuán tshin-tshiūnn tshia-lián ê khuán; i ê ti̍k-sim, i ê guā-khuân, i ê tsí （ Tsù, tshia-lián huâiⁿ-kuaiⁿ ê bué-liu ）, i ê lāi-khuân, lóng sī tsù ê.
English: The work of the wheels was like the work of a chariot wheel: their axles, and their rims, and their spokes, and their naves, were all molten.

Tailo: Guá ê lāu-pē nā ū ì-sù beh hāi lí, guá ē kā lí kóng, hō͘ lí pîng-an khì, nā bô, guān Siōngtsú ka-puē tsik-hua̍t Ionáthan. Guān Siōngtsú kah lí tông-tsāi, tshin-tshiūnn I bat kah guá ê lāu-pē tông-tsāi.
English: Yahweh do so to Jonathan, and more also, should it please my father to do you evil, if I don't disclose it to you, and send you away, that you may go in peace: and Yahweh be with you, as he has been with my father.

Tailo: Sisela̍h koh kā i kóng, Lí khiā tī pò͘-pênn mn̂g, nā ū lâng lâi mn̄g lí kóng, ū lâng tī lí tsia bô? Lí tsiū kā i kóng, bô.
English: He said to her, Stand in the door of the tent, and it shall be, when any man does come and inquire of you, and say, Is there any man here? that you shall say, No.

Tailo: Tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê Isulael lâng tuā-tuā huann-hí, siú Tû-kàⁿ-tseh tshit kang. Lēbī lâng kah tsè-si ji̍t-ji̍t o-ló Siōngtsú, īng hiáng-liāng ê ga̍k-khì o-ló Siōngtsú.
English: The children of Israel who were present at Jerusalem kept the feast of unleavened bread seven days with great gladness; and the Levites and the priests praised Yahweh day by day, singing with loud instruments to Yahweh.

Tailo: Samuel í-king lāu, tsiū siat-li̍p i ê kiáⁿ lâi tsò Isulael ê sū-su.
English: It happened, when Samuel was old, that he made his sons judges over Israel.

Tailo: Simiān ū uî gō͘-tsa̍p tiú, uî ê thiāu tsa̍p ki, khū tsa̍p-ê, thiāu ê kau kah huâiⁿ-kuaiⁿ sī īng gîn tsò ê.
English: For the west side were hangings of fifty cubits, their pillars ten, and their sockets ten; the hooks of the pillars, and their fillets, of silver.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h o-ló Siōngtsú! Tiàm tī Siōngtsú ê tiān teh ho̍k-sāi ê lô͘-po̍k, lín tio̍h o-ló Siōngtsú ê miâ!
English: Praise Yah! Praise the name of Yahweh! Praise him, you servants of Yahweh,

Tailo: I ê kiáⁿ-jî tit-tio̍h îng-kng, i m̄-tsai; in tú-tio̍h kàng kē, i mā m̄-tsai.
English: His sons come to honor, and he doesn't know it; They are brought low, but he doesn't perceive it of them.

Tailo: （ Tabi̍t ê si, kau hō͘ ga̍k-kuaⁿ. ）Siōngtsú ah, Lí bē kì-tit guá beh guā kú? Kám tio̍h kàu íng-uán? Lí am bīn m̄-khuàⁿ guá beh kàu guā kú?
English: How long, Yahweh? Will you forget me forever? How long will you hide your face from me?

Tailo: Kah i tsò-hué tsò ê, ū Tàn ê tsi-tso̍k A-hi-sat-buat ê kiáⁿ A-ho-li-ia̍p, i sī gâu tiau-khik koh ū kî-khiáu ê sai-hū, koh ē īng nâ-sik, tsí-sik, tsu-âng sik ê liāu kah iù-tē lâi siù-hue.
English: With him was Oholiab, the son of Ahisamach, of the tribe of Dan, an engraver, and a skillful workman, and an embroiderer in blue, in purple, in scarlet, and in fine linen.

Tailo: Guán án-ne tsò m̄-sī kóng guán bô kuân thang iau-kiû lín kiòng-ìng, tsí-sī ài beh īng guán ka-kī tsò lín ê bô͘-huān, hō͘ lín thang o̍h guán ê khuán-sit.
English: not because we don't have the right, but to make ourselves an example to you, that you should imitate us.

Tailo: Tshut-tsāi in lah, in sī tsheⁿ-mê-.ê teh kā tsheⁿ-mê-.ê tshuā-lō͘; nā-sī tsheⁿ-mê-.ê kā tsheⁿ-mê-.ê tshuā-lō͘, nn̄g-ê lóng ē pua̍h-lo̍h kheⁿ-kau.
English: Leave them alone. They are blind guides of the blind. If the blind guide the blind, both will fall into a pit.

Tailo: Tabi̍t koh mn̄g Siōngtè, Siōngtè kā i kóng, M̄-thang khì jiok, tio̍h siám tuì piⁿ-á khì, tī sng-tsâi tshiū ê tuì-bīn lâi kā in kong-kik.
English: David inquired again of God; and God said to him, You shall not go up after them: turn away from them, and come on them over against the mulberry trees.

Tailo: I ē hō͘ lāu-pē ê sim ua̍t tńg-lâi ǹg i ê kiáⁿ, kiáⁿ ê sim ua̍t tńg-lâi ǹg i ê lāu-pē, bián-tit Guá lâi tsiù-tsó͘ tsit-ê tē.
English: He will turn the hearts of the fathers to the children, and the hearts of the children to their fathers, lest I come and strike the earth with a curse.

Tailo: Iésu koh kā in kóng, Guá beh lī-khui ā, lín ē tshuē guá, lín mā ē uī-tio̍h ka-kī ê tsuē lâi sí. Guá beh khì ê só͘-tsāi, lín bē-tàng khì.
English: Jesus said therefore again to them, I am going away, and you will seek me, and you will die in your sins. Where I go, you can't come.

Tailo: Tabi̍t siu Abigail tuà-lâi hō͘ i ê mi̍h, tsiū kā i kóng, Lí thang pîng-an tńg-khì lí ê ke, lí khuàⁿ, guá ū thiaⁿ lí ê uē, tsiàu lí ê uē khì tsò.
English: So David received of her hand that which she had brought him: and he said to her, Go up in peace to your house; behold, I have listened to your voice, and have accepted your person.

Tailo: Mô͘se hui-siông siū-khì, tuì Siōngtsú kóng, Kiû Lí m̄-thang kàm-la̍p in só͘ hiàn ê; guá pīng bô khan in tsi̍t tsiah lî-á, mā bô hāi in tsi̍t-ê lâng.
English: Moses was very angry, and said to Yahweh, Don't respect their offering: I have not taken one donkey from them, neither have I hurt one of them.

Tailo: Ioap ê lâng kah Ke-le-thih lâng, Be-le-thi lâng kah tsìng ióng-sū, lóng tshut-khì tuè Abisai, tuì Êlúsalèm tshut-.khì, jiok Biklih ê kiáⁿ Síbah.
English: There went out after him Joab's men, and the Cherethites and the Pelethites, and all the mighty men; and they went out of Jerusalem, to pursue after Sheba the son of Bichri.

Tailo: Gī lâng ê lô-khó͘ tì-sú ū ua̍h-miā; pháiⁿ lâng só͘ thàn ê tì-sú ū tsuē.
English: The labor of the righteous leads to life. The increase of the wicked leads to sin.

Tailo: Lí ê só͘-tsāi bô koh thiaⁿ-tio̍h kiông-pō, lí ê kíng lāi bô koh thiaⁿ-tio̍h pha-hng, huí-bia̍t ê tāi-tsì; lí ē tshing lí ê tshiûⁿ tsò tsín-kiù, tshing lí ê mn̂g tsò o-ló.
English: Violence shall no more be heard in your land, desolation nor destruction within your borders; but you shall call your walls Salvation, and your gates Praise.

Tailo: In tī ta̍k-ê tuâⁿ piⁿ tó tī lâng tsò tsún-tǹg ê saⁿ, koh tī in ê Siōngtè ê tiān lāi lim siū-hua̍t ê lâng ê tsiú.
English: And they lay themselves down beside every altar on clothes taken in pledge; And in the house of their God they drink the wine of those who have been fined.

Tailo: Kíng-uē ìn kóng, Tsiông kàu taⁿ m̄-bat ū lâng kóng-uē tshin-tshiūnn tsit-ê lâng.
English: The officers answered, No man ever spoke like this man!

Tailo: Īng iû buah tuâⁿ ê ji̍t, Isulael tsiah-ê siú-líng, i tio̍h kiânn hiàn-tuâⁿ ê lé só͘ hiàn ê, to̍h-sī gîn-puâⁿ tsa̍p-jī-ê, gîn-uáⁿ tsa̍p-jī-ê, kim-au tsa̍p-jī-ê;
English: This was the dedication of the altar, on the day when it was anointed, by the princes of Israel: twelve silver platters, twelve silver bowls, twelve golden ladles;

Tailo: La̍hban kā i kóng, Guá nā tī lí ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián, tshiáⁿ lí kah guá tuà, in-uī guá tshim tsai Siōngtsú sù guá hok-khì, sī in-uī lí ê iân-kò͘.
English: Laban said to him, If now I have found favor in your eyes, stay here, for I have divined that Yahweh has blessed me for your sake.

Tailo: In tio̍h sîng-jīn in só͘ huān ê tsuē, tsiàu siàu-gia̍h puê i, līng-guā ke gō͘-hūn tsi-it, kui hō͘ i só͘ khik-khui ê lâng.
English: then he shall confess his sin which he has done, and he shall make restitution for his guilt in full, and add to it the fifth part of it, and give it to him in respect of whom he has been guilty.

Tailo: Isulael lâng kiû-kiò Siōngtsú ê sî, Siōngtsú tsiū kā in hing-khí tsi̍t-ê hiàn-sin-tsiá, to̍h-sī Biāniámín lâng Gela̍h ê kiáⁿ Ehut, i sī si̍p-kuàn īng tò tshiú ê. Isulael lâng kau-thok i sàng lé-mi̍h khì hō͘ Mô͘ap ông Egúlóng.
English: But when the children of Israel cried to Yahweh, Yahweh raised them up a savior, Ehud the son of Gera, the Benjamite, a man left-handed. The children of Israel sent tribute by him to Eglon the king of Moab.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē koh lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Isulael lâng tshut-huat, tsat iâⁿ tī Mô͘ap ê pîng-guân, tī Ioltàn hô guā, I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ ê tuì-bīn.
English: The children of Israel traveled, and encamped in the plains of Moab beyond the Jordan at Jericho.

Tailo: Tsa-bó͘ gín-á siàu-liân iáu tī lāu-pē ê ke ê sî, nā tuì Siōngtsú hē guān, īng iok lâi ka-kī iok-sok;
English: Also when a woman vows a vow to Yahweh, and binds herself by a bond, being in her father's house, in her youth,

Tailo: Lâng ê hûn tsiūⁿ-khì tíng-bīn, siù ê hûn tuī-lo̍h tē, siáⁿ lâng tsai sī án-ne, á m̄-sī?
English: Who knows the spirit of man, whether it goes upward, and the spirit of the animal, whether it goes downward to the earth?

Tailo: Siōngtsú khuàⁿ-tio̍h i uat-khì beh khuànn, Siōngtè tsiū tuì tshì-phè lāi kā i kóng, Mô͘se, Mô͘se. I tsiū ìn kóng, Guá tī tsia.
English: When Yahweh saw that he turned aside to see, God called to him out of the midst of the bush, and said, Moses! Moses! He said, Here I am.

Tailo: Guá kám sī tuā hái á-.sī hái-kuài? Lí kìng-jiân siat-hông lâi kài-pī guá?
English: Am I a sea, or a sea monster, That you put a guard over me?

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Sihông m̄ siong-sìn Isulael, m̄ hō͘ in king-kuè i ê kíng-kài, Sihông tsiū tsū-tsi̍p i ê jîn-bîn, tī Ia-hat tsat iâⁿ kah Isulael lâng kau-tsiàn.
English: But Sihon didn't trust Israel to pass through his border; but Sihon gathered all his people together, and encamped in Jahaz, and fought against Israel.

Tailo: Lí ê kài-bīng tsuân-pō͘ lóng sìn-si̍t; in bô-iân bô-kò͘ pik-hāi guá, kiû Lí pang-tsān guá.
English: All of your commandments are faithful. They persecute me wrongfully. Help me!

Tailo: In sī bo̍k-tsiá, in-uī in sī tshī tsing-seⁿ ê lâng, in kā iûⁿ-kûn, gû-kûn kah it-tshè só͘-ū ê lóng tuà-.lâi. '
English: These men are shepherds, for they have been keepers of livestock, and they have brought their flocks, and their herds, and all that they have.'

Tailo: Tshì-á ìn hiah-ê tshiū kóng, ' Lín nā si̍t-tsāi siat-li̍p guá tsò lín ê ông, tsiū tio̍h tī guá ê ìm-ńg ē siám-bih; nā m̄, guān hué tuì tshì-á tshut, sio-bia̍t Le-ba-nòng ê pik-hiuⁿ tshiū. '
English: The bramble said to the trees, If in truth you anoint me king over you, then come and take refuge in my shade; and if not, let fire come out of the bramble, and devour the cedars of Lebanon.

Tailo: （ Té kiat-bué ）, （ Tsù, Ū ê kò͘-kuàn tī 16:8 ê āu-piah hù-ka tsit-ê tshing-tsò Té kiat-bué ê king-bûn ）9 In kā it-tshè ê tsí-sī kán-iàu tuì Piattò͘ tsiu-uî ê lâng kóng. Liáu-āu, Iésu tsiū thong-kuè in, tuì tang kàu sai thuân-sàng hit-ê sîn-sìng, bē huí-huāi ê, ē íng-uán tsín-kiù ê sìn-sit. （ tn̂g kiat-bué ）, （ Tsù, Ū ê kò͘-kuàn tī 16:8 ê āu-piah hù-ka tsit-ê tshing-tsò Tn̂g kiat-bué ê king-bûn ）Tshit ji̍t ê thâu tsi̍t ji̍t thàu-tsá, Iésu koh-ua̍h liáu-āu, tāi-sing tuì Ma̍k-ta-lé ê Mâlíah hián-hiān. Iésu tsîng bat kā i kuáⁿ-tshut tshit-ê kuí.
English: Now when he had risen early on the first day of the week, he appeared first to Mary Magdalene, from whom he had cast out seven demons.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Iôná khí-.lâi, ài tsáu-khì Talsisih, lâi siám-phiah Siōngtsú; lo̍h-khì Io̍p-pe, tú-tio̍h tsi̍t tsiah tsûn beh khì Talsisih. I tsiū hō͘ i tsûn-phiò tsîⁿ, tah hit tsiah tsûn beh kah in khì Talsisih, lâi siám-phiah Siōngtsú.
English: But Jonah rose up to flee to Tarshish from the presence of Yahweh. He went down to Joppa, and found a ship going to Tarshish; so he paid its fare, and went down into it, to go with them to Tarshish from the presence of Yahweh.

Tailo: Tī tsit-ê tē-ki tíng-bīn, lâng īng kim, gîn, pó-tsio̍h, tshâ, tsháu-á-.sī tiū-kó lâi khí-tsō.
English: But if anyone builds on the foundation with gold, silver, costly stones, wood, hay, or stubble;

Tailo: Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè án-ne kóng: Guá tshuā lín ê tsó͘-sian tuì Aigi̍p tē tsò lô͘-lē ê ke tshut-.lâi ê ji̍t kah in li̍p-iok, kóng,
English: Thus says Yahweh, the God of Israel: I made a covenant with your fathers in the day that I brought them forth out of the land of Egypt, out of the house of bondage, saying,

Tailo: In tī Aigi̍p kiânn kan-îm, to̍h-sī tī siàu-liân ê sî kiânn kan-îm. Tī hia in ê ling hō͘ lâng teh, koh tī hia lâng lia̍p i tsāi-sik-lí ê ling-thâu.
English: and they played the prostitute in Egypt; they played the prostitute in their youth; there were their breasts pressed, and there was handled the bosom of their virginity.

Tailo: I īng o͘-àm tsò sì-kho͘-uî ê tiùⁿ-pâng, to̍h-sī tsū-tsi̍p ê tsuí kah khong-tiong ê ba̍t hûn.
English: He made darkness pavilions round about him, Gathering of waters, thick clouds of the skies.

Tailo: I phah-ka-tshiùⁿ tsiū huat-tshut kng; i ê ba̍k-tsiu tshin-tshiūnn tsá-khí sî ê ba̍k-tsiu phuê.
English: His sneezing flashes forth light, His eyes are like the eyelids of the morning.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā ū phuà-siùⁿ á-.sī ū siáⁿ-mi̍h pháiⁿ-iūⁿ ê gû-iûⁿ, lí m̄-thang hiàn tsè hō͘ Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè, in-uī tse sī Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè só͘ thó-ià ê.
English: You shall not sacrifice to Yahweh your God an ox, or a sheep, in which is a blemish, or anything evil; for that is an abomination to Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Siâⁿ lāi ū kian-kò͘ ê tâi, siâⁿ lāi ê kûn-tsiòng, bô-lūn lâm-lí lóng tsáu-khì hia, kuainn mn̂g, tsiūⁿ tâi tíng.
English: But there was a strong tower within the city, and there fled all the men and women, and all they of the city, and shut themselves in, and got them up to the roof of the tower.

Tailo: Lí khì kā Tabi̍t kóng, Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, ' Taⁿ Guá īng sann hāng hō͘ lí, lí kíng tsi̍t hāng, guá thang tuì lí lâi kiâⁿ. '
English: Go and speak to David, Thus says Yahweh, I offer you three things: choose you one of them, that I may do it to you.

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú ah, Lí tuì Lí tsú-bîn ê kî-tó huat-tshut siū-khì ē koh guā kú?
English: Yahweh God of Armies, How long will you be angry against the prayer of your people?

Tailo: Si-óng tshun tshiú, bô lâng kā i an-uì; kóng-tio̍h Iâkop, Siōngtsú í-king tshut bīng-līng, hō͘ sì-kho͘-uî ê lâng tsò i ê tuì-ti̍k; Êlúsalèm tī in tiong-kan, tshin-tshiūnn bô tshing-khì ê mi̍h.
English: Zion spreads forth her hands; there is none to comfort her; Yahweh has commanded concerning Jacob, that those who are round about him should be his adversaries: Jerusalem is among them as an unclean thing.

Tailo: Guá beh khì tó-uī, lín tsai hit tiâu lō͘.
English: Where I go, you know, and you know the way.

Tailo: Kò͘-kaⁿ ê lâng tsiap-tio̍h bīng-līng, tsiū kā in kuainn ji̍p-khì lāi-kaⁿ, siang kha pa̍k tuà tshâ-kê.
English: who, having received such a charge, threw them into the inner prison, and secured their feet in the stocks.

Tailo: In-uī gōng lâng ē kóng gōng uē, sim siūⁿ beh tsò pháiⁿ, kuàn-sì kiânn siat-to̍k ê tāi-tsì, kóng phian-siâ ê uē kong-kik Siōngtsú, hō͘ iau ê lâng bô mi̍h thang tsia̍h, tshuì-ta ê lâng bô tsuí thang lim.
English: For the fool will speak folly, And his heart will work iniquity, To practice profanity, And to utter error against Yahweh, To make empty the soul of the hungry, And to cause the drink of the thirsty to fail.

Tailo: Í-guā iáu ū in ê lô͘-po̍k kah lú-pī, tshit-tshing saⁿ-pah saⁿ-tsa̍p tshit lâng, lâm-lí tshiùⁿ kua ê ū nn̄g pah lâng.
English: besides their male servants and their female servants, of whom there were seven thousand three hundred thirty-seven: and they had two hundred singing men and singing women.

Tailo: Sìng-tiān ê guā-īⁿ m̄-bián niû, in-uī guā-īⁿ í-king kau hō͘ guā-pang lâng, in ē thún-ta̍h sìng-siâⁿ sì-tsa̍p-jī gue̍h-ji̍t.
English: Leave out the court which is outside of the temple, and don't measure it, for it has been given to the nations. They will tread the holy city under foot for forty-two months.

Tailo: Tse sī in-uī in bô tsun-thàn Guá ê uē, to̍h-sī Guá tshe Guá tsiah-ê lô͘-po̍k — tsìng sian-ti kā in kóng ê uē, sī Guá tsá-tsá khí-lâi tshe in; tsóng-.sī, lín bô thiaⁿ. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: because they have not listened to my words, says Yahweh, with which I sent to them my servants the prophets, rising up early and sending them; but you would not hear, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Lín só͘ hō͘ Lēbī lâng siâⁿ guā ê kau-iá, tuì siâⁿ-kha sì-kho͘-uî niû tshut tsi̍t tshing tiú.
English: The suburbs of the cities, which you shall give to the Levites, shall be from the wall of the city and outward one thousand cubits round about.

Tailo: Êlúsalèm lâng, lín tio̍h siū kà-sī. Bián-tit Guá ê sim kah lí so͘-uán, bián-tit Guá hō͘ lí pha-hng, tsiâⁿ-tsò bô lâng tuà ê só͘-tsāi.
English: Be instructed, Jerusalem, lest my soul be alienated from you; lest I make you a desolation, a land not inhabited.

Tailo: Lín nā kan-taⁿ īng sim-sîn kám-siā, hiah-ê huē-tsiòng m̄-tsai lí teh kóng siáⁿ-mi̍h, i ná ē tuì lí ê kám-siā tâng-sim lâi kóng, A-men ?
English: Otherwise if you bless with the spirit, how will he who fills the place of the unlearned say the Amen at your giving of thanks, seeing he doesn't know what you say?

Tailo: Utsiiah koh ū tsiàn-sū tsi̍t tuī, tsiàu su-kì E-i-el kah siú-líng Maaseiah só͘ tiám-sǹg ê, tī ông ê tsi̍t-ê kun-tiúⁿ Hananiah ê tshiú-hā, hun tuī tshut-khì kau-tsiàn.
English: Moreover Uzziah had an army of fighting men, who went out to war by bands, according to the number of their reckoning made by Jeiel the scribe and Maaseiah the officer, under the hand of Hananiah, one of the king's captains.

Tailo: Iô-há-neh ìn kóng, Ū nn̄g niá saⁿ ê lâng, tio̍h pun hō͘ bô saⁿ ê lâng; ū tsia̍h-mi̍h ê lâng, mā tio̍h án-ne tsò.
English: He answered them, He who has two coats, let him give to him who has none. He who has food, let him do likewise.

Tailo: Páulô beh hō͘ in ah ji̍p-khì iâⁿ-pâng ê sî, tuì kun-kuaⁿ kóng, Guá ū tsi̍t kù uē beh kā lí kóng, thang bô? kun-kuaⁿ kóng, Lí bat Hi-la̍h uē oh?
English: As Paul was about to be brought into the barracks, he asked the commanding officer, May I speak to you? He said, Do you know Greek?

Tailo: Esáu tuì Iâkop kóng, Guá tsin ià-siān, kiû lí kā tsit-ê âng-ê thng hō͘ guá tsia̍h. In-uī án-ne, Esáu mā miâ kiò-tsò Etóm （ Tsù, Etóm Ū Âng ê ì-sù. ）.
English: Esau said to Jacob, Please feed me with that same red stew, for I am famished. Therefore his name was called Edom.

Tailo: Mô͘se kā jîn-bîn kóng, Lín tio̍h kì-liām tsit ji̍t, to̍h-sī lín tuì Aigi̍p tē, tuì tsò lô͘-lē ê ke tshut-.lâi, in-uī Siōngtsú īng tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú tshuā lín tuì hia tshut-.lâi. Ū kàⁿ ê piáⁿ lóng m̄-thang tsia̍h.
English: Moses said to the people, Remember this day, in which you came out from Egypt, out of the house of bondage; for by strength of hand Yahweh brought you out from this place. No leavened bread shall be eaten.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Iésu kóng, Tio̍h hō͘ sè-hàn gín-á lâi guá tsia, m̄-thang kā in tsó͘-tòng, in-uī tshin-tshiūnn tsiah-ê gín-á ê lâng tsiah ē-tàng tsiâⁿ-tsò thian-kok ê tsú-bîn.
English: But Jesus said, Allow the little children, and don't forbid them to come to me; for to such belongs the Kingdom of Heaven.

Tailo: Iâkop hiah-ê kiáⁿ uī-tio̍h in sió-muē siū uè lah-sap, tsiū lâi-kàu siū thâi ê lâng hia, tshiúⁿ-kiap in ê siâⁿ.
English: Jacob's sons came on the dead, and plundered the city, because they had defiled their sister.

Tailo: In-uī in tó-huāi ê siann, tē tsiū iô-tāng. In tuā-siaⁿ huah ê siann, thuân kàu Âng-hái.
English: The earth trembles at the noise of their fall; there is a cry, the noise which is heard in the Red Sea.

Tailo: I ê pē-bú án-ne kóng, sī in-uī kiaⁿ Iô-tá-iah lâng, in-uī Iô-tá-iah lâng í-king ū iok-sok hó-sè, nā ū lâng jīn Iésu tsò Ki-tok, tio̍h beh kā i tuì huē-tn̂g kuáⁿ tshut-.khì.
English: His parents said these things because they feared the Jews; for the Jews had already agreed that if any man would confess him as Christ, he would be put out of the synagogue.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê sī O-biat-e-tóm ê kiáⁿ-sun, in kah in ê kiáⁿ in ê hiann-tī lóng sī ióng-sū, ū khuì-la̍t gâu pān tāi-tsì ê, kiōng la̍k-tsa̍p jī lâng, lóng sī O-biat-e-tóm seⁿ ê.
English: All these were of the sons of Obed-Edom: they and their sons and their brothers, able men in strength for the service; sixty-two of Obed-Edom.

Tailo: Li-bé-kah tsiū tuì i ê kiáⁿ Iâkop kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, guá thiaⁿ-tio̍h lín lāu-pē kā lí ê a-hiaⁿ Esáu kóng,
English: Rebekah spoke to Jacob her son, saying, Behold, I heard your father speak to Esau your brother, saying,

Tailo: Alâm ông ê jîn-sîn kā i kóng, Isulael lâng ê Siōngtè sī suaⁿ-thâu ê Siōngtè, só͘-í, in khah iâⁿ lán; tsóng-.sī, lán nā tī pîng-guân kah in kau-tsiàn, tsiū ē khah iâⁿ in.
English: The servants of the king of Syria said to him, Their god is a god of the hills; therefore they were stronger than we: but let us fight against them in the plain, and surely we shall be stronger than they.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, lāu lâng tshuā in kàu i ê tshù, tshī i ê lî-á, in tsiū sé kha lim-tsia̍h.
English: So he brought him into his house, and gave the donkeys fodder; and they washed their feet, and ate and drink.

Tailo: Kià-kha tī guá tshù lāi ê lâng kah guá ê lú-pī, lóng kā guá khuàⁿ-tsò sī guā-lâng; in kā guá khuàⁿ-tsò sī guā-pang lâng.
English: Those who dwell in my house, and my maids, count me for a stranger. I am an alien in their sight.

Tailo: In-uī i kiânn Nebat ê kiáⁿ Ia-lô-ba-am ê lō͘, koh kiâⁿ i hō͘ Isulael lâng só͘ huān ê tsuē, īng hi-ké ê ngó͘-siōng lâi kik Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè siū-khì.
English: For he walked in all the way of Jeroboam the son of Nebat, and in his sins with which he made Israel to sin, to provoke Yahweh, the God of Israel, to anger with their vanities.

Tailo: I só͘ king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê kun-tuī, tsóng-kiōng ū la̍k-bān nn̄g-tshing tshit-pah miâ.
English: His division, and those who were numbered of them, were sixty-two thousand seven hundred.

Tailo: Thiàⁿ-sioh ka-kī sèⁿ-miā ê lâng, ē sòng-sit sèⁿ-miā; tī tsit sè-kan bô tham-luân ka-kī sèⁿ-miā ê lâng it-tīng ē pó-siú sèⁿ-miā lâi tit-tio̍h íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā.
English: He who loves his life will lose it. He who hates his life in this world will keep it to eternal life.

Tailo: Ông kā ông-hō͘ Êsutel kóng, Iôtah lâng tī Su-san siâⁿ thâi-sí tuì-ti̍k gō͘ pah lâng, koh thâi-sí Hamán tsa̍p-ê kiáⁿ. Tī ông kî-tha ê ta̍k síng m̄-tsai piàn-tsò án-tsuáⁿ? Taⁿ lí só͘ tshíng ê sī siáⁿ-mi̍h? Guá beh hō͘ lí; lí só͘ kiû sī siáⁿ-mi̍h? Guá mā beh hō͘ i tsiânn.
English: The king said to Esther the queen, The Jews have slain and destroyed five hundred men in Shushan the palace, and the ten sons of Haman; what then have they done in the rest of the king's provinces! Now what is your petition? and it shall be granted you: or what is your request further? and it shall be done.

Tailo: Tsè-si Lēbī lâng tshing-khì ka-kī mā tshing-khì jîn-bîn, í-ki̍p siâⁿ mn̂g kah siâⁿ tshiûⁿ.
English: The priests and the Levites purified themselves; and they purified the people, and the gates, and the wall.

Tailo: In tī hia tuà kàu He-lo̍t kuè-sin. Tse sī beh ìng-giām Tsú kau-tài sian-ti só͘ kóng ê uē, guá ū tiàu guá ê kiáⁿ tshut Aigi̍p. (tsù, HSA 11:1)
English: and was there until the death of Herod; that it might be fulfilled which was spoken by the Lord through the prophet, saying, Out of Egypt I called my son.

Tailo: In-uī uī-tio̍h ka-kī ê iân-kò͘, koh uī-tio̍h guá ê lô͘-po̍k — Tabi̍t ê iân-kò͘, guá beh pó-hō͘ tsit-ê siâⁿ, lâi kā i tsín-kiù.
English: For I will defend this city to save it, for my own sake, and for my servant David's sake.'

Tailo: In-uī guá siú Siōngtsú ê tō-lō͘, m̄-bat tsò pháiⁿ, lī-khui guá ê Siōngtsú.
English: For I have kept the ways of Yahweh, And have not wickedly departed from my God.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, gia̍h ke-si ê lâng tsiū kā in só͘ lia̍h ê lâng kah só͘ tshiúⁿ ê mi̍h, pàng tī hiah-ê siú-líng kah huē-tsiòng ê bīn-tsîng.
English: So the armed men left the captives and the spoil before the princes and all the assembly.

Tailo: Guá beh kā Guá ê thòng-hūn piàⁿ tī lí ê sin tsiūⁿ, kā Guá tuā siū-khì ê hué pûn tī lí; kā lí kau tī tsân-jím koh gâu thâi lâng-.ê ê tshiú.
English: I will pour out my indignation on you; I will blow on you with the fire of my wrath; and I will deliver you into the hand of brutish men, skillful to destroy.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, ji̍t-tsí teh beh kàu, Guá beh tsám-tn̄g lí ê tshiú-kut kah lí ê pē ê ke ê tshiú-kut, hō͘ lí ê tshù lāi bô tsi̍t-ê lāu lâng.
English: Behold, the days come, that I will cut off your arm, and the arm of your father's house, that there shall not be an old man in your house.

Tailo: Lín liam-khau pun tē tsò sán-gia̍p, tio̍h hiàn tsi̍t hūn hō͘ Siōngtsú lâi tsò sìng, tn̂g nn̄g-bān gō͘-tshing ko-tshioh, khuah tsi̍t bān ko-tshioh. I ê kài ê sì-kho͘-uî lóng sī sìng ê.
English: Moreover, when you shall divide by lot the land for inheritance, you shall offer an offering to Yahweh, a holy portion of the land; the length shall be the length of twenty-five thousand reeds, and the breadth shall be ten thousand: it shall be holy in all the border of it round about.

Tailo: Tse to̍h-sī tī hiah-ê kì-ji̍p tso̍k-phó͘ saⁿ huè í-siōng ê tsa-po͘ ting í-guā, to̍h-sī kiàn-nā ji̍p-lâi Siōngtsú ê tiān ê, tsiàu ta̍k ji̍t ê hūn-gia̍h só͘ ing-kai tit ê, uī-tio̍h in tsiàu pan-lia̍t tsīn i ê tsit lâi ho̍k-sāi.
English: besides those who were reckoned by genealogy of males, from three years old and upward, even everyone who entered into the house of Yahweh, as the duty of every day required, for their service in their offices according to their divisions;

Tailo: Kiàn-nā Sàulô tshe i khì tó-uī, Tabi̍t khì tsò lóng tsin tsing-thong. Sàulô tsiū siat-li̍p i tsò tsiàn-sū ê thâu-lâng, jîn-bîn kah Sàulô ê jîn-sîn lóng khuàⁿ-tsò sī hó.
English: David went out wherever Saul sent him, and behaved himself wisely: and Saul set him over the men of war, and it was good in the sight of all the people, and also in the sight of Saul's servants.

Tailo: Êlúsalèm lâng, khí lí ê siâⁿ tshiûⁿ ê ji̍t-tsí kàu à, hit ji̍t, lí ê tē-kài ē khui-khuah.
English: A day to build your walls In that day, he will extend your boundary.

Tailo: thê-ô͘, tshàu-thâu-ing, lô͘-tsî,
English: and the pelican, and the vulture, and the cormorant,

Tailo: In lāu-pē īng tsin tsē sán-gia̍p hō͘ in, to̍h-sī kim, gîn, pó-puè kah Iôtah tē kian-kò͘ ê siâⁿ hō͘ in; tsóng-.sī, kā kok-uī hō͘ Io-lâm, in-uī i sī tuā-kiáⁿ.
English: Their father gave them great gifts, of silver, and of gold, and of precious things, with fortified cities in Judah: but the kingdom gave he to Jehoram, because he was the firstborn.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h the̍h tām-po̍h-á tsit-ê hiuⁿ, tsing hō͘ i tsin iù, hē tī huē-bō͘ lāi ê huat-kuī tsîng. Guá beh tī hia kah lí siong-huē, lín tio̍h lia̍h i tsò tsì-sìng.
English: and you shall beat some of it very small, and put some of it before the testimony in the tent of meeting, where I will meet with you. It shall be to you most holy.

Tailo: In tuì sian-kiàn kóng, M̄-thang ū sian-kiàn ê ī-siōng ; tuì sian-ti kóng, M̄-thang tuì guán kóng tsìng-ti̍t ê uē, tio̍h tuì guán kóng jiû-nńg ê uē, kóng hi-ké ê tāi-tsì.
English: who tell the seers, Don't see! and to the prophets, Don't prophesy to us right things. Tell us pleasant things. Prophesy deceits.

Tailo: Lí tsit-ê tuā siū-khì thiah-li̍h ka-kī ê saⁿ, tē kám ē uī-tio̍h lí lâi siū khì-sak? Tsio̍h-puâⁿ kám ē suá-khui guân uī?
English: You who tear yourself in your anger, Shall the earth be forsaken for you? Or shall the rock be removed out of its place?

Tailo: Lí tio̍h khiā tī Siōngtsú ê tiān ê mn̂g, tī hia suan-iông tsiah-ê uē, kóng: Huān-nā sio̍k Iôtah ji̍p tsiah-ê mn̂g lâi kìng-pài Siōngtsú ê, tio̍h thiaⁿ Siōngtsú ê uē.
English: Stand in the gate of Yahweh's house, and proclaim there this word, and say, Hear the word of Yahweh, all you of Judah, who enter in at these gates to worship Yahweh.

Tailo: Isulael pàng-sak siān-liông; tuì-ti̍k beh jiok i.
English: Israel has cast off that which is good. The enemy will pursue him.

Tailo: Guá nā phuàⁿ-tuàn lâng, guá ê phuàⁿ-tuàn sī tsìng-khak ê, in-uī guá m̄-sī ka-kī teh sím-phuàⁿ, sī tshe-phài guá lâi ê Thiⁿ-pē kah guá tsò-hué teh sím-phuàⁿ.
English: Even if I do judge, my judgment is true, for I am not alone, but I am with the Father who sent me.

Tailo: In tī tuì-ti̍k ê tiong-kan kiânn I ê sîn-jiah, tī Hâm ê tē kiânn kî-sū.
English: They performed miracles among them, And wonders in the land of Ham.

Tailo: Ji̍t-kî iáu-buē kàu, Tabi̍t khí-lâi kah tuè i ê lâng, tshut-huat khì, thâi-sí nn̄g-pah-ê Huilīsū lâng. Tabi̍t tuà hiah-ê iông-bu̍t ê phuê, in tsiū tsiàu siàu-gia̍h tsuân-pō͘ hiàn hō͘ ông, hō͘ i thang tsò ông ê kiáⁿ-sài. Tsiū án-ne, Sàulô kā tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Mikal hō͘ Tabi̍t tsò bó͘.
English: and David arose and went, he and his men, and killed of the Philistines two hundred men; and David brought their foreskins, and they gave them in full number to the king, that he might be the king's son-in-law. Saul gave him Michal his daughter as wife.

Tailo: Iésu tsiū ìn kóng, Lín tio̍h khì, kā lín só͘ khuàⁿ-.tio̍h kah só͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê pò Iô-há-neh tsai, to̍h-sī tsheⁿ-mê-.ê khuànn-.kìnn, pái-kha-.ê kiâⁿ-lō͘, thái-ko-.ê tshing-.khì, tshàu-hīⁿ-lâng-.ê thiann-.kìnn, sí-lâng koh-ua̍h, sàn-tshiah lâng ē-tàng thiaⁿ-tio̍h hok-im.
English: Jesus answered them, Go and tell John the things which you have seen and heard: that the blind receive their sight, the lame walk, the lepers are cleansed, the deaf hear, the dead are raised up, and the poor have good news preached to them.

Tailo: Asah ông pián i ê A-má — Mákah thài-hō͘ ê uī, in-uī i uī-tio̍h A-si-lah bat tsng khó-ò͘ⁿ ê siōng. Asah tshò i ê siōng, kā i tuî kah tshuì-tshuì, tī Kit-lông khe piⁿ kā i sio-tiāu.
English: Also Maacah, the mother of Asa the king, he removed from being queen, because she had made an abominable image for an Asherah; and Asa cut down her image, and made dust of it, and burnt it at the brook Kidron.
