Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú ē pó-hō͘ in; in ē thun-bia̍t tuì-ti̍k, thún-ta̍h só͘ hiat lâi ê tsio̍h-thâu. In ē lim lâi huah, tshin-tshiūnn teh lim tsiú; in ē tshin-tshiūⁿ té-muá ê uánn, tshin-tshiūnn tuâⁿ tíng hiah-ê kak.
English: Yahweh of Armies will defend them; And they will destroy and overcome with sling stones; And they will drink, and roar as through wine; And they will be filled like bowls, Like the corners of the altar.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, in tī huān-lān tiong tshuē Lí; Lí ê kíng-kài lîm-kàu in sin tsiūⁿ, in tsiū tsuan-sim tuì Lí kî-tó.
English: Yahweh, in trouble they have visited you. They poured out a prayer when your chastening was on them.

Tailo: Lí ê tuā siū-khì pau-uî guá; Lí īng kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ kā guá huí-bia̍t.
English: Your fierce wrath has gone over me. Your terrors have cut me off.

Tailo: Eliiah tsiū lī-khui hia khì, tú-tio̍h Siahuat ê kiáⁿ Elísiah, i teh lê-tshân; tī i ê thâu-tsîng ū tsa̍p-jī tuì gû, i ka-kī teh kuáⁿ tē-tsa̍p-jī tuì. Eliiah king-kuè i hia, kā ka-kī ê saⁿ phua̍h tī i ê sin tsiūⁿ.
English: So he departed there, and found Elisha the son of Shaphat, who was plowing, with twelve yoke of oxen before him, and he with the twelfth: and Elijah passed over to him, and cast his mantle on him.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tio̍h īng lé-mi̍h kā Mo͘-le-siat-gat sàng-hîng. Ak-tsip tsiah-ê ke ē īng kuí-kè lâi khuán-thāi Isulael tsiah-ê ông.
English: Therefore you will give a parting gift to Moresheth Gath. The houses of Achzib will be a deceitful thing to the kings of Israel.

Tailo: I ê pē kah i ê bó tio̍h kā i lia̍h khí-.lâi, kā i thua tshut-.khì, tshuā kàu pún-siâⁿ ê tiúⁿ-ló hia, to̍h-sī i pún só͘-tsāi ê siâⁿ mn̂g,
English: then shall his father and his mother lay hold on him, and bring him out to the elders of his city, and to the gate of his place;

Tailo: Kim, gîn, tâng, thih, tsē kàu sǹg bē-liáu. Lí tio̍h khí-lâi tsò, guān Siōngtsú kah lí tông-tsāi.
English: of the gold, the silver, and the brass, and the iron, there is no number. Arise and be doing, and Yahweh be with you.

Tailo: Guá it-tīng beh kā lí sù-hok, beh ke-thinn kiáⁿ-sun hō͘ lí. (tsù, CSK 22:17)
English: saying, Most surely I will bless you, and I will surely multiply you.

Tailo: M̄-sī tī thinn-tíng, tì-sú lí kóng, ' Siáⁿ lâng uī guán tsiūⁿ thiⁿ, tuà-lâi guán tsia, hō͘ guán thiaⁿ lâi tsiàu án-ne khì kiâⁿ? '
English: It is not in heaven, that you should say, Who shall go up for us to heaven, and bring it to us, and make us to hear it, that we may do it?

Tailo: Tō í-king tī sè-kan, sè-kan thong-kuè tō lâi tshòng-tsō, m̄-koh, sè-kan m̄-bat tsit-ê tō.
English: He was in the world, and the world was made through him, and the world didn't recognize him.

Tailo: Lín put-sî to ū sàn-tshiah lâng kah lín tsò-hué, m̄-koh, guá bô tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kah lín tī-.leh.
English: For you always have the poor with you; but you don't always have me.

Tailo: Án-ne, Só͘lômóng ông tsò uân Siōngtsú ê tiān it-tshè ê kang. Só͘lômóng kā i ê lāu-pē Tabi̍t só͘ hiàn ê mi̍h tuà ji̍p-.khì, kā gîn, kim kah khì-kū, hē tī Siōngtsú ê tiān ê khò͘-pâng.
English: Thus all the work that king Solomon worked in the house of Yahweh was finished. Solomon brought in the things which David his father had dedicated, even the silver, and the gold, and the vessels, and put them in the treasuries of the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá koh kàng tsí, lín tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ kiânn tī Iôtah ê tiúⁿ-ló, kā in pang-tsān lâi khí hit king Siōngtè ê tiān, to̍h-sī tio̍h tuì hô guā ê hiòng-suè tiong-kan thiu-tshut ông ê gîn hāng, kín hō͘ hiah-ê lâng tsò king-huì, bián-tit tam-gō͘.
English: Moreover I make a decree what you shall do to these elders of the Jews for the building of this house of God: that of the king's goods, even of the tribute beyond the River, expenses be given with all diligence to these men, that they be not hindered.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tshiū tuì bû-hua-kó tshiū kóng, ' Lí lâi, lâi tsò guán ê ông. '
English: The trees said to the fig tree, Come you, and reign over us.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí m̄-thang uī-tio̍h tsiah-ê jîn-bîn kî-tó, m̄-thang uī-tio̍h in tshut siaⁿ kî-kiû, mā m̄-thang thè in tuì Guá kiû, in-uī Guá bô beh thiaⁿ lí ê uē.
English: Therefore don't you pray for this people, neither lift up a cry nor prayer for them, neither make intercession to me; for I will not hear you.

Tailo: Tuè-āu koh ū tshit tsiah gû-bó khí-.lâi, nńg-tsiáⁿ, tsin khiap-sì, koh tsin sán. Aigi̍p tsuân tē, guá m̄-bat khuàⁿ-kuè tsiah bái ê.
English: and behold, seven other cattle came up after them, poor and very ugly and thin, such as I never saw in all the land of Egypt for ugliness.

Tailo: Baal tuì Palân kóng, Lí lóng m̄-thang kā in tsiù-tsó͘, mā m̄-thang kā in tsiok-hok.
English: Balak said to Balaam, Neither curse them at all, nor bless them at all.

Tailo: Guán tsa̍p-jī tsi-tso̍k ê tông-pau mê-ji̍t jia̍t-sim kìng-pài, mā sī teh kî-thāi ē-tàng ta̍t-sîng tsit-ê ǹg-bāng. Ông, guá uī-tio̍h tsit-ê ǹg-bāng, tsiah hō͘ Iô-tá-iah lâng khòng-kò.
English: which our twelve tribes, earnestly serving night and day, hope to attain. Concerning this hope I am accused by the Jews, King Agrippa!

Tailo: I ē khui hue bō͘-sīng lâi huann-hí, ē ū huann-hí kah tshiùⁿ kua. Le-ba-nòng ê îng-kng, Kal-mel kah Sia-lông ê suí ē kui i. In ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h Siōngtsú ê îng-kng, lán ê Siōngtè ê bí-biāu.
English: It will blossom abundantly, And rejoice even with joy and singing. Lebanon's glory Lebanon will be given to it, The excellence of Carmel and Sharon. They will see Yahweh's glory, The excellence of our God.

Tailo: Gī lâng tī pháiⁿ lâng ê bīn-tsîng thè-niū, tú tshin-tshiūnn ta̍h lô khì ê tsuí-tsuâⁿ uè lah-sap ê tséⁿ.
English: Like a muddied spring, and a polluted well, So is a righteous man who gives way before the wicked.

Tailo: Tng tsit-ê ē hiú-nuā ê piàn-tsò bē hiú-nuā-ê, ē sí ê piàn-tsò bē sí ê sî, king-tián só͘ kì-tsài ê Sí-bông ē hō͘ tik-sìng thun-tsia̍h lo̍h-khì (tsù, ISI 25:8) tsit kù tsiū ē ìng-giām.
English: But when this corruptible will have put on incorruption, and this mortal will have put on immortality, then what is written will happen: Death is swallowed up in victory.

Tailo: Gī lâng tsin tshing-tshó pháiⁿ lâng ê ke, tsai-iáⁿ pháiⁿ lâng ē tshia-tó tì-kàu bia̍t-bô.
English: The Righteous One considers the house of the wicked, And brings the wicked to ruin.

Tailo: Iâkop hiah-ê kiáⁿ, in-uī Sīkhiàm uè lah-sap in ê sió-muē Tí-nah, tsiū īng kan-tsà ê uē lâi ìn Sīkhiàm kah i ê lāu-pē Hamool. In tuì in kóng,
English: The sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father with deceit, and spoke, because he had defiled Dinah their sister,

Tailo: I tsai in ê kiong-tiān, koh hō͘ in ê siâⁿ piàn-tsò pha-hng, in-uī i hm̄-hm̄ háu ê siann, tsuân tē kah kî-tiong só͘-ū ê tsiū lóng hong-huì.
English: He knew their palaces, and laid waste their cities; and the land was desolate, and the fullness of it, because of the noise of his roaring.

Tailo: Tio̍h kā hit-ê tsiù-tsó͘ ê lâng tshuā kàu iâⁿ guā, hō͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâng tī i ê thâu-khak tíng huāⁿ-tshiú; tsuân huē-tsiòng tio̍h īng tsio̍h-thâu kā i tìm-sí.
English: Bring out of the camp him who cursed; and let all who heard him lay their hands on his head, and let all the congregation stone him.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng thiaⁿ-.tio̍h tsiū kóng, Tsit-ê lâng tsí-put-kò sī khò kuí-ông Be̍h-tse-bul teh kuáⁿ kuí.
English: But when the Pharisees heard it, they said, This man does not cast out demons, except by Beelzebul, the prince of the demons.

Tailo: Guá kiò guá ê lô͘-po̍k kiò bē ìn, guá tio̍h tshin-tshuì kā i kiû.
English: I call to my servant, and he gives me no answer; I beg him with my mouth.

Tailo: Lí sǹg siáⁿ-mi̍h, ná ē teh phue-phuàⁿ pa̍t lâng ê tshe-īng? In khiā tsāi á-.sī pua̍h-tó, in ê tsú-lâng ē kā in kuan-sim. In ē khiā tsāi, in-uī Tsú ē kā in pang-tsān.
English: Who are you who judge another's servant? To his own lord he stands or falls. Yes, he will be made to stand, for God has power to make him stand.

Tailo: Lí hō͘ guán ji̍p lô-bāng, kā tāng-tàⁿ hē tī guán ê sin tsiūⁿ.
English: You brought us into prison. You laid a burden on our backs.

Tailo: in-uī Siōngtsú — guán ê Siōngtè bat tshuā guán kah guán ê tsó͘-sian tuì Aigi̍p tē tsò lô͘-lē ê ke tshut-.lâi, tī guán ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng kiânn hiah-ê tuā ê sîn-jiah, tī guán só͘ kiâⁿ it-tshè ê lō͘, só͘ king-kuè ê ta̍k kok, lóng ū kā guán pó-hō͘.
English: for Yahweh our God, he it is who brought us and our fathers up out of the land of Egypt, from the house of bondage, and who did those great signs in our sight, and preserved us in all the way in which we went, and among all the peoples through the midst of whom we passed;

Tailo: Guá tsiū mn̄g kah guá kóng-uē ê sù-tsiá kóng, Tsiah-ê sī siáⁿ-mi̍h? I ìn guá kóng, Tsiah-ê to̍h-sī phah-suàⁿ Iôtah, Isulael kah Êlúsalèm ê tsiah-ê kak.
English: I asked the angel who talked with me, What are these? He answered me, These are the horns which have scattered Judah, Israel, and Jerusalem.

Tailo: Isulael ê tsìng kiáⁿ tsiū án-ne tshut-huat. Iôséhuh tsiàu Huâ-láu ê bīng-līng hō͘ in tshia kah lō͘ tiong su-iàu ê tsia̍h-mi̍h,
English: The sons of Israel did so. Joseph gave them wagons, according to the commandment of Pharaoh, and gave them provision for the way.

Tailo: In tī Iôtah kà-sī lâng, ū tuà Siōngtsú lu̍t-huat ê tsheh, piàn kiâⁿ Iôtah ta̍k-ê siâⁿ, kà-sī hiah-ê jîn-bîn.
English: They taught in Judah, having the book of the law of Yahweh with them; and they went about throughout all the cities of Judah, and taught among the people.

Tailo: Ū hīⁿ-khang thang thiaⁿ ê lâng tio̍h thiaⁿ. （ Tsù, guân pán-pún bô tsit tsat, ū ê tshau-pún ke tsit tsat ）
English: If anyone has ears to hear, let him hear!

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k lán tio̍h siá phue kā in huan-hù, m̄-thang tsia̍h pài ngó͘-siōng bô tshing-khì ê mi̍h, m̄-thang îm-luān, m̄-thang tsia̍h ni̍h-sí ê mi̍h kah hueh.
English: but that we write to them that they abstain from the pollution of idols, from sexual immorality, from what is strangled, and from blood.

Tailo: Mal-tha kóng tsiah-ê uē liáu-āu tsiū tńg-.khì, kiò i ê sió-muē Mâlíah lâi, su-hā kā i kóng, Lāu-su lâi ā, I teh kiò lí.
English: When she had said this, she went away, and called Mary, her sister, secretly, saying, The Teacher is here, and is calling you.

Tailo: In-uī tī hia siat-li̍p sím-phuàⁿ ê pó-tsō, to̍h-sī Tabi̍t ke ê pó-tsō.
English: For there are set thrones for judgment, The thrones of David's house.

Tailo: Lí í-king thó-ià kah Lí ê lô͘-po̍k só͘ li̍p ê iok, kā i ê bián-liû tsau-that tī tē-.ni̍h.
English: You have renounced the covenant of your servant. You have defiled his crown in the dust.

Tailo: Guá beh siat-li̍p tsi̍t-ê bo̍k-tsiá lâi tsiàu-kò͘ in, i ē kā in iúⁿ-tshī, to̍h-sī Guá ê lô͘-po̍k — Tabi̍t. I ē kā in iúⁿ-tshī, tsò in ê bo̍k-tsiá.
English: I will set up one shepherd over them, and he shall feed them, even my servant David; he shall feed them, and he shall be their shepherd.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê tô-tsáu ê lâng, lâi kā Hi-bú-lâi lâng Abúlâm kóng; hit sî, Abúlâm tuà tī Amô͘lī lâng Mamlē ê siōng tshiū hit só͘-tsāi, Mamlē, E-si-kol kah Anel lóng sī hiann-tī, ū kah Abúlâm liân-bîng.
English: One who had escaped came and told Abram, the Hebrew. Now he lived by the oaks of Mamre, the Amorite, brother of Eshcol, and brother of Aner; and these were allies of Abram.

Tailo: Omlī kî-tha só͘ kiâⁿ ê tāi-tsì kah i só͘ hián-tshut ê lîng-li̍k, kám bô kì tī Isulael tsiah-ê ông ê kì-lio̍k?
English: Now the rest of the acts of Omri which he did, and his might that he shown, aren't they written in the book of the chronicles of the kings of Israel?

Tailo: Ai-ah, n̂g-kim thè-kng! Sûn-kim piàn-sik! Sìng-só͘ ê tsio̍h hông hiat tī ta̍k tiâu ke-lō͘ kháu.
English: How is the gold become dim! how is the most pure gold changed! The stones of the sanctuary are poured out at the head of every street.

Tailo: Tsit tè tsio̍h tuì lín tsiah-ê sìn ê lâng lâi kóng sī tsin pó-kuì, m̄-koh, tuì hiah-ê m̄-sìn ê lâng sī, khí-tsù sai-hū só͘ khì-sak ê tsio̍h, í-king tsiâⁿ-tsò tshù-kak-thâu siōng tiōng-iàu ê tsio̍h. （ Tsù, SPh 118:22）
English: For you therefore who believe is the honor, but for such as are disobedient, The stone which the builders rejected, Has become the chief cornerstone,

Tailo: M̄-koh, hū-jîn-lâng nā an-hūn siú-kí, tshî-siú sìn-gióng, ū thiàⁿ-sim koh sìng-kiat, tsiū ē in-uī seⁿ kiáⁿ lâi tit-tio̍h kiù.
English: but she will be saved through her childbearing, if they continue in faith, love, and sanctification with sobriety.

Tailo: Lí tshiong-muá pháiⁿ lâng ê gí-gī, gí-gī kah phuàⁿ-tuàn tsiū ē lia̍h lí.
English: But you are full of the judgment of the wicked. Judgment and justice take hold of you.

Tailo: In khì thâi lâng ê sî, tshun guá tī hia; guá tsiū phak tī thô͘-kha, tuā-siaⁿ huah, Hāiⁿ ah, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú ah, Lí kā tuā siū-khì piànn tī Êlúsalèm, kám sī beh kā Isulael lâng tsuân-pō͘ bia̍t-bông?
English: It happened, while they were smiting, and I was left, that I fell on my face, and cried, and said, Ah Lord Yahweh! will you destroy all the residue of Israel in your pouring out of your wrath on Jerusalem?

Tailo: Taⁿ khuànn lín só͘ kíng só͘ kiû ê ông tī tsia, lí khuàⁿ, Siōngtsú í-king siat-li̍p ông lâi kuán lín.
English: Now therefore see the king whom you have chosen, and whom you have asked for: and behold, Yahweh has set a king over you.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, í-king ū hué tuì thiⁿ lo̍h-lâi sio sí í-tsîng nn̄g-ê pâi-tiúⁿ kah in ta̍k-ê gō͘-tsa̍p lâng; taⁿ kiû lí khuàⁿ guá ê sèⁿ-miā tsò pó-puè!
English: Behold, fire came down from the sky, and consumed the two former captains of fifty with their fifties; but now let my life be precious in your sight.

Tailo: Lín tó tī iûⁿ-tiâu lāi ê sî, tshin-tshiūnn hún-tsiáu ê si̍t siuⁿ pe̍h-gîn, i ê mn̂g siuⁿ n̂g-kim.
English: While you sleep among the campfires, The wings of a dove sheathed with silver, Her feathers with shining gold.

Tailo: Nā lī-khui, tsiū tio̍h siú to̍k-sin, nā bô, tio̍h koh kah in ang hô-hó; tsa-po͘ lâng mā m̄-thang pàng-sak in bó͘.
English: (but if she departs, let her remain unmarried, or else be reconciled to her husband), and that the husband not leave his wife.

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, lí ē hō͘ lâng kiò-tsò tsì-kuân Siōngtè ê sian-ti. in-uī lí beh tsò Tsú ê sian-hong lâi tsún-pī I ê lō͘,
English: And you, child, will be called a prophet of the Most High, For you will go before the face of the Lord to make ready his ways,

Tailo: Iésu kā i kóng, Lí tńg-.khì, lí ê sìn-sim í-king hō͘ lí tit-tio̍h i hó. Tsheⁿ-mê ê suî-sî koh ē khuànn-kìnn, tsiū tuè Iésu khì.
English: Jesus said to him, Go your way. Your faith has made you well. Immediately he received his sight, and followed Jesus in the way.

Tailo: Kî-tiong tsi̍t-ê miâ kiò-tsò A-ga-bó͘ ê lâng khiā khí-.lâi, khò Sìng Sîn lâi ī-giân kóng, phó͘-thinn-ē teh beh ū tuā ki-hng. Tng Ku-láu-tio thóng-tī ê nî-kan, kó-jiân huat-sing tsit-ê tāi-tsì.
English: One of them named Agabus stood up, and indicated by the Spirit that there should be a great famine all over the world, which also happened in the days of Claudius.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì lóng í-king thiaⁿ-liáu à; kiat-bué to̍h-sī tio̍h kìng-uì Siōngtè, kín-sīn tsun-siú I ê kài-bīng. Tse to̍h-sī lâng tsê-pī ê pún-hūn.
English: This is the end of the matter. All has been heard. Fear God, and keep his commandments; for this is the whole duty of man.

Tailo: Ông tsiū tshut līng, lâng tsiū kā hiah-ê kò Taniel ê lâng, liân in ê bó͘-kiáⁿ lóng tshuā-.lâi, kā in hiat lo̍h-khì sai hia̍t. In iáu-buē kàu hia̍t té, sai tsiū thiàu khí-lâi kā in, kā tshuì in ê kut-thâu.
English: The king commanded, and they brought those men who had accused Daniel, and they cast them into the den of lions, them, their children, and their wives; and the lions had the mastery of them, and broke all their bones in pieces, before they came to the bottom of the den.

Tailo: Koh tio̍h tshú hit tsiah iûⁿ ê iû kah i ê puî ê bué, í-ki̍p khàm ngó͘-tsōng ê iû kah kuaⁿ tíng ê bāng-se, nn̄g lia̍p io-tsí kah io-tsí ê iû, í-ki̍p tsiànn pîng ê thuí. ( Tse sī sîng-tsiap sìng-tsit ê lé-gî só͘ hiàn ê iûⁿ ).
English: Also you shall take some of the ram's fat, the fat tail, the fat that covers the innards, the cover of the liver, the two kidneys, the fat that is on them, and the right thigh (for it is a ram of consecration),

Tailo: Kì-jiân ū hiah tsē kiàn-tsìng-jîn tshin-tshiūnn hûn kā lán pau-uî-.leh, lán tio̍h pâi-tû it-tshè ê tsó͘-gāi kah it-ti̍t kā lán tîⁿ-puàⁿ ê tsuē, kian-jím pháu-tsáu lán thâu-tsîng ê lō͘-thîng.
English: Therefore let us also, seeing we are surrounded by so great a cloud of witnesses, lay aside every weight and the sin which so easily entangles us, and let us run with patience the race that is set before us,

Tailo: Kám bô tit-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h? Kám bô pun-tio̍h só͘ tshiúⁿ ê mi̍h? Ta̍k lâng kám bô pun-tio̍h tsi̍t nn̄g-ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á? Sisela̍h tsiū pun-tio̍h só͘ tshiúⁿ tshái-sik ê saⁿ, só͘ tshiúⁿ siù-hue tshái-sik ê saⁿ, nn̄g bīn lóng sī tshái-sik siù-hue ê, thang khuà tī ām-kún, tsò só͘ tshiúⁿ ê mi̍h.
English: Have they not found, have they not divided the spoil? A lady, two ladies to every man; To Sisera a spoil of dyed garments, A spoil of dyed garments embroidered, Of dyed garments embroidered on both sides, on the necks of the spoil?

Tailo: Kū ê tiâu-lē in-uī bô la̍t koh bô lō͘-īng, suah siū huì-tû.
English: For there is an annulling of a foregoing commandment because of its weakness and uselessness

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, tī suaⁿ-kok hit pîng kah tī Ioltàn hô hit pîng ê Isulael lâng, khuàⁿ-tio̍h Isulael lâng í-king tô-tsáu, Sàulô kah i hiah-ê kiáⁿ mā lóng sí, tsiū khì-sak hiah-ê siâⁿ tô-tsáu. Huilīsū lâng suà lâi tiàm hia tuà.
English: When the men of Israel who were on the other side of the valley, and those who were beyond the Jordan, saw that the men of Israel fled, and that Saul and his sons were dead, they forsook the cities, and fled; and the Philistines came and lived in them.

Tailo: só͘-í, siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí tì-huī kah tshong-bîng, Guá mā ē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí tsâi-bu̍t, hó-gia̍h kah tsun-kuì. Tī lí í-tsîng ê lia̍t ông lóng bô ū án-ne, tī lí í-āu mā bē koh ū án-ne.
English: wisdom and knowledge is granted to you; and I will give you riches, and wealth, and honor, such as none of the kings have had who have been before you; neither shall there any after you have the like.

Tailo: Satán nā ka-kī khí hun-tsing, i ê kok ná khiā ē tiâu? Lín kóng guá khò Be̍h-tse-bul kuáⁿ kuí,
English: If Satan also is divided against himself, how will his kingdom stand? For you say that I cast out demons by Beelzebul.

Tailo: Siú-líng koh tuì in kóng, Tio̍h iông-ín in ua̍h lo̍h-.khì. In tsiū án-ne kā huē-tsiòng tsò phuà tshâ kah tshiūⁿ tsuí ê kang-lâng, tsiàu siú-líng só͘ kā in kóng ê uē.
English: The princes said to them, Let them live: so they became wood cutters and drawers of water to all the congregation, as the princes had spoken to them.

Tailo: Lâng ê tsîⁿ-tsâi ē-tàng kā i sio̍k-huê ua̍h-miā; m̄-koh, sàn-tshiah lâng m̄ kiaⁿ lâng ê tuā-siaⁿ khióng-hat.
English: The ransom of a man's life is his riches, But the poor hear no threats.

Tailo: Mā guān lí ê ke tuì Siōngtsú tsiá-tio̍h tsit-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ só͘ beh siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí ê kiáⁿ-sun, tsiâⁿ-tsò tshin-tshiūnn Thamal kā Iôtah só͘ seⁿ ê Hua-lè-suh ê ke.
English: and let your house be like the house of Perez, whom Tamar bore to Judah, of the seed which Yahweh shall give you of this young woman.

Tailo: Saⁿ-tsa̍p-ê thâu-lâng tiong-kan ū saⁿ lâng lo̍h-khì tsio̍h-puâⁿ hia, ji̍p-khì A-tu-lâm ê tōng kìnn Tabi̍t; Huilīsū ê kun-tuī tsat iâⁿ tī Le-hua-im ê suaⁿ-kok.
English: Three of the thirty chief men went down to the rock to David, into the cave of Adullam; and the army of the Philistines were encamped in the valley of Rephaim.

Tailo: mā sī kah hiah-ê kin-á-ji̍t kah lán tâng khiā tī Siōngtsú — lán ê Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng ê, í-ki̍p kin-á-ji̍t bô kah lán tông-tsāi ê lâng li̍p ê.
English: but with him who stands here with us this day before Yahweh our God, and also with him who is not here with us this day

Tailo: Tse sī tsiah-ê siú-bōng ê lâng só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê bīng-līng, tsiah-ê sìng ê só͘ tshut ê bīng-līng, hō͘ tsiòng-sing tsai, tsì-kuân-.ê tsiáng-kuán lâng ê kok, mā tsiàu ka-kī ê ì-sù kā kok siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lâng, mā īng siōng sè ê lâng lâi siat-li̍p tsò tsú. '
English: The sentence is by the decree of the watchers, and the demand by the word of the holy ones; to the intent that the living may know that the Most High rules in the kingdom of men, and gives it to whoever he will, and sets up over it the lowest of men.

Tailo: Tī i iáu-buē tsiūⁿ-khì suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ beh tsia̍h-toh ê tsìn-tsîng, lín tsi̍t ē ji̍p siâⁿ tsiū ē tú-tio̍h i; in-uī i nā iáu-buē kàu, jîn-bîn bô tāi-sing tsia̍h, it-tīng thìng-hāu i lâi sing tsiok-hok tsè-mi̍h, jiân-āu só͘ tshiánn ê lâng-kheh tsiah tsia̍h. Taⁿ lín kín khì, tsit sî ē tú-tio̍h i.
English: as soon as you are come into the city, you shall immediately find him, before he goes up to the high place to eat; for the people will not eat until he come, because he does bless the sacrifice; and afterwards they eat who are invited. Now therefore get you up; for at this time you shall find him.

Tailo: Bô liông-sim, bô siú iok, bô tshin-tsîng, bô liân-bín.
English: without understanding, covenant breakers, without natural affection, unforgiving, unmerciful;

Tailo: Ū hué tuì Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng tshut-.lâi, sio tuâⁿ tíng ê sio-tsè kah iû; tsìng lâng khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū tshut tuā huann-hí ê siann, phak tī tē-.ni̍h.
English: There came forth fire from before Yahweh, and consumed the burnt offering and the fat upon the altar: and when all the people saw it, they shouted, and fell on their faces.

Tailo: Tē m̄-thang íng-uán bē-tn̄g, in-uī tē sī Guá ê; lín tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng sī tshut-guā lâng, sī kià-kha ê.
English: The land shall not be sold in perpetuity, for the land is mine; for you are strangers and live as foreigners with me.

Tailo: Siū thâi ê ē tó tī Kal-tí-ah lâng ê tē, siū tshì ê ē tó tī ke-lō͘.
English: They shall fall down slain in the land of the Chaldeans, and thrust through in her streets.

Tailo: Akisi kóng, Lín kin-á-ji̍t khì tshim-ji̍p tsing-ho̍k siáⁿ-mi̍h tē-hng? Tabi̍t kóng, Phah Iôtah ê lâm-hong, E-la-mel lâng ê lâm-hong, Kenî lâng ê lâm-hong.
English: Achish said, Against whom have you made a raid today? David said, Against the South of Judah, and against the South of the Jerahmeelites, and against the South of the Kenites.

Tailo: Tsí-sī lí tì-huī ê ò-pì, tse tì-huī ū ta̍k tsióng ê kong-hāu; lí tio̍h tsai Siōngtè bô lóng ē kì-tit lí ê tsuē-kò.
English: That he would show you the secrets of wisdom! For true wisdom has two sides. Know therefore that God exacts of you less than your iniquity deserves.

Tailo: Tsit-ê mi̍h, Isulael lâng kā i kiò-tsò má-ná, khuán-sit tshin-tshiūnn iân-sui-jîn, sik-tì sī pe̍h ê, tsu-bī tshin-tshiūnn tsham bi̍t ê piáⁿ.
English: The house of Israel called the name of it Manna, and it was like coriander seed, white; and its taste was like wafers with honey.

Tailo: Tuì hit sî khí, ông só͘-ū ê tì-huī lâng lóng ji̍p-.lâi; tsóng-.sī, in bē-hiáu tha̍k hit-ê bûn-jī, mā bē-hiáu kái-bîng hō͘ ông tsai.
English: Then came in all the king's wise men; but they could not read the writing, nor make known to the king the interpretation.

Tailo: kā in kóng, Tsit-ê jîn-bîn ū tuì guá kóng, ' Lí ê lāu-pē hē tī guán ê ka-tann, kiû lí kā guán kiám khah khin. ' Taⁿ lín ū siáⁿ-mi̍h kè-tshik hō͘ lán thang kā in huê-hok?
English: He said to them, What counsel do you give, that we may return answer to this people, who have spoken to me, saying, Make the yoke that your father did put on us lighter?

Tailo: I phò-huāi káu-kuài ê lâng ê kè-bô͘, tì-kàu in tshiú só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì bē sîng-kong.
English: He frustrates the devices of the crafty, So that their hands can't perform their enterprise.

Tailo: Koh tio̍h īng pa̍t tè tsio̍h tāi-thè hiah-ê tsio̍h, koh īng hue-thô͘ buah hit king tshù.
English: They shall take other stones, and put them in the place of those stones; and he shall take other mortar, and shall plaster the house.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā Mô͘se kóng, Tsiah-ê siú-líng hiàn lé-mi̍h, ta̍k-ê tio̍h tī i ê ji̍t lâi hiàn, lâi kiâⁿ hiàn-tuâⁿ ê lé.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, They shall offer their offering, each prince on his day, for the dedication of the altar.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, hit-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ lí m̄-thang án-tsuáⁿ kā i pān, in-uī hit-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ bô ing-kai sí ê tāi-tsì, tsit-ê tāi-tsì sī tshin-tshiūnn lâng khì kong-kik i ê tshù-piⁿ, kā i thâi-sí sio-siâng.
English: but to the lady you shall do nothing; there is in the lady no sin worthy of death: for as when a man rises against his neighbor, and kills him, even so is this matter;

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Siōngtsú huat-tshut bīng-līng, kā tuā king tshù phah hō͘ i tshuì-tshuì, phah sè-king tshù hō͘ i li̍h-li̍h-.khui.
English: For, behold, Yahweh commands, and the great house will be smashed to pieces, And the little house into bits.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h sé sing-khu, buah iû, uāⁿ saⁿ, lo̍h-khì kàu tiūⁿ-tiâⁿ, tsóng-.sī, m̄-thang hō͘ hit-ê lâng jīn-tio̍h lí. Τhìng-hāu i lim-tsia̍h liáu-āu,
English: Wash yourself therefore, and anoint you, and put your clothing on you, and get you down to the threshing floor, but don't make yourself known to the man, until he shall have done eating and drinking.

Tailo: Guá tio̍h jím-siū Siōngtsú ê siū-khì, in-uī guá tik-tsuē I, thìng-hāu I piān-hō͘ guá ê àn, kā guá phuàⁿ-tuàn. I ē tshuā guá tshut-lâi-kàu tī kng-bîng, guá mā ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h I ê kong-gī.
English: I will bear the indignation of Yahweh, Because I have sinned against him, Until he pleads my case, and executes judgment for me. He will bring me forth to the light. I will see his righteousness.

Tailo: Sian-ti tsiū kā Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k ê sin-si hē tī lî-á ê tíng-bīn tsài tńg-.lâi, lâi-kàu lāu sian-ti ê siâⁿ, beh uī i thî-khàu, lâi kā i bâi-tsòng.
English: The prophet took up the body of the man of God, and laid it on the donkey, and brought it back; and he came to the city of the old prophet, to mourn, and to bury him.

Tailo: Thiàⁿ-sim íng-uán tsûn-tsāi, m̄-koh, thuân-káng sìn-sit ê un-sù sī tsiām-sî ê; hiah-ê kóng kńg-tsi̍h-uē ê tsâi-tiāu ē bô-.khì, tì-sik mā ē bô-.khì.
English: Love never fails. But where there are prophecies, they will be done away with. Where there are various languages, they will cease. Where there is knowledge, it will be done away with.

Tailo: I ê kiáⁿ-jî lī-khui an-ún hn̄g-hn̄g; tī siâⁿ mn̂g siū ap-pik, mā bô lâng kā in tsín-kiù.
English: His children are far from safety, They are crushed in the gate. Neither is there any to deliver them,

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn lí tuì Le-ba-nòng só͘ kiâⁿ ê kiông-pō, í-ki̍p tsân-hāi iá-siù hō͘ i kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ ê tāi-tsì lóng ē kā lí jia-khàm; sī in-uī lí thâi lâng, tuì kíng lāi ê siâⁿ-tshī kah tuà tī kî-tiong ê lâng só͘ kiâⁿ kiông-pō ê iân-kò͘.
English: For the violence done to Lebanon will overwhelm you, and the destruction of the animals, which made them afraid; because of men's blood, and for the violence done to the land, to every city and to those who dwell in them.

Tailo: Pá-tsiok ê, hō͘ lâng tshiàⁿ lâi thàn-tsia̍h; iau ê, bô koh iau. Bē sing-io̍k ê, seⁿ tshit-ê kiáⁿ, ū tsin tsē kiáⁿ ê, tian-tò sue-jio̍k.
English: Those who were full have hired out themselves for bread; Those who were hungry have ceased to hunger: Yes, the barren has borne seven; She who has many children languishes.

Tailo: Lí ê suí iâⁿ-kuè siáⁿ lâng? Lí tio̍h lo̍h-khì kah bô siū kat-lé ê lâng tsò-hué tó-.leh!
English: Whom do you pass in beauty? Go down, and be laid with the uncircumcised.

Tailo: Mā ū ê ka-la̍uh tī tshì-á lāi, tshì-á tsi̍t ē tuā tsâng tsiū kā gê hip-sí;
English: Others fell among thorns. The thorns grew up and choked them:

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tshiū tuì phû-tô tshiū kóng, ' Lí lâi, lâi tsò guán ê ông. '
English: The trees said to the vine, Come you, and reign over us.

Tailo: Hit ji̍t Siōngtsú huat-tshut siū-khì, tsiū tsiù-tsuā kóng:
English: Yahweh's anger was kindled in that day, and he swore, saying,

Tailo: Siōngtsú koh tuì Mô͘se kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, lí ē kah lí tsó͘-sian tsò-hué khùn; tsiah-ê jîn-bîn ē khí-.lâi, kiânn siâ-îm lâi thàn i só͘ beh khì tuà hit só͘-tsāi guā-bīn ê sîn-bîng, lī-khui Guá, uî-puē Guá kah i só͘ li̍p ê iok.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Behold, you shall sleep with your fathers; and this people will rise up, and play the prostitute after the strange gods of the land, where they go to be among them, and will forsake me, and break my covenant which I have made with them.

Tailo: Kóng, Tsú kó-jiân koh-ua̍h ā, I í-king tshut-hiān hō͘ Símòng khuànn.
English: saying, The Lord is risen indeed, and has appeared to Simon!

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Mikaiah tuì in kóng-khí i só͘ thiaⁿ-tio̍h it-tshè ê uē, to̍h-sī Palosih tuì jîn-bîn tha̍k hit pún tsheh ê sî i só͘ thiaⁿ-tio̍h ê.
English: Then Micaiah declared to them all the words that he had heard, when Baruch read the book in the ears of the people.

Tailo: I hing-khí ê sî, i ê kok ē hun-lia̍t, ǹg thiⁿ ê sì-bīn ê hong-hiòng hun-khui, tsóng-.sī, bô kui i ê kiáⁿ-sun, mā bē pí-tit i í-tsîng só͘ tsiáng ê kuân; in-uī i ê kok ē tú-tio̍h siū pue̍h khí-.lâi, kui tī i ê kiáⁿ-sun í-guā ê pa̍t lâng.
English: When he shall stand up, his kingdom shall be broken, and shall be divided toward the four winds of the sky, but not to his posterity, nor according to his dominion with which he ruled; for his kingdom shall be plucked up, even for others besides these.

Tailo: Thâu tsi̍t-ê iok mā ū lé-pài ê kui-tīng kah sio̍k sè-kan ê sìng-tiān.
English: Now indeed even the first covenant had ordinances of divine service, and an earthly sanctuary.

Tailo: Guá tsō in ê tshuì, beh hō͘ in kóng-tshut o-ló ê uē; pîng-an kah hok-khì kui hō͘ hn̄g kah kīn ê lâng, Guá koh beh kā i i hó. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: I create the fruit of the lips: Peace, peace, to him who is far off and to him who is near, says Yahweh; and I will heal him.

Tailo: Kaleah ê kiáⁿ Io-ha-nân kah tī tshân-iá só͘-ū ê kun-tiúⁿ lâi Mi-su-peh kìnn Getália̍h, tuì i kóng,
English: Moreover Johanan the son of Kareah, and all the captains of the forces who were in the fields, came to Gedaliah to Mizpah,

Tailo: Tī thinn-tíng siáⁿ lâng ē pí-tit Siōngtsú? Tuā kuân-lîng tsiá ê tsìng kiáⁿ tiong, siáⁿ lâng ū huat-tō͘ tshin-tshiūnn Siōngtsú?
English: For who in the skies can be compared to Yahweh? Who among the sons of the heavenly beings is like Yahweh,

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá mā beh kíng ē bê-hi̍k in ê tāi-tsì, hō͘ in só͘ kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ ê lîm-kàu in; in-uī guá kiò, bô lâng ìn; guá kóng-uē, in bô beh tsun-thàn; tian-tò kiânn guá ba̍k-tsiu tiong khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê, kíng guá só͘ bô huann-hí ê.
English: I also will choose their delusions, and will bring their fears on them; because when I called, none did answer; when I spoke, they did not hear: but they did that which was evil in my eyes, and chose that in which I didn't delight.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, tio̍h ē kì-tit lín siū-tiàu ê sî, tsiàu sè-kan it-puaⁿ ê phiau-tsún, lín bô kuí-ê lâng ū tì-huī, bô kuí-ê lâng ū lîng-li̍k, bô kuí-ê lâng sio̍k siōng-liû kai-kip.
English: For you see your calling, brothers, that not many are wise according to the flesh, not many mighty, and not many noble;

Tailo: Khì tshuā ông-hō͘ Ua-si-thih tì ông-hō͘ ê bián-liû kàu ông ê bīn-tsîng, hō͘ hiah-ê jîn-bîn kah jîn-sîn khuànn i ê suí, in-uī i ê bīn-māu tsin hó khuànn.
English: to bring Vashti the queen before the king with the crown royal, to show the peoples and the princes her beauty; for she was beautiful to look on.

Tailo: Hit-ê lâng tsù-ba̍k kā i khuànn, tiām-tiām bô kóng-uē, ài beh tsai Siōngtsú ū siúⁿ-sù i sūn-sī ê lō͘ á-bô.
English: The man looked steadfastly at her, remaining silent, to know whether Yahweh had made his journey prosperous or not.

Tailo: Tabi̍t kóng, Hó, guá kah lí li̍p-iok. Tsóng-.sī, guá beh tuì lí thó tsi̍t hāng, to̍h-sī lí lâi kìnn guá ê bīn hit sî, nā bô kā Sàulô ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Mikal tshuā-.lâi, it-tīng bē-tàng kìnn guá ê bīn.
English: He said, Well; I will make a league with you; but one thing I require of you: that is, you shall not see my face, except you first bring Michal, Saul's daughter, when you come to see my face.

Tailo: Kiû lín īng phû-tô piáⁿ lâi pó͘ guá ê thé-la̍t, īng phông-kó lâi ióng guá ê tsing-sîn; in-uī guá uī-tio̍h ài-tsîng lâi tì pēⁿ.
English: Strengthen me with raisins, Refresh me with apples; For I am faint with love.

Tailo: In ê kuáⁿ-hū ke-thinn tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng, pí hái sua khah tsē; Guá hō͘ tsân-sat ê tiong-tàu lâi, kong-kik siàu-liân lâng ê lāu-bú, hō͘ thòng-khó͘, kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ hut-jiân lîm-kàu tī i ê sin tsiūⁿ.
English: Their widows are increased to me above the sand of the seas; I have brought on them against the mother of the young men a destroyer at noonday: I have caused anguish and terrors to fall on her suddenly.

Tailo: Tíng-tsàn ê pâng khah e̍h, in-uī hō͘ lâu ê lông tsiàm i ê tē; pí tiong-tsàn, ē-tsàn tsiàm khah tsē.
English: Now the upper chambers were shorter; for the galleries took away from these, more than from the lower and the middle, in the building.

Tailo: Hit sî, tsè-si Lēbī lâng khí-.lâi, kā jîn-bîn tsiok-hok. In ê siann ū hō͘ Siōngtsú thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, in ê kî-tó thàu kàu I tuà ê sìng-só͘, kàu tī thiⁿ-.ni̍h.
English: Then the priests the Levites arose and blessed the people: and their voice was heard, and their prayer came up to his holy habitation, even to heaven.

Tailo: Nó͘ah seⁿ saⁿ-ê kiáⁿ, to̍h-sī Sémh, Hâm, Iá-hia̍t.
English: Noah became the father of three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.

Tailo: Guá ê tshuì beh kóng-tshut o-ló Siōngtsú ê uē; guān it-tshè ū hia̍t-khì ê lóng íng-uán o-ló I ê sìng-miâ.
English: My mouth will speak the praise of Yahweh. Let all flesh bless his holy name forever and ever.

Tailo: Tì-huī pí âng-pó-tsio̍h khah kuì-khì, lâng só͘ him-bō͘ ê bô tsi̍t hāng kah i （ Tsù, Tsim-giân ê tsok-tsiá kā Tì-huī Lâng keh huà-tsò lú-sìng ） ē pí-tit.
English: She is more precious than rubies. None of the things you can desire are to be compared to her.

Tailo: Thih-tshiūⁿ tsō pó͘-thâu, īng hué-thuàⁿ tuàn-liān, īng thuî kā i phah, īng i ū la̍t ê tshiú lâi tuî, tì-sú pak-tó͘ iau bô la̍t; bô lim tsuí lâi ià-siān.
English: The smith makes an axe, and works in the coals, and fashions it with hammers, and works it with his strong arm: yes, he is hungry, and his strength fails; he drinks no water, and is faint.

Tailo: Ge-bal, Ammóng, Amáli̍k kah Huilīsū, í-ki̍p Tulô ê tsū-bîn;
English: Gebal, Ammon, and Amalek; Philistia with the inhabitants of Tyre;

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì Lí lóng khǹg tī Lí ê sim-lāi; guá tsai Lí guân-pún to̍h ū tsit-ê ì-sù.
English: Yet you hid these things in your heart. I know that this is with you:

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Nùn ê kiáⁿ Iosiúah kóng, Lí tio̍h ióng-kám tsòng-táⁿ, in-uī lí beh tshuā Isulael lâng ji̍p-khì Guá só͘ tsiù-tsuā hō͘ in ê tē,Guá beh kah lí tông-tsāi.
English: He gave Joshua the son of Nun a charge, and said, Be strong and of good courage; for you shall bring the children of Israel into the land which I swore to them: and I will be with you.

Tailo: Tshiánn lín ua̍t tńg-.lâi, m̄-thang ū put-gī; koh ua̍t tò tńg-.lâi, guá ê kong-gī iáu-koh tī-.leh.
English: Please return. Let there be no injustice; Yes, return again, my cause is righteous.

Tailo: Lī-khui lí hn̄g-hn̄g hiah-ê siâⁿ, m̄-sī tsiah-ê lia̍t kok ê siâⁿ, lí tio̍h án-ne kā i khuán-thāi.
English: Thus shall you do to all the cities which are very far off from you, which are not of the cities of these nations.

Tailo: In tsiū khan hit tsiah lî-á lâi hō͘ Iésu, kā in ka-kī ê guā-saⁿ phua̍h tuà lî-á tíng, hû Iésu khí-lih khiâ.
English: They brought it to Jesus. They threw their cloaks on the colt, and set Jesus on them.

Tailo: In khì-kàu tsi̍t-ê kiò-tsò Na-tsa-lia̍t ê siâⁿ, tsiū tī hia tuà. Tse sī beh ìng-giām tsá-tsîng Siōngtè kau-tài sian-ti só͘ kóng ê uē, I beh kiò-tsò Na-tsa-lia̍t lâng.
English: and came and lived in a city called Nazareth; that it might be fulfilled which was spoken through the prophets: He will be called a Nazarene.

Tailo: to̍h-sī uī-tio̍h lín kah guán ê tiong-kan, í-ki̍p lín kah guán āu-tāi ê tiong-kan tsò tsìng-kì, hō͘ guán thang tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, īng guán ê sio-tsè, siā-un-tsè kah pa̍t tsióng tsè lâi ho̍k-sāi I, bián-tit lín ê kiáⁿ-sun āu-ji̍t tuì guán ê kiáⁿ-sun kóng, ' Lín tī Siōngtsú lāi-bīn bô hūn. '
English: but it shall be a witness between us and you, and between our generations after us, that we may do the service of Yahweh before him with our burnt offerings, and with our sacrifices, and with our peace offerings; that your children may not tell our children in time to come, You have no portion in Yahweh.

Tailo: Te-li-lah kā i kóng, Lí ê sim bô kah guá kiat-liân, án-tsuáⁿ kóng lí thiàⁿ guá? Lí í-king phiàn guá saⁿ pái, bô kā guá kóng lí ê khuì-la̍t tsāi tī tó-uī.
English: She said to him, How can you say, I love you, when your heart is not with me? you have mocked me these three times, and have not told me in which your great strength lies.

Tailo: Kuan-hē guá ê tāi-tsì, Siōngtsú ē si̍t-hiān I tuì guá ê ìng-ín; Siōngtsú ah, Lí ê tsû-ài íng-uán tsûn-tsāi! Kiû Lí m̄-thang pàng-sak Lí tshin-tshiú só͘ tsō ê.
English: Yahweh will fulfill that which concerns me; Your loving kindness, Yahweh, endures forever. Don't forsake the works of your own hands.

Tailo: Lí ē thiaⁿ-tio̍h in só͘ kóng ê, jiân-āu lí tsiū ū tám-liōng lo̍h-khì kàu iâⁿ-pâng. Gîtióng tsiū kah i ê lô͘-po̍k Phó͘la̍h lo̍h-khì kàu iâⁿ-pâng, tuà kun-khì ê lâng ê piⁿ-á.
English: and you shall hear what they say; and afterward shall your hands be strengthened to go down into the camp. Then went he down with Purah his servant to the outermost part of the armed men who were in the camp.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, in tshin-tshiūnn Atám pōe-iok, tī hia ǹg Guá kiânn kuí-tsà.
English: But they, like Adam, have broken the covenant. They were unfaithful to me, there.

Tailo: Ū lâng kā Ioap kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, ông uī-tio̍h Αpsalôm thî-khàu pi-siong.
English: It was told Joab, Behold, the king weeps and mourns for Absalom.

Tailo: Guá beh sé-tû in it-tshè puē-gi̍k Guá ê tsuē, Guá mā beh sià-bián in só͘-ū puē-gi̍k Guá, puē-puān Guá ê hiah-ê tsuē.
English: I will cleanse them from all their iniquity, by which they have sinned against me; and I will pardon all their iniquities, by which they have sinned against me, and by which they have transgressed against me.

Tailo: tsóng-.sī, sio̍k siâⁿ ê tshân-hn̂g kah i ê tsng-thâu lóng sī hō͘ E-hun-neh ê kiáⁿ Ka-le̍p.
English: but the fields of the city, and the villages of it, they gave to Caleb the son of Jephunneh.

Tailo: Tī bîn-tshn̂g tô͘-bô͘ tsuē-kò, tsō-tsok kan-ok ê lâng, lí kàu thiⁿ-kng, in-uī tshiú ū la̍t tsiū khì tsiàu án-ne kiânn, tsit khuán lâng ū tsai-hō!
English: Woe to those who devise iniquity And work evil on their beds! When the morning is light, they practice it, Because it is in the power of their hand.

Tailo: Kóng suah, i tsiū suan-pò͘ suàⁿ-huē.
English: When he had thus spoken, he dismissed the assembly.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Utsà siū-khì, Siōngtsú tī hia in-uī i ê tshò-gō͘ lâi kā i phah, i tsiū sí tī hia, tī Siōngtsú ê kuī piⁿ.
English: The anger of Yahweh was kindled against Uzzah; and God struck him there for his error; and there he died by the ark of God.

Tailo: Guá nā hō͘ lín kan-khó͘-sim, tû-liáu lín tsiah-ê ū kan-khó͘-sim ê lâng í-guā, iáu ū siáⁿ lâng ē-tàng hō͘ guá huann-hí?
English: For if I make you sorry, then who will make me glad but he who is made sorry by me?

Tailo: Iésu kah bûn-tô͘ mā hō͘ in tshiánn khì hù tsit-ê hun-iàn.
English: Jesus also was invited, with his disciples, to the marriage.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Mô͘se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: I-é-lí-miah tuì tsìng lâng kóng tshing-tshó Siōngtsú — in ê Siōngtè it-tshè ê uē, to̍h-sī Siōngtsú — in ê Siōngtè tshe i só͘ kóng it-tshè ê uē.
English: It happened that, when Jeremiah had made an end of speaking to all the people all the words of Yahweh their God, with which Yahweh their God had sent him to them, even all these words,

Tailo: Samuel keh kang tsá-khí, thàu-tsá beh khì gîng-tsiap Sàulô. Ū lâng kā Samuel kóng, Sàulô khì-kàu Kal-mel, tī hia uī ka-kī khiā tsio̍h-pi, koh ua̍t-tńg kuè-.khì, lo̍h kàu Gilgal.
English: Samuel rose early to meet Saul in the morning; and it was told Samuel, saying, Saul came to Carmel, and behold, he set him up a monument, and turned, and passed on, and went down to Gilgal.

Tailo: In kóng, Bô iáⁿ, lí tio̍h kā guán kóng. E-hú ìn kóng, I án-ne, án-ne kā guá kóng. I kóng, ' Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: Guá īng iû kā lí buah hō͘ lí tsò Isulael ê ông. '
English: They said, It is false; tell us now. He said, Thus and thus spoke he to me, saying, Thus says Yahweh, I have anointed you king over Israel.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng tsin kú bô tsia̍h, Páulô khiā tī in tiong-kan, kóng, Kok-uī, lín tsîng nā thiaⁿ guá ê uē, bô khui-tsûn lī-khui Ku-lé-té tó, tsiū bē tú-tio̍h tsit khuán ê siong-hāi kah sún-sit.
English: When they had been long without food, Paul stood up in the middle of them, and said, Sirs, you should have listened to me, and not have set sail from Crete, and have gotten this injury and loss.

Tailo: Hit sî, lín ē kiû-kiò Guá, ē khì tuì Guá kî-tó, Guá ē thiaⁿ lín.
English: You shall call on me, and you shall go and pray to me, and I will listen to you.

Tailo: Iâkop in-uī ū sìn-sim, beh sí ê sî tsiah kā Iôséhuh ê nn̄g-ê kiáⁿ tsiok-hok, koh huāⁿ tuà kuái-á thâu kìng-pài Siōngtè. (tsù, CSK 47:31 LXX)
English: By faith, Jacob, when he was dying, blessed each of the sons of Joseph, and worshiped, leaning on the top of his staff.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, lín nā thiaⁿ tsiah-ê huat-tō͘, tsip-siú lâi tsiàu án-ne khì kiâⁿ, Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè in-uī án-ne ē kā lí si̍t-hîng I tuì lí ê tsó͘-sian só͘ tsiù-tsuā ê iok kah tsû-ài.
English: It shall happen, because you listen to these ordinances, and keep and do them, that Yahweh your God will keep with you the covenant and the loving kindness which he swore to your fathers:

Tailo: Hō͘ in tit-tio̍h Etóm iáu tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê tsò sán-gia̍p, mā tit-tio̍h hiah-ê īng Guá ê miâ lâi tshing-ho͘ ê guā-pang. Tse sī kiânn tsit-ê tāi-tsì ê Siōngtsú só͘ kóng ê.
English: that they may possess the remnant of Edom, and all the nations who are called by my name, says Yahweh who does this.

Tailo: Iôtah ông Ahatsiah khuàⁿ-tio̍h án-ne, tsiū tuì hn̂g ê tshù ê lō͘ tô-tsáu. E-hú jiok i, kóng, Mā tio̍h kā i phah-sí tī tshia lāi. Kàu uá-kīn Ip-le-àm tsiūⁿ Gu-l ê suaⁿ-phiânn kā i phah-siong. I tsáu kàu Megitóng, tsiū sí tī hia.
English: But when Ahaziah the king of Judah saw this, he fled by the way of the garden house. Jehu followed after him, and said, Smite him also in the chariot: and they struck him at the ascent of Gur, which is by Ibleam. He fled to Megiddo, and died there.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú beh piàn kiâⁿ, phah-sí Aigi̍p lâng, I khuàⁿ-tio̍h hueh tī mn̂g-bâi kah siang pîng ê mn̂g-khing, Siōngtsú tsiū ē puâⁿ-kuè hit-ê mn̂g, m̄-tsún bia̍t sèⁿ-miā-.ê ji̍p-khì lín ê tshù, lâi phah-sí lín.
English: For Yahweh will pass through to strike the Egyptians; and when he sees the blood on the lintel, and on the two doorposts, Yahweh will pass over the door, and will not allow the destroyer to come in to your houses to strike you.

Tailo: In-uī guá ê tuì-ti̍k bē-tàng tuì guá khua-kháu khah iâⁿ, guá tsiū tsai Lí kah-ì guá.
English: By this I know that you delight in me, Because my enemy doesn't triumph over me.

Tailo: Kuan-hē Tē-tshit ji̍t , king-tián ū tsi̍t-ê só͘-tsāi án-ne kóng, Siōngtè tī tē-tshit ji̍t, suah I it-tshè ê kang-tsok lâi an-hioh. (tsù, CSK 2:2)
English: For he has said this somewhere about the seventh day, God rested on the seventh day from all his works;

Tailo: Kî-tiong ū tsi̍t-ê lâng suî-sî tsáu-khì the̍h hái-mî tsìm tshò͘, pa̍k tuà lô͘-tik-á bué, tu-khì hō͘ Iésu suh.
English: Immediately one of them ran, and took a sponge, and filled it with vinegar, and put it on a reed, and gave him a drink.

Tailo: Guá mā ū thiaⁿ-tio̍h Isulael lâng ai-siaⁿ thó͘-khuì, to̍h-sī Aigi̍p lâng tok in tsò khó͘-kang, Guá mā ē kì-liām Guá ê iok.
English: Moreover I have heard the groaning of the children of Israel, whom the Egyptians keep in bondage, and I have remembered my covenant.

Tailo: M̄-koh, hit-ê siann tē-jī pái tuì thiⁿ ìn kóng, ' Siōngtè só͘ hō͘ i tshing-khì ê, lí m̄-thang lia̍h-tsò lah-sap. '
English: But a voice answered me the second time out of heaven, What God has cleansed, don't you call unclean.'

Tailo: Iésu ua̍t tńg-sin tuì Piattò͘ kóng, Satán, siám-khui! Lí sī guá ê tsó͘-gāi, lí só͘ siūⁿ ê m̄-sī Siōngtè ê tāi-tsì, sī lâng ê tāi-tsì.
English: But he turned, and said to Peter, Get behind me, Satan! You are a stumbling block to me, for you are not setting your mind on the things of God, but on the things of men.

Tailo: Guán lóng pua̍h lo̍h-khì thô͘-kha. Guá thiaⁿ-tio̍h ū siaⁿ īng Hi-bú-lâi uē tuì guá kóng, ' Sàulô, Sàulô, lí ná ē beh pik-hāi guá? Lí án-ne tsò, tshin-tshiūnn gû īng kha teh that ū tshì ê kùn-á （ Tsù, Tsit-kù ê ì-sù to̍h-sī lán Tâi-gí ê Īng kûn-thâu-bú teh tsing tsio̍h-sai ）, sī ka-kī teh thó phuê thiàⁿ. '
English: When we had all fallen to the earth, I heard a voice saying to me in the Hebrew language, Saul, Saul, why are you persecuting me? It is hard for you to kick against the goads.'

Tailo: Aigi̍p ê pang-tsān sī khang-khang bô lī-ik, só͘-í, guá kā i tshing-tsò tsē-.leh bē tín-tāng ê La̍h-hap.
English: For Egypt helps in vain, and to no purpose; therefore have I called her Rahab who sits still.

Tailo: Thiⁿ kah tē ē siau-sit, m̄-koh, guá ê uē tsua̍t-tuì bē siau-sit.
English: Heaven and earth will pass away, but my words will not pass away.

Tailo: Huâ-láu tuì Iôséhuh kóng, Guá sī Huâ-láu, nā bô lí tshut siaⁿ tsí-sī, tī Aigi̍p tsuân tē, m̄-tsún lâng suî-piān tāng kha tāng tshiú.
English: Pharaoh said to Joseph, I am Pharaoh, and without you shall no man lift up his hand or his foot in all the land of Egypt.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tio̍h tuì in suan-pò͘ tse it-tshè ê uē, lâi kā in kong-kik, kóng: Siōngtsú ē tuì tíng-bīn tuā-siaⁿ huah, tuì I tuà ê sìng-só͘ tshut siaⁿ, tuì I ê iûⁿ-kûn tuā-siaⁿ huah; I ē tuì tē-tsiūⁿ só͘-ū ê jîn-bîn huah-hiàm, ná tshin-tshiūnn teh ta̍h phû-tô ê lâng.
English: Therefore prophesy you against them all these words, and tell them, Yahweh will roar from on high, and utter his voice from his holy habitation; he will mightily roar against his fold; he will give a shout, as those who tread the grapes, against all the inhabitants of the earth.

Tailo: ( tshin-tshiūnn hué sio ta-tshâ, tshin-tshiūnn hué hō͘ tsuí kún), hō͘ Lí ê tuì-ti̍k tsai Lí ê miâ, hō͘ lia̍t kok tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah.
English: as when fire kindles the brushwood, and the fire causes the waters to boil; to make your name known to your adversaries, that the nations may tremble at your presence!

Tailo: Lín koh tī nn̄g-ê siâⁿ tshiûⁿ ê tiong-kan khui tsi̍t-ê thâm, lâi té kū tî ê tsuí. Tsóng-.sī, lín bô gióng-bōng tsō i ê, mā bô siūⁿ-tio̍h tsá to̍h tiāⁿ-tio̍h, koh lâi kā i uân-sîng ê Siōngtè.
English: You also made a reservoir between the two walls for the water of the old pool. But you didn't look to him who had done this, neither did you have respect for him who purposed it long ago.

Tailo: Nā ū bī-sìn-tsiá tshiánn lín tsia̍h pn̄g, lín nā khì, pâi tī lín bīn-tsîng ê mi̍h lóng thang tsia̍h. M̄-bián uī-tio̍h liông-sim ê iân-kò͘ lâi mn̄g-tang mn̄g-sai.
English: But if one of those who don't believe invites you to a meal, and you are inclined to go, eat whatever is set before you, asking no questions for the sake of conscience.

Tailo: Iptsàn liáu-āu, ū Tse-bú-lông lâng Elóng tsò Isulael ê sū-su, i tsò Isulael ê sū-su tsa̍p nî.
English: After him Elon the Zebulunite judged Israel; and he judged Israel ten years.

Tailo: Kàu tē-tshit nî, Io-ho-iá-tah tshe lâng kiò Ka-lī tso̍k kah hō͘-uē-ping ê liân-tiúⁿ, tshuā in ji̍p-khì Siōngtsú ê tiān lâi-kàu i hia, tsiū kah in li̍p-iok, hō͘ in tī Siōngtsú ê tiān tsiù-tsuā, koh kā ông ê kiáⁿ hō͘ in khuànn.
English: In the seventh year Jehoiada sent and fetched the captains over hundreds of the Carites and of the guard, and brought them to him into the house of Yahweh; and he made a covenant with them, and took an oath of them in the house of Yahweh, and shown them the king's son.

Tailo: Lâng nā ín-iú buē siū phìng ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á kah i tâng-pâng, i tio̍h tshuā i tsò bó͘.
English: If a man entices a virgin who isn't pledged to be married, and lies with her, he shall surely pay a dowry for her to be his wife.

Tailo: Ông īng pháiⁿ siaⁿ-sàu ìn jîn-bîn, Lô-bo-àm ông pàng-sak lāu lâng ê kè-tshik,
English: The king answered them roughly; and king Rehoboam forsook the counsel of the old men,

Tailo: Lí tio̍h uī Isulael ê ông-tshin tsò ai-ko:
English: Moreover, take up a lamentation for the princes of Israel,

Tailo: Lín tāi-ke kong-kik lâng, lâi kā i huí-huāi, tshin-tshiūnn huí-huāi khi-tshiâ ê tshiûⁿ, á-.sī beh tó ê piah, tio̍h kàu tang-sî uî-tsí?
English: How long will you assault a man, Would all of you throw him down, Like a leaning wall, like a tottering fence?

Tailo: Án-ne, guá beh mn̄g, Isulael lâng pua̍h-tó, kám lóng peh bē khí-.lâi? Tsua̍t-tuì ē! In-uī in ê huān tsuē, tsín-kiù suah lîm-kàu guā-pang lâng, tian-tò ē kik-khí in ê tsi̍t-tò͘.
English: I ask then, did they stumble that they might fall? May it never be! But by their fall salvation has come to the Gentiles, to provoke them to jealousy.

Tailo: Kàu-huē ê líng-tō-tsiá ná tshin-tshiūnn Siōngtè ê kuán-ke, tio̍h bô kiau-ngō͘, bô khuài siū-khì, bô in-uī tsiú-tsuì lâi jiá-sū, bô hiong-pō, bô tham put-gī ê tsîⁿ-tsâi.
English: For the overseer must be blameless, as God's steward; not self-pleasing, not easily angered, not given to wine, not violent, not greedy for dishonest gain;

Tailo: Abúlâm ê gû, gîn, kim tsin tsē.
English: Abram was very rich in livestock, in silver, and in gold.

Tailo: Uàn-hūn ē jiá-khí sio-tseⁿ; thiàⁿ-sim ē jia-khàm só͘-ū ê kuè-sit.
English: Hatred stirs up strife, But love covers all wrongs.

Tailo: Guán ê kut-thâu sì-suàⁿ tī bōng piⁿ, tshin-tshiūnn lâng tsoh-tshân lê-khui hit-ê thô͘.
English: As when one plows and breaks up the earth, Our bones are scattered at the mouth of Sheol.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-tuā-tīn lâng teh tuè Iésu, kî-tiong ū tsi̍t-kuá hū-jîn-lâng uī I pi-siong thî-khàu.
English: A great multitude of the people followed him, including women who also mourned and lamented him.

Tailo: Tī in tuì lán siū-khì ê sî, tsá to̍h ua̍h-ua̍h kā lán thun-tsia̍h lo̍h-pak.
English: Then they would have swallowed us up alive, When their wrath was kindled against us;

Tailo: Tsháu-me̍h khí-lâi Aigi̍p tsuân tē, hioh tī Aigi̍p ê sì-kho͘-uî, lī-hāi kàu-ki̍k. Tsá-tsîng bô ū án-ne ê tsháu-me̍h, í-āu mā bē koh án-ne.
English: The locusts went up over all the land of Egypt, and rested in all the borders of Egypt. They were very grievous. Before them there were no such locusts as they, neither after them shall be such.

Tailo: Tsín-tsè sàn-tshiah ê lâng bē tì-kàu khiàm-khueh; tsóng-.sī, tèⁿ-tsò bô khuàⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâng ē siū tsiù-tsó͘.
English: One who gives to the poor has no lack; But one who closes his eyes will have many curses.

Tailo: Lí nā kah kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ tsē-toh, tio̍h tsù-ì tī lí bīn-tsîng ê lâng.
English: When you sit to eat with a ruler, Consider diligently what is before you;

Tailo: Tī hiann-tī tiong tsò tuā-tsè-si, īng buah ê iû thîn tī i ê thâu-khak, koh siat-li̍p tam-tng sìng-tsit, tshīng sìng-saⁿ ê, m̄-thang phah-suàⁿ thâu-mn̂g, mā m̄-thang thiah-li̍h saⁿ.
English: He who is the high priest among his brothers, upon whose head the anointing oil is poured, and that is consecrated to put on the garments, shall not let the hair of his head hang loose, nor tear his clothes;

Tailo: In-uī tsìng lâng lóng tsai lín ê sūn-ho̍k, só͘-í, guá uī-tio̍h lín huann-hí. M̄-koh, guá ài lín tuì hó sū tio̍h khiáu, tuì pháiⁿ tāi tio̍h ū tì-huī.
English: For your obedience has become known to all. I rejoice therefore over you. But I desire to have you wise in that which is good, but innocent in that which is evil.

Tailo: Guá tī Siōngtè kah Ki-tok Iésu í-ki̍p siū kíng-suán ê thiⁿ-sài bīn-tsîng bīng-līng lí, tio̍h tsun-siú tsiah-ê tsí-sī, m̄-thang ū phian-kiàn, tsò tāi-tsì m̄-thang su-phian.
English: I charge you in the sight of God, and Christ Jesus, and the chosen angels, that you observe these things without prejudice, doing nothing by partiality.

Tailo: In án-ne kìng-uì Siōngtsú, tuì kûn-tsiòng tiong siat-li̍p lâng tsò suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ ê tsè-si, thè in tī suaⁿ-thâu biō hiàn tsè.
English: So they feared Yahweh, and made to them from among themselves priests of the high places, who sacrificed for them in the houses of the high places.

Tailo: Tsit-ê tāi-tsì Siōngtè kā i sǹg-tsò sī gī, sè-sè tāi-tāi, it-ti̍t kàu íng-uán.
English: That was credited to him for righteousness, For all generations to come.

Tailo: Ta̍k hāng tāi-tsì lí tio̍h ka-kī tsò hó bô͘-huān. Kà-sī lâng ê sî tio̍h sîng-khún tuan-tsong,
English: in all things showing yourself an example of good works; in your teaching showing integrity, seriousness, incorruptibility,

Tailo: Kiânn siat-li̍p ê lé-gî só͘ hiàn kang-iûⁿ ê bah, lí tio̍h tī sìng ê só͘-tsāi tsú.
English: You shall take the ram of consecration, and boil its flesh in a holy place.

Tailo: Guá tsin-tsiàⁿ tsai-iáⁿ sī án-ne; in-uī lâng tī Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng, ná ē sǹg-tsò sī gī?
English: Truly I know that it is so, But how can man be just with God?

Tailo: In-uī kiàn-nā só͘ tsò ê kah it-tshè ún-ba̍t ê tāi-tsì, bô-lūn sī hó sī pháiⁿ, Siōngtè lóng ē sím-phuàⁿ.
English: For God will bring every work into judgment, with every hidden thing, whether it is good, or whether it is evil.

Tailo: Tī Hebúlông tsò Iôtah ông tshit nî koh la̍k gue̍h-ji̍t, tī Êlúsalèm tsò tsuân Isulael kah Iôtah ê ông saⁿ-tsa̍p saⁿ nî.
English: In Hebron he reigned over Judah seven years and six months; and in Jerusalem he reigned thirty-three years over all Israel and Judah.

Tailo: Lí kah lí ê jîn-bîn ná ē beh in-uī to-kiàm, in-uī ki-hng, in-uī un-i̍k lâi sí, tsiàu Siōngtsú lūn-khí m̄-khíng ho̍k-sāi Babúlông ông hit khuán kok ê uē?
English: Why will you die, you and your people, by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, as Yahweh has spoken concerning the nation that will not serve the king of Babylon?

Tailo: Guá tī Tho͘-lo-a ê sî lâu tī Ka-pò͘ in tau ê guā-saⁿ, lí lâi ê sî tio̍h suà tuà-.lâi, mā tio̍h kā hiah-ê tsheh tuà-.lâi, iû-kî-sī hiah-ê iûⁿ-phuê ê tsheh.
English: Bring the cloak that I left at Troas with Carpus when you come, and the books, especially the parchments.

Tailo: Lí tsiū kóng: Siōngtè tsai siáⁿ-mi̍h? I kám ē khuànn thàu o͘-àm lâi sím-phuàⁿ?
English: You say, What does God know? Can he judge through the thick darkness?

Tailo: La̍k ji̍t lāi tio̍h ing-kai lô-khó͘, tsò lí só͘-ū ê kang;
English: You shall labor six days, and do all your work,

Tailo: Êlúsalèm, tio̍h puāⁿ-khì tîn-ai! Khí-lâi tsē! Si-óng siū lia̍h ê jîn-bîn, tio̍h tháu-khui lí ām-kún ê só-liān.
English: Shake yourself from the dust; arise, sit on your throne, Jerusalem: loose yourself from the bonds of your neck, captive daughter of Zion.

Tailo: Tuì kin-á-ji̍t khí, guá beh hō͘ thiⁿ-ē bān-bîn, thiaⁿ-tio̍h lí ê miâ-siaⁿ ê, kiaⁿ lín, lún lín, koh in-uī lí lâi thòng-khó͘ kah phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah.
English: This day will I begin to put the dread of you and the fear of you on the peoples who are under the whole sky, who shall hear the report of you, and shall tremble, and be in anguish because of you.

Tailo: Tshit nî ê ki-hng tsiū lâi. Τú-tú tsiàu Iôséhuh só͘ kóng ê, ta̍k kok lóng ū ki-hng; to̍k-to̍k Aigi̍p tsuân tē ū bí-niûⁿ.
English: The seven years of famine began to come, just as Joseph had said. There was famine in all lands, but in all the land of Egypt there was bread.

Tailo: Koh ū tsi̍t tsiah tuā ing, si̍t tuā, mn̂g tsa̍t, lí khuàⁿ, tsit-ê phû-tô tshiū tuì tsai-tsìng ê só͘-tsāi uan i ê kin ǹg i, huat i ê ki ǹg i, ǹg-bāng i lâi kuàn-ak.
English: There was also another great eagle with great wings and many feathers: and behold, this vine did bend its roots toward him, and shot forth its branches toward him, from the beds of its plantation, that he might water it.

Tailo: Tsiū tshú nn̄g tâi tshia kah bé, ông tshe lâng khì jiok Alâm ê kun-ping, kóng, Lín khì khuàⁿ-māi leh.
English: They took therefore two chariots with horses; and the king sent after the army of the Syrians, saying, Go and see.

Tailo: Gōng lâng ê lô-lo̍k tì-sú hō͘ in ià-siān, in-uī liân ji̍p siâⁿ ê lō͘ i mā m̄-tsai.
English: The labor of fools wearies every one of them; for he doesn't know how to go to the city.

Tailo: Phâu sì-kho͘-uî ê ē-kha pô͘, tio̍h īng nâ-sik, tsí-sik, tsu-âng sik ê liāu, tsò sia̍h-liû; phâu ê sì-kho͘-uî tī sia̍h-liû ê tiong-kan tio̍h ū kim hâm-lîng.
English: On its hem you shall make pomegranates of blue, and of purple, and of scarlet, around its hem; and bells of gold between them round about:

Tailo: Tsit-ê siâⁿ ū Siōngtè ê îng-kng, siâⁿ ê kng tshin-tshiūnn siōng pó-kuì ê pó-tsio̍h, tshin-tshiūnn phik-gi̍k, tshin-tshiūnn tsuí-tsinn hiah-ni̍h kng.
English: having the glory of God. Her light was like a most precious stone, as if it was a jasper stone, clear as crystal;

Tailo: to̍h-sī Babúlông ông — Nepkatnetsal lia̍h Iôtah ông E-hō͘-iá-kim ê kiáⁿ Ia-ko-niah kah Iôtah Êlúsalèm tsiah-ê tsun-kuì ê lâng, tuì Êlúsalèm kàu Babúlông ê sî, só͘ bô tshiúⁿ-.khì ê. ）
English: which Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon didn't take, when he carried away captive Jeconiah the son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, from Jerusalem to Babylon, and all the nobles of Judah and Jerusalem;

Tailo: Lín kan-taⁿ teh khuàⁿ gán-tsiân ê sū. Nā ū lâng jīn-uî ka-kī sī sio̍k Ki-tok, i tio̍h koh siūⁿ khuàⁿ māi, i sio̍k Ki-tok, guán mā sī sio̍k Ki-tok.
English: Do you look at things only as they appear in front of your face? If anyone trusts in himself that he is Christ's, let him consider this again with himself, that, even as he is Christ's, so also we are Christ's.

Tailo: Tiōng-hu iáu ua̍h-.leh ê sî, hit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tio̍h siū sok-pa̍k; tiōng-hu nā sí-.khì, i thang tsū-iû kè i só͘ ì-ài ê lâng, to̍k-to̍k tio̍h kè hō͘ sìn Tsú ê lâng tsiah thang.
English: A wife is bound by law for as long as her husband lives; but if the husband is dead, she is free to be married to whoever she desires, only in the Lord.

Tailo: Lí tuì Lí ê lô͘-po̍k, guá ê lāu-pē Tabi̍t só͘ ìng-ín ê, Lí ū siú iok. Lí tshin-tshuì kóng ê, tshin-tshiú kā i ìng-giām, tsiàu kin-á-ji̍t ê khuán.
English: who have kept with your servant David my father that which you did promise him: yes, you spoke with your mouth, and have fulfilled it with your hand, as it is this day.

Tailo: uī nn̄g-ê bāng tsò sì pah lia̍p sia̍h-liû; tsi̍t-ê bāng ū nn̄g tsuā ê sia̍h-liû, lâi uî thiāu tíng thiāu-táu ê nn̄g lia̍p kiû;
English: and the four hundred pomegranates for the two networks; two rows of pomegranates for each network, to cover the two bowls of the capitals that were on the pillars;

Tailo: Tse sī beh hō͘ lín tsiah-ê thong-kuè sìn lâi siū Siōngtè tuā kuân-lîng pó-siú ê lâng, thang tī bua̍t-ji̍t tit-tio̍h hit-ê í-king tsún-pī hó-sè, teh beh si̍t-hiān ê tsín-kiù.
English: who by the power of God are guarded through faith for a salvation ready to be revealed in the last time.

Tailo: Tsóng-tok Le-hóm kah su-kì Simsiai beh kò Êlúsalèm lâng, mā tsiūⁿ-pió tsàu Altasiásuta ông, hit-ê pió tshin-tshiūnn án-ne:
English: Rehum the chancellor and Shimshai the scribe wrote a letter against Jerusalem to Artaxerxes the king in this sort:

Tailo: Tshiáⁿ lí mā tio̍h tsún-pī só͘-tsāi hō͘ guá tuà, in-uī guá ǹg-bāng Siōngtè ē thiaⁿ lín ê kî-tó, hō͘ guá ē-tàng khì lín hia.
English: Also, prepare a guest room for me, for I hope that through your prayers I will be restored to you.

Tailo: Lí pān toh tshiánn lâng-kheh ê sî, tio̍h tshiánn sàn-tshiah-.ê, phuà-siùⁿ-.ê, pái-kha-.ê, tsheⁿ-mê-.ê,
English: But when you make a feast, ask the poor, the maimed, the lame, or the blind;

Tailo: Lí sue-pāi ê sî beh án-tsuáⁿ tsò? Suî-jiân tshīng tsu-âng ê saⁿ, īng kim-khì táⁿ-pān, īng sik-liāu uē lí ê ba̍k-tsiu, án-ne tián hó khuànn, sī khang-khang! Luân-ài lí ê khuànn-khin lí, koh siàu-siūⁿ lí ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: You, when you are made desolate, what will you do? Though you clothe yourself with scarlet, though you deck you with ornaments of gold, though you enlarge your eyes with paint, in vain do you make yourself beautiful; your lovers despise you, they seek your life.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtè kā lán an-pâi koh khah hó ê kè-uē, Siōngtè ê tsí-ì to̍h-sī, tsiah-ê lâng tio̍h kah lán tsò-hué tsiah ē-tàng uân-tsuân.
English: God having provided some better thing concerning us, so that apart from us they should not be made perfect.

Tailo: Iésu kā in sé kha liáu-āu, tshīng guā-saⁿ, koh tńg-lâi tsē-toh, mn̄g in kóng, Guá tuì lín só͘ tsò tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, lín kám ū bîng-pi̍k?
English: So when he had washed their feet, put his outer garment back on, and sat down again, he said to them, Do you know what I have done to you?

Tailo: Lí só͘ thang tsia̍h ê tsing-seⁿ to̍h-sī tsiah-ê: gû, mî-iûⁿ, suaⁿ-iûⁿ,
English: These are the animals which you may eat: the ox, the sheep, and the goat,

Tailo: Kiau-ngō͘ ê lâng uī guá thau-thau-á tiuⁿ ua̍h-tauh kah soh-á; in tī lō͘ piⁿ an lô-bāng, Siat khuan-thò beh hāi guá. [Sè-la̍h]
English: The proud have hidden a snare for me, They have spread the cords of a net by the path. They have set traps for me. Selah.

Tailo: Guá koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h sìng-siâⁿ, to̍h-sī sin ê Êlúsalèm, tuì thinn-tíng Siōngtè hia kàng lo̍h-.lâi, tshin-tshiūnn sin-niû tá-pān hó-sè, lâi gîng-tsiap sin-lông.
English: I saw the holy city, New Jerusalem, coming down out of heaven from God, made ready like a bride adorned for her husband.

Tailo: I kám ē īng tuā kuân-lîng kah guá kè-kàu? Tik-khak bô án-ne; I ē ànn-lo̍h thiaⁿ guá.
English: Would he contend with me in the greatness of his power? No, but he would listen to me.

Tailo: Kàu tē-tshit nî, tē tio̍h siú tuā ê an-hioh, to̍h-sī kā Siōngtsú siú ê an-hioh, m̄-thang tsìng-tsoh lí ê tshân-hn̂g, mā m̄-thang siu-tsíng phû-tô hn̂g.
English: but in the seventh year there shall be a Sabbath of solemn rest for the land, a Sabbath to Yahweh. You shall not sow your field or prune your vineyard.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, lí tshin-tshiūnn tsuí teh kún, it-tīng bē-tàng khiā thâu uī; in-uī lí peh-tsiūⁿ lín lāu-pē ê bîn-tshn̂g, lí peh-tsiūⁿ guá ê tshn̂g-pho͘, lí kā i uè lah-sap,
English: Boiling over as water, you shall not excell; Because you went up to your father's bed; Then defiled it. He went up to my couch.

Tailo: Guá ê ji̍t-tsí í-king kuè uân, guá ê kè-uē kah guá ê sim-su lóng í-king tuān-tsua̍t.
English: My days are past, my plans are broken off, As are the thoughts of my heart.

Tailo: Siâⁿ lāi í-king pha-hng, siâⁿ mn̂g lóng huí-huāi.
English: The city is left in desolation, and the gate is struck with destruction.

Tailo: Hiah-ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ kah thâu-lâng kā I ah-khì hō͘ lâng phuàⁿ sí-hîng, tìng si̍p-jī-kè.
English: and how the chief priests and our rulers delivered him up to be condemned to death, and crucified him.

Tailo: Tì-huī lâng ê uē tshin-tshiūnn tshì, in pian-tsi̍p ê gí-lio̍k tshin-tshiūnn tìng-tiâu ê ting, lóng sī tuì tsi̍t-ê bo̍k-tsiá só͘ sù ê.
English: The words of the wise are like goads; and like nails well fastened are words from the masters of assemblies, which are given from one shepherd.

Tailo: Taⁿ guá tsai Siōngtsú kiù I só͘ buah iû ê, ē tuì I sìng ê thinn-tíng thiaⁿ i ê uē, īng I tsiàⁿ tshiú ê khuì-la̍t tsín-kiù i.
English: Now I know that Yahweh saves his anointed. He will answer him from his holy heaven, With the saving strength of his right hand.

Tailo: Bô beh hō͘ lâng khuàⁿ-tshut lí teh kìm-tsia̍h, kan-taⁿ hō͘ Thiⁿ-pē khuàⁿ-.tio̍h; án-ne tiām-tiām-á teh kuan-tshat ê Thiⁿ-pē tsiū ē kā lí pò-siúⁿ.
English: so that you are not seen by men to be fasting, but by your Father who is in secret, and your Father, who sees in secret, will reward you.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kah kìng-uì I ê lâng tshin-bi̍t, koh beh kā I ê iok tsí-sī in.
English: The friendship of Yahweh is with those who fear him. He will show them his covenant.

Tailo: Án-ne, Ki-tok lâi thuân hô-pîng ê hok-im hō͘ só͘-ū ê lâng, pau-kuat lín tsiah-ê í-tsîng lī-khui Siōngtè hn̄g-hn̄g ê guā-pang lâng kah tshin-kīn Siōngtè ê Iô-tá-iah lâng.
English: He came and preached peace to you who were far off and to those who were near.

Tailo: lí ê sim nā liân-bín iau-gō ê lâng, hō͘ khùn-khó͘ ê lâng tit-tio̍h buán-tsiok, lí ê kng tsiū ē tī o͘-àm tiong hián-hiān, lí ê o͘-àm ē piàn-sîng tshin-tshiūnn ji̍t-tiong-tàu.
English: and if you draw out your soul to the hungry, and satisfy the afflicted soul: then shall your light rise in darkness, and your obscurity be as the noonday;

Tailo: Sian-ti nā ū bāng-kìnn thang kóng-khí i ê bāng; tit-tio̍h Guá ê uē ê, tio̍h īng sîng-si̍t thuân Guá ê uē. Tsho͘-khng kah be̍h-á ná ē pí-.tit? Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: The prophet who has a dream, let him tell a dream; and he who has my word, let him speak my word faithfully. What is the straw to the wheat? says Yahweh.

Tailo: E-hú kóng, Kā i tshia lo̍h-.lâi! In tsiū kā i tshia lo̍h-.lâi, i ê hueh tsuāⁿ-tio̍h tshiûⁿ-piah kah bé, tsiū īng kha thún-ta̍h.
English: He said, Throw her down. So they threw her down; and some of her blood was sprinkled on the wall, and on the horses: and he trod her under foot.

Tailo: Ông kā i kóng, Lí thang pîng-an khì. Αpsalôm tsiū khí-.lâi, óng Hebúlông khì.
English: The king said to him, Go in peace. So he arose, and went to Hebron.

Tailo: Guá ê tuì-ti̍k, m̄-thang in-uī guá lâi huann-hí. Guá suî-jiân pua̍h-tó, ē koh peh khí-.lâi; guá tsē tī o͘-àm, Siōngtsú tsò guá ê kng.
English: Don't rejoice against me, my enemy. When I fall, I will arise. When I sit in darkness, Yahweh will be a light to me.

Tailo: Pó͘-kuà sī sù-hong ê, áu-tsò siang-tîng, tn̂g tsi̍t lia̍h, khuah tsi̍t lia̍h, sī siang-tîng ê.
English: It was square. They made the breastplate double. Its length was a span, and its breadth a span, being double.

Tailo: Lí ê pó-tsō tsū kó͘-tsá to̍h kiàn-li̍p; Lí tuì íng-uán tsiū tsûn-tsāi.
English: Your throne is established from long ago. You are from everlasting.

Tailo: Kuan-hē Ne-he-lâm lâng Simáiah, lí tio̍h kóng,
English: Concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite you shall speak, saying,

Tailo: Kā in huan-hù kóng, Lín khì tuì-bīn ê tsng-thâu, ji̍p-khì ê sî ē tú-tio̍h tsi̍t tsiah iáu-buē ū lâng khiâ-kuè ê lî-á pa̍k tī hia, lín kā i tháu-khui khan-lâi tsia.
English: saying, Go your way into the village on the other side, in which, as you enter, you will find a colt tied, whereon no man ever yet sat. Untie it, and bring it.

Tailo: Uàn-hūn kong-pêⁿ ê kám ē tsiáng-kuân? Hit-ê ū kong-gī koh ū kuân-lîng ê Siōngtè, lí kám ē-tàng tīng I ū tsuē?
English: Shall even one who hates justice govern? Will you condemn him who is righteous and mighty?

Tailo: Lí mā tio̍h ē kì-tit lí í-tsîng tī Aigi̍p tē tsò lô͘-po̍k, Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè īng tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú, tshun tshut-.lâi ê tshiú-kut, tshuā lí tuì hia tshut-.lâi, in-uī án-ne, Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè bīng-līng lí tio̍h siú An-hioh-ji̍t.
English: You shall remember that you were a servant in the land of Egypt, and Yahweh your God brought you out of there by a mighty hand and by an outstretched arm: therefore Yahweh your God commanded you to keep the Sabbath day.

Tailo: Kin-á-ji̍t Siōngtsú ē kā lí kau tī guá ê tshiú tiong, guá beh phah-sí lí, thâi lí ê thâu-khak, kin-á-ji̍t guá beh kā Huilīsū kun-ping ê sin-si, hō͘ khong-tiong ê pue-tsiáu kah tē-tsiūⁿ ê iá-siù; hō͘ phó͘-thinn-ē ê lâng lóng tsai Isulael ū Siōngtè,
English: This day will Yahweh deliver you into my hand; and I will strike you, and take your head from off you; and I will give the dead bodies of the army of the Philistines this day to the birds of the sky, and to the wild animals of the earth; that all the earth may know that there is a God in Israel,

Tailo: Ionáthan kā gia̍h i ê kun-khì ê siàu-liân lâng kóng, Lâi, lán lâi-khì bô siū kat-lé ê lâng ê kun-iâⁿ hia, kiám-tshái Siōngtsú ē thè lán tsò tāi-tsì; in-uī Siōngtsú ê kiù lâng, bô hān-tiāⁿ lâng ê tsē-tsió.
English: Jonathan said to the young man who bore his armor, Come, and let us go over to the garrison of these uncircumcised: it may be that Yahweh will work for us; for there is no restraint to Yahweh to save by many or by few.

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h beh hō͘ lán tsū-iû, Ki-tok í-king kā lán tháu-pàng, só͘-í, lín tio̍h khiā ho͘ tsāi, m̄-thang koh hō͘ lâng ap-tsè tsò lô͘-lē.
English: Stand firm therefore in the liberty by which Christ has made us free, and don't be entangled again with a yoke of bondage.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê Lēbī tso̍k ê lâng khì tshuā tsi̍t-ê Lēbī tso̍k ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á lâi tsò bó͘.
English: A man of the house of Levi went and took a daughter of Levi as his wife.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê lóng sī king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê, sī Mô͘se kah Alông kah Isulael tsa̍p-jī-ê siú-líng só͘ sǹg ê, in ta̍k-ê tāi-piáu in ê tsong-tso̍k.
English: These are those who were numbered, whom Moses and Aaron numbered, and the princes of Israel, being twelve men: they were each one for his fathers' house.

Tailo: Huē-bō͘ ê thâu-tsîng king sī teh phì-jū hiān-sè, tsiàu án-ne teh hiàn lé-mi̍h kah tsè-sū, bē-tàng hō͘ lé-pài ê lâng liông-sim tshing-pe̍h.
English: which is a symbol of the present age, where gifts and sacrifices are offered that are incapable, concerning the conscience, of making the worshipper perfect;

Tailo: Tabi̍t tuì Siōngtè kóng, Huan-hù tiám-sǹg jîn-bîn ê kám m̄-sī guá? Guá huān tsuē kiânn tuā pháiⁿ, tsóng-.sī, tsiah-ê iûⁿ-kûn kám ū tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? Kiû Siōngtsú — guá ê Siōngtè, tshun tshiú tī guá kah guá ê pē ê ke, m̄-thang kong-kik Lí ê tsú-bîn, kàng un-i̍k hō͘ in.
English: David said to God, Isn't it I who commanded the people to be numbered? It is even I who have sinned and done very wickedly; but these sheep, what have they done? Please let your hand, O Yahweh my God, be against me, and against my father's house; but not against your people, that they should be plagued.

Tailo: Guán tńg-khì kàu lí ê lô͘-po̍k — guán lāu-pē hia, tsiū kā guá ê tsú ê uē tuì i kóng.
English: It happened when we came up to your servant my father, we told him the words of my lord.

Tailo: Bô kong-tō ê lâng sī gī lâng só͘ thó-ià; kiânn tsìng-ti̍t ê lâng sī pháiⁿ lâng só͘ thó-ià.
English: A dishonest man detests the righteous, And the upright in their ways detest the wicked.

Tailo: Tī tsiah-ê it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, lín lóng m̄-thang uè lah-sap ka-kī, in-uī Guá tī lín ê bīn-tsîng só͘ kuáⁿ-tshut ê lia̍t pang, tī tsiah-ê it-tshè ū uè lah-sap ka-kī.
English: Don't defile yourselves in any of these things: for in all these the nations which I am casting out before you were defiled.

Tailo: Gû teh lún ngó͘-kok, m̄-thang kā i ê tshuì lom-.leh.
English: You shall not muzzle the ox when he treads out the grain.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, Lí ê tuì-ti̍k án-ne teh lîng-jio̍k, to̍h-sī put-sî tuè teh lîng-jio̍k Lí só͘ buah iû ê.
English: With which your enemies have mocked, Yahweh, With which they have mocked the footsteps of your anointed one.

Tailo: Lí kám m̄-tsai tuì kó͘-tsá, tuì sè-kan ū jîn-luī í-lâi;
English: Don't you know this from old time, Since man was placed on earth,

Tailo: Lí khuànn! Tsit-ê siâⁿ kīn-kīn, guá thang tô-tsáu khì hia, jî-tshiánn tsit-ê siâⁿ mā sī sè-.ê. Tshiánn iông-ín guá tô-siám tī hia, lâi pó-tsuân guá ê ua̍h-miā; tsit-ê siâⁿ kám m̄-sī sè-.ê?
English: See now, this city is near to flee to, and it is a little one. Oh let me escape there (isn't it a little one?), and my soul will live.

Tailo: Lán bô-lūn tuì Siōngtè kiû siáⁿ-mi̍h, lóng ē tit-tio̍h, in-uī lán ū tsun-siú I ê bīng-līng, tī I ê bīn-tsîng, tsò I só͘ huann-hí ê tāi-tsì.
English: and whatever we ask, we receive from him, because we keep his commandments and do the things that are pleasing in his sight.

Tailo: Sing-sán ê ji̍t-kî kàu, kó-jiân pak-tó͘ lāi sī siang-seⁿ ê.
English: When her days to be delivered were fulfilled, behold, there were twins in her womb.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h khì kong-kik Mítiân lâng, thè Isulael lâng pò-siû, āu-lâi lí ē sí-bông.
English: Avenge the children of Israel of the Midianites: afterward you shall be gathered to your people.

Tailo: In lóng tsia̍h kāng-khuán sio̍k-lîng ê tsia̍h-mi̍h, lóng lim kāng-khuán sio̍k-lîng ê tsuâⁿ-tsuí.
English: and all ate the same spiritual food;

Tailo: Lín tsiah-ê ang-î ê kiáⁿ, kan-hu kah ki-lí ê tsíng-luī, lóng tio̍h tsìn-tsîng lâi.
English: But draw near here, you sons of the sorceress, the seed of the adulterer and the prostitute.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá beh koh īng kî-biāu ê tāi-tsì khuán-thāi tsiah-ê jîn-bîn, hit-ê tāi-tsì to̍h-sī kî-biāu koh kî-ī ê. In tì-huī lâng ê tì-huī ē siau-bia̍t, in tshong-bîng lâng ê tshong-bîng ē khàm ba̍t.
English: therefore, behold, I will proceed to do a marvelous work among this people, even a marvelous work and a wonder; and the wisdom of their wise men will perish, and the understanding of their prudent men will be hidden.

Tailo: Lâng nā bô tsiàu-kò͘ tshin-lâng, sīm-tsì bô tsiàu-kò͘ ka-kī ê ka-tîng, to̍h-sī uî-puē sìn-gióng, pí bô sìn ê lâng koh khah hāi.
English: But if anyone doesn't provide for his own, and especially his own household, he has denied the faith, and is worse than an unbeliever.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h i iân-lō͘ kiânn, iân-lō͘ o-ló Siōngtè,
English: All the people saw him walking and praising God.

Tailo: I suî-sî khuànn-kìnn, tsiū tuè Iésu khì, kui îng-kng hō͘ Siōngtè. Kûn-tsiòng khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê tāi-tsì lóng o-ló Siōngtè.
English: Immediately he received his sight, and followed him, glorifying God. All the people, when they saw it, praised God.

Tailo: Hō͘ lí tsai tsin-lí ê uē khak-si̍t khó-khò; hō͘ lí thang īng tsin-lí ê uē huê-hok tshe-phài lí ê lâng.
English: To teach you truth, reliable words, To give sound answers to the ones who sent you?

Tailo: In nā tī siū lia̍h-.khì ê tē, to̍h-sī tuì-ti̍k lia̍h in khì ê tē, tsīn-sim, tsīn-sìng kui-ho̍k Lí, koh ǹg pún-tē, to̍h-sī Lí siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in tsó͘-sian ê tē kah Lí só͘ kíng ê siâⁿ, í-ki̍p guá uī-tio̍h Lí ê miâ só͘ khí ê tiān, lâi tuì Lí kî-tó ê sî,
English: if they return to you with all their heart and with all their soul in the land of their captivity, where they have carried them captive, and pray toward their land, which you gave to their fathers, and the city which you have chosen, and toward the house which I have built for your name:

Tailo: Jîn-bîn ê siú-líng, Isulael ê tsìng tsi-tso̍k tsò-hué tsū-huē ê sî, i tī E-siu-lûn tsò ông.
English: He was king in Jeshurun, When the heads of the people were gathered, All the tribes of Israel together.

Tailo: Êlúsalèm ê tsìng tsa-bó͘ gín-á, guá sī o͘ koh seⁿ-tsò hó khuànn, tshin-tshiūnn Ketal ê pò͘-pênn, tshin-tshiūnn Só͘lômóng ê tiùⁿ-lî.
English: I am dark, but lovely, You daughters of Jerusalem, Like Kedar's tents, Like Solomon's curtains.

Tailo: I siū ap-pik tú-tio̍h kan-khó͘, iáu-koh bô khui tshuì; i tshin-tshiūnn iûⁿ-á hông khan kàu siū thâi ê só͘-tsāi, koh tshin-tshiūnn iûⁿ tī tsián-mn̂g ê lâng ê bīn-tsîng bô tshut siaⁿ, i mā kāng-khuán án-ne bô khui tshuì.
English: He was oppressed, yet when he was afflicted he didn't open his mouth; as a lamb that is led to the slaughter, and as a sheep that before its shearers is mute, so he didn't open his mouth.

Tailo: Lín kì-jiân sī Siōngtè ê tsú-bîn, kan-îm kah it-tshè ê ù-uè á-.sī tham-sim, tī lín tiong-kan liân kóng-khí to m̄-thang.
English: But sexual immorality, and all uncleanness, or covetousness, let it not even be mentioned among you, as becomes saints;

Tailo: Lín tsò lāu-pē ê lâng, lí ê kiáⁿ kā lí thó piáⁿ, lín kám ē the̍h tsio̍h-thâu hō͘ i?
English: Or who is there among you, who, if his son asks him for bread, will give him a stone?

Tailo: Tabi̍t kā Sàulô kóng, Guá sī siáⁿ lâng, guá ū siáⁿ-mi̍h sin-hūn, guá lāu-pē ê ke tī Isulael tiong sī siáⁿ-mi̍h hō ê ke, guá kám thang tsò ông ê kiáⁿ-sài?
English: David said to Saul, Who am I, and what is my life, or my father's family in Israel, that I should be son-in-law to the king?

Tailo: I ē khí Siōngtsú ê tiān, i mā ē tit-tio̍h îng-kng, tsē i ê pó-tsō lâi tī-lí, mā beh tī i ê pó-tsō tsò tsè-si, tī in nn̄g-ê ê tiong-kan ū hô-pîng ê kè-uē.
English: even he shall build the temple of Yahweh; and he shall bear the glory, and shall sit and rule on his throne; and he shall be a priest on his throne; and the counsel of peace shall be between them both.

Tailo: M̄-koh, guá koh-ua̍h liáu-āu ē pí lín tāi-sing khì Ga-lí-la-iah síng.
English: But after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.

Tailo: In-uī i ê Siōngtsú īng ha̍p-gî ê huat-tō͘ tsí-sī i, koh kà-sī i.
English: For his God instructs him in right judgement, and teaches him.

Tailo: Bô Malkitsetik ê tso̍k-phó͘ thang tsai i ê pē-bú sī siáⁿ-mi̍h lâng, mā bô i tshut-sì kah sí-bông ê kì-tsài. I kah Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ kāng-khuán, kú-tn̂g teh tsò tsè-si.
English: without father, without mother, without genealogy, having neither beginning of days nor end of life, but made like the Son of God), remains a priest continually.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h īng sûn-kim tsò tsi̍t-ê ting-tâi, ting-tâi ê tsō kah tiong thiāu, i ê pue, i ê ba̍k, i ê hue, lóng īng phah ê hong-huat tsò kui tsō.
English: You shall make a lampstand of pure gold. Of hammered work shall the lampstand be made, even its base, its shaft, its cups, its buds, and its flowers, shall be of one piece with it.

Tailo: Lí ê tē-á lāi m̄-thang ū nn̄g tsióng ê tshìn-á-tsí, tsi̍t lia̍p tuā, tsi̍t lia̍p sè.
English: You shall not have in your bag diverse weights, a great and a small.

Tailo: Tsûn-tiúⁿ lâi-kàu i hia, tuì i kóng, Lí tsit-ê hó khùn ê lâng, ná ē án-ne? Khí-.lâi, kiû-kiò lí ê Siōngtè, kiám-tshái Siōngtè ē khuàⁿ-kò͘ lán, hō͘ lán bián bia̍t-bông.
English: So the shipmaster came to him, and said to him, What do you mean, sleeper? Arise, call on your God ! Maybe your God will notice us, so that we won't perish.

Tailo: Piattò͘ tsiū tshut-lâi tuè thiⁿ-sài khì; i m̄-tsai thiⁿ-sài teh tsò ê sī tsin-si̍t ê, lia̍h-tsò sī khuàⁿ-tio̍h ī-siōng.
English: And he went out and followed him. He didn't know that what was being done by the angel was real, but thought he saw a vision.

Tailo: Kiû Lí the̍h tuā-sè ê tîn-pâi, lâi pang-tsān guá.
English: Take hold of shield and buckler, And stand up for my help.

Tailo: M̄-koh, tsa̍p-it-ê bûn-tô͘ khì Ga-lí-la-iah síng, kàu Iésu bat kā in tsí-tīng ê suaⁿ tíng.
English: But the eleven disciples went into Galilee, to the mountain where Jesus had sent them.

Tailo: I hō͘ tsuí tuì tsio̍h-puâⁿ tshìng tshut-.lâi, hō͘ tsuí tshin-tshiūnn kang-hô lâu lo̍h-.lâi.
English: He brought streams also out of the rock, And caused waters to run down like rivers.

Tailo: hō͘ i ê ke tsiàu jîn-ting tsi̍t-ê tsi̍t-ê kiâⁿ uá-.lâi, tsiū tshú-tio̍h Iôtah tsi-tso̍k ê lâng Tsa-la̍h ê kan-á-sun, Tsap-tí ê sun, Kal-mih ê kiáⁿ Akan.
English: and he brought near his household man by man; and Achan, the son of Carmi, the son of Zabdi, the son of Zerah, of the tribe of Judah, was taken.

Tailo: Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsiū tuì Iésu kóng, Lí khuànn, Lí ê bûn-tô͘ tsò An-hioh-ji̍t bô ing-kai tsò ê tāi-tsì.
English: But the Pharisees, when they saw it, said to him, Behold, your disciples do what is not lawful to do on the Sabbath.

Tailo: Bô koh thiaⁿ Iô-tá-iah lâng bô-iáⁿ bô-tsiah ê thuân-suat kah hiah-ê puē-gi̍k tsin-lí ê kài-bīng.
English: not paying attention to Jewish fables and commandments of men who turn away from the truth.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Mô͘se kóng, Lí ji̍p-khì kìnn Huâ-láu, in-uī Guá í-king hō͘ i ê sim kah i ê jîn-sîn ê sim giám-ngē, thang hō͘ Guá hián-bîng Guá tsiah-ê sîn-jiah tī in tiong-kan,
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Go in to Pharaoh, for I have hardened his heart, and the heart of his servants, that I may show these my signs in the midst of them,

Tailo: Tio̍h īng sûn-kim lâi pau, sì-kho͘-uî siuⁿ khí-hîng kim piⁿ.
English: You shall overlay it with pure gold, and make a gold molding around it.

Tailo: Ta̍k lâng tio̍h tsiàu Tsú siúⁿ-sù ê un-sù, tsiàu Siōngtè kíng-tiàu ta̍k lâng ê bo̍k-tik lâi sing-ua̍h. Tse sī guá kàu-tō kok kàu-huē ê tsún-tsik.
English: Only, as the Lord has distributed to each man, as God has called each, so let him walk. So I command in all the assemblies.

Tailo: tiōng-hu thiaⁿ-tio̍h nā tiām-tiām bô tshap i, mā bô m̄ ín-tsún, i só͘ hē tsiah-ê guān lóng ē sîng-li̍p, i iok-sok ka-kī ê iok mā ē sîng-li̍p.
