English: and her husband heard it, and held his peace at her, and didn't disallow her; then all her vows shall stand, and every bond with which she bound her soul shall stand.

Tailo: Iâkop kóng, Ji̍t iáu kuân, tsing-seⁿ tsū-tsi̍p ê sî iáu-buē kàu, tio̍h hō͘ iûⁿ lim tsuí, koh hō͘ in khì tsia̍h tsháu.
English: He said, Behold, it is still the middle of the day, not time to gather the livestock together. Water the sheep, and go and feed them.

Tailo: In ē tsò tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, sī in-uī in m̄-bat Thiⁿ-pē, mā m̄-bat guá.
English: They will do these things because they have not known the Father, nor me.

Tailo: Kiû lí tio̍h kóng, lí sī guá ê sió-muē, hō͘ guá in-uī lí tit-tio̍h pîng-an; guá ê sèⁿ-miā mā tuì lí lâi tit-tio̍h ua̍h.
English: Please say that you are my sister, that it may be well with me for your sake, and that my soul may live because of you.

Tailo: Guá thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsiah-ê uē tsiū tsē-.leh, thî-khàu pi-ai kuí-nā ji̍t, tī thinn-tíng ê Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng kìm-tsia̍h kî-tó, kóng,
English: It happened, when I heard these words, that I sat down and wept, and mourned certain days; and I fasted and prayed before the God of heaven,

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí ê bīn tio̍h tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ ǹg siū uî-khùn ê Êlúsalèm, tshiú-ńg pih khí-.lâi, kóng ī-giân lâi kong-kik tsit-ê siâⁿ.
English: You shall set your face toward the siege of Jerusalem, with your arm uncovered; and you shall prophesy against it.

Tailo: Piattò͘ tsiū mn̄g Iésu kóng, Guán í-king pàng-sak it-tshè lâi tuè Lí, án-ne guán ē tit-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: Then Peter answered, Behold, we have left everything, and followed you. What then will we have?

Tailo: Keh tńg kang, to̍h-sī pī-pān ji̍t ê keh tńg kang, hiah-ê tsè-si-tiúⁿ kah Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng tsò-hué khì kìⁿ Pí-la̍h-to,
English: Now on the next day, which was the day after the Preparation Day, the chief priests and the Pharisees were gathered together to Pilate,

Tailo: In sī gōng lâng ê kiáⁿ-jî, sī hā-tsiān lâng ê kiáⁿ-jî; siū piⁿ-phah hông kuáⁿ-tshut kíng guā.
English: They are children of fools, yes, children of base men. They were flogged out of the land.

Tailo: Iésu iáu teh kóng ê sî, tsa̍p-jī bûn-tô͘ tiong-kan ê Iôtah lâi-kàu-uī, mā ū kui tīn lâng gia̍h to kah thuî-á, tuè tsè-si-tiúⁿ, king-ha̍k kàu-su kah tiúⁿ-ló tsò-hué uá-.lâi.
English: Immediately, while he was still speaking, Judas, one of the twelve, cameand with him a multitude with swords and clubs, from the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders.

Tailo: Koh ū lâng hō͘ lâng īng tsio̍h-thâu tìm, īng kì-á kì, īng to thâi-sí. Mā ū lâng tshīng mî-iûⁿ-á-.sī suaⁿ-iûⁿ ê phuê, sì-kè phun-pho, jím-siū sàn-tshiah, huān-lān kah gi̍k-thāi;
English: They were stoned. They were sawn apart. They were tempted. They were slain with the sword. They went around in sheep skins and in goat skins; being destitute, afflicted, ill-treated

Tailo: Lín kuè Ioltàn hô liáu-āu, tsiū tio̍h tī Ebal suaⁿ khiā guá kin-á-ji̍t só͘ bīng-līng lín hiah-ê tsio̍h, īng hue kā i buah.
English: It shall be, when you are passed over the Jordan, that you shall set up these stones, which I command you this day, in Mount Ebal, and you shall plaster them with plaster.

Tailo: Lí ē tit-tio̍h ún-ba̍t, bián siū tshuì-tsi̍h ê kong-kik; tsai-eh kàu ê sî, lí mā bián-kiaⁿ.
English: You shall be hidden from the scourge of the tongue, Neither shall you be afraid of destruction when it comes.

Tailo: Amátsiah só͘ tshe tńg-khì hiah-ê kun-tuī, m̄-tsún in kah i khì kau-tsiàn ê, in kong-kik Iôtah hiah-ê siâⁿ, tuì Sa-má-lī-a kàu Bia̍t-ho-lông, thâi-sí saⁿ tshing lâng, tshiúⁿ tsin tsē mi̍h.
English: But the men of the army whom Amaziah sent back, that they should not go with him to battle, fell on the cities of Judah, from Samaria even to Beth Horon, and struck of them three thousand, and took much spoil.

Tailo: M̄-koh, lán nā tī kng-bîng tiong sing-ua̍h, tshin-tshiūnn Siōngtè tī kng-bîng tiong, lán tsiū hō͘-siong ū thuân-khè kuan-hē, I ê Kiáⁿ Iésu ê hueh mā ē kè-sio̍k sé-tû lán it-tshè ê tsuē.
English: But if we walk in the light, as he is in the light, we have fellowship with one another, and the blood of Jesus Christ, his Son, cleanses us from all sin.

Tailo: In kiânn khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì, kám tsai kiàn-siàu? Bô, in lóng bô kiàn-siàu, bīn mā bē âng. In-uī án-ne, in ē tī pua̍h-tó ê lâng ê tiong-kan pua̍h-tó; Guá pān in ê sî, in ē tian-tian tó-tó. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: Were they ashamed when they had committed abomination? nay, they were not at all ashamed, neither could they blush: therefore they shall fall among those who fall; at the time that I visit them they shall be cast down, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá tuì ông kóng, Ông nā huann-hí, lí ê lô͘-po̍k tī lí ê bīn-tsîng nā tit-tio̍h un-tián, tsiū kiû lí tshe guá khì Iôtah, kàu guá ê tsó͘-sian hûn-bōng hit-ê siâⁿ, guá thang koh khí hit-ê siâⁿ.
English: I said to the king, If it please the king, and if your servant have found favor in your sight, that you would send me to Judah, to the city of my fathers' tombs, that I may build it.

Tailo: Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng kah king-ha̍k kàu-su nga̍uh-nga̍uh-liām, kóng, Tsit-ê lâng tsiap-la̍p tsuē-jîn koh kah in tsò-hué tsia̍h pn̄g!
English: The Pharisees and the scribes murmured, saying, This man welcomes sinners, and eats with them.

Tailo: Lāu-tuā lâng, lín tio̍h thiaⁿ tsit-ê uē; tsit só͘-tsāi ê jîn-bîn, lín tio̍h àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ, tng lín ê ji̍t á-.sī lín ê tsó͘-sian ê ji̍t, kám bat ū tsit-ê tāi-tsì?
English: Hear this, you elders, And listen, all you inhabitants of the land. Has this ever happened in your days, Or in the days of your fathers?

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, tsū-tsi̍p ê huē-bō͘ it-tshè ê kang lóng tsò uân liáu-āu, só͘-ū Siōngtsú só͘ huan-hù Mô͘se ê, Isulael lâng lóng tsiàu án-ne tsò.
English: Thus all the work of the tent of the tent of meeting was finished. The children of Israel did according to all that Yahweh commanded Moses; so they did.

Tailo: M̄-koh, bô-lūn ji̍p-khì siáⁿ-mi̍h siâⁿ, lâng nā m̄ tsiap-la̍p lín, lín tio̍h tshut-khì in ê tuā ke-lō͘, kóng,
English: But into whatever city you enter, and they don't receive you, go out into the streets of it and say,

Tailo: Iésu siū iau-tshiáⁿ tī Máthài ê tshù tsia̍h pn̄g ê sî, ū tsin tsē thiu-suè ê í-ki̍p tsuē-jîn lâi kah Iésu tsham bûn-tô͘ tsò-hué tsē-toh.
English: It happened as he sat in the house, behold, many tax collectors and sinners came and sat down with Jesus and his disciples.

Tailo: Tsû-ài kah sìn-si̍t sio tú; kong-gī kah pîng-an sio tsim.
English: Mercy and truth meet together. Righteousness and peace have kissed each other.

Tailo: Lí ê lô͘-po̍k bat phah-sí sai kah hîm, tsit-ê bô siū kat-lé ê Huilīsū lâng, mā beh tshin-tshiūnn in tiong-kan ê tsi̍t tsiah, in-uī i biáu-sī íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōngtsú ê kun-tuī.
English: Your servant struck both the lion and the bear: and this uncircumcised Philistine shall be as one of them, seeing he has defied the armies of the living God.

Tailo: Guá ài i-tī Isulael ê sî, Ehulaim ê tsuē-kò kah Sa-má-lī-a ê tsuē-ok tsiū lō͘-hiān. In-uī in tsò tāi-tsì hi-ké, lāi-bīn ū tsha̍t ji̍p-.lâi, guā-bīn ū kui tīn ê tshiúⁿ-kiap.
English: When I would heal Israel, Then the iniquity of Ephraim is uncovered, Also the wickedness of Samaria; For they commit falsehood, And the thief enters in, And the gang of robbers ravages outside.

Tailo: Iôséhuh kā i bīn-tsîng ê tsia̍h-mi̍h pun hō͘ in; to̍k-to̍k Biāniámín só͘ tit-tio̍h ê pí pa̍t lâng gō͘ puē tsē. In tsiū lim tsiú kah Iôséhuh tsò-hué iàn-lo̍k.
English: He sent portions to them from before him, but Benjamin's portion was five times as much as any of theirs. They drank, and were merry with him.

Tailo: I hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú ê lé-mi̍h, nā īng tsiáu-tsiah tsò sio-tsè, tsiū tio̍h hiàn pan-kah á-.sī hún-tsiáu-kiáⁿ tsò lé-mi̍h.
English: If his offering to Yahweh is a burnt offering of birds, then he shall offer his offering of turtledoves, or of young pigeons.

Tailo: Guá nā thâu gia̍h kuân, Lí tsiū tshin-tshiūnn sai jiok uá-lâi beh lia̍h guá, koh tuì guá hián-tshut Lí ê kî-ī.
English: If my head is held high, you hunt me like a lion. Again you show yourself powerful to me.

Tailo: Lí ē tī ji̍t-tiong-tàu sì-kè bong, tshin-tshiūnn tsheⁿ-mê-.ê khuàⁿ bô teh luān bong; lí ê lō͘ bē hing-thong, tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tú-tio̍h tsè-ap kah tshiúⁿ-tua̍t, bô lâng kā lí tsín-kiù.
English: and you shall grope at noonday, as the blind gropes in darkness, and you shall not prosper in your ways: and you shall be only oppressed and robbed always, and there shall be none to save you.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá kā lín kóng, lâng it-tshè ê tsuē-ok kah huí-pòng, lóng ē tit-tio̍h sià-bián; to̍k-to̍k siat-to̍k Sìng Sîn ê, bē-tàng sià-bián.
English: Therefore I tell you, every sin and blasphemy will be forgiven men, but the blasphemy against the Spirit will not be forgiven men.

Tailo: Ū tsai-eh ah, hit-ê kah tsō i ê Tsú kè-kàu ê! I put-kò sī tē-tsiūⁿ hiā-phìⁿ tiong ê tsi̍t tè hiā-phìⁿ; thô͘ kám thang tuì tshiau-thô͘ ê lâng kóng, Lí teh tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? Á-sī lí só͘ tsò ê mi̍h kám thang kóng, I bô tshiú ?
English: Woe to him who strives with his Makera potsherd among the potsherds of the earth! Shall the clay ask him who fashions it, What are you making? or your work, He has no hands?

Tailo: Elísiah tsiū lī-khui hiah-ê gû, tsáu kàu Eliiah ê āu-bīn, kóng, Kiû lí tsún guá tāi-sing tsim guá ê pē-bú, jiân-āu guá tsiū lâi tuè lí. Eliiah kā i kóng, Lí tńg-.khì, guá kám ū tuì lí tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h?
English: He left the oxen, and ran after Elijah, and said, Let me, I pray you, kiss my father and my mother, and then I will follow you. He said to him, Go back again; for what have I done to you?

Tailo: Tsit-ê sī ai-ko, lâng ē īng tsit-ê lâi ai-khàu, lia̍t kok tsiah-ê tsa-bó͘ gín-á ē īng án-ne lâi ai-khàu, in uī-tio̍h Aigi̍p kah i ê jîn-bîn, mā ē īng tsit-ê lâi ai-khàu. Tse sī tsì-kuân Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: This is the lamentation with which they shall lament; the daughters of the nations shall lament therewith; over Egypt, and over all her multitude, shall they lament therewith, says the Lord Yahweh.

Tailo: Mánáse ê tē-kài, tuì Asel khí, kàu Sīkhiàm ê thâu-tsîng ê Bi̍t-bí-tha, hit-ê kài ǹg tsiàⁿ tshiú pîng, kàu Ún-tha-phó͘-a tuà ê jîn-bîn hia.
English: The border of Manasseh was from Asher to Michmethath, which is before Shechem; and the border went along to the right hand, to the inhabitants of En Tappuah.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: The word of Yahweh came to me, saying,

Tailo: Moltékái kì-tsài hiah-ê tāi-tsì, koh siá phue hō͘ Ahasuiló͘ ông ta̍k síng hn̄g-kīn só͘-ū ê Iôtah lâng,
English: Mordecai wrote these things, and sent letters to all the Jews who were in all the provinces of the king Ahasuerus, both near and far,

Tailo: Guá mā beh kā Isulael tso̍k ê sin-si hē tī in ê ngó͘-siōng ê bīn-tsîng, kā lín ê kut-thâu sì-kè hiat tī lín ê tuâⁿ ê sì-kho͘-uî.
English: I will lay the dead bodies of the children of Israel before their idols; and I will scatter your bones round about your altars.

Tailo: Tē tsiūⁿ khiân-sîng ê lâng ē sí-bông, tī lâng ê tiong-kan bô tsìng-ti̍t ê lâng; in lóng bâi-ho̍k beh thâi-sí-lâng, īng lô-bāng tng i ê hiann-tī.
English: The godly man has perished out of the earth, And there is no one upright among men. They all lie in wait for blood; Every man hunts his brother with a net.

Tailo: Guá uī ka-kī khui tsuí-tî, lâi kuàn-ak puê-ióng sing-tióng ê tshiū-nâ.
English: I made myself pools of water, to water from it the forest where trees were reared.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guá tshut līng, só͘-ū ê jîn-bîn, só͘-ū ê kok, só͘-ū ê khiuⁿ-kháu ê lâng, kiàn-nā īng uē siat-to̍k Sia-to-la̍k, Me-siak kah A-bia̍t-ne-go͘ ê Siōngtè ê, guá beh kā in ê bah kuah tshuì-tshuì, in ê tshù ē piàn-tsò pùn-sò-tui, in-uī bô pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng ē tshin-tshiūⁿ án-ne teh kiù lâng.
English: Therefore I make a decree, that every people, nation, and language, which speak anything evil against the God of Shadrach, Meshach, and Abednego, shall be cut in pieces, and their houses shall be made a dunghill; because there is no other god who is able to deliver after this sort.

Tailo: Só͘-í, kàu siu-kuah ê ji̍t, Guá beh kā Guá ê ngó͘-kok tuì in the̍h tò tńg-.lâi, koh tī tshut tsiú ê sî, beh kā Guá ê sin tsiú the̍h tò tńg-.lâi, mā beh kā Guá hō͘ i thang jia tshiah-theh ê iûⁿ-mn̂g kah muâ tshiúⁿ tò tńg-.lâi.
English: Therefore I will take back my grain in its time, And my new wine in its season, And will pluck away my wool and my flax which should have covered her nakedness.

Tailo: Guá ê ba̍k-tsiu só͘ ì-ài ê, guá bô kā i tsó͘-tòng; guá ê sim só͘ huann-hí ê, guá bô kā i kìm-tsí. In-uī guá ê sim uī-tio̍h guá só͘ lô-khó͘ ê lâi khuài-lo̍k; tse to̍h-sī guá tuì só͘-ū ê lô-khó͘ lâi tit-tio̍h ê hūn-gia̍h.
English: Whatever my eyes desired, I didn't keep from them. I didn't withhold my heart from any joy, for my heart rejoiced because of all my labor, and this was my portion from all my labor.

Tailo: Sàulô kàu Amáli̍k ê siâⁿ, bâi-ho̍k tī suaⁿ-kok tiong.
English: Saul came to the city of Amalek, and laid wait in the valley.

Tailo: Isulael ê kiáⁿ-sun lóng ē in-uī Siōngtsú lâi tit-tio̍h tshing-tsò gī, mā beh khua-kháu.
English: In Yahweh shall all the seed of Israel be justified, and shall glory.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Isulael tsiah-ê suaⁿ, lí tio̍h thiaⁿ tsì-kuân Siōngtsú ê uē. Tsì-kuân Siōngtsú tuì tsiah-ê suaⁿ, tsiah-ê niá, tsiah-ê kheⁿ-kau, tsiah-ê suaⁿ-kok, tsiah-ê pha-hng ê só͘-tsāi, siū khì-sak ê siâⁿ, hō͘ sì-kho͘-uî só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê guā-pang lâng tshiúⁿ-kiap khau-sé ê, án-ne kóng.
English: therefore, you mountains of Israel, hear the word of the Lord Yahweh: Thus says the Lord Yahweh to the mountains and to the hills, to the watercourses and to the valleys, to the desolate wastes and to the cities that are forsaken, which are become a prey and derision to the residue of the nations that are round about;

Tailo: I tsiah-ê a-hiaⁿ koh lâi phak tī i ê bīn-tsîng, kóng, Guán sī lí ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: His brothers also went and fell down before his face; and they said, Behold, we are your servants.

Tailo: Páulô kiò tsi̍t-ê liân-tiúⁿ lâi, kóng, Tshiánn tshuā tsit-ê siàu-liân lâng khì kìⁿ iâⁿ-tiúⁿ, in-uī i ū tāi-tsì beh pò i tsai.
English: Paul summoned one of the centurions, and said, Bring this young man to the commanding officer, for he has something to tell him.

Tailo: M̄-thang him-siān pháiⁿ lâng, mā m̄-thang ài kah in tsò-tui.
English: Don't be envious of evil men; Neither desire to be with them:

Tailo: Tsú-lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h i ê bó͘ tuì i só͘ kóng ê uē, Lí ê lô͘-po̍k tshin-tshiūnn án-ne khuán-thāi guá. I tsiū siū-khì.
English: It happened, when his master heard the words of his wife, which she spoke to him, saying, This is what your servant did to me, that his wrath was kindled.

Tailo: Hannah kóng, Guān lí ê lú-pī tī lí ê bīn-tsîng tit-tio̍h un-tián. Tsa-bó͘ lâng tsiū tńg-.khì, lâi lim-tsia̍h, tsiū bô koh-tsài tài iu-iông.
English: She said, Let your handmaid find favor in your sight. So the woman went her way, and ate; and her facial expression wasn't sad any more.

Tailo: Guá ê kiáⁿ, lí tio̍h thiaⁿ, tio̍h ū tì-huī, koh tio̍h ín-tshuā lí ê sim kiânn tsìng-ti̍t ê lō͘.
English: Listen, my son, and be wise, And keep your heart on the right path!

Tailo: Ông kah hiah-ê tāi-sîn lóng lia̍h i ê uē tsò hó, ông tsiū tsiàu Memukan ê uē lâi kiâⁿ.
English: The saying pleased the king and the princes; and the king did according to the word of Memucan:

Tailo: koh khioh tsio̍h-thâu tìm Tabi̍t kah Tabi̍t ông ê jîn-sîn. Hit sî, tsìng lâng kah ióng-sū lóng tī ông ê tsó-iū.
English: He cast stones at David, and at all the servants of king David: and all the people and all the mighty men were on his right hand and on his left.

Tailo: In tī suaⁿ tíng tiô-thiàu tshin-tshiūnn tshia ê siann, koh tshin-tshiūnn hué-iām sio tsháu ê siann, tshin-tshiūnn kiông-bíng ê jîn-bîn pâi tī tsiàn-tīn.
English: Like the noise of chariots on the tops of the mountains do they leap, Like the noise of a flame of fire that devours the stubble, As a strong people set in battle array.

Tailo: In-uī i tī i ê tsuē koh ke-thinn puē-gi̍k; i tī lán tiong-kan phah tshiú, koh īng tsin tsē uē huán-tuì Siōngtè.
English: For he adds rebellion to his sin. He claps his hands among us, And multiplies his words against God.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ lí íng-uán pha-hng, lí tsiah-ê siâⁿ it-tīng bô lâng tuà, lín tsiū it-tīng ē tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: I will make you a perpetual desolation, and your cities shall not be inhabited; and you shall know that I am Yahweh.

Tailo: Lín tsá-tsá khí-.lâi, uàⁿ-uàⁿ khì khùn, tsia̍h lô-lo̍k só͘ tit-tio̍h ê pn̄g mā sī bô tshái-kang. Siōngtsú só͘ thiàⁿ ê lâng, I ē hō͘ in hó khùn.
English: It is vain for you to rise up early, To stay up late, Eating the bread of toil; For he gives sleep to his loved ones.

Tailo: Kî-tiong tsi̍t-ê lu̍t-huat kàu-su lâi beh tshì-thàm Iésu, kóng,
English: One of them, a lawyer, asked him a question, testing him.

Tailo: Kàu hiàn ê-hng-tsè ê sî, sian-ti Eliiah kiâⁿ uá-.lâi, kóng, Abulahàm, Ísak, Isulael ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí kin-á-ji̍t hō͘ lâng tsai Lí tī Isulael tsò Siōngtè, mā tsai guá sī Lí ê lô͘-po̍k, koh sī tsiàu Lí ê uē lâi kiâⁿ tse it-tshè ê tāi-tsì.
English: It happened at the time of the offering of the evening offering, that Elijah the prophet came near, and said, Yahweh, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Israel, let it be known this day that you are God in Israel, and that I am your servant, and that I have done all these things at your word.

Tailo: Samuel kā I-é-sái kóng, Lí ê kiáⁿ kám lóng tī tsia? I-é-sái ìn kóng, Iáu ū tsi̍t-ê suah-bué ê, taⁿ teh tshī iûⁿ. Samuel kā I-é-sái kóng, Lí tio̍h tshe lâng khì tshuā i lâi, in-uī i iáu-buē lâi, lán bô beh tsē-toh.
English: Samuel said to Jesse, Are here all your children? He said, There remains yet the youngest, and behold, he is keeping the sheep. Samuel said to Jesse, Send and get him; for we will not sit down until he come here.

Tailo: Guá tsò gín-á ê sî, kóng-uē tshin-tshiūnn gín-á, sìng-tsîng tshin-tshiūnn gín-á, ì-kiàn tshin-tshiūnn gín-á. Taⁿ guá í-king tuā-lâng ā, tsiū kā gín-á ê tāi-tsì lóng pàng-sak.
English: When I was a child, I spoke as a child, I felt as a child, I thought as a child. Now that I have become a man, I have put away childish things.

Tailo: Tabi̍t kā Gi-bóng lâng kóng, Guá tio̍h uī lín tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h? Guá tio̍h īng siáⁿ-mi̍h lâi thè-sio̍k, thang hō͘ lín tsiok-hok Siōngtsú ê sán-gia̍p?
English: and David said to the Gibeonites, What shall I do for you? And with what shall I make atonement, that you may bless the inheritance of Yahweh?

Tailo: Siâⁿ ê su-kì-kuaⁿ hō͘ kûn-tsiòng an-tsīng liáu-āu, tsiū kóng, Ê-hu-soh lâng, siáⁿ lâng m̄-tsai Ê-hu-soh lâng ê siâⁿ sī tuā A-té-mih ê biō kah tuì thinn-tíng lak lo̍h-lâi hit tè sìng-tsio̍h ê siú-hō͘-tsiá?
English: When the town clerk had quieted the multitude, he said, You men of Ephesus, what man is there who doesn't know that the city of the Ephesians is temple keeper of the great goddess Artemis, and of the image which fell down from Zeus?

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, guá kā tsit-ê tāi-tsì tī tsá-khí sî tuì jîn-bîn kóng, ê-hng guá ê bó͘ tsiū sí. Keh kang tsá-khí, guá tsiū tsun-thàn bīng-līng lâi kiâⁿ.
English: So I spoke to the people in the morning; and at even my wife died; and I did in the morning as I was commanded.

Tailo: I khui kiong, īng guá tsò tsìⁿ-pé.
English: He has bent his bow, and set me as a mark for the arrow.

Tailo: Kâng toh ê lâng sim-lāi siūⁿ kóng tsit-ê teh sià tsuē ê sī siáⁿ lâng?
English: Those who sat at the table with him began to say to themselves, Who is this who even forgives sins?

Tailo: Lí am Lí ê bīn, in tsiū tshau-huân; Lí kā in ê khuì siu-huê, in tsiū sí-bông lâi kui tī thô͘-hún.
English: You hide your face: they are troubled; You take away their breath: they die, and return to the dust.

Tailo: mā hō͘ in tsò kng-thé tī thiⁿ ê kiong-tshong, tsiò-kng tī tē-tsiūⁿ. Tsiū tsiàu án-ne uân-sîng.
English: and let them be for lights in the expanse of sky to give light on the earth, and it was so.

Tailo: I īng kuí-kè lâi tuì-hù lán ê bîn-tso̍k, gi̍k-thāi lán ê tsó͘-sian, bīng-līng in tio̍h kā in ê enn-á tàn tuà guā-bīn, hō͘ in sí.
English: The same took advantage of our race, and mistreated our fathers, and forced them to throw out their babies, so that they wouldn't stay alive.

Tailo: Kiû Lí pó-tsìng Lí ê lô͘-po̍k thang tit-tio̍h hó kíng-gū, m̄-thang hō͘ kiau-ngō͘ ê lâng kā guá ap-tsè!
English: Ensure your servant's well-being. Don't let the proud oppress me.

Tailo: I kah jîn-bîn gī-lūn liáu-āu, tsiū siat-li̍p tshiùⁿ kua o-ló Siōngtsú ê, hō͘ in tshīng sìng koh suí ê saⁿ, kiânn tī kun-tuī ê thâu-tsîng o-ló Siōngtsú, kóng, Tio̍h kám-siā Siōngtsú, in-uī i ê tsû-ài íng-uán tī-.leh.
English: When he had taken counsel with the people, he appointed those who should sing to Yahweh, and give praise in holy array, as they went out before the army, and say, Give thanks to Yahweh; for his loving kindness endures forever.

Tailo: Guá ê lāu-pē hō͘ lín phāinn tāng ê ka-tann, guá beh ke-thinn lín ê ka-tann! Guá ê lāu-pē īng piⁿ kā lín kíng-kài, guá beh īng giat-á-thâng kā lín kíng-kài! '
English: Now whereas my father did lade you with a heavy yoke, I will add to your yoke: my father chastised you with whips, but I will chastise you with scorpions.

Tailo: In tī Isulael lâng ê bīn-tsîng tô-tsáu, tuì Bia̍t-ho-lông lo̍h-.khì ê sî, Siōngtsú tuì thiⁿ lo̍h tuā pha̍uh tī in ê sin tsiūⁿ, it-ti̍t kàu A-tse-kah hō͘ in sí, hiah-ê hō͘ pha̍uh phah-sí ê, pí Isulael lâng īng to thâi-sí ê khah tsē.
English: It happened, as they fled from before Israel, while they were at the descent of Beth Horon, that Yahweh cast down great stones from the sky on them to Azekah, and they died: they were more who died with the hailstones than they whom the children of Israel killed with the sword.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Babúlông hiah-ê siú-líng tshe sù-tsiá lâi i hia, beh mn̄g kok lāi só͘-ū ê kî-sū; tī tsit-ê tāi-tsì Siōngtè lī-khui i, beh kā i tshì-giām, thang tsai i sim-lāi tsuân-pō͘ só͘-ū ê.
English: However in the business of the ambassadors of the princes of Babylon, who sent to him to inquire of the wonder that was done in the land, God left him, to try him, that he might know all that was in his heart.

Tailo: I tuì hit-ê liân-tiúⁿ tsai-iáⁿ Iésu í-king sí-.khì, tsiū ín-tsún kā sin-si kau hō͘ Iôséhuh.
English: When he found out from the centurion, he granted the body to Joseph.

Tailo: Hó lâng tuì só͘ tsik-tsū ê hó lâi hián-tshut liông-siān; pháiⁿ lâng tuì só͘ tsik-tsū ê pháiⁿ lâi hián-tshut siâ-ok.
English: The good man out of his good treasure brings out good things, and the evil man out of his evil treasure brings out evil things.

Tailo: Guán suî-jiân puē-gi̍k Tsú — guán ê Siōngtè, tsóng-.sī, liân-bín sià tsuē sī tsāi tī I;
English: To the Lord our God belong mercies and forgiveness; for we have rebelled against him;

Tailo: Lí thâu-khak tíng ê thiⁿ ē piàn-tsò tâng, kha tsîng ê tē ē piàn-tsò thih.
English: Your sky that is over your head shall be brass, and the earth that is under you shall be iron.

Tailo: Taⁿ Siōngtè hō͘ lán ê Tsú Iésu koh-ua̍h khí-.lâi, thong-kuè Iésu só͘ lâu ê hueh, lâi khak-li̍p íng-uán ê iok, hō͘ Iésu tsiâⁿ-tsò ín-tshuā iûⁿ-kûn ê tuā-bo̍k-tsiá.
English: Now may the God of peace, who brought again from the dead the great shepherd of the sheep with the blood of an eternal covenant, our Lord Jesus,

Tailo: Só͘-í, nā ū lâng kā lín kóng, ' Lín khuànn, Ki-tok tī khòng-iá. ', lín m̄-thang tshut-.khì; á-.sī kóng, ' Lín khuànn, Ki-tok tī pâng-king lāi. ', lín mā m̄-thang siong-sìn.
English: If therefore they tell you, Behold, he is in the wilderness,' don't go out; Behold, he is in the inner chambers,' don't believe it.

Tailo: Guá siá tsiah-ê tāi-tsì hō͘ lín, sī teh tsí hiah-ê siūⁿ beh bê-hi̍k lín ê lâng.
English: These things I have written to you concerning those who would lead you astray.

Tailo: M̄-bián kiaⁿ lí teh beh siū ê khó͘-lān. Lí khuàⁿ, Mô͘-kuí beh kā lín tiong-kan kuí-nā-ê lâng kuaiⁿ lo̍h kaⁿ, lâi kā lín khó-giām, lín ē siū khó͘-lān tsa̍p kang. Lí tio̍h tsīn-tiong kàu sí, guá ē siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lí ua̍h-miā ê îng-kuan.
English: Don't be afraid of the things which you are about to suffer. Behold, the devil is about to throw some of you into prison, that you may be tested; and you will have oppression for ten days. Be faithful to death, and I will give you the crown of life.

Tailo: Hō͘ i tshin-ba̍k khuàⁿ-tio̍h ka-kī pāi-huāi, pún-sin lim Tsuân-lîng-.ê ê siū-khì.
English: Let his own eyes see his destruction. Let him drink of the wrath of the Almighty.

Tailo: Lín só͘ kì-liām ê Tsim-giân sī tshin-tshiūnn hué-hu; lín ê iâⁿ-tsē sī thô͘-muê ê iâⁿ-tsē.
English: Your memorable sayings are proverbs of ashes, Your defenses are defenses of clay.

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn Guá beh hō͘ hiah-ê ap-tsè lí ê tsia̍h ka-kī ê bah, in mā beh lim ka-kī ê hueh lim kàu tsuì, tshin-tshiūnn lim tiⁿ-tsiú án-ne. Kiàn-nā ū hia̍t-khì ê, lóng ē tsai Guá — Siōngtsú sī lí ê Kiù-tsú, sī kiù-sio̍k lí ê Tsú, sī Iâkop ê tuā kuân-lîng-.ê.
English: I will feed those who oppress you with their own flesh; and they shall be drunken with their own blood, as with sweet wine: and all flesh shall know that I, Yahweh, am your Savior, and your Redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.

Tailo: In sim-lāi siūⁿ kóng, lán tio̍h tsuân-pō͘ kā i huí-huāi; in tī tsuân tē kā Siōngtè ê huē-tn̂g lóng sio-sio-.khì.
English: They said in their heart, We will crush them completely. They have burned up all the places in the land where God was worshiped.

Tailo: I ê bah pí gín-á ê bah khah iù-nńg; i ē huê-ho̍k siàu-liân ê ji̍t-tsí.
English: His flesh shall be fresher than a child's; He returns to the days of his youth.

Tailo: In tsua̍t-tuì bē tit-tio̍h khuàⁿ-tio̍h Guá tuì in ê tsó͘-sian só͘ tsiù-tsuā ìng-ín ê tē. Só͘-ū khuànn-khin Guá ê lâng lóng bē-tàng khuàⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: surely they shall not see the land which I swore to their fathers, neither shall any of those who despised me see it:

Tailo: In ê tshù ū kuí-tsà muá-muá, sī tshin-tshiūnn tsiáu-lang lāi ū tsiáu-á muá-muá; só͘-í, in tsiâⁿ-tsò tuā koh hó-gia̍h.
English: As a cage is full of birds, so are their houses full of deceit: therefore they are become great, and grew rich.

Tailo: Tabi̍t kah Isulael jîn-bîn tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng tsīn-la̍t tshiùⁿ kua, īng khîm, sik, lô, kó͘ kah kó͘-tshue, tsàu ga̍k thiàu-bú.
English: David and all Israel played before God with all their might, even with songs, and with harps, and with psalteries, and with tambourines, and with cymbals, and with trumpets.

Tailo: Tuì sù-tô͘ pò-kò tsiah-ê tāi-tsì ê, to̍h-sī Ma̍k-ta-lé ê Mâlíah kah Iô-a-ná, Iâkop ê lāu-bú Mâlíah, í-ki̍p kî-tha kah in tsò-tīn ê hū-jîn-lâng.
English: Now they were Mary Magdalene, Joanna, and Mary the mother of James. The other women with them told these things to the apostles.

Tailo: Si-óng ê jîn-bîn, ing-kai tio̍h tshiùⁿ kua; Isulael, tio̍h huann-hí lâi kiû kiò! Êlúsalèm ê jîn-bîn, tio̍h muá-sim huann-hí khuài-lo̍k!
English: Sing, daughter of Zion! Shout, Israel! Be glad and rejoice with all your heart, daughter of Jerusalem.

Tailo: Ū kuí-nā-ê bûn-tô͘ hō͘-siong kóng, I kā lán kóng, ' Koh bô guā kú, lín tsiū bē-tàng khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá, koh-tsài bô guā kú, lín tsiū ē koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá. ', koh kóng, ' In-uī guá teh beh tńg-khì Thiⁿ-pē hia. ' Tsiah-ê uē sī siáⁿ-mi̍h ì-sù?
English: Some of his disciples therefore said to one another, What is this that he says to us, A little while, and you won't see me, and again a little while, and you will see me;' and, Because I go to the Father?'

Tailo: mā m̄-thang tī An-hioh-ji̍t tuì tshù lāi taⁿ tàⁿ tshut-.khì, bô-lūn siáⁿ-mi̍h kang lóng m̄-thang tsò, to̍k-to̍k tio̍h lia̍h An-hioh-ji̍t tsò sìng-ji̍t, tsiàu Guá pîng-sî huan-hù lín ê tsó͘-sian ê.'
English: neither carry forth a burden out of your houses on the Sabbath day holy, neither do any work: but make the Sabbath day, as I commanded your fathers.

Tailo: lâi-kàu kng phó͘-thinn-ē ê tsì-kuân Siōngtsú ê iok-kuī ê tsè-si hia, in ê kha khiā tī Ioltàn hô ê tsuí, Ioltàn hô ê tsuí to̍h-sī tuì tíng-bīn lâu lo̍h-.lâi ê tsuí ē tsia̍t-tn̄g, khiā khí-lâi tsiâⁿ-tsò tsuí-tshiûⁿ.
English: It shall come to pass, when the soles of the feet of the priests who bear the ark of Yahweh, the Lord of all the earth, shall rest in the waters of the Jordan, that the waters of the Jordan shall be cut off, even the waters that come down from above; and they shall stand in one heap.

Tailo: I koh tuà it-tshè ê tsing-seⁿ kah só͘ tsik-tsū ê tsâi-bu̍t; só͘ tit-tio̍h ê tsing-seⁿ, sī tī Pa-tàn-a-lâm só͘ tit-tio̍h ê. I beh khì Ka-nân tē, khì i ê lāu-pē Ísak hia.
English: and he took away all his livestock, and all his possessions which he had gathered, including the livestock which he had gained in Paddan Aram, to go to Isaac his father, to the land of Canaan.

Tailo: Iésu kā in kóng, Án-ne, Tabi̍t hō͘ Sìng Sîn kám-tōng ê sî, ná ē tshing Ki-tok tsò Tsú, kóng,
English: He said to them, How then does David in the Spirit call him Lord, saying,

Tailo: In-uī im-kan bē-tàng kám-siā Lí, sí-bông bē-tàng o-ló Lí; lo̍h hûn-bōng ê lâng bē-tàng ǹg-bāng Lí ê sîng-si̍t.
English: For Sheol can't praise you. Death can't celebrate you. Those who go down into the pit can't hope for your truth.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lán tio̍h pá-ak ki-huē lâi tuì tsìng lâng tsò hó sū, iû-kî-sī tuì hiah-ê tuì sìn tsiâⁿ-tsò tsi̍t ke ê lâng koh khah tio̍h tì-ì.
English: So then, as we have opportunity, let's do what is good toward all men, and especially toward those who are of the household of the faith.

Tailo: Tsá-khí sî tio̍h iā lí ê tsíng-tsí, ê-hng sî mā m̄-thang thîng lí ê tshiú, in-uī lí m̄-tsai tó tsi̍t-ê ē bō͘-sīng, sī tsit-ê á-.sī hit-ê, á-.sī nn̄g-ê ē pêⁿ hó.
English: In the morning sow your seed, And in the evening don't withhold your hand; For you don't know which will prosper, whether this or that, Or whether they both will be equally good.

Tailo: Hit sî, hué-iām sio tī suaⁿ-.ni̍h, lín thiaⁿ-tio̍h hit-ê tuì o͘-àm tiong tshut-.lâi ê siann, lín tsi-tso̍k só͘-ū ê siú-líng kah tiúⁿ-ló lóng lâi kìnn guá.
English: It happened, when you heard the voice out of the midst of the darkness, while the mountain was burning with fire, that you came near to me, even all the heads of your tribes, and your elders;

Tailo: Sûn-lô tsuân tē ê lâng ē king-kuè hia, nā ū lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h lâng ê kut-hâi, tsiū tī hia li̍p tsi̍t-ê kì-hō, thìng-hāu bâi-tsòng ê lâng kā i bâi-tsòng tī Ha-mong-gok ê suaⁿ-kok.
English: Those who pass through the land shall pass through; and when any sees a man's bone, then shall he set up a sign by it, until the undertakers have buried it in the valley of Hamon Gog.

Tailo: Tuì hiah-ê kim-sè hó-gia̍h ê lâng, lí tio̍h kā in huan-hù, m̄-thang kiau-ngō͘, m̄-thang kā in ê ǹg-bāng hē tī bô tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê tsîⁿ-tsâi, tio̍h uá-khò kā bān-mi̍h hong-hong hù-hù hō͘ lán hióng-siū ê Siōngtè.
English: Charge those who are rich in this present world that they not be haughty, nor have their hope set on the uncertainty of riches, but on the living God, who richly provides us with everything to enjoy;

Tailo: Guán siū huí-pòng, iáu-koh hó-tshuì ìn-tap; taⁿ guán kìng-jiân hō͘ lâng khuàⁿ-tsò sī sè-kan ê pùn-sò, bān-mi̍h ê pùn-sò-tui.
English: Being defamed, we entreat. We are made as the filth of the world, the dirt wiped off by all, even until now.

Tailo: I iau kah siūⁿ beh the̍h ti teh tsia̍h ê tāu-phoh lâi tsí-iau, mā lóng bô lâng beh hō͘ i tsia̍h.
English: He wanted to fill his belly with the husks that the pigs ate, but no one gave him any.

Tailo: Só͘lômóng mā tsò Siōngtsú ê tiān lāi it-tshè ê khì-kū, to̍h-sī kim-tuâⁿ kah pâi-lia̍t piáⁿ ê toh, sī īng kim tsò ê;
English: Solomon made all the vessels that were in the house of Yahweh: the golden altar, and the table whereupon the show bread was, of gold;

Tailo: Hit tíng-bīn īng piáⁿ pâi tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, sī tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ huan-hù Mô͘se ê.
English: He set the bread in order on it before Yahweh, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: I ē huí-huāi, tshin-tshiūnn lâng huí-huāi sio-huî lâng ê huî-khì, kòng tshuì mā bô pó-sioh, tì-sú tshuì-phìⁿ ê tiong-kan tshuē bô tsi̍t-phìⁿ thang tuì hué-lô͘ lâi tshú hué, tuì tî lāi lâi iúⁿ tsuí.
English: He will break it as a potter's vessel is broken, breaking it in pieces without sparing, so that there won't be found among the broken piece a piece good enough to take fire from the hearth, or to dip up water out of the cistern.

Tailo: Gîtióng thiaⁿ-tio̍h tsit-ê bāng ê uē kah i ê kái-sueh, tsiū kìng-pài Siōngtsú, tò tńg-lâi-kàu Isulael ê iâⁿ tiong, kóng, Khí-.lâi, in-uī Siōngtsú í-king kā Mítiân ê kun-tuī kau tī lín ê tshiú à.
English: It was so, when Gideon heard the telling of the dream, and the interpretation of it, that he worshiped; and he returned into the camp of Israel, and said, Arise; for Yahweh has delivered into your hand the army of Midian.

Tailo: Hiah-ê lâng tuì hia ua̍t tńg-sin, ǹg So͘tóm-khì; Abulahàm iáu khiā tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng.
English: The men turned from there, and went toward Sodom, but Abraham stood yet before Yahweh.

Tailo: Tuì tsit sî khí, Huilīsū lâng tsiū khut-ho̍k, m̄-káⁿ koh ji̍p-lâi Isulael lâng ê kíng lāi. Samuel it-sing ê ji̍t-tsí tiong-kan, Siōngtsú ê tshiú kong-kik Huilīsū lâng.
English: So the Philistines were subdued, and they came no more within the border of Israel: and the hand of Yahweh was against the Philistines all the days of Samuel.

Tailo: Tsá-tsîng Tsa-la̍h ê kan-á-sun Akan, kám bô tī hit-ê ing-kai hiàn ê mi̍h huān tsuē, tsiū ū siū-khì lîm-kàu tī Isulael ê tsuân huē-tsiòng? Hit-ê lâng tī i só͘ huān ê tsuē, m̄-nā i ka-kī tsi̍t-ê lâng sí.
English: Didn't Achan the son of Zerah commit a trespass in the devoted thing, and wrath fell on all the congregation of Israel? and that man didn't perish alone in his iniquity.

Tailo: Guá ê tsú-bîn, lí tio̍h thiaⁿ, guá beh tuì lí tsò kiàn-tsìng; Isulael, guān lí tsun-thàn guá.
English: Hear, my people, and I will testify to you, Israel, if you would listen to me!

Tailo: Tsiong-lâi Iâkop ē tìng i ê kin; Isulael ē huat-gê khui hue, in ê kué-tsí ē tshiong-muá sè-kài.
English: In days to come, Jacob will take root. Israel will blossom and bud. They will fill the surface of the world with fruit.

Tailo: Kàu tiong-tàu, Eliiah khau-sé in kóng, Tuā siaⁿ kiû-kiò à! In-uī i sī sîn-bîng, i kiám-tshái tiām-tiām teh siūⁿ, á-.sī thè-khì phian-phiah ê só͘-tsāi, á-.sī kiâⁿ lō͘, á-.sī teh khùn, lín tio̍h kā i kiò-tshéⁿ.
English: It happened at noon, that Elijah mocked them, and said, Cry aloud; for he is a god: either he is musing, or he is gone aside, or he is on a journey, or peradventure he sleeps and must be awakened.

Tailo: Guá tuì kiau-ngō͘ ê lâng kóng, M̄-thang kiau-ngō͘! Tuì pháiⁿ lâng kóng, M̄-thang tián-ui!
English: I said to the arrogant, Don't boast; To the wicked, Don't lift up the horn.

Tailo: Mā uī-tio̍h gû-káng, iûⁿ-káng kah iûⁿ-á, suà hiàn i ê sò͘-tsè, i ê kuàn-tiān, lóng tsiàu in ê sò͘-gia̍h, tsiàu hit-ê lē.
English: their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bull, for the ram, and for the lambs, shall be according to their number, after the ordinance:

Tailo: Tabi̍t kā Abigail kóng, Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè sī ing-kai o-ló ê, in-uī I kin-á-ji̍t tshe lí lâi tú-tio̍h guá.
English: David said to Abigail, Blessed be Yahweh, the God of Israel, who sent you this day to meet me:

Tailo: Kā tsìng lâng kuáⁿ tshut-.khì liáu-āu, Iésu tsiū ji̍p-khì tsa-bó͘ gín-á ê pâng-king, khan i ê tshiú. Tsa-bó͘ gín-á tsiū khí-.lâi.
English: But when the crowd was put out, he entered in, took her by the hand, and the girl arose.

Tailo: Tiū-tiâⁿ kah tsiú-khut bô beh iúⁿ-tshī in; ǹg-bāng sin tsiú mā sī khang-khang.
English: The threshing floor and the winepress won't feed them, And the new wine will fail her.

Tailo: Lí tsi̍t ē pûn-hong, hái tsiū kā in khàm ba̍t; in tshin-tshiūnn iân tîm tī tuā-tsuí tiong.
English: You blew with your wind. The sea covered them. They sank like lead in the mighty waters.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tsín-tsè ê sî, m̄-thang tshin-tshiūnn ké-hó ê lâng tī huē-tn̂g á-.sī ke-lō͘ pûn kó͘-tshue suan-thuân, ài hō͘ lâng kā i o-ló. Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, in í-king tit-tio̍h in ê pò-siúⁿ à.
English: Therefore when you do merciful deeds, don't sound a trumpet before yourself, as the hypocrites do in the synagogues and in the streets, that they may get glory from men. Most assuredly I tell you, they have received their reward.

Tailo: Guán thong-kuè Ki-tok, tuì Siōngtè ū tsit khuán ê khak-sìn tsiah ē án-ne kóng.
English: Such confidence we have through Christ toward God;

Tailo: Lí tio̍h īng tsô-kia̍p tshâ tsò tuâⁿ, tn̂g gō͘ tiú, khuah gō͘ tiú, tsit-ê tuâⁿ sī sì-kak-hîng ê, kuân saⁿ tiú.
English: You shall make the altar of acacia wood, five cubits long, and five cubits broad; the altar shall be foursquare: and its height shall be three cubits.

Tailo: Su-kì Siahuánn koh tuì ông kóng, Tsè-si Hilkíiah ū the̍h tsi̍t pún tsheh hō͘ guá. Siahuánn tsiū tī ông ê bīn-tsîng kā i tiah iàu-tiám lâi tha̍k.
English: Shaphan the scribe told the king, saying, Hilkiah the priest has delivered me a book. Shaphan read therein before the king.

Tailo: In-uī guá tsai, lín ê sìn-gióng king-kuè khó-giām ē sán-sing jím-nāi.
English: knowing that the testing of your faith produces endurance.

Tailo: Tshia-lián kah in ê tsò-huat ê khuán-sit tshin-tshiūnn n̂g-gi̍k ê sik-tì; sì-ê lián ê hîng-siōng siâng tsi̍t-khuán, in ê khuán-sit kah tsò-huat sī tshin-tshiūnn lián tiong ū lián.
English: The appearance of the wheels and their work was like a beryl: and they four had one likeness; and their appearance and their work was as it were a wheel within a wheel.

Tailo: Guān sù jím-nāi kah an-uì ê Siōngtè, hō͘ lín tāi-ke tâng-sim lâi ha̍k-si̍p Ki-tok Iésu ê bô͘-iūⁿ,
English: Now the God of patience and of encouragement grant you to be of the same mind one with another according to Christ Jesus,

Tailo: In bô thang ǹg Siōngtsú tiān-tsiú （ Tsù, kā tsiú tò lo̍h-khì thô͘-kha lâi hiàn tsè ）, in ê tsè-mi̍h mā bô tit-tio̍h I huann-hí. In ē tshin-tshiūⁿ tú-tio̍h sí-sit ê ke ê tsia̍h-mi̍h, kiàn-nā tsia̍h ê it-tīng bak-tio̍h lah-sap; in-uī in ê tsia̍h-mi̍h thang tsò ka-kī ê lō͘-īng, bē-tàng ji̍p-khì Siōngtsú ê tiān.
English: They won't pour out wine offerings to Yahweh, Neither will they be pleasing to him. Their sacrifices will be to them like the bread of mourners; All who eat of it will be polluted; For their bread will be for their appetite. It will not come into the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: Tappúah ê tē kui Mánáse, to̍k-to̍k Mánáse ê kau-kài ê Tappúah kui Ehulaim ê kiáⁿ-sun.
English: The land of Tappuah belonged to Manasseh; but Tappuah on the border of Manasseh belonged to the children of Ephraim.

Tailo: M̄-koh, só͘ su-iàu ê kan-tāⁿ tsi̍t hāng; Mâlíah í-king kíng-tio̍h hó ê hit hūn, bô lâng ē-tàng kā i tshiúⁿ-.khì.
English: but one thing is needed. Mary has chosen the good part, which will not be taken away from her.

Tailo: Tuì-ti̍k bē-tàng iâⁿ-kuè i; hiong-ok ê lâng bô huat-tō͘ kā i khó͘-to̍k.
English: No enemy will tax him. No wicked man will oppress him.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h ē kì-tit, Tsú ē kā lín pò-siúⁿ, hō͘ lín tuì I tit-tio̍h sán-gia̍p. Lín sī teh ho̍k-sāi Tsú Ki-tok.
English: knowing that from the Lord you will receive the reward of the inheritance; for you serve the Lord Christ.

Tailo: In tsiū ua̍t tńg-sin tsiūⁿ suaⁿ-tē khì, lâi-kàu E-si-kol ê suaⁿ-kok, thàm-khuàⁿ hit só͘-tsāi.
English: and they turned and went up into the hill country, and came to the valley of Eshcol, and spied it out.

Tailo: Lín tio̍h hiàn phang-phang ê sio-tsè hō͘ Siōngtsú, to̍h-sī gû-káng-á tsi̍t tsiah, mî-iûⁿ-káng tsi̍t tsiah, bī-muá-nî ê iûⁿ-káng-á tshit tsiah, lóng tio̍h bô khuat-tiám ê.
English: but you shall offer a burnt offering to Yahweh for a sweet savor: one young bull, one ram, seven male lambs a year old; they shall be to you without blemish;

Tailo: I tiàm tī tsio̍h-phiâⁿ, tuà tī kiā-piah kah kian-kò͘ ê só͘-tsāi.
English: On the cliff he dwells, and makes his home, On the point of the cliff, and the stronghold.

Tailo: Guá ê sim tio̍h-kip tshin-tshiūnn hué teh kā guá sio sí, in-uī guá ê tuì-ti̍k bē kì-tit Lí ê uē.
English: My zeal wears me out, Because my enemies ignore your words.

Tailo: Thong-kuè Iésu tsi̍t pái ê hiàn tsè, hō͘ sìng-huà kui sio̍k Tsú ê lâng íng-uán uân-tsuân.
English: For by one offering he has perfected forever those who are being sanctified.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tsiū tuì guá kóng, Ē ū tsai-hō tuì pak-hong huat-tshut, lîm-kàu tuà tī tsit só͘-tsāi só͘-ū ê jîn-bîn.
English: Then Yahweh said to me, Out of the north evil shall break forth on all the inhabitants of the land.

Tailo: Thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâng lóng tsin tio̍h-kiaⁿ;
English: All who heard it wondered at the things which were spoken to them by the shepherds.

Tailo: In ê ba̍k-tsiu khui, tsiū jīn-tshut I sī Iésu, I suî-sî tuì in tiong-kan siau-sit.
English: Their eyes were opened, and they recognized him, and he vanished out of their sight.

Tailo: Hûn thîng tī huē-bō͘, bô-lūn sī nn̄g ji̍t á-.sī tsi̍t gue̍h-ji̍t á-.sī tsi̍t nî, Isulael lâng iû-guân tsat iâⁿ tī hia, bô tshut-huat; tsóng-.sī, hûn siu tńg-.khì, in tsiū tshut-huat.
English: Whether it was two days, or a month, or a year that the cloud stayed on the tabernacle, remaining on it, the children of Israel remained encamped, and didn't travel; but when it was taken up, they traveled.

Tailo: Ông huan-hù thài-kàm-tiúⁿ — A-si-pe-na-tsuh tio̍h tuì Isulael ê ông-tshin kah kuì-tso̍k ê tiong-kan tshuā kuí-ê lâng lâi;
English: The king spoke to Ashpenaz the master of his eunuchs, that he should bring in certain of the children of Israel, even of the seed royal and of the nobles;

Tailo: Siū siong ê lô͘-uí, I bô at-tn̄g; beh hua ê ting-hué, I bô phah-sit. I tsiàu tsin-si̍t, kā kong-lí thuân-pò͘.
English: He won't break a bruised reed. He won't quench a dimly burning wick. He will faithfully bring justice.

Tailo: In lī-khui Le-hui-tim, lâi-kàu Si-nái ê khòng-iá, tsiū tī khòng-iá tsat iâⁿ, Isulael lâng tsiū tī hit-ê suaⁿ ê thâu-tsîng tsat iâⁿ.
English: When they had departed from Rephidim, and had come to the wilderness of Sinai, they encamped in the wilderness; and there Israel encamped before the mountain.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-kuá Êlúsalèm ê lâng teh kóng, Tsit-ê kám m̄-sī in siūⁿ beh sat-hāi ê lâng?
English: Therefore some of them of Jerusalem said, Isn't this he whom they seek to kill?

Tailo: Guá tī àm-tiong siū tsō, tī tē-hú tsin tshim ê só͘-tsāi siū tsiap liân khí-.lâi; hit sî, guá ê hîng-thé bô tuì Lí ún-muâ.
English: My frame wasn't hidden from you, When I was made in secret, Woven together in the depths of the earth.

Tailo: Jiânāu, Iésu the̍h piáⁿ tsiok-siā liáu-āu, peh-khui, the̍h hō͘ in, kóng, Tsit-ê sī guá ê sing-khu, uī-tio̍h lín lâi hiàn ê, lín tio̍h án-ne tsò, lâi kì-liām guá.
English: He took bread, and when he had given thanks, he broke it, and gave to them, saying, This is my body which is given for you. Do this in memory of me.

Tailo: lî ū la̍k-bān tsi̍t-tshing tsiah;
English: and seventy-one thousand donkeys,

Tailo: Lín tio̍h īng khí-thâu si̍k ê mī-hún tsò piáⁿ, hiàn tsò kí-tsè; lín kí-khí, tshin-tshiūnn kí-khí tiūⁿ-tiâⁿ ê ngó͘-kok sio-siâng.
English: Of the first of your dough you shall offer up a cake for a wave offering: as the wave offering of the threshing floor, so shall you heave it.

Tailo: Guán in-uī Lí ê iân-kò͘ kui ji̍t siū sat-hāi; lâng khuànn guán tshin-tshiūnn beh hông thâi ê iûⁿ.
English: Yes, for your sake we are killed all day long. We are regarded as sheep for the slaughter.

Tailo: Palân tsá-khí khí-.lâi, tsún-pī lî-á kah Mô͘ap ê siú-líng tsò-hué khì.
English: Balaam rose up in the morning, and saddled his donkey, and went with the princes of Moab.

Tailo: Giân-gí tsió ê lâng ū tì-sik, sìng-tsîng tsū-tsāi ê lâng ū tshong-bîng.
English: He who spares his words has knowledge. He who is even tempered is a man of understanding.

Tailo: In-uī in ka-kī kiò-tsò sìng-siâⁿ ê jîn-bîn, uá-khò Isulael ê Siōngtè, I ê miâ kiò-tsò bān-kun ê I-é-ho-bah.
English: (for they call themselves of the holy city, and stay themselves on the God of Israel; Yahweh of Armies is his name):

Tailo: Tsú-lâng mā án-ne kā i kóng, ' Hō͘ lí mā kuán-lí gō͘-ê siâⁿ. '
English: So he said to him, And you are to be over five cities.'

Tailo: Lín tio̍h kiaⁿ to-kiàm, in-uī siū-khì tsiū ū to-kiàm ê hîng-hua̍t, hō͘ lín tsai ū sím-phuàⁿ.
English: Be afraid of the sword, For wrath brings the punishments of the sword, That you may know there is a judgment.

Tailo: Lí ê sim nā siūⁿ kóng, ' Siōngtsú só͘ bô kóng ê uē, guán beh ná ē tsai? '
English: If you say in your heart, How shall we know the word which Yahweh has not spoken?

Tailo: Lí ê tshiú tio̍h gia̍h tsi̍t ki kuái-á, īng i lâi kiâⁿ sîn-jiah.
English: You shall take this rod in your hand, with which you shall do the signs.

Tailo: Guán tuì thian-hō͘ sio hiuⁿ kuàn-tiān ê sî, guán tsò piáⁿ lâi kā i ho̍k-sāi, tuì i kuàn-tiān, guán ê tiōng-hu kám bô hūn?
English: When we burned incense to the queen of the sky, and poured out drink offerings to her, did we make her cakes to worship her, and pour out drink offerings to her, without our husbands?

Tailo: Lí tó-.leh, it-tīng bē kiaⁿ; lí tó lo̍h-khì bîn-tshn̂g, ē tsin hó khùn.
English: When you lie down, you will not be afraid. Yes, you will lie down, and your sleep will be sweet.

Tailo: Guá tshuā Iôtah hiah-ê siú-líng tsiūⁿ-khì siâⁿ tshiûⁿ tíng, kā o-ló kah kám-siā ê hun-tsò nn̄g tuā tuī. Tsi̍t-tuī tī siâⁿ tíng tuì tsiànn pîng ǹg pùn-sò mn̂g khì.
English: Then I brought up the princes of Judah on the wall, and appointed two great companies who gave thanks and went in procession. One went on the right hand on the wall toward the dung gate;

Tailo: In-uī lín ē tshin-tshiūⁿ hio̍h ta-.khì ê siōng tshiū, ē tshin-tshiūⁿ bô tsuí ê hn̂g.
English: For you shall be as an oak whose leaf fades, And as a garden that has no water.

Tailo: I tsū-guān khiam-pi, sūn-ho̍k kàu sí, sīm-tsì sí tī si̍p-jī-kè tíng.
English: And being found in human form, he humbled himself, becoming obedient to death, yes, the death of the cross.

Tailo: Iésu khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t tsiah lî-á-kiáⁿ, tsiū khan lâi khiâ. Tsiàu king-tián só͘ kì-tsài,
English: Jesus, having found a young donkey, sat on it. As it is written,

Tailo: Pháiⁿ lâng tī kiau-ngō͘ tiong jiok khùn-khó͘ ê lâng tsin kín-kip, guān in hām-lo̍h tī ka-kī só͘ siat ê kè-bô͘.
English: In arrogance, the wicked hunt down the weak; They are caught in the schemes that they devise.

Tailo: Hit kù Beh koh tsi̍t pái Sī tsí-bîng hiah-ê siū tsō ê mi̍h beh siū iô-tāng, beh siū tshian-suá, hō͘ hiah-ê bô siū iô-tāng ê kú-tn̂g lâu lo̍h-.lâi.
English: This phrase, Yet once more, signifies the removing of those things that are shaken, as of things that have been made, that those things which are not shaken may remain.

Tailo: to̍h-sī Lí thok Lí ê lô͘-po̍k — tsiah-ê sian-ti só͘ bīng-līng ê kóng, ' Lín só͘ khì beh sîng-tsiap tsò sán-gia̍p ê tē sī ù-uè ê tē, uī-tio̍h hiah-ê kok ê jîn-bîn ê ù-uè kah in khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì, in-uī in hō͘ tsuân tē tuì tsit pîng kàu hit pîng, muá-muá sī lah-sap.
English: which you have commanded by your servants the prophets, saying, The land, to which you go to possess it, is an unclean land through the uncleanness of the peoples of the lands, through their abominations, which have filled it from one end to another with their filthiness:

Tailo: Lín nā bô kah kî-tha ê kiáⁿ-jî kāng-khuán siū kuán-kà, to̍h-sī su-sing-tsú, m̄-sī tsin-tsiàⁿ ê kiáⁿ-jî.
English: But if you are without discipline, of which all have been made partakers, then are you illegitimate, and not children.

Tailo: Khang-hi ê lâng lóng bô sim-su, lâng tshut-sì tshin-tshiūnn iá-lî ê lî-á-kiáⁿ.
English: But vain man can become wise If a man can be born as a wild donkey's colt.

Tailo: tsiū kā hit-ê gîn kau hō͘ tsò-kang ê lâng, lâi siu-lí Siōngtsú ê tiān.
English: for they gave that to those who did the work, and repaired therewith the house of Yahweh.

Tailo: Hit sî, lí kiû-kiò, Siōngtsú ē thiaⁿ lí; lí khún-kiû, I ē kóng: Guá tī tsia. Lí nā tuì lí tiong-kan tû-khì tāng ê ka-tann kah tsí-tsik lâng, í-ki̍p lām-sám kóng ê uē;
English: Then shall you call, and Yahweh will answer; you shall cry, and he will say, Here I am. If you take away from the midst of you the yoke, the putting forth of the finger, and speaking wickedly;

Tailo: Siâⁿ lāi ê lâng tuì Io-a-si kóng, Lia̍h lí ê kiáⁿ tshut-.lâi, thang hō͘ i sí, in-uī i thiah-huí Baal ê tuâⁿ, tshò tuâⁿ piⁿ ê A-si-lah.
English: Then the men of the city said to Joash, Bring out your son, that he may die, because he has broken down the altar of Baal, and because he has cut down the Asherah that was by it.

Tailo: Iâkop tsiū tuì Bel-sí-bah tshut-huat; Isulael hiah-ê kiáⁿ hō͘ in ê lāu-pē Iâkop kah in ê bó͘-kiáⁿ lóng tsē tī Huâ-láu só͘ tshe lâi beh tsài i ê tshia.
English: Jacob rose up from Beersheba, and the sons of Israel carried Jacob, their father, their little ones, and their wives, in the wagons which Pharaoh had sent to carry him.

Tailo: Iôséhuh ē kì-tit í-tsîng só͘ bāng-kìnn kuan-hē in ê hiah-ê bāng, tsiū tuì in kóng, Lín sī tsing-thàm, beh lâi thàm-thiaⁿ tsit só͘-tsāi ê hi-si̍t.
English: Joseph remembered the dreams which he dreamed about them, and said to them, You are spies! You have come to see the nakedness of the land.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tshin-ài ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, lín tio̍h khiā ho͘ tsāi, m̄-thang iô-tāng. Tio̍h tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tsīn-la̍t uī Tsú tsò-kang, in-uī lín tsai uī Tsú sin-khó͘ tsò-kang it-tīng bē khang-khang.
English: Therefore, my beloved brothers, be steadfast, immovable, always abounding in the Lord's work, because you know that your labor is not in vain in the Lord.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, Lí khuànn Lí ê tuì-ti̍k! Lí ê tuì-ti̍k it-tīng ē bia̍t-bông; só͘-ū tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng mā ē siū phah sì-suàⁿ-.khì.
English: For, behold, your enemies, Yahweh, For, behold, your enemies shall perish. All the evil-doers will be scattered.

Tailo: Lí ê ba̍k-tsiu tshing-khì bô beh khuànn siâ-ok, bô beh khuànn hîng-gi̍k; kiânn kuí-tsà ê, Lí ná ē tiām-tiām khuànn in? Pháiⁿ lâng thun-bia̍t pí i khah kong-gī ê, Lí ná ē tiām-tiām ah?
English: You who have purer eyes than to see evil, and who cannot look on perversity, why do you tolerate those who deal treacherously, and keep silent when the wicked swallows up the man who is more righteous than he,

Tailo: Tio̍h kā i só͘-ū ê iû lóng the̍h khí-.lâi, tshin-tshiūnn siā-un-tsè the̍h-khì iûⁿ-á ê iû. Tsè-si tio̍h tī tuâⁿ tíng sio, tshin-tshiūnn hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú ê hué-tsè. Kuan-hē i só͘ huān-.tio̍h ê tsuē, tsè-si tio̍h án-ne kā i sio̍k-tsuē, i tsiū ē tit-tio̍h sià-bián.
English: All its fat he shall take away, like the fat of the lamb is taken away from the sacrifice of peace offerings; and the priest shall burn them on the altar, on the offerings of Yahweh made by fire; and the priest shall make atonement for him concerning his sin that he has sinned, and he will be forgiven.

Tailo: Gín-á í-king sí à, guá kìm-tsia̍h beh tshòng siáⁿ? Guá kám ē hō͘ i tò tńg-.lâi? Guá beh khì i hia, i bē-tàng lâi guá tsia.
English: But now he is dead, why should I fast? can I bring him back again? I shall go to him, but he will not return to me.

Tailo: Guá án-ne tsáu, m̄-sī bô bo̍k-phiau teh tsáu; guá phah-kûn, mā m̄-sī teh phah khong-khì.
English: I therefore run like that, as not uncertainly. I fight like that, as not beating the air,

Tailo: Kun-ông ê pún-hūn tī tseh-kî, to̍h-sī ta̍k gue̍h ê tshe-it, ta̍k pái An-hioh-ji̍t kah Isulael ê tsú-bîn tiong só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê tseh-kî, tio̍h hiàn sio-tsè, sò͘-tsè, kuàn-tiān tsè; i tio̍h tsún-pī sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, sò͘-tsè, sio-tsè kah pîng-an-tsè, lâi uī-tio̍h Isulael ê tsú-bîn sio̍k-tsuē.
English: It shall be the prince's part to give the burnt offerings, and the meal offerings, and the drink offerings, in the feasts, and on the new moons, and on the Sabbaths, in all the appointed feasts of the house of Israel: he shall prepare the sin offering, and the meal offering, and the burnt offering, and the peace offerings, to make atonement for the house of Israel.

Tailo: Taⁿ lí ê ông-uī bô kú-tn̂g, Siōngtsú í-king tshuē-tio̍h ha̍h I ê sim-ì ê tsi̍t-ê lâng, jî-tshiánn Siōngtsú mā tiāⁿ-tio̍h i lâi tsò I ê tsú-bîn ê thâu, in-uī lí bô tsun-siú Siōngtsú só͘ bīng-līng lí ê.
English: But now your kingdom shall not continue: Yahweh has sought him a man after his own heart, and Yahweh has appointed him to be prince over his people, because you have not kept that which Yahweh commanded you.

Tailo: Kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah kā guá pau-uî, khióng-pò͘ kā guá im-ba̍t.
English: Fearfulness and trembling have come on me. Horror has overwhelmed me.

Tailo: Tē iáu tsûn-tsāi ê sî, tsai-tsìng kah siu-sîng, kuâⁿ kah jua̍h, kuâⁿ-thiⁿ kah jua̍h-thinn, ji̍t kah mê, lóng bô-hioh.
English: While the earth remains, seed time and harvest, and cold and heat, and summer and winter, and day and night shall not cease.

Tailo: Isulael ông Ia-lô-ba-am jī-tsa̍p tshit nî, Iôtah ông Amátsiah ê kiáⁿ Atsalíah tsē-uī.
English: In the twenty-seventh year of Jeroboam king of Israel began Azariah son of Amaziah king of Judah to reign.

Tailo: Lí ê sí-lâng ē koh ua̍h! Guá tsiah-ê sin-si ē koh khí-.lâi! Tó tī tîn-ai ê lâng, lín tio̍h tsing-sîn khí-lâi tshiùⁿ kua; in-uī Siōngtè ê lō͘-tsuí tshin-tshiūnn tshài-se tíng-bīn ê lō͘-tsuí, tē mā ē kau tshut im-hûn.
English: Your dead shall live. My dead bodies shall arise. Awake and sing, you who dwell in the dust; for your dew is like the dew of herbs, and the earth will cast forth the dead.

Tailo: Tabi̍t kuáⁿ-kín tsàu khì khiā tī hit-ê Huilīsū lâng ê tíng-bīn, kā i ê to pue̍h tshut siù, īng hit ki to kā i thâi-sí, tsám i ê thâu-khak. Huilīsū kûn-tsiòng khuàⁿ-tio̍h in ê ióng-sū í-king sí, tsiū kuáⁿ-kín tsàu.
English: Then David ran, and stood over the Philistine, and took his sword, and drew it out of the sheath of it, and killed him, and cut off his head therewith. When the Philistines saw that their champion was dead, they fled.

Tailo: Αpsalôm kóng, Nā bô, tsiū hō͘ guá ê a-hiaⁿ Amnon kah guán khì. Ông kóng, Án-tsuáⁿ tio̍h i kah lí khì?
English: Then said Absalom, If not, please let my brother Amnon go with us. The king said to him, Why should he go with you?

Tailo: In bô kè-sio̍k kah tsò thâu ê Ki-tok kiat-liân. Tsuân sing-khu tio̍h tuì tsit-ê thâu tit-tio̍h îng-ióng, tsiah-ê tsat kah kin tio̍h kiat-liân khí-.lâi, tsiàu Siōngtè ê tsí-ì lâi tióng-sîng.
English: and not holding firmly to the Head, from whom all the body, being supplied and knit together through the joints and ligaments, grows with God's growth.

Tailo: Kng Siōngtsú iok-kuī ê tsè-si tī Ioltàn hô ê ta tē tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ khiā-.leh, Isulael jîn-bîn lóng tuì ta tē kuè-.khì, it-ti̍t kàu jîn-bîn tsuân-pō͘ kuè Ioltàn hô.
English: The priests who bore the ark of the covenant of Yahweh stood firm on dry ground in the midst of the Jordan; and all Israel passed over on dry ground, until all the nation were passed clean over the Jordan.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, Siōngtsú in-uī lín ê iân-kò͘ tuì guá siū-khì, m̄-thiaⁿ guá, Siōngtsú tuì guá kóng, ' Án-ne lí kàu-gia̍h à, lí m̄-thang koh tuì guá thê-khí tsit-ê tāi-tsì.
English: But Yahweh was angry with me for your sakes, and didn't listen to me; and Yahweh said to me, Let it suffice you; speak no more to me of this matter.

Tailo: Iôtah lâng tsiū kuat-ì sîng-jīn in kah in ê kiáⁿ-sun, í-ki̍p kiàn-nā kui-uá in ê lâng, nî-nî beh tsiàu só͘ kì-tsài ê, tī só͘ tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê kî, siú tsit nn̄g ji̍t tsò tseh, hō͘ i bô huì-tû.
English: the Jews ordained, and took on them, and on their seed, and on all such as joined themselves to them, so that it should not fail, that they would keep these two days according to the writing of it, and according to the appointed time of it, every year;

Tailo: In tsū-tsi̍p kong-kik Mô͘se kah Alông kóng, Lín tshiàm-kuân, tsuân huē-tsiòng ta̍k lâng lóng sī sìng, Siōngtsú mā tī in tiong-kan, lín ná ē kiau-ngō͘ puâⁿ-kuè Siōngtsú ê huē-tsiòng?
English: and they assembled themselves together against Moses and against Aaron, and said to them, You take too much on you, seeing all the congregation are holy, everyone of them, and Yahweh is among them: why then lift yourselves up above the assembly of Yahweh?

Tailo: Tabi̍t tuì i kóng, Lí tshun tshiú thâi-sí Siōngtsú só͘ buah iû ê, ná ē bô kiann?
English: David said to him, How were you not afraid to put forth your hand to destroy Yahweh's anointed?

Tailo: Kiàn-nā tī hué-lô͘ piak ê sò͘-tsè kah tī tiáⁿ á-.sī tī tsian-puâⁿ tsún-pī ê, lóng tio̍h kui tī hiàn hit-ê tsè ê tsè-si.
English: Every meal offering that is baked in the oven, and all that is dressed in the frying pan, and on the baking pan, shall be the priest's who offers it.

Tailo: La̍hban kóng, Buē kè tuā ê tsìn-tsîng sing kè sè-.ê, tī guán tsia bô lâng án-ne tsò.
English: Laban said, It is not done so in our place, to give the younger before the firstborn.

Tailo: koh king-kuè Ehulaim ê mn̂g, kū ê mn̂g, hî ê mn̂g, Ha-na-nel ê lâu, Ha-me-ah ê lâu, ti̍t-kàu Iûⁿ-mn̂g, tsiū thîng-kha khiā tī hō͘-uē ê mn̂g.
English: and above the gate of Ephraim, and by the old gate, and by the fish gate, and the tower of Hananel, and the tower of Hammeah, even to the sheep gate: and they stood still in the gate of the guard.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Tsú ìn kóng, Ké hó ê lâng, tī An-hioh-ji̍t, lín kám bô ta̍k lâng tuì gû-tiâu tháu i ê gû á-.sī lî-á, khan-khì tsia̍h tsuí?
English: Therefore the Lord answered him, You hypocrites! Doesn't each one of you free his ox or his donkey from the stall on the Sabbath, and lead him away to water?

Tailo: Piattò͘ kā in kóng, Lín tio̍h hué-kái, ta̍k lâng lóng tio̍h hōng Iésu Ki-tok ê miâ niá siū sé-lé, hō͘ lín ê tsuē tit-tio̍h sià-bián, lín tsiū ē-tàng niá-siū Siōngtè siúⁿ-sù ê Sìng Sîn.
English: Peter said to them, Repent, and be baptized, everyone of you, in the name of Jesus Christ for the forgiveness of sins, and you will receive the gift of the Holy Spirit.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, i taⁿ bih tī suaⁿ-kheⁿ-á-.sī pa̍t só͘-tsāi, nā ū kuí-nā-ê lâng tāi-sing hō͘ i thâi-sí, kiàn-nā thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâng ē kóng, ' Tuè Αpsalôm ê jîn-bîn tiong-kan ū lâng siū thâi. '
English: Behold, he is hid now in some pit, or in some other place: and it will happen, when some of them are fallen at the first, that whoever hears it will say, There is a slaughter among the people who follow Absalom.

Tailo: Siū buah iû ê ông kóng, Guá beh thuân-ta̍t sìng-tsí, Siōngtsú bat kā guá kóng, ' Lí sī guá ê kiáⁿ, guá kin-á-ji̍t seⁿ lí.
English: I will tell of the decree. Yahweh said to me, You are my son. Today I have become your father.

Tailo: In ē tuà kun-khì, tsiàn-tshia kah ūn niû ê tshia, tshuā tuā tuī ê kûn-tsiòng lâi kong-kik lí. In gia̍h tuā pâi, sió-pâi koh tì thâu-khue, pâi tīn tī lí ê sì-kho͘-uî lâi kong-kik lí. Guá ē kā sím-phuàⁿ ê tāi-tsì kau-tài in, in ē īng in ê lu̍t-huat kā lí sím-phuàⁿ.
English: They shall come against you with weapons, chariots, and wagons, and with a company of peoples; they shall set themselves against you with buckler and shield and helmet round about; and I will commit the judgment to them, and they shall judge you according to their judgments.

Tailo: Asah tsiū tshut-khì kā i tí-ti̍k, tsiū tī Malésiah ê Tse-huat ê suaⁿ-kok, tāi-ke pâi tīn.
English: Then Asa went out to meet him, and they set the battle in array in the valley of Zephathah at Mareshah.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h hō͘ in ê sim piàn ngē, hō͘ Lí ê tsiù-tsó͘ lîm-kàu tī in.
English: You will give them hardness of heart, your curse to them.

Tailo: In-uī beh ū ké Ki-tok kah ké sian-ti ē tshut-hiān, kiânn sîn-jiah kah kî-sū, tsīn-liōng beh lâi bê-hi̍k Siōngtè ê suán-bîn.
English: For there will arise false christs and false prophets, and will show signs and wonders, that they may lead astray, if possible, even the chosen ones.

Tailo: In-uī in khuànn thiⁿ-kng tsá-khí tsò sí-ìm, in-uī in tī sí-ìm tsin kuàn-sì.
English: For the morning is to all of them like thick darkness, For they know the terrors of the thick darkness.

Tailo: I ê tshùn-tshioh to̍h-sī án-ne: pak bīn sì-tshing gō͘-pah, lâm bīn sì-tshing gō͘-pah, tang bīn sì-tshing gō͘-pah, sai-bīn sì-tshing gō͘-pah.
English: These shall be the measures of it: the north side four thousand and five hundred, and the south side four thousand and five hundred, and on the east side four thousand and five hundred, and the west side four thousand and five hundred.

Tailo: In-uī I bat tuì Mô͘se kóng, Guá beh liân-bín guá ài liân-bín ê lâng, guá beh thé-thiap guá ài thé-thiap ê lâng. （ Tsù, CAG 33:19)
English: For he said to Moses, I will have mercy on whom I have mercy, and I will have compassion on whom I have compassion.

Tailo: Isulael lâng koh kiânn Siōngtsú só͘ khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì, Siōngtsú tsiū kā in kau tī Mítiân ê tshiú tiong, king-kuè tshit nî.
English: The children of Israel did that which was evil in the sight of Yahweh: and Yahweh delivered them into the hand of Midian seven years.

Tailo: Tī hia siū lia̍h ê lâng tsò-hué tit-tio̍h an-jiân, bô thiaⁿ-tio̍h tok-kang ê siann.
English: There the prisoners are at ease together. They don't hear the voice of the taskmaster.

Tailo: In-uī Babúlông tó-huāi ê siann, tē tsiū iô-tāng, in tuā-siaⁿ huah ê siann thuân kàu tī lia̍t pang tiong.
English: At the noise of the taking of Babylon the earth trembles, and the cry is heard among the nations.

Tailo: Tuì saⁿ-tsa̍p huè í-siōng kàu gō͘-tsa̍p huè, kiàn-nā ji̍p-lâi tng-tsit tī huē-bō͘ lāi tsò-kang ê, lóng tio̍h sǹg.
English: from thirty years old and upward even until fifty years old, all who enter into the service, to do the work in the Tent of Meeting.

Tailo: Lín bô tsia̍h piáⁿ, mā bô lim tshing-tsiú, kāu tsiú, tse sī beh hō͘ lín tsai-iáⁿ Siōngtsú to̍h-sī lín ê Siōngtè.
English: You have not eaten bread, neither have you drunk wine or strong drink; that you may know that I am Yahweh your God.

Tailo: Thiàⁿ hiaⁿ-tī á-.sī tsí-muē ê lâng, sī tī kng-bîng tiong teh sing-ua̍h, bē tì-sú hō͘ lâng pua̍h-tó huān tsuē.
English: He who loves his brother remains in the light, and there is no occasion for stumbling in him.

Tailo: Kiû Lí īng gû-tshik-tsháu sé guá, guá tsiū tshing-khì; kiû Lí sé guá, guá tsiū pí seh khah pe̍h .
English: Purify me with hyssop, and I will be clean. Wash me, and I will be whiter than snow.

Tailo: Tsa-po͘ lâng m̄-sī uī-tio̍h tsa-bó͘ lâng tsiah tshòng-tsō ê, sī tsa-bó͘ lâng uī-tio̍h tsa-po͘ lâng lâi tshòng-tsō ê.
English: for neither was man created for the woman, but woman for the man.

Tailo: In tsiū lâi Mi-su-peh khì kìⁿ Getália̍h, tsò-hué khì ê ū Nethániah ê kiáⁿ Isimael, Kaleah nn̄g-ê kiáⁿ — Io-ha-nân kah Ionáthan, Tanhumet ê kiáⁿ Selaiah, Ne-to-huat lâng Í-huí ê tsìng kiáⁿ, Mákah lâng ê kiáⁿ Ia-tsa-ni-iah, í-ki̍p sio̍k in ê lâng.
English: then they came to Gedaliah to Mizpah, to wit, Ishmael the son of Nethaniah, and Johanan and Jonathan the sons of Kareah, and Seraiah the son of Tanhumeth, and the sons of Ephai the Netophathite, and Jezaniah the son of the Maacathite, they and their men.

Tailo: Iésu koh tuì bûn-tô͘ kóng, Ū tsi̍t-ê hó-gia̍h lâng, i ū tsi̍t-ê kuán-ke. Ū lâng tuì tsú-lâng kiám-kú tsit-ê kuán-ke lōng-huì i ê tsâi-sán.
English: He also said to his disciples, There was a certain rich man who had a manager. An accusation was made to him that this man was wasting his possessions.

Tailo: Taⁿ Thiⁿ-pē kā guá hun-pia̍t tsò sìng, koh tshe-phài guá ji̍p sè-kan, sī án-tsuáⁿ guá kóng, guá sī Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ, lín tsiū kóng guá teh siat-to̍k Siōngtè?
English: do you say of him whom the Father sanctified and sent into the world, You blaspheme,' because I said, I am the Son of God?'

Tailo: I tī suaⁿ-kok tiong īng tê pê thô͘, ka-kī huann-hí i ê la̍t; i tshut-khì gîng-tsiap ping-khì.
English: He paws in the valley, and rejoices in his strength: He goes out to meet the armed men.

Tailo: In m̄-thang tshuā ki-lí tsò bó͘ á-.sī hông uè lah-sap ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tsò bó͘, mā m̄-thang tshuā hō͘ tiōng-hu lî-tshut ê tsa-bó͘ lâng tsò bó͘, in-uī in sī kui in ê Siōngtè tsò sìng.
English: They shall not marry a woman who is a prostitute, or profane; neither shall they marry a woman divorced from her husband: for he is holy to his God.

Tailo: Siōngtè ê lô͘-po̍k tsiū kah lāu sian-ti khì, tī i ê ke tsia̍h piáⁿ lim tsuí.
English: So he went back with him, and ate bread in his house, and drank water.

Tailo: Iésu kóng, Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, lín nā bô kái-piàn, tsiâⁿ-tsò tshin-tshiūnn gín-á, lín tsua̍t-tuì bē-tàng ji̍p thian-kok.
English: and said, Most assuredly I tell you, unless you turn, and become as little children, you will in no way enter into the Kingdom of Heaven.

Tailo: Sàulô tso̍k hit ki tshiuⁿ, beh tsha̍k Ionáthan, Ionáthan tsiū tsai i ê lāu-pē kuat-ì beh thâi Tabi̍t.
English: Saul cast his spear at him to strike him. By this Jonathan knew that his father was determined to put David to death.

Tailo: Siōngtsú í-king tsiù-tsuā, it-tīng bô hō͘-hué, kóng, Lí ná tshin-tshiūnn Malkitsetik án-ne, íng-uán tsò tsè-si.
English: Yahweh has sworn, and will not change his mind: You are a priest forever in the order of Melchizedek.

Tailo: Sī-uē-tiúⁿ Nebutsalatàn kā tsiah-ê lâng lia̍h-kàu Lip-la̍h, Babúlông ông hia.
English: Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard took them, and brought them to the king of Babylon to Riblah.

Tailo: Tsha̍t lâi, it-tīng sī beh thau-the̍h, beh thâi, beh huí-bia̍t; guá lâi sī beh hō͘ in tit-tio̍h hong-sīng ê ua̍h-miā.
English: The thief only comes to steal, kill, and destroy. I came that they may have life, and may have it abundantly.

Tailo: Sî-kî kàu à, ji̍t-tsí teh beh kàu; bé ê lâng m̄-thang huann-hí, bē ê lâng m̄-thang huân-ló, in-uī tuā siū-khì í-king lîm-kàu tī in tsìng lâng.
English: The time is come, the day draws near: don't let the buyer rejoice, nor the seller mourn; for wrath is on all the multitude of it.

Tailo: Koh tsio-tsi̍p huē-tsiòng kàu huē-bō͘ mn̂g-kháu.
English: and assemble all the congregation at the door of the Tent of Meeting.

Tailo: I koh tshuā guá lâi-kàu pak-mn̂g, tsiàu í-tsîng ê tshùn-tshioh lâi niû.
English: He brought me to the north gate: and he measured it according to these measures;

Tailo: In gîm tsi̍t siú sin ê si, kóng, Lí ū tsu-keh the̍h hit kńg tsheh, thiah-khui i ê hong-ìn, in-uī Lí ū siū sat-hāi, īng Lí ê hueh tuì kok tso̍k-kûn, kok tsióng gí-giân, kok bîn-tso̍k, kok kok sio̍k-huê lâng lâi kui Siōngtè.
English: They sang a new song, saying, You are worthy to take the book, And to open its seals: For you were killed, And bought us for God with your blood, Out of every tribe, language, people, and nation,

Tailo: Hit ji̍t sī Iô-tá-iah lâng pī-pān tseh ê ji̍t, bōng koh bô hn̄g, in tsiū kā Iésu bâi-tsòng tī hia.
English: Then because of the Jews' Preparation Day (for the tomb was near at hand) they laid Jesus there.

Tailo: Mô͘se ê guā-tshik sī Kenî lâng, i ê kiáⁿ-sun kah Iôtah ê kiáⁿ-sun tuì tsó-tshiū siâⁿ tsò-hué khì, lâi-kàu A-la̍t lâm pîng ê Iôtah ê khòng-iá kah hia ê lâng tsò-hué tuà.
English: The children of the Kenite, Moses' brother-in-law, went up out of the city of palm trees with the children of Judah into the wilderness of Judah, which is in the south of Arad; and they went and lived with the people.

Tailo: Guá nā m̄-sī teh tsò Thiⁿ-pē ê tāi-tsì, lín m̄-bián sìn guá.
English: If I don't do the works of my Father, don't believe me.

Tailo: Gī lâng ê kha-pō͘ sī Siōngtsú só͘ an-tì, jî-tshiánn Siōngtsú ì-ài gī lâng ê lō͘.
English: A man's goings are established by Yahweh. He delights in his way.

Tailo: Ji̍t beh lo̍h ê sî, ū hō-līng piàn thuân tī kun-iâⁿ tiong, kóng, Ta̍k lâng tńg-khì pún-siâⁿ, ta̍k lâng tńg-khì pún-tē.
English: There went a cry throughout the army about the going down of the sun, saying, Every man to his city, and every man to his country.

Tailo: Guá kám ū su-iàu tian-kông ê, lín tsiah tshuā tsit-ê lâng lâi tī guá ê bīn-tsîng tian-kông? Tsit-ê lâng kám thang ji̍p guá ê tshù?
English: Do I lack madmen, that you have brought this fellow to play the madman in my presence? shall this fellow come into my house?

Tailo: Tī āu-tiān ê lāi-bīn, i īng kaⁿ-ná tshâ tsò nn̄g-ê ki-lō͘-ping, ta̍k-ê kuân tsa̍p tiú.
English: In the oracle he made two cherubim of olive wood, each ten cubits high.

Tailo: Hō͘ to thâi-sí ê pí gō-.sí ê khah hó, in-uī sī khiàm-khueh tshân-hn̂g ê lông-sán-bu̍t, tsiām-tsiām gō-.sí, tshin-tshiūnn tshì-tsha̍k thàng-kuè.
English: Those who are killed with the sword are better than those who are killed with hunger; For these pine away, stricken through, for want of the fruits of the field.

Tailo: In ē thiaⁿ lí ê uē, lí kah Isulael ê tiúⁿ-ló tio̍h khì kìⁿ Aigi̍p ông, kā i kóng, ' Hi-bú-lâi lâng ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú í-king tú-tio̍h guán, taⁿ kiû lí iông-ín guán khì khòng-iá, kiânn saⁿ ji̍t ê lō͘-thîng, beh tsè-sū Siōngtsú — guán ê Siōngtè. '
English: They will listen to your voice, and you shall come, you and the elders of Israel, to the king of Egypt, and you shall tell him, Yahweh, the God of the Hebrews, has met with us. Now please let us go three days' journey into the wilderness, that we may sacrifice to Yahweh, our God.'

Tailo: Mā hiàn tsi̍t tsiah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, tse sī tī tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ hiàn ê sio-tsè kah i ê sò͘-tsè kah i ê kuàn-tiān í-guā.
English: and one male goat for a sin offering, besides the continual burnt offering, and the meal offering of it, and the drink offering of it.

Tailo: Lí só͘ khuàⁿ-tio̍h tī guá tsiàⁿ tshiú hit tshit lia̍p tsheⁿ kah tshit ki kim ting-tâi ê ò-pì sī án-ne, tshit lia̍p tsheⁿ sī tshit king kàu-huē ê sù-tsiá, tshit ki ting-tâi sī tshit king kàu-huē.
English: the mystery of the seven stars which you saw in my right hand, and the seven golden lampstands. The seven stars are the angels of the seven assemblies. The seven lampstands are seven assemblies.

Tailo: Hiah-ê lâng tsiū tsò-hué kóng, Tsit-ê Taniel, tû-khì i ê Siōngtè ê lu̍t-huat í-guā, lán bô thang tshuē-tio̍h i ê khang-phāng lâi kò i.
English: Then said these men, We shall not find any occasion against this Daniel, except we find it against him concerning the law of his God.

Tailo: Siâⁿ lāi sûn-lô ê lâng tú-tio̍h guá, guá mn̄g in kóng: Lín ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h guá sim só͘ ài ê á-bô?
English: The watchmen who go about the city found me; Have you seen him whom my soul loves?

Tailo: Hō͘ tē iô-tāng ê guân-in ū sann hāng, liân tam-tng bē-khí ê ū sì hāng:
English: For three things the earth tremble, And under four, it can't bear up:

Tailo: Hamán tsiū ji̍p-.khì. Ông mn̄g i kóng, Ông só͘ ài kā i îng-kng ê lâng, tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ kā i khuán-thāi? Hamán sim-lāi siūⁿ kóng, ông só͘ ài kā i îng-kng ê lâng, siáⁿ lâng ē iâⁿ-kuè guá?
English: So Haman came in. The king said to him, What shall be done to the man whom the king delights to honor? Now Haman said in his heart, To whom would the king delight to do honor more than to myself?

Tailo: Lēbī lâng lī-khui in ê kau-iá kah sán-gia̍p, lâi-kàu Iôtah kah Êlúsalèm, sī in-uī Ia-lô-ba-am kah i ê kiáⁿ kī-tsua̍t in, m̄-tsún in kiânn tsè-si ê tsit-hūn ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú.
English: For the Levites left their suburbs and their possession, and came to Judah and Jerusalem: for Jeroboam and his sons cast them off, that they should not execute the priest's office to Yahweh;

Tailo: Guá bô kiû ka-kī ê îng-kng, ū tsi̍t uī teh thè guá kiû, koh tsò tsit-hāng tāi-tsì ê sím-phuàⁿ tsiá.
English: But I don't seek my own glory. There is one who seeks and judges.

Tailo: Taⁿ tio̍h ǹg Siōngtsú — lín tsó͘-sian ê Siōngtè jīn tsuē, kiânn I só͘ huann-hí ê, ka-kī hun-pia̍t lī-khui tsiah-ê kok ê jîn-bîn kah guā-pang ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ.
English: Now therefore make confession to Yahweh, the God of your fathers, and do his pleasure; and separate yourselves from the peoples of the land, and from the foreign women.

Tailo: Hit sî, tsóng-tok ê ping-á ah Iésu ji̍p-khì tsóng-tok-hú, tiàu-tsi̍p tsuân-iâⁿ ê ping kā I uî khí-.lâi.
English: Then the governor's soldiers took Jesus into the Praetorium, and gathered the whole garrison together against him.

Tailo: Tâng-hái khuà tī tsa̍p-jī tsiah tâng-gû ê tíng-bīn, saⁿ tsiah ǹg pak, saⁿ tsiah ǹg sai, saⁿ tsiah ǹg lâm, saⁿ tsiah ǹg tang; tâng-hái hē tī gû ê tíng-bīn, gû bué ǹg lāi-bīn.
English: It stood on twelve oxen, three looking toward the north, and three looking toward the west, and three looking toward the south, and three looking toward the east; and the sea was set on them above, and all their hinder parts were inward.

Tailo: I ìn guá kóng, Tse sī Siōngtsú huan-hù Tso-lô-ba-bel ê uē. Kóng, ' M̄-sī īng kuân-sè, m̄-sī īng lîng-li̍k, to̍h-sī īng Guá ê Sìng Sîn. Tse sī bān-kun ê Siōngtsú kóng ê. '
English: Then he answered and spoke to me, saying, This is the word of Yahweh to Zerubbabel, saying, Not by might, nor by power, but by my Spirit,' says Yahweh of Armies.

Tailo: Koh tuì Ga̍t tsi-tso̍k ê sán-gia̍p tiong-kan, kā Gilia̍t ê La̍h-mot, to̍h-sī thâi-sí-lâng ê tô-siám ê siâⁿ kah i ê kau-iá, í-ki̍p Ma-há-niam kah i ê kau-iá,
English: Out of the tribe of Gad, Ramoth in Gilead with its suburbs, the city of refuge for the manslayer, and Mahanaim with its suburbs,

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh kā tsit-ê siâⁿ kau hō͘ Kal-tí-ah lâng ê tshiú kah Babúlông ông Nepkatnetsal ê tshiú, i ē kā i tsing-ho̍k.
English: Therefore thus says Yahweh: Behold, I will give this city into the hand of the Chaldeans, and into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon, and he shall take it:

Tailo: In-uī I kà-sī lâng tsin ū kuân-ui kah in ê king-ha̍k kàu-su bô kāng-khuán.
English: for he taught them with authority, and not like the scribes.

Tailo: Guá ài pò lín tsai, lán ê hiann-tī Tî-mó͘-theh í-king tshut kaⁿ. I nā khah kín lâi, guá ē kiò i kah guá tsò-hué khì lín hia.
English: Know that our brother Timothy has been freed, with whom, if he comes shortly, I will see you.

Tailo: Lí í-king kā guá ê thî-khàu piàn-tsò thiàu-bú, Lí kā guá ê muâ-sann thǹg tiāu, īng huann-hí tsò tuà kā guá hâ,
English: You have turned my mourning into dancing for me. You have removed my sackcloth, and clothed me with gladness,

Tailo: Síbah ê lú-ông thiaⁿ-tio̍h Só͘lômóng ê miâ-siaⁿ, tsiū lâi-kàu Êlúsalèm, beh īng oh-tit kái-bîng ê tāi-tsì tshì-thàm Só͘lômóng; tuè i ê lâng tsin tsē, ū lo̍k-tô tsài phang-liāu kah n̂g-kim tsin tsē, mā ū pó-tsio̍h. I kìnn Só͘lômóng ê sî, tsiū kā sim-lāi it-tshè só͘ tsûn ê kah i kóng-uē.
English: When the queen of Sheba heard of the fame of Solomon, she came to prove Solomon with hard questions at Jerusalem, with a very great train, and camels that bore spices, and gold in abundance, and precious stones: and when she was come to Solomon, she talked with him of all that was in her heart.

Tailo: Ísak ê lô͘-po̍k tī suaⁿ-kok teh ku̍t, tú-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê ua̍h-tsuí ê tséⁿ.
English: Isaac's servants dug in the valley, and found there a well of springing water.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú uī-tio̍h Abulahàm ê bó͘ Sala̍h ê iân-kò͘, í-king hō͘ Amí-me-li̍k tshù lāi ê tsa-bó͘ lâng bē-tàng seⁿ kiáⁿ.
English: For Yahweh had closed up tight all the wombs of the house of Abimelech, because of Sarah, Abraham's wife.

Tailo: Ta̍k tsá-khí kah ta̍k ê-hng, lóng hiàn sio-tsè koh sio phang-hiuⁿ hō͘ Siōngtsú, koh ū pâi-lia̍t ê piáⁿ tī sìng-kiat ê toh, mā ū kim ting-tâi kah ting-tsuáⁿ, ta̍k ê-hng thang tiám-to̍h, in-uī guán siú Siōngtsú — guán Siōngtè ê kài-bīng; to̍k-to̍k lín khì-sak I.
English: and they burn to Yahweh every morning and every evening burnt offerings and sweet incense: the show bread also set they in order on the pure table; and the lampstand of gold with the lamps of it, to burn every evening: for we keep the charge of Yahweh our God; but you have forsaken him.

Tailo: Tī tshù-piⁿ ê bīn-tsîng tap-ìng tsò pó-tsìng, hit khuán lâng to̍h-sī gōng lâng.
English: A man void of understanding strikes hands, And becomes collateral in the presence of his neighbor.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — guán tsó͘-sian Abulahàm, Ísak, Isulael ê Siōngtè ah, kiû Lí hō͘ Lí ê tsú-bîn tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tsûn tsit khuán ê sim-su liām-thâu, tsún-pī in ê sim lâi kui-ǹg Lí,
English: Yahweh, the God of Abraham, of Isaac, and of Israel, our fathers, keep this forever in the imagination of the thoughts of the heart of your people, and prepare their heart to you;

Tailo: Ông mn̄g i kóng, Lí ū siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì? I ìn kóng, Guá si̍t-tsāi sī kuáⁿ-hū, guá ê tiōng-hu í-king sí.
English: The king said to her, What ails you? She answered, Of a truth I am a widow, and my husband is dead.

Tailo: Guá bô tsē tī iàn-lo̍k ê lâng ê huē tiong lâi khuài-lo̍k; guá in-uī Lí ê kám-tōng, ka-kī tiām-tiām tsē, in-uī Lí hō͘ siū-khì tshiong-muá guá.
English: I didn't sit in the assembly of those who make merry, nor rejoiced; I sat alone because of your hand; for you have filled me with indignation.

Tailo: Mehuibosiat ū tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ iáu sè-hàn, miâ kiò-tsò Mika. Kiàn-nā tuà tī Tsi-bah ê ke ê lâng, lóng tsò Mehuibosiat ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: Mephibosheth had a young son, whose name was Mica. All that lived in the house of Ziba were servants to Mephibosheth.

Tailo: Tshâi-lông ē tī iâⁿ-pâng háu, suann-káu ē tī i iàn-lo̍k ê kiong-tiān háu. Babúlông tuā tsai-lān ê sî kīn là! I ê ji̍t-tsí í-king bô kú-tn̂g!
English: Wolves will cry in their castles, and jackals in the pleasant palaces. Her time is near to come, and her days will not be prolonged.

Tailo: Guá ê siū khó͘ tuì guá lâi kóng sī ū lī-ik, in-uī hō͘ guá ē-tàng ha̍k-si̍p Lí ê lu̍t-lē.
English: It is good for me that I have been afflicted, That I may learn your statutes.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Siōngtè tuì pháiⁿ lâng kóng, Lí ná káⁿ thuân guá ê lu̍t-lē, tshuì káⁿ kóng-khí guá ê iok?
English: But to the wicked God says, What right do you have to declare my statutes, That you have taken my covenant on your lips,

Tailo: Án-ne sī beh tuì sè-sè tāi-tāi piáu-bîng I kàu-gia̍h ê un-tián, to̍h-sī thong-kuè Ki-tok Iésu tuì lán hián-sī ê tsû-ài.
English: that in the ages to come he might show the exceeding riches of his grace in kindness toward us in Christ Jesus;

Tailo: Tio̍h ǹg I gîm-si, ǹg I tshiùⁿ kua o-ló, tâm-lūn I it-tshè kî-biāu ê só͘ kiâⁿ.
English: Sing to him, sing praises to him; Talk you of all his marvelous works.

Tailo: Mô͘se kóng, Guá beh tuì lí tsia tshut-.khì, mā beh kiû Siōngtsú hō͘ kui tīn ê hô͘-sîn bîn-á-tsài lī-khui Huâ-láu kah i ê jîn-sîn, í-ki̍p i ê jîn-bîn; tsóng-.sī, Huâ-láu m̄-thang koh kuí-tsà, m̄-tsún jîn-bîn lī-khui khì tsè-sū Siōngtsú.
English: Moses said, Behold, I go out from you, and I will pray to Yahweh that the swarms of flies may depart from Pharaoh, from his servants, and from his people, tomorrow; only don't let Pharaoh deal deceitfully any more in not letting the people go to sacrifice to Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá beh kā lí hun-suànn khì tī lia̍t kok, kā lí sì-suàⁿ tī lia̍t pang. Guá beh tû-khì lí tiong-kan ê ù-uè.
English: I will scatter you among the nations, and disperse you through the countries; and I will consume your filthiness out of you.

Tailo: Guá beh hō͘ lí tsiâⁿ-tsò tuā kok, Guá beh kā lí sù-hok, hō͘ lí ê miâ tsò tuā, lí mā ē hō͘ lâng tit-tio̍h hok-khì.
English: I will make of you a great nation. I will bless you and make your name great. You will be a blessing.

Tailo: Án-ne, lu̍t-huat ū siáⁿ lō͘-īng? Lu̍t-huat sī uī-tio̍h beh hō͘ lâng tsai siáⁿ-mi̍h sī kuè-sit, iû thiⁿ-sài thong-kuè tsi̍t-ê tiong-kan-jîn só͘ siat-li̍p ê, it-ti̍t kàu hit uī tit-tio̍h ìng-ín ê Kiáⁿ-sun lâi-lîm ê sî tsiū kiat-sok.
English: What then is the law? It was added because of transgressions, until the seed should come to whom the promise has been made. It was ordained through angels by the hand of a mediator.

Tailo: In-uī guán só͘ khuàⁿ-tio̍h kah só͘ thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê, bô kóng tshut-lâi bē īng-tit.
English: for we can't help telling the things which we saw and heard.

Tailo: I ê tsú-lâng tsiū tio̍h tshuā i kàu kìng-pài Siōngtè ê só͘-tsāi, koh tio̍h tshuā i uá-kīn mn̂g á-.sī mn̂g-khing, tsú-lâng tio̍h īng tsǹg-á tsǹg i ê hīnn-á, i tsiū íng-uán ho̍k-sāi tsit-ê tsú-lâng.
English: then his master shall bring him to God, and shall bring him to the door or to the doorpost, and his master shall bore his ear through with an awl, and he shall serve him for ever.

Tailo: Lí kám bat ji̍p-khì hái ê tsuí-guân? Á-sī bat kiânn tī tshim-ian pì-bi̍t ê só͘-tsāi?
English: Have you entered into the springs of the sea? Or have you walked in the recesses of the deep?

Tailo: Siōngtsú tī Mô͘ap pîng-guân, Ioltàn hô piⁿ, I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ tuì-bīn, huan-hù Mô͘se kóng,
