English: Yahweh spoke to Moses in the plains of Moab by the Jordan at Jericho, saying,

Tailo: Bān-kun ê Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè án-ne kóng: Kóng-tio̍h Ko-lai-iah ê kiáⁿ Ahap kah Maaseiah ê kiáⁿ Tsetikiah, in thok Guá ê miâ tuì lín suan-pò͘ pe̍h-tsha̍t. Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh kā in kau tī Babúlông ông — Nepkatnetsal ê tshiú, i ē tī lín ê bīn-tsîng kā in thâi-sí.
English: Thus says Yahweh of Armies, the God of Israel, concerning Ahab the son of Kolaiah, and concerning Zedekiah the son of Maaseiah, who prophesy a lie to you in my name: Behold, I will deliver them into the hand of Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon; and he shall kill them before your eyes;

Tailo: Kám to̍h-sī guá só͘ siu-tsông lâi thìng-hāu huān-lān ê kî, thìng-hāu sio-thâi kau-tsiàn ê ji̍t?
English: Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, Against the day of battle and war?

Tailo: Hit ji̍t, Isulael lâng tsin khùn-khó͘, in-uī Sàulô ǹg jîn-bîn tsiù-tsuā kóng, Bô tán kàu ji̍t àm, thìng-hāu guá pò guá ê tuì-ti̍k ê uan-siû ê tsìn-tsîng, tsia̍h-mi̍h ê lâng tio̍h siū tsiù-tsó͘. Só͘-í, jîn-bîn lóng bô tsia̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: The men of Israel were distressed that day; for Saul had adjured the people, saying, Cursed be the man who eats any food until it be evening, and I be avenged on my enemies. So none of the people tasted food.

Tailo: Iésu kā i kóng, Guá lâi-khì kā i i-tī.
English: Jesus said to him, I will come and heal him.

Tailo: I ē īng Eliiah ê tsing-sîn kah tsâi-lîng tsò Tsú ê sian-hong, hō͘ pē-bú kah kiáⁿ-jî hô-hó, hō͘ puē-gi̍k ê lâng huê-sim tsuán-ì lâi kin-tuè gī lâng ê tì-huī, hō͘ jîn-bîn tsún-pī sim lâi gîng-tsiap Tsú.
English: He will go before him in the spirit and power of Elijah, to turn the hearts of the fathers to the children,' and the disobedient to the wisdom of the just; to make ready a people prepared for the Lord.

Tailo: Koh kì-tsài tī tso̍k-phó͘ tiong ê, in ê sè-hàn ê, in ê bó͘, in ê kiáⁿ, in ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, tī tsuân huē-tsiòng tiong ê, in-uī in tsīn tsit-hūn ka-kī tshing-khì tsiâⁿ-sìng.
English: and those who were reckoned by genealogy of all their little ones, their wives, and their sons, and their daughters, through all the congregation: for in their office of trust they sanctified themselves in holiness.

Tailo: Síbah kah La̍h-má ê sing-lí lâng kah lí kau-i̍k, in īng ta̍k luī siōng hó ê phang-liāu, ta̍k luī ê pó-tsio̍h kah n̂g-kim, lâi uāⁿ lí ê huè-bu̍t.
English: The traffickers of Sheba and Raamah, they were your traffickers; they traded for your wares with the chief of all spices, and with all precious stones, and gold.

Tailo: Só͘-í, hit-ê siâⁿ miâ kiò-tsò Ba-bel, in-uī Siōngtsú tī hia phah-luān thian-hā ê giân-gí; Siōngtsú hō͘ lâng tuì hia sì-suàⁿ tī tsuân tē-tsiūⁿ.
English: Therefore the name of it was called Babel, because there Yahweh confused the language of all the earth. From there, Yahweh scattered them abroad on the surface of all the earth.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, tī Guá tsia ū só͘-tsāi, lí tio̍h khiā tī tsio̍h-puâⁿ tíng.
English: Yahweh also said, Behold, there is a place by me, and you shall stand on the rock.

Tailo: In bô koh gióng-bōng ka-kī ê tshiú só͘ khí ê tsè-tuâⁿ, bô koh kuan-khuàⁿ ka-kī ê tsíng-thâu-á só͘ tsō ê tshâ-thiāu á-.sī ji̍t-thâu ê siōng.
English: They will not look to the altars, the work of their hands; neither shall they respect that which their fingers have made, either the Asherim, or the incense altars.

Tailo: Guá koh khuàⁿ-tio̍h ji̍t-kng ê ē-bīn, tī sím-phuàⁿ ê só͘-tsāi ū kan-ok, tī kong-gī ê só͘-tsāi mā ū kan-ok.
English: Moreover I saw under the sun, in the place of justice, that wickedness was there; and in the place of righteousness, that wickedness was there.

Tailo: Tsháu tsá-khí sî huat-tshut-lâi bō͘-sīng, ê-hng sî siū kuah tsiū ta-.khì.
English: In the morning it sprouts and springs up. By evening, it is withered and dry.

Tailo: Jîn-tsú, lí tio̍h gia̍h tsi̍t ki lāi-kiàm, tsò lí ê thì thâu to, lâi thì lí ê thâu-mn̂g kah lí ê tshuì-tshiu, jiân-āu īng lî-tíng lâi tíng i ê tāng-khin, lâi kā i hun-khui.
English: You, son of man, take a sharp sword; as a barber's razor shall you take it to you, and shall cause it to pass on your head and on your beard: then take balances to weigh, and divide the hair.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, pháiⁿ lâng ê ba̍k-tsiu ē hue; in bô lō͘ thang tô-tsáu, in só͘ ǹg-bāng ê tshin-tshiūnn khuì tn̄g.
English: But the eyes of the wicked shall fail, They shall have no way to flee; Their hope shall be the giving up of the spirit.

Tailo: Guá kí íng-uán ua̍h ê Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè lâi kóng, bô tsi̍t tso̍k, bô tsi̍t kok, guá ê tsú bô tshe lâng kàu hia tshuē lí. In nā kóng, i bô tī tsia, tsiū kiò hit kok hit tso̍k ê lâng tsiù-tsuā kóng in si̍t-tsāi bô tú-tio̍h lí.
English: As Yahweh your God lives, there is no nation or kingdom, where my lord has not sent to seek you: and when they said, He is not here, he took an oath of the kingdom and nation, that they didn't find you.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê uē koh lîm-kàu I-é-lí-miah.
English: The word that came to Jeremiah from Yahweh, after that the king Zedekiah had made a covenant with all the people who were at Jerusalem, to proclaim liberty to them;

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, ē ū só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê lâng lâu-.leh, to̍h-sī siū lia̍h tshut-.lâi ê kiáⁿ-jî; lí khuàⁿ, in ē tshut-lâi-kàu lín tsia, lín ē khuàⁿ-tio̍h in ê só͘ kiâⁿ, só͘ tsò, kóng-tio̍h Guá só͘ kàng-lo̍h tī Êlúsalèm ê tsai-hō, to̍h-sī Guá it-tshè kàng-lo̍h tī in tíng-bīn ê, lín tsiū ē tit-tio̍h an-uì.
English: Yet, behold, therein shall be left a remnant that shall be carried forth, both sons and daughters: behold, they shall come forth to you, and you shall see their way and their doings; and you shall be comforted concerning the evil that I have brought on Jerusalem, even concerning all that I have brought on it.

Tailo: Lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h guá tsiū thìng-hāu, tiām-tiām teh tán guá tsí-kàu.
English: Men listened to me, waited, And kept silence for my counsel.

Tailo: Iô-sa-huat tsiàu án-ne kiâⁿ i ê lāu-pē Asah hiah-ê lō͘, bô ua̍t-tńg lī-khui i, kiânn Siōngtsú khuàⁿ-tsò hó ê tāi-tsì; tsóng-.sī, suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ iáu-buē huì-tû, jîn-bîn iû-guân tī suaⁿ-thâu tuâⁿ hiàn tsè sio hiuⁿ.
English: He walked in all the way of Asa his father; He didn't turn aside from it, doing that which was right in the eyes of Yahweh: however the high places were not taken away; the people still sacrificed and burnt incense in the high places.

Tailo: I kiù-sio̍k lí ê sèⁿ-miā thuat-lī sí-bông, īng thiàⁿ-sim kah tsû-pi tsò lí ê bián-liû.
English: Who redeems your life from destruction; Who crowns you with loving kindness and tender mercies;

Tailo: M̄-koh, guán tsiah-ê ū tsit khuán sio̍k-lîng pó-puè ê lâng, tú tshin-tshiūnn thô͘ tsō ê khì-kū, sī beh piáu-sī hit-ê ki̍k tuā ê kuân-lîng sī sio̍k Siōngtè, m̄-sī sio̍k guán.
English: But we have this treasure in clay vessels, that the exceeding greatness of the power may be of God, and not from ourselves.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì í-āu, Iésu kuè-khì Ga-lí-la-iah ô͘, to̍h-sī Tî-bé-lī-a ô͘ ê hit pîng.
English: After these things, Jesus went away to the other side of the sea of Galilee, which is also called the Sea of Tiberias.

Tailo: Khiā tī Iésu ê tuì-bīn ê liân-tiúⁿ khuàⁿ-tio̍h I án-ne tn̄g-khuì, tsiū kóng, Tsit-ê lâng tsin-tsiàⁿ sī Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ.
English: When the centurion, who stood by opposite him, saw that he cried out like this and breathed his last, he said, Truly this man was the Son of God!

Tailo: tsè-si tio̍h hiàn, tsi̍t tsiah tsò sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, tsi̍t tsiah tsò sio-tsè; tsè-si tio̍h in-uī i ê ē-sin lâu-lâng ê tsìng-thâu, tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng kā i sio̍k-tsuē.
English: and the priest shall offer them, the one for a sin offering, and the other for a burnt offering. The priest shall make atonement for him before Yahweh for his discharge.

Tailo: I tio̍h uī-tio̍h sìng ê sìng-só͘ sio̍k-tsuē, mā uī-tio̍h huē-bō͘ kah tsè-tuâⁿ sio̍k-tsuē, koh uī-tio̍h só͘-ū ê tsè-si kah tsuân huē-tsiòng ê jîn-bîn sio̍k-tsuē.
English: Then he shall make atonement for the Holy Sanctuary; and he shall make atonement for the Tent of Meeting and for the altar; and he shall make atonement for the priests and for all the people of the assembly.

Tailo: Lí tsi̍t-ē kiò, guá tsiū ìn Lí; Lí ē him-bō͘ Lí ê tshiú só͘ tsò ê lâng.
English: You would call, and I would answer you. You would have a desire to the work of your hands.

Tailo: The̍h tsi̍t-ê gîn-á hō͘ guá khuànn. Tsit-ê siōng kah jī-hō sī siáⁿ lâng ê? In kóng, Sī Lô-má hông-tè ê.
English: Show me a denarius. Whose image and inscription are on it? They answered, Caesar's.

Tailo: Lí khì A-bá-lîm suaⁿ, Nebó ê suaⁿ-thâu kah I-é-lī-kho siâⁿ tuì-bīn ê Mô͘ap tē, khuànn Guá siúⁿ-sù Isulael lâng tsò sán-gia̍p ê Ka-nân tē.
English: Go up into this mountain of Abarim, to Mount Nebo, which is in the land of Moab, that is over against Jericho; and see the land of Canaan, which I give to the children of Israel for a possession;

Tailo: In-uī guá tsai Lí ē hō͘ guá tì-kàu sí-bông, kàu tī hit king uī-tio̍h só͘-ū ua̍h-miā lâi tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê tshù.
English: For I know that you will bring me to death, To the house appointed for all living.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, sím-phuàⁿ-kuaⁿ ē tsē-uī, in ē tshiúⁿ-tua̍t ông ê kuân, kā i huí-huāi, hō͘ i bia̍t-bông kàu thiat-té.
English: But the judgment shall be set, and they shall take away his dominion, to consume and to destroy it to the end.

Tailo: Tē-peh nî lín tio̍h tsìng-tsoh, mā tio̍h tsia̍h tē ê tshut-sán, to̍h-sī kū ê bí-niûⁿ, thìng-hāu kàu tē-káu nî, hit nî ê tshut-sán siu-sîng ê sî, lín iáu-koh teh tsia̍h kū ê bí-niûⁿ.
English: You shall sow the eighth year, and eat of the fruits, the old store; until the ninth year, until its fruits come in, you shall eat the old store.

Tailo: Thiaⁿ-.tio̍h ê lâng lóng tshut-lâi ài beh khuànn tsit-ê tāi-tsì. In lâi-kàu Iésu hia, siâ-sîn í-king tuì hit-ê lâng tshut-.lâi. In khuàⁿ-tio̍h i ū tshīng saⁿ, tsing-sîn tsìng-siông, tsē tī Iésu ê kha tsîng, in tsiū tuā tio̍h-kiaⁿ.
English: People went out to see what had happened. They came to Jesus, and found the man from whom the demons had gone out, sitting at Jesus' feet, clothed and in his right mind; and they were afraid.

Tailo: Koh uī-tio̍h lí lâi thì kng-thâu, īng muâ-pò͘ hâ io, thòng-sim thî-khàu, hui-siông pi-ai.
English: and they shall make themselves bald for you, and gird them with sackcloth, and they shall weep for you in bitterness of soul with bitter mourning.

Tailo: Siōngtè ū tsín-kiù gī lâng Lótoh, in-uī i tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ uī-tio̍h siâ-ok îm-luān ê lâng lâi tshim-tshim iu-būn.
English: and delivered righteous Lot, who was very distressed by the lustful life of the wicked

Tailo: Keh tńg kang thiⁿ-kng tsá-khí, jîn-bîn khí-.lâi, tī hia khí tsi̍t tsō tuâⁿ, hiàn sio-tsè kah pîng-an-tsè.
English: It happened on the next day that the people rose early, and built there an altar, and offered burnt offerings and peace offerings.

Tailo: Mā uī-tio̍h gû-káng, iûⁿ-káng kah iûⁿ-á, suà hiàn i ê sò͘-tsè, i ê kuàn-tiān, lóng tsiàu in ê sò͘-gia̍h, tsiàu hit-ê lē.
English: and their meal offering and their drink offerings for the bulls, for the rams, and for the lambs, according to their number, after the ordinance;

Tailo: In tī tshân-iá tú-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê Aigi̍p lâng, tsiū kā i tshuā lâi-kàu Tabi̍t hia; the̍h piáⁿ hō͘ i, i tsiū tsia̍h, phâng tsuí hō͘ i lim,
English: They found an Egyptian in the field, and brought him to David, and gave him bread, and he ate; and they gave him water to drink.

Tailo: Iôséhuh khuàⁿ-tio̍h i hiah-ê a-hiaⁿ, ē jīn-tit; i ké-tsò tsheⁿ-hūn-lâng, tuì in kóng giâm-lē ê uē, mn̄g in kóng, Lín tuì tó-uī lâi? In kóng, Tuì Ka-nân tē lâi tia̍h bí-niûⁿ.
English: Joseph saw his brothers, and he recognized them, but acted like a stranger to them, and spoke roughly with them. He said to them, Where did you come from? They said, From the land of Canaan to buy food.

Tailo: In tshin-tshiūnn phang kā guá pau-uî, tshin-tshiūnn sio tshì-phè ê hué siū phah-hua; guá uá-khò Siōngtsú ê miâ lâi kā in tsâu-bia̍t.
English: They surrounded me like bees. They are quenched like the burning thorns. In the name of Yahweh I cut them off.

Tailo: An-tì tī tsè-si ho̍k ê phi-kian, uī Isulael lâng tsò kì-liām tsio̍h, tsiàu Siōngtsú só͘ huan-hù Mô͘se ê.
English: He put them on the shoulder straps of the ephod, to be stones of memorial for the children of Israel, as Yahweh commanded Moses.

Tailo: In-uī i ē hō͘ lí ê kiáⁿ ua̍t tńg-sin bô beh tuè guá, khì ho̍k-sāi pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng, tì-sú Siōngtsú tuì lín tuā siū-khì, kuáⁿ-kín kā lín siau-bia̍t.
English: For he will turn away your son from following me, that they may serve other gods: so will the anger of Yahweh be kindled against you, and he will destroy you quickly.

Tailo: Guá tshuā lín tī khòng-iá sì-tsa̍p nî, lín sing-khu ê saⁿ bô phuà, kha-.ni̍h ê ê mā bô phuà.
English: I have led you forty years in the wilderness: your clothes have not grown old on you, and your shoe has not grown old on your foot.

Tailo: kàu i tó-.leh ê sî, lí tio̍h tsim-tsiok khuànn i tó ê só͘-tsāi, ji̍p-khì hian i ê kha só͘ kah ê, jiân-āu tó tī hia. I ē kā lí kóng, lí só͘ tio̍h tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h.
English: It shall be, when he lies down, that you shall mark the place where he shall lie, and you shall go in, and uncover his feet, and lay you down; and he will tell you what you shall do.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Mô͘se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: I hō͘ guá ê khuì-la̍t tī puàⁿ-lō͘ sue-lám, hō͘ guá ê ji̍t-tsí kiám-tsió.
English: He weakened my strength along the course. He shortened my days.

Tailo: Ū lâng kóng, Tsia̍h sī uī-tio̍h pak-tó͘, pak-tó͘ mā sī uī-tio̍h tsia̍h. Tsóng-.sī, Siōngtè lóng beh kā tsit nn̄g hāng huí-huāi. Sing-khu m̄-sī uī-tio̍h îm-luān, sī uī-tio̍h ho̍k-sāi Tsú, Tsú mā ē kiong-kip lán sing-khu ê su-iàu.
English: Foods for the belly, and the belly for foods, but God will bring to nothing both it and them. But the body is not for sexual immorality, but for the Lord; and the Lord for the body.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì í-āu, Siōngtsú kā i phah, hō͘ i ê tn̂g-á huān-tio̍h bē i-tit ê pēⁿ.
English: After all this Yahweh struck him in his bowels with an incurable disease.

Tailo: Guá in-uī Siōngtsú kóng beh kā lín siau-bia̍t, tsiū phak tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng phak-teh sì-tsa̍p kang sì-tsa̍p mê.
English: So I fell down before Yahweh the forty days and forty nights that I fell down, because Yahweh had said he would destroy you.

Tailo: koh tī Itsakal tsi-tso̍k ê tē, Ketésih kah i ê kau-iá, Ta-be-lat kah i ê kau-iá;
English: and out of the tribe of Issachar, Kedesh with its suburbs, Daberath with its suburbs,

Tailo: Só͘ tìng ê kim-ting tāng gō͘-tsa̍p si-khel. Lâu-koh lóng an-tsng kim.
English: The weight of the nails was fifty shekels of gold. He overlaid the upper chambers with gold.

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, nā ū lâng tī tshân-iá tú-tio̍h í-king phìng tiāⁿ-tio̍h ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, hit-ê lâng kā i kiông-kan, kan-taⁿ hit-ê kā i kiông-kan ê lâng tio̍h sí.
English: But if the man find the lady who is pledged to be married in the field, and the man force her, and lie with her; then the man only who lay with her shall die:

Tailo: Kiàn-nā kuè-khì kui tī hiah-ê king-kuè tiám-sǹg ê, tuì jī-tsa̍p huè í-siōng, ū la̍k-tsa̍p-bān khòng saⁿ-tshing gō͘-pah gō͘-tsa̍p lâng, tsiàu sìng-só͘ ê tshìn-á lâi tshìn, ta̍k lâng tshut gîn puàⁿ si-khel, to̍h-sī tsi̍t Pekah.
English: a beka a head, that is, half a shekel, after the shekel of the sanctuary, for everyone who passed over to those who were numbered, from twenty years old and upward, for six hundred three thousand five hundred fifty men.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Iésu ìn kóng, Lín tsiah-ê lu̍t-huat kàu-su mā ū tsai-hō ah! In-uī lín kā lâng taⁿ bô huat-tit ê tāng-tàⁿ hō͘ lâng taⁿ; m̄-koh, lín ka-kī liân tsi̍t ki tsíng-thâu-á to m̄-khíng tín-tāng lâi kiám khin hiah-ê tāng-tàⁿ.
English: He said, Woe to you lawyers also! For you load men with burdens that are difficult to carry, and you yourselves won't even lift one finger to help carry those burdens.

Tailo: Hit sî, La̍hban khì tsián iûⁿ-mn̂g, La̍h-khel tsiū thau-the̍h in lāu-pē tshù lāi ê ngó͘-siōng.
English: Now Laban had gone to shear his sheep: and Rachel stole the teraphim that were her father's.

Tailo: Tuì tiong-tàu khí saⁿ tiám-tsing, tsuân tē lóng o͘-àm.
English: Now from the sixth hour there was darkness over all the land until the ninth hour.

Tailo: tîm-hiuⁿ gō͘-pah kah kaⁿ-ná iû tsi̍t hin, lóng tsiàu sìng-só͘ ê tshìn-á.
English: and of cassia five hundred, after the shekel of the sanctuary; and a hin of olive oil.

Tailo: Lí ka-kī tio̍h kín-sīn, mā tio̍h tsù-ì lí ê kà-sī, tio̍h tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ kuan-sim koh tsò tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, in-uī án-ne tsò tsiah ē kiù lí pún-sin kah thiaⁿ lí kà-sī ê lâng.
English: Pay attention to yourself, and to your teaching. Continue in these things, for in doing this you will save both yourself and those who hear you.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h īng tsô-kia̍p tshâ tsò huē-bō͘ thiāu ê pán.
English: You shall make the boards for the tent of acacia wood, standing up.

Tailo: Án-ne, guá ê pò-siúⁿ sī siáⁿ-mi̍h? Tsiū-sī guá teh thuân hok-im, hō͘ lâng pe̍h-pe̍h tit-tio̍h hok-im, guá khiok bô tit-tio̍h thuân hok-im kai-tit ê khuân-lī.
English: What then is my reward? That, when I preach the Good News, I may present the Good News of Christ without charge, so as not to abuse my authority in the Good News.

Tailo: Io-lâm ông tńg-khì E-tsu-le-el, beh i-tī i ê siong, to̍h-sī i tī La̍h-mot kah Alâm ông Hatsael kau-tsiàn ê sî, Alâm lâng kā i phah-tio̍h ê. Iôtah ông Io-lâm ê kiáⁿ Ahatsiah lo̍h-khì E-tsu-le-el, beh thàm-hóng Ahap ê kiáⁿ Io-lâm, in-uī i ū phuà-pēⁿ.
English: King Joram returned to be healed in Jezreel of the wounds which the Syrians had given him at Ramah, when he fought against Hazael king of Syria. Ahaziah the son of Jehoram king of Judah went down to see Joram the son of Ahab in Jezreel, because he was sick.

Tailo: Kuan-hē tsit-ê lâng, ū kì-tsài, guá tshe guá ê sù-tsiá tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng; i beh tsò Lí ê sian-hong, kā Lí khui lō͘. (tsù, MLK 3:1)
English: For this is he, of whom it is written, Behold, I send my messenger before your face, who will prepare your way before you.'

Tailo: I tio̍h tshut-lâi-kàu Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng ê tuâⁿ hia, kiat-tsīng tsè-tuâⁿ, mā tio̍h the̍h tām-po̍h gû-káng-á ê hueh kah suaⁿ-iûⁿ-káng ê hueh, buah tī tuâⁿ tíng hiah-ê kak ê sì-kho͘-uî.
English: He shall go out to the altar that is before Yahweh and make atonement for it, and shall take some of the bull's blood, and some of the goat's blood, and put it on the horns of the altar round about.

Tailo: Só͘-í, guán put-sî tshiong-muá ióng-khì. Guán tsai, lán iáu-sī jio̍k-thé teh ua̍h ê sî, to̍h-sī kah Tsú uī lán tsún-pī ê tshù lī-khui hn̄g-hn̄g.
English: Therefore, we are always confident and know that while we are at home in the body, we are absent from the Lord;

Tailo: In teh tshuē Iésu, koh khiā tī sìng-tiān lāi, hō͘-siong mn̄g kóng, Lín siūⁿ án-tsuáⁿ? I it-tīng ē lâi kuè-tseh ho͘ⁿh?
English: Then they sought for Jesus and spoke one with another, as they stood in the temple, What do you thinkthat he isn't coming to the feast at all?

Tailo: Só͘-í, guán koh tshe-phài tsi̍t-ê hiann-tī kah in tsò-hué khì, tsit-ê hiann-tī king-kuè guán tsin tsē khó-giām, guán tsai i jia̍t-sim pang-tsān lâng. Taⁿ i hui-siông sìn-jīm lín, tsiū koh khah khat-bōng khì pang-tsān lín.
English: We have sent with them our brother, whom we have many times proved earnest in many things, but now much more earnest, by reason of the great confidence which he has in you.

Tailo: tsè-si, Lēbī lâng mā íng-uán ū lâng hiàn sio-tsè, lé-mi̍h; tiāⁿ-tiāⁿ tī Guá ê bīn-tsîng pān-lí hiàn tsè ê tāi-tsì.
English: neither shall the priests the Levites want a man before me to offer burnt offerings, and to burn meal offerings, and to do sacrifice continually.

Tailo: Taⁿ tsì-kuân Siōngtsú ah, tsí ū Lí sī Siōngtè, Lí ê uē sī tsin-si̍t; Lí mā īng tsit-ê hok-khì ìng-ín Lí ê lô͘-po̍k.
English: Now, O Lord Yahweh, you are God, and your words are truth, and you have promised this good thing to your servant:

Tailo: In hiàn tsè hō͘ in ê sîn-bîng, tshiánn jîn-bîn lâi hù, jîn-bîn tsia̍h in ê tsè-mi̍h, suà kuī-pài in ê sîn-bîng.
English: for they called the people to the sacrifices of their gods; and the people ate, and bowed down to their gods.

Tailo: Guá suî-jiân siū buah iû tsò ông, kin-á-ji̍t iáu-sī luán-jio̍k; Tse-lú-iah ê kiáⁿ, tsiah-ê lâng pí guá khah kiông. Kiâⁿ pháiⁿ ê lâng, guān Siōngtsú tsiàu i ê pháiⁿ kā i pò-ìng.
English: I am this day weak, though anointed king; and these men the sons of Zeruiah are too hard for me. May Yahweh reward the evil-doer according to his wickedness.

Tailo: Ū tsai-hō ah! Hiah-ê ka-kī khuàⁿ-tsò ū tì-huī, ka-kī khuàⁿ-tsò thong-ta̍t ê lâng.
English: Woe to those who are wise in their own eyes, And prudent in their own sight!

Tailo: Lí tī Siōngtsú só͘ beh tshuā lí kàu ê lia̍t kok tiong, ē hō͘ lâng tio̍h-kiaⁿ kah gāng-.khì, hō͘ lâng tsò uē-pèⁿ, hông khau-sé.
English: You shall become an astonishment, a proverb, and a byword, among all the peoples where Yahweh shall lead you away.

Tailo: Iôtah kah Sela̍h pún-sin mā sī sian-ti, in īng tsin tsē uē an-uì sìn-tô͘, lâi kian-kò͘ in ê sìn-sim.
English: Judas and Silas, also being prophets themselves, encouraged the brothers with many words, and strengthened them.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-ê lâng, miâ kiò-tsò A-ná-ni-a, i kah i ê bó͘ Sap-hui-la bē in ê sán-gia̍p.
English: But a certain man named Ananias, with Sapphira, his wife, sold a possession,

Tailo: Lí ê khai-ki tsó͘ huān tsuē, lí ê tiong-pó puē-gi̍k Guá.
English: Your first father sinned, and your teachers have transgressed against me.

Tailo: In-uī tshin-tshiūnn sih-nà tuì tang pîng teh sih, tsiò kàu sai pîng, Jîn-tsú ê tsài-lîm mā ē tshin-tshiūⁿ án-ne.
English: For as the lightning comes forth from the east, and is seen even to the west, so will be the coming of the Son of Man.

Tailo: Isulael lâng thiaⁿ-tio̍h kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, Lūbiān lâng, Ga̍t lâng kah Mánáse puàⁿ tsi-tso̍k ū tī Ka-nân tē ê thâu-tsîng khí tsi̍t tsō tuâⁿ, Ioltàn hô ê piⁿ-á, Isulael lâng kuè-.khì ê só͘-tsāi.
English: The children of Israel heard say, Behold, the children of Reuben and the children of Gad and the half-tribe of Manasseh have built an altar in the forefront of the land of Canaan, in the region about the Jordan, on the side that pertains to the children of Israel.

Tailo: Lia̍t kok, lóng tio̍h kah I ê tsú-bîn tsò-hué huann-hí; in-uī I ē uī I ê lô͘-po̍k ê hueh sin-uan, pò-ìng i ê tuì-ti̍k, beh sio̍k i ê tē kah i ê jîn-bîn ê tsuē.
English: Rejoice, you nations, with his people: For he will avenge the blood of his servants, Will render vengeance to his adversaries, Will make expiation for his land, for his people.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k Sìng Sîn tī ta̍k-ê siâⁿ tuì guá kíng-kò, kóng ū kaⁿ-ga̍k kah huān-lān teh thìng-hāu guá.
English: except that the Holy Spirit testifies in every city, saying that bonds and afflictions wait for me.

Tailo: Isulael lâng nā tsip-siú lâi kiâⁿ Guá it-tshè só͘ bīng-līng in ê, tsiàu Guá ê lô͘-po̍k Mô͘se só͘ bīng-līng in it-tshè ê lu̍t-huat, Guá tsiū bô koh hō͘ in ê kha î-suá, lī-khui Guá só͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ in tsó͘-sian ê tē.
English: neither will I cause the feet of Israel to wander any more out of the land which I gave their fathers, if only they will observe to do according to all that I have commanded them, and according to all the law that my servant Moses commanded them.

Tailo: E-hō͘-iá-kim kî-tha ê tāi-tsì kah i só͘ kiâⁿ khó-ò͘ⁿ ê tāi-tsì, í-ki̍p i ê put-tsìng, lóng kì tī Isulael kah Iôtah lia̍t ông ê kì-lio̍k tiong. I ê kiáⁿ E-hō͘-iá-kin suà-tsiap i tsò ông.
English: Now the rest of the acts of Jehoiakim, and his abominations which he did, and that which was found in him, behold, they are written in the book of the kings of Israel and Judah: and Jehoiachin his son reigned in his place.

Tailo: Hit-ê tshut-bē Iésu ê lâng tsìn-tsîng ū kah in thò àm-hō kóng, Guá kā I tsim ê hit-ê lâng to̍h-sī Iésu. Lín thang kā I lia̍h khí-.lâi, sè-jī kā I ah-khì.
English: Now he who betrayed him had given them a sign, saying, Whoever I will kiss, that is he. Seize him, and lead him away safely.

Tailo: Αpsalôm lâi kìnn ông, kóng, Taⁿ lí ê lô͘-po̍k ū tshiàⁿ lâng teh tsián iûⁿ-mn̂g, tshiánn ông í-ki̍p ông ê jîn-sîn kah lô͘-po̍k, tsò-hué khì.
English: Absalom came to the king, and said, See now, your servant has sheepshearers; let the king, I pray you, and his servants go with your servant.

Tailo: Tsit-ê siōng, i ê thâu-khak sī sûn-kim ê, i ê hing-khám kah tshiú-kut sī gîn ê, pak-tó͘ kah tuā-thuí sī tâng ê,
English: As for this image, its head was of fine gold, its breast and its arms of silver, its belly and its thighs of brass,

Tailo: Hiah-ê teh kā lín jiáu-luān ê lâng, guá khó͘ in m̄ ka-kī iam khí-.lâi.
English: I wish that those who disturb you would cut themselves off.

Tailo: Tī tsia teh kóng ê Tsú Tsiū-sī Sìng Sîn. Ū Tsú ê Sìng Sîn ê só͘-tsāi tsiū ū tsū-iû.
English: Now the Lord is the Spirit and where the Spirit of the Lord is, there is liberty.

Tailo: Huē-bō͘ āu-bīn ê nn̄g-ê kak-thâu, tsò nn̄g tè pán.
English: He made two boards for the corners of the tent in the far part.

Tailo: Guān ông ē tshin-tshiūⁿ hō͘-tsuí lo̍h tī kuah kuè tsháu ê hn̂g, tshin-tshiūnn ki̍p-sî ê hō͘-tsuí tsu-jūn thó͘-tē.
English: He will come down like rain on the mown grass, As showers that water the earth.

Tailo: Tsi̍t tsūn tsi̍t tsūn ê lâng tī phuàⁿ-tuàn ê suaⁿ-kok, in-uī Siōngtsú ê ji̍t-tsí teh beh kàu, tī phuàⁿ-tuàn ê suaⁿ-kok.
English: Multitudes, multitudes in the valley of decision! For the day of Yahweh is near, in the valley of decision.

Tailo: I í-king àⁿ hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ guá, só͘-í, guá tsi̍t-sì-lâng lóng beh kiû-kiò I.
English: Because he has turned his ear to me, Therefore I will call on him as long as I live.

Tailo: Suaⁿ pang tsiū suàⁿ-suàⁿ-.khì, tsio̍h-thâu suá-lī i ê pún uī.
English: But the mountain falling comes to nothing; The rock is removed out of its place;

Tailo: Guá sim-lāi siūⁿ, tsiū tuā tsik-pī hiah-ê kuì-tso̍k kah kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ, kā in kóng, Lín ta̍k lâng tuì hiann-tī the̍h lī-sik. Tsiū án-ne, guá tsio-tsi̍p tāi-huē lâi kā in tsik-pī.
English: Then I consulted with myself, and contended with the nobles and the rulers, and said to them, You exact usury, everyone of his brother. I held a great assembly against them.

Tailo: Iésu kā in kóng, Lín tsiah-ê sī tī lâng ê bīn-tsîng ka-kī kiò-tsò gī ê lâng, m̄-koh, Siōngtè tsai lín ê sim-su, in-uī lâng khuàⁿ-tsò tsun-kuì ê, tuì Siōngtè khuàⁿ khí-lâi sī thó-ià ê.
English: He said to them, You are those who justify yourselves in the sight of men, but God knows your hearts. For that which is exalted among men is an abomination in the sight of God.

Tailo: M̄-koh, i uī-tio̍h lán ê kuè-sit siū-siong, uī-tio̍h lán ê tsuē-kò siū hāi; i tam-tng hîng-hua̍t, lán tit-tio̍h pîng-an; i siū piⁿ-phah, lán tit-tio̍h i hó.
English: But he was pierced for our transgressions, he was crushed for our iniquities; the punishment that brought our peace was on him; and by his wounds we are healed.

Tailo: Thinn ê tsheⁿ-siōng sǹg bē-liáu, hái ê sua bē sǹg-.tit, Guá beh tsiàu án-ne hō͘ Guá ê lô͘-po̍k — Tabi̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun kah ho̍k-sāi Guá ê Lēbī lâng, ke-thinn tsin tsē.
English: As the army of the sky can't be numbered, neither the sand of the sea measured; so will I multiply the seed of David my servant, and the Levites who minister to me.

Tailo: Siong-sìn Iésu sī Ki-tok ê lâng, lóng sī Siōngtè ê kiáⁿ-jî; thiàⁿ pē-bú ê, mā ē thiàⁿ in só͘ seⁿ ê kiáⁿ-jī.
English: Whoever believes that Jesus is the Christ is born of God. Whoever loves the father also loves the child who is born of him.

Tailo: koh siat nn̄g-ê huí-luī tī i ê bīn-tsîng tsò kiàn-tsìng, kò i kóng, ' Lí huí-pòng Siōngtsú kah ông! ' Jiânāu kā i thua tshut-.khì, īng tsio̍h-thâu kā i tìm-sí.
English: and set two men, base fellows, before him, and let them testify against him, saying, You did curse God and the king. Then carry him out, and stone him to death.

Tailo: Abulahàm siūⁿ kóng, Siōngtè ē-tàng hō͘ Ísak tuì sí-lâng tiong koh-ua̍h, só͘-í mā ē īng-tit kóng, Ísak sī sí-liáu koh tò tńg-.lâi.
English: accounting that God is able to raise up even from the dead. Figuratively speaking, he also did receive him back from the dead.

Tailo: Tē-saⁿ ji̍t kah tē-tshit ji̍t, tshing-khì ê tio̍h kā hit-ê bô tshing-khì ê hiù tsuí, kàu tē-tshit ji̍t thang hō͘ i tshing-khì; hit-ê lâng tio̍h sé saⁿ, īng tsuí sé sing-khu; kàu ê-hng tsiah tshing-khì.
English: and the clean person shall sprinkle on the unclean on the third day, and on the seventh day: and on the seventh day he shall purify him; and he shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and shall be clean at even.

Tailo: In-uī án-ne, lín tsiah ē ū tsin tsē lâng sue-lám kah phuà-pēⁿ, mā bē tsió lâng sí-.khì.
English: For this cause many among you are weak and sickly, and not a few sleep.

Tailo: Lí in-uī hò͘ⁿ-sik put ti-tsiok, koh kah Asiul lâng kiânn kan-îm; kah in kiânn kan-îm liáu-āu, iû-guân bô buán-ì.
English: You have played the prostitute also with the Assyrians, because you were insatiable; yes, you have played the prostitute with them, and yet you weren't satisfied.

Tailo: Páulô kah Sela̍h king-kuè Àm-hui-po-lí, A-po-lô-nî-a, lâi-kàu The-sa-lô-nî-ke, tī hia ū Iô-tá-iah lâng ê huē-tn̂g.
English: Now when they had passed through Amphipolis and Apollonia, they came to Thessalonica, where there was a synagogue of the Jews.

Tailo: In-uī ín-tshuā tsiah-ê jîn-bîn ê lâng hō͘ in kiânn tshe-lō͘, hō͘ in ín-tshuā ê lâng lóng siū thun-bia̍t.
English: For those who lead this people lead them astray; And those who are led by them are destroyed.

Tailo: King-tián ū kì-tsài, I hō͘ lâng sǹg-tsò put-huat ê lâng. (tsù, ISI 53:12) Tsit-kù uē it-tīng ē ìng-giām tī guá ê sin tsiūⁿ. Sū-si̍t siōng, king-tián só͘ kì-tsài kuan-hē guá ê tāi-tsì í-king teh beh ìng-giām ā.
English: For I tell you that this which is written must still be fulfilled in me: He was counted with the lawless.' For that which concerns me has an end.

Tailo: In-uī kiông-pō ê lâng í-king siau-sit, bú-bān ê lâng í-king bia̍t-bông; só͘-ū tshuē ki-huē tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng mā lóng siū tsián-tû.
English: For the ruthless is brought to nothing, and the scoffer ceases, and all those who are alert to do evil are cut off

Tailo: Asiul bē-tàng kiù guán, guán bô koh khiâ bé, mā bô koh tuì guán ê tshiú só͘ tsō ê kóng: Lí sī guán ê sîn-bîng, in-uī ko͘-jî tuì lí tit-tio̍h liân-bín.
English: Assyria can't save us. We won't ride on horses; Neither will we say any more to the work of our hands, Our gods!' For in you the fatherless finds mercy.

Tailo: Tsìng tó-sū, tio̍h tī guá ê bīn-tsîng tiām-tiām! Tsìng lâng tio̍h tit-tio̍h sin ê khuì-la̍t! Lín lóng tio̍h kiâⁿ uá-.lâi, tsiah thang lâi kóng-uē; lán thang tāi-ke lâi piān-lūn.
English: Keep silent before me, islands, And let the peoples renew their strength. Let them come near, Then let them speak. Let's meet together for judgment.

Tailo: Hit tong-sî, lán tsing-ho̍k i só͘-ū ê siâⁿ, tsâu-bia̍t ū lâng tuà ê siâⁿ, liân tsa-bó͘ lâng kah gín-á, bô lâu kah tsi̍t-ê.
English: We took all his cities at that time, and utterly destroyed every inhabited city, with the women and the little ones; we left none remaining:

Tailo: Keh tńg kang tsá-khí, Siōngtsú ê uē lîm-kàu guá, kóng,
English: In the morning came the word of Yahweh to me, saying,

Tailo: Guá ê sìng-só͘ tī in tiong-kan, it-ti̍t kàu íng-uán; guā-pang lâng tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú, hō͘ Isulael tsiâⁿ-tsò sìng ê.
English: The nations shall know that I am Yahweh who sanctifies Israel, when my sanctuary shall be in the midst of them forevermore.

Tailo: Tuì thô͘-kha kàu mn̂g tíng, lóng ū khik ki-lō͘-ping kah tsang tshiū. Tiān ê tshiûⁿ lóng sī án-ne.
English: from the ground to above the door were cherubim and palm trees made: thus was the wall of the temple.

Tailo: Tiān-tsîng ê mn̂g-lông tn̂g jī-tsa̍p tiú kah tiān ê khuah pêⁿ, mn̂g-lông ê khuah tsa̍p tiú.
English: The porch before the temple of the house, twenty cubits was the length of it, according to the breadth of the house; and ten cubits was the breadth of it before the house.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kàng tsai-hō hō͘ jîn-bîn, in-uī in tsō gû-á, to̍h-sī Alông só͘ tsō ê.
English: Yahweh struck the people, because they made the calf, which Aaron made.

Tailo: Tuì lu̍t-huat-guā ê lâng, guá tsiū tsò lu̍t-huat-guā ê lâng, tsiah thang tit-tio̍h khah tsē lu̍t-huat-guā ê lâng lâi sìn Tsú. Án-ne tsò, m̄-sī kóng guá bô tsun-siú Siōngtè ê lu̍t-huat, kî-si̍t guá sī siū Ki-tok lu̍t-huat ê kuán-hat.
English: to those who are without law, as without law (not being without law toward God, but under law toward Christ), that I might win those who are without law.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tsiah-ê tshut-sì to̍h sī guā-pang lâng ê, lín hō͘ hiah-ê tsū-tshing siū-kat-lé ê iô-tá-iah lâng kā lín tshing-tsò bô siū kat-lé ê; in ê kat-lé sī lâng īng tshiú tī sing-khu kiânn kat-lé.
English: Therefore remember that once you, the Gentiles in the flesh, who are called uncircumcision by that which is called circumcision, (in the flesh, made by hands);

Tailo: Guá tī àm-sî ê ī-siōng tiong teh khuàⁿ, lí khuàⁿ, ū tsi̍t-ê tshin-tshiūnn lâng ê khuán, i tsē thinn-tíng ê hûn lâi-kàu tī hit-ê tuì kó͘-tsá to̍h ū-.ê, in tsiū tshuā i kàu hit-ê lâng bīn-tsîng.
English: I saw in the night visions, and behold, there came with the clouds of the sky one like a son of man, and he came even to the ancient of days, and they brought him near before him.

Tailo: Kiânn tī lín ê bīn-tsîng ê Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè, ē thè lín kau-tsiàn, tshin-tshiūnn I tī Aigi̍p uī-tio̍h lín lâi kiâⁿ tī lín ba̍k-tsiu tsîng it-tshè ê tāi-tsì.
English: Yahweh your God who goes before you, he will fight for you, according to all that he did for you in Egypt before your eyes,

Tailo: In-uī guá ê siâⁿ tsiah-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ, hō͘ guá khuàⁿ-tio̍h to̍h siong-sim.
English: My eye affects my soul, because of all the daughters of my city.

Tailo: Hit-ê hū-jîn-lâng seⁿ tsi̍t-ê tsa-po͘ kiáⁿ, to̍h-sī tsiong-lâi beh īng thih-kuái thóng-tī bān-pang ê; i ê kiáⁿ hō͘ lâng tsiap-khì Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng, lâi-kàu I ê pó-tsō hia.
English: She gave birth to a son, a male child, who is to rule all the nations with a rod of iron. Her child was caught up to God, and to his throne.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h ē kì-tit lí tī Aigi̍p bat tsò lô͘-lē, lí tio̍h tsip-siú lâi kiâⁿ tsiah-ê lu̍t-lē.
English: You shall remember that you were a bondservant in Egypt: and you shall observe and do these statutes.

Tailo: Ông ê jū-tsí só͘ kàu ê ta̍k síng ta̍k siâⁿ, Iôtah lâng lóng huann-hí khuài-lo̍k, siat iàn-si̍k, lia̍h hit ji̍t tsò hó ji̍t. Hit só͘-tsāi ê jîn-bîn in-uī kiaⁿ Iôtah lâng, tsin tsē lâng ji̍p Iôtah tsik.
English: In every province, and in every city, wherever the king's commandment and his decree came, the Jews had gladness and joy, a feast and a good day. Many from among the peoples of the land became Jews; for the fear of the Jews was fallen on them.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lí tio̍h tsiàu lí ê tì-huī lâi kiâⁿ, m̄-thang iông-ín i pe̍h thâu-mn̂g an-jiân lo̍h im-kan.
English: Do therefore according to your wisdom, and don't let his gray head go down to Sheol in peace.

Tailo: Tsìng lâng tsiū kā I thí-tshiò. M̄-koh, Iésu kā kûn-tsiòng kuáⁿ tshut-.khì, tsiū tshuā gín-á ê pē-bú í-ki̍p kah I lâi ê bûn-tô͘ ji̍p-khì gín-á ê pâng-king.
English: They ridiculed him. But he, having put them all out, took the father of the child and her mother and those who were with him, and went in where the child was lying.

Tailo: Tshin-tshiūnn Lí ū tshe-phài guá ji̍p sè-kan, guá mā ū tshe-phài in ji̍p sè-kan.
English: As you sent me into the world, even so I have sent them into the world.

Tailo: King-tián án-ne kóng, Abulahàm sìn Siōngtè, Siōngtè tsiū kā i khuàⁿ-tsò sī gī lâng. （ Tsù, CSK 15:16)
English: Even as Abraham believed God, and it was counted to him for righteousness.

Tailo: Tsá-tsîng Amí-me-li̍k ê lô͘-po̍k pà-tsiàm tsi̍t kháu tsuí-tséⁿ, Abulahàm uī-tio̍h tsit-ê tāi-tsì tuì Amí-me-li̍k bâi-uàn.
English: Abraham complained to Abimelech because of a water well, which Abimelech's servants had violently taken away.

Tailo: Tse-bú-lông ê tsi-tso̍k kun-tuī ê thóng-líng sī Tse-lông ê kiáⁿ Elíap.
English: Over the army of the tribe of the children of Zebulun was Eliab the son of Helon.

Tailo: Mô͘se kā Siōngtsú uī Isulael ê iân-kò͘ tuì Huâ-láu kah Aigi̍p lâng só͘ kiâⁿ it-tshè ê tāi-tsì, í-ki̍p lō͘-.ni̍h só͘ tú-tio̍h it-tshè ê kan-lân kah Siōngtsú án-tsuáⁿ kā in tsín-kiù, lóng it-it kóng hō͘ i ê tiūⁿ-lâng thiaⁿ.
English: Moses told his father-in-law all that Yahweh had done to Pharaoh and to the Egyptians for Israel's sake, all the hardships that had come on them on the way, and how Yahweh delivered them.

Tailo: Iésu mn̄g in kóng, Lín ū guā tsē piáⁿ? In ìn kóng, Tshit tè kah kuí bé sè-bué hî á.
English: Jesus said to them, How many loaves do you have? They said, Seven, and a few small fish.

Tailo: Tsiaⁿ-.gue̍h tē-it pan ê pan-tiúⁿ sī Tsap-ti-el ê kiáⁿ Ia-sio-be-am, i ê pan lāi ū nn̄g-bān sì-tshing lâng.
English: Over the first division for the first month was Jashobeam the son of Zabdiel: and in his division were twenty-four thousand.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Iôtah tio̍h khì, lí khuàⁿ, Guá í-king kā hit-ê tē kau tī i ê tshiú tiong.
English: Yahweh said, Judah shall go up: behold, I have delivered the land into his hand.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, ' Guá bô tshe in, tsóng-.sī, in thok Guá ê miâ suan-pò͘ pe̍h-tsha̍t, tì-sú Guá kā lín kah hiah-ê tuì lín suan-pò͘ ê sian-ti lóng kuáⁿ tshut-.khì, tsò-hué bia̍t-bông. '
English: For I have not sent them, says Yahweh, but they prophesy falsely in my name; that I may drive you out, and that you may perish, you, and the prophets who prophesy to you.

Tailo: Mā ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h hit-ê tit-tio̍h i hó ê lâng khiā tī in ê sin piⁿ, tsiū bô uē thang piān-pok.
English: Seeing the man who was healed standing with them, they could say nothing against it.

Tailo: Jî-tshiánn tē-tsiūⁿ bān-pang koh ē in-uī lí ê kiáⁿ-sun tit-tio̍h hok-khì, in-uī lí tsun-thàn Guá ê uē.
English: In your seed will all the nations of the earth be blessed, because you have obeyed my voice.

Tailo: O͘-se ê iân-kò͘ sī beh hō͘ guá kiaⁿ, hō͘ guá án-ne tsò lâi huān tsuē, in thang suan-iông pháiⁿ uē lâi kā guá huí-pòng.
English: For this cause was he hired, that I should be afraid, and do so, and sin, and that they might have matter for an evil report, that they might reproach me.

Tailo: tsiah bián guá ê tuì-ti̍k kóng, Guá iâⁿ-kuè i ; tsiah bián guá ê siû-ti̍k tī guá pua̍h-tó ê sî huann-hí.
English: Lest my enemy say, I have prevailed against him; Lest my adversaries rejoice when I fall.

Tailo: [siàu-lí]Hit-ê tuì khòng-iá lâi, hîng-tsōng tshin-tshiūnn hué-ian ê thiāu, īng bu̍t-io̍h kah jú-hiuⁿ, í-ki̍p sing-lí lâng ta̍k tsióng ê phang-hún lâi hō͘ i phang ê, sī siáⁿ lâng?
English: Who is this who comes up from the wilderness like pillars of smoke, Perfumed with myrrh and frankincense, With all spices of the merchant?

Tailo: Guá beh tuì in pìⁿ-bīn; in tuì hué tiong tshut-.lâi, tsóng-.sī, hué ē kā in sio-bia̍t. Guá tuì in pìⁿ-bīn ê sî, lín tsiū ē tsai Guá sī Siōngtsú.
English: I will set my face against them; they shall go forth from the fire, but the fire shall devour them; and you shall know that I am Yahweh, when I set my face against them.

Tailo: In-uī guá thiaⁿ-tio̍h lí tuì Siōngtè ê tsú-bîn ū thiàⁿ-sim, tuì Tsú Iésu ū sìn-sim.
English: hearing of your love, and of the faith which you have toward the Lord Jesus, and toward all the saints;

Tailo: Tsîng-kiâⁿ āu-tuè ê kûn-tsiòng tuā-siaⁿ huah, Tabi̍t ê kiáⁿ-sun, Hô-sàn-ná! Hōng Tsú ê miâ lâi ê hit uī ing-kai tit-tio̍h o-ló! （ Tsù, SPh 118:26) Hô-sàn-ná! Tsì-kuân Siōngtè.
English: The multitudes who went before him, and who followed kept shouting, Hosanna to the son of David! Blessed is he who comes in the name of the Lord! Hosanna in the highest!

Tailo: Kā lín suah-bué sió-tī tshuā-lâi guá tsia, án-ne lín ê uē tsiū ū pîn-kì, lín mā m̄-bián sí. In tsiū tsiàu án-ne khì kiâⁿ.
English: Bring your youngest brother to me; so will your words be verified, and you won't die. They did so.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t ji̍t beh àm ê sî, Tabi̍t tuì tshn̂g-.ni̍h khí-.lâi, tī ông-kiong ê tshù tíng kiâⁿ lâi kiâⁿ khì, tuì tshù tíng khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng teh sé-i̍k, tsit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng seⁿ-tsò tsin suí.
English: It happened at evening, that David arose from off his bed, and walked on the roof of the king's house: and from the roof he saw a woman bathing; and the woman was very beautiful to look on.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê sù-tsiá kíng-kài Iosiúah, kóng,
English: The angel of Yahweh protested to Joshua, saying,

Tailo: Tsit sè-kan tshám ah, in-uī ū ín-khí lâng huān tsuē ê tāi-tsì. Sè-kan lân-bián ū ín-khí lâng huān tsuē ê tāi-tsì, tsóng-.sī, ín-khí lâng huān tsuē ê hit-ê lâng ū tsai-hō.
English: Woe to the world because of occasions of stumbling! For it must be that the occasions come, but woe to that person through whom the occasion comes!

Tailo: Tsiū mn̄g i kóng, ' Pîng-iú, lí ji̍p-lâi tsia ná ē bô tshīng lé-ho̍k? ' Hit-ê lâng tiām-tiām bô ìn.
English: and he said to him, Friend, how did you come in here not wearing wedding clothing?' He was speechless.

Tailo: To̍k-to̍k Lí bat kiù guán thuat-lī tuì-ti̍k, hō͘ uàn-hūn guán ê lâng kiàn-siàu.
English: But you have saved us from our adversaries, And have shamed those who hate us.

Tailo: Tsiaⁿ-gue̍h kan, Isulael tsuân huē-tsiòng lâi-kàu Tsîn ê khòng-iá, jîn-bîn tsiū tuà tī Ka-té-si. Milíám sí tī hia, tsiū bâi-tsòng tī hia.
English: The children of Israel, even the whole congregation, came into the wilderness of Zin in the first month: and the people abode in Kadesh; and Miriam died there, and was buried there.

Tailo: I-é-lí-miah ìn Tsetikiah kóng, Guá nā kā lí kóng, lí kám bô beh thâi-sí guá? Guá nā tsí-sī lí, lí mā bô beh thiaⁿ.
English: Then Jeremiah said to Zedekiah, If I declare it to you, will you not surely put me to death? and if I give you counsel, you will not listen to me.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí ē kì-tit tuì-ti̍k ū huí-pòng Lí, gû-gōng ê lâng ū siat-to̍k Lí ê miâ.
English: Remember this, that the enemy has mocked you, Yahweh. Foolish people have blasphemed your name.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Hit sî, Guá beh tsò Isulael ta̍k pâng-thâu ê Siōngtè, in ē tsò Guá ê tsú-bîn.
English: At that time, says Yahweh, will I be the God of all the families of Israel, and they shall be my people.

Tailo: Alâm ông Bian-ha-tat tsū-tsi̍p i ê kun-tuī, ū saⁿ-tsa̍p-jī-ê ông kah i khì, ū bé, ū tsiàn-tshia, tsiūⁿ-khì uî Sa-má-lī-a, lâi kā i kong-kik.
English: Ben Hadad the king of Syria gathered all his army together; and there were thirty-two kings with him, and horses and chariots: and he went up and besieged Samaria, and fought against it.

Tailo: Tsit-ê ua̍h-miā í-king tshut-hiān, guán ū khuàⁿ-.tio̍h, tsit-má lâi tsò kiàn-tsìng, beh pò lín tsai hit-ê íng-uán ê ua̍h-miā; I pún-lâi to̍h kah Thiⁿ-pē tông-tsāi, taⁿ tuì guán hián-hiān.
English: (and the life was revealed, and we have seen, and testify, and declare to you the life, the eternal life, which was with the Father, and was revealed to us);

Tailo: Tsóng-.sī, hit nn̄g-ê lâng tshun tshiú, khan Lótoh ji̍p-khì tshù lāi, kā mn̂g kuainn khí-.lâi.
English: But the men put forth their hand, and brought Lot into the house to them, and shut the door.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, guá àm-sî kì-liām Lí ê miâ, tsun-siú Lí ê lu̍t-huat.
English: I have remembered your name, Yahweh, in the night, And I obey your law.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kā tsè-mi̍h lâu tī tsè-tuâⁿ tsîng, sing khì kah lí ê hiann-tī tsí-muē hô-hó, jiân-āu tsiah tńg-lâi hiàn tsè-mi̍h.
English: leave your gift there before the altar, and go your way. First be reconciled to your brother, and then come and offer your gift.

Tailo: Só͘-í, I kā bíng-lia̍t ê siū-khì kah tsing-tsiàn ê hiong-bíng piàⁿ tī i ê sin tsiūⁿ. Tī i ê sì-kho͘-uî tshin-tshiūnn hué to̍h, i iáu m̄-tsai, hué sio-.tio̍h i, i mā bô khuà-ì.
English: Therefore he poured on him the fierceness of his anger, and the strength of battle; and it set him on fire round about, yet he didn't know; and it burned him, yet he didn't lay it to heart.

Tailo: M̄-koh, tshia-hua ê kuáⁿ-hū suî-jiân teh ua̍h, kî-si̍t sim-sîn í-king sí-.khì.
English: But she who gives herself to pleasure is dead while she lives.

Tailo: I īng tsô-kia̍p tshâ tsò huē-bō͘ ê khiā-pán.
English: He made the boards for the tent of acacia wood, standing up.

Tailo: Tì-huī ê lâng tī an-tsīng tiong kóng-uē, pí gōng lâng ê thâu-ba̍k tuā-siaⁿ jióng khah ū lâng thiaⁿ.
English: The words of the wise heard in quiet are better than the cry of him who rules among fools.

Tailo: Koh tuì hia tsiūⁿ-khì kong-táⁿ tuà tī Te-bil ê jîn-bîn. （Tsit-ê Te-bil í-tsîng miâ kiò-tsò Ki-lia̍t-se-hut. ）
English: He went up there against the inhabitants of Debir: now the name of Debir before was Kiriath Sepher.

Tailo: Lâng nā khan i ê tsí-muē, bô-lūn tâng-pē á-.sī tâng-bú ê, i khuànn i ê ē-sin, i khuànn i ê ē-sin, tse sī kiàn-siàu ê tāi-tsì; in tio̍h tī i ê jîn-bîn ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng hông tsián-tû. I ū lō͘-hiān i ê tsí-muē ê ē-sin, tio̍h tam-tng i ê tsuē.
English: If a man takes his sister, his father's daughter, or his mother's daughter, and sees her nakedness, and she sees his nakedness; it is a shameful thing; and they shall be cut off in the sight of the children of their people: he has uncovered his sister's nakedness; he shall bear his iniquity.

Tailo: Iûⁿ-ko khui tshit-ê hong-ìn tiong-kan ê tsi̍t-ê ê sî, guá teh khuàⁿ, ū thiaⁿ-tio̍h sì tsiah ua̍h-mi̍h ê tsi̍t tsiah, īng ná tshin-tshiūnn luî ê siann kóng, Lâi!
English: I saw that the Lamb opened one of the seven seals, and I heard one of the four living creatures saying, as with a voice of thunder, Come and see!

Tailo: Bē-tha-niah lī Êlúsalèm iok saⁿ kong-lí.
English: Now Bethany was near Jerusalem, about fifteen stadia away.

Tailo: I niû i ê sù-hong, sì-kho͘-uî ū tshiûⁿ, tn̂g gō͘ pah, khuah gō͘ pah, lâi hun-pia̍t sìng ê kah pîng-siông ê.
English: He measured it on the four sides: it had a wall round about, the length five hundred, and the breadth five hundred, to make a separation between that which was holy and that which was common.

Tailo: Siōngtsú bat kah in li̍p-iok, kā in huan-hù kóng, M̄-thang kìng-uì pa̍t-ê sîn-bîng, m̄-thang kuī-pài, m̄-thang kā i ho̍k-sāi, m̄-thang tuì i tsè-hiàn.
English: with whom Yahweh had made a covenant, and charged them, saying, You shall not fear other gods, nor bow yourselves to them, nor serve them, nor sacrifice to them:

Tailo: Mô͘se tsiū tuì i ê Siōngtè — Siōngtsú kiû-tsîng, kóng, Siōngtsú ah, Lí án-tsuáⁿ tuì Lí ê tsú-bîn tuā siū-khì? Sī Lí īng tuā khuì-la̍t kah tuā kuân-lîng ê tshiú, tuì Aigi̍p tē kā in tshuā tshut-.lâi ê.
English: Moses begged Yahweh his God, and said, Yahweh, why does your wrath burn hot against your people, that you have brought forth out of the land of Egypt with great power and with a mighty hand?

Tailo: Tse sī in tsò-kang ê pan-lia̍t, thang ji̍p-khì Siōngtsú ê tiān, tsiàu in ê tsó͘-sian Alông tsun-thàn Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè só͘ huan-hù ê lē.
English: This was the ordering of them in their service, to come into the house of Yahweh according to the ordinance given to them by Aaron their father, as Yahweh, the God of Israel, had commanded him.

Tailo: Kàu tē-tshit ji̍t, tsè-si tio̍h giām hit-ê tsìng-thâu, lí khuàⁿ, tshng nā bô thuàⁿ, hit tiong-kan mā bô âm mn̂g, tshng ê khuán-sit mā bô tshim-ji̍p-khì phuê-hu lāi,
English: On the seventh day the priest shall examine the plague; and behold, if the itch hasn't spread, and there is no yellow hair in it, and the appearance of the itch isn't deeper than the skin,

Tailo: Só͘-í, tio̍h tshīng Siōngtè só͘ sù tsuân-hù ê tsiàn-kah, thang tī siâ-ok ê ji̍t-tsí ē-tàng tí-khòng tuì-ti̍k ê kong-kik, tsiàn-tàu kàu-té, khiā tsāi siú-tiâu tīn-tē.
English: Therefore, put on the whole armor of God, that you may be able to withstand in the evil day, and, having done all, to stand.

Tailo: Guán tī hia khuàⁿ-tio̍h Alap tso̍k lâng, to̍h-sī tuā-hàn lâng, in sī tuā-hàn lâng ê kiáⁿ-sun. Tsiàu guán khuànn ka-kī ná tshin-tshiūnn tsháu-me̍h, tsiàu in khuànn guán mā sī án-ne.
English: There we saw the Nephilim, the sons of Anak, who come of the Nephilim: and we were in our own sight as grasshoppers, and so we were in their sight.

Tailo: Hit sî, hiah-ê king-ha̍k kàu-su kah tsè-si-tiúⁿ tsai Iésu tsit-ê phì-jū sī teh tsí in, tsiū ài beh tong-tiûⁿ hē tshiú lia̍h Iésu, m̄-koh, in kiaⁿ tsìng lâng.
English: The chief priests and the scribes sought to lay hands on Him that very hour, but they feared the peoplefor they knew He had spoken this parable against them.

Tailo: Hit-ê put-huat ê lâng lîm-kàu ê sî, uá-khò Satán ta̍k tsióng ê kuân-sè, lâi kiâⁿ ké sîn-jiah kah kî-sū.
English: even he whose coming is according to the working of Satan with all power and signs and lying wonders,

Tailo: Tuà tī Hatsool ê jîn-bîn, lí tio̍h tô-tsáu, tsáu-khì hn̄g-hn̄g, bih khì ún-ba̍t ê só͘-tsāi; in-uī Babúlông ông Nepkatnetsal siat-kè beh hāi lín, kuat-tīng beh kā lín kong-kik.
English: Flee you, wander far off, dwell in the depths, you inhabitants of Hazor, says Yahweh; for Nebuchadnezzar king of Babylon has taken counsel against you, and has conceived a purpose against you.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng: Guá in-uī án-ne beh kah lín tsing-piān, mā beh kah lín ê kiáⁿ-kiáⁿ sun-sun tsing-piān.
English: Therefore I will yet contend with you, says Yahweh, and with your children's children will I contend.

Tailo: Tī thâi lí ê lâng ê bīn-tsîng, lí kám iáu teh kóng, ' Guá sī Siōngtè '? Kî-si̍t lí tī thâi-sí lí ê lâng ê tshiú, tsí-put-kò sī lâng, m̄-sī Siōngtè.
English: Will you yet say before him who kills you, I am God? but you are man, and not God, in the hand of him who wounds you.

Tailo: It-tīng tio̍h pàng tsiáu-bó khì, tsóng-.sī, tsiáu-á-kiáⁿ lí thang lia̍h-.khì; án-ne, lí tsiū thang hióng-siū hok-khì koh tsia̍h tn̂g huè-siū.
English: you shall surely let the hen go, but the young you may take to yourself; that it may be well with you, and that you may prolong your days.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Iôtah lâng kah Êlúsalèm án-ne kóng, Tio̍h khai-khún lín ê thó͘-tē, m̄-thang iā tsíng tī tshì-phè lāi.
English: For thus says Yahweh to the men of Judah and to Jerusalem, Break up your fallow ground, and don't sow among thorns.

Tailo: Tsit-ê tē-jī ji̍t, ông tī tsiú-iàn ê tiong-kan koh mn̄g Êsutel kóng, Ông-hō͘ Êsutel, lí só͘ tshíng ê sī siáⁿ-mi̍h? Guá beh hō͘ lí; lí só͘ kiû sī siáⁿ-mi̍h? Tsiū-sī kok ê tsi̍t-puàⁿ mā ē tsò-.tit.
English: The king said again to Esther on the second day at the banquet of wine, What is your petition, queen Esther? and it shall be granted you: and what is your request? even to the half of the kingdom it shall be performed.

Tailo: Isulael ông kóng, Tshám ah, Siōngtsú tsū-tsi̍p tsit saⁿ-ê ông, beh kā in kau tī Mô͘ap lâng ê tshiú.
English: The king of Israel said, Alas! for Yahweh has called these three kings together to deliver them into the hand of Moab.

Tailo: Siōngtsú bat giâm-lē kā guá kíng-kài; tsóng-.sī, I bē kā guá kau tī sí-bông.
English: Yah has punished me severely, But he has not given me over to death.

Tailo: Tsìng-tsoh tshân-hn̂g ê lâng ē ū bí-niûⁿ kàu-gia̍h; kau-puê bô hē-lo̍h ê lâng sī bû-ti.
English: He who tills his land shall have plenty of bread, But he who chases fantasies is void of understanding.

Tailo: Ū tsi̍t-kuá lâng ba̍k-thâu hui-siông kuân, ba̍k-tsiu phuê mā thí kuân-kuân.
English: There is a generation, oh how lofty are their eyes! Their eyelids are lifted up.

Tailo: Kàu tē-la̍k ji̍t, in khioh tîng-puē ê gia̍h, ta̍k lâng nn̄g o͘-mel. Tsuân huē-tsiòng hiah-ê thâu-lâng lâi kā Mô͘se kóng;
English: It happened that on the sixth day they gathered twice as much bread, two omers for each one, and all the rulers of the congregation came and told Moses.

Tailo: Tī tsit-ê tuâⁿ tíng, m̄-thang hiàn pa̍t tsióng ê hiuⁿ, mā m̄-thang hiàn sio-tsè kah sò͘-tsè, mā m̄-thang kuàn-tiān tī i ê tíng-bīn.
English: You shall offer no strange incense on it, nor burnt offering, nor meal offering; and you shall pour no drink offering on it.

Tailo: In-uī hiah-ê ji̍t-tsí teh beh ū tuā tsai-lān, sī tuì Siōngtè tshòng-tsō sè-kan í-lâi m̄-bat ū ê, tsiong-lâi mā bē koh ū.
English: For in those days there will be oppression, such as there has not been the like from the beginning of the creation which God created until now, and never will be.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, Lí ê tsû-ài phiàn-muá tē-bīn; kiû Lí kā Lí ê lu̍t-lē kà-sī guá!
English: The earth is full of your loving kindness, Yahweh. Teach me your statutes. TET

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Bôohtsuh tshuā Lùthuh tsò bó͘ kah i tâng-pâng liáu-āu, Siōngtsú hō͘ i huâi-īn seⁿ tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ.
English: So Boaz took Ruth, and she became his wife; and he went in to her, and Yahweh gave her conception, and she bore a son.

Tailo: tsóng-.sī, lâng tshut-sì tiāⁿ-tio̍h ū huān-lān, tshin-tshiūnn hué-tsheⁿ pue tsiūⁿ-kuân.
English: But man is born to trouble, As the sparks fly upward.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, tsa̍p-it-ê bûn-tô͘ tsē teh tsia̍h pn̄g ê sî, Iésu tuì in hián-hiān, tsik-pī in ê m̄-sìn kah sim ngē, in-uī in m̄ siong-sìn hiah-ê khuàⁿ-tio̍h Iésu koh-ua̍h ê lâng kā in kóng ê uē.
English: Afterward he was revealed to the eleven themselves as they sat at the table, and he rebuked them for their unbelief and hardness of heart, because they didn't believe those who had seen him after he had risen.

Tailo: Hó-gia̍h kah tsun-kuì lóng sī tuì Lí lâi, Lí mā tsiáng-kuán bān-iú. Tī Lí ê tshiú ū tuā kuân-lîng kah tuā khuì-la̍t, hō͘ lâng tsun-tuā, hō͘ kûn-tsiòng tuā khuì-la̍t, lóng tshut tī Lí ê tshiú.
English: Both riches and honor come of you, and you rule over all; and in your hand is power and might; and it is in your hand to make great, and to give strength to all.

Tailo: Hiann-tī tsí-muē, uī-tio̍h lín, guá tsiah īng pún-sin kah A-po-lô tsò lē, lâi kóng-khí tsiah-ê tāi-tsì, hō͘ lín thang tuì guán lâi ha̍k-si̍p M̄-thang tshiau-kuè king-tián só͘ kì-tsài Tsit-kù uē ê ì-sù. Lín tiong-kan bô-lūn siáⁿ-mi̍h lâng to m̄-thang kiau-ngō͘, m̄-thang tsun-tiōng tsit-ê, khuànn-khin hit-ê.
English: Now these things, brothers, I have in a figure transferred to myself and Apollos for your sakes, that in us you might learn not to think beyond the things which are written, that none of you be puffed up against one another.

Tailo: In-uī lí tuì Guá tuā siū-khì, koh in-uī lí kiau-ngō͘ ê uē thàng-kàu Guá ê hīⁿ-khang, Guá tsiū beh īng Guá ê kau kau lí ê phīⁿ, īng Guá ê bé-kā-kiuⁿ khuà tī lí ê tshuì, hō͘ lí tuì guân-lō͘ tò tńg-.khì. '
English: Because of your raging against me, and because your arrogance has come up into my ears, therefore will I put my hook in your nose and my bridle in your lips, and I will turn you back by the way by which you came.

Tailo: Guá án-ne kóng, sī uī-tio̍h beh hō͘ lín bián siū hua-giân khá-gí ê bê-hi̍k.
English: Now this I say that no one may delude you with persuasiveness of speech.

Tailo: Lí hō͘ Lēbī ê tsi-tso̍k kiâⁿ uá-.lâi, khiā tī tsè-si Alông ê bīn-tsîng, thang kā i ho̍k-sāi.
English: Bring the tribe of Levi near, and set them before Aaron the priest, that they may minister to him.

Tailo: I tio̍h tuì hit tiong-kan the̍h-tshut sò͘-tsè ê mī-hún tsi̍t pé, kah iû, kah sò͘-tsè tiong só͘-ū ê jú-hiuⁿ, tī tuâⁿ tíng sio lâi tsò kì-liām, hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú tsò phang-bī.
English: He shall take from there his handful of the fine flour of the meal offering, and of its oil, and all the frankincense which is on the meal offering, and shall burn it on the altar for a sweet savor, as its memorial, to Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá tsiū tshìn lâi kau tī in ê tshiú, ū gîn la̍k pah tha-lan-t, gîn-khì tāng tsi̍t pah tha-lan-t kah kim tsi̍t pah tha-lan-t;
English: I weighed into their hand six hundred fifty talents of silver, and silver vessels one hundred talents; of gold one hundred talents;

Tailo: Nā i só͘ thau ê, kiám-tshái gû á-.sī lî, iûⁿ, iáu ua̍h tī i ê tshiú tiong, tsiū tio̍h puê tîng-puē.
English: If the stolen property is found in his hand alive, whether it is ox, donkey, or sheep, he shall pay double.

Tailo: ' Lí khuàⁿ, lí ê a-tsik Sialúm ê kiáⁿ Hanámel beh lâi kìnn lí, kóng: Guá tī Anáthot hit khu tshân, tshiáⁿ lí lâi bé; in-uī sio̍k-huê ê kuân tsāi tī lí, lí thang bé. '
English: Behold, Hanamel the son of Shallum your uncle shall come to you, saying, Buy you my field that is in Anathoth; for the right of redemption is yours to buy it.

Tailo: In tshut-.lâi ê sî, Aigi̍p lâng tuā huann-hí, in-uī Aigi̍p lâng bat uī-tio̍h in lâi kiaⁿ.
English: Egypt was glad when they departed, For the fear of them had fallen on them.

Tailo: In-uī lí kóng, ' Guá sī hó-gia̍h lâng, í-king huat-tsâi, lóng bô khiàm-khueh. ' Kî-si̍t lí m̄-tsai ka-kī pi-tshám, khó-liân, sàn-tshiah, tsheⁿ-mê koh thǹg-pak-theh.
English: Because you say, I am rich, and have gotten riches, and have need of nothing;' and don't know that you are the wretched one, miserable, poor, blind, and naked;

Tailo: Kûn-tsiòng tsiū mn̄g Iésu kóng, Guán beh uân-sîng Siōngtè ê kang-tsok ing-kai tio̍h án-tsuáⁿ lâi tsò?
English: They said therefore to him, What must we do, that we may work the works of God?

Tailo: Tsiah-ê jîn-bîn īng tshuì-tûn tsun-kìng guá, m̄-koh, in ê sim lī-khui guá hn̄g-hn̄g.
English: These people draw near to me with their mouth, And honor me with their lips; But their heart is far from me.

Tailo: I tuì ông kóng, Guá tī pún-kok thiaⁿ-tio̍h lí ê tāi-tsì kah lí ê tì-huī, lóng sī tsin-si̍t!
English: She said to the king, It was a true report that I heard in my own land of your acts, and of your wisdom.

Tailo: Taⁿ lín tio̍h khak-si̍t tsai, lín tī só͘ beh khì kià-kha ê tē, ē tuì to-kiàm, tuì ki-hng, tuì un-i̍k lâi sí.
English: Now therefore know certainly that you shall die by the sword, by the famine, and by the pestilence, in the place where you desire to go to sojourn there.

Tailo: Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Lín m̄-thang kì-liām í-tsîng ê tāi-tsì, mā m̄-thang siūⁿ kó͘-tsá ê tāi-tsì.
English: Don't remember the former things, neither consider the things of old.

Tailo: In ū tshin-tshiūnn tsa-bó͘ lâng ê thâu-mn̂g, koh ū tshin-tshiūnn sai ê gê.
English: They had hair like women's hair, and their teeth were like those of lions.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h kià phue hō͘ só͘-ū siū lia̍h ê lâng, kóng, ' Siōngtsú kóng-tio̍h Ne-he-lâm lâng Simáiah kóng: In-uī Simáiah tuì lín suan-pò͘ ê, Guá bô tshe i, i hō͘ lín uá-khò pe̍h-tsha̍t;
English: Send to all them of the captivity, saying, Thus says Yahweh concerning Shemaiah the Nehelamite: Because Shemaiah has prophesied to you, and I didn't send him, and he has caused you to trust in a lie;

Tailo: In-uī khùn ê lâng lóng sī àm-sî teh khùn, tsiú-tsuì ê lâng lóng sī àm-sî teh tsuì.
English: For those who sleep, sleep in the night, and those who are drunken are drunken in the night.

Tailo: Lí kā in khǹg tī Lí ê bīn-tsîng ún-ba̍t ê só͘-tsāi, bián-tit tú-tio̍h lâng ê kè-bô͘; Lí àm-tiong tī tiùⁿ-uî lāi kā in pó-siú, tsiah bián hō͘ in siū tshuì-tsi̍h ê tiòng-siong.
English: In the shelter of your presence you will hide them from the plotting of man. You will keep them secretly in a dwelling away from the strife of tongues.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, Lí kám tsuân-pō͘ khì-sak Iôtah? Lí ê sim kám thó-ià Si-óng? Lí ná ē phah guán, koh hō͘ guán bô thang tit-tio̍h i hó? Guán ǹg-bāng pîng-an, mā bô ū hok-khì; ǹg-bāng i-tī ê ki-huē, bô siūⁿ kóng ē tú-tio̍h kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ.
English: Have you utterly rejected Judah? has your soul loathed Zion? why have you struck us, and there is no healing for us? We looked for peace, but no good came; and for a time of healing, and behold, dismay!

Tailo: Iésu koh kā in kóng, Guá si̍t-tsāi kā lín kóng, lín ē khuànn-kìnn thiⁿ khui, Siōngtè ê thiⁿ-sài tī Jîn-tsú ê tíng-bīn teh khí-khí lo̍h-lo̍h.
English: He said to him, Most assuredly, I tell you, hereafter you will see heaven opened, and the angels of God ascending and descending on the Son of Man.

Tailo: Hui-li̍p-pò͘ kah Ba-tho-lô-mái; Tho-má-suh kah thiu-suè ê Máthài; Al-hua-ioh ê kiáⁿ Iâkop kah That-tái;
English: Philip; Bartholomew; Thomas; Matthew the tax collector; James the son of Alphaeus; and Lebbaeus, whose surname was Thaddaeus;

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Iôséhuh kā in lóng kuainn tī kaⁿ-.ni̍h saⁿ kang.
English: He put them all together into custody for three days.

Tailo: Siâⁿ ū tuā koh kuân ê tshiûⁿ, siâⁿ tshiûⁿ ū tsa̍p-jī-ê mn̂g, tsiah-ê mn̂g ū tsa̍p-jī-ê thiⁿ-sài teh kò͘-siú; muí tsi̍t-ê siâⁿ mn̂g kok khik Isulael kiáⁿ-sun tsa̍p-jī tsi-tso̍k ê miâ.
English: having a great and high wall; having twelve gates, and at the gates twelve angels; and names written on them, which are the names of the twelve tribes of the children of Israel.

Tailo: só͘-í, guá thó-ià ka-kī, tī tîn-ai kah hué-hu ê tiong-kan hué-kái.
English: Therefore I abhor myself, And repent in dust and ashes.

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tsiah-ê bú-bān ê lâng, to̍h-sī kuán-hat tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê jîn-bîn ê lâng, lín tio̍h thiaⁿ Siōngtsú ê uē.
English: Therefore hear the word of Yahweh, you scoffers, that rule this people in Jerusalem:

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā in bē hō͘ Ka-nân ông Ia-bín, to̍h-sī tī Hatsool tsò ông ê, i ê kun-tiúⁿ sī Sisela̍h, i tuà tī guā-pang lâng ê Hā-lô-siat.
English: Yahweh sold them into the hand of Jabin king of Canaan, who reigned in Hazor; the captain of whose army was Sisera, who lived in Harosheth of the Gentiles.

Tailo: Tsháu-me̍h ê hîng-tsōng tshin-tshiūnn tsún-pī beh tshut-tsiàn ê bé, thâu-khak tíng kah-ná ū tì kim ê bián-liû, in ê bīn tshin-tshiūnn lâng ê bīn.
English: The shapes of the locusts were like horses prepared for war. On their heads were something like golden crowns, and their faces were like people's faces.

Tailo: I kìm-tsí ta̍k lâng ê tshiú kang-tsok; hō͘ só͘ tsō ê lâng lóng ē tsai I ê tsok-uî.
English: He seals up the hand of every man, That all men whom he has made may know it.

Tailo: Só͘-í, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng, Lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh kā Guá ê siū-khì kah Guá ê thòng-hūn piàⁿ tī tsit só͘-tsāi, to̍h-sī piàⁿ tī lâng kah tsing-seⁿ, í-ki̍p tshân-iá ê tshiū-ba̍k kah thó͘-tē ê tshut-sán, tshin-tshiūnn hué teh to̍h bē hua.
English: Therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh: Behold, my anger and my wrath shall be poured out on this place, on man, and on animal, and on the trees of the field, and on the fruit of the ground; and it shall burn, and shall not be quenched.

Tailo: Mā bô siūⁿ khuàⁿ māi lè, lîng-khó hō͘ tsi̍t-ê lâng thè tsìng lâng sí, tsiah bián hō͘ tsuân bîn-tso̍k bia̍t-bông. Án-ne tuì lín khah iú-lī.
English: nor do you consider that it is advantageous for us that one man should die for the people, and that the whole nation not perish.

Tailo: Páulô kóng suah, the̍h piáⁿ, tī tsìng lâng ê bīn-tsîng kám-siā Siōngtè liáu-āu, kā piáⁿ peh-khui lâi tsia̍h.
English: When he had said this, and had taken bread, he gave thanks to God in the presence of all, and he broke it, and began to eat.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, kiû Lí kā Lí ê tō-lō͘ tsí-sī guá, in-uī guá ê tuì-ti̍k ê iân-kò͘, kiû Lí tshuā guá kiânn pêⁿ-tháⁿ ê lō͘.
English: Teach me your way, Yahweh. Lead me in a straight path, because of my enemies.

Tailo: Tī Tsú tuā koh îng-iāu ê ji̍t kàng-lîm tsìn-tsîng, ji̍t-thâu ē piàn-tsò àm, gue̍h ē piàn-tsò ná hueh hiah-ni̍h âng.
English: The sun will be turned into darkness, And the moon into blood, Before the great and glorious day of the Lord comes.

Tailo: [siàu-lí] Guá ê lông-kun sio̍k guá, guá mā sio̍k i, i tī pik-ha̍p hue tiong teh tshī i ê iûⁿ-kûn.
English: My beloved is mine, and I am his. He browses among the lilies.

Tailo: Babúlông ông tī Tsetikiah ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng, thâi-sí i hiah-ê kiáⁿ, koh tī Lip-la̍h thâi-sí Iôtah só͘-ū ê kuì-tso̍k.
English: The king of Babylon killed the sons of Zedekiah before his eyes: he killed also all the princes of Judah in Riblah.

Tailo: I ê thâu-hia̍h siá tsi̍t-ê ū ún-ba̍t ì-sù ê miâ, to̍h-sī Tuā Babúlông, tē-tsiūⁿ ê îm-hū kah khó-ò͘ⁿ ê mi̍h ê lāu-bú.
English: And on her forehead a name was written, MYSTERY, BABYLON THE GREAT, THE MOTHER OF THE PROSTITUTES AND OF THE ABOMINATIONS OF THE EARTH.

Tailo: Tuà tī Mô͘ap ê lâng, lín tio̍h lī-khui tsiah-ê siâⁿ, khì tuà tī tsio̍h-puâⁿ, tshin-tshiūnn pan-kah tsò siū tī khang-kháu ê piⁿ-á.
English: You inhabitants of Moab, leave the cities, and dwell in the rock; and be like the dove that makes her nest over the mouth of the abyss.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā thinn-tíng ê Siōngtè só͘ bīng-līng ê, tio̍h uī-tio̍h thinn-tíng ê Siōngtè ê tiān tsim-tsiok lâi tsò. Ná ē-sái hō͘ siū-khì lîm-kàu ông kah ông ê kiáⁿ ê kok?
English: Whatever is commanded by the God of heaven, let it be done exactly for the house of the God of heaven; for why should there be wrath against the realm of the king and his sons?

Tailo: Ông tsiū tshe bé, tshia kah tuā tuī ê ping khì hia. In thàu-mê lâi-kàu-uī, uî-khùn hit-ê siâⁿ.
English: Therefore sent he there horses, and chariots, and a great army: and they came by night, and surrounded the city.

Tailo: [tsùn-lâm] Guá só͘ ài ê tī tsiah-ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ tiong-kan, tshin-tshiūnn tshì-á lāi ê pik-ha̍p hue.
English: As a lily among thorns, So is my love among the daughters. Beloved

Tailo: In nā m̄-thiaⁿ, Guá tsiū beh kā in kuáⁿ-tshut hit kok, kuáⁿ tshut-lâi kā in bia̍t-tiāu. Tse sī Siōngtsú kóng ê.
English: But if they will not hear, then will I pluck up that nation, plucking up and destroying it, says Yahweh.

Tailo: Lí m̄-thang kóng, tsá-tsîng ê ji̍t-tsí ná ē iâⁿ-kuè hiān-kim ê ji̍t-tsí? In-uī lí án-ne mn̄g m̄-sī tshut tī tì-huī.
English: Don't say, Why were the former days better than these? For you do not ask wisely about this.

Tailo: Kiông-pō hing-khí, tsiâⁿ-tsò hîng-hua̍t pháiⁿ ê kuái-á. In sí-.khì, in ê kûn-tsiòng mā sí-.khì, in ê tsâi-pó mā bô-.khì, in tiong-kan bô lâng tit-tio̍h tsun-kuì.
English: Violence is risen up into a rod of wickedness; none of them shall remain, nor of their multitude, nor of their wealth: neither shall there be eminency among them.

Tailo: Tng hit ji̍t, ū tshut hó tsiú ê phû-tô hn̂g, lín tio̍h kí tsit-ê hn̂g tshiùⁿ kua, kóng,
English: In that day, sing to her, A pleasant vineyard!

Tailo: Tio̍h ū tsi̍t-ê lâng tī tsè-si ê ba̍k-tsiu tsîng, sio bó ê gû-á, to̍h-sī sio i ê phuê, i ê bah, i ê hueh, i ê sái.
English: One shall burn the heifer in his sight; her skin, and her flesh, and her blood, with her dung, shall he burn:

Tailo: Guán tsit sî tshiáⁿ lí kàu Siōngtsú — guán ê Siōngtè ê bīn-tsîng, I só͘ kóng ê, bô-lūn sī hó sī pháiⁿ, guán lóng ē tsun-thàn I ê uē; guán tsun-thàn Siōngtsú — guán ê Siōngtè ê uē, tsiū thang tit-tio̍h hing-thong.
English: Whether it be good, or whether it be evil, we will obey the voice of Yahweh our God, to whom we send you; that it may be well with us, when we obey the voice of Yahweh our God.

Tailo: Sàulô kah Tabi̍t saⁿ-ê a-hiaⁿ, í-ki̍p Isulael jîn-bîn, tī Ela̍h ê suaⁿ-kok kah Huilīsū lâng kau-tsiàn.
English: Now Saul, and they, and all the men of Israel, were in the valley of Elah, fighting with the Philistines.

Tailo: Ahap kā Eliiah kóng, Guá ê tuì-ti̍k, lí kám tshuē ē tio̍h guá? I ìn kóng, Guá tshuē-tio̍h lí, in-uī lí tshut-bē ka-kī, kiânn Siōngtsú khuànn-tsò pháiⁿ ê tāi-tsì.
English: Ahab said to Elijah, Have you found me, my enemy? He answered, I have found you, because you have sold yourself to do that which is evil in the sight of Yahweh.

Tailo: Ehulaim kóng： Guá si̍t-tsāi tsin hó-gia̍h, í-king tit-tio̍h tsâi-pó; tī guá só͘ lô-khó͘ tit-tio̍h ê, bô thang tshuē-tio̍h guá ū put-gī, lâi sǹg-tsò ū tsuē.
English: Ephraim said, Surely I have become rich, I have found myself wealth. In all my wealth they won't find in me any iniquity that is sin.

Tailo: Siōngtsú — lí ê Siōngtè kā i kau-hù lí, lí tsiū tio̍h īng to kā i hiah-ê tsa-po͘ ting tsuân-pō͘ thâi-sí.
English: and when Yahweh your God delivers it into your hand, you shall strike every male of it with the edge of the sword:

Tailo: Só͘-í, tsì-kuân Siōngtsú án-ne kóng: In-uī lín lóng tsiâⁿ-tsò tse-tái, lí khuàⁿ, Guá beh tī Êlúsalèm ê tiong-kan kā lín tsū-tsi̍p.
English: Therefore thus says the Lord Yahweh: Because you are all become dross, therefore, behold, I will gather you into the midst of Jerusalem.

Tailo: M̄-koh, guá koh-ua̍h liáu-āu, ē pí lín tāi-sing khì-kàu Ga-lí-la-iah síng.
English: However, after I am raised up, I will go before you into Galilee.

Tailo: Keh kang tsá-khí, Asito͘t ê lâng khí-.lâi, khuàⁿ-tio̍h tāi-kún pua̍h-tó tī Siōngtsú ê kuī tsîng, bīn phak tī thô͘-kha, tsiū kā tāi-kún koh tshāi tī i ê guân uī.
English: When they of Ashdod arose early on the next day, behold, Dagon was fallen on his face to the ground before the ark of Yahweh. They took Dagon, and set him in his place again.

Tailo: In-uī Siōngtsú tsik-pī I só͘ thiàⁿ ê lâng, tshin-tshiūnn lāu-pē teh tsik-pī i só͘ ì-ài ê kiáⁿ.
English: For whom Yahweh loves, he reproves; Even as a father reproves the son in whom he delights.

Tailo: Jîn-bîn teh kî-thāi Ki-tok, sim-lāi lóng teh siūⁿ kóng Iô-há-neh bô tiāⁿ-tio̍h to̍h-sī Ki-tok.
English: As the people were in expectation, and all men reasoned in their hearts concerning John, whether perhaps he was the Christ,

Tailo: Iô-tá-iah lâng hiah-ê tuā-tsè-si, ta̍k nî tio̍h īng gû kah iûⁿ ê hueh ji̍p-khì tsì-sìng-só͘; Ki-tok m̄-bián tsi̍t pái koh tsi̍t pái hiàn ka-kī pún-sin.
English: nor yet that he should offer himself often, as the high priest enters into the holy place year by year with blood not his own,

Tailo: Elóng liáu-āu, ū Pí-la̍h-tòng lâng, Hilia̍t ê kiáⁿ Aptóng, tsò Isulael ê sū-su.
English: After him Abdon the son of Hillel the Pirathonite judged Israel.

Tailo: Kiàn-nā bong-tio̍h i só͘ tsē ê mi̍h ê, tio̍h sé i ê saⁿ, ka-kī tī tsuí-.ni̍h sé, bô tshing-khì-kàu ê-hng.
English: Whoever touches anything that she sits on shall wash his clothes, and bathe himself in water, and be unclean until the evening.

Tailo: Iosiúah kóng, Lín taⁿ tio̍h tû-khì lín tiong-kan só͘-ū guā-pang ê sîn-bîng, hō͘ lín tsuan-sim kui-ǹg Siōngtsú — Isulael ê Siōngtè.
English: Now therefore put away, said he, the foreign gods which are among you, and incline your heart to Yahweh, the God of Israel.

Tailo: Lūbiān, Ga̍t, Asel, Tse-bú-lông, Tàn, Náhuthalím, tsiah-ê tsi-tso̍k, tio̍h khiā tī Ebal suaⁿ lâi suan-pò͘ tsiù-tsó͘.
English: These shall stand on Mount Ebal for the curse: Reuben, Gad, and Asher, and Zebulun, Dan, and Naphtali.

Tailo: Siat-sú i ê kiáⁿ-sun pàng-sak Guá ê lu̍t-huat; bô tsun-siú Guá ê huat-tō͘;
English: If his children forsake my law, And don't walk in my ordinances;

Tailo: In tsiū tsó͘-tòng Utsiiah ông, kā i kóng, Utsiiah, sio hiuⁿ hō͘ Siōngtsú m̄-sī lí ê tāi-tsì, he sī tsè-si Alông ê kiáⁿ-sun ê tāi-tsì, in siū siat-li̍p lâi sio hiuⁿ ê. Lí tio̍h lī-khui sìng-tiān, in-uī lí í-king huān tsuē. Lí kiânn tsit-ê tāi-tsì, Siōngtsú — Siōngtè bô beh hō͘ lí tit-tio̍h îng-kng.
English: and they withstood Uzziah the king, and said to him, It pertains not to you, Uzziah, to burn incense to Yahweh, but to the priests the sons of Aaron, who are consecrated to burn incense: go out of the sanctuary; for you have trespassed; neither shall it be for your honor from Yahweh God.

Tailo: hit uī ê bīn tshin-tshiūnn phik-gi̍k kah âng-pó-tsio̍h teh huat kng. Pó-tsō sì-kho͘-uî ū khīng, khuàⁿ khí-lâi ná tshin-tshiūnn li̍k-pó-tsio̍h.
English: that looked like a jasper stone and a sardius. There was a rainbow around the throne, like an emerald to look at.

Tailo: Tsiū án-ne, Mô͘se kah Alông siū-tiàu tò tńg-lâi kìnn Huâ-láu, Huâ-láu kā in kóng, Lín khì ho̍k-sāi Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè; to̍k-to̍k hiah-ê siūⁿ beh khì ê, tàu-té sī siáⁿ-mi̍h khuán lâng?
English: Moses and Aaron were brought again to Pharaoh, and he said to them, Go, serve Yahweh your God; but who are those who will go?

Tailo: In-uī I kàm-tshat in ê só͘ tsò; tī àm-sî kā in tshia-tó, in tsiū bia̍t-bông.
English: Therefore he takes knowledge of their works. He overturns them in the night, so that they are destroyed.

Tailo: M̄-koh, Iô-tá-iah lâng khuàⁿ-tio̍h lâng hiah tsē, tsiū muá-sim uàn-tò͘, huán-po̍k Páulô só͘ kóng ê tō-lí, koh kā i huí-pòng.
English: But when the Jews saw the multitudes, they were filled with jealousy, and contradicted the things which were spoken by Paul, and blasphemed.

Tailo: O-ló kah tsiù-tsó͘ tuì kāng tsi̍t-ê tshuì-tsi̍h tshut-.lâi. Tshin-ài ê hiann-tī tsí-muē, tse sī bô ing-kai ê.
English: Out of the same mouth comes forth blessing and cursing. My brothers, these things ought not to be so.

Tailo: Kuan-hē lín tī phue lāi-bīn thê-khí ê būn-tê, lâng bô kiat-hun khah hó.
English: Now concerning the things about which you wrote to me: it is good for a man not to touch a woman.

Tailo: Si-óng ê jîn-bîn, lín tio̍h khuài-lo̍k, uī-tio̍h Siōngtsú — lín ê Siōngtè lâi huann-hí; in-uī I kā ki̍p-sî ê hō͘ siúⁿ-sù hō͘ lín, uī-tio̍h lín lo̍h hō͘-tsuí, to̍h-sī tshun-hō͘ tshiu-lîm kah í-tsîng kāng-khuán.
English: Be glad then, you children of Zion, And rejoice in Yahweh, your God; For he gives you the former rain in just measure, And he causes the rain to come down for you, The former rain and the latter rain, As before.

Tailo: Tshiánn lín kà-sī guá, guá tsiū tiām-tiām, mā hō͘ guá bîng-pi̍k tī siáⁿ-mi̍h tāi-tsì ū tshò-gō͘.
English: Teach me, and I will hold my peace; Cause me to understand wherein I have erred.

Tailo: Tabi̍t kā Mikal kóng, Tse sī tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng, I kíng guá puâⁿ-kuè lí ê lāu-pē kah i ê tsuân ke, siat-li̍p guá tsò Siōngtsú ê tsú-bîn — Isulael lâng ê kun-ông, só͘-í, guá beh tī Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng thiàu-bú.
English: David said to Michal, It was before Yahweh, who chose me above your father, and above all his house, to appoint me prince over the people of Yahweh, over Israel: therefore will I play before Yahweh.

Tailo: Lí tio̍h uī é-káu ê lâng lâi khui tshuì, uī só͘ ū bô i-uá ê lâng lâi sin-uan.
English: Open your mouth for the mute, In the cause of all who are left desolate.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, tsa-bó͘ lâng seⁿ tsi̍t-ê kiáⁿ, tsiū kā i hō-miâ kiò-tsò Sâmsóng. Gín-á tuā-hàn, Siōngtsú kā i sù-hok.
English: The woman bore a son, and named him Samson: and the child grew, and Yahweh blessed him.

Tailo: In koh tī iâⁿ tiong uàn-tò͘ Mô͘se kah Siōngtsú sìng-pia̍t ê Alông.
English: They envied Moses also in the camp, And Aaron, Yahweh's saint.

Tailo: Lí khuàⁿ, Iôtah tsi-tso̍k Huul ê sun, U-lī ê kiáⁿ Betsalel, Guá í-king tsí miâ lâi kā i kíng-tiàu.
English: Behold, I have called by name Bezalel the son of Uri, the son of Hur, of the tribe of Judah:

Tailo: Iâkop tuì i ê lāu-bú Li-bé-kah kóng, M̄-koh, guá ê a-hiaⁿ Esáu sing-khu ū mn̂g, guá ê sī kng-ku̍t.
English: Jacob said to Rebekah his mother, Behold, Esau my brother is a hairy man, and I am a smooth man.

Tailo: Hit sî, Só͘lômóng tsū-tsi̍p Isulael ê tiúⁿ-ló, kok tsi-tso̍k ê siú-líng kah Isulael lâng hiah-ê tso̍k-tiúⁿ, lâi-kàu Êlúsalèm, beh kā Siōngtsú ê iok-kuī, tuì Tabi̍t siâⁿ, to̍h-sī Si-óng ūn lâi tsia.
English: Then Solomon assembled the elders of Israel, and all the heads of the tribes, the princes of the fathers' houses of the children of Israel, to Jerusalem, to bring up the ark of the covenant of Yahweh out of the city of David, which is Zion.

Tailo: Só͘lômóng ua̍h-.leh ê ji̍t, tuì Tàn kàu Bel-sí-bah ê Iôtah lâng kah Isulael lâng, ta̍k lâng lóng tī i ê phû-tô tshiū kha kah bû-hua-kó tshiū kha an-jiân sing-ua̍h.
English: Judah and Israel lived safely, every man under his vine and under his fig tree, from Dan even to Beersheba, all the days of Solomon.

Tailo: Iésu bô ìn i puàⁿ-kù uē. I ê bûn-tô͘ lâi kiû I, kóng, Kā i kuáⁿ-tsáu, in-uī i tī lán ê āu-bīn it-ti̍t teh tuā-siaⁿ huah.
English: But he answered her not a word. His disciples came and begged him, saying, Send her away; for she cries after us.

Tailo: Guá tāi-khài ē kah lín tuà tsi̍t-tsām-á, kiám-tshái ē kah lín tsò-hué kuè kuâⁿ-thiⁿ. Án-ne, bô-lūn suà lo̍h-khì guá beh khì tó-uī, lóng thang hō͘ lín sàng guá tshut-huat.
English: But with you it may be that I will stay, or even winter, that you may send me on my journey wherever I go.

Tailo: Kiau-ngō͘ bô tsun-thàn Lí lu̍t-huat ê lâng, ku̍t hām-kheⁿ beh hāi guá.
English: The proud have dug pits for me, Contrary to your law.

Tailo: Hit sî, koh ū tsi̍t tsiah tshiah-sik ê bé tshut-.lâi, khiâ bé ê lâng ū niá-siū kuân-pìng, thang tuì tē-tsiūⁿ tshiúⁿ-tua̍t hô-pîng, hō͘ jîn-luī hō͘-siong sat-hāi; i koh ū niá-siū tsi̍t ki tuā ki kiàm.
English: Another came forth, a red horse. To him who sat on it was given power to take peace from the earth, and that they should kill one another. There was given to him a great sword.

Tailo: Só͘-í, Guá hō͘ lín hō͘ kûn-tsiòng khuànn-khin, khuàⁿ-tsò hā-tsiān; in-uī lín bô tsun-siú Guá ê tō-lō͘, tī lu̍t-huat īng phian-su khuán-thāi lâng.
English: Therefore I have also made you contemptible and base before all the people, according to the way you have not kept my ways, but have had respect for persons in the law.

Tailo: In suî-jiân bat Siōngtè, khiok bô tsun-tiōng I, mā bô kā I kám-siā. In ê sim-su piàn-tsò gû-gōng, bē lí-kái ê sim-su tshiong-muá o͘-àm.
English: Because, knowing God, they didn't glorify him as God, neither gave thanks, but became vain in their reasoning, and their senseless heart was darkened.

Tailo: Uī guá sin-uan ê hit uī Siōngtè, I hō͘ tsìng lâng khut-ho̍k tī guá ê kha-ē.
English: Even the God who executes vengeance for me, And subdues peoples under me.

Tailo: I ē īng I ê si̍t-kó͘ áⁿ lí; lí ē bih tī I ê si̍t-ē; I ê sìn-si̍t sī tuā-tuā sè-sè ê tîn-pâi.
English: He will cover you with his feathers. Under his wings you will take refuge. His faithfulness is your shield and rampart.

Tailo: Tī hit gō͘ gue̍h-ji̍t tiong-kan, lâng kiû beh sí mā bē tit sí, ài beh sí mā sí bē-khì.
English: In those days people will seek death, and will in no way find it. They will desire to die, and death will flee from them.

Tailo: Sian-ti ī-giân pîng-an, hit-ê sian-ti ê uē tit-tio̍h ìng-giām, tsiū tsai hit-ê sian-ti tsin-tsiàⁿ sī Siōngtsú só͘ tshe ê.
English: The prophet who prophesies of peace, when the word of the prophet shall happen, then shall the prophet be known, that Yahweh has truly sent him.

Tailo: Sâmsóng khùn kàu puàⁿ-mê, tī puàⁿ-mê khí-.lâi, kā siâⁿ mn̂g ê mn̂g-sìⁿ kah nn̄g ki mn̂g-khing, í-ki̍p mn̂g-tshuàⁿ lóng thiah khí-.lâi, hē tī king-kah-thâu tíng, giâ kàu Hebúlông tuì-bīn ê suaⁿ tíng.
English: Samson lay until midnight, and arose at midnight, and laid hold of the doors of the gate of the city, and the two posts, and plucked them up, bar and all, and put them on his shoulders, and carried them up to the top of the mountain that is before Hebron.

Tailo: Lí ê sin-si ē hō͘ khong-tiong ê pue-tsiáu kah tē-tsiūⁿ ê tsáu-siù tsò tsia̍h-mi̍h, mā bô lâng kā i kuáⁿ-tsáu.
English: Your dead body shall be food to all birds of the sky, and to the animals of the earth; and there shall be none to frighten them away.

Tailo: Sī-uē-tiúⁿ Nebutsalatàn, thài-kàm ê thâu Ne-bu-sia-tsu-ban, tsheⁿ-siōng-ka ê thâu Nî-kah-sat-lī-siat kah Babúlông ông hiah-ê kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ,
English: So Nebuzaradan the captain of the guard sent, and Nebushazban, Rabsaris, and Nergal Sharezer, Rabmag, and all the chief officers of the king of Babylon;

Tailo: Iésu kā kûn-tsiòng khuànn tsi̍t liàn tsiah tuì bûn-tô͘ kóng, Hó-gia̍h lâng beh ji̍p Siōngtè kok-tō͘ tsin khùn-lān!
English: Jesus looked around, and said to his disciples, How difficult it is for those who have riches to enter into the Kingdom of God!

Tailo: Uī-tio̍h án-ne, lín ê io tio̍h hâ muâ-pò͘, tuā-siaⁿ thî-khàu; in-uī Siōngtsú ê tuā siū-khì bô beh tuì lán ua̍t tò tńg-.khì.
English: For this gird you with sackcloth, lament and wail; for the fierce anger of Yahweh hasn't turned back from us.

Tailo: Tē-jī pái koh khì ê sî, Iôséhuh hō͘ hiann-tī jīn-tshut i ê sin-hūn; in-uī án-ne, Huâ-láu bat Iôséhuh ê ka-tso̍k.
English: On the second time Joseph was made known to his brothers, and Joseph's race was revealed to Pharaoh.

Tailo: Mn̄g in kóng, Tsit-ê sī lín kóng tshut-sì to̍h tsheⁿ-mê-.ê kiáⁿ, sī-.bô? Taⁿ i ná ē ū khuànn-kìnn?
English: and asked them, Is this your son, who you say was born blind? How then does he now see?

Tailo: I nā-sī tshiûⁿ, guán beh tī i ê tíng-bīn khí gîn thah; i nā-sī mn̂g, guán beh īng pik-hiuⁿ tshâ pán kā i uî khí-.lâi.
English: If she is a wall, We will build on her a turret of silver. If she is a door, We will enclose her with boards of cedar. Beloved

Tailo: In mā kuán-lí hiah-ê ka-tann mi̍h-kiāⁿ ê lâng, tok-tshui só͘-ū ê tsò-kang ê, bô-lūn tsò siáⁿ-mi̍h kang. Lēbī lâng ū ê tsò su-kì, tsò kuaⁿ-uân, tsò kuán-mn̂g ê.
