English: Also they were over the bearers of burdens, and set forward all who did the work in every manner of service: and of the Levites there were scribes, and officers, and porters.

Tailo: Guá ê a-tsik ê kiáⁿ Hanámel kó-jiân tsiàu Siōngtsú ê uē lâi khu-liû-só͘ ê īⁿ tshuē guá, tuì guá kóng, Guá tī Biāniámín ê kíng lāi ê Anáthot ê hit khu tshân, tshiáⁿ lí lâi bé; in-uī sîng-tsiap kah sio̍k-huê ê kuân tsāi tī lí, lí tio̍h bé lâi tsiâⁿ-tsò lí ê! Guá tsiū tsai tse sī Siōngtsú ê uē.
English: So Hanamel my uncle's son came to me in the court of the guard according to the word of Yahweh, and said to me, Please buy my field that is in Anathoth, which is in the land of Benjamin; for the right of inheritance is yours, and the redemption is yours; buy it for yourself. Then I knew that this was the word of Yahweh.

Tailo: Iôtah ê siâⁿ mn̂g pī kong-phuà, hit ji̍t lí tsiū tsa-khuàⁿ kun-tsong-kio̍k ê kun-khì.
English: He took away the covering of Judah; and you looked in that day to the armor in the house of the forest.

Tailo: Siōngtsú tuì Mô͘se kóng, Lí tsò tsi̍t bué hué-tsuâ, khuà tī kî-kuaⁿ ê tíng-bīn; kiàn-nā hō͘ i kā-tio̍h ê lâng tsi̍t ē khuànn, tsiū ē ua̍h.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Make you a fiery serpent, and set it on a standard: and it shall happen, that everyone who is bitten, when he sees it, shall live.

Tailo: Hiah-ê kò͘-siú Iésu ê lâng kā I hì-lāng, koh kā I piⁿ-phah.
English: The men who held Jesus mocked him and beat him.

Tailo: Tng Isulael kiânn bê-lō͘ ê sî, ū Lēbī lâng lī-khui Guá hn̄g-hn̄g, to̍h-sī kiânn bê-lō͘ lī-khui Guá khì tuè in ê ngó͘-siōng, in tio̍h tam-tng in ê tsuē-kò.
English: But the Levites who went far from me, when Israel went astray, who went astray from me after their idols, they shall bear their iniquity.

Tailo: Tsá-tsîng Ehulaim kóng-uē, lâng lóng phi̍h-phi̍h tshuah; i tī Isulael tiong tiàm tī kuân uī; tsóng-.sī, i tī Baal ê tāi-tsì huān tsuē, tsiū tì-kàu sí-bông.
English: When Ephraim spoke, there was trembling. He exalted himself in Israel, But when he became guilty in Baal, he died.

Tailo: Siōngtsú huan-hù Mô͘se kóng,
English: Yahweh spoke to Moses, saying,

Tailo: Tsiū tio̍h tsiàu jîn-ting, tsiàu sìng-só͘ ê si-khel, ta̍k lâng tshú gō͘ si-khel, ( Tsi̍t si-khel sī jī-tsa̍p ge-la̍h )
English: you shall take five shekels apiece for each one; after the shekel of the sanctuary you shall take them (the shekel is twenty gerahs):

Tailo: Hilkíiah ê kiáⁿ Eliakim, Siapná kah Io-uah, tuì Lap-siá-keh kóng, Kiû lí īng Alâm ê uē kah lí ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, in-uī guán ē-hiáu thiaⁿ, m̄-thang īng Iôtah ê uē kah guán kóng, hō͘ siâⁿ tíng ê jîn-bîn hīⁿ-khang thiaⁿ-.tio̍h.
English: Then said Eliakim the son of Hilkiah, and Shebnah, and Joah, to Rabshakeh, Please speak to your servants in the Syrian language; for we understand it: and don't speak with us in the Jews' language, in the ears of the people who are on the wall.

Tailo: Hua-lí-sái phài ê lâng tsiū tuì huē-tn̂g tshut-.khì, suî-sî kah He-lo̍t tóng ê lâng tsò-hué kè-bô͘, khuànn thang án-tsuáⁿ lâi hāi-sí Iésu.
English: The Pharisees went out, and immediately conspired with the Herodians against him, how they might destroy him.

Tailo: Guá ê tsó͘-sian ê Siōngtè ah, guá kám-siā Lí, o-ló Lí, in-uī Lí siúⁿ-sù guá tì-huī kah tsâi-lîng, taⁿ Lí kā guán tuì Lí só͘ kiû ê í-king tsí-sī guá, in-uī Lí ū kā ông ê tāi-tsì tsí-sī guán.
English: I thank you, and praise you, you God of my fathers, who have given me wisdom and might, and have now made known to me what we desired of you; for you have made known to us the king's matter.

Tailo: Siū buah-iû ê tsè-si tio̍h tshú tām-po̍h gû-káng-á ê hueh, tuà kàu huē-bō͘ lâi.
English: The anointed priest shall bring of the blood of the bull to the Tent of Meeting:

Tailo: Ū lâng tú-á teh bâi-tsòng sí-lâng, hut-jiân khuàⁿ-tio̍h kui tīn lâng, tsiū kā sí-lâng hiat tī Elísiah ê bōng, sí-lâng tsi̍t-ē kha̍p-tio̍h Elísiah ê kut-thâu, tsiū koh-ua̍h khiā khí-.lâi.
English: It happened, as they were burying a man, that behold, they spied a band; and they cast the man into the tomb of Elisha: and as soon as the man touched the bones of Elisha, he revived, and stood up on his feet.

Tailo: I tsiū tsín-kiù lán, m̄-sī in-uī lán ka-kī ê hó hîng-uî, sī in-uī I ê liân-bín. I thong-kuè tîng-thâu-seⁿ ê sé-lé kah Sìng Sîn ê uāⁿ sin lâi tsín-kiù lán.
English: not by works of righteousness, which we did ourselves, but according to his mercy, he saved us, through the washing of regeneration and renewing by the Holy Spirit,

Tailo: Siōngtsú sī guá ê suaⁿ-giâm, guá ê iâⁿ-tsē, tsín-kiù guá ê.
English: and he said, Yahweh is my rock, and my fortress, and my deliverer, even mine;

Tailo: I tsiū án-ne an-tì jîn-bîn, to̍h-sī siâⁿ pak pîng ê kun-tuī kah siâⁿ sai pîng bâi-ho̍k ê ping. Tsit mê, Iosiúah ji̍p-khì suaⁿ-kok tiong.
English: So they set the people, even all the army who was on the north of the city, and their ambush on the west of the city; and Joshua went that night into the midst of the valley.

Tailo: Iûⁿ-ko thiah-khui tē-jī-ê hong-ìn ê sî, guá thiaⁿ-tio̍h tē-jī tsiah ua̍h-mi̍h kóng, Lâi!
English: When he opened the second seal, I heard the second living creature saying, Come!

Tailo: Náthan ê kiáⁿ Atsalíah tsò kuaⁿ-tiúⁿ, Náthan ê kiáⁿ Tsa-but tsò tsè-si, mā tsò ông ê pîng-iú,
English: and Azariah the son of Nathan was over the officers; and Zabud the son of Nathan was chief minister, and the king's friend;

Tailo: Tsiù-tsó͘ lāu-pē á-.sī lāu-bú ê lâng, i ê ting ē tī ki̍k o͘-àm ê tiong-kan hua-khì.
English: Whoever curses his father or his mother, His lamp shall be put out in blackness of darkness.

Tailo: Sù-tsiá koh lâi kóng, Bian-ha-tat án-ne kóng: Guá ū tshe lâng khì kìⁿ lí, ài lí kā lí ê gîn, kim, bó͘ kah kiáⁿ-jî lóng kau hō͘ guá.
English: The messengers came again, and said, Thus speaks Ben Hadad, saying, I sent indeed to you, saying, You shall deliver me your silver, and your gold, and your wives, and your children;

Tailo: In-uī tsiah-ê kò͘-mn̂g ê thâu, sì-ê Lēbī lâng lóng tam-tng in ê tsik-jīm, lâi kuán-lí Siōngtsú tshù lāi tsiah-ê tsàn-pâng kah kim-khò͘.
English: for the four chief porters, who were Levites, were in an office of trust, and were over the chambers and over the treasuries in the house of God.

Tailo: Siōngtè ah, tuì guá siàu-liân ê sî Lí to̍h kà-sī guá; tsit-má guá iáu teh suan-iông Lí kî-biāu ê tsok-uî.
English: God, you have taught me from my youth. Until now, I have declared your wondrous works.

Tailo: Tsú huat-tshut tsi̍t kù uē hō͘ Iâkop ke, hit-ê uē mā lîm-kàu tī Isulael tso̍k.
English: The Lord sent a word into Jacob, And it falls on Israel.

Tailo: Taniel tuì ông kóng, Guān ông bān-suè!
English: Then said Daniel to the king, O king, live forever.

Tailo: Lí hō͘ guá ê kha só͘ ta̍h ê tē khui-khuah, guá ê kha mā m̄-bat ta̍h thu̍t-.khì.
English: You have enlarged my steps under me; My feet have not slipped.

Tailo: Lín kong-tshú siâⁿ liáu-āu, tsiū tio̍h īng hué sio siâⁿ, tio̍h tsiàu Siōngtsú ê uē kiânn. Lí khuàⁿ, tse sī guá só͘ bīng-līng lín ê.
English: It shall be, when you have seized on the city, that you shall set the city on fire; according to the word of Yahweh shall you do: behold, I have commanded you.

Tailo: Guá bê-lō͘ tshin-tshiūnn phah-m̄-kiàn ê iûⁿ, kiû Lí kā Lí ê lô͘-po̍k tshuē tò tńg-.lâi, in-uī guá bô bē kì-tit Lí ê kài-bīng.
English: I have gone astray like a lost sheep. Seek your servant, for I don't forget your commandments.

Tailo: Ông tsiū bīng-līng ông-tsú （ Tsù, guân i̍k-pún sī Hap-bí-li̍k ê kiáⁿ, Hap-bí-li̍kê guân-bûn sī Ông ê ì-sù ） E-la-mel, kah A-su-li-el ê kiáⁿ Selaiah, kah Ab-tel ê kiáⁿ Silemiah, khì lia̍h su-kì Palosih kah I-é-lí-miah sian-ti. Tsóng-.sī, Siōngtsú kā in tshàng khí-.lâi.
English: The king commanded Jerahmeel the king's son, and Seraiah the son of Azriel, and Shelemiah the son of Abdeel, to take Baruch the scribe and Jeremiah the prophet; but Yahweh hid them.

Tailo: Guá beh ji̍t-ji̍t kám-siā Lí, mā beh íng-uán o-ló Lí ê miâ.
English: Every day I will praise you. I will extol your name forever and ever.

Tailo: Guá mā puāⁿ khui guá ê saⁿ-á phè, kóng, Kiàn-nā bô tsiânn tsit-ê uē ê, guān Siōngtè tsiàu án-ne kā i puāⁿ khui lâi lī-khui i ê ke kah i ê tsit-gia̍p, to̍h-sī guān I tsiàu án-ne puāⁿ kàu khang-khang. Huē-tsiòng lóng kóng, A-men! Koh o-ló Siōngtsú. Jîn-bîn tsiū tsiàu tsit-ê uē lâi kiâⁿ.
English: Also I shook out my lap, and said, So God shake out every man from his house, and from his labor, that doesn't perform this promise; even thus be he shaken out, and emptied. All the assembly said, Amen, and praised Yahweh. The people did according to this promise.

Tailo: Siūⁿ beh pó-tsuân ka-kī sèⁿ-miā ê lâng ē sòng-sit sèⁿ-miā, só͘-ū sòng-sit sèⁿ-miā ê lâng ē pó-tsuân i ê sèⁿ-miā.
English: Whoever seeks to save his life loses it, but whoever loses his life preserves it.

Tailo: Guá tsò thuân-tō ê, bat tī Êlúsalèm tsò Isulael ông.
English: I, the Preacher, was king over Israel in Jerusalem.

Tailo: tsiū ū kun-ông, ông-tshin, tsē Tabi̍t ê pó-tsō ê, in kah in ê ông-tshin, kah Iôtah lâng, kah tuà tī Êlúsalèm ê jîn-bîn, á-.sī tsē tshia, á-.sī khiâ bé, ji̍p tsit-ê siâⁿ mn̂g, jî-tshiánn tsit-ê siâⁿ ē lâu kàu íng-uán.
English: then shall there enter in by the gates of this city kings and princes sitting on the throne of David, riding in chariots and on horses, they, and their princes, the men of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem; and this city shall remain forever.

Tailo: I ê tshin-lâng thiaⁿ-.tio̍h, tsiū tshut-lâi beh kā I lia̍h-teh, in-uī ū lâng kóng I ê tsing-sîn sit-siông.
English: When his friends heard it, they went out to seize him: for they said, He is insane.

Tailo: Isulael ê Siōngtè ah, Lí tuì Lí ê lô͘-po̍k — guá ê lāu-pē Tabi̍t só͘ kóng ê, kiû Lí hō͘ i tsiâⁿ-tsò sū-si̍t.
English: Now therefore, God of Israel, Please let your word be verified, which you spoke to your servant David my father.

Tailo: Tē-ki̍k ê lâng lóng tio̍h gióng-bōng Guá lâi tit-tio̍h kiù; in-uī Guá sī Siōngtsú, bô koh ū pa̍t-ê.
English: Look to me, and be you saved, all the ends of the earth; for I am God, and there is none else.

Tailo: Piattò͘ ìn I kóng, Tsú ah, nā tsin-tsiàⁿ sī Lí, tshiánn bīng-līng guá kiânn tsuí-bīn lâi-khì Lí hia.
English: Peter answered him and said, Lord, if it is you, command me to come to you on the waters.

Tailo: Kà-sī tì-huī ê lâng, i tsiū ē koh khah ū tì-huī; tsí-sī gī lâng, i tsiū ē ke-thinn ha̍k-būn.
English: Instruct a wise man, and he will be still wiser. Teach a righteous man, and he will increase in learning.

Tailo: Siat-sú Siōngtsú tsò tsi̍t hāng sin ê tāi-tsì, hō͘ tē khui tshuì, kā in kah só͘-ū sio̍k in ê mi̍h-kiāⁿ lóng thun lo̍h-.khì, hō͘ in ua̍h-ua̍h tuī-lo̍h im-kan, lín tsiū tsai tsiah-ê lâng sī teh biáu-sī Siōngtsú.
English: But if Yahweh make a new thing, and the ground open its mouth, and swallow them up, with all that appertain to them, and they go down alive into Sheol; then you shall understand that these men have despised Yahweh.

Tailo: Guá ê tshiú the̍h-tio̍h lia̍t kok ê tsâi-pó, tshin-tshiūnn the̍h tsiáu-á siū. Guá tit-tio̍h tsuân tē, tshin-tshiūnn khioh-tio̍h hông pàng-sak ê tsiáu-á nn̄g; bô ū phia̍t si̍t ê, bô ū khui tshuì ê, bô ū háu-kiò ê.
English: My hand has found the riches of the peoples like a nest, and like one gathers eggs that are abandoned, have I gathered all the earth. There was no one who moved their wing, or that opened their mouth, or chirped.

Tailo: M̄-thang uī-tio̍h tsò pháiⁿ ê lâng lâi phō put-pîng, mā m̄-thang him-siān pháiⁿ lâng.
English: Don't fret yourself because of evildoers; Neither be envious of the wicked:

Tailo: Hong só͘ tshue ê lō͘, lí m̄-tsai, kut-hâi tī īn-hū ê thai án-tsuáⁿ sing-tióng, lí mā m̄-tsai; án-ne, kiânn bān sū ê Siōngtè só͘ tsò ê tāi-tsì, lí mā sī bē-tàng tsai.
English: As you don't know what is the way of the wind, Nor how the bones grow in the womb of her who is with child; Even so you don't know the work of God who does all.

Tailo: Jiânāu Iésu tuì bûn-tô͘ kóng, Lâng nā ài beh tuè guá, tio̍h pàng-sak ka-kī, giâ i ê si̍p-jī-kè lâi tuè guá.
English: Then Jesus said to his disciples, If anyone desires to come after me, let him deny himself, and take up his cross, and follow me.

Tailo: In-uī tsin-tsiàⁿ ta̍t-tit o-ló ê, sī Tsú só͘ o-ló ê lâng, m̄-sī tsū-khua ê lâng.
English: For it isn't he who commends himself who is approved, but whom the Lord commends.

Tailo: Ū tsin tsē lâng tuè Iésu khì, in-uī in ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h I i hó pēnn-lâng ê sîn-jiah.
English: A great multitude followed him, because they saw his signs which he did on those who were sick.

Tailo: Guá mā beh kā in sì-suàⁿ khì tī lia̍t pang tiong, to̍h-sī in kah in ê tsó͘-sian m̄-bat ê pang-kok, mā beh hō͘ to-kiàm jiok in, kàu Guá kā in tsuân-pō͘ tsâu-bia̍t uî-tsí.
English: I will scatter them also among the nations, whom neither they nor their fathers have known; and I will send the sword after them, until I have consumed them.

Tailo: Tsè-si tio̍h uī Isulael lâng ê huē-tsiòng sio̍k-tsuē, in tsiū tit-tio̍h sià-bián, in-uī tse sī tshò-gō͘, in mā in-uī in ê tshò-gō͘, tuà in ê lé-mi̍h, to̍h-sī hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú ê hué-tsè kah sio̍k-tsuē-tsè, lóng tuà kàu Siōngtsú ê bīn-tsîng.
English: The priest shall make atonement for all the congregation of the children of Israel, and they shall be forgiven; for it was an error, and they have brought their offering, an offering made by fire to Yahweh, and their sin offering before Yahweh, for their error:

Tailo: Ū kuí-nā-ê king-ha̍k kàu-su tsē tī hia, sim-lāi gī-lūn kóng,
English: But there were some of the scribes sitting there, and reasoning in their hearts,

Tailo: Isulael ê lú-jîn tiong-kan m̄-thang ū ki-lí; Isulael ê lâm-jîn tiong-kan m̄-thang ū lâm-sìng biō-tshiong.
English: There shall be no prostitute of the daughters of Israel, neither shall there be a sodomite of the sons of Israel.

Tailo: Kàu tē-saⁿ ji̍t, Abulahàm gia̍h thâu khuànn hn̄g-hn̄g hit-ê só͘-tsāi.
English: On the third day Abraham lifted up his eyes, and saw the place far off.

Tailo: Tsú-lâng kā i kóng, ' Tsin hó, hó ê lô͘-po̍k, lí kì-jiân tī sió-khuá ê tāi-tsì tsīn-tiong, taⁿ hō͘ lí kuán tsa̍p-ê siâⁿ. '
English: He said to him, Well done, you good servant! Because you were found faithful with very little, you shall have authority over ten cities.'

Tailo: Só͘-í, lín tio̍h tsim-tsiok khuànn lín ê kiâⁿ-ta̍h, m̄-thang tsò bô tì-sik ê lâng, tio̍h tsò tshong-bîng ê lâng.
English: Therefore watch carefully how you walk, not as unwise, but as wise;

Tailo: Siōngtsú thok I-é-lí-miah sian-ti lūn Babúlông, lūn Kal-tí-ah lâng ê tē, só͘ kóng ê uē,
English: The word that Yahweh spoke concerning Babylon, concerning the land of the Chaldeans, by Jeremiah the prophet.

Tailo: Guá ê sim tuā-tuā kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ. Siōngtsú ah, Lí beh kàu tang-sî tsiah kiù guá?
English: My soul is also in great anguish. But you, Yahwehhow long?

Tailo: Guá koh the̍h tām-po̍h-á piáⁿ hō͘ lín tsò tiám-sim, jiân-āu tsiah tsìn-tsîng khì. Lín kì-jiân lâi-kàu guán tsia, tshiánn tsiap-siū lín ê lô͘-po̍k ê khuán-thāi. In kóng, Τhang tsiàu lí ê uē khì kiâⁿ.
English: I will get a morsel of bread so you can refresh your heart. After that you may go your way, now that you have come to your servant. They said, Very well, do as you have said.

Tailo: Siōngtsú ah, Lí ná ē khiā tī hn̄g-hn̄g ? Tī guán huān-lān ê sî, Lí ná ē tiām-tiām m̄ tshap guán?
English: Why do you stand far off, Yahweh? Why do you hide yourself in times of trouble?

Tailo: Páulô kíng Sela̍h tsò-hué lī-khui, sìn-tô͘ kā in kau-thok tī Tsú ê un-tián.
English: but Paul chose Silas, and went out, being commended by the brothers to the grace of God.

Tailo: Iô-há-neh kā Iésu kóng, Lāu-su, guán ū khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê lâng hōng Lí ê miâ teh kuáⁿ kuí. Guán kā i tsó͘-tòng, in-uī i bô teh tuè lán kiânn.
English: John said to him, Teacher, we saw someone who doesn't follow us casting out demons in your name; and we forbade him, because he doesn't follow us.

Tailo: In-uī kuan-hē in, Siōngtsú bat kóng, In it-tīng tio̍h sí tī khòng-iá, só͘-í, tû-liáu E-hun-neh ê kiáⁿ Ka-le̍p kah Nùn ê kiáⁿ Iosiúah í-guā, hiah-ê lâng bô lâu tsi̍t-ê lâng tī-.leh.
English: For Yahweh had said of them, They shall surely die in the wilderness. There was not left a man of them, save Caleb the son of Jephunneh, and Joshua the son of Nun.

Tailo: In ang-á-bó͘ tsham-siông liáu-āu, kuat-tīng kā só͘ tit-tio̍h ê tsînn lâu tsi̍t-kuá khí-.lâi, tshun-ê tsiah tuà-lâi kau hō͘ sù-tô͘.
English: and kept back part of the price, his wife also being aware of it, and brought a certain part, and laid it at the apostles' feet.

Tailo: Án-ne, tī koh-ua̍h ê sî, tsit-ê hū-jîn-lâng beh tsò in tiong-kan tó tsi̍t-ê ê bó͘? In-uī tsit tshit-ê lâng lóng ū tshuā i tsò bó͘.
English: Therefore in the resurrection whose wife of them will she be? For the seven had her as a wife.

Tailo: I ê piⁿ-á pun tshut la̍k ki, ting-tâi ê tsit pîng ū sann ki, ting-tâi ê hit pîng ū sann ki;
English: There were six branches going out of its sides: three branches of the lampstand out of its one side, and three branches of the lampstand out of its other side:

Tailo: Siōngtsú ê sù-tsiá bô koh tshut-hiān hō͘ Manouah kah i ê bó͘ khuànn, Manouah tsiah tsai i sī Siōngtsú ê sù-tsiá.
English: But the angel of Yahweh did no more appear to Manoah or to his wife. Then Manoah knew that he was the angel of Yahweh.

Tailo: Lí īng ba̍k-sái tsò tsia̍h-mi̍h hō͘ in tsia̍h, koh īng tsin tsē ba̍k-sái hō͘ in lim.
English: You have fed them with the bread of tears, And given them tears to drink in large measure.

Tailo: Kan-ok tuè guá ê kha-āu-teⁿ sì-bīn uî guá, tī tsit khuán huān-lān ê ji̍t-tsí guá mā bô teh kiaⁿ.
English: Why should I fear in the days of evil, When iniquity at my heels surrounds me?

Tailo: Tuà tī Ka-lîm ê jîn-bîn tio̍h tuā-siaⁿ huah! Lâi-sa, lí tio̍h àⁿ hīⁿ-khang lâi thiaⁿ! Tshám ah, khùn-khó͘ ê Anáthot!
English: Cry aloud with your voice, daughter of Gallim! Listen, Laishah! You poor Anathoth!

Tailo: Lí ê sim m̄-thang sò-sìng lâi siū-khì; in-uī siū-khì tsûn tī gōng lâng ê sim-huâi.
English: Don't be hasty in your spirit to be angry, for anger rests in the bosom of fools.

Tailo: Koh tshú Siōngtsú tiān lāi O-biat-e-tóm só͘ kò͘-siú ê kim, gîn, khì-kū kah ông-kiong ê tsâi-pó, koh lia̍h lâng tsò tsún-tǹg, tsiū tńg-khì Sa-má-lī-a.
English: He took all the gold and silver, and all the vessels that were found in the house of God with Obed-Edom, and the treasures of the king's house, the hostages also, and returned to Samaria.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê tāi-tsì liáu-āu, tsit-ê tsa-bó͘ lâng, to̍h-sī hit ke ê tsú-lâng, i ê kiáⁿ phuà-pēⁿ, pēⁿ kah tsin siong-tiōng, tì-sú i bô tsi̍t-tiám-á khuì-si.
English: It happened after these things, that the son of the woman, the mistress of the house, fell sick; and his sickness was so sore, that there was no breath left in him.

Tailo: Tsiah-ê thâu-lâng kā âng bé-ló kah pa̍t tsióng ê pó-tsio̍h, thang siuⁿ tī tsè-si ho̍k kah pó͘-kuà ê, lóng the̍h-lâi hiàn.
English: The rulers brought the onyx stones, and the stones to be set, for the ephod and for the breastplate;

Tailo: Siōngtsú kóng, Ji̍t-tsí teh beh kàu, Guá beh kā Tabi̍t hing-khí gī ê ki; i ē tsò ông lâi tī-lí, tsò tāi-tsì ū tì-huī, tī tē-tsiūⁿ kiânn kong-pêⁿ kah kong-gī.
English: Behold, the days come, says Yahweh, that I will raise to David a righteous Branch, and he shall reign as king and deal wisely, and shall execute justice and righteousness in the land.

Tailo: Siōngtsú í-king khui I ê kun-tsong-khò͘, gia̍h tshut I tuā siū-khì ê khì-hâi; in-uī Tsú — bān-kun ê Siōngtsú, ū tāi-tsì beh tī Kal-tí-ah lâng ê tē huat-sing.
English: Yahweh has opened his armory, and has brought forth the weapons of his indignation; for the Lord, Yahweh of Armies, has a work to do in the land of the Chaldeans.

Tailo: Kiaⁿ-hiâⁿ ê tāi-tsì ua̍t-tńg lîm-kàu tī guá, in kuáⁿ-tio̍k guá ê îng-kng tshin-tshiūnn hong; guá ê hok-lo̍k tshin-tshiūnn hûn kuè-.khì.
English: Terrors are turned on me. They chase my honor as the wind. My welfare has passed away as a cloud.

Tailo: Iésu koh kā in kóng, An-hioh-ji̍t sī uī-tio̍h lâng lâi siat-li̍p, m̄-sī lâng uī-tio̍h An-hioh-ji̍t lâi tshòng-tsō.
English: He said to them, The Sabbath was made for man, not man for the Sabbath.

Tailo: Lín tsiah-ê kiáⁿ, taⁿ tio̍h tsun-thàn guá, tsù-ì thiaⁿ guá só͘ kóng ê uē.
English: Now therefore, sons, listen to me. Pay attention to the words of my mouth.

Tailo: Tuā siaⁿ huah, Tsì-kuân Siōngtè ê Kiáⁿ Iésu, Lí hô-pit lâi kan-sia̍p guá? Guá kí Siōngtè ê miâ lâi khún-kiû Lí, m̄-thang kā guá tsik-hua̍t.
English: and crying out with a loud voice, he said, What have I to do with you, Jesus, you Son of the Most High God? I adjure you by God, don't torment me.

Tailo: Siōngtsú kā Mô͘se kóng, Lí tshun tshiú ǹg thiⁿ, hō͘ Aigi̍p tē o͘-àm, tsit-ê o͘-àm ē o͘ kah bē bong-.tit.
English: Yahweh said to Moses, Stretch out your hand toward the sky, that there may be darkness over the land of Egypt, even darkness which may be felt.

Tailo: M̄-koh, guá tshâ bô i ū huān-tio̍h siáⁿ-mi̍h kai sí ê tsuē. I kì-jiân í-king tuì hông-tè siōng-sò͘, guá tshâi-kuat kā i sàng-khì Lô-má.
English: But when I found that he had committed nothing worthy of death, and as he himself appealed to the emperor I determined to send him.

Tailo: Mô͘se kah Alông lī-khui Huâ-láu tshut-.khì, Mô͘se uī-tio̍h I só͘ tshe lâi hāi Huâ-láu ê tshân-kap-á, kiû-kiò Siōngtsú.
English: Moses and Aaron went out from Pharaoh, and Moses cried to Yahweh concerning the frogs which he had brought on Pharaoh.

Tailo: Nepkatnetsal ông tiàu-tsi̍p tsiah-ê tsóng-tok, khim-tshe, sûn-hú, àn-tshat-si, pò͘-tsìng-si, bô͘-sū, huat-kuaⁿ kah kok síng ê kuaⁿ-uân, lâi hù Nepkatnetsal ông só͘ li̍p ê siōng kiânn tiám-gán ê lé.
English: Then Nebuchadnezzar the king sent to gather together the satraps, the deputies, and the governors, the judges, the treasurers, the counselors, the sheriffs, and all the rulers of the provinces, to come to the dedication of the image which Nebuchadnezzar the king had set up.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, i ū siū kat-lé, tsit-ê kat-lé sī tsi̍t tsióng kì-hō, tsìng-si̍t i iáu-buē siū kat-lé í-tsîng to̍h in-uī ū sìn, tsiū hō͘ Siōngtè kā i jīm-tīng tsò gī lâng. Só͘-í, tuì hiah-ê bô siū kat-lé in-uī ū sìn, tsiū hō͘ Siōngtè jīm-tīng tsò gī lâng ê lâng lâi kóng, Abulahàm tsiâⁿ-tsò in ê tsó͘-sian.
English: He received the sign of circumcision, a seal of the righteousness of the faith which he had while he was in uncircumcision, that he might be the father of all those who believe, though they be in uncircumcision, that righteousness might also be accounted to them.

Tailo: Guá só͘ ài ê, guá kā lí pí-phīng tsò tshin-tshiūnn Huâ-láu ê tsiàn-tshia ê bé.
English: I have compared you, my love, To a steed in Pharaoh's chariots.

Tailo: Lí tī guá ê tsîng-āu pó-hō͘ guá, huāⁿ-tshiú tī guá ê tíng-bīn.
English: You hem me in behind and before. You laid your hand on me.

Tailo: Lí m̄-thang siūⁿ kóng, guá beh pò-ìng pháiⁿ lâng; tio̍h thìng-hāu Siōngtsú, I ē kiù lí.
English: Don't say, I will pay back evil. Wait for Yahweh, and he will save you.

Tailo: Lô͘-po̍k tńg-khì kā tsiah-ê tāi-tsì kā tsú-lâng kóng. Hit-ê tsú-lâng siū-khì, kā i ê lô͘-po̍k kóng, ' Kín tshut-khì siâⁿ lāi ê ke-thâu hāng-bué, tshuā hiah-ê sàn-tshiah-.ê, phuà-siùⁿ-.ê, tsheⁿ-mê-.ê kah pái-kha-.ê lâi tsia. '
English: That servant came, and told his lord these things. Then the master of the house, being angry, said to his servant, Go out quickly into the streets and lanes of the city, and bring in the poor, maimed, blind, and lame.'

Tailo: Tabi̍t tńg-khì beh kā i ê ka-kuàn tsiok-hok, Sàulô ê tsa-bó͘ kiáⁿ Mikal tshut-lâi gîng-tsiap Tabi̍t, kóng, Isulael ông kin-á-ji̍t ū guā tuā ê îng-kng! Kin-á-ji̍t lō͘-thé tī jîn-sîn ê lú-pī ba̍k-tsiu tsîng, tshin-tshiūnn tsi̍t-ê bô hē-lo̍h ê lâng bô kiann kiàn-siàu lō͘-thé.
English: Then David returned to bless his household. Michal the daughter of Saul came out to meet David, and said, How glorious was the king of Israel today, who uncovered himself today in the eyes of the handmaids of his servants, as one of the vain fellows shamelessly uncovers himself!

Tailo: Tsit khuán ê uē, guá ū thiaⁿ-kuè tsin tsē à; lín ê an-uì lóng sī hō͘ lâng tian-tò kan-khó͘.
English: I have heard many such things. Miserable comforters are you all!

Tailo: Hit ke ê tsa-bó͘ lâng īng kuà khàm tséⁿ-tshuì, tíng-bīn pho͘ be̍h-sap, tāi-tsì tsiū bô lāu-sia̍p.
English: The woman took and spread the covering over the well's mouth, and strewed bruised grain thereon; and nothing was known.

Tailo: Kóng, ' Guá beh tsiūⁿ-khì kàu tsng-thâu ê tē, kàu tiām-tiām an-jiân sing-ua̍h ê jîn-bîn hia, in só͘ tuà ê só͘-tsāi lóng bô siâⁿ tshiûⁿ, mā bô mn̂g, bô tshuàⁿ ;
English: and you shall say, I will go up to the land of unwalled villages; I will go to those who are at rest, who dwell securely, all of them dwelling without walls, and having neither bars nor gates;

Tailo: （ Tabi̍t tsí Biāniámín lâng Kú-si̍t ê uē, ǹg Siōngtsú tshiùⁿ kua; tiāu īng Si-ga-ióng）（ Tsù, tan-sò͘ hîng, Ha-bá-kok su 3:1 ê Si-gi-io-nah sī ho̍k-sò͘ hîng ） Siōngtsú — guá ê Siōngtè ah, guá uá-khò Lí; kiû Lí kiù guá thuat-lī só͘-ū jiok guá ê lâng, kiù guá tshut-.lâi.
English: Yahweh, my God, I take refuge in you. Save me from all those who pursue me, and deliver me,

Tailo: Hanun tsiū kā Tabi̍t ê jîn-sîn ê tshuì-tshiu thì tsi̍t-puàⁿ, koh tuì-tiong kuah-tn̄g i ê saⁿ kàu tuā-thuí tíng, tsiū tshe in tò tńg-.khì.
English: So Hanun took David's servants, and shaved off the one half of their beards, and cut off their garments in the middle, even to their buttocks, and sent them away.

Tailo: Pak-hong ê ông ē ji̍p-khì lâm-hong ê ông ê kok, tsóng-.sī, ē iû-guân tò tńg-khì i ê pún só͘-tsāi.
English: He shall come into the realm of the king of the south, but he shall return into his own land.

Tailo: Āu-lâi, i tsiū tsiú-kuáⁿ. Kàu-taⁿ í-king peh-tsa̍p-sì huè, lóng bô lī-khui sìng-tiān, mê-ji̍t kìm-tsia̍h kî-tó, ho̍k-sāi Siōngtè.
English: and she had been a widow for about eighty-four years), who didn't depart from the temple, worshipping with fastings and petitions night and day.

Tailo: Tio̍h īng kim tsò nn̄g-ê ki-lō͘-ping, īng phah ê hong-huat lâi tsò, an-tì tī si-un-só͘ ê siang thâu.
English: You shall make two cherubim of hammered gold. You shall make them at the two ends of the mercy seat.

Tailo: Iésu gia̍h thâu khuànn I ê bûn-tô͘, kóng, Lín tsiah-ê sàn-tshiah lâng si̍t-tsāi ū hok-khì, in-uī Siōngtè kok-tō͘ sī lín ê.
English: He lifted up his eyes to his disciples, and said, Blessed are you who are poor, For yours is the Kingdom of God.

Tailo: In-uī Abulahàm teh kî-thāi Siōngtè só͘ siat 計 khí-tsō hit-ê ū tē-ki ê siâⁿ.
English: For he looked for the city which has the foundations, whose builder and maker is God.

Tailo: Lí ê ba̍k-tsiu nā hue, tsuân sing-khu tsiū àm. Lí lāi-bīn ê kng nā àm, hit-ê o͘-àm sī guā-ni̍h-á lī-hāi!
English: But if your eye is evil, your whole body will be full of darkness. If therefore the light that is in you is darkness, how great is the darkness!

Tailo: Ū ê-hng, ū tsá-khí, sī tē-saⁿ ji̍t.
English: There was evening and there was morning, a third day.

Tailo: I ìn kóng, Guá uī-tio̍h Siōngtsú — bān-kun ê Siōngtè tuā jia̍t-sim, in-uī Isulael lâng khì-sak Lí ê iok, huí-huāi Lí hiah-ê tuâⁿ, īng to thâi Lí hiah-ê sian-ti, kan-taⁿ tshun guá tsi̍t-ê lâng, in iáu teh siàu-siūⁿ guá ê sèⁿ-miā, beh kā guá thâi-sí.
English: He said, I have been very jealous for Yahweh, the God of Armies; for the children of Israel have forsaken your covenant, thrown down your altars, and slain your prophets with the sword; and I, even I only, am left; and they seek my life, to take it away.

Tailo: Iô-sa-huat ū tsin tsē tsâi-bu̍t kah îng-kng, tsiū kah Ahap kiat-tshin.
English: Now Jehoshaphat had riches and honor in abundance; and he joined affinity with Ahab.

Tailo: In ê hîng-uî sī teh piáu-sī lu̍t-huat ê iau-kiû ū khik tī in ê sim-lāi; in ê liông-sim mā ē tsìng-si̍t, in-uī in ê lāi-sim sî-sî teh tsik-pī ka-kī, ū sî teh uī ka-kī piān-hō͘.
English: in that they show the work of the law written in their hearts, their conscience testifying with them, and their thoughts among themselves accusing or else excusing them)

Tailo: Thiaⁿ tio̍h thian-kok ê sìn-sit bô bîng-pi̍k ê lâng, ná tshin-tshiūnn iā tī lō͘ piⁿ ê tsíng-tsí; Mô͘-kuí tsi̍t-ē kàu, tsiū kā iā tī i sim-lāi ê tsíng-tsí tshiúⁿ-.khì.
English: When anyone hears the word of the Kingdom, and doesn't understand it, the evil one comes, and snatches away that which has been sown in his heart. This is what was sown by the roadside.

Tailo: Lâi-kàu Sa-má-lī-a tsiū thâi-sí kiàn-nā sio̍k Ahap só͘ tshun tī Sa-má-lī-a ê, tsuân-pō͘ kā i bia̍t-tiāu, tsiàu Siōngtsú tuì Eliiah só͘ kóng ê uē.
English: When he came to Samaria, he struck all who remained to Ahab in Samaria, until he had destroyed him, according to the word of Yahweh, which he spoke to Elijah.

Tailo: Guá nî lāu ê sî, kiû Lí m̄-thang pàng-sak guá; guá khuì-la̍t sue-lám ê sî, kiû Lí m̄-thang lī-khui guá.
English: Don't reject me in my old age. Don't forsake me when my strength fails.

Tailo: ( guân-lâi A-thé-nè lâng kah tuà tī hia ê guā-kok lâng lóng ài kóng, mā ài thiaⁿ sin-kî ê tāi-tsì lâi siau-mô͘ sî-kan. )
English: Now all the Athenians and the strangers living there spent their time in nothing else, but either to tell or to hear some new thing.

Tailo: Ai-ah! Guān hit mê bô ū seⁿ kiáⁿ; in tiong-kan bô huann-hí ê siann.
English: Behold, let that night be barren. Let no joyful voice come therein.

Tailo: Utsiiah kiông-sīng liáu-āu, sim tsiū kiau-ngō͘, tì-sú hú-pāi, puē-gi̍k Siōngtsú — i ê Siōngtè, in-uī i ji̍p Siōngtsú ê tiān, beh tī hiuⁿ-tuâⁿ sio hiuⁿ.
English: But when he was strong, his heart was lifted up, so that he did corruptly, and he trespassed against Yahweh his God; for he went into the temple of Yahweh to burn incense on the altar of incense.

Tailo: Tī gû-gōng ê siàu-liân lâng tiong-kan, guá bîng-bîng khuàⁿ-tio̍h tsi̍t-ê bû-ti ê siàu-liân-ke,
English: I saw among the simple ones. I discerned among the youths a young man void of understanding,

Tailo: In-uī king-tián ū kì-tsài kóng, Lâng nā ài beh pó-sioh ua̍h-miā, koh ài beh kuè hīng-hok ê ji̍t-tsí, tio̍h kìm-tsí tshuì-tsi̍h kóng pháiⁿ uē, koh m̄-thang kóng pe̍h-tsha̍t.
English: For, He who would love life, And see good days, Let him keep his tongue from evil, And his lips from speaking deceit.

Tailo: Guá mā beh tsīn guá ê hūn-gia̍h lâi ìn, pâi-lia̍t guá ê ì-kiàn.
English: I also will answer my part, And I also will show my opinion.

Tailo: Īng uánn lim tsiú, īng siōng hó ê iû buah ka-kī, tsóng-.sī, bô uī Iôséhuh ê pāi-huāi tam-iu.
English: Who drink wine in bowls, And anoint themselves with the best oils; But they are not grieved for the affliction of Joseph.

Tailo: Án-ne, tuì tshòng-tsō sè-kài í-lâi só͘ lâu tsìng sian-ti ê hueh lóng beh kā lín tsit sè-tāi thó,
English: that the blood of all the prophets, which was shed from the foundation of the world, may be required of this generation;

Tailo: Sò͘-tsè só͘ tshun lo̍h-.lâi ê tio̍h kui hō͘ Alông kah i ê kiáⁿ-sun, tse sī hiàn hō͘ Siōngtsú ê hué-tsè tiong tsò tsì-sìng ê.
English: That which is left of the meal offering shall be Aaron's and his sons'. It is a thing most holy of the offerings of Yahweh made by fire.

Tailo: Ji̍t-thâu ū ji̍t-thâu ê kng, gue̍h ū gue̍h ê kng, tsheⁿ ū tsheⁿ ê kng, sīm-tsì muí lia̍p tsheⁿ ê kng to lóng bô kāng-khuán.
English: There is one glory of the sun, another glory of the moon, and another glory of the stars; for one star differs from another star in glory.
